reviews.review: Nice place for a family. Good place for a family. The atmosphere is not very pretty, and the size of the place is not that big.

LOVELY WATER PARK. We were staying at the Jumeirah beach hotel so got unlimited use of Wild Wadi, it was really good fun and not too big . My daughter aged 14 loved it here and it is well worth a visit.
Great day out!. Been around for a while but well worth a visit. Great for a family day out or fun day with friends when anytime of year

Been a while since I've been there. Last time I went to wild wadi was at least 10 yeas ago. Although I prefer wild wadi for its size and design the place does look old. Clean but needs a makeover . My son who is 14 enjoyed himself. But not worth the full price if compared with the newer water parks in Dubai and abu Dahabi.

Quite simply wicked. What is there to say? I've never really liked big rides yet here I indulge them. this is one of the most entertaining water parks I've been too. The park itself is huge and is right on the door step of the Burj al Arab. Great day out and the rides are worth going on

Wild wadi. A wonderful place for all the family
My 3 boys absolutely love it here
Friendly staff and well operated rides for all to enjoy

Best in Dubai. Slides for persons of 110cm and up. A lot of good rides suitable for the whole family! (IMO these were better/more entertaining than in Atlantis, And therefore we went here 2 times)Many places to sit, and a lot of shady places (the sun was brutal towards Norwegian skin, in early October) Food was OK. We only tried fried chicken, and some snow-cone/slush-drinksWardrobe-areas and showers was ok, (similar to Atlantis) Clean and not to crowded.Payment-system was (similar to Atlantis) very smart. You get a wrist-band witch can be "charged with money" so that there is no need to bring cards or cash in the park. Whatever if left/not used will get refunded to you when you leave.No need to book ahead online here, pay when you arrive was most convenient! (we tried both)The surface on the ground (smooth rock) was not too slippery, and not as hot to walk bare-feet on as in Atlantis (in Atlantis I would recommend some sort of shoes/sandals!)

Needs more rides. Arrived just after opening so got on all the rides without waiting, so had done everything in a couple of hours. Then we just sat by the wavepool. Arrive early to get a chair with shade, you can't bring food into the park and a meal costs about £15 (65AED)each, a Pepsi is£4.50.(20AED)Towel hire is £9(40AED) so better to bring your own. Its an expensive day out when you add in all the extras after paying over £50 each to get in.

Great fun. . We had a great time with the kids. Did all the rides and it wasn't too crowded at all. No wait over 5 minutes. We went on a Sunday when all the locals are back to work / school. Great fun day out with the family.

Water Fun for the Family. Visited the park as a family of four with two young children in May 2016. Really fun experience though it gets crowded as the day wears on. Try to get in early for a more exclusive time at the park. If your kids love water, this is a great place to visit. Couldn't go on most of the rides because I had small children with me. But believe me, you can spend the whole day having fun with just a few rides.Changing rooms were adequate although a bit crowded, food is quite expensive.The queue for a taxi when getting out is also pretty long.

Decent water park. the place is good, the location is awesome.. the rides are not much, could have a lot more.
you have to be lesser than 120 kg, if you want to try all the rides, one ride, you have to be lesser than 136 kg. if you are more than that, you may not be able to enjoy all the rides..
Perfect water park in Dubai. Perfect location, many water slides for children, swimming pool with waves. Perfect view to Burj-Al-Arab.

Adrenaline rush. Went to park in the morning
Was quite nice this time no rush
Enjoyed all the rides
It was warm but bearable ...
No food allowed . You be got to buy inside...
Jumeirah hotel guests enjoy free entrance
And shuttle to wild wadi

Not overly impressed at all. . Positives- My 2 year old thoroughly enjoyed the wave pool and tube floats. - Some of the food was nice. Negatives- The food. It was incredibly overpriced, staff were very poorly trained with no obvious managerial support, extended wait times and either poor quality and/or small portions. - Visitors are not welcome to bring their own food or drink into the park forcing guests to buy everything, including water. - Ticket pricing. Overpriced. - I am six months pregnant, was charged full entry fee and then denied access to use a slide in the children's area. I spent the day in the wave pool and tube floats. Despite being fit and healthy with a low risk pregnancy, I knew I'd be turned away from any other activity (not that I'd even contemplate the thrill seeker ones). With this in mind, my entry ticket price was a total rip off. A 'spectator fee' would be far more appropriate. - The children's play area. Where to begin... It's an area specifically for those under 1.1 metres tall yet was not age appropriate at all. Throughout the area, constantly and without warning, you have a deluge of water dumped on you. It was unnecessary and painful (for both me and my daughter), not to mention scary for the little ones. Constant water/sprinkler jets are fine, kids seem to quite like them, but I think Wild Wadi has too many. Adults were not allowed to ride on even the most basic of slides with the child. Adults are welcome to slide before or after the child, just one is not to enter the slide until the other is off the other end. With a noticeable baby bump I was told I was refused entry to any of the slides in the children's area. In my opinion this area is currently appropriate for children aged approximately 6-10 years old, yet this is the age group I saw being turned away from due to their height. My normally brave, gutsy and outgoing two year old was in tears screaming after having masses of water dumped on her head and did not feel comfortable at all to use a slide by herself. As such the whole children's area was off limits for us. Many other visitors to the park appeared to be having the same issues. All in all, I think our money would have been better spent elsewhere.

" that's it". Never expect this.Not many rides , extremely rude staff.I wouldn't say go to the other water parks around UAE because it's not fair to compare this.Just save your money and sit home it's better than this bad experience.

Great fun to cool down . We visited hear while seeing the burj al Arab which overlooks the water park. This park is fun for all ages. Get on a rubber tyre and float upwards and downwards. The surfing machine is great. Surf in one place. Be careful of the big water slide.....the speed will bring your speedos a bit too close for comfort!
Amazing water experiences for the family. I was there with my kids aged 12, 10 boys and 5y girl, really they loved it. A must see place in Dubai

nice park, just not enough rides. we stayed at the Jumeriah Al Qasr for 5 days so had complimentary access to Wild Wadi. We only visited once in those 5 days... nice park, well set out, wait times are acceptable... just not enough rides.

Great time at the water park. Went to the Wild Wadi with anticipation as I thought this kind of activity was for youngsters not for the over 60's, I was so pleasantly surprised, what a great experience, loved every ride, especially the tubes, you will know when you try them, do the easy one first !,, fun for all ages took me back years. It is free to get in if you stay in a hotel owned by the Jumeirah group....
A must do. When in Dubai and have children or big kids this is awesome highly recommend try get a deal through group on

Exciting. Just going there will make you happy . Fuuuulllll of kids with their parents . Full of life . You can go there even if u r an adult . It's good to go there in a group of friends to have more fun .

Wohoo Experience. Visited wild wadi with friends , its a must visit place if you are looking for some adventurous rides , breath stopping situations and thrilling fun. We enjoyed each and every ride and loved the entire location. The view of al arab from top is just heart catching, and the sunset view was mind blowing.All in one it was memorable experience.
Amazing Water Park!. It was a lovely experience.That is absolutely mind-boggling. I highly recommend it. This place is simply amazing!!
Good Half Day/Full Day outing. Went on most of the rides!Start with the tubes, this will take you through the whole Water Park.The Jumeirah Sceirah is a must!

pleasant experience however some safety issues. We visited recently, we enjoyed the rides, staff was pleasant.Even though it says 30 rides, there are not nearly that many for adults. We enjoyed them and since the day was not crowded we were able to do them several times.Several of the tube type rides are nice for couples. The new Jumeriah Scremiah is intense and I enjoyed it with the short lines was able to do it twice.The end of the visit was marred by an accident, when my wife went to use a public shower to rinse off, the shower head fell off and hit her in the head when she pressed the button to start the water. The shower heads are large and it left a large lump. not sure ow a metal shower head just falls off, but it did.Only after us walking out of the treatment area in frustration did they offer to pay for treatment at a local hospital and no offer at all of free tickets/refund or any type of compensation for ruining the day.

Epic waterpark but it's number 2. Great waterpark full of amazing rides. Would recommend it but Aquaventure is a lot better in my opinion. This one is smaller and the rides are older. Some of the rapids and jets stop from time to time which makes it frustrating. The food isn't great and their is limited space to sit around. However the rides are exciting and enjoyable.

Awesome water park. Spent our first day in Dubai at Wild Wadi as we were staying at a Jumeirah hotel - which meant entry was free and the towels complimentary. Life jackets are also provided (and you can't use your own) so no need to take anything but sunscreen and money. Had a great time with our girls 1 and 4. What a fun place. Never seen so many lifeguards! Make sure you get to ride on the super fun uphill water tube - it's tucked away off the main river tube ride. Highly recommend this place!
SUPERB!. Wild wadi was by the highlight of our trip to Dubai. We had so much fun on the rides - especially the lazy river. It was great fun and somewhere anyone travelling to Dubai should visit!

Best enjoyable place!. I think "Wild Wadi" is the best water park in Dubai for some reasons; Really FantasticStone Mountain!Feel like Ali-BabaVery Standard and has many life savers...I really love that more than other water parks...Trust me ;)

Very nice. We have enjoyed our day there, not so busy, price is expensive when you add the locker and the towel. Food prices inside is also expensive and tasteless.You will have fun after all, and that's what is important.

Fantastic day out. Loved our day here - such a variety of rides for all involved.
Would definitely go back as children would love it.
Drinks seemed quite expensive.
Wild, family fun. Fun selection of rides. The queues were acceptable....even on the busy rides.Be wary of the floor that gets burning hot though!!

Amazing afternoon spent there. Amazing water park! There are so many slides and attractions to do, it is a lot of fun if you love water and slides! Especially for children (once they are able to swim properly!). Staff is very friendly and careful. Hygiene and security are taken care of perfectly!
Day out . Water park great place for a day with friends or family fun for all ages on different water rides good staff lots of car parking highly recommended

Don't trust their digital photo shop, disappointed.. Our hotel tells us we can have free access to this water park, we spent three hours in the park yesterday. Staffs are kind and they kept taking photos for us so we can collect the printed photos at their shop before leaving. The guy in the photo shop cheated on us about the printing price. The deal was 300 AED for 5 prints with a bar code which stores all photos we can download from their website. The staff keeps telling us the bar code is free if we buy their printed photos. We bought one print for 110 AED (the original price was 125, but they promised us a discount). The thing is after payment he returned my card and told us the bar code only contains one copy of the photo. We argued with them because they did not tell us about this otherwise we would not buy it at all. The reason I gave a terrible rating is not only they cheated on the agreement, but also when we negotiating about this, he knows we want the code with all photos but asks do we still want to keep it, I was hesitating and he just threw it with no reason. I would recommend using your own camera instead of their photo services.
waterpark. this place offers families a day of fun, nothing is to much trouble for the staff the food outlets are not expensive, they cater for all, I spent a family day here it was amazing.
Fun. Great fun for the family, extremely great deal if you stay at a jumeira hotel as you get free access to the parkAmazing fun in the park plenty to do and plenty of choice of food outlets

So much better when its quiet. Visited a couple of years ago, and returned last week. There was barely anyone in the water park throughout the day - no queues for anything, and easy to get food/refreshments. The summer deal (entry, unlimited drinks, and a meal) saves you around 150 AED in the long run so worth buying

Good fun, great view, awesome adventure!. I booked Wild Wadi as one of my excursions when visiting Dubai in August. Lets say it did not disappoint! I went at 2pm and stayed until it closed which was 7pm. It wasn't too busy and the queues weren't that long. It's a very friendly place, the staff were so nice which made it even better! The rides were great too. They have rapid rides were you sit in like a doughnut ring and it shoots you up and down various slides all around the waterpark. You must try the Jumeirah Sceirah! Even if you're a tad scared, it's an experience you won't forget! Lastly, as the sun sets about half 6 and you look up to see a view of the Burj Al Arab with a pink sky, you forget where you are and it makes visiting Wild Wadi that even bit special. Enjoy!

Amazing!. I was abit nervous going to a water park in a new country but wild wadi was amazing, very family friendly, rides were for all ages. Staff are very friendly and polite and the food isn't too bad. When you arrive you are given a wrist badge to load money on so there is no need to worry about that. Rides are surf machines, rapid rides and a kids pool area. Queues are very fast so not much waiting around! All in all a fantastic experience and I would definitely be going again! The location is great also- a fantastic view of the burj al Arab from the rides! A recommendation of mine is to take flip flops as the floor can get very hot from the sun.

Super Hot. My team had a great time in this waterpark few months ago it was really hot but still we managed to enjoy the rides and the craziest tube ride. I will definitely recommend this to all who loves extreme ride and adventures.
Fun and cool man made rides.
Great family oriemtated park. Great water park. Not as glitzy as some of the others but easier to navigate with a more manageable feel. Plenty of rides to suit everyone.

not worth the money. This place is ridiculously overpriced. very limited slides and the ground gets very hot at noon and in the afternoon and no means of foot protection is offered. Very basic service for very high price.

Good time for the kids and young at heart. Good water park with a variety of slides capped with a magnificent view of the Burj Al Arab.Vrty safe with alert lifeguards everywhere you turn,overall very clean and reasonable priced and good quality fast food.We visited aug16 when it was stifling and very busy but still managed to find a subbed hidden away from the masses.The children loved the slides but as an older adult i enjoyed the lazy river.Highly recommended but we did get free passes as stayed at a Jumeirah hotel but it is expensive for a family of four if you have to pay full price.

Keep wet all day. Has been a few years since coming to Wild Wadi. Great location at the base of the Burj Al Arab. AED295 then 40 for towel hire and 45 for locker. Currently open from 10-19:00 with plenty of rides for people of all ages. Food is fast food and you can get unlimited drinks within certain packages.

A lot of fun!. We love this Waterpark. There's something for everyone: steep slides for adults and bigger kids, a whole area of slides for younger kids with a life guard underneath each one to ensure safety, and lots of shallow waters for the youngest ones. The dressing rooms are really practical with private changing rooms that are actually spacious enough to go into with your kids, same with the showers. Lockers come with an extra charge. You can load credit into your wristband to spend in the restaurants. My 5-year old wants to go here every single day

poor facility. Wild Wadi Water Park is an ok place to go to if you need to cool down but they don't have a good attraction . The entrance fee is quite high compared with other and bored of the water slides. You have to pay for the lockers and the food is overpriced as well.

Slides that go up 🙃. If you stay at the Jumeirah hotel the entry to Wild Wadi is free. It's a great place for adventure and fun for both adults and kids. The double dinghies really help if your child is a little anxious about going on the slides. The price for food and photos is really expensive inside. A single photo was costing £55.00 .My kids aged 9-10yrs learned to surf on a board with some really friendly instructor. The ques can be long but really worth it. I've been coming here each time Ive visited Dubai kids love the slides and have a blast a here every time!

Ok. Not much variety in terms of the rides. More of a family fun day than for young groups, this is definitely not a theme park. We went for the sundowner packer 130AED to use the park from 4-7pm. Definitely wouldn't pay the full 280AED for a full day pass. We did get a free burger with our ticket which was good.
Good variation. I loved the slides that take you up! Saves climbing all those stairs!! Underground parking is great. Needs a fast river but all other rides were good.

Good park but not many rides. I enjoyed the rides that we did but there are not enough of them. We didn't have to pay to visit as it was included in our hotel stay but if we had paid the admission price I would have been disappointed.

Great morning out. We spent a morning at wild wadi during our stay at Mina a Salam as our hotel stay included free entrance to the park. We caught the free buggy there from the hotel beach. Towels are provided free but they charge to hire a locker which is expensive. There were no queues for the slides we went on.
AWESOME!!! THE RIDES ARE A THRILL OF A LIFETIME!. Don't take any food items or they will be held behind but that's the rule at all waterparks. Food is very expensive in the waterpark.

Playing in the sun. A wonderful happy day with family while playing in the water. We enjoyed as much as the other water park in the city. Children would enjoy this park as much as adults. There is plenty of foods and comforts for the visitor. A must do while in Dubai especially in the sunny hot months, and do not forget your sunblock lotion.

Excellent Waterpark for 1.1m+ kids!. I went with my 5-year old during the last Eid vacation in Dubai which is normally extremely crowded everywhere. Pleasantly, the wait times on all the rides was very short with only 1 ride with a 15-minute wait. My son who is taller than 1.1m was able to go on all the slides in my company! That was really a big differentiator for me as he is in the age where the kids slides are boring and he may not be allowed on bigger slides in other parks requiring 1.2/1.3m. In this respect, Wild Wadi was perfect for us. To avoid carrying cash, you can charge your bracelet with credit in advance that allows you to buy food and reserve a locker. The ticket employee did not inform me that there were different locker sizes so I ended up overspending in that department. Wild Wadi staff were very understanding in that regard and very cooperative. We were even offered ice cream in compensation which made a big difference for my son!Car Parking also available and within immediate proximity (no need for a transport from parking to park).

Ladies Night . Let me start of that my first visit to this theme park 4 years ago was great. But last Thursday when we tried the ladies night, it was not. I don't know whether it was because the fee charge is less than the normal fee, the staff is already tired? Because of our brown skin? They are very strict on the "no taking picture" rule. But we see alot of muslim ladies taking pictures and even videos.... So.... Although i love it that there is not a lot of people on queiu, but still i would say that the staff reception we received last thursday was not par with last 4 years ago. With the many theme parks available, i think the only real competition here is how the staff will receive the guests. And wild wadi failed in that category.

Good day but not enough slides. It's hard to choose which park to go to but I'm pretty sure they're all the same. We went on a Friday morning and early to get on all the rides and it was fun but after you go on everything your pretty much done.Food there is also very expensive.
Great waterpark. Visited several times in the past just as good now.Good variety rides.We wanted to purchase some hats very little stock in shops.

Great water park . Wild wadi is a must for splash and dashGreat wet day out As you would expect being next door neighbour to the burj al Arab and jumeria beach hotel standards to be high and they certainly are Get yourself over there and enjoy them nip next door to the show and anchor for a sun downer in the jumeria beach hotel

Fun for every age group. The water park has all kinds of fun activities for all age groups. Its a good adrenaline rush adventure :) Be sure to carry a swim Suit and a phone protector to be able to capture all the fun while in the water.
Prepare to be wet . I had a nice day with my freinds and my daughter, extremely enjoyable and exciting, many water games are waiting for you.

Wet and Wild in Dubai. This is a pretty standard issue water park filled with the usual water park rides and activities. I was a little disappointed by the size of the wave pool, but is still big enough to float around and still maintain some personal space. Went on a weekend in September and the queues were quite small - max wait of 15mins on the busier rides (ie the thrill rides). Food options were a little limited and mostly consisted of burgers chips or similar variations. Has a couple of high-thrill rides, but would be better suited to families.

Great day out for whole family. We visited the park 3 times during our stay at a Jumeirah group hotel. There's a special entrance for hotel guests.Try to arrive as early as possible otherwise the deck chairs will all be gone. There are rides for all abilities & ages. My personal favourite is the wave pool as I call it. My husband loves the Jumeirah Scaearh ( sorry for spelling) while as a family we enjoy the huge water bucket are. There are a few eateries on site as well as stations selling drinks & ice slush is etc.

It was ok..... Not as big as I expected. It was ok, but people kept pooping in the pool. We had to leave the pool for them to clean up. I guess it's really not the facility's fault that customers poop in the pool. Lol After saw the poop in the pool one last time, I was out and done. Lol
Great experience. Really good fun day out for all of us. The variety of rides suited all from the most relaxing to the most scary.

Too much fun!! Prepare to get wet!. Absolutely excellent. Hardly any queues for rides. Staff fantastic-very friendly and helpful. Clean everywhere. Plenty to do for a full day. Life jackets for children of all sizes plentiful. Great area for smaller children with multiple slides. Fantastic views of Burj el-arab throughout the waterpark. Towels provided. Beware lockers though! Around £17 for a large locker-not refundable! Can manage without one if you don't take valuables.

Perfect For Families. This waterpark is not overwhelming with its size. The rides are pretty family friendly with a few "super thrill" rides. There is loads of seating near the wave pool, but if you want a more quiet spot head towards ride #4. There are decks of lounge chairs nearly empty. The food service was a bit slow, but quality was fine. Not a super value, but food at these kinds of places never is. We had a super fun day and would gladly go again.

Family day out at Wild Wadi. Myself/partner and 3 children aged 8/5 and 1 and my three teenage neices attended. LocationThe park is located near the Burj Al Arab which is away from the main part of Dubai. Their is a little Mall near by and a Mcdonalds Drive by about 5 minutes by car from the water park. The park is on the beach, but you have no access to the beach. It is roughly a 20/30 minute drive by car from JBR.Avoid this park on a Friday and Saturday as it is Dubais weekend and is busy. I went mid week at the time of opening 9am, it was quiet. We were ready to leave by 2pm, at which time the park was getting busy.Water ParkYou are apparently not allowed food into the park, i was not searched.On entrance their is a height test 1m- if your over you pay and are allowed to access all rides. If under your free to enter park.You pay for a locker- non refundable. Changing rooms are largeThe park has rides/water/play areas for all children including babies. They have sun beds all over mainly sutuated at points of interest e.g. by the fake beach/water activities etc which are free. I would advise to bring aqua shoes which are £5 in the UK as you can wear them in the park without your feet burning when walking between rides. Bring your own towels or pay for theres.Either from UK of from the Wild Wadi shop in the park please purchase a water phone bag which hangs on your neck. It is completely waterproof. £25 in park.Life guards are plentiful, life vests are provided where needed if needed for free.The park does have a VIP cabanas which also allows beach access. This is for 8 people- overpriced at £300 or £400 UK GBP not including park tickets.Rides:The rides are good/Ok and my teenage neices had completed all the rides in the park in about 3 hours. After that they got a bit bored. The children under 10 could stay all day splashing in the water.All in all, rides were good for all ages.Food:Fried chicken Fast food - over pricedIndian fast food - anyone that has tasted UK indian food knows this is not indian. Over pricedGrilled chicken and Pizza- over priced.No restaurant style place to eat, all fast food.Clothing:People were in Burkinis/Bikinis/Rashers and or speedos.Taxi:Plentiful outside the park.I had the Dubai entertainer app, buy 1 get 1 Wild wadi ticket free. The savings here alone paid for the app and some!.Keep an eye on your kids, easy to lose them.
Fun day out. Really loved this water park.Great fun and the slides were amazing - better than a lot of the slides in Orlando's water parks.Looking forward to visiting again.

Classy. OK Ok free entry via Jumeirah is always going to put me in a good mood from the off but what I love about this waterpark is its a bit more classy than the usual frenetic atmosphere of these parksThe whole park is themed which is much better than the European style of a clutch of rides and a load of nothing, the rides themselves are top quality plenty of variety my favourite being the rides that shoot you up nothing like a bit of laziness on holiday but rides you don't have to climb to get to are winners for me when its 49 degreesFoods good but it can be annoyingly complex we got caught up in some drinks offer where you could have free top ups all day but for some reason we ould not do this after we'd entered the park and it took visits to about 4 vendors and the front gate to establish this with a fair few mixed messages.Just sell me the drinks folks and let me get on with the dayAnyway a minor gripe over 3 visits during the week and without doubts the highlight of the holiday for the kids

Fun for the family. Well organized Waterpark with rides and attractions catering to both adults and children. The best of the lot was Jumeirah Sceira which almost felt like a free fall. Prices for the food and drinks were exaggerated. Apart from that, everything was great.

What an amazing day out . Visited wild wadi with my younger brother and we had a blast. The jumeira scriera was the highlight of the trip. If you like big thrill rides then it is definitely for you. There were many activities for all thrill levels as well as for kids. Food wise I had an amazing pizza there it was probably one of the cheesiest pizzas I've ever had and I loved it. Price is a adequate for the attractions available and cheaper than big us water parks so all in all a great day
Wild Journey. As name said Wide , yes it is one of most attractive place in Dubai for Water related FUN & Hangout where you feel amazing experience with lots of FUN.

Enjoy time. This water park in one of the best water park in UAE.it is located in jumeirah it's next to Burj al Arab.it has many water slide.nice pool.the price of food and water is too high.you cannot bring food and water inside.it is good place

EXCITING. The rides are so exciting and enjoyable the food outlets are good but the prices a bit dearer for the food give. Can be a bit overcrowded on weekends and during public holidays and long ques for the rides at the end you get the ride after a long wait.

Fantastic . Yes I agree the rides take about an hour and half to finish however we enjoyed the setup and friendly staff.The rides we thrilling the park is neat and as always with Dubai people are relaxed.Do try the mas scara a try it will blow your mind.
Good Park. Fun for every one and lot of water rides .Guards are very helpful . Enjoyable for almost everyone !!
Good place. This water park contain slops for all ages. Specially the slop go upward around the park. The jumeirah scream was awesome 15m fall in tube. Good for every persons.

Great value for Sundowner. We took advantage of the greatly reduced entry fee for evening admission and thought it was fantastic value. You have more than enough time to do all the rides in the park and the lines were really quite short. The included pizza is also good value. The park is well maintained but getting around can be a bit of a chore since the layout is quite confusing. There are not really enough changing facilities so if you can plan to leave in your swimwear.

A good place to keep cool. Went here and had a fantastic time, the place is kept scrupulously clean. Lockers are provided and if you stay within the Jumeriah group of hotels you don't need to take any money.

Awesome day. Had to try Wild Wadi with so many mixed reviews. We had already done a day at the Aquaventure water park so Ill make my review comparing both. Yes its expensive. Converting back to our home country currency (NZ) we paid somewhere around $600 for 2 adults & 3 kids. As for the enjoyment there, I think you won't be disappointed with your day! We had so much fun. The park is compact, so less walking which was fantastic! Aqua venture was a killer on the feet!! The food was ok - hot chips were a HIT @ both parks. Quite a big tub of watermelon for $35UAE and it was fresh and yummy. This park has one thriller ride, Jumeriah scierah - wow, so thrilling, scary, fun & has fantastic views from the top!!!! I don't think you would be disappointed - might burn a hole in your pocket but thats to be expected.

Fun way to kill a few hours. We were staying at the Jumeirah hotels and so had free access to the park. The slides are great and going at opening (10 am) was less busy than when we left in the early afternoon. As two adults I thought it was a great way to spend a few hours. The only negative was that to rent a locker for your stuff it was $12USD for the day, which I think is a little steep. Everything seemed very safe and clean, and there were multiple lifeguards for every pool or slide.

Solo ok. Great. Help with jet lag! Even a 65 year old on his own can have fun - water everywhere! Interesting rides. Lots of shade. Friendly lifeguards all over. Weekday best - 3hours should be long enough.

Really appreciate the water. Wasn't sure what to expect going to a water park in an Islamic country. What I found was only a bit different from the US. Set up is same as most water parks. Get your ticket, enter, optional changing and locker facilities separated for men and women. Then a lot of awesome attractions. Some women wear "burkinis" ok most women wear "burkinis".I ran around in swimming trunks and no shirt. It was fine.And you really appreciate the water when it's 120 farenheit
Exciting. Spotless great staff and lif guards lots of rides to choose clean all areas where tidy food was good and it's free to guests staying at the Jumeirah beach hotel next door.

Awesome. The most fun I had in a while. I recommend go with friends and family. Not solo! Rides 4-6 brought tears to my eyes. I really loved it. Also staff is helpful and friendly, lots of food to choose from.
a funny day!. wild wadi park is quite enjoyable for water-adventure-lovers! we really enjoyed the long water ride & also surfing waves...

Good time with family. Nice place for few hours to get wet. The activities are great. We like the small fishes where you put you feet. It easy ti orientate, however when it it weekend there are too many people.

Amazing !!!. Wild wadi.was one of the most beautiful water park ive ever went to.such an amazing experience.i enjoyed it with my friends too.it is on my top 3 list of places i want to visit again in dubai.

Amazing park. I and my husband enjoyed the park a lot. However the costs were a little high. Tantrum Alley was a crazy and awesome slide in the park. You must try! We did it for twice Jumeirah Scariah is another must to try :) You can spend one day and you won't regret.

Free with hotel stay!!. By staying at the Jumeirah Creekside Hotel we were entitled to unlimited access to this park during our 9 day stay, in addition to free transport to and from!! So for the party of 6 of us including 2 grand children it was a win win for us! I think this park is one of the first of its kind in Dubai but it is still at the top of its game..Numerous rides for all ages, good food outlets,plenty of sun beds etc. All in all a great day out for us FREE!
Great Eid trip with my daughter. My 7 year old and I took a last minute trip to Wild Wadi during the Eid break. The park was busy but the staff were excellent and very friendly.

Fantastic . We had a great day at Wild wadi, it's great fun, all rides were very good ,and the new ride the screamer , worth the entrance fee alone , staff are excellence great day out value for money
Excellent. Great waterpark! Make sure to bring your own towels as they charge loads on the spot!! on the door price is same as online!

Fun with Water - the Best day event in Dubai.. Enjoyed the day out with the children - amazing rides and had fun with the little showers all day long - in the hotel weather .... with the rides all with pleasant surprises we didnt eat much inside but had an amazing day.

Well worth a visit. Great day out! We went in Sept when it was extremely hot and quite busy. As it was a Friday then are open until 10pm so we went back later when it was cooler and less crowded. There are some great rides for thrill seekers and lots for the kids too!

Beautiful park . The park has many games. You can enjoy a whole day there. It gets crowded in the weekends. You can get a free or discounts if you stay in jumearah hotel. The park is beautifully designed and is good for all family.
Who don't love water?!!. It was my first time here in one of the most hot summer day!! Guess what? You will forget the weather and enjoy every second in this place! It's fair money cost.
Summer fun in the Wadi. A great place to have some fun with the family or friends. Clean and safe as ever for all ages. The rides still exciting and fast.

Perfect for adults or families with children. Many rides to enjoy and the water park is not huge so I don't worry about my kids getting lost.Family rides are a must do Children section is very nice but if your child is a little bit scared to go on the slides, they won't allow you to go down with him/her.If you decide to go on a Friday, be there first thing in the morning as it gets extremely busy around 1:00 pm

Great visit with a baby . We absolutely loved LOVED our visit to this water park. So much fun! And we had a baby 11 months old and there was a few slides etc that you can do with a small baby. We loved our visit!
well spend day. Been here with colleagues as its a good place for fun, have got many good rides, I really enjoyed , But the prices for lockers is bit high and not much variety of food options
Good day out. Good fun day. The park was clean but overall it was expensive for what it provided. The staff teaching how to body board were particularly good.

So so. It's clean and the design of it is nice. It has a nice view of burj al Arab. In my opinion it is just value for once visiting because the variety of the games it's not too much you don't have a lot of choice for games and also I think it's not value for money although because i stayed at jumairah creekside hotel I went to wildwadi for two times without paying.

Plenty of shade too!. Used to visiting the Florida water parks, this is much smaller but so much fun. Lots of different attractions with the rides and everyone very safety conscious. Ample loungers and lots of shade too. Well worth a visit.

amazing place for families & friends. wild wadi was a spectacular activity to do whilst in dubai. theme park of water attractions is perfect for the warm days in dubai. it was a great and fun filled time. 1000 pee cent recommend

Bit Dissappointing. Wasn't as many rides as I was expecting, the good thing about it was that it was pretty quiet due to Ramandan so there was no mad queues. The rides that were there were pretty good, I chickened out at the top of the Jumeirah Screamer..not a big fan of heights! Food was awful and really expensive there, bring something with you if you can.

Better for families with younger children. There is one ride that is a bit adventurous (not for little bits) but overall it's a smaller park . Nice lazy river, watch out for the wave pool and do get there early to get prime lounging chairs, I prefer the area just past the wave pool near shallow water and food kiosks. Towels are provided and I've seen all manner of swimwear. Parking is convenient and it's very easy to navigate, much more accessible than Aquaventure.(Atlantis)

Old but still good. The water park is old but they keep improve it and the best thing for this one is the location coz u can look at burj al arab and the jumara hotel at the same time and if u stay at jumara hotel u can access the water park for free

Great for kids. Friendly staff, great rides, good food at the pizza place. A great way to spend a day. The only thing to watch out for is to take an extra pair of flip flops, there is a shop if your flip flops come apart, but it will cost you a bit more.
water themed park. The best themed park i have ever been at so far, good place to go with a family or friends and they have water rides for all age groups

Expensive without the need to be. I place is nice and one can enjoy a nice day over there. However the ticket price is ridiculously expensive for such a small park with a small number of rides. Literally including queues you can go through all rides in 2 hours. The staff wastes alot of time so queue lines are very long. Prices to buy food of drink is funny. Make sure you don't buy from the park.

Simply love it!. This water park must be visited. There is entertainment for all ages, whether you are a child or adult you won't get bored. Fun rides and shoots, but also a simple relaxing water wave pool for those of you who don't wish to go on the shoots

Wild Amusement.. It's not an ordinary wadi, it's the wildest wadi I can say. for 175 AED with a discount me and my friends went over the weekend for some amazing water adventure. The place is very neat and tidy. The staff there is very helpful and nice. The food is a bit expensive though, but I wouldn't complain.One of the best places to visit for water adventure.

Great amusement Water Park. Nice variety of rides. The distances inside allow you to do all the rides with no much walking inside. You would need to select a day when it is not a public holiday as it is very crowded then,

Best thing we did in dubai. This water park is amazing much better then any other water park we have visited so much to do we spend the whole day here a full 8 hours!!My 5 year old was ecstatic! Such a clean safe and friendly environment. Life jackets available for kids and lots of inflatables everywhere!We sat on all the rides and enjoyed every bit of it.Food was available fresh and quick pizzas burgers fried chicken and ice creams with unlimited refill of drinks too.We got buy one get one free tickets through the entertainer book!!

Aquaventure is better. This one is just good. The problem is why would you settle for good if you have a chance to go for better? Wild Wadi is a good waterpark and you will not regret coming there. Aquaventure is just better.

Lovely time in Water park. Many variety of water activities . The wild wadi water park is a very interesting place for family with children to go out for a great outdoor activity day . This is a brilliant place where I can go again and again with friends/ family and never get bored . Each visit always feel different !

good experience but didn't worth enough. we were there..very large place full of such funniest things to do that maybe you run out of time in large queues...the foods there somehow was good...some photographs take your picture to sell you at the end but one photo will be sell to you 110 dirham that doesn't worth...you can buy waterproof case of mobile outside of wild wadi and you yourself take your photos (each waterproof cases there sell to you 140 dirham that i bought one opposite side of city center deira's carefore with only 30 dirham)we paid 320 dirham for enterance fee, round trip and a medium taste lunch for each person.
Disappointing . Very limited number of rides.The signage inside the park is a nightmare...Food choice is also very poor and charged at an extortionate price considering the quality.

Bad security . I gave wild water park a 3 because I enjoyed the rides and swimming pools but the security was poor, they did not live up to the standards as i expected and they can not control big crowds. However the lifeguards were very friendly and I did have a great time. One thing I could ask for then to improve on is the water park overall because it did not have much rides and there weren't much maps around. I could not find my way.
Fun for everyone. Wild Wadi aqua park is good for people from all different ages. Everybody can enjoy the water slides. I strongly recommend it.
Great family day out all year round very quiet , June to August. great relaxed swimwear only day out kids will love it swimming , slides , surfing , wave pools , burgers , drinks .

The kids loooove it !. The waterpark is great and safe, but the food is terrible which ruins partly the experience. As it is not a cheap treat, we would expect some healthier and fresher food on site. But the staff is friendly and helpful.

Bonding with Friends at Wild Wadi. If you want water parks, this is one of the best place in Dubai. With the iconic Burj al Arab, how can you go wrong? Pump up your adrenaline with things to ride there. My family went with our friends and it was all good fun. Its even pure joy for the kiddos.

Good day out. We visited while staying at Jumeiral Beach Hotel, the wave pool was very good and so was the lazy river all very tame and good for children or just a chilled day out, there was also plenty of other things to do for children. I did not go on the other ride but they looked great. The life guards were everywhere and plenty of places to eat and drink. I do think the one at the Atlantis is better
Simply enjoy. This park is quite expensive for foreigner but the number of slide that you will enjoy justify this cost. Half day there is the minimum!

Is there anywhere you want to get wet it`s when it`s plus 40 degrees. Here is your chance to get wet close to downtown .Plenty of attractions in various degrees of difficulty. Fun for a few hours.Wait to eat intill you let the area

Fun day out . I loved wild wadi as it was the highlight of my trip. We reallyEnjoyed all the rides especiallyJumeirah scairah (never again) lol.It was a fun day out we arrived as soon as it opened and didn't have to queue for most of the rides. After midday it started getting busy and there were expected queues but this did not take the fun out. I was a bit hesitant as I cannot swim but you feel very safe because there are lifeguards everywhere. Every ride has lots of lifeguards. So no matter where you are there will be a lifeguard who is watching you. The life guards And the staff at wild wadi were so friendly and had a great sense of humour. Loved it this is a must if your in Dubai

Great time!. Our 4yo son loved it here! He spent hours floating down the lazy river and enjoyed every minute. There are many activities - including activities for those more timid in water such as the wave pool and lazy river. Highly recommend for everyone

Water fun . Gotta go. We went during April which is shoulder season. Made great use of our entertainer vouchers. The good thing about the low season is that the queues are short! Love the near vertical drop.
Fun. Had an awesome time, the views on some of the slides are amazing went in the summer time, So it wasnt that bad being outside.

Not Dubai usual standards + over priced. Visiting wild wadi for the first time; It was a standard water park nothing impressive actually below Dubai usual standards, though we enjoy it and kids had great time but as an adult will not return besides tickets were over priced for what we get! Beverages and water were also expensive! Entrance and long queue were really annoying and ruin the whole experience! Kids got tired and start crying! The staff keep explaining to each visitor about lockers , foods payments ... Etc. As jumeirah hotels' guest we should get the access and all details from the hotel concierge and to pay the extras at the hotel in coordination with the Park to avoid the inconvenience at the entrance.
Ok place. The ride is Next to Madinat Jumeirah hotel and doesnt have much of rides as compared to other prominent parks in UAE.
Great water park. What more to ask? Burj al Arab on side, water park on side. Great fun, love Dubai, great place for fun.
Fun time in Dubai. Very nice park with a lot of rides in the heart of Jumeriah. They have steep high slides, slow moving rivers, fast moving rivers, wave pools and rip rides for boogie boards.

An attraction that never gets old!. Love this place! It allows me to embrace the inner child.Get there early to avoid long queues. Head straight to the Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley as these are the best rides, followed closely by Jumeirah Sceirah.
The pizzas are very big for lunch. The pizzas are big for lunch, be warned as we over ordered. Great water park. We got a bogof offer in the local paper in UAE.

So much fun. We enjoyed our stay at Wild Wadi, as it offers different water rides for any age. There are a lot of life guards, which assist you, provide information and make you feel safe at any time. Great park, international visitors and a lot of fun!
small, but great fun. small water park, but great rides and views...you can drift around all day or get blasted up to the tops of the rides, then enjoy the fun.....zero effort required

Amazing . Visited this place with family (had complimentary access as stayed at Jumeirah). A must in Dubai especially for kids. The rides are amazing and full of fun. This park gives amazing views of Jumeirah Beach hotel and Burj AlArab. Better to enter early as it's not too hot and less queues for the rides. Later during the day, queues can be very long and you waste a lot of time waiting for your turns. Access to lockers is charged at around AED 45 for a small one and this is non refundable. Bigger ones costs lots more. Food is of reasonable price. Felt that water and drinks are very costly and you will need loads of them due to the heat. Don't forget to take sun screen. Waterproof phone covers are sold at a very high cost. If you prefer to take pics with your phone, buy a waterproof cover elsewhere.

A must do in Dubai. Fantastic water park especially good for kids. I had a great time going on the rides,made my kids see a side of me they had never seen before.Will recommend this to families intent of making their holiday a memorable one.

Great. This is a great water park - only been once and it was Eid holiday so very busy. They have the surf machines which are fun - feel it has more thrill seeking rides compared to Aquaventure, less relaxing

Very limited range of rides too many people. It used to be the best, but now it's one of the less amusing water park. It over crowed and you spend all of your time waiting in the queues, waiting in the water for the ride to handle the load. It's nice but the other newer water parks are much better.

Not a bad place . just come back from a day at the water park initially it was frustrating as the que was really long at entrance as I was a guest my entrance was free which was rather nice when the guys in the que next to me were paying 60 pounds per person. we had a double buggy which was a bit difficult to get through the entrance Isles but once through wow what an amazing place had real fun well done

So much fun!. This Waterpark is defiantly a must go! Kids will love it, as well as adults! The park isn't that big but the rides are exciting and make up that. There's also a nice sunbathing area with a large pool, so you can relax and catch the sun while everyone else is on the rides if that's what you prefer. They upgraded their tall water slide, so now you stand inside a clear box, and the floor drops under you. Much more scary!!!

Top Class, Must Go. Well I guess being in Dubai you would expect the water park to be good. It is.. Great rides, really clean, amazing set up, little bit pricey but what do you expect.The money is well worth it as its a great day out and a MUST if you go to Dubai
Surfing!. I felt it was pricey at first but after I started surfing, it was all worth it. Great crowd and super fun place. Must do!

Wild Wadi - The coolest place in Dubai!. Attended Wild Wadi on Saturday 20th August 2016 and had a fantastic day out.For any tourist wishing to go, I would recommend getting a pass for the city tour bus, there is a stop right outside Wild Wadi and the buses pick you up at the same stop every 20 minutes. The tourist buses will talk you round all the other attractions before dropping you off near your hotel or the mall.You can spend the whole day at this attraction but due to the Dubai sun I'd recommend only 4 hours. The waterpark is completely set up to assist you staying in the shade with shade covers on all queues. The queues weren't too bad for most of the rides, unless you really want to, I wouldn't bother with the queue jumpers.My favourite ride was the capsule one (not sure of the ride name), it is truly a thrilling experience.This attraction is a must for any thrill seekers in Dubai!
Good trip. Everything going nice even it very warm weather that time.but great experience with friends team together

every one who travels to Dubai must spend a day at this wonderful aqua park. as you know Wild Wadi is the 6th best aqua parks in the world. me and my wife spend a day in this amazing aqua park. we go there by a tour that they they take 320 UA Derhams (about less than 90 US Dollars) each as: entrance + lunch meal (a sandwich with potato and coke) + shuttle service. it was very good for us. the point you should pay attend is that when you get there they give you a watch like bracelet. you should charge 45 UA Derhams per small shelf, 60 UA Derhams per Middle sized shelf and a big one that i do not know the price. second point, better use sunscreens . and the tools you can enjoy was great ones. if you afraid of adrenaline, better use some tools that has less speed and ask from the nice staffs that working there. there are some signs that has a small describe of tools. some one had named with "Floating" at the end of name are really frightening and adrenaline ones. we enjoy from almost every tools and games in there. last point is that better take slippers with yourselves else you cant walk specially in the noon times. if i want to go to Dubai again of course i would visit this nice and funny place again!
Wild Wadi. It's fun for everybody! I always go there with my friends. The rides are so fun and exciting! I was in Dubai 2000-2006. It's beside Burj Al Arab hotel.
So much fun. Definitely worth visiting the water park, especially in Dubai's 50 degree summer days! Great fun, loads to do. Food, drink and sun cream is expensive there so try and bring your own.

Not so wild these days. I have been going to the Wild Wadi since it opened. One of the main attractions for me has always been the wave pool. It was an invigorating experience and always great funOn my visit this time, it was hardly worth the wait for the waves to start. For some reason the machine that produces these thrilling waves has been turned right down to the point it is barely a swell. Such a shame. I may visit Atlantis on my next trip instead.

Fabulous Time. I have been there many times as it not only centrally located but it offers a variety of rides for thrill seekers. While the Jumeirah Sceirah is there big media attraction, the Burj Surj is our favorite. When you get tired of the main rides we love to take the lazy river around the park. This waterpark is easy to move around and pretty compact for the amount of activities there are.

What a great great place to go . Highlight of our Dubai trip by far, what a nice water parkGreat for Muslims as women can wear a Burkini and no one has an issue with it. Not like stupid France The park has a stream all the way around great to walk around in and use loops, I chilled mostly with the kids in the smaller area that was cool a big tea cup drops loads and kids of water on you great fun especially in the sun Would go again anyday
Thoroughly enjoyed . Wild wadi was incredibly fun. My family and I had a great time at the park and we would definitely recommend it to everyone who is going to Dubai

Wonderful. We had free admission into the waterpark with our hotel so I'm unsure of the value for money, however we had a brilliant time, with lots to do and plenty for children if on a family holiday. You can relax by the pool, or go down the crazy slides, & a towel is provided for you. The only thing I found wrong was the expense of a locker as it was 45AED which I thought should have been included but apart from that we had a fantastic time and it was really really fun.

LOADS OF FUN. A place you have to visit if you go to Dubai especially if you are with children. Very safe as water isnt to deep for adults and there are life guards on every corner watching you all the time. The place is fantastic. So many different rides, a area for the children, places to just sit and relax and many water sports to get involved in also. I dont swim and i am a little scared of water but i was at ease knowing im being watched incase i slip up. Food?? Nkt the best to be honest. Pizza OK (ish) but other than that its just about filling your self up. Id say food is 3 out of 10. Other than that the place overall is awesome. Please go if you in dubai. Prices are 295 dirams over 1.1 metres high and 250 below 1.1 metre so a average of 60 uk pounds per person.

It's nice not Dubai normal standard. It's expensive for what it is. Nice to get out of the heat, however l would not return there.Dubai is play capital of the world, so l don't want to waste time on things l can do at home.

Excitment. You will surely enjoy this water park and I recommend it to you to at least experience it once.
The only problem is lockers which their charge is excluded from entrance ticket . 45 dhms for small lockers!!

Fantastic Water Games . Been here couple of times and really fun and always can't get enough.
If you are the lover of water games this is your time.

superb fun day out for all the family. Bit pricey to get in, so try get on-line deals, enquire for discount vouchers at your hotel, or even better stay at any Jumeira property in Dubai and entrance is FREE !!!! Including Aqua-Adventure at the Atlantis Palm

Lovely Half day. We have been before but not with our teenage daughter. She wanted to go as we went to Atlantis water park last year. They were advertising a 25% discount for paying with a Visa card but when we went to pay were told it only applied to non European Visa cards! How convenient. Thought it was very expensive for the few slides there and whilst we enjoyed our time was really just a half day. For the same price I would go to the Atlantis.
not recommended in weekends. wonderfull upstream slides ,clean waterexpensive entry expensive foods inside ,a lot of harassment for ladies by teenagers

An enjoyable visit. Wild Wadi Water Park is a lovely experience to escape the blistering heat of Dubai. We spent a couple of hours there exploring some of the rides (they don't have too many) and just floating in the wave pool.

My visit to Wild wadi , bad and good things. Once I arrived yesterday in Wild Wadi I purchased a locker , went there with my wife , so after she changed I went to mens changing room and there were an issue with a locker , I just simply couldnt use any of lockers and the one I used couldnt open after , all my things were stuck in there , I've spoke to one of the guys from park who was there to try to fix my issue but then he took me to some other place to speak to some other guy named James ( all best comments about him , very polite and helpful ) , than I've been told to go back with him to locker to see whats happening , once we got there he start kicking locker with his hand and trying to open and he opened it. Where I've been told that its working , on my big surprise there was manager and few other staff around us , and I've said that I don't really want everytime I need something from locker to kick door with my hand and hope that door will open , and that I just arrived and I've spent 1 hour trying to fix issue with my locker while my wife is waiting me outside on heat wondering whats going on, they said we will give you another locker which took another 20 minutes of waiting. However I got another locker , very very very bad experience at very begging of visit and for my big surprise manager made it even more bad since he didnt even talk to me , he didnt even apologize for the issue I have what was horrible from side of someone on high position as him. Overall park is very nice and rides are good , safety on high level , just this issue made me very upset since its wasting of my time spending more than 1 hour for an issue simple like that. I don't think that this kind of issue should take that much time to fix and even more not making me walk here and there with them when they can do it on their own in very faster period. I am very unhappy with my visit only because first impression was very badd.
family fun. We had free entry from our hotel. It is best to get there early to beat the queues. Lots of staff to ensure things run smoothly. Fun day out.

A must if you have kids. Very well organised, plenty of lifeguards who are on the ball.which we saw first hand. Very safety conscious.food pricy as they have a captive ordinance.plenty of things to do.you will have to wait and queue for some rides

Water park with a view. Like a few on here we got free access staying at Jumeirah hotels,great just having wristband and everything(food if required) charged via this if required no need to carry cash. Found it a great way to spend a few hours although smaller than some water parks there was still plenty of choice of rides and relaxing pool and lazy river if required. Thoroughly enjoyed my visit.

Great Water Park. We visited a couple of times, we enjoyed the lazy river and more adventurous thrill rides which certainly make you scream ! A lovely couple of visits. Cool water is always welcome in August heat !

Waterpark. This is a place were you leave your kids free to do what they want to do
They loved it.went there about 4pm and was open till 10pm.avoid the heat in the day

Thoroughly enjoyed it!. We visited the park during Ramadan and was pleasantly surprised at how little people were at the park. We never had to queue or wait anywhere. We enjoyed the outing and the rides are fun.The fact that Wild Wadi is in the Entertainer as well makes this an all more affordable adventure to enjoy. My personal choice of water park would be Yas Island, followed by Wild wadi and Atlantis coming in last.

Lovely place with lots of fun. It was my first visit to wild wadi me and the kids and we spend full day there and it's simply a place to remember and sure am going to come back if not next month maybe tomorrow

Awesome. We had a very good time at the Wildwadi waterpark, the kids didn't want to leave, we had to stay there until they closed for the day, it seems to be too expensive for the money charged.Usage of locker is a ripoff, people should get changed in the changing room and carry their belongings with them, try not to go with too much cloth when You're visiting

fantastic. Another fine example of a water park... very good... Atlanta water park and wadi water park very good for kids and family.... go enjoy the water and a sun tan... make sure you take your sun tan lotion!!!!buy tickets from online sites you will save a lot
Free if you stay at a Jumeriah hotel!!. Unlimited free visits if you stay at a Jumeriah hotel!! Fantastic place!! Keeps the kids entertained all day!

Lots of fun. The park itself is smaller than i expected and the number of rides fewer. However it was a lot of fun especially given it was ~45 degrees!The staff are v friendly and at that time of year (August) the queues were quite small. The entrance fee is quite expensive but we all enjoyed ourselves and thought it was worth it.You also get some very nice views of the Burj Al Arab from the park. Happy sliding!

wild at the wadi. Went with a few friends to this park, just for a few hours.Too expensive for what it offers, though it was free to us as we stayed at Al Qasr. Food was again as last year ... terribleIt was very busy this time round, and queueing was a problem in the heat and direct sun, but a couple of the rides were worth it, fun and put a smile on everyones face.staff were ok here but not overly friendly or helpful.This place is a little dated now and needs an overhaul.
Summer water fun!!!. This is the most fun I've had in a loooong time. Considering it is summer and soo hot. It was refreshing and amazing!!!!! But don't forget your sun lotion.

Ok for a short trip but nothing to write home about. We visited Wild Wadi as we had it free with our hotel. As a place to spend a couple of hours it was ok, nothing special. We took in a few of the rides but it just felt crazy busy and quite over priced for everything inside the park. If we'd have had to pay I wouldn't have been too happy.

A bit overrated. I was expecting more from Wild wadi, don't get me wrong, the good rides are good but there's not a lot of them and I'm glad we got there at 11am on an early closing day (shut at 3pm) as it meant we got in for half price and I feel that the full price of around £50-55 per person is steep for what it is.. Atlantis is better value in my opinion.
Great Swim at Wild Wadi. Yesterday I had out at wild wadi , it was great for swim and fun in this time. Had great and fantastic experiences, Love to go again.
Family fun. Busy but enjoyable. Fantastic rides, thrilling, relaxing, lounging and tanning all in one. Great day out for the whole family!

Beautiful but not funny. My family and I visited this park four times,because we were in jumeirah beach hotel and had free entrance to park.In comparison with other water park it was not fun.games were good.food and beverages were more expensive but not delicious and various.over all it was good.Enjoy it....

Great fun! . We spent about 3 hours, did many of the rides, lockers are AED 48, a lot of fun and some places to shade from sun, with refreshments. Very clean, cover up as much or as little as you want ie a modest bikini is fine.
Great Day Out. Spent the day here with my daughter & granddaughter and what a fabulous time we had. the water sides are great fun and the main pool is great.

Nice rides, but prices for all services are definitely over-inflated.. Visited the Waterpark in Sept. 2016.Staff assisting at the water slides are really friendly. Average queues.Slides are ok - nothing outstanding.Prices are absolutely over-inflated. Especially for a tiny locker, sun protector. The excessive prices for pictures are a laugh.16 Dirham for a small bottle of Water ? It could be a nice Family park if prices would be reasonable.We won't visit this park a second time.

Not to be missed . Went there with family (2 adults and 3 kids who are 11 yrs old, 5 yrs old & 2 yrs old)We all enjoyed this place very much. It's for kids and adults The place looks really good with so much things to do to keep the whole family entertained His place is worth a visit!

My visit to wild wadi. I went to Yas Water world last year and was much better and It didn't go as I thought. The fast track is expensive and only one game it had the fast track and need to wait on queue for other games. I don't think that I will go to wild wadi again

Wonderful Experience. The place is absolutely fun especially for young children as they these long slides design for their age. Plus it has the amazing view of Burj Al Arab with is a super plus. A perfect location in Dubai, where it is accessible by bus and taxi and train station nearby.Everything essential is there from locker to food and helpful staff. Overall, my daughter and nice had an amazing day and will definitely go back there.
Excellent. Brilliant day out, much better than Atlantis, very clean, great slides, staff are friendly. Good food outlets that are reasonably priced

Just a fun place to be.... I have visited this park several times, the most recent of which was yesterday as its part of a hotel package stay at the Jumeirah hotel Al Qasr. This time we visited the park seeking an adventure without the children, it was wonderful. My husband and I had just as much fun together here as the children would usually. We went on All of the rides including the infamous Jumeirah Sceirah and the other scary rides. Some of the rides now have weight restrictions, tantrum alley and /or Burj Surj. This wasn't managed as best as possible with lots of people forming additional queues at the entrance to the ride because they were waiting for the right couple to team with / making the right group weight to be allowed access to the ride. In the past 2 people could go on a 4 person 4 but now it has to be 4 and a group of 4 with the Right weight. This was Long but we got there in the end. It could be managed better by posting the recommended weight at the beginning of the queue so people can add themselves before queuing. Could also advertise for male/female pairs or male/female and 2 children. Then people have an idea how to proceed. The ride itself is Awesome. Scary and risky and totally enjoyable. Tips: you only live once... Try the Jumeirah Sceirah... Yikes!!If you're a hotel guest TAKE the hotel shuttle which is a golf trolley enabling direct access to the park w/out more queues.Good luck! Enjoy

Family fun. We stayed at Atlantis, so had included entry to the water park. We arrived early, which was good to secure deck chairs in the shade. Great water play area for children and heaps of lifeguards on duty. We only stayed the morning because it was too hot in the afternoon, but will be going back.

Great for Grandpa too!. Had to go and experience the rides whilst on holiday with grand children - just to please the children irrespective that i could have said no after viewing the rides!Did my bit, grandpa a hero again with them and i had an experience!!
Amazing water park . If you love water parks wild wadi is the place for you it's so fun and full of surprises and it's not that expensive

Lovely but lying. . Had a fun day at Wild Wadi - but did not appreciate being LIED to by staff on the way in. We were coaxed into renting a locker - "Will we get our 45dhs back?" We asked, TWICE. "Yes." They replied. TWICE. On our way out we found this wasn't the case, and we'd wasted 45dhs on something we really didn't need. So my advice? Don't listen to the staff members on the turnstiles... They are either not trained properly or are blatantly lying for commission.
Fun. Really enjoyed the park. Fun rides, average queues but the park needs refurbishing as it looks dated compared to other parks.

A lovely waterpark. We visited with our two boys 11 and 13 at end of August. There were some big rides for the thrill seekers a lazy river and wave pool. The wave pool compared to water parks in the US was disappointing.We had free access from hotel and found it best to go in first thing at 10 when it was quieter no queues and choice of sunbeds till around 12 when starts to get busy.We would have booked our holiday for different dates had we known the water park was open till 10 pm on a Friday June to September - we missed this.We took bottles of water in from hotel you couldn't take in any other food and drink.

Good day out . As we stayed in Jumeirah Zabeel we could visit Wild Wadi for free. We decided to check it out with the kids. It was very warm (about 40c) so we weren't expecting to get wowed by this place at all. But what a pleasant trip. Easy to get in and several water 'rides' or areas suitable for 4 and 2 year olds. Kids had a good time. Food selection is very little but pretty decent quality. Biggest downside is if you lose a member of your group it is difficult to locate them. Place is huge and noisy. And there is no announcement system. Understandable as there's alot of water noise topped with people enjoying themselves (or scared senseless) screaming their heads off.Would I pay £60 per person with such young kids. No. That would be dumb.

Loved it. Love this place every single time we come we have such good fun. Everyone enjoys. Ideal its free with our hotel but would never pay as its sooo expensive. Defo should be cheaper then that. Food inside is not bad too. Overall good fun
Fun couple of hours in the heat. Family fun but very expensive. Enjoy the scenery of the local seaside buildings while you swim. Try to avoid the crowds.

Fun Fun Fun. Go to Dubai every other year for the past 12 years and every time we go it gets better. Full of fun and new rides being build every year or two. Home to Jumeirah Sceirah scariest ride in Dubai. 3.2.1.Aaaagh Only problem is once been a few times the only scary challenging rides are Jumeirah Sceirah, Tantrum Ally and Burj Surj. Overall an incredible waterpark with money stored in a wristband/watch. I highly recommend you go.

Lovely day out. Had a wonderful time here. Queues were not too long. My kids love rides and being in water so this was ideal for them. My 3 year old wasn't allowed on a few rides as he is not tall enough but there was still enough to do.
Awesome. I would really recommend this attraction when you are visiting Dubai.Not only for childeren but also really fun for adults!

Loved it!. Me and my family always have an amazing time at Wild wadi Waterpark!It was now our 4th time at the Waterpark and it becomes better each time!We spent most of our time on the shoot slides that connect to the lazy river at the end. On this ride it connects to all different slides so you don't have to step out of your float- it is all of my family's favourite ride(s)!The lifeguards are very alert and friendly! In my personal opinion I would say that the Waterpark, in terms of rides and food, is better then the Atlantis Waterpark, which we visited last year! The food is good but a little bit pricey!I will be returning to Wild Wadi Waterpark again- for my 5th visit, we cannot wait!!

It's a good way to cool off with the family on a very hot day.. I probably expected too much, because the rides are great fun, the staff are helpful and friendly, and it's modern, up to date and clean. The fast food restaurants aren't great, the food quality is poor, but I do realise that it's a water park not a food destination. My kids loved it, so it's probably just me, but I couldn't help thinking there was something missing. I'm sure if you want to splash about in the hot sunshine and that you don't expect too much that you'll enjoy it.
Entertainment........... Its a good place for an entertainment.......Atteast every one need to visit once.You will enjoy it.
Have been three times enjoyed alot. Beautiful Product, nice rides and very amazing experience. don't remember names of ride but all of those enjoyed except sequria as I have height fobia

Great fun! . Wild Wadi is much smaller than Acquventure Waterpark which makes it easier to get to all the rides, and also has a great vibe and culture. Would definitely recommend people to go to this waterpark!

Fun with Frd's. We all enjoyed a lot as a part of big water spot activities good choice to go with family or Frds. Only the think make me disturb to realise the staff need to be more frdly and helpful.

Visit it at least once. We have visited the park many times in the last years and it is always in our list with the things to do when we spend our vacations at Dubai. This year two new waterslides were ready, actually they are two identical slides side by side. It has a lot of rides and you can easily spend a whole day there. There are slides where three or four persons can use the same tube. The park is very clean overall. If you are visiting the park, avoid Thursdays and Fridays which is the equivalent of Saturday and Sunday, or public holidays. At those days the park is overcrowded. Snacks are reasonable priced. One suggestion for drinks, is to buy one of those drinking cups which can be refilled for free. For a day’s visit you can have the AED 75 option, with which you get unlimited free refills for a single day, or if you are staying at any Jumeirah hotel, you can have the AED 100 option with which you get unlimited free refills during your whole stay at the hotel. Both options are valid for soft drinks and water. The first time we have visited the park was in 2012 and the water was really cool and enjoyable. Since then, almost every year the water is slightly warmer than the previous one. This year the water temperature was higher than comfortable and this is the opinion of our whole family. I do not know why they don’t keep the water temperature cool anymore. However, we have noticed this happening to other waterparks in the area. Another change this year, was the replacement of some beds with chairs. You cannot really spend a day sitting on a chair, squeezed in rows like a theatre and every time someone wants to get out, you have to either stand up or pull your feet together to make way. There are lifeguards all over the place which are very watchful especially at pool areas and they behave professionally. Despite that, in one of the slides which move you upwards using water jet, the jets did not manage to push my tube up the slide and it started going backwards and then forwards again. This was repeated for two or three cycles. The riders of a double tube coming behind me at full speed hit me very hard at the head with their feet. Then the guards hit the emergency stop. The park looks to have very high safety standards and this is one of the reasons we visit it. Since the back and forth of my tube lasted for some time I believe it should have been noticed by the guards earlier and they should have pushed the emergency stop some seconds earlier. Overall, if you are in Dubai with your family and kids, you must visit the waterpark.

Mr s patel. Good water park .you can spend your day out but it's not good as yas water world in abudhabi ...yas water world is more better than this..I think it's famous because of its near by burj al Arab & jumairah beach .other wise it's nothing..

Dubai 2016. It was absolutely amazing!!!! The people the service, the help, from the arrival at the park to the departure , everything is perfect.And the view is an added bonus.Wild wadi is never timeless activity and it's never too old for anyone.Everyone loved it!!!!

Everyday at Wild wadi. We spent every day here whilst on holiday for a week. We arrived at 10 AM most mornings and there was always plenty of places to find chairs or sunbeds.we spent most the day on the rides or the lazy river and by the wave pool. I felt redundant as a parent on this occasion as my child spent hours on flow rider. So we just nipped to and fro from the rides to check every now and then. This place is so clean ,safe and fun for all ages. I prefer wild wadi to Atlantis water park. I even managed to walk around the park without any footwear for a change as usually it's too hot to do so.

Great waterpark for fun day. Family of all ages can enjoy the water rides.. Located next to Jumeirah Beach hotel. Entry is expensive but worth it with a voucher (1 person free entry with a full paying person) which can be obtained by buying the Entertainer book/App or buying the specific voucher on Ebay. There are plenty of water rides and for all ages. When we went we were fortunate that queuing times to get on rides were low (between 5 mins to 20 mins). I recommend taking beach shoes which will will help during walking in between the rides without feet burning walking on the ground.

Good Day out. We visited as we were staying at a Jumeirah hotel so gained complimentary access. There are not a huge variety of rides but we really enjoyed the ones that were there - doing each 3-4 times. We really liked how the river rapid type rides are linked together seamlessly so you start with one and end up doing nearly all of them in one go. The park was smaller than we had expected but still stayed for around 4 hours.

Great fun went twice. Go at opening time if possible. Queues appear later in the day as with any popular attraction. Queues are well managed.Stay in a hotel with complimentary entry such as Mina A Salam. Any other costs can be billed to your room.
