Not worth it. Its really nice and has nice waterslides, but I've seen much better in Dubai. If you are going to stay in a hotel that offers tickets with your stay, then you should go but I don't think it deserves a visit on its own.

Great family day. We had a great day at the wild wadi no food or drink allowed in take your own towel or hire one 40dhr each you need to be 1.1metre tall for all slide rides but the rapids were great only ride in the park were you go up as well as down everyone enjoyed this ride (we are 5, 7, 32, 35, 59, 61 years of age) even nanny liked it. the other slides were up to 4 people ride together were also great the highlight of the day was when my grandson 7 years old did the biggest ride in the park then dabbed the admiring crowd. This is worth the money.

Great fun day out . This was my second visit to wild wadi after the first vist wasn't over impressed however this time it was a great day out so much fun and I loved the drink offer always pay the extra it is worth every penny. The park is still the most expensive out of the 3 palm Atlantis and Yas waterworld and I think could be a bit cheaper in price as Yas is much larger. However a good day out with friends
Fab day out! . We all had a fab day out at Wild Wadi water park! The park is well set out, fab slides & swimming facilities. We'll be back!!

Really hot and hard to enjoy, but we did. It was so hot (50C) when we went and our feet were burning. We started with the Sceirah and that was worth the price of admission. all the rides were great and no wait time...probably because we went in August. It took me awhile to realize the drink deals that you could get, so do some research. there is an unlimited drink that you can get but you need to carry it around, I think...we paid dearly but you need it to cool off and keep hydrated. My son had a some medical issues and many staff were there to help so this was really nice. Finding shaded places to sit and relax is difficult unless you pay for the private cabanas, so wear an old hat and keep hydrated, the rides are totally worth it.

Fantastic. The customer service is great, they supply nappies and life jacket and swimming aid for young children. The place is great for young children and the food is reasonably priced, the pools are clean and they have plenty of life guards available.

Fun day out for adults and kids. A compact park which is easy to navigate and to find all the slides and so on. Family raft rides are superb, (spectacular views from the tower at the top of the queue for this ride, particularly of the 7 star Burj al Arab hotel), and a little scary particularly the bowl slide aspect which really turns your stomach upside down! Plenty of lifeguards around in each area and they are very vigilant. A positive thing, but it meant that the wave machine in the main pool was hardly ever on as when they blew their whistle at anyone it was turned off for what seemed like ages. We bought a refillable cup which was invaluable and able to fill up with any soft drink at any kiosk. At the entrance, there was the option of loading a wrist band with some money to spend around the park. We didn't do this which was a mistake as it meant that it was a trip back to the locker every time we needed to buy something. At the end of the day any money not spent on it is refunded.Food was really delicious. Ordered a pizza for children which was huge. Food not cheap but in line with what you would expect to pay at any main attraction.Loads of sun bed and parasol availability even though quite busy.On balance a great fun day out when hot, though you may be a tad ,tad disappointed if expecting the scale of Florida's Blizzard Beach/Typhoon Lagoon.

Super fun for the family . Wild wadi is a must do water park destination in dubai. It's located perfectly in jumeirah and has a great mix of rides for all age groups. Even with the advent of aqua venture at Atlantis and Yas waterworld in Abu Dhabi, wild Wafi still has soul and is a must do for tourists and residents alike.

Great way to spend the day with kids. Nice compact park with plenty to do for the kids, best to get there close to opening time, so you get some rides in without having to wait too long in queues. Food was ok value and a good selection. The changing facilities are very small and crowded especially since they insist that you must use a tiny changing cubicle to get changed in...they only had 6 mens ones! Good value if you have a 2 for one entry or great value if you get free access from your Jumeirah Hotel.

Nice day out. This water park is located next to Burj al Arab. You have the chance to rent a cabana. This are located in a Privat area in the park and give you also nice shade. The rides are great the time was passing by so quick.

Very fun . If it is a hot summer day and you and your family are not busy the place to go is wild wadi but we won't suggest it for people who are afraid of heights and a family with pregnant women and babies

Great fun in the sn. On those hot summer days nothing is better than a water park and this is a great one. Plenty of rides and restaurants and as most of the local people either can't afford or don't like the sun, it's pretty much empty, meaning no cues for the rides.

It's not worth it! For 1-2 and your back out, the clothing is not warm enough!. Staff were not helpful at all!!! Rude and can't be bothered to assist you!
Would not recommend this adventure to anyone, total waste of money!
Great day out. Fabulous fun day out, take beach shoes though as floor gets really hot , rides great fun and wave pool good size for something different

Good summer treat. Visited with 4 of my friends....
Had a fun though only 4 major slides are thr. Liked the wave pool and good water activities to do.

What can you say!. Start to finish one of the best experiences for the family. It helps that it's free with jumeirah hotel stays and is a real incentive to book. Plenty to do and for all ages. Hands down definitely something a Muslim family can enjoy. Food is available as are plenty of towels and the hotel being less than 100ft away really helps. Free access means you can come and go as you please especially if you have little ones that need to have naps. Highly recommended.
Amazing place for Family & kids. you will enjoy every minute you spend it in Wild Wadi , I’m sure you will love it . The best water park in Dubai .
Must visit... One of the best places on earth.. Visited here while a back i think in 2005! Loved it each minutes.. Nicely designed.. Great fun..
Worth visiting . We are passing though the place and it was Friday morning, they asked to come in the evening and we didn't have enough time to visit. So we just passed by.

Good yes excellent no. While staying in Dubai we took a taxi to visit the water park (taxi very reasonable approx £40) the water park is showing signs of ageing and in need of some tlc, good choice of water slides and great selection of drinks and food outlets Would recommend getting there at 10am when opening as for busier and busier as the day went on resulting in quite large waiting times for slides A slight negative one of the family rides was closed all day which my two children were quite looking forward to

A day well spent. If you are on a visit to Dubai with young children then you must visit this Water Park. I bet you will not be disappointed.We didn't want to come out of the water as it was so enjoyable. The water course is just fantastic and the water buckets are a treat.

Well worth a visit. Excellent easy access if staying at Jumeriah beach hotel especially with complimentary access. Good rides with relaxing lazy river. Sun beds and shades are very close.Entrance fee a bit pricy for the size and rides available.We found it best to arrive early before the park fills.

Good fun, ideal for children. We went here whist staying at the Jumeriah hotels next door:- good selection of rides, suitable for children and adults- something to appeal to everyone- friendly staff- large water area with waves every couple of minutes- wet play area for toddlers- big lazy river that goes around most of the complex- some faster rides as well.Overall this was a fun afternoon out (we went twice).

11 slides on 1 ride . I went to the ladies night at wild wadi which is on a Thursday from 8pm until midnight. I went on a slide that had 11 different slides. And was so fun. Cameras are banned however and a photographer is not present at the ladies night. This is so the women are not photographed. However if you come at any other time you can take phones and cameras in. It was a great evening!
Must Enjoy. To beat the heat of UAE summer, you need to visit this perfect place for a cool splash with your family and loved ones to get a fresh dose of recharge !!!

water paradise. I've been to wild wadi twice and it was so fun. Trust me if you are in Dubai you don't want to miss this place it is like a water paradise. It has many different selections of waterslides and swimming pools and flow riders. And its great for both big and small families. The price is perfect and worth visiting. highly recommended.

Mina Aslam hotel holiday . Had free entry as hotel guests. Took kids a Couple of times. It's kids paradise they just don't want to leave. The water is so soothing in the July heat, you just want to get soaked. The trill seeking rides my elder two went on multiple times and they just had a whale of a time.

seen better days. even tho this attraction is free to hotel guests staying at Jumeriah hotels its deffinatley seen better days-from check in to facilities for changing are at best mediocre.it requires a complete overhaul or a reduction in entrance fees from the fee paying public Along way to go before its comparable to Orlando similar attractions

Wild wadi has many rides and is great for all ages and price is reasonable . There are many rides and family rides too if you are too afraid to go on your own on a tube .there is a children's area where the bucket falls and a public beach wave pool which is super fun . If you want to just chill you can also go to the lazy pool and float around

Great way to cool your self. Went to Wild Wadi on the 22nd of August 2016. Great place to enjoy and have fun . Avoid Friday's as it over crowded.First getting to wild wadi park is a bit of a mission if you don't know how the metro work's.get off at the mall of the emirates and then find the exist that lead's to the bus stand and catch the no 81 which take's you near the park,,, From the bus stop its about 10 min walk.Admission fee's are high AED 295 and AED 250 for kids. But having a voucher which entitle's you a bogof option.Locker's are charged at 45 aed and food at 60+ per meal.Rides are fun and safe. children have a separate area and have plenty to do.Only down side is the ticket price.
Average. Couple of good rides, getting a little old and outdated however convenient location. Very high entry price for what it is

closing hour.. I loved the park it has really good rides, however upon closure of the park the security and restaurant staff were very rude and kicked us out like we were some sort of criminals, it was appalling.It ruined the whole lovely day experience. They need to be taught alittle bit of PR. Really sad.

Not Without My Wild Wadi!. Specially for families. Dubai Without Wild Wadi is not complete. Recieve abundant vitamine D due to sunshie and very pleasant hours with family in a well desighed water park.

FUN!. We enjoyed a lot in this water park. All the rides were less crowded (lucky) and the assistance are very friendly and safety conscious. The food items and the merchandises are expensive. I recommend a 5 to 6 hours to spend here and enjoy the rides. Jumeirah Sceirah is the best and i couldn't breath for few seconds!
A bit of water fun. Small but nice. Excellent for those with young families on a hot sunny day. Well staffed and clean. Can be expensive, but demand is high for this park.

A must try for families. Was in Dubai and went to the Wadi Park 2 times. Easy entry process with good clean changing rooms with shower facilities.
Overall the Park has many water rides a kids play area and is a must try if you have time
Would highly recommend a vist

Good fun and spacious . Perfect for kids as not too big and lots of sun loungers. Not as big as Atlantis so if you're looking for slides, slides and more slides you should go there. But for kids or a more chilled out day go to wild wadi. Staff are so professional and nice. Very friendly. Opt for the package which includes lunch and unlimited drinks and book at the park which usually is cheaper than booking through your hotel. Approx 250 drh on entry per person

Great water park - but go early and avoid weekend . This is a great waterpark. Lots of slides and enough for kids and adults - great for 8+. My kids loved the Jameria Scriaha and the corn cups! It is still good for tots. But an expensive day out. Make the most of it and go early to get a good sunbed. Also worth doing the refillable juice cup. They don't let you take food and drink in so if you want to sneak some in- be very discrete! We went twice and the weekends are busier so avoid if you can. Be prepared to queue for rides and food..if you can buy the Dubai voucher booklets (about (£50) you get Bogof for here and loads of restaurants including the Atlantis - worth the investment and research before you go. Dubai is not cheap for a family holiday.....
👍🏼👌🏼. During summer in Dubai and to cool down I highly recommend with friend or children.It prohibits to enter with you food or drinks u should only buy from the inside

It's ok. There are a few new rides added which make wild wadi much better than it was but realistically still does at compare to others for the size and the food options But a good day out non the less

Just a normal waterpark. Its okay, we went cause we got free passes when staying at Jumeirah hotel. Its not too bad for the kids but nothing compared to Atlantis. Perhaps we should have come here first. Very disappointed with the food just rubbish burgers and pizzas and chips
Lot of fun!. A lot of fun - not only for children. A few places were closed but it was still good entertainment. We were 14 February. We received free pizza and mascot. Great gift!

Fun and worth it. Try the jumeirah sakira ride and tantrum valley for sureDon't forget to bring the right outfit with you (especially if you're wearing hijab and an islamic outfit ) you shouldn't wear denim and clothes with zippers .Charge your bracelets at first for lunch .It was a great and memorable experience but i kinda wanna see more variable rides if I'm coming back next time .Thank you Wild Wadi ❤Ps. I think the slushs (those ice crushed drinks with flavor) here were a little expensive ? Its just ice and flavor , is it necessary to charge this much ?

Its always feel like first time visit. I love all that park. its makes you feel like first time visit. It has a lot of water games and its connected to beautiful beach if you stay in that area. You can have mix of many things. It good for both adults and kids. Sure will visit it again
Fun!!!!. a great place to have fun with family and friends. variety of rides for grown-ups like me who is afraid of heights!!! LOL
It is amazing. I advise everyone to visit as you can spend almost a full day along with your family and friends enjoying the water parks sliding, swimming, games and others.

Good Experince. The Water park was fun, Even though the number of Rides available are limited and during busy days the waiting time is more for enjoying the rides with a regular ticket. Else you need to purchase a Gold Ticket to avoid the Que.The Jumeirah Sceirah and Burj Surj was amazing, Rest all were average rides only.Before booking the Ticket look for the current offers in ther website, so you can save some money

Excellent... a must visit if you can afford..!!. We had a lovely time. Excellent staff. Attentive lifeguards who were preventing any potential risks as well as quick to dive in to assist. We witnessed the very quick actions of a lifeguard to prevent a man from drowning in the wave pool. We felt very safe in the water here.Water temperature was perfect. The cleanliness has improved and the entrance system is better compared to our last visit 2 years ago.Highly recommended.

Fun Filled Fantastic Day!. This is a great day out for all the family. The park has many different areas and there is fun around the corner for all ages. The slides are great and the lazy river is a nice trek, especially when you are ushering an excited toddler and a nervous mum round on a doughnut!

Was a lot of fun. Visited Wild Wadi was a nice waterpark water was clean and it was very safe with lots of lifeguards. The rides were fun and friendly staff and customer service. Only negative point is that the food and souvenirs were expensive from wild wadi.
Fun!!!. If you like water parks, you will love this one. Fun for the whole family. The rides are all shaded so even in summer it is bearable. The water is also chilled so it's refreshing.
Good fun. They don't have a lot of variety in watersports, but to go for a couple of hours is perfect. Make sure that you are there when the doors open that way there are very few people and no cues!

Awesome. We had a fantastic time at Wild Wadi great day out with the kids. The rides were perfect for all sizes. Kids loved it. The only drawback is the costs of extras and food. Far far too expensive.
Just loved it. A must place to visit if u want to spend a day full of fun and entertainment. Will be back here for sure

Better than Aquaventure. I visited here again after a few years gap in May of this year and was pleasantly surprised at the updating to rides and general facilities around the park. The Jumeirah Scarer is still the best ride in Dubai and is now fully enclosed making it much safer. The location is much closer to everything than Aquaventure which is stuck out on the Palm and means you only have a short journey home after. Once you've parked you're not far away from the changing facilities, unlike Aquaventure and it's cheaper and more compact. If you're taking children you might want to get a swimming t shirt to ensure they don't get too much sun exposure waking between the rides. Great family day out for all the kids and big kids!

Good For A Few Hours... Just Dont Spend Anything!!. Wild Wadi Water Park is free to enter when staying at selected hotels which makes it ideal for a splash about for free.Beach Towels are provided complimentary at the entrance, but lockers cost a whopping 45AED! Best to leave the valuables in the hotel.The rides are good but moving between them can be uncomfortable on the feet when its hot... and you exit the rides at different places so slippers arent an option.Jumeirah Sceirah is amazing!!
Lovely. Been twice already in two days as my 6 year old daughter love's it. She is tall enough now for all the rides.
Nice and Fun. Wild Wadi Water Park i believe this is Belongs to Jumeirah Group. lot of fun elements at least one time you need to make an experience in Wild wadi.
Fun place. I go every year in summers on the ladies only night 7pm to 1am..its great fun a must visit once !clean friendly staff fun rides nice place
Had a Great time!. Always enjoy Wild Wadi! Best for kids and families. Some new rides. The only disappointment was that the wave pool is no longer a wave pool. The waves are small!

Kids went eveyday.. Really nice waterpark that is part of the Jumeirah hotels, as we were staying at Dar Al Massaf entry was free, saved us a fortune. it only seamed busy on the Friday as this is a day off for the locals.
My kids loved it !. My kids absolutely loved it at the Wild Wadi Water Park, but I would not recommend for kids under 1.1m tall as its height restricted.
good place. its awesome place goo job its a lovely place enjoyable tooo goood the place is really good, i enjoy with my family & friends need to go again & again i feel it like that

Safe fun for all the family. This waterpark has something for every age, from thrill rides to lazy rivers. It is very diverse in its offering. If you pay to enter you should stay all day. Food and drink is not expensive there compared to elsewhere in the Jumeirah beach complex. There are lockers and lots and lots of various types of seating, pool side and elsewhere. Young children will have an absolute ball and be really safe.

Great. Very cooling for a hot summer day in the middle east. Kids enjoyed it. Has rides for adults and kids. Our 2 year old had a great time. Food really expensive inside though. No choice though.Good changing rooms. Includes prayer rooms just inside the changing rooms area.
Fun time. We went to wild wadi because we were staying in the Jumeirah. It is good. Atlantis is better but saving 200 dollars made us happy. They have about 5 great rides. We really enjoyed it.

Great place to have fun with your kids. Layzi river and the rapids are great.There is eating places that is in expensive and even a clothes store if you forgot your bather.I stayed the whole day with my kids at this place while my wife was shopping
Safe and fun. My kids and cousins wanted to go to wild wadi alone. Was a bit apprehensive at first but let them go alone any ways. They came back happy and had an excellent time.It's a safe place

Small and crowded. We stayed at one of the hotels in Jumeirah Madinat, so we had the water park entrance for free. If I had paid for the entrance for this water park I would have regretted spend my money. To much people. To much line. Not been maintained. Only fun thing was the fishes that eat the dry skin from your feet.

EXCELLENT. Speechless, great waterpark and very short queues, loved it. My favourite slide was Burj Surj and the lazy river that flowed throughout the park was great. Number 1 choice waterpark in Dubai.
Nice waterpark. Smaller than others waterparks in the country, you will find great view on Burj Al Arab.A good day of fun but a little bit expensive... Look for special offers to visit!

Wild AF. I paid a visit here as I had complimentary access to the waterpark through Jumeirah Emirates Towers. There is a regular shuttle service to and from the hotel to here, Zero Gravity private beach and Dubai Mall. Even though I have visited Wild Wadi many times before, it never fails to amaze me. Jumeirah Sceirah did not result in personal injury this time. Staff are always friendly and the venue is close to popular resorts, bars and restaurants. If you're staying at any Jumeirah property, you would be silly not to go. This is the joint-best waterpark in Dubai. The other one is, you guessed it... Atlantis Aquaventure.
Sab. Brilliant water park which is safe for children. Lots of life guards around. This water park is free to visit if you are staying at a Jumeriah hotel.
Really great fun. Myself, wife and daughter loved this place. Was really good run and staff were great. Evening times it tends to get very busy.
Amazing Fun. Very excited and safe that should be visited by every Dubai traveler. It is a little expensive but it has the value of visiting

Fab. Visited with a 5 and 14 YO Had the best time. Well worth the cost to attend.My girls loved it , food and drinks are expensive ( like any theme park).Have a good breakfast before you leaveDont visit on a fri or sat as this is their weekend so can be busy. We went on a sunday it was quiet - que no more then 10 mins if that. Plenty of sunbeds. Hire a locker.

Adventure with friends. We had a group of six that went to Wild Wadi and we had a blast. This was a great way to have fun relax in the floaties and float around in the water. We had fun on the slides. Alot of laughter for the soul. We didn't have children with us, just a bunch of adults living in their youthfulness. A great way to cool off, get wet and enjoy life. They offer many small children polls and activities. They have this area you can pay and Soak your feet and little tiny fish eat the dead skin off your feet. Photos were taken by wild wadi, you can purchase them.

Awesome experience!!. I really love to go back to this place and i had so much fun swim at the wave pool and try the rides except the jumeirah sceirah, the view of Burj Al Arab and the staff, they are very friendly and helpful they are very hardworking although the weather in Dubai now increase to 42-47 degrees they can still survive.. Keep it up guys!
Perfect. This place is a perfect place to be in the 40 degree heatMy son loved it here, long queues but worth it

best aqua park in Dubai. don t miss this adventure. the park is very large, many games to do, for all ages, very safe, lifeguards are everywhere, no blind spots. very well organized. 1 full day required to worth the price .

"Really fun". I've been here for the second time and I really enjoyed very much...I am having with those slides especially the capsule one.it was a bit scary at first because you have no idea at all where to drop..its just only the water splashing you and you keep holdin your breath...the food was great...its mouth watering shawarma and a big cup of soft drinks ..I can't even finish the other shawarma..we really have much fun....next time I will really try that surfing once I have a tight shirt to wear on it....
Second best Water park in the UAE. Second best water park in the UAE after Atlantis. Liked the new rides added, the water was a bit cold even though it was September.

Wonderful experience!!!. I played all the rides where every ride many staffs, crews and lifeguards who are ready to assist you for any needs and inquiry. Facilities and amenities are easy to use and neat. Mostly players were well satisfied and enjoyed the whole day including Me! I would recommend this activity to anyone for future Dubai vacation plan. Price is worthy enough...
Great waves pool!. I love waves pools and the one inside Wild Wdi Water Park is great! Tubes are as well good for all tipes of needs. I haven`t eat inside so I can`t tell you an opinion.

My 2nd favourite waterpark in the UAE! . After Yas World in Abu Dhabi, Wild Wadi is my favourite waterpark. It's perfect for thrill seekers as there's loads of big rides, and it's also great for families with young children.As it's always been busy when I've been the queues can be quite long so you must make sure you arrive early and stay until closing! If you go when the days are shorter, by the time the park shuts it becomes dark so you can see the Burj al Arab light up as you leave.A must-do in Dubai!

Overated and overpriced. We had free admission due to a special deal with the hotel we were staying at, but had I paid for a family of 4, I would not consider it to be good value.Despite the hype, there really are only 4 waterslides if you ignore the children's area. The Tantrum Alley was the best with the Burj Surj a close second. The high water slide with the vertical drop was only mildly scary, although my 11 year old son was a little apprehensive getting into the pod with the trap door which can be claustophobic. The Lazy River ride starts off well and then gets really boring and slow with a huge bottleneck of mostly boisterous young men which can get a little intimidating for women.We went to the park twice, but after experiencing the best rides 3 or 4 times, it got a little boring, especially having to queue. I would imagine in the peak season it would be extremely crowded.Compared to other waterparks and water rides around the world, the Wild Wadi was really no match.

Needs a bit of updating but still very good!. Feel as if a lot of the rides needs updating - some where closed for repairs etc but the rides at Atlantis is a lot better. The water park is clean and you get some amazing views of the Burj Al Arab and Jumeriah Beach hotel however there isn't many sun loungers and we had to resort to sitting on chairs near the water which wasn't ideal.

Wild wadi for age 6 and up. Fab day out, but with the hotel package this is well worth it!Have kids aged 6 and 9 who went on all the thrill rides aside from jumeireah scarer!!'But of advice is to attend for the first two hours when the park opens via the hotel entrance go on all the big rides multiple times and then relax in the pool for a bit. We often then returned to our hotel pool for the afternoon or did other activities!!!Both kids enjoyed burj surj and my 6 year old went on tantrum alley for the first time and it was scary but ten minutes later all we heard was " again please". Do advise using the life jackets for smaller swimmers in the wave pool part even if u can swim well! Lifeguards are brilliant throughout relaxed yet helpful and keep everyone behaving!Recommend this watermark to everyone in Dubai. We have been every year and enjoy it more and more!
Excellent place. Very nice place where you can push some adrenalin in your body and enjoy hot summer weather. Several visits to the same place and feel no bored time.

Great Park for kids 11+. You have to be above 120cm for most rides so not really suitable for small kids. For everyone else great day out, loads for amazing rides with small waiting times. Some of the best rides we have been on. 5 food outlets across the park and plenty seating. The river is a bit slow.Warning, it's hot so make sure you have max sun cream on. For kids we bought uv swim kit which was needed as at times you are in the blazing sun. Easy to get to with plenty taxis outside when park closes at 7pm.

Fun all the way. We deliberately visited this water park the last day of our visit. Great family time, different rides for all ages. We all loved the slides especially the dark tunnel one. We loved the beach-like area.  The attraction closed early at 6pm. We all didn't like that. Don't know if this is the daily closing time but we visited on Thursday and they said they had the ladies night later that day.

Best water park I have ever been too. The safest, cleanest and nicest smelling water park I've ever been too. Highly recommend. My younger children (5&2) loved the wave pool and my husband and eldest (8) loved all the rides.

Family visit . It was very interest place to visit, we visit ladies night and was very interest and fun night for us it will be better if they organise at the end because it close 12 o'clock am and everybody have to leave and it was bit crazy at the end.

Excellent for adults but not suitable for little children. The place is awesome and I have been there when single many times and had a blast. When coming with children as part of a weekend in Al Qsar, we noticed our 4 year old was too young for the vast majority of rides unfortunately. We left within an hour.

What else do you do in 43 degree heat?. Free access if you stay at one of the connected hotels was incredibly handy! Its a great, fun way to spend some time in Dubai and cool off. It may not have a slide through a shark tank but it has lots of different fun rides for all ages.

Best water park in dubai. Located in the heart of jumeirah, it is easily accessible.Dhs 295/head.Dhs 310 (with unlimited cold drinks).lockers are for 45, 75,95Dhs (small,medium, large).A little over priced. But the rides are simply amazing and worth it. Jumeirah seyairah is the best for thrill seekers. Food is overpriced Dhs 50 minimum for a meal. Dhs 20 for watermelon (3 slices )most over priced of them all.

Perfect place to cool off !. We visited with our family and young little boy who is 2 years 2 months and we had a blast it is nice and cool and the staff where excellent and friendly.Some tips thoughGet there early as rides get busy around 12 to 1 pm. If you have a younger kids it is free entry for up to 2 years 9 months so if you book online remember this. The lockers and food and drink are expensive as it would be as I am sure these shops pay huge rent to be in the park and running a water park in the desert cannot be cheap ! This park will keep you busy for 1 day I would not recommend you plan to spend more days there if you want a new experience each time.Thanks for the fun.

Good Not Great. We went with our daughter who is 3.5 years and on getting to the park, wasn't tall enough for most slides which was a shame. Wild Wadi is uber safe, i have honestly never seen so many lifeguards in my life so that was a plus, but the fact that it is relatively small and that we couldn't go on certain rides downgrades the park in my review

Great fun. A fabulous fun place for children of all agesMake sure you take flip flops as the floor gets very hot.Great rides and great fun. Not huge but big enough.Free entry if you are staying in the Jumeirah hotels, take advantage of the first and last hours as it is generally quieter.Loved the lazy river. Very clean water park.

Hit and Miss. The rides at Wild Wadi are like no other; they keep getting better and better. The waterpark is convenient especially for those staying at Jumeirah hotels. The rides are all mostly connected which inevitably is a bonus in the scorching heat. Having said that, I would not advise going during the midday sun because it's far too hot to walk on the stone floors particularly when queuing. I find that going during weekdays is much better as the queues are shorter and there is less of a bustle. During weekends, there are a lot more locals which although creates an atmosphere; increases queues and makes everything slightly rowdy. Like at all waterparks, there's a lot of queue jumping and the like but that's obviously going to happen. I wasn't particularly impressed with the wave pool, it's very warm like a bath. Not at all refreshing. The water also tends to be slightly grubbier than most and I would guess this is because of the greenery around the park. However, the rides are fantastic and perfect for everyone. Whether you enjoy thrillers or prefer to float along peacefully. There's even things for smaller children. Great experience.

One of the best water park in Dubai. Wild Wadi water park is having enough parking space and easy to reach. Rides are also good. Atlantis is bigger but there are some rides here which you may like it. If you have time constrain you may visit this place as it nearby.

Very good with a twist. Great water park with water propelled climbs etc a very enjoyable day out but rather expensive So whats the twist - well as you get to the end of the lazy river - if you're a bloke - no issues, but if you are a lady there is a high percentage chance you will get touched / groped call it what you will - as there are very many boys/men standing around at the end of the river where it basically funnels to a stop. Happened to my wife so I'm speaking from experience.

Had a great time !. We really had a good time. We went there for the sundown offer from 16 to 19 pm, wich was way cheaper than the all day price plus we had a pizza to go !
The park is well equiped and the staff is very smily and professional.

Hot in June. Wild Wadi was the original..Atlantis is bigger and better as a water park...but wild wadi is convenient has great parking and the rides are really very good...I got bored after hall a day...it's best to go between October and end may....or in the evenings in June...don't miss having your feet eaten by the fish..it's great fun..and you end up with really smooth feet!#

Cooling Off.. Wow! This is one place I must definitely love to visit again and again in my subsequent visits to Dubai. My daughter and I felt so excited and really overwhelmed with fun swimming around in the water all day. I found swimming in those boat-like guards in and out of the tunnels and tube so exciting and the water fountain was not left out. The experience was really awesome and unforgettable.

Fun in the sun!. Head a really fun time here! Love the fact that you can connect rides through the water and not necessarily have to walk. The queues were not long at the other rides either. Value for money!

Clean fun park!. Wild Wadi is a great water theme park for every age group from young ones to the adults that still want to be a kid. I liked all the rides, but always like the lazy river to be just that...lazy!

The best . The best water park and you can find a lot of famous people and you can buy cool souvenirs and swimsuits and If you don't know how to swim don't worry they are a lot of staff that they can teach you how to swim

Great day in the water. I visited with my children, 5 & 7 year old. They had so much fun that they didn't want to leave! There was a good balance of scary and child-friendly rides, though there are not many things for children under 1.1m tall, to do. I wish there was more rides in general, though we had a lot of fun going on the few rides repeatedly.Luckily there were 3 adults in our group, so we could take turns to babysit, while 2 of us went on more thrilling rides. I could see some parents looked a little bored. The place could do with other forms of entertainment such as a show of some sort.The food was very expensive, and I would recommend that you take your own bottles of water and snacks.

Family visit . Small in the scheme of dubai things but worth a visit, especially is u have entertainer vouchers for bogof on entry tickets. Only a cpl of big rides and we only stayed a few hours but glad we went.

Summer time is best here. We went on weekday & so should you if you're going with family. Reach around 10 o clock & take big rides before the queue starts increasing. Then later you can explore other areas too.
Tons of fun. Good water park, staff is great and very helpful. Kids, 9 and 11, absolutely loved it. We went for 4 hours and stayed for 6.5.

Fun, good rides. I would recommend looking to see if there are online or app vouchers anywhere before going as admission is pricey, and so is the food inside. So don't go on an empty stomach. Admission does not include locker hire which is another 60dhs per locker so share if you are able. Rides are good fun and there is a nice variety, also good views of the area so all in all a fun day out.

Great day. Packages available with food and free refills really helped as no need to carry money. Park I'd a lot smaller than other water parks but has a lot of rides. Wave rider machines are a nice addition as aqua adventure Atlantic doesn't have these. Take a camera/phone as we did not have one photograph taken all day.

Over rated!. Not sure what the craze here is! No loungers available Very busy and full of people - kids!! Not value for money in my opinion /charging for fish aquarium and other side lines in there should all be free with price of entry!

Good fun. Makes a change from the Malls of dubai. Relaxed in the pool and enjoyed cooling off in the clean waters. Only negative would be the extortionate picture prices and the lack of enough showers in the changing rooms

Exciting Slides. Wild Wadi is a great place to go to for a day trip as it is great fun for kids and also adults. There is also a VIP Cabana where you get a limited of free drinks and your private shaded area and much more advantages though I would only recommend the Cabana if you are 4 or more as less I don't think makes sense from my point of view.

Very fun and very hot. Although weather was very hot, but we had so much fun in Wild Wadi. Games was very fun and everyone with any age can have fun there. I suggest to buy and drink a coconut, it's so delicious there!

Wild Wadi Still The Best. Been to the Wild Wadi many times during our holidays in Dubai and for a 40 something year old I still really enjoy it with my teenage boysWe were staying in the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray so used the courtesy bus and got there around half 10 and it was very quiet on a Monday - just gave our room number, checked details and given complementary entrance including towels but we did need to hire a small lockerThe place is spotless and nicely spread out with fantastic views of Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach hotels Rides wise there is plenty to keep you entertained for the day and we went on each one many times - Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj are awesome plus Master Blaster, Lazy River and wave pool are great for just chillingIf we return to Dubai next year (which is a very strong possibility) this will be a must do day out yet again !!!Enjoy
Cooling off in Dubai. The heat can get the better of us in the desert, this is truly a great day of chilling and splashing. forget you are in the oven for a few hours.

Don't waste your money for 4 rides!. We picked this based on good reviews and location...what a mistake that was. Overpriced, food and drink extortionate and poor choice/quality and in total there were only 4 slides. Loads of water to swim in and great for kids I suppose but I would never recommend for couples!

A good park, but let down by the prices.... Wild Wadi is a good waterpark, let's just get that out of the way. There are tons of attractions, and whilst the park may not be as large or impressive as Atlantis waterpark in Dubai, it is great fun. There are a good number of slides (I think eight), and the Surf Rider is especially fun. We arrived early and since the park wasn't too crowded, the day went well and we got to ride everything in a five-hour visit. This park would be a solid choice, if not for one, fatal problem.The prices.They are absolutely extortionate, worse than almost all other tourist attractions in Dubai. Close to sixty pounds per person for admission, more than twice what one should expect to pay for a place like this, and even more than the far superior Atlantis Park. And that is without towels, food or any concessions. The towels are another problem, also costing close to ten pounds PER PERSON. Bring your own at all costs. Overall the day cost us the equivalent of almost 300 pounds, which despite the good quality of the park itself, was not worth these prices. I therefore recommend Atlantis over Wild Wadi, but this is still OK if the prices are not a problem for you.

Interest Place. Nice place and every thing was interesting except the staff ,most of them are not friendly .don't take a locker ,you can just put your bag outside ,there are a plenty of places specially if you are not in the weekends .If you don't have a water camera,you can just buy a water proof cover for your mobile and I prefer to buy it from outside because it's little expensive if you buy it from there ,finally take a look carefully for the map and click what you finished and what remaining to try.Have fun :)

Expensive Day Out. We visited the Park today. As we were staying in one of the Jumeirah hotels we got in Free. Had we not it would have cost 600AED. once you would pay for lunch, drinks and any photos you would be looking at 1,000 AED per couple. This is expensive for not really a great selection of slides/rides. There are 2 what I would class as extreme slides. The rest were just normal. When you compare this to other water parks I don't think it is worth the money. If you want a cabana this is extra as are lockers and towels. The wave pool was disappointing with the waves not at all high. I wouldn't recommend paying to go to this park.

Best time. We had the best time and lots of fun really enjoyed all the rides and the lazy river was the best as you can relax also there is a wave pool where you can chill it is awesome and had many places to have lunch however you need to pay for your lockers here as well as other charges for admission and food. We really enjoyed this park!
Great fun. Its a must see and visit. Fun activity for everyone They provide food vouchers and everything is completely fun to adventure.Fun for all ages!!!

Fun time at Wild Wadi. Wild Wadi has been the oldest water park in Dubai. But its kept in immaculate condition. Wild Wadi also runs amazing Women only nites which allows you to have some good time with your girlfriends. Over the week its packed with families ,children, rides and nice and amazing. The lifeguards and the staff is very well trained to handle any sort of emergencies. They do a great job in running the park successfully.

funny amasing joyful. a clean wide park near borj al-arab in dubai , thats really amasing ana fantastic , good restaurant , clean water , very very very fearful free fall from 33 meters above in water
Enjoyed. Nice water park with different entertainment, with different meals inside and soft non alcoholic drinks, I am enjoyed a lot!

Nice park, quite small and better suited for smaller children.. Entry was complimentary as we were staying in a jumeriah hotel which we appreciated. However if we had paid we would have been disappointed. It's quite a small park with few slides but brilliant for a couple of hours out. As with everything jumeriah service was slick and outstanding. Nothing is too Much trouble.

Fun!. Lots to keep kids and big kids entertained - Jumeirah Scarer is particularly hair-raising...Not very cheap but worth looking for discount vouchers online beforehand to save money. Ladies Night on Thursday - genius!

Family week day visit. If you are looking for a short water park trip then this may well suit you. However it is quite small and has limited rides to occupy your time. Wait time even during the week was 15-20 mins at most rides. I'd try Aquaventure if you want more variety for a day out.

Aqua fun. A very busy water park good if your staying in jumeirah resorts , included in your package , not very big so does get overcrowded but has got good slides , not on the scale of Disney etc. Very good slides jus for little ones and a wave pool
Great water park. Best to avoid Friday and Saturday when it is very busy with locals. Great water park and lots of rides for kids and big kids!

needs upgrade and renewal. its amazing and you will have fun.
but for me I have visited this place a lot since it was open at first more than 10 years ago.
expensive too.

great for families. Great variety of water rides and many options available , loved the new food outlets all around the place and small kiosks that sells everything
the kids play water splash area is great for kids
over all its nice and safe and the amount of safe guards around the park is amazing

Great water park. A classy water park with good rides, mainly in tubes, but a little small. We went in August and unlike previous reviews I thought the shade protected from the heat more. The blaster ride actually takes you uphill which is great
Another great afternoon out . What a great idea of donating items of clothes during the Holy Month of Ramadan to gain access to the water park whilst benefiting others. Very well done Jumeriah
Love wild wadi . Wild wadi is amazing and I would say there are more adult rides here compared to aquaventure. Saying that there was still a lot of kids rides and a huge kids water playground.

Nice but ... . Wild Wadi used to be something amazing in Dubai many years back, the rides and the services ... After all these years it is still the same, they need to make some effort and refurbish it, add more rides, water is hot during summer and it is extremely an expensive place! Please Jumeirah, upgrade the place.
enjoyable experience. i really enjoyed the water park.But in comparison to Atlantis i experienced less rides.the accessibility of this park was better than the others and it worth to go and enjoy.

It is worth a visit. I expected it be larger that is is. I was in another water park in Dubai a few days ago and it was much bigger. The price of foods and drinks are so high in there. They allow everybody to go near the water and even inside the water with his/her own slippery or shoes and I think that it is awful because it may give extremely dirty objects and germs into water. It is better that they provide free slippery to everyone to maintain the cleanness of the water especially for kids.

NOT DUBAI STANDARD ANYMORE, it's a shambles now.. This place is only about footfall nowadays. Entering from the hotel side there is no consideration for families with young kids, we were left standing in the hot sun for at least 20 minutes, there is no shaded area and if you are lucky enough to get into the canopy area it is even hotter in there. On the inside they have reduced the seating area near the kids pool adjacent the tree area. The staff are mostly all unhappy, no smiling faces anymore, not like before when the atmosphere was very vibrant. After our visit, I was asked to complete a questionnaire and almost 2 months later Miss Janine Adams "the entertainment specialist" send me a feeble attempt of an apology. What a pathetic standard Wild Wadi is now. Don't waste your money here go to Atlantis instead.

Faster than Aquaventure.... Despite what some reviewers have said, this water park is on a par with Aquaventure. Ok it's not as glamorous as being on the palm, or is it as the park sits in the shadow of the exclusive self acclaimed 7 star hotel the Burj Al Arab.All in all a great day out but do buy the summer saver package that includes food and unlimited soft drink refills. You'll need them here in Dubai at the moment.....
OK. No where near as big or impressive as Aqua-venture but facilities were clean and still a good day out

Great way to beat the heat. Great day out for the family. Make sure you arrive early, before opening as the lines can fill up very quickly and they move slowly, you don't want to waste time standing in the heat when you could be in the water. Great fun!

Splashing Fun. Fun for the whole family. The children get a waterproof wristband on which money can be loaded, so they can stop anywhere to get something to drink or a snack to eat. Very practical not to carry money with you and it gives them a bit more independence. There are lockers that you also open with tis wristband.The water rides are a lot of fun some more thrilling others calmer for the not so adventurous. You can easily spend the whole day there.

Best experience ever. i am not into physical games and water splashed like girls.my friend insisted to take me there. I went i was astonished amazed we stayed for four hours i played like 16 years old boy i felt refreshed i tried every thing.Best experience ever i wish if i just could do it all over again.

Enjoyable . Had a brilliant day at this waterpark. Lots of fun slides and places to relax. Very clean and good service. However for the price I would have to say the water park at atlantis is the one I would go back to out of the two. I cannot say I didn't enjoy it though but the price is high for what you get.

Great way to cool off. We loved our trip to wild wadi. With the hot Dubai weather it was a great way to cool off and enjoy some sunshine without the feel of the scorching summer heat. The entrance is well organized to collect your tickets and enter. Collect towels and change. You do need to pay extra for the lockers to keep your things. The rides were great. We felt safe with lots of lifeguards at every possible turn. There was a huge range of rides and thrill levels which was good for everyone. The children's area was brilliant. We stayed and dined at the park before jumping back into the water for more afternoon splashing and sliding.Well worth the experience.
in Love with it . i went in ladies night, it was amazing and really we spend funny time and enjoyable memonts .recommeded for ladies and families
One of my favorite. This is one of my favorite water parks that have visited so far. My family and had experienced several times having so much fun. Great place to chill during the summer heat.
Enjoy fun & Relax. Wow wow ! It s a nice place to go and you can spend your all day there. Food court all so nice.Great time to be with the friends so many rides to do...

Excellent waterpark fun for all the family. Excellently day out visit wild wadi with 4 young children aged 9,5,4 and 4 months. They all really enjoyed themselves and the compact size of the park makes it ideal for a family with young children. We went aquaventure a couple days later but overall we enjoyed wild wadi more. Decent choice of food as well
Fun filled day. Fantastic time we had with friends. Restaurants are inside the park too, very friendly lifeguard, nice rides.
Awesome. Think this is one of the oldest water park in Dubai But still has its own charm and lots of things to offer

Wish It Was In Blighty!. Great water park. Loads of rides with as much fun shooting up a tube as coming down. Screamer scared the life out of me but well worth ticking off your list. All great fun and not particularly busy so queueing was a breeze.

A good day out . A good day out and reasonably priced - did not have to wait too long for even the major attractions
Meals and drinks reasonable priced
Great waterpark. Really enjoyed the day ; fantastic waterpark. It's amazing here.Thdy have restaurants too inside Rd the park.

Good rides . Good rides for adults who don't want to be too adventurous, not too large, but a nice place to spend with kids. Clean and well managed, food and toilets and changing rooms available, take your own towel and some waterproof pouches to keep money and phones during rides.
perfect on a hot day. location is convenient next to Burj Al Arab hotel, there are things to do for all ages. It is all about getting wet or trenched.

The direction to the activity is do bad. The place is nice clean and stuff is so friendly food good but expensive ladies night is so good.
I wished if the maps was more clear its so hard to know the way to every play the direction is totally not clear.
Very nice for all ages.
Perfect. Everybody should go it s perfect specilly with the family you can also have food inside .better to go early morning

Okeishh. Atlantis is much more modern and better kept
The rides are ok but you can do everything in 1 hour
Not going back

My family holiday . What a fantastic holiday we had staying at Jumeriah Beach hotel. I have lived in Dubai for many years and have been flying back and forth for the last 12 years! Never have I had so much fun with my family! I have enjoyed many of a times previously but it was a trip of a lifetime on this occasion . Absolutely amazing hotel and great service from all.

I consider it a daily activity. When ever i visit dubai i go to wild wadi everyday especially if i stayed in a jumeriah chain hotel i get in for free. Dont rhink if you go there everyday you are gonna get bored, no never

Family friendly water park. I visited Wild wadi with my niece and nephew aged between eleven and 16 years and they enjoyed the place. They wanted us to visit the waterpark everyday of our ten days visit! They have sound safety measures, attraction slides for all ages and the staff at the wave pool are very very keen on all the swimmers!

The best water park. I have to say that this is by far the best watermark in Dubai in our families experience the place as lots on offer for all ages and every one is helpful and there are lifeguards everywhere to assist you should you need one. A very safe and clean place to visit.
Good attraction for tourists. I went there with my cousins to enjoy the fun water rides.Very good water park having very good water rides.

Excellent expereince. A water park that is full of fun for all ages. There is a good range of restaurants as well within the Park for those who get hungry after frolicking in the water. The palce is well supervised by staff and is suitable for all ages.

Brilliant!!. Superb fun for all the family, something for everyone. Very well laid out and easy to find your way around the park which isn't too big. A decent selection of places to eat. Would definitely recommend a visit.

The rides are entertaining, but the price is too high. This park has attractions - Aquatic roller coasters, pools, tunnels etc. The true asset making this park, a beau and one of the most prominent and renowned outdoor water parks in Dubai, is that the limited amount of rides are exhilarating but fun. The customer service is excellent, and the lifeguards assisting you to get through the tunnels/tubes are friendly and welcoming. The only disadvantage is the price - exorbitant, and once you pay the entrance fee - you have to additionally pay for lockers, food, and beverages. (Average ticket is between 220 - 285 AED)

Very large and busy. I went here with my family, including my father who has a paralysed arm. Unfortunately, this hindered the visit somewhat, as he was restricted on the rides the staff would allow him on, but this is understandable. The park is very large with queues at every ride. There also did not seem to be very many places to fill up the drinks bottle we had bought. Nevertheless, the rides we did go on were fun and exciting, and we had a good morning at Wild Wadi.

Must do this!!. We've been to Wild Wadi before and it truly is a great water park and day out. Buy your tickets in the UK if your from there as it's cheaper but do get them weeks in advance as taking of payment is one thing, processing and sending of the tickets can take considerably longer but in our opinion if you buy your excursions on various websites at least then all you do is presents print offs for vouchers at entrances then off you go. With Wild Wadi, when obtain wristbands don't forget to load up credit on there too, this will be for your lockers, if there's more than two of you then don't use small lockers as they are just that, too small, medium or large are best, loading if credit also allows you to buy your lunch there so you don't have to carry around money, at the end of the day when giving them back any remaining credit will be given back to you in cash. Whilst enjoying the water park most people tend to wear the aqua tops with good UV rating, thus us a must if you don't want to get burnt to a crisp, stay safe and have a blast, go pros and waterproof phones and cameras are a must and are allowed. Enjoy
has all the fun with water in a park. has all the fun with water in a park, and the people speak English , which is obviously a plus. Enjoyable, expecially the high water-slide, when I went 2010

Great Experience!!. My visit here is truly unforgettable! I could say that this is one of the best water park I've been to. I went here with my friends. We are one of the first customer and the last to leave. I can stay here for whole day! The rides are good for all ages. I enjoyed the lazy river so much. It offers great view of the man-made river that reminds me at the real one way back in my hometown in Philippines. That is truly relaxing. They have a great view of the iconic Burj Al Arab. And all the staff are very helpful. I remember when I tried the surfing, I was pretty afraid that I might fall but the staff help me out and I made it. I learned a little bit on surfing here. So I could say, you shouldn't miss visiting this place in Dubai.
Exilherating. a good place to spend time and enjoy some phenomenal water rides. Very pricy though depending on your budget. Very organised.
Dated and not many slides. Wild Wadi is now out dated and not many slides. I find it expensive for what is on offer.I would prefer going to Abu Dabi's Water Park instead.

Fun filled day out. The park is getting on a bit now, it's been around for as long as I can remember. Nevertheless I recommend this attraction as a thrilling adventure involving plenty of tube rides. The park isn't massive but they still have a wide range of enjoyable content. The park is very close to the Burj Al Arab hotel and one or two other hotels.

The views towards the sea was amzing. The park is very close to the sea and when you're on top you get a nice view including the famous Burj Al Arab, If you are there only for a few days I would suggest a call at the Burj Al Arab although it can be very expensive.

Well run and efficient. It's been a while since I'd been to a water park but this visit brought me back to my childhood in my teens...except everything is bigger, faster, and there are much more options. There's plenty to do whether you love the water or just like lying in the sun, for both children and adults. The slides were as exhilarating as the lazy river was, well, lazy. Speaking of the lazy river, there were a few jackasses who decided to pull my fiancee and I along with their tubes, but they were young and having fun and once I let them know to knock it off, they got the message. Overall, the park is very efficient (lines) and run professionally. The greeters and cashiers spell out everything for you so you know what to expect and where to go. The guides and chaperones kept the lines moving and the lazy river from getting bottle necked. I didn't buy anything except a locker for valuables, but I presume they were overpriced, even for Dubai, as one would expect for a park with a "captive" audience. The only issue we had was with my sunglasses and my fiancee's hair claws. The line for the Jumeirah Sceirah was long and there are some signs of what you cannot have while on the slide. I had $100 sunglasses and reluctantly and naively left them in a small box at the base of the stairs at the beginning of the line. Upon reaching the front of the line, the park personnel let my fiancee know she couldn't wear her plastic hair claws and held them in a small box for her. After we went down the slide, perhaps unsurprisingly my sunglasses were missing and we had to ascend the stairs (past everyone waiting in line) to get her hair claws. Seems as though signs could be more informative and a more secure place for these things at the beginning of the line would be more practical and expected (this is a desert environment and a water park after all, sunglasses are the norm). To Wild Wadi Park's credit though, I went to lost and found and they called me two days later saying they had secured my sunglasses. Overall, it was a good time, a bit pricey, but plenty of things to do.

Not very impressed. I have been there with friend hoping to spend a fun day in an aqua park. Having been to other aqua parks in Europe that are much cheaper and bigger I would not rate wild wadi an an extraordinary one. They have basic slides.. Nothing special. A couple of them are adult slides but you can very quickly go through everything in a couple of hours. Staff and people working there are very nice though. And if you are a surfing beginner you could practice a bit there.My biggest disappointment was the price. It is very expensive knowing that you have to pay extra for everything/ towels.. Lockers...

A super crowded aqua park. This aqua park located in the Jumeirah Beach Hotel is usually quite crowded, specially during weekends and holidays and you have to wait in long lines for 45 mins to an hour in order to be able to use some of the slides.
No place to stay :). Me and my son we have the time of our life, joy all the rides and have best time over there. Friendly and care staff as well the food inside. Highly recommend !!!

great. This amazing water park offers 30 rides to people from all age groups. It is situated in front of the stunning Burj Al Arab. The water park is themed around a character named Juha from the Arabian folklore. It boasts of the biggest water slide outside of North America, but since then it has been replaced by two other water rides. It has cooled/cooled wave pool, two artificial surfing machines and multiple water slides. Its amazing place and a must visit.
Great Fun!. Wild Wadi is a fantastic waterpark! It has rides for everyone! Helpful staff! Clean! If you are travelling with kids or teens, this is a must!
What a great fun day out. As always, we had a great day at Wild Wadi. The best place to go to cool down in these summer months!

Good waterpark. Got two-for-one entry with Entertainer. Not too busy, short queues and the rides were good especially the high drop. Drinks and snacks a bit pricey but expected. One ride was shut, but kids were happy overall so fair enough. Recommended.
fantastic. Came in dubai with friends and came at this waterpark which is really worth it.Nice and exciting rides, nice restaurant inside themepark also. Had really had a fun filled day.
Overpriced water park. Wild Wadi is an overpriced water park next to Jumerirah Beach Hotel. Even renting a locket is DHS 60 for a medium sized locker. Go once is enough.

Good for kids, not much apart from one ride, for older teenagers - and expensive!. This is a nice place for families with younger kids. However, for teenagers/adults the rides are pretty tame - with the obvious exception of Jumeirah Sceirah. This is a great slide. However, even this can't justify the hefty admission price of AED 295 (£60) which is excessive for the size and number of slides, etc.And surely there is no way to justify charging more for a portion of fries than the Gordon Ramsay restaurant at Atlantis charges for chips!However, the park is well laid out, clean and has great staff - especially the attentive lifeguards. .

Love this place. We have been here many times before and this was no disappointment either. Plenty of things to do of course all water related. Slides, rides, wave machine and lazy rivers. A few places to eat and drink are scattered throughout the place. On arrival, you pay for lockers and charge your wristband with money. This saves having to take your wallet or purse around with you. It's an energetic day so you'll probably be tired afterwards but you can always rest on the many loungers about. People unfortunately stick a towel on them and then disappear for hours so this is a little frustrating. If you don't have a waterproof camera there are lots of staff with cameras around the main rides and pools who will take your photos and you can buy them at the end of the day. They'll scan your wrist band or give you a tag. These can be quite expensive especially if your looking to buy a few. A good tip is to buy a decent waterproof camera before you get there. This will also come in handy in the hotel pool!

Another Summer get away in Dubai. You'll love and enjoy everything inside. Big water park ever, all rides you really have fun and will never notice time running so fast.
Good thing, they have ladies night.

Good Fun. Great place for a day out with the children. Lots to do and keep the children entertained for the day. This gives the parents time to chill and enjoy the sunshine. Fast food expensive for what it is....

very amazing day in wild wadi. we have a good amazing day in wild wadi by playing many games and swimming .....
wild wadi is a beautiful and very big water parks in world

Worth the wait but crowded. View of the Burj is just amazing from this waterpark. Get there early because the lines are long, very long. park itself is crowded and lines inside will be long for rides too. Take a fair share of patients when you go. If you have small kids have snacks and drinks handy for the long line to enter the park
fun to be there. Go any time of the year but avoid the summer because humidity will ruin your visit and its expensive too
Number 1 water park in Dubai . So in love with this water park very clean so many water activities place for kids slides also the food is delicious the staff is so friendly

Best water park in Dubai. Great set up, compact, good selection of rides. Kids can ride these slides when they are a bit shorter than if they were at aquaventure. The lazy river at aquaventure is far far better though (no Rapids on this one).
For a much cheaper waterpark visit, try Dreamland which is a drive north for about 45 minutes into Ajman.

Preferred it to aquaventure. I can't put my finger on it, as this is smaller than the Atlantis park, and older, but I preferred it. My other half felt the rides were tame at Wild wadi but I liked the lazy river. I think for thrill seekers, Atlantis is where it's at, but the backdrop is pretty cool here too.

Good but Jumeirah needs to sort out admission process for hotel guests. Our trip to Wild Wadi was part of our hotel stay in Jumeirah Zabeel Saray where guests receive unlimited complementary access (expensive day out if you had to pay!). Previously the complementary pass was obtained at concierge at the hotel and a voucher given allowed swift and direct access to the park. This year the process has changed and you now have to queue at general admissions show your key and provide your room and details, this can take a bit of time. The park always provides a great fun day out will all rides open other than the larger flow rider which was under refurbishment. The lazy river with off shoots to rides via water travelators means no walking and climbing stairs in temperatures of 40 degrees plus. Plenty of outlets to eat at, food reasonably priced or you can use your half board vouchers too.
Good day but not the Atlantis . Visited wild wadi on 15 July with 2 adults and 4 teenagers. They all enjoyed it, but they much preferred the Atlantis because it has a lot more to do and faster rides.

Good but need to work on queue times . Been here back in 2010 was great but wasn't very busy so the queue times were minimal. Went this year in May and we had to wait for up to an hour to go on a 30 second ride which took all day to do most of the slides. Based on the price to go here and the amount of times you can use the slides I think this needs to be looked over.
great place to have fun. excelent place to have fun. safe, well organized, not full at all, great and thrill attractions, we just loved it!

Nice day out, It's expensive but then it's associated with Jumeirah so wouldn't be cheap. Definitely worth visiting, it's no way a typical water park. It's a water park in a desert, in one of the hottest places in the world.I found it expensive but comparatively to theme parks in London where it's always raining and around £3.00 for a sugar filled cola, I'd prefer WWWP anytime.They have lockers for your belongings and I'd recommend wearing cheap slip ones when there, leave your expensive jewellery and watches at home as your be in water most of your day.I'd recommend visiting for sure....

good for half a day. be sure to wear lots of sunscreen and be prepared to be thrilled on a couple of rides, but the rest are more for children. good half day out but prefer the aquaventure water park at the palm

brill day out. the wild wadi water park is one for the family or single people. the rides are amazing and good fun. the queues are not to long. very friendly staff. reasonably priced food. only down fallnot aloud to bring your own drinks or food.

Wet & Wild - a fantastic day out. A great range of rides and attractions for all ages providing a welcome break from the very hot weather. Very well manned with several, friendly lifeguards. Recommended, especially if you stay at a Jumeirah hotel (e.g. Jumeirah Beach Hotel) that includes free entrance - otherwise can be pricey but you can stay all day! Queues can sometimes be lengthy.

Not so good. Unfortunately not very happy about my visit in this aqua park.. I had the intention to visit the other ones also since my son loves this and we have visited many Aqua parks in different countries but it was so bad that we stopped aqua parks in Dubai.First of all there are not many attractionsThe food was horribleI got a plantar wart and I am not at all happy about itVery complicated to find a taxi when we leftIt was very expensive and not terrible at all.. I won't go back!
its closed down now.... We did this a while back but you could tell it was falling apart slowly. They had a great concept but in Dubai you have to re invent the wheel all the time.

A typical water park. A great waterpark in the a prime location with good views. alot of rides for the whole family. i would recommend if you arrange your visit in the weekdays. it can be a bit crowded on weekendsMandeep Duggal

H2Woah!. It took a second visit to Wild Wadi for me to realise how ridiculously expensive it was. Even with an entertainer voucher, the price for Two Adults and one child was nearly £100. Entrance fee is dependant on height and not age, so here's to hoping the kids are late bloomers. It is family friendly, there are lifeguards and staff everywhere with constant checks going on throughout the park. The Scierah remains the only ride that adults will get much excitement out of, however the other rides are enjoyable enough. We had a 8 year old with us and he absolutely adored every second. Especially when the wave machine is turned on in the paddling pool. It's nice enough but rides are limited and if you have older kids or are going as adults, venture over to AquaVenture as there's is much more to do there. In terms of value for money, you don't get much bang for your buck as it gets boring very quickly and you pay through the nose for everything.

Day out with family. Visited the Dolphins experience which was fantastic, then spent rest of the day at the water park, they have everything for adults and the children. A great day out but get there early toget your place by one the pools.

Great water park. We stayed at the Jumeirah so we got free access to the water park. We come every year and it is always a great day out! I would come to this water park over the Atlantis purely because you don't have as far to walk!
Amazing experience . I recommend the Jumeirah Sceirah as a must when visiting the Wild Wadi water park. Mind blowing experience

Been to Dubai four times and always visit Wild Wadi Water Park,. Wild Wadi is a great place, it's very clean and staff are really helpful and cheerful, the water rides are good, there are enough sun beds to relax in between rides, good eating places, going again in September can't wait.

Fun with the kids. I actually enjoyed this waterpark more than Aquaventure, because I have small children and for some reason they could get on the waterslides here without a problem. However I have to say that the lawn chairs were not in good condition and the space for sitting and relaxing is kind of crowded. Also they have their own signature restaurant that fries food all day long and extraction and ventilation system is awful. So anywhere you are in the park you will smell a nasty fried stench all day long. Otherwise, we enjoyed it very much

Amazing water park. Great water park for couples and families. All attractions are explained well in the brochure and are giving a rating on a "thrill" scale so you can decide whether you want to enjoy yourself on a raft on a nice slow river or are seeking for adventure on a Jumeirah Sceirah slide. You can easily find things to do there for an entire day.Good tip is to rent a locker not to be bound to a particular place and be able to move around between attractions.
Awesome . The park was very nice. My visit was with my little girl. She liked it. But the prices are too high comparing with other aqua parks.

Aggressive and Poorly Managed. Packs of aggressive young men roaming the place pushing and shoving to mostly get looks at young girls in swim wear. My daughter was very uncomfortable....so was I. Had several run ins with the youth and no help from the staff when they did show up. A terrible experience.
a Must visit water theme park. an adventure you will never forget. with the new thrilling rides it will give you a thrill of a lifetime.

Very good water park but very expensive . We loved this water park and went multiple times on our holiday as the kids loved it. However we had access as part of the hotel deal, we definitely would have thought twice about this place if we were having to pay.

Alright. The price is very high for what it is. Also not many great rides, even their big slide that showed extreme thriller level was alright. However our 12 and 13 year old daughters really loved it.

Underwhelming. Massively under whelming, water is really dirty which doesn't help one bit. Did not find any of the rides as thrilling apart from the tantrum tunnel. Waste of 295 AED. You would think after spending 395 AED in total after locker and towel rental they would at least have proper signage but nope not even that. If I could choose to sit in a room all day with no WiFi and TV or go to wild wadi I'd pick the first option.

Excellent day out for the whole family!. This water park was on our Dubai "to do list" & it did not disappoint. We had a fabulous day with our children aged 14, 12 & 10. There is plenty to do & we didn't have to wait too long to enjoy a ride!We wanted to stay longer!

Good family fun. We where staying at the Jumeriah beach so entry was included in our stay. It was a total bonus . Our kids are boys 11 and 10 and they visited it just about every day of our week holiday. It's very family orientated. Plenty of life guards on duty. There are life jackets available at the side of the wave pool so that everyone can enjoy it . It always seemed busy but we always found a seat or a lounger somewhere. Even on Friday/Saturday the lines went very quickly . Id recommend you wear scuba shoes as you can wear them on rides, unlike flip flops as the ground can get very warm whilst walking to rides . Unfortunately I can't comment on the price of entry as I was a hotel guest . Also can't comment on the food or shops, however one of the outlets seemed to be like a KFC under a generic name, another was like a subway. You can buy a refill cup for juice too if your gonna be there all day , I think it was about £15 . I haven't been in aquaventure at Atlantis since the extension was opened so couldn't really compare the 2.

Great place but queues can be long. . Visited again with the Jumeirah vouchers as this would be very expensive and possibly cost restrictive without them. Brilliant water park but the queues can be long so chose your days careful avoiding Friday and Saturdays. If some of the 'ride attendants' spent less time chatting and more time loading then perhaps the queue would have been shorter. It's a shame when these places do the hard part (create an amazing place) and then mess up the easy bit (create unnecessary queues). Lifeguards are everywhere ensuring safety and are very friendly and great with the youngsters especially on the rides themselves. Food and drink is a little pricey but hey, welcome to Dubai. Well worth a visit but go early or get queuing!

A whole day splashing around. Wow what a water park. Absolutely amazing, lots of rides for singles and families. Enjoyed the lazy river just floating around. The day went so quickly, we hadn't realised the time. There are looking kersey available at a cost to put your valuables in. They can also top up a wristband with money so that you don't have to carry cash. You can buy drinks ice creams and food off the wristband. Depending on how much money you add to the wrist band.

Family holiday. Wild wadi was brilliant catered for all ages. Millions times better than Atlantis. We spent so much money booking for Atlantis that we only stayed for 2 hours, they don't cater for 8 month old babies. At Wild Wadi they met all the family needs, the staff was brilliant and attentive. The restaurant were excellent

Way overpriced!!!. Visited here today, although there was some amazing thrilling rides there was only about 4 of them!!! I visited with my brother, I'm 18 and he is 25, we enjoyed it here but paying £75 for entrance and a refillable drinks cup and £10 for a locker on top. We found it way overpriced for the rides that are inside. The park although it appeared clean, it smelt really bad in certain places when queuing up for two of the most popular ride it smelt really strong of urine!!!The one positive we had about the park is that in the height of summer the floor remained cool as it was sprayed with water frequentlyOverall we would rate it average and in future will be trying aquaventure instead!
We like it!!. I went with 2 of my friends and man, we did have fun!!! Our favourite was the Tantrum Alley. There are more thrilling rides than Aquaventure.
