nice waterpark. We spent half a day here, we done a couple of small rides and the lazy river .keep you flip flops close the floor gets very hot. towels on arrival.

It is a Woow. wild wadi is amazing, I have been there many times with friends.you can enjoy all the games though there are similar water parks in UAE, but yet wild wadi has something special.the thing I like the most is when I set on the wheel and it takes me all over the games so I didn't need to wait or climb lot of stairs...it is lovely...
Not so clearn and all foods were too expensive. All foods were too expensive. For example, a meal like fast food, burger and French fry and coke, was 20 Euro. It's too expensive !!

WILD WILD WADI. Endless fun for young kids and adults alike from the family Rapids to the towering jumierah screamer! If you're taking kids, don't worry there are lifeguards throughout and the best bit is you don't have to walk up stairs as there is a blaster ride that shoots you up and down flumes. If you're staying in the Jumierah Beach Hotel, Burj Al Arab or that other huge hotel you get unlimited free entry which is always awesome! If not, WILD WADI is convenient from both the Palm and downtown Dubai. Top Notch!

good experience. You can be there for a whole day, yet you can play all the games more than once in just 4 hours. We had a very fun day, and the staff were really polite and helpful. you can use entertainer tickets (one person has to pay the actual fee and the other one can use the ticket).Don't forget to bring sandals, towels and swimming suit, you can buy all of these in the park, but they are quite expensive.In Dubai the price for a bottle of water is just 1 Durhams, In Wild Wadi park, its 12 Durhams. (do the math for everything else).
Great. Great trip to Dubai and worth a visit for the families and friends visiting the country. Food options needs to improve and the offering needs to increase and the change as its monotonous.

Wild wadi. Dident rate this water park if I paid to get in I would of asked for a refund you get in free if you stay in zabbeel saray seats by the pools instead of sun beds waiting to long to get on anything and some staff not very nice especially the ones checking your bag before you get in Atlantis water park is way ahead of this one definatley would not return here

Great fun!. We were staying in JBH so access to Wild Wadi was complementary which was great. I'm not so sure I would have been happy to pay the £55 enterance fee. We went to the water park twice a day for our entire 9 day stay, normally first thing in the morning and then in the evening. We were visiting during Ramadan and it was very quiet, no queues for any any rides. I worked up the courage (as a 40 year old mum!) to go down the Jumeriah Sceriah and it was so much fun! I went down it about 20 times, it's so exhilarating. The ground was a bit hot in July but the park is very compact so you never had to walk too far too the next ride. We have been to Aquadventure at the Atlantis and I would say for older kids it is marginally better but not by much. Wild wadi could just do with a couple more thrilling rides and it would go into the lead. It was very safe to leave your belongings on a deck chair and they were never interfered with, if you are staying in JBH you get complementary towels in the water park and can charge all food and drink to your room.

Fantastic fun. We took a family trip to wild wadi water park.It was our first time there.We had great fun the rides were super.I thought putting money on your wristband so you didn't have to carry money was genius.

Fun Fun Fun. It is a very impressive water park with a variety of rides to suit all ages. It can be very busy and there can be long queues as a result. All in all though it was a nice way to spend the day

Enjoy of swim in a waved pool & play on skating rinks. a big area that you can swim in a waved pool with your family and play on skating rinks in a safety place. all of the places are controlling by staff persons which are trained to do best ...

Best wAterpark in the world ! . I have been to this attraction many time it is definitely somewhere you have to visit !
Perfect for all ages lots to do :)
Food here is top notch !

Worth a visit . Went here nearly every day on my holiday recently. Only because it was part of the hotel package and I was able to go in for free. I would not pay £50 for the day a bit over priced. However it is really good here few water slides and the lazy river is good to float about.

Good Way To Cool Off. Irs been awhile since I went to a water park, and this one was quite exciting. Not too many people and we never waited more than 15 min, other than when one of the slides had a malfunction
The best. Even that outside was 45 degrees and over while you are in the water park you don't feel it. We just had an amazing time
Amazing Activity. Very wonderful day at This Wild Wadi at Dubai is really wild with water and waves all around. We with family had a visit and all enjoyed the splash.

Very nice aquapark. Slides are WOW!!! So exciting and a bit scary. Many games and fun stuff 😍😍
Lifeguards are like every 1 meter which was really making us feeling safe!

Great day out but can get busy. Avoid fri and sat as they are the weekend days in Dubai. Park was much quieter on the Sunday with very little queuing even for the bigger rides. Our 5 year old loved it, getting on all of the rides. Spent a good 5 hours here each day

good place for one time. Lifeguards highly committed employees and good
Restaurant quality was very poor
For the first experience is good

Wild Wadi With Water, Waves. This Wild Wadi at Dubai is really wild with water and waves all around. We with family had a visit and all enjoyed the splash of the water. and the move of water around us.All small and little too enjoyed and the day itself was fresh and refresh

Fun,fun and more fun. as water parks go this is up there with the best.
the nearly vertical drop,flume ,is frightening,enclosed in a tube,a count down then the floor falls away... very scary, had to repeat many times...I dare you
good place to visit. I went with my friends and we really enjoyed it. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Food is bit expensive.
Fun filled day at wild Wadi. Really enjoyed the rides well worth a visit. found some sunbeds to relax on after with lovely view of The Burj Hotel.
Great fun. Fantastic for kids, we had a free entry with the hotel jemirah. We went early to get on rides without hassle.

Great day out for all. As a family we love Wild Wadi. It is one of the older water parks but that doesn't make it any less special.The whole family is kept busy all day. Queues can get long so go for opening if possible. If you are a resident don't forget your ID card to get your residents discount.Food and beverages are average for this type of attraction.If decide to buy your photos get them put onto a card as this is much cheaper than buying individually and they aren't always keen to tell you this.

A pleasant day. A nice experience when visiting Dubai. For children is the best day of the vacation but adults too can enjoy and relax with all the activities. You can have a good lunch and relax close to the pool and spend a full day at Wild wadi.

Great afternoons at Wild Waldi. Another great family holiday at Jumeirah Beach Hotel and daily afternoon visit to the Wild Wadi waterpark.Always a great opportunity to have some fun in the water slides.
Best water park in the world. I love this water park .The atmospher is grate and the wildvadi workers are very polite and helpful .I think it is one of the best water parks .
GREAT WATER PARK!. Rides are great !Great Water park for kids and family! The site is very well organized and you can spend a full day having fun!

My best place in summer. I visit wild wadi 5 times a year with my family and kids. Everything is just unique. The water park games are all great, the best thing is their safety & number of life guard which are in every corner of the park. Restaurant and shops are just wonderful, the staff are very helpful, if you want to enjoy and have fun with your kids in summer it is the best place.
Very good day out. Work from Dubai, and with a day off from the yard it as a great laugh with the lads from work. The place is very well organised....

LOVE IT, but it's hot on the feet!. Be aware - when I first went to Wild Wadi (it was in the year 2000, so I know it is a million years in Dubai time) the water was sprayed on the hot pathways so your feet stayed cool. Doesn't seem to work now though. Rides are great - haven't changed in 16 years, but I'm still a kid at heart. Best bit? Not having to walk up stairs to get on the rides - the best one shoots you UP with the water - brilliant!

Great water park...Well worth a visit. Great Waterpark and the main vertical waterslide is worth a go - adrenaline frenzy. Vertical drop in a tube ! The large inflatable flumes are great too. Kids and family friendly

Love the Fun. I have been to Wild Wadi few times, with my husband. The park is not as big as those new water parks, such as Aquaventure or Yas Waterpark in Abu Dhabi, but somehow I love the time I spent in Wild Wadi. The park is next to Burj Al Arab hotel. Usually, if you are the hotel guest, or Jumeirah Beach hotel guest, you will have free pass to the water park. There are various rides, suitable for different types of visitors. Some rides are for single, some are for couples, and they are both fun. lazy river is good for those who just like to lie in the water. It is not that big, so you do not need to spend lots of time on walking between the rides. Restaurant is in the middle of the park. Changing/Locker rooms are very clean. Overall, I love the fun in Wild Wadi.
best activity . this is one of the best activity in dubai. rides are good. take your swimming suits , towels,along with you otherwise they really make a hole in your pocket.
Family Destination. The water park was fantastic for my kids. They have enjoyed and especially because we were staying at Jumairah Beach hotel so it was easy access

Great way to spend the day especially in summer.. The waterpark was amazing! Bought a 2 for1 pass recommended by a travel blog. Saved almost $75! Rides were fun and helped cool off. No queue for the rides. Good fun!

Great fun. Great place to visit although can get quite busy.They used to offer the first hour to just guests of the neighboring hotel but for some reason that has now stopped so busy from opening.Definitely wouldnt visit on Friday or Saturday as this is weekend so way too busy.

Not even close to Waterbom in Bali. Staying at Jumeirah gave us free entry thank goodness. I would have been very disappointed if we had paid full price. The park feels quite cramped and there are very few trees, although they do have some shaded areas. There are only a small number of proper rides, one is a long enclosed tube which was really hot, Tantrum Alley was fun and the long ride was ok but a bit boring as it is basically a flat ride that they use water to push you around on. The kids enjoyed the wave pool and the playground area seemed a winner.Probably a great day out with younger or less confident kids but for the average Aussie kid it's not that great.

Very Good. I loved the long long slide that haf the tunnel and all as it was new and exciting.The other slides were okay and have tried them before.Food facilities weren't that great.Lines were long at later morning and noon hours.Communication with life guards was a bit difficult as they have different accents when it comes to English.Overall it was a very good experience and would like to revisit some time.
Nice but small. If you have visited the Aquaventure Waterpark then you will find the Wild Wadi a bit of a disappointment.

Great day out!. I enjoyed a great day out with friends!
Lot of action and as well places to rest.
We specially enjoyed the long slide.
You sit in a big floating tyre and you have a great ride.
Getting pushed by water jets, then you flat, slide down, get pushed again and end up in the lazy river.
Great!
Worth to visit!

Brilliant Fun. We visited Wild Wadi most days as we were staying at The Jumeriah Beach Hotel so we had complimentary access. The waterpark is brilliant fun although one of the rides was playing up so could only take single riders - this was disappointing as one of our group was only comfortable with a double ring and therefore had to give that ride a miss. This was one of the best rides in the Park so not great that it could only take single riders. The staff are very friendly and it was very easy to get a sun lounger. If you go in the height of summer I recommend you purchase a pair of Pumps that are sold at the park as the floor can get very hot and burn your feet. These special pumps can be worn on the rides and save your feet.
Fantastic family fun. My family and I had a fantastic day here from my 1 year old grandson to myself there was something for us all

Family day out. Perfect place for a day out with children and teenagers. Lots of great water rides. Inflatable rings take you on long rides around the park giving you some great views of Dubai when you reach the top. There are some thrill seeking rides and also the long slow river lets you float along enjoying the sun. The wave riding is cool. Food is ok, and could be better but the attraction it's self is just so good.

Awesome fun with awesome views. What a fun day we had !!! Lots of nice rides with amazing views of the Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach hotel. Lots of place to lounge, chill, have fun, go on a ring through the Wadi, go on a bigger ring on bigger Wadi and even get a fish spa ! Very nice kids area and wave pool. Friendly staff and lots of place to get healthy ( or not) snacks. A must do while in Dubai specially when the temperature is soaring !!!

Two Words: Jumeirah Sceirah aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa. This Waterpark is Fantastic. The Rides, Atmosphere, Weather, Beautifull Burj Al Arab Hotel view. I Love It :)))You must ride Jumeirah Sceirah with speed of 80 km/hSuuuuuuuupppppppeeeeeeerrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr FaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaassstttttttRecommend to All

Open during Ramadan. This was our 2nd visit to the park. It was great as the crowds were down due to Ramadan. restaurants were open and all attractions had hardly no waiting. It made for a long day as we spent it doing the rides instead of "resting" waiting for our turn.
New rides since our last viait. A great place to spend an afternoon. The place is much cleaner than it used to be and the newer rides great fun. Give it a go as its great fun

Awesome!. Wild Wadi isn't as impressive as Aquaventure at Atlantis the Palm but it's so much fun. A bit cheaper, lots of activities and they also have great spots for relaxation as well. The rides are fun and the staff are super helpful and nice. it's great place to visit in the summer.
fun in the sun. we did the wild wadi every morning while we was on holiday for two hours before going to our private pool at the jumeirah beech hotel great fun for the kids which breaks the day up.

Great fun and a must visit . We stayed at JBH for two weeks and Wild Wadi is therefore complimentary for guests to visit.
This is a great day, loads to do for the kids and adults.
It safe and spacious too. Parents can relax and sunbathe should they want to whilst kids spend hours giggling and having fun!
best waterpark in gulf. you cant be wrong with this place..live, vibrant, fun and hotness are overloaded. been to many waterparks but very few are even close to wild wadi.

Great day out . Myself and my husband visited this water park and had a really good day. Slides were really good fun and this time of year was not very busy. Staff were lovely and very accommodating. This is a great place to go even if you don't have kids..

Good fun. The park is great but very expensive to get in. I'd recommend staying at one of the jumeirah hotels as you get free entry if you stay there. Drinks were £5 a time so it's a pricey day out if going with the family. It's great fun though
Excellent. Very well set out water park with everything well planned. The changing and shower facilities are excellent.

Small and sweet. Small waterpark with a hand full of rides and restaurants. Could be done in half a day easily unless you wanted to take advantage of the loungers and soak up a bit of sun. We had the entrance included with our hotel stay and so went to visit, but not too sure I would have paid the entry fee of around £40-50pp, especially after I had been to it I don't think it would have been worth that much.

Excellent . Had great fun. Definitely the highlight of my trip to Dubai. Tickets are pretty expensive, however you can buy the entertainer dubai and get buy one get one free on wild wadi. For people of all ages
Nice for a fun day. Medium-sized water park very close to Burj Al-Arab and Jumeirah Beach hotels. Good for kids but for adults too.
Great aqua park. Amazing park. Very nicely designed with great attractions. We spent a great day with friends. Come early as it really worth to spend a full day there.

Everyone loves a day in a waterpark :). We have so many water parks around here but Wild wadi is still one of my favourites. The big group slides are sooo much fun and I like that the smaller slides are all connected through the river.

great weekend. One of the oldest but still one of the best waterpark in the UAE . Rides are enjoyable, there were plenty of restaurant too inside the themepark. Lifeguard are very attentive and friendly.I loved the ride where we go inside the tunnel. Worth spending your day's off.
Great fun. Staff are very good the food is good very clean loved it . Good fun for families and very safe for children.😀🌞😀🌞😀🌞😀😀😎😎😎😎

Nice place. As a Jumeirah property guest we had free entry to the water park. The water park is not that big. The rides are good. It is entertaining for a couple of hours.
Sometime waiting could be long.
Family Fun Day. Amazing place for a family fun day out, you can just get lost on all the rides and activities to do, or just relax on the sunbeds.

A little tired. Compared to Yas or Aquaventure, Wild Wadi appears dated, tired and small. I have friends who have been and absolutely loved their time there, but for me it's past its prime and better days out are to be had at Yas or Aquaventure.

Great Fun! here are some tips:. - lovely - and large - water park that is conveniently located with the Jumeira!- Ladies night is Thursday night and is very useful for ladies wearing a hijab (like me)- other days are also good for families; veiled women can were special swimsuits available in the Wild Wady stores- Emirates NBD card holders get a discount on entry tickets- Ask for a large locker; small lockers are too small- you can get your own towel

Book at Jumeirah and Go for Free. We went to Wild Wadi for free when we stayed at Jumeirah Beach Hotel. The cost of the room for 2 adults and 2 kids was 800 AED, but Wild Wadi alone would have been over 1000 AED. It's a no brainer- book the hotel for a night, enjoy a nice breakfast, and spend the day at the park. Definitely try the surfing/boogie boarding. It's a blast!
Same time visit whe we stayed at burj hotel. We enjoyed the swiming and water activity it was wonderful and many variety attraction to choose from and at reasonable cost

Fun and must do. Wild Wadi is a great place for individuals or families....if you like water activities.It offers many options for water based entertainment and its facilities are top class. Worth a visit - some pope might find it expensive.
So Fun . one of the best thing to visit in Dubai, don't miss !for friends and families to have fun.. i had so much fun over there , but don't forget to bring your towels with you :))

A must.. Lovely park, not too big or small. Rides were very different to what i had expected. A flume that moves you along up a hilly way, with plenty of slides and twists. Some not for the faint hearted.

Loved it!. What a fab place for adults and children alike. We had a great time for the whole day. Wasn't too busy the sun was shining food was reasonably priced. Lots to do and plenty of life jackets and lifeguards around. Fab!

Fun for all ages. Great fun for kids to grand parents, when staying at the Jumeriah resort hotels it's free, saves you £50 a day pp. you could spend all day there, lying in the sun looking at the Burg al Arab

A fantastic day out!. Never tire of this place - we're like a couple of kids (50 year old kids!!) who still love the thrill and adventure that Wild Wadi offers. From thrill, full of action, fast rides to the more serene lazy river, all that this park offers is exceptional with prestine clean facilities and changing areas. A must do when visiting Dubai.

Nice fun day. Nice relaxing day out.
Slightly high cost for entry, food and drinks where typical of this type of venue in cost. Easy parking and easy taxi drop off and pick up point.

A fun place for the whole family!. Various rides for every age...thrills and spills...lockers available for belongings and many seating areas especially around the main pool. Beware of busy times it does get crowded...plenty of helpful staff around.

Wet and Wild at Wild Wadi. Such a wonderful water park experience. Lot of great rides both for kids and kids at heart. Food stalls are everywhere and i love the ECash System.It also has a great view of Burj Al Arab. Quite expensive? Check on their promos. :)

Great day . What a great day out this place is. It's quite expensive but you can spend the whole day there. Very well run and some great water rides including the death slide. All in all a great day out
Good water park. Had a fab day at Wild wadi good slides good food outlets really good for young children however Atlantis is my fab but still worth a trip.

Best Ever Water Park . Its Truly Amazing Water Park . I havnt seen Such Amazing water park in my life .. in this variety of water slides are there . In this Some Electronic water Slides are there which make surprising and more amazing adventure and Fun Place . Must Visit Place For Water Fun activities .
Good fun, but quite expensive . Great Park. Lots of slides for kids and adults. Fun for all family. Just a bit on the expensive side, if you can do entertainer deal then worth it.

Small waterpark but fun enough. Silly us we went here during winter but during day time. Water was warm but hahaha we did not last an hour........ Never again will we visit on January. Need ti climb many sets of stairs for slides and gosh weather makes it double effort. But ya twas fun. Though food was little expensive yet quality not so good.
such fun. Such fun to visit this waterpark and highly recommend the experience. Its a bit annoying (to me, NOT the non-smokers I'm sure) that you cannot smoke outdoors besides in designated areas.
Best Water Park in the UAE. Great to visit with friends and family arrive early to enjoy the best of the water park before it gets too busy

Amazing Water Park. I visited the Waterpark with my 11yr old son and his friend and friend's mom - we had a blast. All rides/ attractions are well planned and safe. The park is extremely hygienic. Lots of snacks available inside, though I must mention that everything is exorbitantly priced. Very clean and well maintained Locker rooms and washrooms.... Go on a weekday - the crowd is less and there's a more relaxed feel. Make sure to take along all necessary swimming apparatus - they have multiple shops inside filled to the brim with swimming costumes et all....but again it's exorbitantly priced.Another point to remember - even though we went on a blisteringly hot day, since we were in the water most of the time we did'nt feel the heat. But if you plan on sitting on the side while the kids frolic...then you are in trouble.....might be better to just soak in the water to stay cool.Our 11 yr olds had a blast as most rides were ideal for their age and height....nothing seemed extremely scary or impossible except maybe the surfing rides...All in all an exhausting but exhilarating day!Totally worth it.

A nice little waterpark. We managed to do all of the rides in 3 hours. Its fun and definately worth visiting if you want spend the morning or afternoon in sun. The view of the Burj al Arab was really good and provided good photo opportunities.I had lots of fun but i wish they had more rides.

what a great place. One of our most enjoyable moments in Dubai, we spent an entire day at the water park with the kids , one do the rides as many times one wants, also they have a kids play area, where you can leave the kids, they can enjoy themselves on the water slides and play with water guns etc. Great food also available inside the park. Would recommend wild wadi if you have smaller kids.

Great fun. We went with our 3 children 7, 4 and 3. It was brilliant, so much to do and amazing attractions but not too spread out. The kids loved it and so did we. Beautiful views from the main pool, if you're in Dubai with children you should definitely go.

Love this waterpark!. My 1st water park experience in the UAE didn't disappoint! Wild Wadi is great fun (get there early to beat the queues) my favourite being the ride (don't know the name sorry) which basically is 13 (??) mini rides , and you sail along enjoying each one at ease! Definitely a must for water park lovers!

So much fun for all the family . We really enjoyed wild wadi water park- it had so much to offer for all different ages! With one of the tallest slides in the world it is worth a visit! We had so much fun it is worth the trip.

Good day of fun. We were staying at one of the nearby hotels which are part of the jumeriah so we were given free access to the wild wadi. My 6 year old absolutely loved the wild wadi, she throughly enjoyed trying every ride even the biggest one that no one could believe she was brave enough to go on! She got a big round of applause and cheers when she came out at the bottom! It's best to get to the wild wadi as it opens for 10am as the queues for each ride tend to get quite long in the afternoons. There is plenty to do at the wild wadi for all ages to enjoy. We had some fantastic pictures taken in the wave pool which we purchased at a reasonable price. Very much enjoyed our time here and will defiantly be visiting again when we come back to Dubai.
Great !. We had a lot of fun, so it's quite expensive. Try Jumeraih Sceraih We were there during Ramadan, so there were not a lot of people in the park.
Nice and compact . Smaller then atlantis waterpark, but much better... It looks better and you dont have to walk for kn... Ideal if you like de rides... If you like sunning more then go to atlantis

Perfect Water park. I have been here 1 month ago I was my first time It was Amazing and fun.The water recreation that this place have to offer like non other place I have been.Pizza is really good and taste perfect at the pizza place inside at wile wadi.
best place fo r fun. best place for fun but food its not goodand you cant bring beer and wine with yourself in thereand its bad

Great fun for everyone!!!. When I think of fun, this place comes to mind. It is ideal for all. We travelled as a big family, and stayed next door in Jumeira Al Qasr. We payed frequent visits to the water park, and the children loved it everytime. It has all amenities in moderation, and there are enough staffs around. I lost my sunglasses twice, but it was found, and I was able to collect it from the lost and found hut. We would definitely be returning here in future trips to Dubai.

Amazing day the lad loved it. Great water park with views of Burj Al Arab(kite hotel). We had free entry with the hotel we stayed in if we had to pay the price to get in I dont think we would have gone ££££. The big slide with the pod and drop floor is proper intense and the river rapid type slide **** is like nothing I have ever been on before and I have been to quite a few water parks. The lad enjoyed the pirate cove kiddies bit and the main pool. They give the kiddies life jackets so no need to bring the flotation devices.

Great fun. We were able to use the facilities of Wild Wadi free, being hotel guests and we particularly liked Ladies Night which was on a Thursday night from 8pm onwards. Ladies only and children 8 years and younger could go. It's a good waterpark with lots of fun things for younger kids too. I think we went on everything, some rides scarier than others! If you were paying and had the decision to visit Wild Wadi or Aquaventure, I think that Aquaventure pipped it (in my humble opinion) but, saying that, it was good fun and came free!
Great fun. I LOVED THIS PLACE!!! Such great fun for everyone of all ages with rip tides, wave machine, flumes and the breathtaking Jumeirah Sceirah is worth the entrance fee itself. Great fun :)

fun on the rides. this is certainly a fun place to spend a few hours particularly if you are staying at the JB hotel where you are able to get in for 1 hour before the general public and its included in the price of the hotel otherwise it could be pricey for a family.Plenty of staff to oversee that all is going as it should and believe me they stand no nonsense security guards called in at an incident whilst my husband was there and people concerned drug tested and were marched off ! !reason being that they came out of the craft on the ride they were on and came down the flume on their own leaving the craft which could have been very dangerous for the next people coming down but fortunately ride stopped immediately.

An old favorite . I've been going to the wild wadi since not long after it opened it was a firm favorite of mine as a child and even now as an adult I still love it here! Great slides, good food and I love the lazy river. Plus it's only a few minutes away from madinat and about a 10 minute drive from mall of the emirates. So some great links for tourists as well!!

Great water park. To be honest, I wanted to go to the water park at the Atlantis. We were on holiday visiting my brother who lives in Sharjah and he had some discount vouchers for wild wadi. I went with the flow (pun intended) and was pleasantly surprised.The park was excellent, very clean lots of things to do for kids of all ages; they lave a lazy river, you can try surfing, they have a vertical drop slide, they have some really cool tube slides that our 7 year old loved, a little beach area etc. Lots of the rides were 2 or 3 per inflatable vessel which just added to the fun. Probably fair to say that our 7 year old got more out of the day than our 4 year old but that was to be expected. We visited in February half term, on a week day. Get there as early as you can because as with a lot of things in Dubai, it will cost you a 'wadi' of cash. Sorry.

Great way to spend a day and keep the kids occupied. This is a great water park. albeit a little bit pricey. If you have kids, they will absolutely love the water rides Whilst staying at the Jumeriah Brand hotels, i.e. Jumeriah Beach Hotel, Jumeriah Emirates Towers, Zabeel Saray you get complimentary access to Wild Wadi

Best fun place . We went all together 5 people we had thrilling fun all day long, one of the best fun destination in Dubai located besides Burj Al Arab, with a beautiful view and a lot of fun attractions. Highly recommended for all part of the family.

Enjoyable plan . Wild Wadi is an enjoyable water park, easy to get by bus and metro. There are lots of water slides, pools, wild river, ...A wide variety of water funs for any ages and an exciting slide named JUMEIRAH SCEIRAH, around 30m high and 100m slide, max speed of 80km/h. BTW as a negative point it's better to take a bag pack like picnic since there extra charges for every thing. It was a bit expensive and I surprised when I saw you should pay for locker, towel, ...
Decent waterpark. Great for kids. Nice waterpark. My second visit to it. Biggest downside is needing to pay for a locker. Queues were ok to put up with.

A Fun Day. It is a good place to go as a group of friends, or for families.Easily may spend there the entire day. My advice is to go during the week because weekends are too long lies for each ride.They got a few really nice rides, the rest are just ok.

Excellent. Two tips:1st. Don’t leave the park at closing time because its a little hard to take taxi at that time.2nd. Entering the park with foods or drinks are illegal and you should buy them from inside.

Not the best water park. Unfortunately comparing this water park to Yas Island water park or Atlantis one I must say its the worst one maybe because it's a bit old and not that advanced as others. However worth to visit with children.

Fun place!. I got free entry into the park as is stayed in Jumeirah Beach Hotel and it was so amazing that i could come to this fun place for free! really amazing attractions- some really scary! perfect for all ages i had so much fun times in this place. definitely worth a visit for anyone in Dubai!

Rides are good. Came here as part of staying at Jumeirah hotel (included).Shame was there was a Sri-Lankan thing going on at the beach club so there were literally hundreds of the guys wandering around and it was crazy busy.we left at 11.30am and saw them all leaving en masse for lunch on the green, and there were 100's - it was probably a bit quieter after that!Having said that the rides are great, the biggest one is well scary (Jumeirah Scareh or something), quite a few people chickened out and did the walk of shame down the stairs.Lockers expensive.
A family waterpark. A real family waterpark, a few high speed slides. A good place to visit with young children. A lot of life-guards, so very safe.

Fun-packed Waterpark . It is no secret that Wild Wadi is a smaller version of Atlantis The Palm's Aquaventure and Yas Waterworld but boy! This modest-sized waterpark is surely packed with a lot of surprises! It has an amazing view of Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach Hotel and the gulf sea. It is exciting and lively. A must try during summer season... though I prefer visitinf it during pre and post winter.

Great day out . Wild wadi is the better of all water parks in Dubai, the price seems to be increasing on a regular basis so I would advice always to check groupon and other sites for cheaper entrance tickets. The site is clean and heavily staffed so you always feed safe. Attire can be swimming gear. I would recommend to wear a swim tshirt and shorts to avoid any embarrassment when coming down slides... The food however is the only downside, overpriced and bland.

Fun Family outing. The park has lots of great spaces for kids and teens of all ages. Great wading and kid friendly areas for the littlest ones and an excellent body surfing and more adventurous rides for teens. Best to get there at 10am and find a spot to set up camp. It's safe so you can let the kids explore independently and let your teens go off by themselves. About 3 hours of water fun will exhaust them enough. Lots of food options so get some lunch and leave by 2pm when the crowds start to arrive. Get a locker and stow away your valuables so that you don't lose your phone or wallet in the water. Wear flip flops because the ground gets quite hot.
Holiday. The water park is s safe and secure place. My experience of the park is that of pure fun and excitement. The children (nephews) loved the water rides.Enjoyment all round

Great fun. It's a really fun place for children and adults as well. The entrance fee is quite high so worth looking out for deals or pre-booking. One can see this is an older venue and requires some refurbishment/maintenance works but not every one is an engineer, like me, so most people probably don't even notice. Hair dryers in the lockers/restrooms would be useful to have as well as more toilet areas. Other than that...if you have enough time in Dubai, don't miss it!

Nice to visit. Wild wadi has a kids play area, lazy pool and a couple of nice water slides. Jumeirah scareah is awesome.Charge for towels or bring your own.Locker room charge too.Food nice but more expensive than most places. Best to go early as later queues can get long.

" Super Duper Water Park !!! ". This water park is one of the biggest water park in Dubai..This place is near Burz Al Arab & Souk Jumerah & Jumerah Public Beach..To save some money, don't buy entry tickets directly from their site, instead buy it through online coupon site like Coubon.com or coupon book ...There are some good rides & rest are average..Good to spend a hot summer day at here is a good option..enjoy...
Fun for everybody. Dubai has basically everything you need, to have fun.This waterpark has very cool slides for the all ages.If you want to have a fun day, pick Wild Wadi! :)

Total Adrenaline. You can spend a whole day here, and enjoy every minute of that. The entrance ticket is not that much expensive as it may seem because you will have a joyful day, but everything else is unnecessarily overpriced.

not bad but overpriced. not bad but overpriced - costs about £60 for an adult ticket then you will need to hire a towel and locker on top of that! Rides a tad tame for adults but great views of Jeremiah beach and Burj al Arab hotels.

Not so amazing and quite expensive. I would have expected more
Besides the price is far to high for 2/3 good rides
The rest is average, nothing special

Water wonderful day!. Spent the whole day with our son (25, not a teenager) and had a brilliant time. Lots of fun and laughter. Rides vary from easy and relaxed to white knuckle! Plenty of staff around, all we met were pleasant polite and helpful. The place was very tidy and clean. Plenty of seating and loungers available at no extra cost. Note that you cannot take in any food or drink (we were allowed water) we ate at the Ali's BBQ and although a little on the expensive side , good value for money and huge portions. At the end of our visit changed in well attended clean changing rooms with COOl shower, which was very welcome and quite unusual in Dubai. Most water tends to range from warm to scalding!! We did not go to Atlantis, so cannot compare, but we would definitely go again and are happy to recommend.

Free entry with Jumeirah Hotel. We have free unlimited access to Wild Wadi with our hotel. It's a great experience but super hot during the peak hours. We went in the morning and left around 12-1 when it stared getting too hot. It's great to experience once for adults, the ride are great too.
Brilliant!. Just what you need on a boiling hot day. Helpful staff, changing room with great facilities except a hairdryer would be a great addition. Take a towel with you and enjoy!
Love it. Great time in.I really recommend you to go there and have fun if you love water and water parks. You can have meal or something else there too. Enjoy your time and tanning!

Fun fun fun. A must if you have children or young at heart. The park is great, it is starting to show some signs of being dated but honestly a great day out. It does get busy and there are queues but well worth the wait. Food is basic but what do you expect. It's better than Atlantis and cheaper.

Fantastic experience . Amazing time spent with family...tried out the Fish O Spa, and the tingly feeling as the fish nibble your toes is quite an experience. The rides are varied to cater for all tastes, best of all must try Truman and the Burj surf. A day well spent.

Great fun. Been there several times before, but took the family this time, a great time was had by all, even our 4 year old Grand daughter.food was good at the outlets, plenty of towels, we has free entry, but if we had to pay, it would have been a lot of money for a family of 6 and 2 kids

Ok but Atlantis much better . It's ok but tiny compared to Atlantis waterpark, not as many rides and was pretty busy when we went but as we was staying in Burj al Arab which is a short buggy ride I can't complain too much as it cost nothing . If you are with family and not staying at any of the adjoining hotels I'd recommend Atlantis for the bigger rides .

Ok but very expensive. We visited Wild Wadi Waterpark as entry was included as part of our hotel accommodation. I have to say we were a bit underwhelmed. Eventhough there were some good rides we have been to much better. We also thought that the entry fee was quite expensive for what it was, although that is probably par for course in Dubai.We were carrying a backpack with a few snacks and they had to be left with security because no outside food is allowed but we didn't buy any food or drinks because it was also ridiculously expensive. All said and done, if entry is included with your room rate its worth a visit. On the upside, there was no lines when we visited but I think this would be very different on weekends and holidays.
beautiful water park. Full and beautiful water park , we got a good deal of 2x1 , the bad is very hot and there are few options for food, but okay .
nice place. we went with a friends we had very funny time here cafes was nice and delicious food staff very good and helpfully thank you very much

Definitely worth a visit. Although it was extremely busy we didn't mind it at all. Lots of things to do for all ages including adults and the wait isn't that bad. Changing rooms and bathrooms were very well maintained and my only issue with the venue is during closing times where the staff start to force people out as fast as possible

Dubai Trip. Nice place to enjoy in summer, there are a list of water game you can try along with your child and food also available , usually it is crowded in weekend and there are some days where the entry will be exclusive for females

Water park. We took a taxi from our hotel in bur dubai and as you turn into the lane you come up close to the Burj al Arab which is quite amazing in itself At the entrance you get a wrist band you can add as much or little or no money onto it as you wish I recommend adding some its quick n easy as you leave your belongings in the lockers so you dont have to keep going back Its a wet water park so you dont want to drag bags around There is a shop near the entrance if you need to buy anything And lots of eatries around You can also get henna on your hands ( leave til the end)The jumeira scarier is one of the longest shoot rides not for the faint hearted The flumes are awesome you sit on a rubber ring some tandem available And the water pressure shoots you around the long tubes All the way round up down thru tunnels and then you end up along the lazy river There is a swimming pool and separate play area for kids This is an all day trip and thoroughly enjoyable Lifeguards are everywhere and it is a very safe place I would love to visit again

Fantastic day out. Great water park with lots to do for all of the family . My son and husband love the Jumeirah Scarer . Park exceptionally clean and all staff really friendly . Food of a good standard and surpasses the normal theme / water park offerings . Highly recommend a visit

Not the best..... The park is quite small and gets so busy. I have been to Aquaventure at Atlantis and Yas Waterpark in Abu Dhabi, both of which are far superior to Wild Wadi.Also, the overall cleanliness of the park and pools leaves a lot to be desired. We won't be returning.

Image not having to walk up the hill to ride the slide down again.. The best water park I have ever visited. Something for everyone. Non of this climbing steep hills to reach the top, simply get in your ring and be shot to the top on the rapids type ride. Highly recommended

Amazing experience..!! . Wild wadi is situated close to the burj al arab and is an amazing waterpark.. Really loved the slides that propel you upwards.. It was slightly chilly in February but the heated pools made it comfortable..

Good visit . We had a great time at the park and it was value for money, it is worthwhile for families you could spend a whole day there , the changing room area is impeccably clean and to a good standard. The staff are supportive and over all it's a fantastic place to visit, be awful during the months of June and July as its so hot and a lot of people were burnt !! And the ground to hot to walk on!
Nice Day Out with Water Games. Time Goes Out Very quickly while you are there.Lots of Games and Options and You never get Board.Kids Enjoy it very much.

Male dominated . Rides are good but it's quite a compact waterpark.very busy on a Friday afternoon with mainly male locals .women can feel a little uncomfortable. In comparison with Atlantis aquaventure its a totally different experience as Atlantis is more 5* and family oriented which I preferred. The only thing it has a nice view of the burj Al Arab.

Loved it. It was the only water park we visited in dubai and we enjoyed it! The kids went on all the rides- even our 7 year old. They were safe. Many helpful and friendly life savers everywhere. The bathrooms are adequate- hot showers and clean. Lockers are also available for an additional fee. Remember to carry flip flops. You can buy them at the gift shop but they are quite expensive.Meals and drinks are very expensive too.A lot of sitting space to just lay back also. But it can get very crowded so avoid their busy days-weekends most likely.I would certainly go if ever in dubai again.
Wild Wadi experience. This place is as wild as its name and the water rides are quite thrilling. Some of the rides are only for the strong hearted. Its a must visit whether alone or with family.

Fun in the sun. Great place for fun and a splash around, we had free entry from staying at the Mina a Salam.Love the lazy river and the slides with inflatable rings, was too much of a Eus to do the Jumeriah Sceera this time
Great fun. Everything about our visit was excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed the rides especially the Burj Surge. Staff were excellent, very attentive and polite

Just ok!. We had the luxury of being able to visit all 3 water parks in the area (Atlantis, Yas) which may have affected the scoring of Wild Wadi. All 3 water parks are priced around the same so in theory should offer the same sort of standard. In no way was Wild Wadi a bad park but it just wasn't the best and the pricing makes that fact worse. It was well themed and clean but we got bored quite quickly as there just isn't a lot of rides. Found ourselves looking at the map thinking "have we done it all, already" The other water parks

It's average .. Not Atlantis or Yas water world . It's not the greatest water park in Dubai ..In Fact the poorest ..I guess it's hard to compete with Yas water park or the legendary Atlantis ..Average ..I wouldn't pay to go ..but as it was complementary as we stayed at Jumeriah it was ok ..passed the afternoon until the kids got board of the 9 rides Worth a visit if it's complementary

Fun on ladies night. As ladies, yet another attraction Dubai has to offer is wild wadi open only for ladies Thursday Nights! Whether its a fun night out with the girls or with the kids. We went with 3 kids under 5 and two tweeneagers. The kids area is more than sufficient to satisfy the enthusiastic lil 'uns, the older girls had a 'blast' exploring the different slides and rides, and ! You have got to try the Tantrum Alley & Burj Surge! Everyone had an awesome time. But ladies night is not on throughout the year
Good. Good fun but not able to spend a whole day here. Aqauventure is bigger. We went here for an afternoon which was perfect!! Food was amazing and a good pick me up after lots of fun and slides.

Free trip with hotel stay.. Excellent Day out. Changing rooms need a little more direction but we worked it out in the end.Fab day had by us all once we worked out which rides went where. Travelling by water uphill is possible!
Good fun, even for a couple of oldies. We were staying at the Mina A'Salam and decided to try out the waterpark, we had great fun and stayed longer than we had intended

It was ok. Wild wadi is always crowded as it is shared by four major hotels and also people who come on day trips from outside. It is over rated and nothing special if you've already been to Aqua venture at the Atlantis. I would still recommend.

The best fun in the Dubai hot weather. One of the best water parks in the Dubai that belong to the chain Jumeirah is Wild Wadi.Very large water game instead to play along with delicious foods.You can best experience the water game in Dubai extremely hot weather.

So much fun!. This water park is so much fun! It was a great experience for us since I never seen a lazy river before. We spent the entire day here because the weather was great and it was simply a great place to relax. There is another park in Palm island that I think it's called Atlantis. Heard it's very good too.

My girls loved it. We got entrance to this park included with our hotel stay at jumeirah madinat. My girls loved it. Had it not been included I wouldn't have paid to visit. It was a good park But was very busy and the locals were quite rude and also thought they were too good to queue like the rest of us!
Fantastic experience . Very nice and well designed aqua park . Smaller than Atlantis hotel water park but I like wild wadi more ! I think it is cosy and beautiful .

Visited twice with and without children . Visited in Feb and may , first solo then with my 5 years old . It's a an all day visit if you like water. Facilities are really clean and well maintained . Towels are given part of the visit so all you need is swimming costume. You can get locker for your valuable at 40 Edh . You get wrist band at entrance . No food allied unless baby food. Prayers room and showers available and clean. No need to take shampoos all available. Food a bit expensive compared to the quality. Icecream available too with pop corn and other food. Very good fun area for children, surfing for teens and adults . Pretty nice smooth rides too all around and high slides but age restriction applicable . You get food view of borj al Arab . Staff very helpful and if your hotel gives you access card to beach you will love it , amazing clean and a must see. Make sure you ask your concierge at the hotel for pass, otherwise you will not get access. This is good sight with or without children , if solo 3 hours will do if with the children you need all day.
super rides at wadi. My girls and boy thought the rides were awesome and would recommend highly for all family. Great for old folks too

Day complimentary trip . We visited the park as a complimentary offer through Jumeirah emirates towers. The park in itself is not big but very classy, clean and relaxing. There is something for everyone and I enjoyed the surf Rapids. It was not too busy and was very clean and secure and I will definitely return.

Best water park in UAE. That is an awesome water park tried yas and Aquaventure but still wild wadi is the best experience .. Especially the refreshing upsplashing water that Ayer that push you with your tube uphill
The scenery there is the best as well
Highly recommend for kids and adults

Water stank. Wow! I was shocked! The park stank of urine as we entered! This park has lost its appeal for me completely after this trip. The hoards of Indian male workers who hogged the surfing pools made it uncomfortable for my daughter to even try out her surfing skills. No alcohol either now at this park! It certainly didn't help reduce the urination levels, that's for sure!

Shocking. I have visited Wild Wadi many times throughout my youth and thought it was the most amazing place in the world, so I suppose for a family with small children this is in the waterpark to go to. However on my recent visit I was not impressed and found both me and my boyfriend, along with my younger brother (who is in his teens), were very quickly bored of the park as there as not many rides to actually go on. was a big let down.

Great Day Out. Visited with children 7 and 10. Enough for the 7 year old to do without going on the bigger rides. Lots of things to do for my ten year old. Really clean, plenty of food outlets, lockers etc..
Great for Hijabi women on ladies night . Loved this place but hoped it had more rides. I went there twice. Ladies night was incredible! My son spent a lot of time there and didn't want to leave.

Teenagers paradise. Fantastic for all ages, our teenagers particularly loved it as we were staying at JBH and they could pop in and out as they pleased throughout the day. Worth buying a rash vest in the park as less worries about them getting burnt if they're not popping back in a regular basis for more sun cream. Great wave pool and variety of slides, plenty lifeguards around.

Great outing but food needs attention. When my brother and his wife came to visit, we were excited to embrace our inner kids and take on Wild Wadi. We had an absolute blast. The gentlemen at the store were very helpful. The park has been maintained well and was very clean. There were members of staff present at all times. The only faults I can mention is that the food variety lacks somewhat. There were only the basic burgers, wraps and pizza to be found. The wraps were great but there is a definitely need for healthier options I believe. Secondly, the memorabilia is truly expensive. It's a great concept to receive bands every time a photo is taken, but it is extremely expensive to purchase these. Other than that, I will love to return again!

Good but expensive!. Spent the day at Wild Wadi water park, wasn't too busy. No queues to get in. Had some really good rides-the flood river flyer for one-that weren't too crazy. Lots of sunbeds dotted around. Top tip: when walking around always wear your flip flops the floor is SERIOUSLY hot!! Great area for younger kids with slides and water chutes. Only downfall-entry, towel hire and food cost just under £400!! Wouldn't go again, seen one water park, you've seen them all and would rather spend my money on something else.

Love it . A must visit if you're in Dubai and a waterpark fan! Lots of rides to keep everybody happy, plenty of loungers, towels and food providers. Some of the rides are proper scary so out your big boys pants on and go for it!
Expensive . This park cost us £271 for the three of us for the day. Very expensive. Luckily it wasn't a busy day as I would have been seriously miffed at having to queue for ages.
Wonderfu. If you want to enjoy the sun in Dubai and the water activity , for sure this place is what you are looking for , you will have a day to remember

Great family day out. Very family friendly water park. If you want extreme rides there is only one here, but for young children this is perfect. Can get busy so would recommend getting there early to get a sun bed or deckchair. We also rented towels. Great views from some of the rides of the beach. Overall, a great family day out.

An awesome water park ever seen. Wild wadi water park is one of its kind it is full of crazy and unique rides and in some of the rides childrens are also allowed. At a corner of the park there is big food court where you can buy food and all drinks and the best part is you don't have to carry your money or wallet to buy food and drinks, but they charge us for that from a band which is given at the entrance of the park and to only one of the person in the family.

Average (barely). Visited here 2nd June. Arrived at 11am queues not too busy which was good. Purchased the meal and towel deal for 350 dirhams which in hindsight was extortionate. Never been before but in comparison to aquaventure at Atlantis it was poor. The sunbeds are placed in random locations and the site is relatively small so we struggled to find two free beds. We went on the large tube ride first ( the one on the left is better) queues were 15+ minutes, but it was shaded and windy. Then went off to find other rides to go on and we found 3 (yes 3!!) more rides. Granted they are water coasters that lead into other coasters or slides or the one where the floor drops (didn't go on it after a previous bad experience) but the water coasters were poor. Massive queues (up to 40 minutes) and the double ring got stuck up the hill (and we aren't even overweight in the slightest) the ones at Atlantis are far better. The one thing it has that Atlantis doesn't? A wave pool, which we went to go in and the lifeguards started moving people out with no explanation just whistles. Spent most of the day sunbathing which was a massive waste of money. Food included was like kfc but ok. At least we got a genuine magnum which was probably the highlight of the day (along with view of the burj) Would never return and waste money here when Atlantis is far superior

Great fun. Great rides suitable for all ages and dispositions. Easy to get too free entry if you stay at the Jumeriah hotel next door. Its bigger than it looks, on our first day we missed the fact that there were some more rides around the 'back' of the park. Highlights include the wave rider where a very nice member of staff gave our kids a mini lesson in body boarding and the Jumeriah screamer.Negative points - not enough sun loungers and the big pool with the wave machine looked a little 'murky'.

Just alright. Having visited Dubai previously we stayed at Atlantis and therefore didn't visit Wild Wadi. This time we decided we'd go to both as we'd read good reviews about Wild Wadi.In all honesty, it was pretty average. Getting into the park it was unorganised, limited rides when we finally got in too - the water roller coaster isn't the best either, needs a bit more power to make it exciting I think? Jumeirah Sheriah was very good, but even for that I had a 30 minute queue (on a windy day, not so warm that high up waiting round - that's not a moan at the park either!)We got the food package which was decent, it's expensive but does anyone expect otherwise?I'm glad I've done Wild Wadi but I doubt I'll return in the future unless they renovate.
Great fun activity . Had a fun filled day with family to beat the heat in this water park. Great way to end our trip in Dubai on the last day after all other attractions were covered.

Excellent Fun In The Sun. Free water park for guests of Jeremiah Beach hotel. I believe it's about £50 per person for entry for 1 adult. Here with a 14 year old boy who loves it. There is a good range of rides to suit all ages, including a lazy river for mum! Make sure you take flip flops as the paths between the rides get very hot and you can easily burn your feet.

Nice Day Out but watch food prices!!. Been here several times and always enjoyed it BUT you can't take your own food in as they search you so be prepared for extortionate food prices - eg 6 pcs chicken (quite small and poorly flavoured) and one large chips and two drinks120 dhirams which on today's rate of around 5.2 to the pound is over £23...!!!!Poorly made and flavoured and smallish chicken burger chips and drink over £14...!!Rides are good and some with water shoots taking you to summit so fewer long arduous treks up lots of stairs.

Good fun and great day out. Family of 4 really enjoyed the day at the water park. Make sure you take your own towels as this is chargeable. You will also have to pay extra for the lockers so don't take too much as these come in 3 different sizes and the prices is reflected.Get hold of the Entertainer Book so you can get buy 1 get 1 free on tickets.Limited amount of rides but really enjoyed it

Good day out. Similar to other reviews, prices inside the complex are a bit steep. 60 dirham for a chicken meal deal, 25 dirham for a snow globe (similar to a slush puppy). Family of four and we spent 200 dirham on food and drink, even then we only bought 2 kids meals! There are no towels to buy/rent so you have to take your own - it is so warm that you don't really need them anyway. Not been to Atlantis but I'd say there are 3 main rides with any 'fear' factor here for anyone above the age of 10. The rest are relatively kid friendly and tame. There are swim vests to use where required so no need to worry about taking your own arm bands etc.Definitely worth getting the entertainer app for this attraction alone. Saved us 550 dirham here (2 tickets free). Photos are approx 80 dirham each, or you can get all your photos of the day on a CD for 200 dirham. Taxis readily available at the end of the day (at 6pm).

Fun for the family or a bunch of friends. I agree there are not many rides in Wild Wadi and you will find that two to three of them run along the same path. It was sill fun! We went there for 10am and left there for 2pm. My favourite ride was the Jumeria Scream ( I think that was how it was spelt) you free fall from a tube down a slide. The bottom literally drops out from underneath you. It was terrifyingly fantastic. The open pool area was a bit dry as the waves were not particularly big but I think that was because of all the little ones and non swimmers.The food was pricey but it generally is in such attractions. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that wanted to have an active day in a safe enclosed area. The staff were helpful and genuinely nice. I will visit it again when I come back to Dubai.
Wadi Fun. Excellent for all ages, brings the youth out in everyone!Great place to keep cool from the scorching sun!If you stay with the Jumeriah group it's free!

Breathtaking views, good rides. After aquaventure, this is another slighly pricey water park. The view of Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah beach hotel is phenomenal. Has some good rides. Can enjoy a day with the fam!

Not a patch on the Atlantis . Sorry just have to say if your budget only extends to one water park visit then this is old hat compared to the Atlantis ! Ok to kill half a day for my teenagers but not even close to the Atlantis water park ! Would not be rushing back !

Wet and Wild. Been going here for years and it never fails to excite. Jumeirah Sceirah upgrade is awesome. watching some of the larger visitors fall off the inflatable rings - priceless.Best water park in Dubai. Fact !!!

nice, but we liked aquaventure more. We visitied this park on 2nd day of the visit and left aquanventure visit for the last day. That was a good decision, because this park was not as delightful as the other one. Both parks are overpriced and paid over 150 EUR entrance for two adults and 1 child (7 years old), but concidering other prices in Dubai, this was to be expected. The park is not very big and it was quite crowdy on the day we were there (Wednesday), altough we were told that it gets worse on Fridays and Saturdays, as those are weekdays in Arab countries. We had a nice time, food in the park was ok, but would definitely racommend Aquaventure bettter.
My kids adore this place!!. Great location and lots of fun for kids and adults. Older and smaller but very exciting and still worth alot of thrills. Worth it!

Fun. We had free access here as we were staying in a Jumeirah hotel. If we had paid to go in here I think we would have been slightly disappointed as there aren't that many slides. The slides they do have were really good! Well worth a visit if you are staying in a hotel with free access.

Great Family day out!. On holiday in Dubai and need an entire family fun place to go? You can't go wrong with this water park. It's clean and great fun for the whole family, young and old. Pack for a wet day and save costs on purchasing needs at the water park. The food could be described as a tad expensive, but coupled with the fun my family had, could be overlooked.
A bit bored. We have visited before and had a great time but I think second time round it gets a bit boring for 2 teenagers. Food is diabolical

Great day out.. Complimentary ticket - Thanks to Zabeel Saray. From the moment we stepped out of the hotel, our every need was taken care of. Prompt minibus, express entrance, free towel and locker. In sum, a great day out for all the family!
Fantastic time. Such a wonderfully and relaxing Waterpark. Amazing prices and amazing wonderful staff. Lots of things to do. Jumeirha scream is a complete thrill.

Great Fun. Wild Wadi is a very compact water park that manages to cram a lot into a small area. Fortunately we went on a week day and got there early so didn't have to queue too long for any of the rides, otherwise may not have been so good. Makes a great day out, highlights are the Burj Surj and Tantrum Ali. The Jumeriah Sceirah is not for the faint hearted, actually felt the adrenalin pumping as I stood in a vertical position waiting for the floor to drop away from under me.Food is of the burger and pizza variety and naturally expensive, £12+ for standard meals. Staff were all excellent, particularly the boys in charge of the flow riders, very patient with my wife and daughter. Overall a very enjoyable special treat of a day.

Exciting games. The Wild wadi water park is located in Jumeirah, an area in Dubai, next to the Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach hotel . There are 30 rides including the Jumeriah Sceirah the tallest fastest free fall slide outside the United States. The park is less than 30 minutes drive from the heart of the city. Another feature of this park is an 18 m wterfall that goes off every ten minutes.
Good memories with lots of fun . Been to wild wadi couple of times and left the place with good memories every time.Lovely view of the Persian gulf and lots of entertainment for all ages.

Fun for all ages. We’ve been to Wild Wadi three times now. It’s got a really nice play area for the kids and quite a few rides for the bigger kids and adults. Kids of all ages seem to love the wave pool, but do make sure the little ones put on a life vest as the waves can get rather strong.I’m really scared of heights, so the Jumeira Sceirah was terrifying to get in, but once it starts it’s not too bad and it’s over in 8 seconds. The Burj Surj is fun but also leaves me feeling like I’m going to fall out onto the streets of Jumeira. The kids love the feeling of being flushed down the toilet like a bug; I love the view of the Burj Al Arab from the top – before you get on the ride. Master Blasters is fun for the whole family but the little ones shouldn’t go alone if they don’t weigh enough to hold down the raft.All in all, it’s a great water park with just a few downsides. The shortcomings are that it’s crowded and expensive, so try to get your hands on an Entertainer coupon. There isn’t much to eat if you aren’t into junk food, and some of the relaxing attractions (such as the feet eating fish) cost extra after you’ve already paid a boatload to enter the park. The parking garage is super tight and often full. But apart from that, if you take plenty of cash and lather up the sun screen you’re likely to have a great day.
Mesmerising View of Burj Al Arab. 2 times i have been here and i every time it feels so good, the artificial waves and the view of the Burj Al Arab is just wow. Highly Recommended.

Wonderful Wadi. Second visit back to Wild Wadi and once more found it fantastic. Great rides and helpful friendly staff. Good place to spend 4-5 hours. If you stay at Jumeirah Beach Hotel or The Burj Al Arab access is complimentary. Over wise it can be considered expensive. Food from the fast food outlets can also be poor, but the same as you would expect from any park like this. Eat first or after in any of the great resturants and bars in Jumeirah Beach Hotel.

Great Fun!!!. What a great time you will have there!!!Family fun!!! The attractions are from grandma fun to craziness !!A must do when you come to Dubai! But the food is rubbish stick with the nachos ;-)

Lots of variett. We visited with 2 kids under 10, they could pretty much go on every ride. They loved the thrill of the faster rides. Avoid it at the local weekends(Friday's and Saturdays) as it gets really busy.
Family tour. It was a wonderful experience, my children's enjoyed wild wadi it's a whole day fun to be there with beautiful views. It's for all ages.

Nice. The kids really liked this place, I and wife had a paddle or two aswell. We stayed at the Jumeirah beach hotel so we luckily had free unlimited access and really took advantage of it as it is quite expensive to get in otherwise. Really enjoyed it there.

Fun in the sun. Went with family and friends. One can spend a entire day here. The rides are enjoyable. There is something for the young and old so all can enjoy. The only down side is the food that seems to be a little on the higher side. Even then all in all its worth a visit.
Good fun. Had a good time here but gets very busy so be prepared to queue. A little limited but a good mornings fun. Changing areas kept clean

Great Experience. As were we staying at Jumeriah Creekside Hotel, we were given two free passes but now you only have to give your room number at the reception at Wild Wadi Park. Another benefit was free towels and free shuttle bus but we only have to pay AED 40 for the small locker. Great experience with loads of choices available. Best time to go is in the morning otherwise you will face long queues. Also buy a water proof case for your phone or get a small water proof camera.Overall great.

Mrs M. Amazing water park, we stay on the resort and visit most days with my little one, it's great. clean, well organised easy to get a food and drinks, lockers available, huge changing rooms, shop if you need to buy swimwear, googles, photographers around park for your keepsakes and souvenirs, can't fault it, and most of all great fun!

Costly and you don't get informed rides are closed. It is a costly water park ... You buy the ticket and they don't tell you that 5 rides are closed.... And they don't have the decency of reviewing the entrance fee... Definitely Atlantis Acquaventure is much better.... No comparison....

Great fun!. We really enjoyed our visit in Wild Wadi. We didn't have a lot time to spend there, but we try all attractions the best for us. For me Jumeirah Sceirah was amazing! I was terrified at first moment, but this adrenaline was fantastic! On the end I was shaking for 10 minutes and could not recover! Why? Because the floor is running out from under the feet is quite a strange feeling! And this speed - fantastic experience! I was proud that my husband convinced me :)
So much fun! . Had so much fun! 25 year olds feeling like 5 year olds again getting all excited for a ride! Would Def go again, had a blast!

Better than Aquaventure!. Having visited both I would definitely side with Wild Wadi. We arrived at 10am opening and the park was very quiet so always a good tip to avoid queuing! Loads of great rides and the park is set out much better with plenty of shaded/covered areas. The 'lazy' river is also connected to several slides so you never have a reason to leave the water unless tackling one of the bigger attractions. The wave pool is also a good addition and the park is very much on a par with ones I've been to in Florida previously. Pricey, but all of these things are.

A Fun Place. A fun place, no doubt.But it costs alot.The food inside is also expensive.You have to have your swimwear, the swimwear available there is way too expensive. Would have given it a 5 star if it was a bit moderately charged water park. Life jackets and life guards are always available.

Ladies Night! . I've been here a couple of times actually and this being my second ladies night. The staff are really friendly. Food is a bit over priced. The best part of ladies night is that the lines for the rides are shorter. However I could tell that there were new staff being trained on the night we went because they would have to shut down the slides due to the lifeguard not pushing the guest hard enough for them to get pass the master blasters. This made me lose my friends on the slides. I still do prefer Wild Wadi during the day though! FYI no cameras are allowed inside during ladies night this includes no picture taking on your phone as well.

Sunny day at Jumeirah. We went there with friends. It is fun indeed. Especially I will never forget Tantrum Alley ( the scream of my friends to be precise ). It is totally worth it. If you plan to go and visit one of public beaches by the hotel, just forget it. You can find everything you need here , along with lots of entertainments. Don't bother, it isn't noisy here. Moreover kids energize you more than the sun and silence. I don't rate it 5 because the price is a bit high for only 15 kind of rides. You may find other parks offering more of them for the same price.

Fun day out! . If you're looking for the touristy hype of Atlantis then this isn't the place for you! However if you're looking for a fun day out for everyone then it definitely is! While it might not have the same pull as Atlantis, Wild Wadi is easy to get to with free parking, it's affordable - even more so if you've got the entertainer! The rides are great and there are very small queues on weekdays but can get busy at peak times obviously! The food is delicious and reasonably priced! Definitely worth the visit, the views are also fab!

A Best Destination in Dubai,. Good Destination, Fare Priced & Good Value of the Money.Tips:- Best time is cool weather - Oct to April- Get some Idea for Deals / Offers by Banks OR even by Park itself.- Obey the Clothe Rules (Minimum Cloths are best Clothe - No Cotton / Jeans)- In Summer Its Hard to walk by barefooted so be careful & have some arrangement.- To Visit whole Park, u need a complete Day.- Mark Most Thrilled Rides & try to catch Either Earliest or at the Last, During that you can cover all other Rides by avoiding the congestion.- They Also Provide Plastic Money, this will help u to buy anything inside, without Card or cash, Confirm the redemption of amount.- Avoid Public Holidays, specially if you are with Family & don't like Crowd & Log Ques.- Generally, Rides will not take time but waiting in Long Ques does, so be prepared for that.

Not sure whether your money and time would returned enough at Wild Wadi Water Park. if you plan to visit wild Wadi water park during a trip to Dubai, make sure you analyze the worthiness before you go. firstly about the money. it happen me to pay via a agent and cost me AED 300 per person and if you go online, it would be little cheaper than that. I am not sure if the bundle of activities are worthy enough for the money paid. i have been to Sun-way Lagoon; the water park in Malaysia before, and it was less costly while Wild wadi rather has less activities comparatively, and some of Wild wadi activities are in similar form. you also have to pay AED 50-70 for lockers . Foods are available inside , you need to bring your swimming clothing with you. give a try looking to your limitation of money and time during the visit.
Adminstrator. Its very beautiful place .. great staff... but verrrry expensive comparing with other countries... it is worth to visit.. but expensive
Adventurous . Full of adventure, excitement and fun. It worth yo try , it worth to take a whole day . I try different water parks and wild wadi was the best.

Uphill water slide . If you are visiting Dubai then it wouldn't be complete without a trip to Wild Wadi.The entrance fee is steep at AED280 each (£56) but it's worth it, the slides are terrific and to save your legs in the blazing heat the slides actually take you up to the top in the tube to then ride back down again.The sun beds at the top behind the kiddies area are an ideal spot to make camp for the day, there's just a bunch of beds on a raised up platform which gives you a great outlook on the whole area.Make the journey out on the Metro train and you will thoroughly enjoy your day.
Being wild in the wadi... One of the best water parks in the city. With amazing attractions in the park. Centrally located. And the view from rides are amazing.

Good if free. This attraction was included free as part of the hotel package - and great to wake yourself up if you hop in the morning. Not huge compared to others and not sure I'd pay to go separately. No queueing up when we went; thoroughly enjoyable. Iced coffee was great.
A grand day out!!!. We went on all of the rides, fantastic ..my partner did the scary one!!!...all great fun...very clean, totally recommend.

Worth a visit. This is an excellent place to go to if you have kids. The kids love the water rides and it's great for thrill seekers. You need a max of around 3 hours to cover all the rides, don't visit on public holiday and a preferable time is at around 3 pm so that you don't get the peak heat.

Great fun!. This is great fun and free if you stay in Jumeirah hotel.. I would imagine it could get very busy at peak times and VERY hot.. ! But there is rides for all bravery levels! Well worth sitting on the lazy river!
Great place . Must visit if u are in Dubai Something really different Enery one can enjoy it It's for adults and kids as well Advisable Enery one who visit Dubai must spend a day there

Over rated . With the way people have been going on about wild wadi I expected it to be a waterpark that would give me many great memories. Unfortunately that didn't happen yes the place was kept clean but the slides were not working and maintenance was not kept to its level a few off the slides we had to get off because of maintenance problems and it's a bit small with not a lot of slides. It definitely was not what I was expecting but overall it was not too bad it was just like any other waterpark.
May 2016. Spent the morning skiing at 'Ski Dubai' and the afternoon here. Pretty average water park - nothing special. Clean and plenty of rides especially for young children.

Wet and wild. We arrived around noon a bit of a queue to get in. The queues moved quickly and there is a wide variety of rides which are all great fun. We spent around 7 hours and made the most of the day. Warm weather is a bonus as you don't get cold whilst waiting. Crowds really thin out after 5pm. We had chicken for lunch which was expensive and not very edible so choose something else to eat.
Fun. A lot of water games that suites different agesThe earlier you go the better, so you can have enough time to try all gamesThe waves pool is a nice experience as well

It is wonderfull. Wild Wadi Water Park in the heart of Dubai is a great escape from the heat of the Persian Gulf. Though Wild Wadi may not be the largest most advanced water theme park in the world it certainly provides more than enough entertainment to take up a day in the water. The "flow rider" near the front of the park is a big hit as people of all ages try their skills at boogie or surf boarding. My personal favorite is the inner-tube ride that has portions of the ride that go uphill, yes uphill. The food is a little pricey for the quality but what amusement park isn't? The hourly rain storm with the flash flood is a nice touch!

Great place to spend the day . Changing room area was clean and plenty of lockers (buy access to locker and towels at entrance).Fun rides and wonderful wave pool.Plenty of lifeguards on duty and very attentive to those swimming.Plenty of float aids if you cannot swim, for adults and children.Nice areas to relax and plenty of eateries.Very friendly staff, always smiling and helpful when getting in rafts etc.
Amazing . Second time in 6months!This time with my son who loved it! So much fun for hours! There's not a huge amount to do for 4yr olds but enough to keep them entertained for a day

Great water parl. A great water park with some interesting rides. The one that shoots you up the slide and round the park was a particular highlight. It could do with a couple more rides however as there's only about 5 genuine slides. Queues get bad when it's busy as well. Well worth a trip though!
