Great day out . Visited with friends and had a brill time with lots of laughs. It is quite expensive for entry and the park itself isn't that big really! I would advise purchasing the meal deal because drinks and food is pricey! Glad I've been but wouldn't necessarily go back.

Splash splash water everywhere . A must visit place for all water babies, children and adults alike, plenty of slides and rides, make sure you take water proof footware you need shoes to walk between the attractions, the walk ways get so hot that they spray them with water to cool them down. I could not walk barefoot even when the water sprays are on, the walkway is to hot for bare feet. The water park has plenty of eating places to suit everybody.you don't need to carry money, before you leave the changing rooms you are presented with a wrist band that you charge up with the amount of money you want to spend.Wild wadi supply all towels etc, security lockers are supplied within the changing rooms and hair dryers. There are shops on site selling souvenirs, swim ware etcThere are plenty of life guards situated around all the attractionsSo enjoy

Wild Wadi Water Park. Very enjoyable and lovely water park in Dubai.Me and friends went Wild Wadi Water Park in June.The Wild Wadi Water Park has lots of exciting stuff to do.The park is very big near Burj Al Khalifa.Wild Wadi Water Park is a place that each visitor must see in Dubai!

Must experience attraction and a good way to keep wet and fresh to overcome summer heat.. One of a Kind waterscsape. This waterpark has non stop acquatic thrill. Amazing place with Plenty of thrilling water sports activities breath taking thrilled rides .

Best water park in Dubai. Brilliant facilities for kids and not too expensive to feed and water them! Always the best day out in a water park because there is enough for the really small kids and the big kids. Really easy for the kids to navigate also so they can go off in a group and not get lost. Plenty of life guards.

Excellent water park. Excellent water park that can be done in half a day. Many good rides and some interconnected. Good fake surfing areas and great for families with kids of any age
Helps that the weather is always good

Great water park. We were staying at Madinat so entry was complimentary, great day and it wasn't too busy. We had smoothies and cool drinks in one of the fruit outlets. It was very clean and ok. Just a shame some of the prices now are very expensive. We've been going here for 10 years over now and prices are expensive.
Nice water park. Nice way to beat the sweltering heat . Rides were interesting for 11 yr old kids . A nice day money well spent. Clean changing rooms. And lots of interconnected rides .

Great day out. We have now been to Wild Wadi over10 times now and it's awesome , a full day of run , go in the week as weekends can get busy, nice very clean park and also nice food all very clan , look forward to going back
excellent during week days. EIld wadi is as fun as Aquadventure. Both are different but fun to go to. Do try to go on weekdays since Fridays and Saurdays are packed.
Always good fun. Get there early and on a week day. Can be busy but well worth a visit. Get credit on your band for food and drinks and anything you don't use gets refunded.

"That was epically awesome" . Ok so that's from the point of view of an 8 year old who has never been to a waterpark of this size before. Kids (8 & 10) were on the go for 4.5 hours and loved everything about Wild Wadi. Some rides were a bit scary for the little one but she had a go on everything except the Jumeriah Sceirah and loved the experience. The big guy did it all and had a ball. From an adult perspective it's heinously expensive but the wallet pain can be lessened by using 2 for 1 vouchers (we had the entertainer app which was worth the spend given we used it for the aquarium and some restaurants as well). Food is uninspired fast food fare but you are hardly going to expect much more at a place like this. Overall if you want you kids to think you are the best parents ever take them to Wild Wadi. And go early because there was no waiting time at the rides. It seemed to get busier from about 2pm and was quite busy at 5 when we left. The forecast was 39c on the day we went but it really didn't feel that hot because there's shade and water everywhere.

Best WaterPark of Dubai , better than Aquaventure for families. Best waterpark activity for family and kids compared with Aquaventure park. It was the best day out in waterpark after being burnt in dubai for couple of days visiting other things. Kids can enjoy beter in this park where as Aquaventure is more for young kids who enjoy daring rides.I had foot pedicure there for 20dinar (very cheap compared to prices in UK).Park is just under the Burj Al Arab building and you can see the building right up where you will be swimming. Went to search for public beach but found a a quite beach area whic wasnt in use by the public much.Food: Expensive do condier around 500 dinar to spend on food only if you are with familyDont forget to buy your waterproof phone cover, or u can get it from the park shops (just bit expensive to buy in the park)Pictures: Look for camera guys around you everywhere you play an activity and ask them to take your pictures so that you can buy them in the end. Just very very expensive pictures to buy so better to take nice pictures on your good quality of camera/phone.Locakers: You can buy lockers (large and small ones) on arrival. You get to buy a hand wrist band with some credit on it to spend in the park. This is the way to spend money on lockers, food, accesories, swimming clothes (yes u can buy some basic clothes in park shops). Lockers will cost you around 50dinar for large I guess. Towels are all around the park so no worry.

Highly Recomended. Its a must visit water park near to the shining Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah beach. I was very much impressed with their safety rules. Water is so perfect suitable for both swimmers and non swimmers equally. Lockers are available in various sizes and if you want to save money try to carry minimum things and share a small locker with your friend. The small one is perfect for two to three persons to share. Make sure to try Jumeirah scarcia. It is just too much fun but not recommended for people with heart or other similar issues. Restaurants are available inside if you are hungry but they are little pricey. So if you are in Dubai you have to go this place. However, only a taxi can take you here.

Trickery. Be careful that ones your in this is just the beginning of the assault on your wallet.You know that you pay a little bit more for food inside one of this parks than on the street, Not that this is acceptable but they can get away with this so they do!What really ticks me off is that you pay minimum 40 Dhs for a locker (Unless you take the option bring your cloths and valuable to the pool and leave them exposed.Why this not included? 40 Dhs for a towel (No you can not take it home) (This will scare you with entrée fees) So they can get your wallet empty though the backdoor ones your in! 25 Dhs for a snow cone really? Be ready to add al least 100 to 150 Dhs per person extra on top of your entrance fee.Such a shame as they are the ones losing out park was as good as empty could walk in every attraction directly. Would love to come more than twice a year but feel shafted every time I go! Place looks tired would choose other venue in UAE as there are plenty. Just would be simple close to home day out if it would not cost close to 2000 Dhs for a family. Also hard pressed to spend a whole full day there! What reflects already in the next question recommended length of visit 1-3 hours so you spend max 3-4 hours there and that for 2000 Dhs that's simply overpaid.

Average - one off visit. At £50 pp it was very expensive for the amount of slides and rides there are in this park. Luckily it wasn't a busy period so we were able to go on all the rides within 2 hours, after that we were left with nothing to do. There were about 6-7 slides and rides suitable for our age of 27, and even the family part for kids didn't look too appealing. There are however nice areas to relax in and plenty of sunbeds to laze around in. Your not allowed to take you own food in and you are suggested to buy a locker the cheapest (small) being £7.50.
Wadi Fantastic. Our second time here. Every bit as good as the first visit, intact it was free entry provided by Jumeirah Creekside Hotel

Meh!... wasn't amusing. It was the first time my family and I were going to the Wild Wadi waterpark. We obivously had expectations due to the reviews we had read online and from people that have gone before. Honestly, the waterpark was very unorganised, it was unsystematically arranged. Not all the rides exciting just a few, but I guess it doesn't quite matter as long as you've got good company. The lifeguards and staff were really helpful whenever assisstance was needed. Overall the experience was expensive and just an average enjoyment.

disappointing. I thought that I will have a great day but it was quite disappointing . very small with just three slide for adults and nothing more . every thing was very very expensive. It was not as exciting as excepted and was shown in pictures .Just good for those who have child

Holleyday tour.. Wild wadi water park is a example of computeriesd mind of engineer who make a unique items in danger water sports with full safety.we enjoyed there full fun in long n speedey pure water.thanks DUBAI.

Great fun. This was included with our hotel package at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers however prices are quite expensive if not.Lockers are an extra however we didn't take any valuables so left our bags on deck chairs and we're fine.We went late afternoon and had 3hrs at the end, queues had gone and we were able to get on all the rides quickly.You don't need a full day as there's not enough to do.I'd avoid during the midday sun and very little shade and there were a few burnt people walking about.

you should join to visit this theme water park. A very wounderful place to be at for a full day activity , nice games and rides , make the challange and go for it , resturants are available , toilets are very clean , lockers available , and activity of the slow river will be lovely with a couple

Fun, water, fun. This is a great family fun time playing with water. My favourite part is the slides that get you, not down, but up through the use of jets that push your inflatable. It has a decent choice of thrilling slides, surf jet slides and a big wave pool. If you ask me which is better, Atlantis or Wild Wadi, I'll say its one has its own merits and you should visit both. As we are not interested on dolphin encounters that Atlantis offers, I think Wild Wadi is better fun. One thing that needs improvement is the changing rooms, the queues are long and crowded at the end of the day; this needs urgent improvement to go along with the quality of the rest of the park.

Great for family but expensive. It's an amazing day out for the family but it will come at a cost! Would 100% recommend as something to do while on holiday in Dubai with friends or family, book online to get a better price than at the door.

Great place to ho. The kids really liked it, the slides are very nice. Buy the entertainer app or book and you can get buy one get one free. Did now wait too much to get on the slide. The location is absolutely great with free car park.

Awesome water park for the family. We arrived at around 10:30 on a Sunday and there were not a lot of people around in the park. Try not to go during the local weekend as I have been told that there can be alot of people. There is a really long slide called the Jumeirah Sceirah which is definitely geared for the Adrenalin junkie. The park has a variety of rides which is geared for younger kids. Important Note: Bring your own towels as towel rental is a little expensive and don't bring outside food as the security do a bag check.

Not For Adults & Overpriced. Over priced, only 4 rides for adults, its good for family. Really disappointed, I planned for a full day trip to wild wadi, but got done with it in 2 hrs. Aqua-venture water park any day better than this.

Fantastic. We went twice on our visit t Dubai, loved all the water rides, felt very safe with plenty of life guards and plenty of choice when it came to food - felt like a kid again, couldn't stop going on the rides; loved every minute

Would always visit . When I went luckily the water park wasn't very busy at all. not much waiting time for rides and standard of slides was very good. only down side was as it is everywhere in Dubai most the locals have pervy eyes and don't try and hide it at all. which made my girlfriend feel uncomfortable. Other than that it's a great park in a great location and great views

Jumeira fun. Wild wadi park is the oldest and the newest and the best in Dubai, keeping up to date with new beautiful rides for every member of the family all close to each other in plenty of space , good staff .I highly recommend it

Good rides but long queues. We experienced a long queue to get in, long queues for the rides, long queues then waiting time for lunch, and finally the queue for taxis even before closing time was an absolute disgrace. Staff/security were abrupt and unhelpful at the front gate.We ended up walking half a mile along the Jumeirah Road to flag a taxi down, along with many others. With two young kids, that's not a pleasant experience.The location next to Burj Al Arab, whilst spectacular, makes the entrance area a total roadblock. There's lots of shade and cooling fans/water sprays along the footpaths, but in the cooler months of December/January, that's not necessarily a good thing.The rides were good, but not a patch on Aquaventure and not worth the money, in my opinion. We felt we were constantly being encouraged to spend more, especially for photos.
leasure. wild wadi is the first water world I ever tried , I like it because they have a special night for ladies and safe for children

Amazing water park in middle east. The park was amazing. and the slides were amazing in this water park. i would say the best in the middle east i seen this park.. yesterday we visited that park but the tickets we bought was through daytur Dubai. i see over the counter it was little expensive. But it was very good experience..

Fun day out. I went here for my husbands birthday (October) and we had fun. I wish there was a bigger F&B option there although i know its not the predominant feature. overall a great time was had by two big kids celebrating my husbands 32nd birthday! :)

Very busy but great fun. We had a good time at Wild Wadi but it was way too busy. We hadn't realised that there would be so many groups of men rushing around everywhere: we had assumed (wrongly) that it was more aimed at families, children and teenagers. There are plenty of seating areas and eating areas, but very few toilets. It was fun, but I'm glad the tickets were included with our hotel, as I wouldn't have felt it was worth the ticket price. I don't think we would go again, but it was ok.

My favourite water park. . Going to water parks in Dubai is not cheap if your a holidaymakers but you do have a great time. Try to get some concessionary discounts from wherever you can to make it more affordable, your hotel should help you.... luckily I have family who have lived there for over a decade and are never short of concessions. If you haven't been to Wild Wadi for a few years your in for a big surprise. They have added more rides which are superb. Been to a lot of water parks in my life and this one by far has the scariest ride. Dont know who was the most scared, me, my son or my 5 year old grandson. I was not expecting such a scary ride when we all got in the rubber ring. Try them all, you will soon find it, oh, and wear a brown cossie.... WW is smaller than Adventure Park by Atlantis but nowhere near as busy which is fine for me and far more photogenic with the Burj in the background. Great day out.

Great Day Out. Visited with some family and friends and everyone enjoyed. Very cool how you can float around on the rings and get off at the different slides etc you want to use. Great deal also if you are using entertainer.

As good as Atlantis. Smaller park but yet lots of fun . The lazy river with the tub jet propelled slides are great fun . It get you right to the top and then you can choose your route for the way down in lots of tube and one totally in the dark if you dare. Fully recommend it as a very good alternative to the aquaadventure park . Enjoy! All outdoor but rainy in Dubai is rare so not a problem

Lovely day in the sun. Wild Wadi is not a huge water park, but it is not small, right what you need as a family. The kids pool with its different slides is great, the kids loved it, it has not only small slides but some of them are high for a 6 or year old, and still kids enjoyed the challenge. The only bad thing is that unless you go early, you wont find sun beds specially if you are a big group. We had pizza at the pizzeria close to the kids pool and it was very good, not the junk usually found at this kind of places.

A dream for water lovers. Being a Friday the place was extremely busy. However there were plenty of life guards on duty who were very alert. The rides were superb and a must for children who love to play with water. Adults were having a superb time too.

Fun packed water adventure!. A truly wild experience at wild wadi with fun packed excitement n the slides n games are for all age group an amazing kids water area n lots of options to choose from was amazing! Had so much fun n I loved that the staff was so helpful from the time we entered n the food too is so good! My family n I had a splendid time we had a blast!

Fun time . I feel it's smaller compared to Atlantis but we had free tickets because we stayed at a jumeirah hotel so I won't complain too much! When we went there was close to no wait for the rides so we were done within two hours.
A whole day fun, a must. A day packed with water splashes and more splashes. A whole family fun activity. A must in dubai. great food and great place.

Limited Fun. As a muslim lady, WW ladies night is very good idea! I had so much fun with my friend I got adrenaline rush through some of the attaractions. However, the attractions are very limited, one of the game ( something alley) we spend sooooo much time waiting. one more thing, as our visit was in the evening, the water was so cold.
Great Fun!. A great waterpark for all the family. If you stay at any of the Jumeirah hotels, get a wrist band to charge food & drinks too - great idea

Nice waterpark . Great waterpark. Lost to do for small children. The ride are long and fun. There is a lot to do. Food choices are a lot from healthy to snacks. Service in the food court s are poor. I had to wait 15 min on my milkshake. And it can be busy. Have to know don't bring your toys. Like air beds or anything. Because they are really strict rules. The lifeguard are all over. What can be a really good thing because you feel really save with small children. But for the kids it hard when you bring toys and you can use them.

Awesome crazy rides. Price : 275 aed at counter. Try hotels counter as they might give 15% dis. Getting there: accessible via bus 81 and more. Metro not advisable. However its faster via taxi. Approximately 14 aed via taxi from mall of emirates. Very hard to get taxi back from wadi waterpark ( no proper taxi stands). But can just walk to Jumeirah hotel ( 5-7mins away) to catch the taxi.Rides: Must try- jumeirah sceirah, tantrum alley and burj surj. Last 2 are better with the whole family. Jumeirah sceirah and tantrum alley are not for the faint heart. Both haf ROLLERCOASTER feeling. Drop vertically!Be patient as waiting time for rides can be >10minsStart off with lazy river... then go for all the awesome rides.Try all the rides as it is really worth it. You can be on 4 slides continuous.Refer to youtube vid for a glimpse of the rides.Food: affordable food. Family meal cost 120aedSo just leave ur stuffs in the locker, top up ur wrist band and enjoy everything. Remember to bring along hp waterproof cover, you can take pic with the awesome scenery while waiting.Time: be early. There are ladies night within the week so make sure u dont go during those days as they close early for preparation.

Fun.... at a cost. As much as the places and venue merits applause. It has to be balanced against value. This was fun but 'fun' at a price..Price for admission is steep, thankfully we went off peak Monday in may. So the lines were reasonable and waits fine, but I couldn't imagine how long you'd stand in line on a Friday or school holiday's.Rides are decent. Kids would have fun. But you'll pay heavily for extras.40 dh for towel80 dh for a locker (small at best)But it's clean, well maintained and safe.We paid for towels but never got them. They weren't registered to our arm band by cashier. So inside we were passed from 1 to 2 to 3 to 4 people. None could or would make a decision or take ownership. Felt robotic the service.We tried to pay for souvenir photo. But they couldn't find the memory card. 2min sir 5mins sir just 10 more sir.. felt they wanted to say what I wanted to hear, as I said robotic service..
Memories❤️. Great feelings with your love ones! Been there back in 2k12 had a great time with my love! Great rides and atmosphere is so amazing!

FUN. On a hot day in Dubai there is nothing better to do. I personally think Wild Wadi is better than Aquaventure (Atlantis)A real good fun day outWorth looking to purchase the entertainer as it contains a buy one get one free voucher.Enjoy

Brilliant water park. We had a great day at Wild Wadi. As we are staying in one of the Jumeirah properties, we received free entry which is a brilliant deal considering its normally £60 each. Best to get there early (we arrived before 11) as it got pretty busy in the afternoon, although saying this the longest we had to queue was around 10 minutes.Rides are brilliant fun (the Jumeirah Sceirah is terrifying, you're basically dropped out of a trap door into a vertical slide!!) and the staff are very competent, everything feels very organised. Food is overpriced for what it is but that's to be expected in an amusement park. Overall we had a brilliant day here.

Excellent day out. We had a very enjoyable day out here. Its advisable to arrive early to avoid the queues that build up during the day. We did hire a cabana as my wife likes to have the privacy and shade to sunbathe whilst myself and my son go off to do all the rides. Its worth the expense as you get towels, a safe place to keep everything and they also take and bring your lunch order. In addition here you get a separate entrance to the main tube rides which void very lengthy queues. Our favourite ride here is the Flowrider which is great fun once you get the hang of the standing wave. Jumeirah Sceirah the vertical drop ride is also superb fun.
Love it. Went on ladies night, the rides were fantasticI'd say it's a must do for dubai!Though watch out you'll be perved by ladies on the ladies night. I'll probably go on a mixed occasion next time
Wonderful for children and adults. In particular to go upwards when sitting on a waterslide is rather unique. Calculate enough time to enjoy all the possibilities.

You need to stay the whole day to get your money's worth. The last time I visited Wild Wadi was about 15 years ago, and in certain respects it is very much the same, but in others it has moved on with the times. As the last time, we got in for free because we were staying at a Jumeirah hotel (who own Wild Wadi), and thus we felt justified in only staying a couple of hours. Kids of all ages will love it, as there are activities for all ages, be it gently floating round one of the "rivers", hurtling up and down slides, or trying your hand at surfing on a standing wave. The first thing I noticed changed was the number of people there - it can be very crowded, and there are queues for most rides, though not as long (distance or time) as in places like Disneyworld. Another change was the "Jumeirah Scarer" a long drop slide which formerly you just climbed to the top of the tower, and got on the slide when the bottom was clear. Now there is an elaborate system where you are sealed into a pod and after a countdown the floor drops out from under your feet to launch you. This certainly adds to the sense of trepidation. All in all a great day out to get you out of the Dubai heat.
amazin. this park do go .we spent whole day in the park still had so much to see an injoy kids luvd it.normaly they get board but this park they wouldnt get out lol 10/10

Awesome. Great attraction, great rides, especially the latest tube above Jumeirah road, so much fun! Better to go during the summer as water can get a bit cold. But overall fantastic time, with great views of Burj Al Arab

Amazing. This was our 3rd time here. Still can't get enough of this place. Queues are quick to go down. Staff extremely friendly. Food on site is excellent. Overall a great place and value for money. BIG thumbs up

Great Splash!!. The rides are amazing! ! You cam stay there tge whoke day and uou will never get tired. I recommend for families. The kuds will surely enjoy. Its a great place to have fun and relax at the same time! !
Pools in the middle of the desert.. Love this place full of joy! Its clean families love it. Very safe, fun joyful place to be. Great activity for families in dubai!

An Amazing Waterpark. Wild Wadi Waterpark, is the most amazing waterpark I have been to. It has many great slides for everyone in your family. The staff are also all very friendly. My favourite was definitely the Jumeirah Sceirah... It was an thrilling ride. Wild Wadi is absolutely worth a visit if you are in Dubai.

Great place for the kids. Enjoyed a day here with the little ones, great place for all ages. We had the entertainer 2 for 1vouchers, which made it worth the price..it is quiet expansive otherwise like most places in Dubai. Lots of security and lifeguards, feels very safe but still keep close eye on your kids...I lost my daughter for an hour but she is a sensible 7 year old and with help of security she found us.

Splashingly Refreshing. The rides are superb!! It was a well spent day out with friends. I suggest you book your ticket ahead to avoid the queue. A lot seems to be heading and have a splash especially summer time. Water and adventure lovers shouldn't miss this!!

the place you can have fun. I have been to Wild Wadi Water Park some years ago, but when I went back this year I found out some rides are not there anymore. Anyway, It is still a great water park. what I like about it is you don't queue much and sometimes you queue while you are inside the water. It is a bit expensive, so it is better to go there for a whole day, not just for few hours. Also, Since the lockers are not free, it is better to avoid bringing many valuable things. It has a free parking, so you can leave some of your stuff in your car. There is no access to the beach, but there is a pool which makes waves, and another pool for surfing.

A lot of fun at any age!. Wild Wadi is an incredibly fun activity despite your age. They have numerous slides and plenty of places to eat, and it's actually free entry if you stay at a Jumeirah property which is incredible value. The locker/showers and change rooms were very convenient and practical, there were even plastic bags for wet clothing. The park also overlooks the Burj Al Arab and has great views. I would highly recommend!

Fabulous Fun!. Great water park. Beware you can't bring your own snacks or food. It is a great day out. Avoid busy periods at the wknd or Thursday's. Go a week day - morning- avoid log queues. Get some pics outside afterwards with the 7 star hotel in the background.

Best Waterpark In The World!. First of all, it's a great waterpark because I'm staying at the Madinat Jumeriah so the tickets were free. Which in my opinion is amazing! Also, it has so many different slides and a huge swimming pool with artificial waves. It's very creative! There are also a few fast food restaurant with really good food. It's also very big and has a lot of space which is amazing for children. It's also very clean and safe! It's for all ages and it was much better than I expected. There's just one problem, there isn't a lot of chairs available to sit so I would recommend you come quite early because it gets full very quickly especially on weekends. A good amount of time to stay there would be a full afternoon. Otherwise, it's a magnificent waterpark.
Nice place. We enjoyed the whole day had a great time with my family and got value for our money though it's very expensive

ALL ROUND FUN. We had an Entertainer voucher for buy one get one free to use at Wild Wadi, so we decided to take advantage of the offer.We drove and parked in the free underground car park next to the water park. At the time there plenty of spaces but we did arrive at 10:30am.The queues were small and we literally had 2 or 3 people in front of us. We paid one entrance fee and gave the Entertainer code which was accepted. We then paid for a single medium locker, 2 towels and pre loaded 150 Dhms onto a wrist band for food and beverages in the park. After changing and locking away our belongings and just needing our towels we headed to find a couple of chairs/sun beds. There were so many available in every location, but some were sheltered and some were in the direct sun. We left our towels on 2 sun chairs and headed to the rides. You have to collect the towels using your wrist band from the 'Souk' in the park.The first ride was the White Water Wadi. You could use single or double rings, but on a single ring there was more chance of spinning around whilst travelling. This ride climbs and jets of water shoot you up the tubes making you twist and turn. There are always different routes to take and it's so much fun. It's mainly exposed but there is a tunnel too! This connects to 11 slides. Flood River Flyer is a similar ride but connects you to 6 different slides. All of these are so much fun for adults and children and extremely safe. We tried both Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj. Amazing slides, great with 2 or more people on these rides. Just watch out if you are riding backwards down the slide, you are in for an experience and hold on tight! I tried Jumeriah Sceirah! This is a speed slide! Wow it's high and you seriously move at some speed, but it's all over within 10 seconds. It's incredible and it all starts when you are briefly locked in a cylinder standing upright and then there's a 3 second countdown. Next thing you see is the floor drop beneath you and you are moving at a serious speed through a tube with water. It's 32 metres high and you travel 120 metres at approx 80kph!Riptide Flowrider was another great ride. It's all about balance and doing as the instructors tell you. It's brilliant fun and well worth giving it a go.We spent from 10:30am - 4pm in the park. The queues were great and we waited a maximum of 5 minutes for some rides, but the staff keep the rides flowing. We ate in the park at Ali's BBQ area. This is a counter service area with sheltered seating. We ordered a chicken kebab, large drink and this we actually shared as there was plenty. It came with a large pot of hummus and 2 pitta breads with additional dips and fries. This cost approx 75 Dhms. They give you an order number then when your food is ready the staff deliver it to you when seated in the BBQ area.When you finish, you take your wrist bands back to the souk and any remaining money to handed back to you. When you leave the park there are towel bins to place used towels in and you hand back your wrist bands at the exit gates. Some people had mobiles on them, if you need your phone or camera take them with you at the time of changing. The park also sell a waterproof phone case for you to use on the rides and this costs 120 Dhms and they can be purchased in the souk.Would I recommend the park? Yes. Would I return? Definitely. Is it worth the cost? Definitely. Is it safe? Yes.An overall FANTASTIC day!

Worth a visit. After visiting The Atlantis waterpark was pleasantly surprised that this waterpark was as good as it is. The original waterpark of Dubai. Friendly staff and life guards there to help etc... got busy towards the afternoon so get there early so you can go on the rides lots of times before having to queue. Food prices not too bad for type of attraction. Gorgeous views of Burj all Arab and The Jumeirah hotels.

PERFECT!. Great attractions.We visit the facility in April and we really enjoyed it. Really fun, good value for the money-we used Entertainer voucher and we had 1+1 free for bronze ticket. There were no ques so we didn't need to upgrade the ticket.

Wild Wild Waterpark. Wildwadi water isnt just about rides but it is one of the best spot to take pictures with majestic Burj ul Arab in the background, also you can choose the beach or the city while you are on few rides ofcourse before you get on the ride until and unless you have GOPRO or Water-resistant phone case. Its really a great place to hang around with friends, i would discourage solo visitors for the very reason because you need a minimum on few rides or be on others mercy to take you with them not a great sight when its your turn but you have no partner so make sure you enjoy in groups.For the scenery and sight i dont mind the price. Enjoy your day at the water park and you have a water resistant suncream to protect your from sun burn. Directions to the park are very simple if you have a metro line near you and head to Mall of the emirates, get a cab and reach wald wadi.If you are budget catch a bus and reach this park.Other options include cab or own ride.Happy splashing...

Very good but very crowded!. I love this waterpark, is so much funny!! You have lots of slides to do, lockers to keep your stuff and guys that take you pics so you can let your camera at home! The only but is the crowd and the lines, I think there should be a limit in the number of people allowed in the park at the same time to avoid lines and lack of space to put your towel! Sometimes there is a point you can barelly walk through the kids screaming and running!

Nice day out but expensive . We had a fantastic experience with very little queuing. It's was a warm day but we didn't have to wait any longer than 15mins. Overall I would come back again, however try and get a discounted ticket others had them. U.K.
Great family fun day. What a fun water park! Great for couples and family's with lots of slides and other attractions. Good change room and toilet facilities with lockers.

Sun cream!. Get here early in the morning to get the most of the waterpark. It's divided into different areas and there is enough for everyone to keep them all happy. My girls loved the main pool where there were waves every 3 to 4 minutes but please remember your sun cream. Enough eating places but you can always pack a light snack.

Another great water park. Had a great day here with my daughter and nephew; plenty to do and good food also. Watch your feet on the hot ground! The water proof slip on shoes (which can be worn on most rides) are a big plus point.Check out 'The Entertainer' deals app for this and lots of other things to do and places to eat in the UAE, you can save yourself a bomb.

Good but yas waterworld easier and more worthwhile . Returned to wild wadi after 10 yearsAlthough the place is clean and well maintained In my little opinion I feel yas waterworld has more rides, different types of rides, and is easier to spend the day there due to this Main frustration: You pay for the entrance fee and receive a bandYou then pay extra monies which are loaded into a wrist band for foodHOWEVeR this money is NOT refundable so if you don't use t all you lose it- but it's kind of difficult to predict who will be eating what as children have varying appetites ...Once inside the park there are 3 food places where all the menus offer burgers, fried chicken, pizza or Other options.However, yu can only get burgers from place 1, fried chicken from place 2 and pizza from place 3.So if everyone in the group wants something different you all have to queue up at the place where they sell that.Other options such as tandoori chicken in naan or bbq chicken is advertised at all the places. But you can't pay for that with your wrist band. The tills for those options only accept cash. So if you want that, you need to go back and get cash and then pay for that seperately to the other food you've ordered. What management need to do is just put pizza menu in 1 place and burgers menu in 1 place instead of offering menus that don't sell the item in that venue because it's Very confusing and time consuming to get this exlained to you once you're there. I have medium intelligence and it took me a while. It is entirely possible this food conundrum was just a problem for me. Other points all bags must be checked for outside food - okay that's fine it's a rule and we respect that and they are really good at letting baby food in and respectfully searching bags but if a large family have come in looking forward to a day out and have bought their own food as its cheaper what happens to the food? Gets wasted and the family have to pay more just to eat in - seems slightly unreasonable and unfair to me. The rides are good - Jumeira sceirah is really for daredevils.Employees genuinely enjoy their job and provide a fun atmosphere.Very helpful with children.Most rides are lazy river types.Kids play area looked really fun and 9 year old enjoyed that immensely .Waves machine also excellent.Changing area very clean, showers also well looked after, prayer area immaculate.

good for younger children not many thrill rides. busy and quite small, not as good as aquavenuter, but still a good fun couple of hours. Expensive unless you get a deal as really after 3 hours you can do the whole water park a few times over!

Hours of fun. We went here with our 4 year old son who absolutely loved this place, we were worried there wouldn't be much that a 4 year old could do but this wasn't the case, the park has a section for toddlers and younger children if I remember correctly there are 5 mini water slides and countless water cannons that the kids can squirt water at people below, it's best described as a soft play centre with-in a swimming pool. There are approx 6 life guards who look after this pool so you feel ok if your child runs off in excitement and you lose sight of him for a few seconds, Our 4 year old loved it he slept very well that night. We had free entry as we were staying at a jurmeria group hotel we also had meal vouchers we could use at the park for food we had God from the chicken place situated by the kids water play area the food was as good as a kfc, but would have cost over £65 if we didn't have the meal vouchers. A good day out where you feel safe as there are lots and lots of life guards.

Wild Wadi - thumps up. Neat, clean and well organized. It offers exciting and thrilling rides and other water activities. Towel and locker rental are available for minimal fees. A must visit and unforgettable waterpark.

Plenty of fun. Nice place for adults.Heaven for kids.Few things better than sipping a drink, emerged mostly under cool water whilst the blistering heat does its thing.Should you spend most of the day there, you will easily manage to try all the rides at least once.

FUN!. This place was amazing. I had seen it on a tv show back in the US and so I just had to go when I was there. I spent the whole day there alone and had a lot of fun. I would definitely recommend to anyone and everyone. There was a lot to do.

Compact but generous. This place is awesome for visiting with friends, family - well basically anyone has something to do. This is a small water park but has in a creative way made it feel pretty big with a lot of fun packed inside. This park has one of the best sport to view the Burj al Arab and just to see the Dubai skyline or the Jumeirah Beach from distance. Me and my friends even had a meal included if you book a package via their website and it was nice! Staff can sometimes at the entrance and in the store treat people very generic and does not extend understanding or commitment to be perfect - which is a point of improvement.
fabulous. this place is amazing and excellent service for all the staff.thanks for the management and to all staff.

Wild Wadi Full. Great water park, had a great time here! Easy to get to, you could easily get around the whole WaterPark in about 4 hours (meaning going on every ride) for a group of 3-4) hardly any queues times. Loads of family spaces to sit down, restaurants are all their!Downside, need a few more water park rides, restaurants are a little pricey, also pics are pricey too!But none the less you will have a wild wadi them!

Great for families with young children - especially if over 1.1m tall. The water park is a number of years old now (we have been coming for over 8 years) and it still runs efficiently. There are numerous life guards and the tube rides are all great fun.For the young kids (under 1.1m) there is a water park area with mini slides (about 5 in total) just behind the wave pool, which they can also go in with life jackets. The lazy river is also fun for young ones that can sit in the tubes, or for the really small kids/babies, they have special blue tubes which dont have a hole in the middle so the younger kids can be pushed around by their parents.If you're looking for thrills and spills, hands down Atlantis' Waterpark beats Wild Wadi, but for families with younger children, Wild Wadi is better suited. There were lots of older kids/adults without kids here too having fun.The food options here are limited if you are looking for Gluten Free or vegetarian options. Meat eaters are catered for though.

Perfect for Summer days. The park is widespread and pleasant, taking away from the Dubai heat. The intense thrill rides are fun even thrill, just wished there were more intense thrill rides. The slides that keep inter connecting are alot of fun for group activity. Look for deals and book online.

Cool but expected bigger. Staying at the Jumeirah Beach hotel depens on the package you have free entrance at the wild Wadi water park! It is cool but i/ we expected to be bigger. 2-3 rides are funny and a "surf wave" are really worth it with 8 and 11 years old kids.

Fabulous family day out!!. This was our 3rd visit to this waterpark and it didn't fail to disappoint again!! Lots to do for everyone or if you prefer you can just chill on a sun lounger. The DJ that was playing in the wave pool was excellent and provided a fabulous atmosphere!!

Not very spacious for the number of people. I was so excited to go but disappointed having been to other water parks in the UAEI think it was very expensive and overrated but glad I can say I've been.

Totally fun!. We went there was a couple and the place is a blast. I have it 4 Stuarts for the simple fact that they only have 5 slides. The park is not that big but the view of the surroundings is amazing. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. And here's the best part... The give you an encoded rfid bracelet that you can charge with money so you don't need to carry anything with you besides your GoPro. Food, drinks, and souvenirs can all be paid for using the money you've deposited on to the RFID wristband.Take the metro to the Mall of Emirates and take a ten minute cab ride to the park. If you go early you can be done in about 2 to 3 hours and then enjoy the rest of the day exploring the beach and the Borj Al Arab.

More good than average but not worth 4 star very good.. Had free access through our jumeirah hotel, not a bad way to spend a few hours, it was quiet when we went and it took us less than an hour to complete all the rides, nice, but I probably wouldn't want to spend the high entrance fee to go in.
Nice water park. It is crowded yet enjoyable. Also the staff is very helpful. My only complaint is the food price, it is simply too high.

simply loved. it...... We went as family , with grown up kids, rides were enjoyed but some do take 30 minutes or more to get on, can get expensive by the time you add entrance fees and sundries like towel fees, food and drinks, locker fees

Great day out for the family. My daughter (7 yrs) and I were over in Dubai visiting friends who live out there. They also have two young kids (2 & 5 yrs). We wanted a place where we could all find something to enjoy and they had previously visited the park at the Atlantis but said they found it catering more for older kids and adults. We arrived (on a friday) pretty early and stayed right through until the park closed (at 7pm) - we were never board and everyone enjoyed their day there. I felt there was a good variety of rides with varying 'thrill' levels, perhaps we were lucky but we also didn't have to queue much for anything (15 minutes max.). The kids really enjoyed it too. Guess my main thing would be that like pretty much all other water/theme parks the food provided there is not great value (captive audience) and tends to only be fast-food, but hey. We also ended up having a really nice photo taken of all of us by one of the photogrpahers that are 'floating' around the place (unintended bad pun). Something else I quite liked was the fact that it felt safe enough to leave bags and things on sun-beds while you swam or went on slides. There are also discounts vouchers available and a massive discount for Dubai residents, which all help make it a much better value day out.

Great day out for families. This park is particularly good for families with a large wave pool and children's slides.Not a huge amount of slides for adults but the latest additions (trap door ride and group rides) have definitely improved the park.Entry and food expensive, but unlike Atlantis it is still in the Entertainer.
enjoyable day out. but works out expensive if there few of you, approx £70 per person + food and drink, locker charge, Towel Charge, Q on popular rides
Great fun!. Again another great water park in Dubai. This one is more for ride enthusiasts than an overall good water park like at aquaventure. Good rides and has parking on site which is great.

Amazing water park have to go a must. Kids loved it, best place to take kids in dubai same as the atlantis take kids to emirates mall, Dubai mall, Burj Khalifa, Safari, Quad Bikes, Jet Ski, Boat Cruise including Meal. go to sun and sand travel bur dubai and book all excursions or use dubai groupon had a time of a lifetime.

Love it!. Love the flow barrel here - definitely the best I've been to anywhere in the world but not happy that they've stopped playing music in this area. Special thanks to Sunil in the green top for going above and beyond to help me out. Would definitely recommend this place and the great staff.
Very expensive. A fun way to spend an afternoon, but too expensive for the limited number of rides. Good locker facilities and a clean waterpark.

Very good . We always visit this place every time we come to Dubai. A couple of very good rides eg tantrum alley & master blaster. It can get busy during weekends / holiday season. They could do with a few more thrill rides & slides.

Good wet day out.. The place is clean and has a nice atmosphere. Can get very busy at times. River rides on rubber tubes/rings are fab. My daughter who is 6 and not a great fan of water thoroughly loved it therefore had to go back twice in a week. It is a tad expensive with soft-drinks almost 4 pounds. Good family day out.

will always go there. it has to be budgeted for.. We paid about 400USD for this attraction 2 adults and 2 children. but it is worth it if you go the full day. yeah once every visit to Dubai :)
lots of activities and restaurants really nice :)
A wonderful water park. With warm waters and lots to do for the whole family, this is the perfect place to stay and wet and dry!

It's Fun for the 1st time.. But few water rides!! . I went to wild wadi together with my friends last 2014.. I was very excited that time because I'm hearing lots of things about wild wadi.. But when I experienced it.. It's like normal.. There's nothing special about it..
The oldest Water park in Dubai but still the best.. Comparing to the park near Atlantis in the Palm, this park is better interms of enterance fee, rides, service and View of the Persian Gulf

Brilliant water park - a must do if you like water parks!. Been to wild wadi today (my second time ever) thanks to free entry due to staying at a Jumeriah resort. It was wonderful - spotlessly clean with lovely staff and maybe I just came on a lucky day but it really was not that busy, could do all of the slides with no more than a couple mins queue.Only downside was we grabbed a bite for lunch and the fries were not v nice. Apart from that, small note! All great!
Great for families. Great place for family fun. All the water slides are really good. Kids will love it here. Entry is pretty expensive though. Staff are also helpful.
Great park! Could however need more rides. The park itself is great, and a good way to spend a hot day in Dubai. However the attractions feel limited and the food options are slim.
FUN & FUN.. A place to experience a full day of FUN , water games and Tan. If you are a fan of water games and Whether you're family ,couple or with friends you will Love this place
Needs updating . Like the JB hotel this is in serious need of updating and refreshing. We had our towels stolen when on a ride and the place was overcrowded. Not good!

Great park - not much for adults. Was a great park - huge. Not much for couples. there are a few bigger rides but once you have done them you are left with a lot of kids rides. the adult rides are definitely worth it though, we went on some a few times. One ride links lots of little rides up, it's quite incredible!

Lifeguards are brilliant. We visited Wild Wadi with 3 young children (age 7, 5 and 3). We didn't have to pay as we were staying at a Jumeirah hotel, though if you are paying I did think entry was expensive. The place is extremely well organised and the staff are first class. There is something for everyone. Many of the rides have a minimum height requirement of 1.1 and to be honest, like any theme park, if you have very young children, I would probably wait until they are older as there is too much they cannot do. My two youngest spent all their time in the lagoon area which is perfect as very safe, but still exciting as they have a wave machine that is switched on at regular intervals. There are also a set of kids flumes which mine loved. Very very safe as there are lifeguards at the top and bottom of each slide. My 5 year old has always refused to go on any water slide - he is simply too scared, until Wild Wadi. An amazing lifeguard called Lydia saw he was frightened and routed to the spot and while I have no idea how she managed it, she took him under her wing (while still paying full attention to everyone else), and within 15minutes he was going on every slide (reporting back to her each time with his progress!). She was brilliant and I am beyond grateful to her for what she did. Lots of good quality places to eat and deckchairs in both the shade and sun. And you can put cash onto your locker key when you arrive so that essentially the place operates a cashless system. If you have money left at the end of the day, you simply get it credited back to you as cash. You need to pay for lockers and towels. If you have a family you will need a medium locker or larger. It is a really fun day out (and we were there all day). Definitely recommended for water fans generally and children of probably 7+.

Great . It's a great water park ..you can spend all day with out getting board...kids and adults love it...it's free if you stay at the 2 hotels otherwise you can pay at the gate...there are food courts located around the park....best thing about this park is that thete are life guards on each slide...lockers are available at a cost...

Lots of inflatable fun.. Took my sister and her kids to Wild Wadi. Spent the whole day there which was a first for me. Usually go early and leave mid-afternoon. Went earlier and stayed all day. Kids and adults loved it. Good that it is in the entertainer to get discount on entry. UAE resident rates also favourable. Lots of inflatable fun.

Jumeriah scream one seriously scary ride. We went on a Sunday and did not have to queue at allVoucher saved us AED 500 (the cost of 2 full pice tickets)You get fantastic views of the Burj from the top of the Jumeirah scream...OMG that is one scary ride!Decent Veg option available at food outlets.Tips- take your own towel save 40 aed..wear water shoes..buy Entertainer Wild wadi voucher from ebay. No need to buy food deals at entrance as it is actually cheaper to buy direct from vendors and better not to have a large amount of food in one go.

Great fun for kids. By going on a Sunday we hoped to skip the crowds but alas it was still very busy. Lots of rides for those over 1.1m but sadly not much for those who are shorter (like my 5 year old who measured 107cm the poor kid). We still had a lot of fun and would recommend it to families. Use the Entertainer voucher like we did and save by getting 2-for-1 entry.

fantastic weekend. we spent our weekends here and were really glad we did, all rides caters for everyone, for kids and other young at heart like us. Food is not a problem too since they have few quality fastfood inside the park. It was a fun filled day, recommended to all.

Great way to relax after our 12.5 hour flight. Very typical to your standard US based water park but slightly smaller. People here are very well behaved and not loud!!! They have great lockers and changing facilities that have bathrooms and showers. Concessions have the typical fare (pizza, wings, burgers, snow cones, ice cream, etc.) They do have great photographers strategically placed around the park that take very nice photos. Lines were also not that long for most attractions.The water park is located between the Burj Al Arab Jumierah Beach hotels. This is a very nice park in a great area!You have to try the water coaster and the Jumierah Scierah, Master Blaster and Tantrum Alley.

good. was more of a family water park a smaller park but a lot more friendly then Aquaventure and yes not as expensive for food or to get in with a family /rings was there by the rides so no hunting for them good day out better if we stayed at the hotel next to it this would have been goodwomen are allowed throw overs but can be fully dressed (still silly rules about dress code one rule for us and one for them)
Good park - Nice rides.. A bit crowded after noon with up to 30 minutes waiting, but fun for the family. Not the place for lunch.

Overpriced and little value for money. Very expensive for what is on offer... Been to water parks in Egypt and turkey before a fraction of the cost and they were way better in my opinion.. I used the entertainer 2 for 1 vouchers and with food and lockers it still cost me £180 for four of us. I hear if you travel out of Dubai it's better value for money at Iceland water park. I feel wild wadi is very overhyped and personally was disappointed

Great place but take wetshoes! . Everything about Dubai and surrounding was just amazing! We used the entertainer voucher and got buy one get one free! Good food but great day! loads of fun In the sun with shady spots too! The only thing I would recommend is some wet shoes, ie those with rubber soles and wet suit type material on top. This is because the water rivers can be a tad rough underfoot and in the middle of the say the floor is super hot out of the water and with our shoes ( that we bought in the UK) we could wall anywhere! Definitely one to visit!!

We went with a free pass from Jumeirah. We enjoyed it as two adults but wouldn't have paid the full entry price which i think is around £50 for an adult. One of the rides involves the floor disappearing below you which was fun. Small locker was £8 - ou la la!!!!

Wild Wadi Water park . It's small water park which was nice as you did not need to walk far between the slides but I think it is over priced for what it actually is and should be a lot less but I suppose it is in prime location.My children had a great time and the staff were really good and stuck to the park rules especially on safety.The food was not great and once again over priced for what you actually get.

March 2016. Went here this time fourth time to Dubai but first time to Wild wadi, would rather spend the extra to go the the other waterpark, not enough sun beds for people that don't do rides very cramped and daughter and husband had to wait long time to get on rides and lots of stairs at other one no stairs and can stay in water when waiting for rides would nt visit again
Brilliant. Very good attraction for families with children.Loved the attractions and food was also good. Spent most of the day there

Fantastic day out . We really enjoyed our day at Wild Wadi. There's lots of little areas to choose from. We arrived before the park opened so we were able to get sun beds but they quickly filled up. The food however was not enjoyable. It was flavourless and very over priced and has no child's menu but that didn't bother us. We would definitely go back.

excellent family fun day out!. its a fantastic water park, quite manageable, lots of differing rides, good wave pool, lifeguards everywhere. You must go early to beat the queues and to get the sun loungers. We had chicken tikka kebab for lunch which was £12? but it was very nice and filling- better than your usual theme park fare. The VIP area has seats but is very expensive. The hotel is adjacent to the Jumeriah beach hotel and Burj. All the taxis know of it and there are many hotel shuttle bus options too. Note: you can not take food or drink into the park as they search you upon entry and confiscate as necessary. There are lots of eating places inside though. You can rent towels also if they are not included in your pass.

Kids loved it. Kids just loved Wild Wadi. We tried getting their early on a weekday to avoid the rush, but guess its crowded everywhere right now in Dubai. Cannot quite imagine how would it be on the weekends. There were queues for almost all rides. The lazy river was a slight disappointment since our younger one could not participate (1.1m height restriction). Nevertheless, both kids just enjoyed the wave pool and refused to get out. A day well spent.
Best water park ever been to. wild wadi water park was the best water park i have been to ever. Would have loved to visit this again and again.

Most amazing water park. Wild Wadi is the best water park I have ever been to, the rides are amazing and the park has all the facilities you would expect in a major tourist attraction. The slides and rides keep you busy all day and there is plenty of food available throughout the park.It is very easy to get to and has the spectacular back drop of the Burj Al Arab hotel, if you have a few days off in Dubai this attraction is certainly a lot of fun and worth visiting. The cool waters make a wonderful break from the heat particularly once the days start getting up around 46 degrees Celsius. I will be back again on my next visit to Dubai.
Fun location to go with kids.. The original crazy water park of Dubai. Fun, with great slides and relaxation areas. Great to go with kids.

This place Rocksssssss. Amazing crowd, mind blowing rides, weekdays is the best time to visit...bcoz on weekend u may have to wait for long. Tantrum valley, burj sierah , white wadi, surf ride all are just too good and not be missed

Beat The Heat. An excellent water park to unwind your stress and enjoy an outing with your family.You just do not enjoy the thrill water rides but this park also gives you an opportunity to be close to your family and spend value time with your kids from your hectic work time.Highly recommended for all age groups visiting the park.We enjoyed the surfing, Jumeirah Sceirah, Tantrum valley,the Burj Surj, Master blaster, wipe out, the kids just loved this park and did not want to leave until closing time.Shall definitely return back for more....

Must visit while in Dubai. We stayed at Jumeirah Beach Hotel, and while we were there we visited this magnificent water park. The staff there are very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. The park has many attractions for adults and kids and we spent the whole morning and afternoon there. We enjoyed it very much and my 5 years old daughter loved it. Everything there is ordered and organized. The park is clean and the prices are reasonable. There are several shops that you can buy from if you have forgotten your swimsuit. Prices are acceptable. This is not a park only but some attraction are considered as sport just like surfing if you want to learn surfing. We loved there and will definitely go back again.
Brilliant . Absolutely love Wild wadi. The rides are fantastic the Jumeirah Sceriah is brilliant nothing what you expect it is going to be. The staff were fantastic and friendly.

A decent day out - a compact water park but with some pretty good rides. Watch out for the add-on costs!. At 275dhs each (over £50) this is not a cheap attraction, but we used an Entertainer voucher and got one admission free, so that made it better value. Easy to get to by car, and with a free car park on site. The bad bits: We arrived just after opening at 10am, and even then there were long queues to get in (45 mins) so we were lucky it was a cooler day, or that would have been VERY uncomfortable. Food and drink are fairly pricey inside the park, and your bags are searched on entry, (any food and drinks are confiscated), but you can bring in 1ltr of water per person, so I'd advise doing this. Watch out for the locker scam! Lockers have to be paid for, and the smallest, at 40dhs is TINY - hardly big enough for our 2 handbags and a spare towel. A large locker will cost you 70dhs - about £14 - and is still not that big - a family of four may still need 2. Definitely BRING YOUR OWN TOWELS! Towel rental is 40dhs each, and it all adds up. The good bits: On the good side, the park is very attractive, with great views from the taller rides, and with plenty of sitting areas and loungers where you can leave your towels etc. There are free life vests for kids and less confident swimmers so everyone can enjoy the attractions.Although there aren't many rides, those that are there are are pretty good. Forget the Lazy River unless you just want to use it to get used to the water - it's a bit dull and incredibly slow-flowing and when you go under the waterfall, it traps you there! The wave pool is great, but got very crowded even on the quiet weekday when we visited, and I can imagine it's not so pleasant at busier times. Tantrum Alley is fantastic - really exciting and one where you're definitely hanging on for dear life! Burj Surj is great too, but a little bit more gentle. The maximum wait time was 30 minutes for both, so no problem getting a few repeat rides! The info board for Tantrum Alley said parts of the ride would be enclosed and in darkness, but it wasn't in darkness at all.  The Master Blaster, where jets of water carry you uphill in your inflatable ring, is another must-do, and again the queue was never too long - max 30 mins at the busiest time of day. This slide has a stage called Tunnel of Doom, which is in complete darkness, but there's an alternative route for anyone who might not like this - watch out though, because the attendants automatically send you down the Tunnel of Doom if you don't say anything! The end part of this ride is pretty dull - just a very slow, congested 'lazy river' part. I'd advise hopping out at the first set of steps. There are 2 surfing/body boarding attractions, both with quite long queues, but worth the wait just to experience something like this. Be prepared for the entire queue to enjoy all your falls and mistakes though! :) The only annoyance was a few idiots with their own boards, showing off, splashing any females in the queue and hogging the ride for far too long. The instructors need to be stricter with these guys.All in all, good fun, and plenty to keep us busy for the whole day despite the small scale of the park. Without complimentary hotel admission or a discount voucher, it could be a bit costly, but a still worth a visit, especially on a weekday to avoid the crowds.

Average water park. If you have been to the water parks at Disney you will be disappointed. The rides are ok-not very many of them. This is our second visit but only because it was free due to staying at a Jumeirah hotel. It's certainly not worth the entrance money. Seemed to be quite a lot of seating-we arrived at opening time but was very busy by the time we left at 1pm.I got separated from my son on the lazy river. Luckily he had the sense to get out and ask for help. It took 3 different members of staff before he found someone who actually helped him. At the same time I asked two lifeguards neither who spoke English and the third one told me "he would turn up soon". I didn't feel that their procedure for lost children was very effective.
nice place. best place for water park we enjoyed in alll the rides, no much options for food only fast food is available

Great day for kids, not for vegetarians!. My kids had a great day and the rides were excellent for all the family. It was all good until we tried to take lunch. After walking and queuing at every outlet, it became plain that vegetarian food was not on the menu. I lunched on French fries, my friend eventually found an overpriced margarita pizza. Spoiled an otherwise great day.

Day out at the water park. Great day out and complimentary as part of our hotel stay at Jumeirah Zabeel Saray. Therefore, great value for money!!!Rides not to busy, plenty of life guards in view at all times. Plenty of sun loungers and areas to sit at. Rides were excellent and all were great to go on again and again.A must visit whilst in Dubai.

This place is crazy. Going up hill driven by water, turned upside down and sent down long black hole tunnels, this place is fantastic. There is something for everyone and age. even if you do not like water its fun just being there, all of the rides are well supervised and there are plenty of life guards on hand so children are save at all times. If you are staying at the Jumeirah Beach hotel you can gain access to the park 1 hour before the public, and this means you miss the crowds and have a better chance of getting you best seats for the day, there are plenty of shops selling food gifts and clothing, there are always lots of life vest for you to use for children and adults. This place is a must.
Excellent day out. . We had a great fun at this water park. Plenty of hints to do and keep everyone occupied for the whole day. Rides are good and cater for everyone.
Excellent. Excellent. Buy vouchers off eBay for BOGOF deals. It will save you lots of money especially for families.

Great waterpark fore the whole family. Loot of fun fore the whole family. The water in the pool was warm and the park was really clean and safe. Loot of slides to choose between. Our kids loved the park. They are 6 and 8 years old.

A great way to cool off in the sun. Lots of fun rides at different adrenalin levels to suit all ages. Clean facilities and friendly staff. An expensive day out once you have bought food etc but great fun. Lots of su loungers around the various pools for people to enjoy themselves without going on the rides.

Best water park for lazy people. I have been to this wild wadi water park about 5 times in total as the best thing in this park is u don't need to take soo many stairs to take a ride you just take a tube sit n relax n start your journey from lazy river n than just enjoy continuous riding as much as u want no need to line up again n again but this system to take tubes upside is only in 3 rides not in all rides but well worth. Thanks

:-). What a place ! You just have to visit ! Adults and children alike will love this place . There is so much to do for all ages . It's such a big place that even when it's busy there's no queues . You'll definitely need to visit here at least twice to fully appreciate all it has to offer .
great area. it is just acros the burj arab hotel and jumeirah beach hotel very nice views besides being a water park

Great for couples or families. If your wanting that little bit more from your trip or visit to Dubai then this place certainly is worth a visit be warned it can get busy and it's a good idea to take plenty of sun cream as it can get very hot mid afternoon and if your in the water you will burn if you don't cover up
Excellent day iut. Fun family day out. Very clean, lots to do and very friendly staff. Rides for everyone and very organised. Snacks very overpriced though.

Great splash fun in the sun!. We were fortunate to have free passes included in with our hotel package, otherwise it is an expensive day out for a full family, but the park itself is a good size - upon arrival it took us time to find some free sun loungers but keep going through the park and there are places towards the back with plenty available both in the sun and the shade so don't give up too soon! There are quite a few rides where you get in inflatables which are good fun - can ride the creek or take on the white water Rapids - for the more adventurous there is the Jumeirah Scream where you stand upright in a pod and countdown 3-2-1 before you're released down the shoot - over quickly but good fun! All in all a good way to spend a few hours on a hot day. Also throughout the park you get great views of the Burj Al Arab and the beach which looks fantastic.

A fun day. Not as good as Aquaventure, but still worth a visit if you have lots of time.They have fewer rides than Aquaventure, but good views of the Burj Al Arab, and it's within the city limits, so easier to access. The rides are good as well, but if it's a choice between Wild Wadi and Aquaventure, I'll go for the latter.
Jumeirah Sceirah. You need to try the Sceirah when you are in the Wild Wadi Water Park! We spent a nice day there. Can recommend it.
Good fun. It was really nice. Visited in the afternoon, so longer queues. Certainly a must do, especially the Jumeirah Sceirah.

A good place for all the family.. Spent a whole day there and enjoyed every minute. Nice and clean and must say it's very safe especially for kids as there are plenty of lifeguards. The rides are also very safe and plenty of places were to eat. Please try and go early as the queues start to built up after 10.00 hrs. We will definitely go again.
Excellent variety and something for everyone. The waterpark is of a decent size and has something for everyone. Rides are graded in terms of intensity. Recommended attraction.

Nice visit, but timing is essential for a good visit. This place is good fun with a wide clientele ranging from locals to tourists and local expatriates.The rides are fun and would certainly recommend the Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj. The Jumeirah Scerah is good for those with an adventurous frame of mind.The trick is to arrive just after opening at 10.00 a.m. in order to have minimal queues at the rides. Leave it any later and the number of people coming in increases, especially after lunch. Then the queues get longer, sometimes to as much as 30 minutes for each ride.The food available is decent and a bit pricey. Certainly not 5 star, but does the job to stave off the hunger pangs.

Great fun. Spent a full day here, not many rides but still enjoyed. Arrived at opening time, no queues on any rides for a good couple of hours, got very busy as the day went on. Can't take any food in which is a pain, as the food there is pricey and not great!

fun. a bit outdated but still fun very safe for young children has wheel chair routes plenty of lifegardsif you purchase a magazine called the entertainer you can use the voucher for many restaurants and facilities which entitles you to buy 1 get 1 free all over dubaiit costs about 400 drms but well worth it, and it lasts for the year, it drops in price as the season progresses
average. Small choice of playvery expensive food and drinks.next time I'll try atlantis aquaventures.won't come back again...

Half day fun at Wild-Wadi Water Park. Wild Wadi forms part of the Jumeirah beach hotel which is right next door to the Burj al Arab. Since I was staying at Jumeirah Emirate Towers I had a free access to Wild Wadi. If you are staying at any of Jumeirah Group hotels you can show them your room keycard lock and room number to get into the park. If you want locker you should pay 40 dirhams for small locker. This is not the biggest water park in the world! however you can have a great time for 2-3 hours. I suggest you to be there as early as 10AM(opening time), because as time goes by it will be more crowded.You can find good rides at the park. Jumeirah Sceriah is really fun and scary, you must cross your arms and legs as the doors of the capsules close, and then ready for free fall.I general it is a nice medium-size water park, with good atmosphere, nice view of Burj al Arab, and nice stuff. It is a really good place for 2 to 3 hours stay.

Wild Wadi Experience. It was a birthday treat from our friend to Wild Wadi Waterpark in Dubai. At first I was hesitant to go because I thought i will not enjoy it anyway. I am afraid to take water rides specially the ups and downs of the rides. But when I tried it with friends, I found it so exciting. I enjoyed it a lot and especially the hydromassage.The place is so recommendable. It's clean and facilities are complete.I am planning to visit Wild Wadi again with my family and friends.

Waterslides that shoot you up!!!!. Its not a massive water park but boy is it fun. I have never been on a water slide that shoots you up but this does and it keeps going and going and going also you get some great views of the bURJ UP THERE. tHE RIDES ARE REALLY GOOD FUN AND ALL STAFF ARE VERY HELPFUL. food and drink are very expensive and they only let you take in bottles of water (if you have fizzy pop they will remove it and put it in a fried for you as you exit which i lovely as in England this would never happen) Again all the slides and rides are super fun and they ave a great slide and pool area for little kids !!!!

enjoying. it's a good place to spend a day with the kids....designed so beautiful but not many rides!ticket is 275 dirham for a full day(all the rides)so many chairs and lockers are provided aroundbut renting a small locker cost about 40 dirhams..big money for a small locker !!no metro station is around this place...the nearest metro station is emirates metro station...from there to wild wadi taxi cost about 25 dirhamssome photographer are around but each picture cost 100 dirham and more...don't forget to take towels and sleepers cus everything costs you a big moneythe food was yummy there...

great time. We had free access to this park through the Jumeira Beach Hotel. The kids had an amazing time, and actually so did I. Next time I would think about establishing meeting points as many of the rides land up on different places. I would also load enough on the older children's wrist bands for water and drinks if they do get separated.

What can I say!?. This place is absolutely fantastic, te reviews and score reflect that. It can get extremely busy on Fridays Saturday's and public holidays but it's a great day outFood however is pretty bad as normal in theme parks
Great place for young kids . Little park but it's enough for my 4.5yrs son to spend 5hrs at the wave pool and kids area. Great view to Bruj Al Arab and it doesn't take long to Q for each slides.

Can Be Better. Nice Location,Nice view of Borj Alarab,Great Stuff,Warm water.But a little expensive ticket and food.and its a small water park,i must go to yaswater world to find out witch one is better.

Queued and queued, but it grew on me! . We queued to get in, queued to change ( a sign insisted you had to change in a cubicle, but there were few of them in the women's changing room). We walked round for 20 minutes trying to find a single lounger that wasn't already reserved with a towel. Found one eventually so the non-swimmer in our group could sit down (At the end of the day it seemed lots of "reserved" loungers had just been abandoned with hire towels left on them - if I went again, I'd just chance it and take a lounger which had just a hire towel on it, when I needed it). We queued for half an hour to go on the Wadi blaster. The ride was great fun and lasted ages, so the queue seemed more worthwhile. Queued again to go on surfing ride, but we were queue-jumped and it was all talking ages, so we abandoned that one. This was only a Tuesday, so goodness only knows what it's like on a Friday or Saturday. Then we started to get the hang of it & notice that some great rides had short queues, and it all improved. We had a great time. The lifeguards who help you on the rides are generally really friendly and great with the kids. We stayed until it closed at 7pm and the views from rides were great, lights atmospheric, and queues much reduced in late afternoon. The water park was well done, clean, well-maintained, brilliantly staffed, and nicely planted. Changing rooms were poor in comparison.Tips:1. Use the Entertainer Dubai 2016 scheme for BOGOF entry for people over 1.1m tall. The cheaper Entertainer Kids voucher is only for smaller kids. 2. Take your own drinks! 3. Stay late to enjoy atmospheric lighting and smaller queues. 4. Don't bank on buying extra swimwear there - the prices are scarey. 5. It was difficult to gauge how scarey each ride was from the signs, so ask lifeguards for advice.

Not bad. Good waterpark but not as good as I hoped or thought.Very well run park and enjoyable but limited slides and attractions.Lovely area and worth a visit but not to have your hopes too high..2 or 3 very enjoyable attractions and good to visit when weather is great!!

Good for spending a day with family. It's not so big and not so many options but good staff positive atmosphere inside different nationalities in one place and good enough to entertain my baby and make my wife happy
I recommend this water park

Can be crowded, but some great rides. I spent an afternoon here with my teenage son. The park is small by the standard of some USA water parks, but it's well run, with plenty of lounge space. There are about 16 or 17 different rides, but only 4 or 5 that would interest the older kids. On the day we were there (Thursday) it was quite full, and waiting times on the big rides were between 15 and 35 minutes. There was a good selection of food and beverage outlets, but I would suggest only getting a medium locker unless you have something very big to store.

Good Rides. It is a wonderful water park with attractive rides. One has to be mindful of dress code and do not wear pants and shorts with iron zippers. A proper swimming trunk would be better. All the rides are great, we enjoyed the lazy river thoroughly. There are rides for all age groups.
