extortion. It's overpriced! They let everyone in, queues are ilso long that you wait 45 min for a ride! Ride are difficult to find As signs are useless! They charge for lockers and it's extortionate and so is the food pricing...3 rides in 5 hours! Don't go! Sit on the beach! Absolute extortion! Not worth it at half the price!

Old, cramped and tired. The complex is very cramped and in need of an overhaul. Whereas it may once have been good, it is far behind watermarks elsewhere including in nearby Abu Dhabi. The queue system is poorly managed and there are only four particularly "special" rides, which is not many. the other "rides" being the children's play pool, the wave pool and the lazy river for example. Odly the highly priced food and beverages were somehow chaotic. We had to wait 30mins for one pizza having paid for it. Thirty minutes of hanging around, being reassured it was coming. Other facilities had run out of everything except "strawberry ice cream."The overall experience was thus of a small, but long queuing, old fashioned and expensive water park. Our children all said it was a disappointment and they are normally easily pleased. No doubt this park's days are numbered without a major overhaul.

Nice little park.. We spent a day here. There weren't as many rides as Atlantis, but there is more than enough to keep kids entertained for the day. Beach access is only available with a VIP package, which was 2500 AED for a family of four. We didn't bother with the VIP package, but the beach access did look like fun.

Spread out, Excellent wave ppol, Great view of the Burj al Arab. Every year Wild Wadi runs a Ramadan special where you can enter by donating 3 items of clothing - Yes, it's the month of giving. I availed this offer and had great fun. Water games for the young and old and great buzz. Coz of the free entry there were a lot of people, but on a not-so-crowded day it's a happy place to hangout. They need to improve parking facilities though.
Nice water park. Nice water park with fine rides for small and big ones .An activity for the whole day for a familly .Nice beach near to the park
Amazing. couple of friends .... with crazy water games ... sunny daythe place is amazing and the experience will not be the last.we enjoyed our time with good & organized staff.
Poor visit . Bought one of the waterproof phone cases. For 120 AED. Wasn't even allowed to take it on any of the rides. Was very disappointed!!!!!

Loved it.. We went there as a family and absolutely enjoyed our time. A lot of rides for both the adults and kids but the only drawback is that it's all jumbled up. The access to various slides are so complex that it can confuse you.
Fantastic for Once. if you didn't attend there, I suggest you visit here first then go to Aqua-venture Water-park. in my opinion which tried both, Wild Wadi is better with a reasonable price

Great Fun for all the family!. Its a water park for lazy people but I love it! The best part is you dont have to queue for all the rides, get onto the river on your donut and whizz around the river surrounding the park and try all the rides. A really well constructed park.

Compact but Great Rides. The rides at Wadi are unusual in that on most of them you are going up as well as down. They are more like a roller coaster than the usual water slides. The rides are also combined so you go on two or three rides that are linked by pool stages between each one. Food & drink is very expensive

Amazing. The Wild Wadi was great fun.some of the slides went up instead of down ! Hardly any lines and you were always in the water - this is what a water park should truly be!The staff were fantastic and created such a good atmosphere!The toilets changing rooms were continually being cleaned.If you are a guest you have free use of the water park all day.

fun!. We had a lot of fun there! We used entertainer coupons to get one ticket for free. Still it costed a lot (You have to pay for the lockers and the food is pretty expensive) but we enjoyed it. Great view over Burj Al Arab

A great time for the family. Thoroughly enjoyable water park and even though it is quire old it is still in fantastic condition. The kids (7&11) loved it and did not want to leave.The friendliness of the staff was outstanding, life guards guides, cleaners all could not do enough for us.As part of our hotel package we had access an hour before the main opening and this was great value.
Amazing. Full of enjoyment.very clean and good staff. Rides are very good. They have locker system but I think it should be free. We spend 5 hours and great enjoyment .

Great time for the entire family!. The water park is great fun for the entire family. Make sure you have water socks as the pavement gets very hot. Only bad thing was in the kids pool area there was a poop floating but was quickly cleaned

Good park, but little space and little thrill. The waterpark has a number of slides, but missing the really exiting ones. We went early on a weekday, which was probably a good idea. Its very easy to imagine the place getting very crowded during the weekends.The parks gives a discount for local residents, and you can also get one extra person for free with the entertainer app.Not a must do if you are visiting Dubai for a short period of time.

I worked on the build of this Park. Fantastic engineering on the site of the old Chicago Beach Hotel, it is a must to visit when in Dubai the kids and adults alike will love it 15 yrs old now and still in good shape

Good Experience. Good water park with lot of thrilling & fun rides.
Highly recommended for Kids.. Must try Jumeirah Sceirah ride (Warning - it may take your breath away.., Only for "braveheart" adults)
Fun friendly park with great staff. A great mid sized park with a variety of rides. Excellent lifeguards. No queues on a Saturday morning.

Small and gets over crowded quickly. I don't know if im biased because we went in June and it was extremely hot that day, but I think the overall experience was not good.Overall I'm not satisfied with this waterpark at all, it is way to small for my taste and the rides are ok. Yes the view is stunning, with a direct view to the Burj Al Arab, but thats about it.Would not re-visit, but if you don't mind a small area for having fun, go ahead and see for yourself.

Fun days. I am a resident in the UAE and I enjoy taking my guests to Wild Wadi.It is a nice park. There are a couple of rides with a thrill but not that much (3 in total).The other slides are quite repetitive, always using a big buoy (on which you can be one or two persons).If you are looking for something to do during a hot day or if you have kids, it is perfect place to be.

Great water park with lot of fun rides. This isn't the biggest water park in Dubai, that would be in Atlantis. However this one is new and has the latest and really fun rides. You can spend day their with family and chill. You can learn to surf a little. One ride with free fall is amazing and view is great. There is also a huge ride where you pretty much get entire park in summary and great views of Burj al Arab from all the angles.

Nice cool down, lots of activity, enough shade. The Wild Wadi water park makes for a day of fun and enjoyment. It doesn't matter wether you're with small children or bigger kids. There is enough variety in the attractions. My favourite was the water slide that shoots you up. That saves a lot of climbing. The water Could be cleaner though and there usually are lines. Some attractions seem to be in need for serious maintenance (the vertical drop for example).
Visited twice in 5 days. excellant. great safe place for children and adults. Many slides and no long Q.Towels available and many lifeguards and well managed.

Fun way to cool off from the very hot sun!. We went to the Wild Wadi Water Park as it was part of our hotel - Jumeirah Beach. We had lots of fun on all the different water rides and slides that this part has to offer. The wave pool is good and we really enjoyed the lazy river, although I can imagine during peak times that it must get very busy as the park is not huge. Definitely worth a visit if you are staying at the hotel, if you aren't staying at Jumeirah I would recommend Atlantis Water Park above this one.

Really great water park!. We choosed this because my boy is only 115cm long and could not get to the Aquaventure water park. But the Wild Wadi sure was a great water park! Kids loved it and the whole day went by really fast.

Nice, crowded. My advice ..wear your bathing sport soot- not a bakini or monakini and wear it at home,( changing room are freezing= you'll end up with cold/flue/fever) and cover it up with a simple dress and a simple long sleeve swimming shirt don't take to much stuff, lockers a tuna can..you'll end up caring everything from a game to another,,plus the ticket price is okay..and the food there is fine too..
Great fun.. We had a terrific day and would definitely go back, you can not take any food or drink in with you however, it is given back to you when you leave.

Experience to remember . Wild wadi was an inclusion in our hotel accommodation stay at the Jumeirah Beach hotel. It is one place that everyone should visit especially with children.Lot of activities and the pools are incredible. I simply loved it and recommend to all.

top water park. the water park is very well done, you have different equipment for children, baby, and family. you can eat there and have a rest also in long chair.you can even surfing if interested and make some shopping in Wild wadi souk.the bad points is the price about 250 AED ( 70 EUR) per personn

Used to be better. Have been there sometime back, 1 day before going to Aquaventure, and so I am able to make a direct comparison. At its launch and the few years after it the park was amazing, but now with the other park open, the rides seemed degraded, the empty tubes are scattered around in the rides, and lazy river without being removed, and generally the service there was not as it used to be before. I think its about time to get a renovation.

Good fun...enjoyed being a big kid.. We enjoyed our day here which was good fun. The only thing I would like to point out is the photos at the end are expensive 150AED/£30GBP for 8 photos...this is a great idea for having memories but not very family friendly due to the cost. The rides were good however there were not a lot of adult rides and mainly aimed at children. Also be aware that there is a charge for the lockers on arrival .

Happy Young Once!. Wild Wadi Water Park is for children, adult, old and the like. A place where fun and exciting adventures starts right here. My friends love the place so much with a variety of activities that makes you feel like you are in the middle of cosmopolitan area. Love it!

Water was ice cold and staff really unfriendly. We expected a lot when we entered Wild Wadi, but we got straight disappointed, when we entered with no clear instructions and were on our own to find a place for the whole family. We had to run through the whole park to find some available chairs. The kids water play was really cold, but most shockingly were so rude and even screaming staff. Wild Wadi is the only Water park, where you are not allowed to slide with your child, which makes it impossible to use any slide for kids below three years of age. There is only one water pool available. The floating river was so cold, that we existed after only five minutes, because the kids were shivering. For an entry price of AED 275 I would expect much more than that, the most thing bothering was the rude staff.
Wild Wadi . Great family day out , it's bit expensive with big family but it's worth it. There were no waiting for the attractions and staff is really nice and helpful.
Excellent. Very nice for children and adult with complete facilities....and taking care for every small point...All will like the place

4 adult rides, mainly aimed for children.. I visited the wild wadi water park this week, as it was my first ever trip to a water park. I paid 300 aed, the equivelant of £60 gbp for a day pass and a locker (lockers should be free in my opinion) .got inside and headed for the first ride. All rides are poorly sign posted, but once you find them they're very good. My particular favourites were the tantrum alley and burj surj, both fast multi person adrenaline rides which go round many twists and turns. Another favoirite was the wadi master blaster. Single or double ring ride, which takes you on rapid accelarstion through tubes and dark tunnels. Very good

Fun time at the Wild Wadi Water park. Just had to try this you are never to old for this.Spent a few happy hours here some quiet and tranquil another a little more hair-raising but all added to the fun!! Have a go!!
Great fun. Gret for children and adults. Friendly staff. Life guards every where, so even if cant swim it will be a great experience
So much fun. Had so much fin here with my friends. Cant hardly wait to come back. Staff are friendly and so engaging....

A Great Day. Visited this waterpark for a full day, Booked directly on there internet as they offered 2 people + dinner for 276 Dirham. I always find it a bit annoying once you get in then you have to pay for lockers etc but you have to on top of the price just paid. The park itself was so clean and tidy, easy to get around and great rides fun for everybody. You can also get a good view of the Burj Al Arab too which is an added bonus. Overall i would definetley go back here, and recommend it more than the Atlantis, we went there on day and to be fair didn't look that different and its double the cost and extras.
Great place . Great place for families and singles For fun , joy ,and water games . my kids love it so much . I hope later they will add more games.
Wild wadi. Best waterpark in Dubai, the rides are fun, plenty of sun-loungers and shade and of course the best lifeguards in Dubai

Great day out with rides for everyone. Wild Wadi is more compact than the other water parks in Dubai and Abu Dhabi, but I love the lush vegetation throughout. It's very well maintained, staff are excellent, very friendly and well trained. Good food selection showing that fast food can be good quality - meat is grilled directly, fresh watermelon also available. Rides range from the tranquil Lazy River to the nerve racking tornado. We found the selection of merchandise very small.
Wadi water pack. i moved from one section to another through the park. bought some itemes. saw old war weapons. very memorable experience.
Great water park. Amazing rides, however i feel they need some upgrades. But very clean and the staff are great. Its a family fun pack place to spend a day out chilling.

you have to be there if you go to dubai. the place is 4 start, stuff are really friendly, it's a European company which take care of that, fast foods are good, plenty of different thinks are available, water jet board was awesome, view is crazy , you have got Borj al Arab on south it's like you standing next to private beach of that hotel. but if there was a bear that would be heeeellll awesome :D by the way price is little a bit high but worst it ... may-2010 visited
Great water park...fun also for young kids. I've been there many times with my family (2 kids) and we always enjoyed ...safe and fun!! Good service as well

Very bad experience...AVOID IT NO MATTER WHAT.... Average park, nothing special, waited about 1 hour for a legal taxi and not limo ones..very bad transportation..limo drivers trying to pick up costumers and overcharge them 2 and 3 times higher than a proper meter based taxi..be aware if you go there you will wait at least 1 hour in the queue for a taxi..AVOID IT NO MATTER WHAT..IT IS A TRAP.

Amazing - Great Day & best value for money!!. This is the best entertainment park we have ever been to. The kids just would not come out and only came out after a commitment of re-visit. Will never miss visiting this place in our trips to Dubai. Tantrum Alley was the best.

Great and free for Jumeirah guests. Great waterpark with astonishing views over Burj Al Arab. We got free passes with our Jumeirah creekside booking. If you dont get those, the price is ridiculously high according to European standards. 65€ approx... Also food and drinks are expensive

A superb waterpark and a bit different to Atlantis. Although Atlantis is my favourite water park due to the lazy river, this one is also excellent. it has loads of rubber ring and dinghy slides where you start at the bottom and water fires you up the tubes. It also has a wave simulator for surfing!

Okay. The assistants didn't allow us to take our own water bottles inside as they wanted us to buy it from them. There was a lot of dirt in the water and in the kids area. The rides, however, were fantastic! They were very fun to go on.

Geat time for sunny days!. I had an amazing day at wild wadi water park, i stayed at the burj al arab and i had free entrance to this attraction. The slides are amazing, and it's perfect when it's hot outside
Cool place. Brilliant some great rides, quite exciting worth a visit. Very well designed water park not over crowded at all. Loved the water shoots and the wave machine.

fun day out. Cool waterpark with features/water slides for every age. There are always discount codes so have a look on the Wild Wadi website when booking as it'll cut entrance fees. V helpful staff too
great fun. wild wadi water park is a great day out, there is something for everyone whether it be the water slides, lazing around the pool or floating along the lazy river. Its a must!
Fun with the Kids. we stayed at Mina Salam hotel and had free access and with two boys aged 5 and 8 it was great just to pop into for a few hours each day- well worth a visit

Perfect park for the whole family. We had a fantastic time with our 6 year old. The park is very clean, friendly and helpful staff everywhere. You do not need to carry your tube like in Atlantis. When we visited park was nearly empty and no waiting time for the fun rides. A must do!

Brilliant for those staying at madinat. It's free to enter if you are staying at a jumeirah hotel locally - just a 40dirham charge for a locker. Towels are provided so you just need to take yourself! You get a little red band which is a locker key and can be loaded with cash to spend on food and drinks whilst you are there. Ladies go in a swimming costume that holds everything in... The power of the water flumes dislodges your attire so best to play safe. I'd also recommend a uv shirt. It's a really safe and clean environment. If you want to swim in the big wave pool don't be embarrassed to put on a life jacket. I can swim but used one to bob about in the big waves which was great fun. Go early on in the morning when it's a bit quieter. You can walk about in bare feet so suggest you put flip flops in your locker - some people abandon them by the 'ride' but you then have to walk back for your flip flops which seems crazy. In hot months then Aqua shoes would be a good idea as the floor gets hot.
It's the best water park . It's the best water park, the Atlantis is good but nothing beats the wild wadi. Such a fun day out. Aime to get there as early as possible just to miss out on ques.
Great Fun. If your adventurous and love a good water ride, then look no further! Had a great time when we visited and there's plenty to go crazy about. A definite must when in Dubai.

Great experience (esp with kid) if pricey.... Good fun but very busy and crazy expensive! Many of the rides have queues >45 minutes so turn up early. Entrance fee was also very steep - I understand some hotels etc can get better rates.

fun fun fun. a day packed full of water activities some of which are not for the faint hearted but if you are daring then you shall love every moment just as we did. family friendly rides aswell for a full package 750.00 dirhams including food towels a locker and unlimited rides with great views of the Burj Al Arab and other sites of Dubai.

Wow . Can't rave about this enough. Fantastic day out. Busy crowdswith lines to get onto the rides but once your in the loop you have plenty of time before the ride ends. Food was ok, area to relax also.
Wonderful. An amazing water park, a must to visit and have a good time. It accommodate anyone and a nice getaway.

Water park tips. Bring water and towel with yourself even snack if you can. Even for renting a towel they charge you 40 DHM. And small mineral water 12 DHM. It's a big rip off. For having a locker even a small one they charge you 40 DHM. Buy tickets online in advance otherwise it can be very expensive. In this damn city every thing is so expensive. Water park was fun but expensive

Been to all, it's still the best. While there are several water parks in UAE, wild wadi is simply the best..not too big and not too small..attention to details and very very safe..I take my kids in the summer all the time, they love it..the food is not bad, the prices are reasonable..been to the other ones in UAE, I will rank Yas island water park number 2 after this one...you will enjoy your time and excellent customer service

So much fun!. Love this waterpark, think they have really thought it through, from the wrist bands so you don't have to carry any cash/cards, the paths being mainly shaded so you don't burn your feet! Best way to get a ticket I think is via their website we paid 276aed as a couple for tickets into the park and a meal each, which is way cheaper then just buying tickets into the park! It is standard fast food but its exactly what you would expect! would definitely return as its a good day out!
Excited. My very first time of adventure in Waterpark.So cool. Que line was too long and crowded in that time.

A really fun day in the water with a major food disappointment .... It is a great place if you are a family with kids with a big gap difference, because everybody can play and have fun and the place is not huge so you don't spend the day looking for each other. The water slides are nice, though if you are a true thrill seeker you might be a bit disappointed. The major problem is the food. How can you only offer junk food options, when you do not allowed your customer to bring some food in the Park. Basically if you are not staying at the Jumeirah Hotel attached, you'll have to eat the disgusting, greasy, american typical Fast food. And it is honestly the worst quality of that type of food. I mean, junk food might be ok, once in a while ... but this. Yucky ! Not to mention that if you are a vegetarian, as I am, and as are millions of other people you will have to eat a pizza or some french fries. So if you don't mind spending around 1000 dirhams for only one afternoon for a 4 members family, go after lunch.

Good but not great..... Was here for team building...the ambience is good, but the attraction is not much..I was very excited when I arrived here, however I could finish all the attractions within 1 hour...afterwards was so boring..Would not come again....
Spend a day, in the water. This is an amazing place to spend half a day, water is everywhere, lots of activities that suits all ages, pass by and enjoy an amazing time

A fun afternoon out! . We got a good deal on their own website for entrance and lunch for 138 AED each. Lunch was a burger, fries and a soft drink and very good for a water park meal! Some things to note:Towels 40 AED eachSmall lockers 40 AED eachPlenty to do for adults, very clean everywhere, water a nice temperature for end of February. Park was quiet so no queuing was an added bonus!

Great Experience. Went on weekdays with friends and was not disappointing, all attractions from this theme park is really enjoying specially the trip to the cave one. All lifeguards were very friendly too.The park have many restaurant inside which serve very nice yet affordable food selections.It was a great experience
Fun time. It was great experience, lots of fun for friends or family best timing in summer time. For sure I will go to wild wadi again and again. Excellent

Great Fun. 1st time after many years, the new rides are a significant improvement. Wild Wadi is very easy to navigate, rides flow one after another and the new rides are great fun. Overall a great experience, we visited mid week so no major crowds which saves so much time.As residents of Dubai we also visit Atlantis and Yas water parks, whilst smaller Wild Wadi rides are better quality and more organised . Great day of fun with the family
Dont forget the Jumeirah Scairah!!. Exciting place for all ages, fun rides, cool staff and amazing facilities, even though I think it should have been a more larger location overall.
Fantastic. I was there with my family. Child is 3 years. We spend a great time together. Excellent. We had a lot of fun. It's very safe.
Great Experience. One of the greatest memories from our trip to Dubai.You must visit this place if you can.It may be a bit pricey, but it's very beautiful and fun.

A lot of fun to be had. This is a top water park. There is plenty to do with family or just couples and friends. Food is a bit pricey but it is worth spending a whole day there. Try to avoid busy days as it can get overcrowded.

Fantastic day. This is a great place to have lots of FUN , that's if you likd to get wet.Wave surfing and body boarding is great fun, also the water tubes/slides are brilliant.I would go here again and again. 10 out 10We were lucky the park was not swampt with people so getting on the rides was very easy.

the best aquapark in Dubai. all rides are connected and easily reachable from lazy river. just when you come across the ride, go there. some crazy rides are there, but we enjoyed while being scared.the most important there is no waiting for rides. we went there several times and never waited in line. at many places you can find food and drinks. plan all day for wild wadi.

A great day out.. A great waterpark, lots to do to keep the kids entertained. We loved the wave pool in particular. Take your own towels because if you don't you will have to hire them once you are inside.
Exciting place. I enjoyed a lot because of the different exciting rides, friendly staff and yummy food. The ambience is perfect to relax

Great fun. Spent a day here as it was 'complimentary' with our room. We found a secluded seating area and had great fun on most of the rides, but we didn't get to the really scary ones!The park was busy but queues were short and we never felt rushed or hurried. There are lockers provided and facilities are the usual high standards you would expect of Dubai. Lots of catering outlets serving surprisingly edible fayre, not like the rubbish places like this in Europe would serve! Great fun for all ages.

A nice couple of hours. I had high hopes and have been waiting to visit this place formany years.went with my 3 teenagers. Dissapointed as one of the star attractions was closed. They say 10 major rides but most of the rides are for little children. We did the rides once only. The kids didnt want to go back on the rides. The food inside is over priced, and that does restrict people from spending plus not enough choice of foods. We r vegetarian and apart from magic corn did not have much choice. Again overpriced corn. We paid more for it than we pay in the Uk!! Anyway worth a visit once at least

Nice distractions especially for kids. Our 9 and 6 year old really enjoy Wild Wadi. Not too aggressive in terms of activities. We were lucky not to queue. There is something to do for absolutely all age. Careful though forget about bringing your own picnic as you will have to leave your bag behind. ;)

Fun day out, plenty for everyone. We arrive at the waterpark for when the gates opened and got into the park very quickly due to tickets purchased from our hotel (Same price as online). No food is allowed into the park and would be confiscated but you are allowed to take in bottles of water. The park has lockers available but they are quite expensive. You can take cash and put this onto your wristband to pay for anything while you're in the park, anything you don't spend is refunded at the end of the day.Food and drink around the park is fairly expensive but there is a good variety available.The rides are amazing - something for all ages. We also liked the fact they have many lifeguards on duty with good rotation to ensure they stay alert on their position.The park is extremely clean and the toilets are well maintained throughout the day. When we arrived it was very quiet and slowly got busier during the day so would recommend arriving early. There were no queues at the start and the longest we had to wait was around 5 minutes.Great day out for couples or families.

Family favourite water park in Dubai . Wild wadi water park is our family favourite water park in Dubai every time we comes to Dubai we visit this place my boys love this park as its suitable for all ages and it's much better then Atlantes water park it's much more fun and staff is helpful and polite you can enjoy with your family as its got water rides fur adults and kids

Great day out and not busy!. We went to this waterpark whilst visiting Jueirah Madinat so it was free entry. We went on the last Sunday of Feb half term and it was literally empty. No queues at all. The rides are good although not loads of choice. They are not fussy about the kids heights etc, my daughter was clearly under the height but they let her on the rides with us. Would go back.....but not as good as Siam park in tenerife!

Fun for a couple of hours. It is a great place to spend a couple of hours while soaking up some sun and probably more if you have kids. We had free entrance because we stayed in one of the Jumeirah hotels but I honestly don’t think it is worth the money if you would have to pay for your entrance (250 AED?) yourself. The slides are great fun and there were enough sunbeds in various places in the park to take a seat and rest.We a good laugh when I talked my hubby into going and managed to film him on the scary slide where the floor drops away from underneath you.Tip: You get a bracelet when entering which you can top off with money if you like. You can use it to rent a locker and to buy food. Make sure you put enough money on there to avoid having to go back to the entrance for more (refunds are to be done at the souvenir shop afterwards)

Was OK. Was an OK water park, but as standards go, it didn't really keep up with the impression that the rest of Dubai leaves! If you're ever in Spain, I would recommend Siam Park in Tenerife. Wave pool was quite cool though it's small, it is heated though which was nice! There is a lack of rides here though and I didn't think it was worth the £50 per person fee.

Great waterpark. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Dubai. The children really had a fantastic time..suitable for all ages. The entrance is a bit pricey, but this is common for Dubai, also food is not allowed to be taken in..you are expected to buy from inside the park. I would suggest if you do decide to go to wild wadi, get there early and stay for the full day. Enjoyable day.
Linked to Jumeirah Group. Get a free visit if you stay at one of the Jumeirah Group hotels. Smaller park but has enough attractions to keep all the family happy.

Nice, thrilling, but for a few hours only. We visited Wild Wadi Waterpark in the morning, at 10 o clock. It opens at this time. The first hour was very nice, as not many people were there. After 12 it was getting crowded. Spent 2,5 hours there and that was already enough. We checked all the attractions, took nice pictures of Burj Al Arab and that was it. I think that spending there the whole day can be too much, but it's definitelly woth visiting especially when staying in Jumeirah hotels - you get complimentary access. We did that and the only thing you pay for are lockers. Towels and entrance are free.

Family trip. Great fun in the hot sun. We spent about 2.5 hours floating up and down the slides with lots of laughs. Swim suit and a relaxing attitude is all you need. They have lockers for your belongings!

Brilliant family day out. As a family it was our favourite day of the holiday. It is expensive - vouchers from The Entertainer made it better. The mixture of rides and areas was brilliant and there is something for all ages. Waited for 90 mins for a taxi outside even though we left before it closed.
Great day. Certainly worth a visit. We spent two days here and it provided enough to keep all our children (age 8,12 & 14) entertained.
Great day out!. Me and my husband have been here twice now and each time we have done nothing but laugh!! It really brings out the inner child in you. Great day out for the whole family!!

Great day out. Visited in November when the park wasn't too busy. Great day out - not just for kids!
Try booking online in advance for a reduced price. The park is well thought out and clean - great atmosphere.
Fun for all. The whole family ranging from 1,5 years to 82 years had fun. the clark for small children was important for us as well as the slides for the youth.

Better than Aquaventure. Whilst most waterparks have similar features and qualities, the great benefit of Wild Wadi is their waterproof rechargeable wristbands that you can add a cash balance to and spend during the course of the day. You can credit with as much as you need, spend by scanning the wristband at vendor stalls then at the end of the day receive the leftover back in your pocket. At Aquaventure you have to either carry around cash or a bank card all day in the wet or return to the locker areas every time you want to stop for water or food. It is a fun day out at Wild Wadi made infinitely better by the convenience of the wristband technology

Fabulous fun day out for all the family. Wild wadi is a great place for a family day out, it's very clean and in a great location with amazing views of the burj al arab. You need to get there early to secure a seat in a good position and even for people who don't like fast rides the lazy river is very relaxing as is sitting in a sun lounger with your feet in the childrens beach area! I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this place to families of all ages.

Excellent day for the kids. Went with my family...the kids loved it. There is a paucity of the rides for such a big park. There are essentially a few rides which are the same...you sit on an inflatable ride and either you can go for a long ride or its shorter versions...two other rides are slightly different. But we did not go for ourselves...we went for the kids and they loved it. They loved the children's area and they loved the pool with waves coming in on regular basis. The bathrooms were clean and we went in early so entry was fairly quick as well.

Fun for the fsmily. Our six year old son loved this place. He is just under 1.2 m so would not have been able to enjoy all the amenities of the water park at the Atlantis. Gets quite crowded and hard to find a spot to base yourselves unless you get there quite early. We really enjoyed it though.

Place to be lots of fun. Loved this place but did have 1 hick up, no matter what you do, do not lost your watch entry ticket for the locker... l lost mine and told the security who told me that l have once chance of opening my locking if l get it wrong l would have to wait for the park to close we finished by 2 pm and would have to wait 4 hours, so when back to the locker room with security and I knew roughly where my locker was but got it wrong it was the one next to it security told me that as l got it wrong I would have to wait 4 hours after 40 mins of back and forth pleading etc l spoke to head of security and told me that l got it wrong was unfair to make me wait 4 hours after long discussion he agreed and told me if you get it wrong again then l will have to wait lucky got it right and was away. Apart from that the park was extremely good but also was out of the way quite abit so you need to get a taxi there and back to your hotel and the entry wasn't cheap something like £45 pp then lockers charge food + taxi your looking at £150 for 2 ppl which l do personal think is extortionate for a swimming day out. Oh yes as we didn't take a camera they do photos at £20 a pop yes that's right 1 photo for £20...lol if you got kids defi wouldn't come here probably get bankrupt probably wouldn't be going back but atleast I can say l been ...lol

Brilliant fun. Stayed at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel and had free access to this. Also went to the one at Atlantis and preferred this one as it was "more compact". Good fun, with something for all ages. You can put credit on a wrist band, rent a locker and therefore have the ability to purchase food and drink without having to keep going back to your locker - if you don't use the credit that you put on your wristband then you just claim it back on your way out.

Kids loved it!. Took my two teenage kids who absolutely loved it. Price is the same whether you want to go on the rides or just sit in the cafe which was a bit annoying but most importantly the kids had a blast and couldn't get enough.
Always a great experience!. Wild Wadi is a brilliant waterpark to go to. There are rides available for all levels of thrill- seekers, and lots of lazy rivers/ sunbathing spots if you want to relax!

Great fun!. I visited here with my friend who lives in Dubai; she had a two for one offer with the Entertainer.February is a great time to visit as it's not too busy. We had fun on the incredible slides - being up high, face to face with the Burj Al Arab, was not something I was expecting to do during my visit to Dubai. However, it was such great fun. All your valuables can be stored in a locker (which you have to pay for), whilst you have fun around the park. Grab yourself a sun lounger and use it as your base for the day. The cashless system, with everything being loaded onto a waterproof band, is perfect.Great fun.

Wild Wadi Water Park. Water parks are usually great, and the ones in Dubai are also very nice. Nicely maintained, and fun, and not so crowded. But they are a bit expensive, as is everything in Dubai, so if you are there, then it does not really matter. Just go enjoy.

Great for kids. We went once Kids enjoyed it, we got on free because we were staying at the Jumeirah Beach, perfect place on a hot day, the pools are well supervised by lifeguards, it's got lots to do for kids from all ages.

A great day out!. Visited for the day on a weekend as a family of two adults and two children of 9 and 16. We booked our entry tickets on the day through our hotel concierge and got a small discount off the cost. We arrived just after opening time and there were no queues to get in. We didn't take any food with us just drinking water. Your bags are searched by security on the way in. Once in the park you collect wrist bands which you add credit to enabling you to make purchases in the park instead of carrying cash around. They also lock and unlock your lockers. Any credit left over at the end of the day is paid back to you when you hand back the wrist bands. There is plenty to do with a good choice of slides and splash zones. There is also the lazy river for those who aren't keen on the more strenuous activities. We found there was plenty of sun chairs, umbrellas and loungers located around the park. Based on other reviews we had the pizzas for lunch and they were very good. The staff were very helpful and friendly and there appeared to be high ratio of lifeguards to guests. There was always a resident photographer around and for each photo they took you received a wristband so you could review them at a photo station and buy them if you wanted. For the day out after factoring in tickets, food, drinks, locker rental etc it cost us around 1200 AED. Overall we had a great day out and would recommend it.

Great for groups. Good day out, have not been for a few years and not much has changed. Enjoyable for sure and water mildly warm for the time of year so no real issue there. The lazy river use to be much stronger current so not sure what happened with that.

Top day out. . Amazing day out. Kids really enjoyed the rides. The staff (all - lifeguards, food service, cleaners....) were really amazing and friendly. That for me is a great example of an organisation. Kids came home happy but very tired!!!!! As did mum and dad! Recommended.
Adventure exprience. We went there in February , the temperature is ok until 5 pm. You will have nice moment there. I advise to plan to gp there

WWWP - Great time of year to visit, the floor is not too hot to stand on and the queues are small!. The Wild Wadi Water Park is always a great day out. At this time of year the queues for rides are very small, if indeed there are any queues at all! There are plenty of inflatable rings to use on the rides and the Lazy River is not totally clogged up with discarded inflatables so that you can't move. The other guests seemed very relaxed and the majority were from the Madinat Jumeriah hotels (you can tell by the wristband). In the summer there are lots of locals, in particular large groups of men who seem to thunder through the park regardless of the other visitors. If you are in Dubai, I would thoroughly recommend a visit!
Ace. Ace loved it had a super day we bought the meal deal and had thePizza it was a good size and the kids had waffles later in the day, there is plenty toKeep the whole family entertained

Best water park in the U.A.E . It has taken us many years to finally visit this park and I can confidently say it is now our favourite water park in the U.A.E and here are the reasons:Kids who are taller than 1.1m can go to most all rides unlike the other parks around which require 1.2 (and above) and in this household it made a positive difference to our experience.The rides are fun for all ages. Unlike other parks you do not have to climb a huge flight of stairs carrying your own donut (inflatable device) to take part of the ride, the conveyor belt does the job for you. It actually felt as if the journey to the rides weren’t as steep as in other parks visited and you can actually ride on the “Master Blaster” all the way to the top to go to the Jumeirah Sceirah taking a short cut.The park is well maintained, clean and the only slippery area found was the wooden bridge and the rides aren’t scattered around either.The staff was very friendly and professional from the supervisors to the cleaning smiling staff all over the park they all shown excellent customer services. (Food outlet excluded, see below)The location is not out of the way, easy to get to and ample free parking which is not far from the entrance either.Beautiful views throughout the park with the awesome Burj Al Arab right there with plenty of photos opportunities. There are photographers everywhere too ready to take million photos of you, just remember to check yours prior to giving your bracelet back.There is an area for younger kids, which was popular however lacked a sitting area for the parents to stay out of the way but still watch their youngsters.As most places, you aren’t allowed to carry in food or drinks with you and unfortunately the weak point in the park is the food.The ‘fast’ food (burgers and chips) has taken 29 minutes which we waited standing by the window because they had run out of numbers. We were not alone, there were plenty of others there and when you are paying $16 dollars each of such meal it is not acceptable, especially if tastes bad too.There are however various restaurants with options and will definitely try something else next time. Remember to add credits to your bracelet at the entrance so you have the flexibility to buy food and drinks (remember, non-alcoholic only) without having to carry cash with you. And yes, they will refund any balance on your way out.Do not expect to be a cheap day out; you can easily spend double the amount of the entrance fee with extras inside, the shop is great. There are other options of parks if price is an issue, just shop around. They often run special offers for residents and had valentines special so keep an eye to grab a deal or stay in one of the Jumeirah hotels for free entry.The toilets were clean and manned by; again, professional staff and it could do with better signage for ease of finding it.There are lockers everywhere which you pay extra for as well as the option of renting or buying towels. Separate entrance for guests coming from the hotels and nice cabanas also available.There are separate areas for the smokers which is great for families.Keep in mind that depending on the time of the year the queues can be long, in December – February can get quite chilly when coming out of the water however there are fewer crowds.We will hopefully go back soon for more fun before it gets too busy in the warmer months. Hope you have fun too when visiting.

Fun. It was fun. But I didn't imagine the weather would be this cool. We stayed there until evening in the pool. The water was warm and we didn't notice the coolness of weather until we got out of water only to discover how cold weather is. I got a cold and infected throat for the rest of my trip. Just beware of the weather and keep your towel close to you.

Good fun. Wild wadi is a nice waterpark when you only have half a day time. When you have more time and you want to go for a full day; I recommend you pay a little bit more and you go for the Atlantis waterpark. Wild wadi is fun and you've got like 5cool slides, but once you've done all of them a couple of times you get a bit bored! Don't get me wrong, the slides are nice so once again if it's only for a couple of hours it's definitely worth doing!

Unforgettable enjoyable experience. Fantastic aqua park. Both my preschooler and teen enjoyed it so much we were the last ones to leave the park. I am not a fan of water slides to put it mildly but even I enjoyed the experience.At the entrance they offer a meal packages, definitely worth taking up, as there is no choice but Disney type of meals. If visiting with small children, don't bother bringing snacks or drinks - no outside food or drinks are allowed in the park. All will be taken away at security check at the entrance. At the time we visited in February only a few slides had a short wait. Plenty of floaties available, including those with seats specially designed for small children. Seating is at premium, but then again this isn't a place for sun worshippers!Small children have a choice of wave pool or a climbing frame with slides suitable for small children. No other rides are available for for children under 1.10 m high. The park is very clean and well staffed with life guards who take their job seriously.Would definitely recommend this park for both children and adults.

The best water park in the UAE. We have visited this park, along with others, on a number of occasions and found this to be the best. What makes it our first choice is its friendly staff, huge options for rides and its overall cleanliness.It also has a competitive entrance fee and the food outlets also offer a good mixture of meals and snacks.
Fun for childrens. It's really a fun place for childrens, certainly justifies it's name wild wadi.It's an amazing place for water lovers.

Must Visit. Absolutely love the place! IMHO, its tied with Yas Waterworld, Abu Dhabi, as the two best water parks in the country.The area isn't very large, compared to other water parks, but they have managed to fit a large variety of fun rides. Everything from thrilling rides to relaxing, lazy pools and areas for kids.The food is good, but not cheap. There are two big restaurants and a bunch of cafes around the water park.Best time to visit is during morning hours, on a weekday, to avoid large weekend queues.

Great day out. I've been to Wild Wadi a few times and every time it's been great fun.
It's ideal for friends or families as there is a section for young children, as well as "bigger slides" for the rest.
It's a great day out and there's also a lot to choose from food-wise.

Best waterpark in the UAE. I have been here dozens of times of the past seven years and it continues to provide an excellent day out.Leaps and bounds ahead of its neighbours, it is great for all the family including young children. There are plenty of places to eat, relax, sunbathe and play. The changing rooms have been upgraded to include waterfall showers and separate changing areas.The staff are always friendly and helpful and we have a great time every time.One thing that really sets wild wadi apart is its crowd control. You will never be queueing for hours for one ride like you do in Aquaventure.Love Wild Wadi and it deserves the number one place.Even as a tourist, it is worthwhile buying the Dubai Entertainer voucher book as it offers three buy one get one free tickets and with a group of four it pays for itself.Highly recommend.

Beware the Jeremiah ride!. An ace day out with many slides to choose from. Beware the main attraction though, think it was called the Jeremiah Scream. We didn't realise until we got up there the true extent of it. The floor basically disappears from below you whilst you are in this enclosed tube. Being an asthmatic I found it difficult to breathe. But I'm glad I did it! Would def recommend!
Jumeriah 'Sceirah'!!!. Great day out! Lots of different slides for all. Jumeriah Sceirah is amazing but so scary!! Great place for all the family.

Fun place to be. A good water park with exciting rides and fun place for children. Though overshadowed by the more recent parks like Atlantis, it still has a good advantage of location and has been maintained well..and the crowds are great!
Expensive !!. You pay for everything and also for bad food. I just better go to the beach next time. it´s too expensive also for Dubai.
Brilliant water park!. Loved it, massive place with great rides for all ages. Only big queues were for the huge vertical slide but even that wasn't too long a wait. We got a good value ticket too!

A must do family attraction. This waterpark is fantastic. What makes it particularly special is the cleanliness of the place and the fact that the queues are small. We didn't arrive at the waterpark until around 1.30pm but found sun-loungers immediately and these did not fill up as the afternoon wore on. I have a daring 15 year old and a brave 12 year old who love the thrills of the big rides and this park is perfect for them. I particularly like the roller coaster style rides but ladies-hold on to your bikini knickers!! The wave pool is great fun and life jackets are provided for non swimmers or lazy swimmers like myself that just want to 'bob' in the water. Fast food is expensive and the meal we had in the restaurant under the kids play park (with the bucket that tips) was dreadful. I saw people carrying pizza and that looked much nicer. They operate wristbands which you load money onto on arrival which means you can put your valuables in a locker and not worry about carrying money. Any left over money is reimbursed on departure.

Fun and adventure. We could use this park for free whilst staying in the Madinat Jumeirah. The staff are all so friendly and the park is very clean. Lots of fun as a couple or in a group. Even went on a ladies night which was lots of fun!

The second best water park in UAE . We visit a water park twice a year. And I used to consider Wild Wadi as the best water park in UAE until Yas Waterworld was started. Though I will still say that Wild Wadi is the best water park in Dubai. The rides, the feel, the crowd and the access is the best. This is any day Better than aquaventure water park at Atlantis. My kids love this water park. And I believe every visitor will too.

Great fun. Had a fantastic trip today. No queues at all which is a bonus for my two girls (not for me as meant there was no let up from the thrills!!!)
Very clean water park with very attentive staff. Feels very safe. Lots to do.

Good day out. We visited with small children (4 & 6) for free as part of our stay in the Madinat Junmeirah resort. We had a good half day and the kids enjoyed it. I think in 2/3 years time this would be even better as we would be able to go on all park rides as a family. Our youngest was to small (under 1.1m) to go on lots of the slides.

Visit during the week if possible. Brought a friend to the water park using an Entertainer Guide coupon. We visited during the week, which was great because the lines were small or none at all. The park isn't as big as expected but because of the short lines, we went on rides multiple times. Lots of fun for adults!

Fairly pricy and small. In the summer it is probably a very welcome relief from the heat, but I'm not sure how crowded it is. If you stay in the Jumeirah hotels nearby, entry is free; so I tried it out. The rides are fun, but there are not that many. Overall, this is not a very large park as compared to larger dedicated water parks. So don't have too high expectations; it's fun nonetheless (but fairly pricy).

The Old Star. One of the old stars of Dubai and still fairly strong inspite of new entrants. The theme park has stayed and has been getting tourists and kids and adults who love to have some adventure around. Again like any other outdoor adventure in the middle east, ideal period to visit is from September to April when the weather is pleasant. May to August can be horrible and expect some good discounts on prices.
A fun day out!. Come early, stay long. It will be a well used day. We had a lot of fun, and Wild Wadi was well worth our time and money!

Happy City. Wild Wadi Water Park is one of the best sightseeing in dubai.everybody which arrive in this park,they can find a fun according to his or her age.if you go wild wadi,you will have a perfect experience.
Great for the family. very good day out for the family.lots of good rides.Go early and get a spot in the shade.remember to get a wristband to charge with some money to buy items around the park.
Amazing water park. One of my favorite water park since 1999 that was my first visit to it, this is one of the must visit place that i have to go every year with my 3 kids .

WoW !!! Wonderful Wild Wadi !!!. Went to this fabulous park on 04th Feb 2016, though the entrance fee is high, it's absolutely worth spending it, has lots of lovely rides and situated very close to Burj Al Arabi the 7 star hotel, so we can get some unique pictures of Burj from the water park, took some glorious photos and videos to cherish.Must visit for all age groups, especially children, but watch them and stay close to them while they are playing in the water park.

Good aquapark with some extreme tracks.. Not so big, but beautiful and comfortable aquapark in Dubai. You can find deep and extreme tracks. You can train serfing, ride extreme pipes or relax in pools.Use The Entertainer book for 50% discount. Usually you can buy usage not full book it in different forums cheaper.It's difficult to find taxi from aquapark! Maybe it's possible to ask staff for taxi. All taxies are full in this district.
great day. Went with family, plenty of water activities and take aways. There were also plenty of sunbeds scattered all over the place. It cost us £50 per head. Not a cheap day out but good fun
Wet and Wild. So much fun. Great for kids and young people. So much to do. So clean and well kept. Definitely a place to let it all go. Make sure you have an appropriate bathing suit.

Fun fun and fun!. Enjoyed this park immensely. Arrive early to avoid the queues. Thrilling rides in the big rings at the top. Definitely had the wow factor. Stay safe! Height restrictions are there for a reason, so adhere to them.
Fun in the sun . A wonderful day out just under the Burj al Arab. Good range of activities for a group of friends and the best is that you don't need to get out of the water.
Best Water park in Dubai. If you are on vacation with family, you must visit to Wild wadi water park. Exciting rides and so much fun. Very close to jumairah beach,
Few rides. The aqua park is nice and organized, however it's small and have few rides.It's located in the heart of Dubai which is an advantage not like the other parks that are out of Dubai.

Such fun . Had an absolute scream here. Literally I screamed the day away. I loved shooting down the slides and tubes feeling like a teenager again.Woke up the next day covered in bruises but hey you only live once right?Good fun for all ages. Well organised and it all feels very safe.

Old Park with limited rides, but fun for few hours. This was the first water parks in UAE, it is nice but small, old and few rides compared to other parks. it is fun for 3 hours or less so if you do not have a lot of time and want to be splashed and do some water rides, this is the place.
Amazing. Outstanding place...found it better than Yas Water world...lovely time spent with family..! Cold weather and our family was on a visit visa to Dubai.. we all had a blast
good park but not for me. good water park and good water play but not good day for me becuse i have terrible Headache after play "JUMEIRAH SCEIRAH" and not complate good after about 3 weeks
Closed but not advised. I checked online and on TripAdvisor and it said it's open until I took a taxi across dubai to find out its under renovation.
Breathtaking. Gorgeous views of the sky line, marina and boats. Really fun to just walk around and enjoy the views. Lots of restaurants to have lunch a coffee or dinner. A must do and see.

Great day out. First trip to dubai and used an enter voucher for wadi wadiWent on a Saturday so it was very busy, but more than bearablePlenty of opportunities for you to spend your moneyAll slides openStaff really good and professionalPretty clean everywhere despite it being busyOnly criticism was the queue for taxis afterwards...,,,,took ages.....but that's not the water parks fault
Brilliant . We had free entry with our hotel so had nit5hing to lose really. We werent that keen in the idea but we LOVED it. We went on everything. Highly recommend.
Garden on 8..you rock!!. Great place to hang out with friends!! Great service, great food and happy hour just great value for money!!..............

Nice one-day program. Nice program to visit once this aquapark. It ha its own special slides, several restaurants are available too! From the top of the building inside you have a unique view for Burj Al Arab!

Great Day Out. This is a great cool day out in the hot Dubai summer. There are a lot of rides to go on, however not a lot for 1 to 2 Year old kids. I wish I knew this before I went in. The price is a bit steep but then again it is an experience if you are visiting Dubai. However, please note, when buying tickets at the booth, please don't buy the food coupon from there, just go in straight to the food stand and you can buy the food a bit cheaper yourself. I guess they charge extra for the wrist band they give you. Before you leave, don't forget to check the photo booth if you had any pictures taken, they cost only 100 Dirham for one picture which is not bad.
Disappointing after Atlantis water park!. very expensive entry ticket that does not match with the experience you get. You can't access the beach. you should pay for towels and locker.
Fun in the sun. Book in advance to save queuing and don't expect it to be a cheap day out. For all the fun in the sun comes at a price.

Great Place to Spend a Hot Day in Dubai. Best for Pools, Surfing and Rides.. soothing rides for kids too. you can learn surfing here for few minutes after a long waiting line. Waiting line for rides are a bit longer. No food and drinks allowed. Your swimming shorts should be above your knees and be careful try not to wear anything see through as they wont allow these things. Wipe out and Riptide rides are the best. Best for every age..
Soooo fun! . A great day at this amazing water park. A must visit. You can stay all day and a lot of people/Guards in the pools and slides. Great fun!

Great place to spend a day..... It is well worth the money with many a thrill to be had. Highly recommend the 4 person tube as you slide up high on both sides of the ride before hurtling through darkness to end up in the pool.Food is basic and is on the high price side for what you get.A great day can be spent as family members spent many a time at the surf slide where you can pretend to surf.Overall, money well spent as you could manage all the rides and then keep on doing your favourite. Its safe for children and its a great way to loose teenagers as they tire themselves going after all the rides...Enjoy!

Fabulous and very safe. We enjoyed this attraction as a family several years ago. The management took serious consideration to ensure the safety of their customers on the water rides; we've never seen so many staff positioned intermittently on rides to ensure customer safety anywhere else in the world!!The park uses a cashless system by charging your wristband attached to your credit card.
Enjoy. Of the coolest places in Dubai.Very fun for all ages. Very wonderful water sports. The warmth of the water for games, and this is what distinguishes it from the rest of the water sports.
Nice place for a change. Wild Wadi is a good place for a change when visiting Dubai or if you are residing their. I feel the tickets should be cheaper.

My most amazing experience in dubai. I'va been to wild wadi 2 times now. Every time more adventurous than the last time. They won't let you take food and drinks in there, even my water was thrown away. But any kind of food you need, you can find it in the WW. It's soooooo fun to play all kinds of water games. Thursdays are females only. But on the other days, they are open from 9am to 7pm. With just 250Dhs you can enjoy all this time, daily. If you don't go to WW, I don't think you can say you visited Dubai.
Lovely Experience!. Perfect place to come around! A lot of slides and adventures. I will surely go back in here during summer.
Exciting Rides. Small and very cozy place. All the rides are near to each other. Enjoyed the Wipe out & Riptide a lot.

to spend a day full of adventure and enjoyment there is no better place. despite it being December the temperature was about 23 degrees centigrade we went around 11am and stayed till closing time which is around 6pm. We had a wonderful day despite the park being very busy on that day. The tickets were a bit expensive so if you do not want to pay full price get the Entertainer Voucher books, which give buy one get one free for Wild Wadi. There are not many rides but you have enough to have a great day. One down issue is the price of food inside and you have to bring your own towels if you do not want to pay around £10 for one towel.
Wild Wadi. Great fun for everyone. Thursday evenings have exclusive entry for women and children (boys must be under 7). Get there early if you want a sun bed!
Great waterpark. Wide range of water rides and activities for all ages. Nice clean changing rooms. Great fun for all the family.

Wonderful. Funny and ..... Scary...my sun asked me to slip there :)
Lot of different attractions even waves to surf...
Recommended

Good experience, will be back. We spent very nice weekend there, kids loved it .Will be back , just keep going . This is one of the best Water Park
we visited.
Boring!!!!. Another waste of time and money.... People building these kind of "amusement parks" which are really boring to visit.....

Great. If you are not in search of big thrills or you're visiting with your family, this is a nice place to visit. You'll need a whole day to enjoy the place. The view is excellent from the Wild Wadi. You have the Burj Al Arab just beside. Great for photoshoots. )

Amazing!. We were excited to goto Wild Wadi as the reviews from friends had been fantastic and it did not disappoint! Great variety of rides, our belongings felt safe and most importantly it was clean.
Only bad experience was using The Entertainer app was difficult as the staff seemed confused with it but we got there in the end
Great fun. Easy access from any of the Jumeirah hotels by buggy or walking. Our family enjoyed the many slides and rides.

Ladies night. Came here with friends on a ladies night at the water park. There's a limited number of slides of which not all are interesting but there's enough to keep you entertained and it's good fun. Bring your offspring.

This Nostalgic Class is Fun, But Very Compact and A Bit Cramped . . . .. Many that I talked with have a lot of nostalgia because this is the water park that they grew up going to so naturally they want to take their kids there . . . all fine and good to relive your childhood through your kids : ).Don't get me wrong . . . I liked Wild Wadi but if you are looking for the best water park go to Aqua Adventure at Atlantis which you will pay more for so it's a trade off. This park is one of Dubai's oldest and although it is in a great location, it's a bit land locked so everything is compressed. Fine if you don't like to walk so far and also free if you are staying in adjoining hotels. If you really like water parks then you need to try this one.

Amazing . Loved loved loved it we've visited lots of water parks but this was the best one ever we spent the full day here and the children had the greatest of times, and the views were outstanding would love to go back one day
Soooo much fun. It was amazing! we went in December so that was not a lot of people in the watermark we were able to do all slides a few times!!

Great day out and slides are fun. Took the family here for a days fun in the water and was not disappointed, great slide and loved the reverse rides, unusual to be shot up the way on these rides. Kids loved it and happy times had by all.

Absolutely stunning. This is the best water park in Dubai. I really enjoyed the Rapids because there was a stunning view and you could see everything. Also the other rides are for everyone. You just can't beat it! :)

Fantastic waterpark! . If you have a spare day in Dubai a visit here is totally recommended!!Pure fun with a lot of slides to try....the park is huge and the price is totally affordable. Recommended a full day here!

Surprisingly Extensive. My family and I, staying at the Al Qasr Hotel, decided to travel to the waterpark (it is free for Jumeirah Hotel guests) on two separate days. We have been to many water parks, and expected this one to consist of a few okay slides, however we were pleasantly proven wrong. While there were only a few rides, all of them were extremely well done. Each one was enjoyable with the longest slide lasting for over 3 minutes! I am not sure if we would have wanted to pay for admission, but since it was free, it was definitely worth it! Also if you go earlier in the morning when it opens, the lines are significantly less than midday.

Great waterparks with long slides. Love this aqua park) even though it's not the newest waterpark in UAE it's still got everything a visitor needs: great rides, nice style and beautiful views) if u ever decide to go to Ferrari and to Wild Wadi aquapark- better go to Wild Wadi twice!)))
Free with hotel . It was free with the beach hotel which was a bonus! Really enjoyed it, my partner enjoyed it even though he don't like water parks. Easy to access and great rides.

Great attraction. The original waterpark of Dubai. Smaller than the more recently opened parks. But some of the rides are still great.Make sure to load enough credit onto the wristbands so that you have enough to last all day without having to go back to the entrance to top-up.

Enjoy water activities . This is awesome place for family -kids time. All children likes to play with water and this is th one. Possible to spend all day over there slide and play , have lunch . Many entertainments and funny time.

Scary. I don't like water activities however as we stayed next door at the Jumeirah we got free pass into the water park. Hated every minute - couldn't wear footwear for rides but ground was too hot to walk on! Beware going to rides with sunglasses as you need to hold on so need to leave behind somewhere safe! Was persuaded to go on the Jumeirah scream - couldn't open my eyes - terrifying springs to mind and I did scream all the way down. Give me a lounger next to a pool please!
Fun, fun and more fun. Had an amazing time at the Water Park, the slides are fantastic and so much fun. Definitely a place to visit when in Dubai...a whole day of fun!
a lot of fun. it was for 4th time I went to this complex but this time the weather was a little cold.but everything ok as always and we enjoyed a lot.I recommend it to have a day out fun.

Lot of fun. It is what it is. Waterslide fun in the sun - and a lot of fun it is too. The slides are great, the queues arent too bad and everything is where you want it to be. Its a great laugh and I've been a few times now. I prefer it to the larger and more spread out Aquaventure. WW is an incredible bargain by comparison - and even more so if you use your Entertainer voucher.

Scuba dive.. A wonderful experience that I'll never forget. My instructor was brilliant. I was a little nervous but he let me take the time to become familiar with the equipment and the feel of breathing underwater. Once I was under water it was just amazing. To be able to swim so close to all the animals. It had given me a taste for it and I definitely want to do more diving. ☺

Good place to hang out . It's a very nice water park, but little over crowded, you have many game options but in some waiting time is high, you can roam around the park also. ..its well maintained and well decorated
Great family fun. Excellent rides with lots of places to just sit and relax. Can't take any food or water into the park so be prepared.
Fantastic. We had a excellent day at Wild Wadi! Fantastic rides for all ages. You can easily spend a full day on all the attractions or just laying about on the many sun loungers! Enjoy :-)
Fun day out. Great fun, really well set out. We got there early and got great position on sun beds. Rides were amazing, photos were free!!

Out of this world. This is a magical hotel whoch stands alone in regards to luxuary.I have dined here but not stayed. There is so many choices of places to eat and the service really is 7 stars. Of course, it is expensive but what would you expect!
Water Park. What a place!…free to guests, it has everything you could wish for, the lazy river is something else, the water rides are breathtaking, its fun, fun ,fun

Wonderful waterpark!. We went here for my son's 3rd birthday, so I only experienced the children's area, the lazy river, and the wave pool, but it was all so fantastic! This is a guaranteed GREAT time. The water is temperature controlled so you can enjoy your time there without feeling too hot or too cold. The workers at the top of the water slides in the children's area were all very friendly and encouraging of the little ones to slide down. And there's also a worker at the bottom of every slide to help you get up or scoop up the kiddos to make sure that they don't get squashed!The food was, like all amusement parks, overpriced and not very good, but you know that's the price you must pay!
Jawdropping!!!. We visit with my friends, we love each and every ride so much fun and enjoy. all rides are very nice especially the board with rapids water.

Simply wonderful. Wild Wadi has the best slides in Dubai there restaurants are very good there slides are the best the tantram alley the Burj Surj and the jumeriah sceirah and many more it was a wonderful experience

Intense thrill. One of the best water parks we have been to. The rides have options of thrill and intense thrill. Kids love the adrenal rush and so many options. They have lockers but take the big ones as small lockers won't suffice. They come at a steep price but helpful.
Just OK. This place is more suited for kids than adults really. The games are not exciting and the floors are not clean. It's just OK, I wouldn't recommend to someone or go there again.

Excellent day out. A great day out. Some very good rides, from family to thrill rides. Slightly smaller than Aquaventure, which is why I prefer Aquaventure, but still a great day out.One thing that Wild Wadi does that Aqauaventure doesn't is the payment system using your wristband. You can load up some cash on your wristband at the start of the day for drinks/lunch. At the outlets you just scan your wristband to pay and if you have any leftover balance at the end of the day, you can collect it before you leave.
Amazing place. A place for all ages! Enjoyed all the rides! Time is flying while you are inside! Very friendly staff! Maybe the food should be upgraded little bit.

Brilliant time with the family . The park is smaller than it seems online but that wasn't am issue for us as we were there with our infant so we just wanted to make it fun for her, and she definitely loved the wave pool (kept her on the outskirts). I'd recommend it to families with young children, however teenagers and anyone older may get bored as there is not a great variety of slides.

NIce waterpark with nice location. All rides were in working condition. Staff was supportive. Not too much rides but can enjoy for 5 to 6 hours. burj al arab and beach view can be seen from the rides.

All day fun with the whole family. It was my first time at a water park which I don't usually visit for the sake of hygiene but I had a nice time because the place was really neat and they use salt water so my skin didn't react to the water. Wild Wadi was also not too crowded and the longest time we waited for a ride was 30 minutes (and we made a friend on the waiting line!). It's worth every penny!

Good for a short day trip. The park is very easy to get to and well laid out. A bit on the small side but still worth a visit. The "rides" are good and safe for small children and enjoyable for adults.
Great fun. Great place to visit and I cant really decide which is better out of here and Aquaventure as both very good so you might as well do both

Great for family fun. Spent a day at WIld Wadi with my 6 year old daughter and wife. Fantastic place! In season, make sure you get there early to avoid the crowds. We were there on 2 January 2016 and arrive at 9:50, 10 minutes before opening time. There were already about 30 people waiting to get in. Initially we did not have to really queue for rides but from around 12:30 it became quite busy and we had to wait 20 - 40 minutes for the popular rides. We left at about 14:00 and then it was quite busy although it never felt over crowded (apart from waiting long for rides). But overall a fantastic experience. Staff were very friendly and helpful. For those with deep pockets, you can rent one of the cabanas (only 6 available, at AED 2000 for the day). These are in a private area. Not really necessary if you are going early and leaving before it gets busy. There are other areas that are also quite private at no additional cost - look on the terraces. The areas next to the wave pool is quite busy.The views are spectacular!
Fabulous. I just can't say how great this park is. As far as I know, it's among top ten greatest water parks in the world. You may find lots of games and lots of fun there.
Great day trip. We spend the whole day here, with our two children (15 and 13). Had a wonderful time. Staff is friendly, guards everywhere, attractions amazing.
Always good fun . A good fun day out!! Great to get entry fee included if you're staying at a jumeirah hotel :) food in wild wadi is very reasonably priced - will be back in the future
Great fun and useful to cool down. I actually prefer Atlantis, I find this waterpark very small and it can become very crowded. My children prefer the rides here so I guess be guided by them!

Fantastic experience. . Visited Wild Wadi around 10 years ago, we stayed at Jumeirah Beach hotel so had free access of the park. Me and my sister were left to roam about alone by my parents to explore wild wadi and have fun. The park is just fantastic, very much a fun day. Got a lot of pictures taken and printed off to keep for memories. Will be returning this year in September will my newly wedded husband.Cannot wait!

Small & Sweet. Advice to Save Money: But the Entertainer Book : This book would give you coupons from which you can save 50% on entry tickets : This book is available in almost all supermarkets or book/gift stores also you can purchase it via App (even save more money then).Now coming to the fact why i rated this average.I am a Thrill Seeker and except of 1 or 2 rides most of the rides don't get the adrenaline running. The place is not very huge (as i have heard of Aquaventure). The rides are very good if you travelling with a family and if you reach early you can avoid the rush and complete all the rides in 4-5 hours.Locker is charged separately, so we took a large locker in which we all adjusted our bags.Food is quite expensive inside compared to the rates outside.This place is located right in front of the main gate of Burj Al Arab.

Fun waterpark ...but quite expencive!. Lots of things to do, and fun for the whole family. We went with 9 & 11 year old kids and they had a blast. What we hadn´t experienced before were waterslides going up the hill! The tickets were quite pricy and you need to load money on the braclets for your stay. Everything costs extra, even lockers and towels. You can also pay your food and beverages with the bracelet and if anything is left over you will get a refund upon exit. Notice that you are not allowed to bring any food/drinks to the area. They will check your bags when entering.

It's a typical water park. I visited the park on a Thurday night ladies night. The lines were very long, especially when something went wrong w one of the rides. Otherwise, the rides themselves are very typical of any other water park - nothing extra special. Normally that's an ok thing but for a place like Dubai where they pride themselves on bigger, grander, over-the-top, this came in on average. Would I visit again? Maybe. But not definitely. But that's because I'm not a huge water park person. What I did enjoy is the experience of the fish pond/pedicure pool where little teeny tiny fish eat away at the calluses on your feet. That was interesting and worth a try if you haven't experienced it before. But you could do that part without needing to enter nor pay for the entire park.

DAY TRIP AT WATER PARK WITH TEENAGERS. The Entry cost is quite expensive as are the foods and goods available for sale inside . But that aside , it was still well worth the visit , we spent the whole day there and were thoroughly entertained through out the day . The Jameriah Scream is a must , the rapid river ride , the wave pool were lots of fun. It is certainly worth a visit .
good fun. we were ther with family. and we enjoyed a lot. there are good choices for restaurants that you can have good food.

with sun city tours. arranged with sun city toursfantastic day at water park. excellent views of burj ul arab. types of rides are varied for all types of people. staff fantastic. place very clean. i did my travel to them as part of my package it assisted with the fares to abd from my hotel.

I can do this year in year out!. The thrill and fun here is absolutely interesting. My kids loved all the water works and their ability to mingle with all other kids around the world to participate in fun seeking activities is awesome. the swimming pool is fantastic especially the waves effect as if you are on the beach!
