fun day - bit expensive. Visited with the family - kids, babies and a granny, all enjoyed it so its a fun day out for the whole family! Bit pricey though, worked out to be around £50 a person. Tip - bring your own towels! To rent them costs £7 each, cheeper to buy them! Wasn't very busy in december so we had no queues to get on the rides which was great. A tad cold whenever you are out of the water so take plenty of towels!
amazing weekend. it's less thrilling from other aqua parks but it's so enjoyable and fun, I enjoyed the lazy river a lot. great place for family and friends
Best water park we have visited!. Very clean and loads of rides to go on. Reasonably priced food. Make a full day of it, we ran out of time to go on everything.

Water fun!!!. We stayed ar Jumeirah Beach Hotel and Wild Wadi is part of this resort. What fun!!! We were there everyday during our stay at The resort. We all loved it! The park is so much fun, the water temperatures are perfect. Slides, kids pool, wave pool and more. Really enjoyed this and made the most of it while we were in there. The lifeguards are amazing and so professional that you are at ease with your kids as they splash around. We even tried the wave board. Fun for the whole family!!

Great day. We visited both waterparks in Dubai this one was not quite as good as Aqua .. but still had a great idea. Good idea - you can load up the wristband with money and use this to buy drinks. Great rides and a great day.

Good clean fun... literally!. The Wild Wadi Water Park came complimentary with our syay at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers. In addition to having a good variety of rides, the place is well maintained and well staffed. Ver clean facility. My family enjoyed this immensely.

Fun family trip. One of the ultimate destination in Dubai, well organized and good security,Don't carry much when visiting Lockers are quite small and you pay separately to use Lockers, Wild Wadi is well organized. You need not go farther or walk away just to take other rides as they are alongside. The place is very much safe as you can leave some of your things at the poolside reclining chairs. The best water park for family...

Always fun. I've been here a few times since I was a child and always have the best time! Lots of slides for all ages and a great park area for younger kids. The food is good and served quick. Also space to relax for a while if you get tired from the slides. Great wave pool and lazy river. New additions to the park are always arriving so each time back gets better and better!

Back to childhood. We had a great day there - I'm not a fan of this of parks, but my partner insisted and I have to say : Thanks! It was like going back to childhood! Fun all day long - pure adrenalin!As a guest of Jumeirah hotels you have free access - which makes it cheap ! Restaurants inside only fast food - - taxi rank outside empty! So make sure you are on time for the hotels shuttle! Great fun

Great fun. We stayed in a Jameirah Beach hotel so had free entrance to the park. We just jumped on one of the golf buggies and got a free lift straight to the entrance gate, grabbed the wrist band and we were in. The park was open everyday and closed around 8pm. One evening a week they close a couple of hours early and re-open for ladies only. Jack and I would leave mum on the beach around 4pm and dash over for a couple of hours before getting back in time for dinner. This would give us time to go on each ride. Most rides consist of sitting in tubes/rings and either flying own the ride or being fired along by water jets. Some of the rings are tandem, but some are single. Jack was OK on the singles and he's 10 now. The tubes interconnect, so it's not definite that you will follow each other. One of you may end up going down a different tube and they don't all end at the same point, so you need to plan a meeting point in advance and make sure your children are happy to go alone.There's also a great lazy river which can be done in single or tandem tubes. There's a couple of water falls along the way, so you will get splashed. One of the water jet tube rides ends in the lazy river, which is a nice touch.There's also a wave machine where you can surf, but the queue is about 30 mins. Most rides have a 10 mins queue, although it gets busier at the weekend.We only ate here once and paid cash. We kept our things in a locker. It's mainly Burgers and Chips and there's one Pizza place. When it was Jack and I we didn't take anything with us and used their free towels to dry off. We left our flip flops in one of the many shoe racks at the bottom of the ride and collected then before we left to go.There's plenty of shade, but some queues are not covered and the sun is still very strong at 5pm, so we wore our sun vests. The sun cream will soon come off!There are plenty of sun loungers, but people don't seem to use them as there's too much fun to have.Wild Wadi was a great feature of our holiday - Jack wishes we had one next to our house.
Wow!!. If you're in love with water slides this is the place to go to when in Dubai with a backdrop of the Burj al Arab (the only 7star hotel). Great for children as well as adults.

Wild wadi water park . One of the ultimate destination in Dubai, well organized and good security,Don't carry much when visiting Lockers are quite small and you pay separately to use Lockers, snack are not cheap be prepared, you might want to get a waterproof transparent phone cover b4 coming but if not you can buy in one the shops in the lobby

Fun family trip. We pre booked tickets before travelling. Yes we did get them cheaper than paying on the day, but didnt really save any time as you still need to queue to collect them. Tickets are around £50pp for the day. Additional costs include towels, lockers, zip line. Drinks and snacks are expensive as youd expect. You can pre purchase a cashless wrist band (any unspent credit refunded) which was helpful. We also opted for ziplines, approx £15 which could be used multiple times. Lovely beach area with plenty of loungers. Clean surroundings, however rides not well sign posted. Rapids and flumes all had plenty of rings as required. Some queuing but not significant like in many European/USA parks and this was 28th Dec (PEAK)Good array of slides for all ages, even a toddler splash area. Our party from newborn to 65 all enjoyed it.Would recommend and definitely return

Fabulous day out..but food is expensive. I visited this water park on my family vacation. This water park is beyond amazing. There is so much to do you won't know where the time went. I arrived act 10.30 and stayed till closing around 7. Closing times vary at different times of the year to coinside with spiritual holidays. There is something for all ages whether you are a thrill seeker, then there are huge water slides that will take your breath away from the height and speed of the rides, seeking relaxation then using a tube and slowly drifting around all the rides is a must. There are the waves that are an experience if you can bear to be lifted off your feet and planted who knows where( make sure you can swim for this or stay close to the edge for safety). Or if not sure then walk around and decide. Food is quite expensive here as you can't bring your own you don't really have a choice but to buy a few items as you get hungry and thirsty being there all day.It can be a it expensive so check out prices online either before you go or look for deals at your hotel once you arrive.Overall I had a great day , we all did. I recommend this attraction if you go to Dubai....Enjoy
Worth a Visit. We traveled to Dubai in Dec'15 and really enjoyed our visit to Wild Wadi Water Park. It's a great place to explore with family.
Fun!. Wild wadi is fun if you visit occasionally with friends. Prices are steep so stick to a once off special treat.

Great fun. Great fun for children and adults to. A wide variety of slides to cater for all ages. The water is heated in winter so still fun at Christmas. Everything is kept immaculately clean including the changing rooms. Try and make a day of it as it is expensive. Taxis can be difficult to get at the end of the day.

Well Organized. We have been to other water parks in the UAE, but for us, Wild Wadi is well organized. You need not go farther or walk away just to take other rides as they are alongside. The place is very much safe as you can leave some of your things at the poolside reclining chairs. The best water park for family indulgence.

A great time had!. Had such a good time here. Just wish there had been a few more rides. But the ones they had were brilliant. There is one ride where you are put into a capsule standing up. You hear 3, 2, 1 then the floor opens and you drop. So exciting!

Very good water park if you do not have to pay for it!. We went there as we stayed at Al Qasr and the entry was therefore free. We found the park entertaining for an hour or so and then headed back to the beach.

Great for a Flight Stopover. We visited this less than two hours after getting off a flight from Washington. The place could use more signs, but is small enough you ultimately find each of the rides.This is not designed well for lounging around and there is certainly no need to invest in a cabana.Can be in and out trying every ride within two hours. Serious thrills and people from all over the world.

Great and friendly staff. The water park was free entrance with the hotel we were staying at so we thought we should try it out. It is a small water park but was perfect for me. I have recently had a back injury so have to take care and the staff were extremely friendly and explained the rides in detail before I got on. As I suspected I couldn't go on a lot of them but that was fine with me. My sister had a great time and we spent a couple of hours here. I wouldn't have been able to spend longer just as I would have got bored but not going on the rides but I can see it being a fun day out in normal circumstances. I give the attraction average as I think there should be more high thrill rides. My sister said there was only really one she'd class as this. Other than this the staff were very helpful and would recommend for a few hours of your day.

a GREAT day out. even on a cooler Dubai day the place was abuzz. We had an absolute blast and the rides are so much fun. A great day out for the whole family. Definitely would visit again when in Dubai

Wild Fun!. This is a really great water park. Lots of fun slides and you rarely have to get out of the water. Buy your tickets online for a discount and use the wrist bands to access the lockers and towel rental. Great selection of things for the kids and adults alike!
Not enough Rides. Although the rides were good it was a lot smaller than expected which made it a bit disappointing. It was not too busy and there were plenty of beds which was good

Baby and toddler friendly. Excellent place if you have small kids as there are many rides and slides that are safe for kids. Snacks are also available in plenty inside the waterpark and ts a great place for family to enjoy. Recommend buying Entertainer/Entry vouchers which give you 1+1 offers

Fun family day. If you are the outdoor type - then this is the park for you. There are rides for all levels of adventurers from extreme to the mildest. This is a fantastic family outing - if the service and quality of the rides remain the same I will be there again and again
cool. adrenaline rush rides... great fun.. good day out & great for couples you will have a good time there for sure

The highlight of my trip!. I wish I discovered the park earlier during my trip, I would have gone there everyday. We had free passes daily for 2 which was great. It was a thrilling experience. LOVED IT!
It's ok. Slides are ok, some good some lame. But seriously 40AED just for a locker to keep my stuff?All in all 275AED are to much and not worth it.

Small but nice adventure. Not so many attractions, but really appriciated by the kids.Staff everywhere that are helpful and assist you all the time.Different selections of fast food, but at lunch time it will take some time to get the food (if you order for example pizza).Not so many placed to sit and eat, so bring the food to the sunbed.
Waterworld. My daughter loves water rides. We had fun the whole day, enjoying all the water rides and swimming. Even the food was great.
Excellent. Excellent water park in the United Arab Emirates very family and friendly place in Dubai. good to go there with family.

A great Family Day. Excellent family attraction for kids and adults of all ages. Great rides and also great areas to relax and enjoy some down time. We have visited more than once and each time we are not disappointed.

Worlds best water park! . An absolutely incredible water park with so much to offer. Great rides and slides for all ages! I could visit time and again and not be bored. Super value for money. A must visit when in Dubai!!

great day out with the kids. We really enjoyed our day out. We got a free entry as we were staying at the jumeriah creekside hotel. My son loved it as he was above 120 cm and could enjoy all the rides. The park is well set out, family friendly and we were happy we went on a day where the queues were minimal. I would recommend to go on days when its not too busy as queuing would be off putting. The food was average and fast food but the park is a great day out.

Great Rides!. When you go to wild wadi, you have to do online booking, since there are huge lines for getting a ticket. But my family and I learned the hard way, we didn't book online and we had to wait in line for half and hour. When you are booking a ticket, take the package, where you can get free pictures and 200 dirhams in your green watch, and a locker to put your clothes in. Since you can get food with the 200 dirhams, and you can take loads of pictures for free! But that costs about 1,000 dirhams which is really expensive. So you can either get that or just the package where you can enter and you won't get free pictures of 200 dirhams extra or a locker. I would recommend the Jumeriah Scream for the first ride you do, since it is the scariest ride in the whole park and you can get done with it. Then you should probably do the Burj Surj, and the ride next to the Burj Surj. For food I would recommend Ali's Barbecue restaurant. Since it has many choices of food and they all are really delicious. I got a Chicken burger, with an ice cream at the end and that pretty much fills you for the rest of the day. The park closes around six o'clock, so you guys can enjoy and have a lot of fun by then. The locker rooms also have showers and soap, so I you do want to have a bath you can. After you have had all of your fun, you can go to the photo counter and collect all of the photos you have taken and you can upload those to your computer. Have an amazing time because my family and I did!

Fantastic Day Out. My Son and I visited Wild Wadi on December 31st 2015. Having previously lived in Dubai this was one of my sons favourite water parks and on this visit did not disappoint. Due to the time of year queues were minimal the temps were a chilly 29 degrees but purchase of a 'shorty' wetsuit from the sales in the Mall of Emirates the day before put paid to any shivering. It was nice to see the park quieter than on my previous visits but with all the rides still open. A really nice touch was the huge heated wave pool in the children's area, this allowed for re-heating in-between chutes and rides. The staff in Wild Wadi are fantastic ready to help at any time and the Foot Long Hot Dogs are a great hit with my Son Overall a great day out, the only issue I always have is persuading my Son to leave!

Loads of fun!!! . This water park is the best I've ever visited! The leap of faith is amazing and me and my family had the best fun!!!The rapids are great, all the slides are fun & you can even find areas that are fairly quiet and nice to lie and enjoy the sun!Only thing I will say is as it's fairly built up its warmer in the park than by the pool of you're looking to sun bathe :)

Full day of fun. We went 31 Dec it was not as crowded as I expected. The rides were fun, the staff very friendly and helpful but nothing after Atlantis. If I had to choose? Atlantis.However we had lots of fun and did not have to carry any tubes that made it worth it. The rides are fun nothing Adrenaline rush. We struggle to get a meter taxi back to our hotel.

Dirty, out-dated and too expensive.. The place was dirty and felt very out-dated. The price was around 295 AED so 75€ … Seriously?! For a simple waterpark? No towels included and not even a simple locker where to put your stuff into…? At start it was a total ripoff and there was NOTHING to do … Just couple stupid waterslides and that's it.The "beach-area" was too crowded and the water was more like yellow than blue because of all the children peeing in there and even simple sunbathing was impossible there.Disgusting …!!
Fun day with friends. Good day out! Good price for what is offered. Decent facilities and not huge crowds! Great time of year to visit.

Expensive tourist trap. For £50 per person, I was expecting lots of rides but it's actually just one big course split into sections, a couple of slides, surf/wave things and a large shallow swimming pool in the middle. You pay extra for things like having your feet nibbled by fish. You get your bag searched as they don't like you bringing your own food and drink - my bottled water was ok but if it was a soft drink then that would be a no-no. We had difficulties understanding the guy at the entrance and we didn't realise that we'd paid for a small locker (£6) but used a large one not knowing it was £12. When we asked a member of staff about this, we were suddenly surrounded by other staff pointing out that there were signs and that it was very clear and we were wrong. How rude! The changing rooms were poor. Again, for the price, I'd expect at least hairdryers. I went to the toilet and came out to use the hand dryer when a member of staff rushed over to check no one was using it to dry their hair!It's ok for families but if you want exhilarating rides, it's not a patch on the white water centre where I work!

Great but dated. This is a great day out and kids do love it. we have been many times. Although we enjoyed the first few visits over the years we believe it is a little dated and it does get extremely crowded. you can easily spend all day waiting in queues which is not fun in the heat. you have no chance of getting a sunbed unless you turn up as the doors open or toward the closing time. The do offer towels and there is decent food on offer. in terms of hygene I am not convinced they could ever keep it to an acceptable level given the numbers of people allowed in at any one time. once we saw solid poo in the childrens' section and all they did was to remove it and let kids back in...but I am sure this is the same in any such parks. It is a reasonable size park with some real good rides aimed at older kids. There are couple of areas for younger kids too. so there is something for everyone. It is worth a visit
great day out. amazing place for everyone! It is not huge but it is fun and the weather (during winter period) is perfect! and its also amazing luxury!!

Excellent day out with young child. Visited December 2015 with wife and 2 year old son. Spent a good five hours in the sunshine enjoying the wave pool and the rides. My son had a fantastic time despite being too young for many of the rides. One of the most enjoyable days out we had in Dubai.

Don't go in Dec. Park is nice but you feel cold during UAE winter (Dec-Mar).
There's a long wait for Taxi after you finish.
Be careful with younger children. My 8 year old had to keep inside inflatable tube to avoid crashing into sidewalls.
Overall, park is a full day of family fun. Enjoy

Your never too old for a waterpark. This park was definitely in par with those in Florida. Complimentary access as we stayed at JBH, made more convenient by being on our doorstep. We did a couple of hours each day, which suited us perfectly. Went at beginning of December, national day, which meant it was very busy, but from then it was lovely, hardly any queuing time. We loved the ride where we went on 11 slides one after the other. Fab. I would recommend to anyone not staying at hotel as it is fun!!
Full of Fun..... We have visited Wild Wadi with my family and enjoyed thoroughly, specially the surfing experience and wave pool.

Good day out in Dubai. Visited as a family of a couple and a two year old baby. This is a good day out in dubai if you have spare day in Dubai. Not a huge choice of rides for a young family other than just the lazy river. My decision to visit was mainly driven by free tickets provided by Zabeel Saray hotel for staying in a club room. Otherwise the tickets are very expensive and represent poor value for money. I would prefer atlantis water park to Wild Wadi

Awesome rides, food somewhat lacking. Loved the experience and interaction it offered. Attended with two small kids. Their pool's temperature was extremely cold. The food is extremely expensive and rather unhealthy. Was a cool experience but needs some improvement to warrant a regular visit.
Loads of fun!. Had a great time there with frinds lot of rides and the thrill and water activities provided here are a must visit for tourists

Water Park Wild Wadi. Very good for the whole family not there the whole day as not a massive water park, but still great fun. purchase a wrist band to get credit to pay for locker and to also buy lunch, don't forget to go back to shop where you bought to get your remaining credit back. Food inside the park very expensive - not really much else to say, there are on site photographers who take piccies all the time and give you a wrist band take to a shop at the end and you can buy photos, we found it was cheaper to buy all the photos on line and get one photo large in the package, got home and the photos had been uploaded no problem.

Awesome waterpark for thrillseekers. With the most innovative rides I've ever seen in a waterpark (for example: tubes going uphill and all around the park) and most of the rides being more for thrill seekers than your everyday slide-enthusiast, this is a must-visit for thrillseekers who love to play with water. Avoid the crowds and book a ticket through the website. Tip: Madeinat Jumeirah is just a five minute walk away, so combine your water thrills with a (romantic) visit to this village and have something to eat there.

Fun & Frolic. The whole day spent at the water park was thoroughly enjoyed by all. The rides were great, and safe even for the kids. Ensure you wear a proper swim costume, or you may be denied to use the rides.

Christmas day. We visited the water park as it was free for our hotel it was very nice and we had a good time, it gets very busy and the only disappointment was not enough places to sit as I didn't go on the slides but wanted to wait for my family I had to stand about.

A good day out but very expensive. This was our second trip and we've had great fun both times, but I feel value for money it isn't. The seating areas are lovely, and the food is good for fast food, but extras are silly money 2000 AED for a cabana (these are 800 at Atlantis). We were conned into a meal deal on entry, only to find we could have got it cheaper inside, the meal deal includes a very expensive box of salad and a pudding for 70 AED (personally my kids didn't touch the salad). The meals inside were only 59 at most (minus salad) and the ice cream would have been nice later in the day. The lack of changing facilities always amazes me, and to be honest means you leave the park stressed and frustrated.

Fun but extortionate. Book a cab home.. This is undoubtedly an amazing place especially for children, but the prices are ridiculous. £300+ for 4 passes, the smallest locker and lunch food/drink allowance. Classic Greedy Dubai.We waited for 1 hour outside in the taxi queue, manned by a totally useless Marshall. Top Tip: Go if A) money is no object to youB) you have a voucher from The EntertainerC) you book a cab home whilst in the changing room.

Amazing water park. We had an amazing day at the water park and the rides were all amazing. My son couldn't get enough of the water park. We are looking forward to another trip to Dubai as the children had so much fun.

Great experience. We were there for 3 hours and felt it was enough for us. Excellent rides, well laid out though we felt signage was poor. Free parking was good and entry held up by the cashier trying to sell addons. They could have been sold on a screen above the waiting queue. All in all though a great place to go, especially if you have The Entertainer

Good 2 spend ur day as an outing. So it was a day well spent with the gang. The entry usually can b worked out with FREE passes keep an eye out for offers in the entertainer book or credit cards etc.The wadi is nice for children and adults alike. Needless to say DONT forget ur shorts etc the shop inside is a little steep to buy shorts r a swimming costume in. Do try the sheesha nd a drink in the POOL. Super nice idea

Amazing and Fun day Experience. Amazing family day out. I went with not a lot of expectations however I was proven wrong. The facilities was in a great condition and the rides were amazing. We as a family had so much fun. The place was not crowded as we went on a Saturday and assumed people are working on Saturdays. No waiting lines, water temperature was perfect. The activities serves all ages and I was enjoying all the rides with my kid’s non-stop. Magnificent views from the high rides. Bring your underwater camera for most amazing pictures. The park also have the ability in capturing your experience and the portfolio of photos was fantastic. Looking forward to my next visit.

Great Fun!. I visited here with my parents and sister as we were given free access! Park it's self is very clean but... I feel like there aren't enough family friendly rides. My mum only went on one because of her bp which was a ride featuring rubber rings as slides? Other rides like Jumeriah Scerah were just not family friendly if traveling with younger children. Overall great fun but not a great selection of rides!

Great water park to spend time at.. We were staying at the Jumeriah beech hotel so had free access to the water parks and an hour before normal opening as well. We had previously stayed here only at Easter when the park is really busy so we were expecting the same at Christmas. However the park was quieter which was brilliant.My son loved the flow rider and we loved the family dingy rides.It looking a bit tired in places.Can't take your own food and drinks as they bag search and pizza and drink is £12.

Excellent. Excellent day out as always. Wild wadi is big enough for it not to feel extremely busy even when it is. Would recommend looking for offers prior to visiting. Thoroughly enjoyed our day out. Good for all age groups

Excellent ,amazing experience . The service was great.the facilities are still in good shape and well maintained .food variety is there.the park is not huge but has fair enough activities to enjoy. The activities serve all ages.safety majors are respected and all staff are aware off. Looking forward to visit the park again.
Fun and amazing view!!!!. The park is new and clean, it has many water theme to play, very excited and fun. I recommond to book early!
It was very funny. It was very amazing and funny, wild wadi was very clean, staffs did their duties very well and tried to help people experience more fun, food quality was medium...

Kids loved it. My kids absolutely enjoyed it. The park is not huge but there is enough to do for the day. And they have caramel popcorn and magic corn so that was a plus. Food is pricey... but which attraction isn't?

Fab water park!. Me and my boyfriend had a brilliant time at this water park! It's surfing rides are super but probably the busiest rude so be prepared to queue. All the rides were fun and the lazy river was great too

So much fun! . This is the second time we've visited wild wadi and it was one of the main reasons we returned to Dubai for a holiday. It is so much fun! The rides are brilliant and the whole park is so clean and well managed. We would recommend it to anybody got a great day out. We visited both wild wadi and the water park at the Atlantis, the rides at wild wadi are more fun so if that's what you're going for choose wild wadi.
it was the best day of the vacation. waw it was awsame , me, my wife, and 2 doughters we had the most amazing day in wild wadi water parkdefinatly we are going again so soon

EXTREME!!!😆. The best Water/Aqua Park I had ever been to!!!! It has a lot of amazing things there, but I have some things for you....1. Food is pretty expensive 2. Watch out for Jumeirah Sceirah! (It's scary) I loved it!!! I advise you to go there with your family ‍‍‍ or friends.

Fun water park. Perfect time to visit Dubai when is sunny and windy at the same time. As you may not end up where you start your ride, towels are better left in the locker. You will be given a tag for consumption of food and beverage. Do keep the best slide for last - Jumeirah Sceirah! Both participants slide down 120 metres slides at speed of 80km/hr. Not for the faint hearted.

A fun day out. I've never been to a waterpark in my life...
Because I'm overweight I decided not to take my t shirt off.. staff were fine..weather was amazingly hot...
Stunning women everywhere...heaven!!! Fantastic rides..
We didn't pay entrance fee.. hotel had given the day out because we were celebrating my 40th bday

Amazing place. Good surroundings that makes you feel the moment and amazed about the water slides
it is a great journey and you must visited

Great Day out. Our third visit in 5 years - still great fun and a lovely day out relaxing. Top tips - use the voucher on the back of your Carrefour check-out supermarket receipts for 30Dhirams off. Take your own towel. don't take food - they'll take it off you. The option of putting credit on your wrist band works well - means you don;'t have to chose a package up-front. Photos - if you're naughty take a quick snap of the screen when checking out the shots the photographers take of you.The climb to the top of the tower is worth the ride down in the big funnel - not for the faint hearted. The 'coffin drop is also for brave people too.Very good staff and always kind and helpful - from food counters to rubber ring pushers!

Best timing . We went there in Sunday, it wasn't too crowded Also we were not alone either, but the thing is if u wanna enjoy it u have to stay away from the weekends because u will stay for like half an hour to use a slide for 3 mins! So avoid the weekends as much as u can

Fantastic water park. Went here several times as it's free when you stay at the Jumeirah beach hotel. Had several hours of fun with the kids. I didn't try the food here & you cannot take food in with you (they check your bags). Photography is taken advantage of & we did buy a photo of us all together. The toilets & changing areas are immaculate as is all the park. There's rides to suit every ones ability & they provide life jackets for non swimmers.

Great day out. Payed befor we went with the agent.saved queuing when you get there. Plenty of rides to go on.lots of life guards around. It is a full day with plenty of fun for all the family. Staff very friendly ,food good. ( great day out )

wild fun day. i visited here in dec 2015 i had an amazing time. the rides are great for thrill seekers but there were not much rides, however when we went it was quiet so there was no waiting around in long lines it was instantly get on a ride. waterpark is amazing for all ages and there is always something to do or eat there. defo a must to visit

Fun day out but bring your wallet. We went to this waterpark in December and luckily it was not crowded. It has about 5 main waterslides to ride of which 2 need 2 to 4 riders and one is very wild. The other two use jets to propel you up and down. After lunch the park got busier and we had to wait to ride. There are different areas to relax but hard to find shaded areas.The entrance was quite expensive at 270 per person but we had a coupon for BOGOThe locker was also not free of charge and needed if you didn't want to leave valuables on a beach chair. The food menu was aimed at kids and offered burgers and hot dogs and also on the expensive side.It was a fun day out but bring your wallet.

Fresh water . The park is nice but a bit small. If it gets crowded, it becomes less nice and you wait too much for rides. The main thrilling ride (Jumerah sceirah) is not great and hurts more than it's thrilling. Food served there is basic and fast food but it is not bad.

A great day out with the family. We went to Wild Wadi during a 20 hour lay over in Dubai on the way to Europe. We arrived early, got our tickets and spent most of the day enjoying the attractions. It is a good day out if your have a family with you (our kids were 8,12,15) and there was plenty of fun had by all. It is the kind of place you have to go to once and was certainly a better option than walking around the malls. Take lots of sunblock and lots of money as we found the tickets and food a bit pricey (but what attraction isn't?)
Really enjoyed. We had great time with my kids, really enjoyable great rides more activities love the wave pool my kids will never come out from the park

Good day out for kids of all ages. A fun day out for the family. You cannot bring in food or drink and have to buy it in the facility, unfortunately the quality of food is fairly poor but missing a meal wont do most people any harm. The rides vary from young child friendly to pretty scary for an adult (Sceirah). Remember your sunblock.

Okay waterpark. You can have a fun day at this waterpark. There are good rides. But in my opinion aquaventure is better. Wild wadi seems smaller with fewer rides and also is in not such a nice setting. However, having said that we had a fun day here and the kids in particular had a lot of fun. The surfing was good although it could take quite a while in the queue. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The food was also good and not too badly priced for a waterpark we had the pizza which was cooked to order and delicious.

Not the best, but great location. 3-4 good attractions, not big, but well managed. Gets too crowdy after lunch. Compared to the other water parks, value for money is low, however the location has its costs.
Ok for once. This place is ok for once and not any more . Not so many rides and it is not very big . It is busy because of its location near burj alarab
Overrated. Well it's not bad, but not that worth it for me.It has good rides and nice games, however for me it's pricey and didn't have so much fun as I wanted to.
Great place. Fantastic place, I don't where my day went. I along with my family went so excited that my kids were not leaving the place.

Wild Excitement. This one will probably rank amongst the best water parks in the world. The rides are exciting and multifarious, starting from kiddie/beginner level going right up to a spectacular heart stopping water slide that drops over a 100 feet.

What a water park. Advice if you are traveling to dubai with kids you must go to this water park as kids love every single minute of it. It is also great for adults as they have excellent slides through out the park great place great staff.

even at 40 this place is great. we went here and spent a few hours... the rides are great and great fun.. doing the rubber ring rides with your partner will probably be one of the funniest things to do .. we laughed all the way round the rapids... must do
Nice way to cool off. We went with my two sons who enjoyed splashing around n the water in the intense heat of the sun overhead

The best is here. Everything is awesome Everything U can enjoy the persian gulf along with some fun with all the things in this parkMacDonald is a little expensive here but who care pls enjoy!!! I love this park and have been there 6 times!!!Every time that I have been in Dubai I have been there!

Poor experience. We have been before and it was OK but this trip was disappointing for a number of reasons.1. Negative aspersions. We were staying at Jumeirah Emirates Towers and got free entry. We presented our key cards with the holder that had the room number. The guy still felt the need to ring someone, probably to check we were genuine guests. He didn't tell us what he was doing either! He didn't get through so ended up letting us in anyway. We felt that people of a certain other ethnicity wouldn't have had this issue.2. My Kingdom for a locker! A large locker was the only size that would fit belongings for two adults and two young children . It cost 70 dhms. That's around £14! As guests we thought our trip would be for free, obviously not!3. The Bucket of Doom. Every five minutes or so a huge container of water above the kids slides would empty its entire contents over those using the slides. Great fun right? Wrong! There was no warning, it was a powerful stream of water, the water was cold, and it absolutely terrified my 5 year old who got caught underneath it and wasn't very comfortable in the water to begin with.4. Prison Camp? The security checks were so thorough that I expected a strip search was coming up. Every bag was checked carefully. The main issue? Food and drink so that you have to buy their overpriced equivalent. We still managed to sneak a bottle of water in, result!5. Is a warm shower too much? The water was either boiling or cold, these guys don't do compromise. My 2 year old was cold, after a few minutes of fiddling he left colder and disappointed.If you've read so far then congratulations and leave me a like!

Wild wadi. my last day in Dubai decided to check this water park out..was great fun and big relief fr the heat..enjoyed going in the tube thingie but I'm an adrenaline junkie so just had to try out the jumeira skeira ride..omg!!! what a thrill..its a MUST DO when visiting this park.the flo rider was also fun..

Expensive, Average and OK OK Water Park!. An expensive water park with not many ride options! Almost always crowded..but don't be fooled by that! Mostly tourists that visit Dubai go to Wild Wadi or Aquaventure..there are no other options for water parks in Dubai..I would try Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi for a price much cheaper than Wild Wadi..or Dreamland Aquapark for price 3 times less then Wild Wadi!Food is exceptionally expensive and the locker price will shock you! You can rent a hotel room for the price they charge for a small locker!!!! 65 AED for SMALL LOCKER and 100 for a Big Locker! **FAINTED**

getting wet. nice clean water park spend all day good staff food outlets very good with good variety nice wave machine every 15 minutes not to rough one lazy river very lazy I enjoyed this other not so good for all ages
Average waterpark. While fun, there is nothing special about Wild Wadi. A few good slides, pretty clean place but definitely not something to seek out in Dubai.

Great park in the heart of Dubai.. Awesome waterpark that invested a lot in thrilling new slides over the past years. It is the Masterblaster heaven on earth meaning you can ride up to 17 slides with only leaving the water once! On the tower slides there is no need to drag the rafts up the stairs as they have lifts for that. Also small groundsize, keep in mind with many rides, so saves you from walking a marathon. Last but not least, wristband payment system so no way you can get your waller or key lost. Would definitely visit again. PS If you have a car, after closing it is worth to visit f.e. Marina or you can walk up to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel for a room or a drink.

Great fun!. My family and I had a brilliant day at Wild Wadi. What was particularly great was the span of rides that they had for all levels of adventure and ages. They also have a great many rides that you can go on as a family. Whereas most water parks the rides are one person only this was a great way to share in the fun as a family.
Good. Nice place to go, at least once. I would to give it a second visit though. Its not as good as it looks but can't deny its still fun.

If you are up to it, try the Jumeirah Sceirah Ride, Loved it!!. One place you should definitely go for a fun day out. Highly recommend. May not be too friendly for the pocket but definitely worth it. I hope they introduce scarier rides soon.

Great Water Park for the family!. Great fun place to pass a hot summer day......lots of fun rides, queues are average, food is good, and the place is well monitored with lifeguards all over. Jumeirah Sceirah is amazing!

The best time. I really enjoyed going to this Waterpark. The main advantage is that it's in an open air. There are lots of attractions for everybody. You won't be bored here. Moreover, you can have a meal here. We visited Wild Wadi on Friday, and it was not really crowded. But still you need the whole day to fully enjoy the Waterpark.The safety is on the highest level as always in Dubai.

Good Day Out!. Because we were staying at the Zabeel Saray, we were able to access Wild Wadi water park for free. The signature ride is a vertical slide that drops you in a tube (very fun and suitable for thrillseekers.) the queues were bearable and the rides were enjoyable, in addition to the various restaurants that were available to eat at. I haven't rewarded five stars however because it is quite small, so once all the rides have been done, there is not much else to do. A good day out though and well worth the visit!

Beautiful visit on my b-day. I was there in may on my birthday. It was gorgeous. I was alone there but I had so much fun ☺. The staff is very cool and helpful if you need something. The slides are funny. There was not a big line .The hardest slide made me a little bit afraid (I thought I would get a heart attack) but yeah I survived. It really worth the money. Best thing to do in dubai. Wallah. Go to wild wadi. 5 stars
Excellent day out for all the family. Could spend days at this resort, Excellent day out for all the family all the attractions were great.
Nothing great. Hardly few rides and that too except one nothing great.It has lost its charm as many new water parks are in.
Great venue for kids. Excellent location and slides. Very nice sea and Burj Al Arab view. Good way to spend a day with kids. A bit expensive.

Excellent water rides. It's not exactly a great place for swimming but for the water attractions are amazing. Go early in the morning and enjoy all the rides with little to no queues at all. In the afternoon around 4pm, the Master Blaster route was shortened!
Fun. Great time here, was hit the rides are amazing, one of the best waterparks I have been to in the world! Absolutely brilliant fun

An awesome water park. An enjoyable park to have fun at it has alot of slides there .the prise is almost good for the ticket but not for the food (50) per meal .the safe for the clothes is rental . however i advise u to viset this park you will definitely enjoy there .

almost the first choice in dubai. well if you ever been to dubai and not been there we can say you lost too much . wild wadi is the most popular water park in dubai near burj al arab hotel. with so many games and trills like jumeriah scheerah and power tunnel and etc . the entry fee is 295AED which will be added with locker rent which is 45,55,75 for different sizes. i recommend medium 55AED. the food is not cheap and not expensive .it takes a whole day to visit wild wadi . and it will be a last ending memory for you at the end.
aweome. simply amazing place to enjoy the day. lots of activities and options makes the day perfect. i think, this is the best water park in UAE and everyone should try it.

Great family day out - but can get very busy, so choose your time... Wild Wadi is a fairly compact water park (in comparison to others), but it's amazing how much has been fitted in to the space. The wave pool is great fun, and if you have little kids the proximity to the kids water play area is very useful.The two body boarding surf wave pools offer plenty of opportunity to show off, or to show yourself up. The family rides Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley are great fun, and for the more extreme thrill seeker you can try the Jumeirah Scarer, which has a dropping floor!At lunch time you have a choice of food, although most of it involves chips and soda, would be nice to have some more healthy options. That being said, the Chicken Shawarma is great!At peak times of year there can be over crowding, which can cause queues for rides, but that's probably to be expected.

Great Day Out. If you are looking for somewhere to spend a few hours or a whole day relaxing or getting a few thrills then this is the place for you. There are multiple water slides and rides some of which really get the adrenaline going. On the other hand you can relax by the pool with the Burj Al Arab looming magnificently overhead! Great day out!
Good day. Great day out for the family in a water park plenty to do plenty of seating Food outlets very good friendly and helpful staff

Amazing Rides & Facilities. Visited this water park with my teenage kids. It has some of the best rides in the world. The lazy pool and the pools are great too. The park has excellent locked, shower and changing facilities. There are many eateries with various choices. If you want to enjoy all the facilities then you need to spend a whole day to thoroughly experience every ride and facility. There are good number of life guards at every nook and corner so one can swim and use all water facilities peacefully.

If you want some big boys fun this was seriously good!. the Jumeirah Scream will test your fear of heights and facing the unknown. Loads to do and most of the rides were so good we had to go round again. one of the key things is they have awesome weather for 362 days of the year, it just makes you want to get wet!
Great outdoor activity. We live in Dubai and have been here several times as singles, couples, and families with kids. The rides cater to all and are lots of fun for the kids!
Fun and Enjoyable. Fun and enjoyable waterpark. It was such a wonderful experience and my family truly enjoyed ourselves for 2 days

Good water park, some excellent rides but small.. 2-3 rides at Wild Wadi are excellent but the main pool is tiny, the lazy river quite small and lockers are situated at either end of the park - not very practical. Worth going to but you won't need more than a few hours there (maybe for families but not thrill seekers!)If you pre-book tickets it's cheaper.The Jumeriah Scream and Tantrum Alley are the best rides.
Great fun for kids of all ages. Fantastic water rides for all age groups. A great day out for the whole family with good restaurant and loads to see and do.

Fantastic water park. I was staying at Mina a Salam with my son so the entrance was complimentary but in comparison with the water park at Atlantis I found there was more variety at Wild Wadi . I visited during Ramadan and there was very little queuing. Good choice of locker availability and facilities. Really a very friendly family attraction and well worth a visit
Good Experience. It's a beautiful waterpark, the kids area needs to expanded though...but overall a lovely place to spend your day!

Great rides, great food, great staff. Had a great time at Wild Wadi.The rides were fun, the food was surprisingly delicious, and best of all - when I lost my wallet, it was returned (with all the money still in there.)

One of the best things to do in Dubai. Had a great day and a splash around. Enjoyed the rides and the wave pool. Now its getting a bit cooler its not as nice as the warmer months but a lot less people so easier to get on the rides. Busy during the warmer months means longer queues to get on rides
The name says it all ...wild wadi. A definite place to visit with family. It caters to all age group and has some real thrilling rides.
amazing. it was very amazing experience for me and my family i went there in march the weather was so nice and all games i enjoyed it very much changing rooms are available with locker

Great adventure for all the family. Plenty of variety for all the family. A large pool with wave effect. Floats available. Fast shoots for adrenaline junkies to lazy rivers for those who prefer calm. Clean and plenty of sun beds available. Food is very reasonably priced. You just need to be careful of sun burn. Lockers and changing rooms available. You can load your cash onto your tag which makes life easier and means you don't need to keep running to your locker. We really enjoyed this park but getting a taxi at the end of the day proved difficult. We ended up walking back to Emirates mall for metro.

Looked well organised. While staying at Jumeirah Beach Hotel I had a quick look round on a cold and windy day! From my first impressions I feel it looked well organised with friendy staff. When I visited there were not many people at all so plenty of room for those who chose to visit that day. I noticed so many life guards in all areas of the place which should give comfort with plenty of life vests to ware if you feel the need. Many places to sit although what it's like in peak season may be a different matter! Some small shops with places to eat also in the park. Great fun for both adults and children.
Enjoyable theme & time. Outside foods are not allowed to bring inside and you have to spend more money to buy foods from inside. It suits for all familly member.
Fun. We had free access to the park as we stayed at the Jumeirah beach hotel. Great fun and they truly understand the meaning of a lazy river. You pretty much never need to leave your rubber ring!

A Fun Time in the Water. Wild Wadi is fun and brings out the kid in you. You have a number of "rides" to try, such as the Lazy River where you can just relax and go with the flow or there is the big slide called the Jumeirah Scarer. You go down quick and this only lasts for a few seconds but it's fun. Probably around 3 to 4 hours is enough here and you will have done your thing. Kids would stay all day, so be warned!

Swimming & Flip flops. Kids loves this. All they do, spend whole day & swimming. It's very hot outside. Need flip flops to wear as the floors are boiling hot but again kids have enjoyed all kind of activities they have so much.

Fun visit. My husband and I stayed at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel and free admission was included in our stay. The park is not very big, there are only a handful of rides worth going on. The rides we did go on we had a blast. We only spent 3 hours there and felt that we did everything we wanted. The lines were minimal so we got to go on our favorites several times. All the workers were very friendly, helpful and wanted you to have a great time.
Amazing. It was really an amazing experience, full of energy and fun. It had a lot of things for all ages, then you can have fun all family. And it is fun to have a full day there.

Awesome rides, lovely place. I loved the location and the rides of this place. They also had surf trial area which was fun to try. Swimming costumes are mandatory for some rides so please don't go unprepared. The rides of this water park are a lot of fun compared to the Atlantis aquaventure. It's a fun place to spend time in.
Good day, not so many rides. This is a good water park but unfortunately it has few rides compared to yas island! Although the rides it does have are great fun and it's a great family day out.
unforgettable day. if you want have a good day do not forget wild wadi water park . there is near jumeirah beach area . wonderful water games await you.everything is excellent.
Decent, but overrated. A decent waterpark with a few good rides. It's not as big as we expected. We went at a great time as it was not very busy and lines were minimal.

Perfect for the Dubai heat. We had a great time at this waterpark. Awesome tube rides that get the adrenaline flowing, and great views of Dubai from the top of the slides (especially Burj Al Arab). Lineups weren't too bad...longest maybe 20 mins so worth it for the bigger rides. The only downfall was the park wasn't big enough....wished there were more slides. We were there for Halloween, so the haunted house just outside was actually pretty fun to (we were actually scared) We'd check out other parks before going back, but nothing bad to say.
great rides, helpful staff and no queues. had a great day in the park, we got there as it opened and there were no queues at all. The staff were very helpful and the water was warm too

an excellent adrenalin feeled water park. visited this place and tried most of the facilities.Especially the adrenaline feeling high and steep water slides.the place also ahd restaurant serving various foods depending on ones pocket and taste.would visit this again

A fantastic addition to our holiday. As we were staying at the JBH we had unlimited free access to the park and i was great. The park does get busy so you are best to et there for went it opens. Towels are provided on arrival. We left all valuables at the hotel and therefore didnt need to hire a locker etc. The rides are fun and well run and loads of life guards so everyone always feels safe.
Vacations. Had a great time at the park. Rides were awesome and the park was very well maintained. Enjoyed the rides.

Wonderful way to spend a hot day. I've been to many great water parks over the years and this isn't the best, but it isn't the worst either. It's very clean and well thought out, but doesn't cover a massive area. There's some thrill rides and the views of the city and the Burj Al Arab, from the towers, are fantastic. There are places to sunbathe as well, which is perfect. We were the first in the park, on a quiet day and the staff were brilliant.
Amazing Exitement. Exited water games, From heights, 36 different water rides, 100 % safe, unexpected thrills, 3 hrs to 12 hours time pass,

Amazing Water Experience. Went their on a Friday. The timings for Friday is extended til 10pm. Having water slides at night was one of a lifetime experience. The rides are thrilling and states the level of adventure. I almost had a ride on each and thoroughly enjoyed. We stayee their for good 6 hours and its worth it. You will have a problem yo get a taxi on your way back to hotel if you are late. Di grab discount coupons available on all hotels which gets you an off upto 30aed. Food inside is a bit expensive. You need to rent a locker while buying ticket.

"Good" old fashioned Water park. Very nice well maintained old fashioned water park. Though I had heard that Aquaventure is new and better with bigger rides, I found this park very much to my liking. Though some rides had long queue (like surfing) but otherwise all rides are nice, Beach was good and it is well maintained.
Amazing Rides. Wow had a fun day out at Wild Wadi Water Park & managed to do every ride... Found the park quite small so not long distances to walk between rides and the park was nice and clean also

Awesome team, awesome experience!. My wife and I had decided to book an exclusive session on Riptide, Wild Wadi's straight flow wave. Early morning not too cold, weather was actually perfect to say the least.Arrived and was welcomed by an amazing group of team leaders before we were introduced to our personal coach for the morning. Kenan was our coach, been at Wild Wadi for quite a few years and his commitment to ensuring his guests truly get personal, one on one time with him was obvious from the start. Great asset to the Wild Wadi team!If you are looking for an adrenaline filled, exciting and action packed morning, head on down to Wild Wadi flow riders for great coaching sessions!! Two thumbs up Wild Wadi team!!
OOOo here we go!. Wild Wadi is THE water park! It's not as big as Yas Island but its worth the visit. Amazing rides and awesome experience! A must visit!

Average water park . The first thing I noticed that it was a bit run down, not bad but look closer. The park has plenty of life guards, and the remaining mostly Asian staff members seem disinterested in assisting. I'm glad I had entrance included with my hotel as I would have been upset if I had to shell out cash for this water park. Just a note that if you want a locker you need to buy at the entrance gate so one of your wrist bands will activate it. It's not relaxing nor is it beautiful, I wound up going back to my hotel pool where I found it to be more relaxing and entertaining.

fun for big and little kids. I loved this cool fun place to spend a few hours when last in Dubai. Situated right next to Jumerah Resort Madinat and Al Arab it was a great way to unwind and spend a fun afternoon cooling down. As with any water park lots of noise and people but great fun even for us older kids. Well worth it but so is Dubai in general. Will bring my kids next visit.

Well worth a visit. We had a day here, one of the attractions was a bit too scary for me, but my hubby loved it. The other water rides were great fun. The staff were attentive and there was a lot of focus on health and safety. We didn't eat here as it seemed a bit more like " fast food", not our thing but it did look delicious. We were a couple and had great fun.
Simply the best. This water park never fails to impress. Even better if you're staying in a Jumeirah hotel as you get free entry before the public get access!

So much fun!. Went here for the day with my partner, we had a great time! It was expensive but definitely worth the money.Lots of slides for both single and double riders, one of the best I've been to.  There was a bit of rubbish around which would be the only thing I could say, and that was only noticeable because everything is so clean over there.
Plain ol' good water fun for kids and adults alike. Plain ol' good water fun for kids and adults alike. Entry is free when staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel.

Different options - not too crowded. We were here on a Saturday but it still didn't feel as crowded as Disney or Sesame Place. Excellent compact waterpark with a few rides that will surprise you even if you've been to waterparks in the NY/Orlando area. Well maintained, plenty of lifeguards all over.
Great day out . A little expensive. Tickets appear cheaper if you buy them on here. A great day out with something for all.
great fun. excellent family day out. we all enjoyed it. Suitable for extreme fun & also gentle rides. Get there early & allow a whole day.
Good fun!. Smallish water park but overall it's very good fun, maybe a little expensive but worth a visit. Some great slides here.

Fun water park. Visited this park a couple of times. It is set up the same way any of the water parks are in the USA. Offers good facilities and is a great day out. Obviously the water is a lot warmer than in most destinations in the summer and the hot weather is guaranteed!

Best water-park in the world. It is actually beyond the expectations. It is not so big like they have in US but nice way spread on the shore right next to the Jumeriah hotel on the Jumeriah beach. Plenty of new rides to try on. A very neat and clean place with good crowd including local and foreign nationals. There is a small horror park next to it is also a worth visit. Thank you.

Our favourite water park in Dubai . We have been to a lot of water parks in the US but this is probably our favourite. You never have to leave your dinghy as opposed to walking it around other water parks or carrying it upstairs. Here, they push you up the slide once you're already sitting in it. We had a great day here and can't wait to go back.

Small Waterpark ...but Big in fun for the family. As as guest of the adjoining Jumeirah Beach Hotel we had a private entrance and free access as often as we wanted! which was just great. Although small in scale compared to the other waterparks in Dubia it has plenty of fun for all the family!

Water fun!. Other than the cold water, I can't really find anything negative to say about such a fun place. I don't have many photos to share as camera was in the locker and I didn't have the right gears for my action camera (AEE)!We both had great fun and will be going back for more!!! =D Hopefully, I might be be able to upload photos later ;)

Full of joy. wear your swimming dress and get ready to the most exited water park ever. all type of rids and water activities are at this fine water park. If you are booking at Burj Alarab, your access is complementary.

Tonnes of fun for young and old!. The heat in Dubai in August is incredible so Wild Wadi was the perfect place to spend a free day in Dubai. Our boys aged 2 and 4 loved it and although they weren't able to go on many of the bigger rides (much to their disgust!) the kids area was awesome and big enough to keep them entertained for hours. Food and drinks were really expensive, but to be expected at places like these. Awesome view of the Burj Al Arab and a great spot to get pics in front of it near the kids area. Staff were super friendly, one guy walking us a long way to find the best spot to take our photo (and it WAS an awesome photo!)

Wonderful location, long interesting slides with beautiful views. Exiting location, long interesting slides with beautiful views, cheerful staff. We had a good time.Dislike. Small locker cost 40 Dhs, very expensive food, carry food with them is prohibited, towels for extra charge too, entrance to the beach for extra charge.
Let's our children's enjoy at Wild Wadi. Extremely professional water park. Well-done. Will back again with my family next year. Nice view from high sliding tower to Borj Al Arab.

Excellent water park. If trying to decide between this and aqua venture I would probably go for wild wadi, although they are both different. Wild wadi, changing room facilities, better organised. Felt like there were more rides at Aqua venture but it it felt busier. There was a beach at aqua venture you could use, both have lots of sun beds. If you love water parks do them both which i did. You will not be disappointed with either, both excellent.

Fun Birthday. Going to Wild Wadi was a great experience. I tried almost all the attractions. The waiting time wasn't long and I enjoyed every moment. Beware of the Tantrum Alley! Hold tight!!!!...and keep your eyes closed for Jumeirah Sceirah... Well, that's what I did when I saw I was about to get lauched like a rocket :))
Highlight of kids. I could not get my kids back to hotel, they loved it so much there, it's well maintained, clean and very family friendly, the slides the childre
Emotion. A great fun dayA bit pricey11 entertainmentIncredibly exciting experience free fall from a height of 30 meters

Good day at Wild Wadi. Had free access to Wild Wadi as staying at Jumeirah Emirates Towers, and went once. We arrived early in the morning just after opening and had done all the main rides at least once by lunchtime, so could easily fit it into a morning. Quite a small water park and none of the rides are particularly scary. Good fun day out.

Great day out. Great day out here spent full day here with friends not waiting long to get o. Rides and food stalls available all round was that great went back 2 time also tried out the Atlantis water park but this was our favourite this is for all ages as I travelled with group friends vary from 23 - 35
Fun in the sun. It's always fun to visit wild wadi. Time flies while you are enjoying each moment on the great slides and in the lazy rivers. I also love the seasonal offers they do.
Just Awesome. Loved the water park. Lots of activities. Fun in the sun with lots of sunscreen lol. Relaxing near the pool side and enjoying the view was beautiful. Hope you guys Enjoy.

I felt like a child again!. Running between rides and standing in line to go on each of them brought back a reminiscent rush. It's kind of cool how there's a sign before each ride that shows a scale of how thrilling the ride is. I didn't try the "surfing" rides, but I loved all the other ones. I even went on a few of them more than once! I didn't try the food because we spent three hours there and felt that it was sufficient.

Had a great time here, really fun place to visit.. We got complimentary tickets for the waterpark through our hotel. It was well worth the visit, great fun and the water slides, especially Tantrum Ally and the Scream - which was very intense. Really enjoyed my day there.

Much better than Altlantis water park. I had been here on my first ever visit to Dubai and oh my im so glad i did! This place really has a lot to offer and many different rides. Actually i didn't how good this is until i went to Atlantis water world which compared to this is pretty average. So yeah if you want to make a choice, i recommend Wild Wadi any given day! Plus the staff is really kind and friendly.

Great fun! . Wild Wadi wasn't originally on my itinerary but I'm so glad I made the time to visit. The water slides are great fun - the Jumeirah scream and the Burj surj were my favourites. The wrist bands are brilliant - so much easier paying for drinks and food with the bands rather than going back and forth to the lockers. I was really surprised at the price of food - I expected it to be the usual sky high prices like most parks but it was decent prices with quality food! I had a chicken kebab from the BBQ and it was delicious. Lovely views of the Burj too!

Great family day out , awesome fun but bit pricey!. We have been twice now and both times had a great day, it's not to big so,you can get round it and it's nice and compact, but with plenty to do and lots of great rides. The views of the Burj are fantastic. The children absolutely love it. The only downside is its pricey at over £50 each it's very expensive for a day out swimming.You could always buy an entertainer book and get a half price voucher!

Enjoyable through any mean and anytime during the year. This place is one of those places that you cannot get tired of. I have been there over ten times already and enjoy it every single time. Whether you are going in a small group, large group, or family, the rides are tons of fun. Its only down side is food quality and prices.

By far the best waterpark in the UAE (Maybe the word). I have been numerous time and it never gets old. The uniqueness of not having to walk to the top of the rides makes it a one off. Very well organised and not bad value. Highly recommended over Aquaventure or Yas Waterworld.
Small but nice . My daughter and wife went to the Wild Wadi Water park and it was a nice experience. They enjoyed all the water rides and it was quite clean and safe.

Super fun. Great rides for all ages, wristbands for lockers and cash so you don't have to carry any personal items around the park which is super convenient. Lots of food places.Separate male, female changing rooms, good showers, we went at Halloween and there was a free horror house as you leave, it featured zombies and it was sooooo scary!Definitely something to do in Dubai with the kids or even just the adults, was fun.

Water park. very expensive entry fee for what it is, 2nd visit here but had free vouchers from hotel. They rip you off with lockers the bigger the locker the more they charge and its not cheap. Very busy, food a rip off, but again on a hot day you cant beat a water park, there are a number of rides but you can do them all with in a few hours then it get repetitive, next time i will try the water park at the Palm, i am surprised Dubai not got more water parks. .

Had a nice time. This park is little small compared to others and is expensive. However, had an unforgettable experience by riding with my family in 'Tantrum Alley' .. it was scary though. I would recommend people to visit this on a working day to avoid crowding

Fun . It is a very fun place to be in dubai...however not much variety like the Yas water world in Abu Dhabi, the staff were amazing so friendly and welcoming.The food was so expensive, plus you can not bring in your own water so you had to buy the small bottle for 10AED which is crazy and not right
Fun day. Wild wadi water park is great fun for all ages. We had our 5 year old and he had a ball going up and down the water slides in the kids area.

Wild Wadi Water Park, Dubai. Have spent a day at the Wild Wadi on several different occasions. Especially when we have family staying with us. Everyone, of all ages, enjoy the experience and want to return when they visit again.
Good water park. As water parks go, this one is nice. Didn't really have to queue for anything. God facilities and food available. Lots of different options for children and families.
Always great fun!. Love this place, just so much to do. Can easily spend a whole day here. Lots of areas to soak up the sun in between rides. Great for kids too.
Too small and too crowded. Dubai's smallest water park. It is usually crowded and would rather recommend Atlantis on the palm for this purpose.

Great fun with the kids. Good fun place, well run, well maintained and just what you want from a water park. The attractions are varied and cater for most tastes, from tranquil and lazy floating around, to shear terror drops

Some awesome rides. Some rides are really awesome. Surfing one's are something remember. There are three restaurants which serve burgers, pizza and kebabs. Entry is bit costly but overall is good fun.

Great Water Park & Excellent Fundraiser. We went with our son's school as part of their fundraiser, and the kids had a blast, while the parents sat at the lounge seats. It was nice to have the park just for the families of the school, but this park can be enjoyed at any time. There are many rides/attractions that offer a range of activities for any level of adventure.TIP: Like most places, avoid during the weekend, and be sure to double check ahead of time if the park is open to the public as there are many evenings that the park is reserved for special events or 'Ladies Night.'

Enjoyable, but over priced. A relatively old park now, that has made some good additions to try and maintain interest levels. The two raft rides, Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj are certainly great fun, however please note Tantrum Alley is certainly not for the faint hearted. The rest of the park remains the same from when it first opened and to be honest it shows. Considering the price they charges to day guests I can not say that this is a value for money day out. Don't even get me started on the price of food and beverages inside the park. At least they don't stop you taking in water, 1 litre per guest if memory serves me correct.To put my review in to some kind of perspective, I had recently visited two water parks in Florida, USA. Both parks were well over 10years old, however both parks offered far more by way of thrills, spills and excellent value for money. Unfortunately Wild Wadi receives just 3 (Average) mostly due to the exorbitant pricing.

It's good but not great..!. We stayed in the Zabeel Saray so we got free entry... Considering there is so much growth & building it could be bigger & better. Massively aimed at kids, not big kid rides really. Glad we did not pay entry but a fun afternoon out. Walked & rode most of the rides within 2 hrs. I'm sure if I had kids I'd look at it differently...
One of the best memories.. I had an amazing time here, I will never forget the memories made. I laughed so much, it was great! Highly recommend and there's so much to do you won't get bored!

Old in the tooth - go to Atlantis. I used to love this place but as with most things in dubai, something turns out bigger and better and that is aquaventure at Atlantis. It's a shame as wild wadi was so good- it's now a low end venue with the lower end tourist attending - avoid it if you can unless you are on a tight budget when it is still great - it's just that there is something better and why choose second best ?

Wet & Wild. One of the highlights for kids visiting Dubai. To fully enjoy your visit plan on spending the entire day here & get there early to book the best spots. Access to the park is pricey. If you can get an entertainer & use the buy 1 get 1 free vouchers if traveling in large groups. Also no outside food or drinks are allowed so budget for an expensive outing. The gazebos on the upper level directly opposite the kids zone & beach had amazing views of the park as well as the Burj Al Arab directly behind. Enjoy the park to your hearts content & after lunch chill on the lazy river. Too many thrills to mention so get there early & do each slide as least once.

Great fun for the family.. Really loved our time here.Great slides and rides. The waiting time might be long at times but totally worth it.\The downside: the food is far from great. But then again, it wouldn't be fair to berate them for that as it is not a resto :)Tip: try the Jumeirah Scarah

Nice for kids, OK for adults ;). Not so many attractions, but there is whole range of attractions, suitable for small kids to adrenalin lovers. If you have luck, it might not be crowded, otherwise expect some waiting times at most popular attractions ;)

Thanks to Mr Aboud. I wanted to thank Mr. aboud (see photo) . I've lost my car keys and my apartment keys in the slides and Mr Aboud and his team diden everything so that they find them. Bravo their professionalism.

Fantastic visit. I visited Wild Wadi with my Mum after receiving free tickets with our local Jumeirah hotel. Although we aren't massively into water slides/rides we thought a change of scenery and a different pool would be nice. The place is wonderful, very modern with a great theme throughout. The water park is serviced brilliantly by the staff, very clean, organised and overseen by numerous lifeguards.We sat mainly around the large wave pool where there were comfortable sun chairs, free towels and free water aids. We went on the lazy river in rubber rings, which was so relaxing in the hot sun.The whole experience really exceeded our expectations and encouraged us to attend again the following day!
day visit. hated it, long lines to wait for rides, horrible food and not what I would expect from Dubai. Atlantis is much better

FAMILY VISIT. Love Love Love this Park = we had a great family day out - so many different types of rides not seen elsewhere and not too spread out - wish we could have had another day there and Im not normally a great fan of water parks

Suited us both. We got free entry as part of our hotel deal and whereas I like the rides my wife prefers to just sit in the sun so it suited us both perfectly. After finding a suitable spot by the wave pool I left her to it and went to check out the rides. There are varied rides to suit all ages and tastes and there were few queues so not much waiting. The scariest is the one with a vertical drop at the start which you won't like if you don't like confined spaces as they lock you in a tube before counting down and taking the floor away. It's easy to spend the day here with lots of shady places if you want to keep out of the sun and both my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, despite our different ways of spending the time.
Fun place! Not cheap. Save money, by not renting a locker and bring your own towels. Come early before the crowds hit, opens at 10am! Bring friends that like rides you like as in the thrill factor.

Fun In The Sun For Young and Old Alike. This really is a fun experience and one you should try at least once if you are staying at any of the Jumeirah properties.It is fun for young and old. You can either go on the bigger water rides or just bob along on the lazy river.Would definitely recommend a visit for all age groups.

Been over 5 times now and never get bored of this place. When I first went to Dubai with my mates we went to Walk Wadi and it was a Day to remember. That was back in 2005. Fast forward a few years and I went back with my wife as I got married shortly afterwards and she loved in and so did I.Now We have kids its a must go for Dubai. Its friendly for kids and they always seem to keep adding new rides to keep the momentum going.  If you have kids and want to have some fun then this is the place.PS: Dont be put off that its a waterpark. Most people think its all underwater but its not. If you cant swim it makes no difference as it caters for everyone.
Go! go! go! . Would highly recommend it for a day out. Very busy on the weekend (from &sat) but worth visiting in the week.
Fun experience . Worth a visit especially if you have kids. Slides are fun and the whole facility is well maintained.

Had a Blast with Friends. I am a sucker for waterparks and so are my companions, so when we went to Dubai we immediately decided to visit Wild Wadi.We got a discount with the entrance fee (buy 1 get 1) from that book of coupons they sell in UAE. Wild wadi was for me beyond great. We stayed there the whole day and still can't get enough of it.The place is enjoyable for both adults and children.The staffs were friendly and helpful, the rides were exciting! I would personally recommend trying Jumeirah Sceirah it was scary at first but once you've tried it, you would definitely want to do it again!

Amazing family treat. According to my kids aged 13 /17 and 25, this is the best aqua park they have been to and we travel quite a bit in europe and the arab world. there is a lot to do even for the parents who can lounge and dine and maybe swim in the wave pool and for some quiet, head to the beach.
Loved the place with my son. One of the must be seen place in Dubai. I enjoyed with my son so much that we loved to go back again.

Well worth visiting but use ENTERTAINER vouchers. Me and my partner visited here in Thursday 5th of November. Excellent day - stayed about 5 hours! Well worth going but quite pricey full price. We used the 2 for 1 entertainer vouchers which are well worth getting (we got the booklets of eBay - they are worth getting just for wild wadi vouchers) Saved about 300 dirham (60 quid)! Probably wouldn't have gone without vouchers. Good range of rides! The master blaster was amazing! Quite unique rides such as bodyboarding and surfing all included too! Was reasonably quite at beginning of day, short queues later in the day but didn't have to wait long at all! Staff all really friendly (which seems to be the case across a lot of Dubai!) Would definitely go here again!
Kids paradise. We went on all the water rides fun variety daring and parts to relax while the kids revisited every ride 10 to 20 times, no queues and we spent the whole day at the park.

Great waterpark . A variety of slides, and family friendly rides. From easy to brave. All family loved them. Relax by the pool. Avoid holidays, Fridays and Saturdays if you can as ques are longer. Charge wrist bracelet with money for easy spending inside, for locker, water and drinks. Half a day is enough. Avoid eating there as the variety of food is poor and prices high. Meals are American size, we found it difficult to find a kids size meal.

Great day out. Went here with my two children aged 5 and 8 after visiting aqua adventure. This was the best water park for the children as my 5 year old fell short of the height limitations at aqua adventure. At wild wadi they were both able to enjoy nearly all the rides and they both thoroughly enjoyed the surf and wave board area.
