We did not have to queue for the rides at all throughout the day which was great. I did find this park a little bit more expensive than aqua adventure (as aqua adventure had entry and meal deals). Other than that we had a fantastic time.

A great day out with the kids. Our stay at the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray included a complimentary day here; I went with my wife, two kids and some friends and their son. Complimentary towels are provided. The park, despite being built in the late 1990s is well maintained and doesn't feel tired. Its location adjacent to the Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach hotels gives it an imposing outlook. It is quite compact compared to 'Aquaventure' at the Atlantis, which we went to a couple of years ago and not so open or aesthetically pleasing, but the rides are nevertheless fantastic. Tantrum Alley was probably the most thrilling for me with Jumeirah Sceirah close behind. The latter was over very quickly and riders are at risk of scraping their shoulder blades on the way down, as I did. There are plenty of loungers or chairs available around the park and lockers at a charge, should you need them. The lunchtime food was reasonably priced, particularly when compared to food and drink at our hotel! I particularly liked the facility of being able to 'load' your wrist band with money to use around the park for food, lockers etc. in the absence of your wallet - any balance remaining is refunded in cash at the end of your day. All in all a great day out with the kids and no sign of any massive queues for taxis when we left!
Nice rides and clean. Nice rides and clean, but too expensive for the amount of rides on offer. Not so much value for the money!

According to Kids: BEST DAY EVER. WOW is the only way to describe the day out at Wild Wadi. I don't know if it was made better by the fact that the venue itself wasn't crazy busy but it was brilliant. Arrived at 11am and left at 5pm only because we had another engagement that day. Whether you are a 3 year old (my youngest) or a lot older, there was so much on offer. The drop, the waves the kiddy pool. Just about everything. And if you wanted to just chill, there were so many options available. Even the food at the venue was considerably reasonably priced when compare with the other Water park at the Atlantis. The kids loved every second of their time there and we the adults were in full agreement. JUST DO IT

Good fun, no queues which is great!. Had free entry to this attraction as we were staying at the Dar al Masyaf next door. The Wild Wadi is quite a small waterpark but the rides are great. Jumeirah Scream is amazing I have never come off a water ride with my legs shaking before! The build up when you are locked in the pod is pretty terrifying and I normally love this sort of thing the feeling when the floor falls away and you are falling vertically is pretty intense but very exhilarating. The two huge ring rides are great especially Tantrum Alley which is a real adrenalin rush, at one point it feels like you are being flung off the ride. Master Blasters are good too a series of water jets which push you uphill all around the park. Well worth a visit it was quiet so were able to go on everything in a few hours. If I was paying I might be tempted to go to Atlantis, but as this place was free, we could get there by buggy and was on our doorstep it could not be beat. Like most of Dubai all the staff were very friendly and helpful..

great day out. Great day out for the family - Wild Wadi is not as big as the american / Disney water park but there are more than enough slides and rides to keep the kids interested. Well worth a visit especially if you are staying in a Jumeirah Hotel as the entrance is complimentary
fun place for family.... we never visited such a family friendly place around the world, very nice people and affordable price on everything aound. Life guard Alper was very attentive.....

brilliant day out. A lovely water park, with great slides and attractions, good for family or just for adults wanting a fun day out! Really enjoyable and impressive due to views of the Burj Al Arab right next to it

Wild wadi day. Had a fab day at Wild Wadi. The rides were all great, and the food was such good value for money. We got there for about 11 and it was just beginning to get busy. My favourite was the wild waveS...such good fun and after going on a few rides we would always come back to the wild waves..great for kids too as they had fab life jackets and jackets for adults too....we got the vouchers from the Entertainer so for myself and my daughter I paid £50. It was a real relaxed atmosphere and we were able to leave our belongings on the deck chairs and no one touched them. We did have to wait about 45 mins for a taxi when leaving but you do have the option to use the posh lexus taxis. This water park caters for all age groups...I think I would love to have an adult only day...it would be so much fun:) a definite must when you visit Dubai.

its good. Wild wadi is a good place to go , and appreciate that they have "lady nights" were no males are allowed to enter .. anyhow wild wadi deserves 5 starts when Yas water land was built .. but now i prefer has water land in abu dhabi much more than wild wadi .. but they are both fun at the end :D

Great Fun. Its a good family day out, or couples. Plenty of different rides, and the water is warm, makes for a good day. The Burg Al Arab is right beside it, making a lovely setting too. It is attached to the Jameirah(not spelt right) Hotel.

Good park - been to bigger. Loads of loungers. Liked the wristband/locker system. Food was pretty good. But definitely felt like we had done it all in 4 hours. But good day out - kids liked and had a good time.

Nice little water park. Not that many attractions, but it's in really good conditions. Later in afternoon the park get little bit full and you can be waiting in line for up to half an hour. Food and drinks are not cheap, but it's Jumairah beach in Dubai, so what would one expect.

Great day out for kids. Organize your exit though!. Great day out for the whole family with some pretty exhilarating rides. Friendly and efficient life guards plentiful and lots of eateries. Only irritation of the day was the hours wait for a taxi afterwards. Not sure if this is a usual problem but strongly suggest you get yourself organised for your own pick up slightly away from their exit to avoid the howls of protest of queue jumping you will certainly get! :-)

Good family fun. Visited twice during our holiday and my children loved it. The park is clean, the staff are excellent and the rides are fabulous. We thought the range and quality of the food very good and reasonably priced, which is good because entry to the park is pricey. Wished the metro ran to the park as if you are not staying in a nearby hotel getting a taxi can be a nightmare. Most people leave the park in the late afternoon when the taxi shifts change and both times we left we had to wait over an hour for a taxi. We also found it disappointing that the park shut at 6,30pm. We thought it would stay open much later than that. There seems little reason for it to close so early given the staggeringly good year round climate Dubai enjoys, but these are small gripes - overall we had a fab time and will visit again when we return.

Very good but limited rides. Was a brilliant park, we arrived at around 11am and there was barely anyone there. We got on all the rides straight away but found that there were not as many rides as I'd expected. All in all the rides were brilliant, we didn't have to que and staff were pleasant. Would definitely recommend.
Worth visiting. Good for family, clean and good, but in some places are noisy, reasonable price. The staff excellent and there is a good range of food and drink

Birthday Surf Surprise. My wife was in the Wild Wadi on her birthday, surfing on the Flowrider. Unfortunately I was at work but I told the Wadi about my wife's birthday. The lifeguards all wished her happy birthday and made her day really special. Thank you wild wadi and your excellent lifeguards.

Water park fun. Read on here pre visit to wild wadi and could have been put off by some of the comments. Yes it's not as big as some of the better known ones in America, but I honestly see that as part of the charm, because of the size we had no problems whatsoever with leaving my 12 year old son to do his thing, safe in the knowledge that he would always find his way back. The rides were very good with plenty of life guards at hand should they be needed. The only negative we had as a group was that the food vendors didn't really cater for us...we have a milk intolerant child and up to today we hadn't come across any issues throughout our stay in Dubai maybe that is something wild wadi could maybe look at?
Great aqua park for smaller children. If you have a smaller children around 4-12, it is a perfect park for you. Surroundings is nice for parents.

Must do - pricey but great day out. Would give it 5, but it is very expensive, event though we had entertainer vouchers.To get lockers (about £8) and towels (about £7 to borrow) its extra on top -really should have been included in the £55 entry fee. Food is pricey but very nice. However, the place is amazing. Really clean with amazing customer service and cheerful staff. Great day out.Didnt like the fact they didnt have any hair dryers in the changing rooms.....especially in a Muslim country, where they know women will need to tie hair up and put a hijab over the top when they leave...queue an extremely wet head that lead to headache :( Also, queuing up for taxi took 40minutes! so factor that in as well.but defo do it!! any questions, feel free to ask :)

Fun day out at the Wild Wadi!!!!. As we stayed with a jumeirah hotel we were given complimentary access to this water park and a free bus ride there.Arrived around 10am and had to que for about 20 mins or so. A tip when buying tickets. You will probably need a locker to keep your clothes and bags in etc. If you're buying a ticket or getting in for free save time buy asking them to load the wristband so you can use a locker. It costs to do so and you can pick a small or large. Small locker is ample to store 2 people's stuff in. Lots of things to see and do whilst there. A must do is the slide is the Jumeirah Sceirah. Wow what a water slide. Crazy adrenaline rush, super scary but definately worth a go even if you are a wimp like me. Glad I was able to say I did it. Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley were great. When heading to Flood River Flyer this was pretty weird to find. Keep your eyes peeled. You've got to cross the river flowing. Definately worth a go though.Plenty of food places to eat and lots of places to catch some sun or stay in the shade. A great spot to chill was on a roof terrace facing the Burj Al Arab. We managed to spend 8 hours at the park and didn't get bored. We also purchased a little something from the shop. This is a must do especially if you get in for free!!!!
fun day. you will need to stay there full day to have fun with family and children but you will bay a lot of money.

Good park, must visit in Dubai. . Good fun for all the family, many of the rides are for adults/kids over 1.1mFood and drinks quite expensive and weekends are extremely busy. Try the summer months when it's quieter. UAE residents discounts and entertainer vouchers taken.

it was fun. i visited this place twice already this year and i can say that i was really fun and can made you relax away from work.. the place can give you a wonderful day that last atleast a few weeks.. the place was clean and relaxing..

Best waterpark. This is by far the best waterpark I have ever visited. The 3 times I was there it was never too crowded. We never had long waits for the slides! The water temperature is nice and warm. I loved the artificial wave
fun. this s one of the best waterparks in dubai.. where rides for all ages available. someone seeking thrill or something like a lazy river..

Love this water park. Fantastic, if you haven't been before it's really worth visiting. Lots to do, and you spend the whole day there. Rides are great, and vary for all excitement levels, even just floating round the river in a tube is a great way to top up the tan.

Fun fun fun. Amazing
You never get board of the place.
With all the slides that make you enjoy the place I highly recommend this place for everyone who loves water parks

Highly recommended it. I have not been to Atlantis so I can not do a direct comparision, I decided to visit this park as I got a complimentary ticket as I was staying on the Palm. I was told that this park is older but was surprised on how nice it was. The location is excellerant you can see the burj as a backdrop throughout the park, the rides have a good mixtures for all ages and plenty to do. I would try Atlantis next time not because I didn't enjoy it but so I can compare it.
Fun splash!. It has different swirl & splash rides! It it free for hotel guests! It gets crowded though. But definitely a great fun for familes!

Nice but busy. We had a great time at the park. The only turndown was the long cues sometimes and a bit overcrowded. Besides that enjoy your time with family (and choose wisely the time of the year ... Past may might be a bit too hot to spend the whole day on the sun )

Loved it!. I am not a water park lover, and it was with a bit of reluctance and trepidation that I allowed myself to be talked into going along. My cunning plan was to drift round in the lazy river for a couple of hours............. but I have never experience a lazy river like this in my life. Fantastic! Exhilarating! I got so carried away with enthusiasm for the lazy river, I did it a few times and even ventured onto the family raft ride for 'intense thrill'.Definitely worth a visit to this water park!
must do for children. one of the many water parks..although I prefer the atlantis one..you should use entertainer vouchers here
Brilliant. Had a fantastic day here with my son (14) and we didn't stop all day. The food was better than i expected and the price was reasonable.
AAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!. Just fun for the whole family. For little ones there is enough to do, for big ones..there is some serious sliding to be done here..
fun day out. fun day at the water park. loves the uphill water jets and the lazy river. was quite expensive all in all but was a fun day

Brilliant. Spent a brilliant day here with a very excited eight year old.It's not the biggest water park in the world, and doesn't have an amazing number of slides, and it's not cheap. But despite all this it was great. It wasn't too busy, there were lots of sunbeds available, all the staff were brilliant and there is a good range of food and drink on offer.

Fab place not as expensive as I expected . Great place for the day book book in advance and go on line and get a Sirius points card for Jumeira hotels. We paid £149 for four by booking direct before we arrived so no queue. You then get 10-25% off ticket price and everything you buy on the day but to be Jones £10 ( not including discount) for a burger, fries and large drink was not bad as the food was lovely ! Cost around £35 for four towels to hire and a locker but go early or you'll have no where to sit. We stayed from 10.30 until 6 and loved it. Hardly any queues and immaculately clean. Nightmare getting a taxi after though. We waited an hour so if you can pre book I suggest you do.
Very Dissapointed. I was quite shocked how busy this place was, there was not a chair in sight and some of the rides had a wait time of 45 mins - only went the once and vowed not to go back again.

Pleasant Water Park. We decided on this park after looking at reviews and speaking to locals in Dubai. First of all it is not cheap at over 170 pounds for a group of 3 but when you consider you are entertained for 7/8 hours it is bearable.There are plenty of rides varying from leisurely through to the heart stoppers. There are always plenty of rings to ride and loads of lifeguards keeping an eye on you.There are plenty of beds throughout the park with welcome shade available if you are smart at picking the right ones.The parks location also affords you some excellent photo opportunities to get the Burj Al Arab in the background.One tip worth bearing in mind is that you are allowed to take in your own water rather than purchasing inside, but you are not allowed to take in food. We did eat in the park and it was pretty decent although a bit on the expensive side.So even considering the pricey entry costs it is a grand day out in pleasant and very clean surroundings.

Great fun but food allergy sufferers, take your own food! . We had a fab day.It was really expensive so worth looking for a voucher before you go. We went with a 7 and 5 year old and they loved it (as did we). We went on a week day so didn't have to queue for more than 10 mins for a ride. It gets busier after 3pm.The kids loved the wave pool (life jackets provided make it really fun and safe!), there is also a water soft play area that we all enjoyed for hours. Plenty of sun beds / chairs to rest but we didn't actually have the time to use them. 2 family members are coeliac and the website says the park caters for food allergies - however only safe thing we found to eat was a plate of water melon. The fast food restaurant offered to make separate chicken for us but weren't that keen to do it and we didn't want to risk it for cc so turned it down. When we went to the food carts the person told us nothing was gf either. Also beware - magnums in Dubai (only ice cream they offered) contain wheat - they are different to the U.K.So go along, have fun but on arrival when they check your bag to remove food, it is advisable that you insist you must take in that food or maybe call in advance as they may be able to prepare something in advance if they are prepared for your visit.

Great. Compact water park offering a decent choice of water thrills. Wave pool and kids splash zone with the mandatory bucket spill for the smaller ones and Tantrum Alley, Burj Surge, Jumeirah Scarer for the older thrill seekers. Lazy river ride and plenty of sunbeds for mum. Operates a scary Haunted House walk through experience during October months which im told is very good and realistic. Towels, suncream, water shoes etc all available onsite and you can charge to your room via a wristband if staying locally at the Jumeirah Hotels.

Great day out. What a great day out, either as a family or as a couple. There are what I would term exciting rides but also a number of rides for the less adventurous. Most enjoyable. The availability of various food/drinks outlets make a visit all the more enjoyable.

Great water park but expensive day out. Went with my husband and 17year old daughter. We got there as it opened and it takes a while to get your admission sorted. It is a very expensive day out costing us around £200 in total. Roughly £50 entrance fee each. Cost about £25/30 for three burgers, fries and drinks. Other purchase was locker rental and 150 dirhams for photos taken during the day.....got them done as a digital download so got 11 photos that we had taken for that price. That said what a great water park. Very evident throughout the day was how polite, friendly and efficient ALL staff were. We didn't find it too crowded, we got sun loungers easy enough but we were there as it opened. When you pay to get in you get a "watch" which you can load cash onto for spending during the day which saves you keeping your purse out with you and can leave it in the lockers.if you don't spend everything on your "watch" they give you the cash back at the end of the day. Lots of photographers around so plenty of photo ops and we didn't feel pressured to buy. On leaving we tried the Halloween basement a walk through horror experience. I bottled it within the first 2 mins but hubby continued on said it was good. Only lasted a few mins. Left around 5pm and had quite a wait for a taxi, apparently this is around the shift turn over time, was a bit of a pain but the taxi system is very well organised so we eventually got home.

Nice water park with long slides. Loved the water park, very clean as everything in Dubai. Our hotel (Jumeirah Zabeel Saray) provides free shuttle bus to go there and a free entrance and towels. The lockers we had to buy ourselves and we were not informed of that, so spend some time going back to the shop to buy lockers (three sizes, large one was whopping 65 dirhams). You get a wrist watch at the gate and you can load money to it to pay for locker, food, drinks etc. The locker can be opened as many times as you wish, which was not clear to us in the beginning. The staff was very helpful and friendly.We enjoyed the wave pool (plenty of life jackets in all sizes, if somebody is not a good swimmer), the eleven slides ride (just suberb! One or two person floaters and the waterway goes up and down all in one go. They had personnel in the water to help you if needed) and the multi-person raft slide (was great and less intimitating than it seemed. Took awhile to climb up to the highest point in the park for the slide). We did not try the one that drops straight down in the beginning. Also skipped the surfing.Took refreshing pina colada slush and eat potato skins in Juha's family kitchen. One reason for the missing one star was the food choises, fried or pizza with expensive prices, the other was the confusing beginnings. It would help to have signs explaining things when one queues in,p. There would be plenty of time to read and understand how things work and how much money would one like to load on the wrist watch thingy.There was a nice sun bed area facing the Burj Al Arab hotel, away from the bustle below. There is no access to the beach, fences and a walk path separate it. Cabanas are tucked in between the fence and the lazy river, but we didn't buy them. Cabana users seemed to have a fast pass lane for the water slides.Will go back if ever I am in Dubai.

A fun day out of school holidays. We had a great day, but does get crowded-some people struggled to find sun loungers. Expensive, poor quality food which we expected, but lovely views of the Burj Al Arab and JBH. Good clean facilities and friendly staff.
Fabulous way to spend an afternoon.. Thoroughly enjoyed the water park. Lots of great tubes , safe and easy to yes. Cost want cheap, however it was in line with here in Australia.
great experience. we had so much fun at this waterpark! Definatelly worth a visit! food is great and there is lots of rides that kids and adults would enjoy!
An unexpected day out. A very interesting and lively water park for two 50 years old plus.I bet the younger generation love it,we certainly did
Expensive but an amazing day out!. Do give this a try, each time I have travelled to Dubai i ensure this is on my list of things to do! Always such a fun day out!

really good for the kids. Some awesome adult rides (2 or 3); everything else is a little more for kids but still very good fun. Queues are actually very short. The food is ok (fast food mostly, but a BBQ later on in the day). You can wear what you'd wear at any international waterpark. The staff are all extremely pleasant and knowledgeable. the entire experience was fun and relaxed, with excellent picture opportunities, we never felt rushed or unsafe. Just enjoy the flood river as many times as you want, we went around that thing for hours. pretty good day out.
Amazing Water Park. They have so many fun activities in it. I loved all the slides and the others. It is a great place to relax yourself in the summer.

Water RIde Lover. Must visit place in dubai , The park is a Very good place to spend time with your family. There is something for all age groups. The management of the water park deserves praise for keeping it clean, safe and exciting. The food outlets have plenty of variety on offer and are well prepared. but very limited ride, but one the best ride if the world

Burg Surgem or Tantrum Alley. Both are great, and you will be sure to have a preference off one over the other. Overall, we preferred this Water Park rides to those in Adventure land, but this might have more to do with the excess heat on the day we went to the latter park which did make it unpleasant under foot at times.

Super Duper!. very nice and advanced and big water park, has many many water sliders and other thrilling activities, a bit crowded as you need to wait between 15-30 minutes to access some games, but its worth it! highly recommended, also i have accessed the horror room they have, it was nice but it can be much better, food court were available,recommended for singles, couples and amazing for families i guess.

great water park don't miss it. yes if your in Dubai then go to it its worth the money and yes you can spend all day in it and the staff are great lots to do and great fun warning you will get seriously wet!

There is something for everyone.. I liked the wild wadi park when i visited it . Although there are only 11 rides out of which only 7 or 8 is accessible by adults it is overall a fun experience. You can expect a waiting of 15 minutes in every ride. The best time to visit the park is from 3 pm to 7 pm. The tickets are bit on the expensive side snd you can choose other water parks in the same rate but this is one of the best water parks in dubai. Recommend to not to go on friday or Saturday.

A great water park . A great water part good family time The prices and tickets are on the expensive side but thats expected. .Its right next to Jumerah Village Highly recommend it for family fun and entertainment

Nice family gateway. We visited wild wadi with the entire family. It was an favourite with the kids the centre has many attraction all of them involves water rides a bit expensive but worth it no food or water is allowed as it has its own restaurants the prices are bit high
Good fun. Not as good as the Aquaventure Waterpark but still good fun if you are at Jumeriah beach. More target to children than adults.

Great Value Water Park. Definitely the better of the 2 water parks in Dubai. Friendly and helpful staff, better prices and better food than its neighbour on the palm. Great for kids but they really should be over 1.1 meters tall to fully enjoy the rides.
great family day out. there are plenty to do for all ages as well as numerous places to get out of the sun or sunbathe. The wave pool was excellent

Good Fun. We came here 2 hours after arriving in Dubai. Found the place fun and it kept the kids going for that extra few hours. Food price was reasonable for an attraction like this ( like most places they have captive audience ) Rides can take a little time but all theme parks are the same overall well worth it.
Very fun time. A very nice experience for everyone and a lot of fun. Tasty snacks and friendly staff. A nice day-trip!

A nice waterpark but overcrowded and overpriced.. A nice waterpark but overcrowded and overpriced. Almost 80 $ entrance fee PP plus food on average 30-40$ PP seems to me too expensive. If you go with family prepare to spend approximately 400-500$. Located next to the Burj Al Arab hotel and Jumeirah beach hotel.

Too small and overloaded of people. In my opinion the place is way too small compare to the amount of people allowed to enter the park. Make sure you arrive at the start of the park otherwize you will spend your day in queues.. The "lazy" river becomes a nightmare due to the overload of people. In regards to the food only fat nd unhealthy food is on the menu. You pay double for a salad.. The kind of place you really want to avoid. I recommend other water parks in Dubai or Abu dhabi that have way more rides and way more space!
the best. the oldest and the best waterpark in UAE. Very green, with nice games, good service and gooooood food!

Very exciting . 5 hours of fun and excitement, the place is wonderfully located, rides are ranked from relaxing to intense thrill, we loved Jumeirah Sceirah and Tantrum Alley and the final surprise with spooky halloween, it wasn't crowded so we tried all rides, which are actually limited, in short time then we repeated. We bought our tickets from the website with 200 dirhams including a medium value meal and spooky Halloween entrance while it was 295 in the ticket office. Spectacular experience in the heart of Dubai which is really recommended

Nice if you've never been before. As the title says, went first time to a waterpark weather is brilliant in Dubai so just adds extra to the fun day. . The slide forgot the name but it's the scariest one. Ooo that was good you get locked in a plastic compartment and the floor moves away down you go! Good thrill.I went alone with adults, for children they will not beable to go on all rides there are 11 rides in total. If child is under 8 he can only go in 3/4 rides so a money waste for them. Showers are v.cleanPrice is allot especially when you again need to pay for using their lockers. £50 plus more. We brought our tickets from our hotel 15 dirhams less then the website price. Outside taxi takes 30 mins to come so traveling at the end can be a issue. First time entertainment good but not for repeating.
Super fun. We always enjoy Wild Wadi, food can have a bit of a upgrade for vegetarians. Lots of rides, kids love it.
just made our trip wonderful. it was amazing day spent at wild-wadi.. with safe, clean, hygienic and quality entertainment.. anybody having spare day in Dubai should not miss this fun..

Good fun. I enjoyed this place and the rides were fun. They had a really cool haunted house, so bonus points for that. Beautiful view of the Burj al Arab. Unfortunately the staff was almost useless. We waited probably 20 min for a pizza and then it was clear they didn't make it or gave it away, so we waited another 20 min. We pre-bought a towel and then had to wait in a long line at a second register to pick up the towel. I didn't go to the Atlantis or Yas, so I cannot really compare the attractions, but I liked Wild Wadi.
Expensive but Worth It. amazing experience having tried almost every rides available. exciting and have a lots of fun thrilling experience

Nice place . Nice place to refresh your self in your off day The park is quite big and different things to do there . Staff are helpful and offering any information or guides that you need Only that the price is little bit expensive for food
Great Fun. Want to keep kids entertained fun for adults and kids. Splash and try the slides great fun. a brill Dubai attraction. Great staff very much a Jumeriah Hotel Group 5 star experience.

Expensive . The park is nice and fun. Life guards really friendly but is too expensive for what it offer. There are only 2 good attractions for adults. Others are for kids or just slow. They should build more adult slides..

Excellent Waterpark. First day on arrival at Dubai we hit Wild Wadi, all i can say is that it's a great waterpark and has many rides and a brilliant view of Jumeirah beach hotel and Burj Al Arab! Used Entertainer voucher for a healthy discount making it even better!

Fun day out. It was a great day out with lots of fun rides to do. There was lots of friendly lifeguards around and lots of nice pools. A great thing to go do if you want to go on a day out. The food was also very good.
Life Refreshed. A great place to cool off in the summer, great food, help staff and a ton of fun with the water slides.

Perfect summer splash for family. I was planning to visit this place quite a while and finally got opportunity to visit this place last week. My daughters was very excited after seeing their website and when we reached there, our experience was better then what we expected. My quick review here....Location: Perfect, centrally located next to Hotel Burj Al Arab (Very close to Mall of Emirates)Parking: Available for visitors (Also close to Metro)F&B: They have options inside the water parkFacility: I was amazed, place is neat and clean, they have staff and lifeguard all over to help you.Rides: Oh, lots of options, make sure you reach there on time so that you can enjoy all of them.
Super fun place. Amazing place ,we had great time ,water slides are very nice, just when you go there take swimming suit;towel and slippers as these things are quite expensive to buy it there

Great fun but very expensive . This was a really good day out and although quite busy queues move quickly. Some really good rides like the jumerieh screamer and white water wadi. In comparison to other water park this is pretty steep even with a 2 for 1 voucher. U.K. Equivalent is £50pp plus extras for locker hire and food/drink. You need to spend a full day here to make it worth while and ensure you get a 2 for 1 deal
water water everywhere. great few hrs to spend in afternoon as it keeps you cool and out of the direct heat of the sun all rides were fab

"My favorite". Wild Wadi Water Park is my all time favorite. Just collecting some friend and going there is best adventures in Dubai that we do. The best part of Wild Wadi Water Park is to go to slides you have escalate provided unlike other water park you have to climb all way.

A splendid place but overcrowded. The rides are exhilarating with world class facilities.Better to reach there as early as possible if you wish to take all the rides, as there is a long line for every ride. its next to Burj Al Arab you can reach there by bus no 88.

Fabulous day out. We've visited twice on different trip to visit family. Both times were great. The rides were well managed with lots of staff around to make sure the rides were working and help if needed. Everything's clean and looks well maintained although we didn't go everywhere. The queues weren't too long on either visit for the rides we went on. When you go in you can charge up a wristband to pay for food and drinks during the day - to save you carrying cash. All in all we had a great time. I've not done many water parks but this is a favourite.

One of the best water parks in world. After experiencing Sunway Lagoon at KL Malaysia and Adaland at Kussadasi, Turkey, I can rate wild wadi as best of the best, when it comes to water parks. It has dozens of exciting rides and a great overall ambiance. If you are a water lover, this is the place to be when in Dubai. Park has so much to offer so to enjoy it optimally, one has to go early and plan well on the map. Some rides and pools may captivate you and you would miss many of the other exciting attractions so plan your time intelligently. Entry fee is little steep but guys, it definitely provides value for money. While using rides and attractions, boxers, dress shorts and nickers are not allowed so don't forget to bring proper swimming shorts and costumes as inside they are very expensive. Go light, as using in-park lockers can be tricky and would waist a lot of time/money. Do bring a water-proof case/jacket for your cell phone or buy 1 inside to have great selfies on your own phone. Many park-providing camera men but very expensive.
REMEMBER !!!!. Remember shoes !!!! the stones in the park are SUPER hot , and dont forget water els you will be ill in just 15 min there is NO wind in the park .

Had an amazing time!! Loved Jumeirah Sceirah!. We went there with family. Everyone had an amazing time enjoying in their own type of rides. We got some discount vouchers otherwise ticket costs are a bit on the higher side. The atmosphere was thrilling due to Halloween. Not to forget "jumeirah sceirah" almost gave me a heart attack. It is a ride I have never experienced beforeWave pool is small compared to the park. Other arrangements are fantastic. "Tantrum alley" "burj surj" are my second favourite (after "jumeira sceria") and went in these rides twice. Thank you for allowing to use Sports camera on rides, I can take my memories with me :) Overall a wonderful experience... DO add more rides!!!!!

All high thrilling rides. This is completely a water theme park, wild wadi doesn't have much rides in numbers.. around 15 rides only, but have to say all rides are high thrilling. you will enjoy and cherish the day u spent at wild wadi..

A fun rollercoaster ride on water. Recently we visited the Wild Wadi Waterpark and both children and adults enjoyed themselves immensely. Staff were friendly and helpful and the amenities were clean and safe. Good, clean fun was had by all.

A very unique day. An excellent facility. Plan to spend the whole day their. Be prepared to que for most of the attractions. Not a quite place to relax . Good if you have family you want to entertain and keep in one locality. We found it a very tiring day. But if the plan is to tire the children out before bedtime. Then this place succeeded. Well run and a good fun. Children will enjoy.

good family time. wild wadi is right beside burj ul arab, on jumeriah beach rd. Every cab driver knows it so its not hard to find.while enjoying lazy river u take pics with Burj al arab in the background. staff is very friendly. rides are awesome, u can spend 3-4 hrs depending on your group or number of people. food stalls are also clean and good. Lockers are aval for storage. if you have forgotten your towel or swim suits you can always buy from the shops inside wild wadi. if you dont want to remove your t shirts while inside the park you can buy their wild wadi t shirt. there are some slides and rides where t shirts are not allowed u have to remove them to take the ride. so if you are shy buy one of theirs ;) .. overall its a good experience , very good place to spend some quality time

Wild wadi . Go early for park opening before cues start! Amazing fun day. Much better than Atlantis! Burj Surj and tantrum alley good family fun rides. My sons love the surfing they spend most of the day there! My daughter had her birthday party there and sons have previous years! Staff organise it perfectly nothing is too much!
Expensive. Expensive but well done. Better to go first thing in the morning to avoid crowds. We were there during Muslim EID and was not crowded at all

Grab your trunks! (and towel...). Having visited many water parks around the world WW takes some beating. Suits all budgets. You can drop a towel on a complimentary sun lounger (best spots go quickly) or rent an all inclusive cabana with butler service. Also one of the few that can boast entertainment for adults as well as children: Rides which will have you holding on to your shorts for dear life as well as an adult 'beach club' area. A great way to enjoy the Dubai sunshine. TIP: Take your own towel or pay a premium to rent one.
Fun but kinda expensive. Its a fun day at Wild Wadi but for the price, I expected wider variety of rides. A must-do at Wild Wadi is the Jumeriah Sceirah, dont miss that!

Awesome Experience. Wild wadi waterpark is a classic waterpark Ride which we enjoyed a most is Jumeirah Schera its a deadly ride. Individual person is locked in a tube which is located way above ground level and after 3-2-1 countdown below portion opens and we goes through the ride so speed and within a 3 seconds we reach on the ground. All the rides are nice and Burj sur ride is also very nice to enjoyyy. We love wildwadi.

A must visit. Wailed wadi water park is a must visit place in Dubai you can spend the whole day there having fun without getting bored , food is also available , life guards are around everywhere , even little kids have there games that are suitable for their age and are very safe

very entertaining!. this is an amazing water park that entertain both grown ups as well as young children... our 6 year old son could not get enough of it and had a fantastic memorable day in Wild Wadi.

A great half day out!. Not too many water rides here, but they are well worth it and very fun and thrilling at times. In the Dubai sun, this is a perfect activity although you won't spend all day there. We arrived at 10 and were done by 2pm. Also, DO NOT FORGET ANYTHING that you will need on the day, as the in park shop will charge you an arm and a leg for things like flip flops, sunscreen etc.

Splendid. The park is a splendid place to spend time with your family. There is something for all age groups. The management of the water park deserves praise for keeping it clean, safe and exciting. The food outlets have plenty of variety on offer and are well prepared. Only thing I would suggest is that they park should now replace some of their attractions by bringing in new water rides.
Brilliant thrills. The rides vary from lazy rivers to terrifying slides! We did them all and had a brilliant day at the water park.the jumeriah Scriarh was my favourite!!

The best waterpark in UAE. The best water park in UAE, much better and affordable that Aquaventure. It is older but well maintained and activities well organized. Food places are messy and food is average for the price, but honestly you're not gonna live there, are you?You can take as much photos as you want, but get yourself a locker.
Awesome!. Awesome waterpark, good choice of rides and nice touch that they encourage GoPro's to make you time in there memorable. Great that entry was free when staying in the Burj Al Arab
Fun Fun. Nephews and nieces loved it. We rent a vip cabana for more privacy and the service was great. Drinks . cold towels , vip bracelets so we use the rides first. Really great xxx

Absolute Must-Do!!. I was lucky enough to visit this water park as part of a business trip and it was fantastic. Just relief you need to survive the Arabian heat! The rides are fun and there is something for everyone. The only thing I found disappointing was the food on offer but the rides were fantastic.

Fun, but not exceptional. We had a good time at Wild Wadi. We have been there a few times because of our stays in Jumeirah Hotels. It is a fun way to spend a morning or an afternoon, but it is relatively small. If you're choosing a water park in the UAE, Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi is far better. However, if you're staying in a Jumeirah Hotel in Dubai, access to Wild Wadi is usually complimentary so it's worth going.

Complimentary Access. 2nd visit to this water park, always a good experience. We received complimentary access due to staying at the Jabeel Saray hotel and the JBH. Not sure if I would be willing to pay the entrance fee otherwise. The water park is well laid out with attractions for everyone. It was not to busy and did not have to queue long for the rides. Recommend for all ages plenty to do and relaxing areas to sit.

A good day out with the family. The slides are amazing. The water is at the perfect temperature and the children area is also nice with a lot life guards on duty. This is the best part and you dont need to worry to much with the kids.

Overpriced . Probably like a lot of Dubai this water park is hugely overpriced. Would definately recommend obtaining vouchers before going....Our mistake cost us £160 for two adults which included food but it was just fried chicken, chips, ice cream and a drink.Slides were pretty good fun though :)

Family Fun For All Ages. Wild WadiThis is a must if your in Dubai. I have been 3 times and each time it has been both a fun and completely different experience. The rides are long and you get a far amount of incidental exercise climbing stairs and getting from one point to another but it is worth it as it disperses the crowds and allows you to have an enjoyable time without feeling crowded. They are plenty of staff on hand to direct, assist or supervise and the grounds are kept immaculately clean and tidy. There is a large wave pool with beach lounges that you can set yourself up at for the day. Lockers are available but probably not necessary as everyone seems to leave there bags and belongings without worrying about it. Private cabanas are available but not necessary unless you seek maximum privacy. The wave pool is very well supervised with a number of lifeguards keeping a close eye on activities and areas tend to be zoned depending on the age of your children. All the rides are great, some slower than others and then a couple for the maximum adrenaline rush. My recommendation is not to wear your best swimmers as the first time I went I ended up with a hole in my bikini bottoms due to the force of the water and slide. The food at the park is standard fast food so if you want something healthy I recommend you take it with you. We had swamanas (kebabs) and watermelon for lunch as this was the healthiest options available. I think Wild wadi is much better than the water park at the Atlantis as it caters to everyone and has more variety. You can get a number of different types of tickets depending on your desire to ride but if you get the ultimate pass you can ride all day as many times as you like and so it ends up being good value. We spent 6 hours at the park and left feeling exhausted and completely happy after having a great day of slipping and sliding.

Not enough of rides. The water park is not bad but I think it doesn't have a lot of rides, you only need there an hour or less and you will be done with all the rides. On the other hand , one ride was especially fun for me, I don't remeber the name but the ride was going upwards when you sitting in a rubber ring, and the once you at the top then you go all the way down.
Wild Wadi Water Park. Beautiful and enjoyable water park. Its a bit of crowded since this is one of the attraction. Rides is nice. Location is good as well as its next to burj al arab.

Very good experience. Lovely water park, very big however there are only two real extreme rides that would keep your heart pumping. There is a lot to do and they have very good experiences. Be aware when you get a locker you can only use this once, as your credit will go so will have to keep topping up if you open and close it.Staff very helpful and can spend the whole day there as there are relaxing lounges and a chill out pool to just swim and play in.

Good attraction for water excursion lover. Its has many water rides which are very joyful. You can spend full day easily. Worst thing in this park is very expensive drinking water. You are not allowed to take water from outside and you have to pay 20 times more price for the water you buy inside. Besides you need plenty of water in very hot weather to avoid heat exhaustion.
a great day out. Thought this was just for the kids but my friend and I had a great time, the slides are great but also good for sitting relaxing with your feet in the water.
Brilliant day out. Water flumes that go upwards 1st. Relaxing slow river rides and the Jumeria scarer for the thrill sealer.

Wild Wadi - Enjoy. Wild Wadi - I have been there few times, last visit was on October 9,2015. Its a good place to enjoy and to cool down from the hot climate.Location is superb with a superb view of Burj Al Arab.you have to hire a taxi to get there.If you are coming by you own vehicle then they have a very good parking facility.Area is not that big but they have some good rides like Jumeirah Sceirah,Tantrum Alley, Burj Surj etc.Entrance fees is 295 dhs per Adult.which is very high, in fact its not worth spending 295 for this park.try to get Buy 1 Get 1 offers like from ' The Entertainer' vouchers( i always use that ) .Anyway Entrance is free for the Jumeirah guests and they are allowed to get inside the park one hour prior to the working hours.They wont allow to bring food inside the park, even though one bottle of water is allowed.food inside the park is damn expensive.The least expensive food is chicken shawarma which costs 50 dhs !!!! a small burger costs 59 dhs and a small pepsi costs 20 dhs.They have locker facility - we have to pay for it and its non refundable. Small size is 35 dhs, Medium - 50 dhs and Large is 65 dhs. please note that - large pants are not allowed to wear inside the park so better bring shorts inside. Otherwise get ready to get Shocked as the price for a short starts from 180 dhs ( yea, i mean it ) .Despite all these its a good place to spent 6-7 hours nad to escape from the hot climate of UAE.
Interesting to walk through and people watch. For us too much goofy stuff going on here. Looks like fun for the younger ones, but not for older fogies like us.
thirlling rides. it was a good summer break in the heat of dubai, do visit it for thirlling rides and entertainment that it gives..

Water park. Always we visit this park the games inside it was so fantastic and theirs courts of foods pizza and burgers available to have lunch in it the lifeguard was helpful and take care of all people with big smile I like this place it's unforgettable experience we had especially for the kids they we enjoy it swimming having fun as a family style it's so nice.

great outdoor activity when the sun is blasting. despite the no of excursion competing for your dollars when in Dubai / UAE, if you like a bit of water fun, this is still a great choice, compared to Atlantis or Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi, despite it being the oldest. this is a must do when the weather get you all sweaty, fabulous way to cool down.

Wild Wadi. Amazing. Our school aged children loved the water park. Many different rides to choose from depending on fear factor/ age appropriateness etc. The day we visited it was 35 deg C and perfect for paddling in the wave pool, going on water slides etc. Whole family loved the park. Extremely well run as with everything in Dubai. Can't fault service/ staffing levels/efficiency. Highly recommend sun screen/hats/rash suits etc as sunburn would spoil a fun day out. Can book online and scan ticket at entrance.

Great fun, Good way to cool off in the Dubai heat. Wild Wadi is a fantastic water park in Dubai. There is something for everyone here including families, couples, singles or anyone wanting to cool down in the heat of the day. Allow at least half a day (or more) to spend at the water park. TIP: Wild Wadi is one of the few places that still serve food all day during Ramadan periods in Dubai, our flight attendant informed us we were in Dubai during Ramadan so suggested hitting the water park, it did not disappoint and we had a great day. Also right next to the Burg Al Arab 7 star hotel so great views of that at the water park. Good day our in Dubai.

Amazing waterpark!. Such an amazing waterpark! It's really fun and you got the feeling you are young again!Enjoy the slides, up / down / front / back,.. everything is possible in this park!Visit it in the morning, it's get more busy in the afternoon!

Good fun. I love this place, it is great to spend the day relaxing and lazing about. Try everything. It is a bit expensive so plan to stay the day and have sun block available. The down side is the terrible food on offer, is just like Disneyworld, nasty unhealthy crap

Great day out ! . We spent the day at Wild Wadi with our little boy of 2. He thoroughly enjoyed himself playing in the children's area. He was a bit apprehensive at first about going down the slides, but with some encouragement from the very friendly lifeguards he soon overcame any fears and there was no stopping him ! I can't praise the lifeguards enough and the staff in general who were also very friendly, especially good with children. The entry fee isn't cheap, although children aged 2 and under are free. However if you spend a full day in here you do get your money's worth. The only downside as such is the price of the food and drink....£10 or thereabouts for an adult fast food meal and £4 fit drinks ! Other than that we had a fab day and would definitely recommend it to anyone who's visiting Dubai.
Alright place. its good how ever they need to update the water slides and the whole system, its to expensive compared to others around in UAE
Waterparks. Fantastic time to spend with Family. Go wild and enjoy. The rides are safe and need certain amount of will power to enjoy.
Nice waterpark and cheap comparatively. A very nice water park next to Burj Al Arab. A very good place to enjoy and have fun with family, kids and friends.
supurb. me and my family visit this park in august and we love it. u can find something to do for all ages..we will be back next year

Fun for all ages. A great place to visit for all ages, couples, families or friends. The waterpark caters for adventurers & those not so brave or unsure of the thrills & spills. Plenty of space for getting around & hardly any waiting to get on the rides (weekends & school holidays could take longer). The changing rooms had good facilites & were kept clean. There is a choice on the size of the locker you require & towels available. Plenty of deckchairs & sunbeds available to sit & relax if you don't want to take a plunge on the rides. Well worth a visit.
Fab. I didn't like water parks before I came here. After a couple of rides I decided that I loved it. There was only one ride I did not attempt. Overall great Water Park
Fun at the water park.. Went here a couple of times, great rides, fun place great for young and old. We loved it! Very well run. Not too big. Loved the rides on the regs!!
Wild Wadi. Very nice place to beat the summer heat with many option rides, however it is some how expensive which entry fee needs to be re considered.

1 day of amusement. - Very fast entrance process especially for Jumeirah hotels guests.- It was planned to be after eid vacation to avoid crowd.- Very clean facilities, toilets, restaurants.- Expensive food- Nice show market with good models of swimming suits & suitable prices
Good Waterpark. Lot of rides suitable for children and family. Neat and clean. Access to the Park is very easy with public transportation.

A "must do" in Dubai. This is a great place to visit with children or grandchildren. It is part of the Jumeirah Group next to the JBH, and lives up to Jumeirah Group's reputation for quality. There are ride and attractions for children of any age, but there are height restrictions on some of the rides.As far as I know, I have been on all of the rides over the years, except the Jumeirah Sceirah. I'd heard about it from other guests in the hotel, and have since looked it up on the internet, and I am certain I made the correct decision NOT to go. Apparently, you stand in a capsule, the floor opens and you plunge 120 metres at 80 kph! Not for me. Tantrum Alley is fast and furious, and the Burj Surj is even faster. My son said I looked terrified throughout, whilst my two granddaughters aged 5 and 7 loved it and wanted to go again.It is an absolutely great day out, and I strongly recommend going early, as it does get very busy later on.Entrance is free to anyone staying in a Jumeirah hotel, otherwise I may be put off by the high cost of admission. AED 285 (approx £53.50) for an adult, and AED 240 (£45) for a child under 1.1 metres tall.

Best water park ever. This water park is differnet in the sense that some of the rides actually take you uphill! When you ride the slide you sit in an inflated tube and then water jets shoot you uphill. It is a lot of full, don't forget your sunscreen though!
Super fun :). I had a wonderful experience, lots of fun with my friends, crazy spinning around :) We really enjoy in each game and had a good and quality time. MUST VISIT!!!

Excellent water park. Had a great time in this water park, which is great for families young and old, my advice would be to go first thing in the morning as it really gets busy later in the afternoon, with us staying at the Jumeirah Beach we had free entry and entry an hour earlier then the public which let you do all the rides with no queues. We will certainly be back

Amazing. I visited this water park in the evening on ladies night. I was looking forward to it but the staff outside were rude which put me off. I did buy the ticket and the staff inside were great. I did enjoy the rides.

Fun for the family!. We got in free as staying at ZS, not sure I would pay 285 aed each to get in, pricy! Rides were lots of fun and we got there early so not much queuing, but it was v busy by lunchtime with large groups of men in their teens/twenties who were a bit rough and inconsiderate on the rides. Food was ok but overpriced as in every theme park. Lots of loungers around in the shade. V cool when the rock starts moving and water flows down the street. V clean toilets and showers. Impressed by the quality of the slides/rides!

Great family fun for every age group. Whether you are watching or participating this is a fun place for all age groups. You will need your swimming cossies. We got in for free as we were staying at a Jumeirah hotel, but it is a bit expensive if you have to pay to get in, so hard to say whether it is value for money. At the time we were the it was Au$122.00 per adult, and a little less for children.

Fun experience. This was a wonderful experience. All the rides are very fun and Sceirah is the most adrenaline rushing one. Best time to visit is before 12pm since after that it becomes quite crowdy and lines are getting longer.
Great day out. This was complimentary entrance to park from jbh opening time 10am till late in evening loads to do an loads of eating places in there towels all free great day out if u have children

Mediocre and costly. Upon insistence of kids visited the water park - they charge each person 285 AED and charge separately for locker, towel and food - there are 4 rides which are worth trying and enjoying while the rest you can find in any place - the place is not huge - the food and beverages inside are sold at charges four to five times than outside snd uou are not allowed to take anything inside

A full package of fun and discovery. We went to wild wadi and had no idea about the place. The games are funny but the place itself is very nice, close to burj al arab and jumeirah beach hotel. You can enjoy a great view of Burj al arab and take spectacular photos.
Good . It's good but old the new one is palm aqua park. The area is small and the games is funny but not excited only one
Oasis in desert..... It's an amaizing water park in middle of the desert....no wonder..it can happen only I dubai....state of art water park....a must visit in dubai..

Great waterpark! . The slides are fabulous! Scary but really enjoyed all the slides. We have all the great time to try all the slides. The food is quite expensive with very few choices. They do offer discounts if you have friends working in Jumeirah or with emirates airlines which is good as we were able to get discounts with the entrance fees and with the food.
amazing. was excellent, mornings are even better because it is not crowdy at morning. needs swimware, test all crew were so kind and useful.
Wave and slides . Don't miss it, I love to ride the slides in wild wadi, waves and my best ride is the surfing slide. You will enjoy every monument there.

Hot Slides But Super Cool.. As lovers of water parks we were really looking forward to seeing what Dubai had to offer. We chose Wild Wadi as the park to go to over another well known water park. Tickets aren't cheap but there is plenty to keep you occupied for a good few hours. Our visit on Mon 27th Sept 2015 was a super hot day and we both wore long sleeved surf tops (a must if you don't want to fry). Most of the slides are all ring based but but this only added to the speed on some of the slides. Some rides even shoot you upwards leaving you gasping for breath or screaming in fun.....overall we had 4 hours of fun on the slides and enjoyed every minute of being flung around in the super cool water.

So much fun!!. This waterpark is just fabulous!! We spent 6 hours being big kids and just loved it. We have been to at least 15 waterparks worldwide and this one is right up there with the best! The up hill water coasters were the best and the views of the Burj Al Arab and the jumeirah beach hotel and beach from the park are amazing. All staff/life guards were so friendly and looked genuinely happy to work there. Food was great value, we ate in the bbq and had tandoori chicken with chips and pitas and a large coke each with 2 bottles of water and was under £20, was delish and gave us loads of energy to enjoy the park until closing. We loved the chashless system where you top up money to a wristband, such a great idea! Also we loved how the walk ways were shaded so you don't need to wear your flip flops because you won't burn your feet, very well thought out! Everything was so safe too so even the big slides, although thrilling were very safe and we felt the staff went out of their way to make sure everyone were kept safe as a priority. There is something here for everyone of any age and what a great way to cool down in the 40 degree heat!!

Great water fun for the whole family!. The weather in Dubai during the summer is miserable! And the only way to beat it is as Wild Wadi! It's a very well laid out, clean, family-friendly water park with loads of different activities, including the only-for-the-brave Jumeirah Scareh water slide. A wonderful day out for everyone. Free access to guests staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel next door. :)

Great way to spend a few hours. We had this park included free with our hotel, i went in with friends who stayed in a few hours, for me i prefer the quiet on the beach so only stayed an hour. Fantastic though and very clean, loads of activities to keep children occupied all day.
Great Park. Got Free ticket when you stay In Jumeirah Hotels. Was with My friend . Loved the Park, But i was going Die in . Water Come to my Mouth Without Being Ready In the Water Park tube
Wet Wet Wet. Great rides, my wifes first ever trip to a water park now totally converted. Great views of the Burj Al Arab

Go on the Jumeirah Sceirah!. A nice water park, quite small compared to others I have been to in America but still lots to do. The Jumeirah Sceirah is terrifying but brilliant - a must do! We had complimentary access via our hotel but I believe it is fairly pricey if you have to pay - but then you are in Dubai and isn't everything pricey!!

Great fun. Great day out - went on a really hot day so was nice to cool down. Lots of rides and amusments, the lazy river was by far my favorite thing! Food lovely, people friendly - defiantly a great day out if you have children

Great Water Park. A little pricey . This was a great day out, and like most things in Dubai it was a little overpriced. On top of the entrance fee, locker and towel (if you don't take one) the food is very expensive for what it is. Aim to not eat (it takes up precious water park time anyway). The rides are great however and we had a great time. Avoid leaving at closing time as the crowds are massive. Leave 30 mins early.

Very very nice. Wild wadi Waterpark is connected to Jumeirah Beach hotel and if you stay in that hotel or in any Jumeirah hotel then entrance to it is complimentary and therefore you can avoid the very long waiting lines at the entrance and you don't have to pay the entrance fee .we had the best time there. .totally recommend

Amazing fun! . Been a few times now and each time it seems better and better! Great fun, rides good, food delicious at julsans kitchen! Waves fun and staff friendly! Only downside Jumeirah sceirah slide queue tooooo long! Prefer it better then Atlantis water park.
Amazing Park. Had the best time of my life so far @ wild wadi, beautiful and a very serene environment. Suitable for relaxation

Highly recommended. Wild Wadi Waterpark We had a 2 for 1 voucher for this attraction which they accepted with no issue. I felt the lockers were a little pricey and be warned the price goes up with the size of the locker with the smallest locker starting at 115 AED equilivant of nearly 30 euro, so pack lightly.Also male and female changing is separate and there is no family changing rooms available as we witnessed one poor Fathers dismay as he had two daughters with him. Any one travelling from Europe tend to forget this as we are used to having family changing areas readily available.We went during the week so there was little or no queueing and all the rides were working efficiently. The staff have to be complimented they are the most friendly and helpful and by far the nicest we encoutntered in any attraction in Dubai.The area is well maintained and very clean, be warned though given the heat the ground is unbearably hot in places, as flip flops have to be removed for rides I would recommend swimming shoes to protect your feet especially for kids. We had a quick bite to eat , fast food is readily available and we were surprised by the high quality of what we received. The “Wipeout Burger” is totally recommended. Merchandise and souvenirs are quiet expensive but expected and at a par with any of the other waterparks in both Europe and the US.Deck chairs and seating areas are available in all areas but those around the wave pool appear to be the busiest.There’s also an option for a fish pedicure for an addition 55 AED this is relaxing and it’s a nice option to take you out of the sun. It lasts 20 minutes but we were allotted an extra ten minutes as they were not busy which we appreciated.Lifejackets are readily available and free of charge for both adults and children.One thing that stood out and can often be overlooked was the lifeguards on duty, as some one that spent their college years as a part time lifeguard I feel I have a good insight. The lifeguards by far are the most efficient and observant lifeguards I have ever come across in a waterpark. I would complement the lifeguards on the wave pool who I witnessed doing numerous rescues, they were never once distracted from their duties and there professionalism was unquestionable. It is quite obvious that there is a well-structured training programme in place and the importance of their duties does not seem to have been lost sight of by any of the lifeguard personnel. They are a credit to the park. We enjoyed our day at the park, it’s both suitable for kids and adults and would highly recommend
MARVELLOUS FOR THE KIDS (AND DAD!). Marvellous for the kids (and dad!). The rides are a delight and worth the time you'll spend to ride them all

Wild Wadi. My kids and I had a great day, staff very friendly and welcoming.
I would not buy the meal deal again.
chilling out. stunning, beautiful and enjoyable water park its a bit of crowded since this is one of the attraction, rides are perfect.

Excellent . If you're in dubai then a visit to the water park is a must. We went on a Saturday & we did not have to queue anywhere for more than 5 minutes.There is something for everyone there.The only drawback is that you're not allowed to take yr own food inside & the meals/drinks you purchase there are over priced.We stayed in deira so we got the metro to mall of emirates then got a taxi from there. This was by far the cheapest option as no public transport available to the water park.

Amazing experience . I am absolutely petrified of water! I can not swim. So what made me go to wild wadi. Good question. I must be mad. All that a side it was my birthday, part of our holiday itinerary this fell on my birthday! Great planning by my cousin. My cousins made me try the jumeirah sceirah. I was so petrified, I really thought I wouldn't not be able to do it. But guess what I did it!!! It was amazing! I felt so proud of myself! The staff were helpful and encouraging! I was a nightmare to be fair. Only because I was so scared. After this ride I was unstoppable, I tried other rides. We really enjoyed wild wadi. It was expensive to go in but we got tickets for half price which was around £25 approximately. Good times and embarrassing memories for me!

probably the best one in the UAE. the three are all a bit pricey but this has the best lazy/motorized river by farbring your own towelsthe local men were less of an issue in Abu Dhabi Yas and Atlantisbut generally a good time-plenty of seats but wouldn't want it any more crowded than this ans starting to think staying in the on site hotel actually works out cheaper when you play into the equation 80 US per person.

Very nice.. . We went two times to this place.. Especially if going with kids you will enjoy. There is nice fast food and all thing you might need. Price is quite reasonable.. The location is very good as well as its next to Burj Al Arab which gobs you nice experience.
Wild Wadi is an average place. Wild Wadi is an average place, the rides are OK but the cleanness and services are not great. I think Atlantis water park is much better.

Good to kill an afternoon but only if you get it for a good price!. I didn't actually go to this Water Park but I did pay for my son and his friend who are both 16. They have been to WaterParks the world over and rated it as just OK!It killed a few hours one afternoon but for the cost you'd expect more.

Nice but faded and a bit small and crowded.. We went with our 2yr old and there was only the lazy river that was suitable. Since it was hot, the place was over-crowded as it is quite small, and a lot of youth and not-so-young groups of men shoving each other and acting very rough in the water next to my young child, often splashing her and frightening her.

So much fun. Wild wadis is definitely worth a visit .we went as a couple but family's would love it. Lots of exciting water rides and plenty of eating and drinking areas. We stayed at a jumeriah hotel so entrance and towel were free everyday if you wanted to. We only payed for a locker which was about £6.

Great day out. Brilliant day, get there early if you can, ques can be long due the procedure of telling every visitor how it all works. E.g, do you want a locker? What size locker? Do you want to hire a towel? Etc,etc. Very good system once your in though. Lots of exciting rides with a nice relaxing lazy river. Great for all the family. Suspended sheets provide protection from the sun. Discount vouchers are available from your hotel, one per visitor. Quite an expensive day out, but worth it in my opinion

super cool. Awesome enjoyment, we had in this water park. This is the best water park available in dubai, though it is little highly priced but worth trying it. Many options and kinds of entertainment and dining is available which makes the experience wonderful
Best Activity - Best Water Park. Never had thought will spent more than a day in water park in Dubai. Good Hygiene standards. All rides are fun. Something for everyone and every age groups.

Great fun for all ages. Thoroughly enjoyable experience for all ages. Even better if you get admission as part of your hotel deal. Was there in late September with family and brilliant way to stay cool. Family atmosphere, positive cheerful staff. Could it have been better - yes. Food pedestrian and expensive, entrance could have more shade and cooling, queue for bus back to hotel disorganised and every man for himself. Shame on the single men pushing in ahead of families with young children.

Must Visit . If you are in Dubai, your stay is incomplete without a visit to Wild Wadi. Shrug off your inhibitions about the heat and sun and just tune in to go water wild. Very well organised, clean, full with amenities like first-aid and food this place is an absolute Yes.Rides are superb, built in a vast area, staff well trained and most of all the happy faces around you make the visit memorable.Must visit if you have kids or with friends!

Fantastic.. We were lucky enough to go on a day which was quiet. We had no queues and really enjoyed the whole day. The wave pool to the slides were all amazing & everywhere looked clean and well maintained

Great Fun. Love this waterpark but in comparison with Aqua Adventure at Atlantis there is not as much excitement for a five year old who just loves the Rapids. The wave pool is a lot of fun and I am sure for kids a little older and adults the water slides are awesome!!!
nice place to spend the day. wonderful water park to spend time with your kids. especially when you stay at the Jumeirah properties it makes sense to visit.

Great fun, especially if entry is free as part of your hotel deal. I visited Wild Wadi twice with my 17 year old son and we had lots of fun. We had unlimited free entry (including free towel hire) as part of our Jumeirah hotel package, which was great. The only thing we paid for was 35 AED for locker hire.There are around 6-8 rides with a couple being quite intense (the Jumeirah Screamer lived up to its name for me). Even though it was a hot day (around 38-40 degrees C) we didn't feel hot at all, as we were always wet. Beware of hot feet and sunburn though!Thursday nights is Ladies Only night.

Best waterpark ever!!! Such a fun day here - a must visit!. We visited a monday in August. We arrived shortly after the park opened at 10am, as advised to go on all the bigger rides first before the park got too busy. We were soooo lucky that all day we were able to go on the rides without queuing! Max 15 minutes during peak time around 2pm for the most popular rides! but mostly we walked straight on :-)This is my favourite waterpark EVER! Due to their amazing tyre rides - there is one that goes on for 15 minutes as you're jetted along tubes from one pool to the next, and then you finish up floating down the lazy river on your tyre :-) Amazing! There is a great choice of single or double tyres too. There are more extreme tyre rides (climb the many steps up the tower), which we loved too! You are sat on larger rafts and be prepared to get very wet - hold on tight!!!There are also 2 awesome surfing rides - never done these before but highly recommend! Plus usual kamikazes, wave pools, kids area etc etc. Definitely recommend for a fun day out - I want to go back!!Entry is 275AED, £50 each, but I searched online and was able to buy tickets cheaper from a third party and we paid around £84 for our 2 tickets. Extra charges for lockers (65AED, £12, non refundable) and to hire towels - but you can take your own. Allowed to take bottled water, but not food. The park has a great choice of places to eat and drink, pricey but not too crazy expensive.We took our go pro down the rides with us and got some great photos. There are also great views of Burj Al Arab from the waterpark. Such a fun day here - a must visit!

I will go back again!. I love everything about this placed. It is very safe for the kids. Lot's of life guards everywhere especially in the Kid's pool area. The amenities are also good bathrooms are clean. It is crowded yes, especially during peak season but who cares!

Always Great. Been to Wild Wadi several times but I've never written a review before. Great place for kids as well as adults. Lots of lifeguards on duty so you always have peace of mind. Would definitely be returning soon

Great day out!. Great water park! So much fun here and the food is reasonable priced for a water park, and great quality. The floor gets VERY hot, so if you can get something to protect your feet - do... either that or do what we did and walk in the shady parts!

Flowrider and other rides. The Flowrider surfing machines are great fun. The lifeguards help to create a safe and exciting experience I recommend starting on the smaller machine first and then having a go on the top curl. eeexperience

Lovely water park in just the right place. I was staying at the Jumeirah beach hotel and it was such a pleasure to be able to walk over, hassle free, and enjoy this great park in optimal weather and great conditions. Everyone is friendly and polite and I really enjoyed my second visit there in 3 years. Its perfect for relaxing and although not as sophistiocated as say the Atlantis, it is a nice park centrally located. Helpers were very friendly too. Loved it

Wild rides!. Hello, My name is Bogdan and last year in September 2014 I have visited Wild Wadi Water Park in Dubai. It is one of the best in town, a bit expensive but the location is great, between Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach Hotel. You will find a lot of water slides inside, pools that create waves, surfing pool and many more. It is a very high tech water park that should not be missed during your holiday in Dubai! Best regards, BogdanRomania.

Family fun. We loved Wild Wadi, the kids age 9 and 6 had a fantastic time. We were basically first ones in and last ones out as they just didn't want to leave. We did everything apart from the Jumeirah Scarah and the surfing and it was all fantastic. Will definitely go again next year.

TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE. I visited wild wadi world on the 9th of September 2015. First the good points, we visited when it wasn't very busy, apparently the last 3 days had been packed solid. The water park was fantastic, really clean with excellent facilities, a bit small, but still nice for a really hot summers day. The staff were friendly and professional. A word of warning wear flip flops because the concrete can be a bit course on bare feet. We had entertainer vouchers, buy one get one free, which really softened the blow. Paying £60 is a bit much for one person I think. Now the bad points. My mate dislocated his shoulder on one of the water rides (he'd done it years ago, apparently it pops out ).We were quickly shown to the first aid station and he was given 2 ibuprofen tablets, useless because he was in agony, but understandable because they never had anything stronger. Now the bad news, they said we had to go to the hospital by TAXI. We were taken out of the park through the back entrance as if we had robbed the place. To make matters worse WE HAD TO PAY FOR THE TAXI OURSELVES. The taxi driver told us that he had been here on numerous occasions with other injured people from the water park, he always parked around the back and they NEVER called an ambulance because it would draw negative attention to the park . The taxi driver said that if we'd been locals we'd have called an ambulance straight away and got to the hospital (in diera ) in 15 minutes rather than the 40 minutes it took him, while my mate was in agony. Shocking the way we were treated. SHOCKING
Great Family Fun. Spent a whole day at this park. Caters for all ages. From Thrill seekers to individuals who just wanted to have a slow pace in the water park.
Highly recommended. Brilliant fun! Loads of great slides. Directly on the beach right opposite the Burj Al Arab. Highly recommended, be careful with the sun though!

Water Park. Next to Burj al Arab beautiful water park but not very big. the wave pool is very good & slides as well. The Jumeirah area nearby is good for walking at evening & full of restaurants serving various cuisines from world
Enjoyed to the core. A superb water park, very thrilling rides, a complete fun day with family, a must do activity. Enjoyed to the core

Family fun day. Spent an afternoon here and it kept everyone entertained for the five hours that we where there, great fun was had by all concerned and would go again no large queuing when we went which is always a bonus
Great fun. A great day out to be had here, really good fun family day out. Great rides, friendly helpful staff. Tantrum Alley, Burj Surge and the Scariah are a must!!!

Not as big as I had expected. Still great. I did think the park was going to be bigger. However, what an experience it was. I had to go solo as I was visiting a friend who is working a lot while I'm here. The staff and lifeguards are very helpful and friendly

Holiday. We had a great family day out at the park
We used entertainer vouchers which were welcomed.
There are plenty of rides for all ages some a bit scary like the tunnel of doom..
Food and drinks reasonably priced.
Great location on the beach and good views of Burj al arab and Jumeirah Beach hotel
