Dubz 2015. Really good day out but needs a clean up, looked slightly dated in some parts, pool area tiles dirty/slimey!

Great fun for the kids...... When staying at the Burj, we were informed that we could make use of Wadi water park, not something we'd normally visit, but so glad we did, kids loved it. Many water activities to enjoy and the lifeguards are so on the ball with child safety, perfect. Even better that Burj lay on a golf buggy to visit and skip the queues.....visit was prior to oct 2014
Great Family day at this waterpark. Lovely family day. Need t be prepared to sizzle in the scorching summer heat, but the facility is great. The food wasn't that great though and way overpriced.

Great for Hot summer evenings. Visited on a hot summer Friday evening and had a brilliant time! When we arrived at about 5pm it was still hot and surprisingly busy given the temperature out of 40c+, but as the sun went down (along with the heat) the crowds left, we had no queues and just a great time. There is a good variety of slides and plenty to get the excitement levels going.Food is the usual deep fried unhealthy rubbish so just bring some water and fruit with you.

Great family fun!. My second time at Wild Wadi, this time I visited with my family for my daughters birthday.The park was quiet and made our visit great fun, easy to find sun loungers and no queues for the rides.I was considering a private cabana, but found these to be very very expensive. May explain why they were all empty. Will return again for sure.

Great fun. Brilliant activity for when it's 40 degrees! Lots of shade and cooling water. Relaxing day unless you go down the intense thrill ride. Our kids set us up and we didn't realise what we were in for. Definitely good fun. Kept everyone entertained wether reading in the shade or enjoying the rides. The advantage of being there in September were there were very few queues. Try and get a voucher from the entertainer book then its buy one get one free.
Warm Water. I have a very good experience in this water park with warm water and good service . it is very odd for me that I could met some of my friends over there. seems people have fun over there.
Great fun. Go in the morning as there are less queues. We didn't have to wait for any rides. Not as big as what I thought but still something for everyone. Great fun

Wonderful Experience. Came with group of friends ,stayed until late since we were enjoying all the exciting rides ,features, this theme park has to offer.We really appreciate the attentiveness of lifeguards on duty.Really if one is in Dubai certainly not to miss coming here.Wonderful experience !

Wild Wadi. Visited here in July with 2 kids aged 9 and 4, it was a very hot day but we managed to get some shaded area to sit in for a bit out of the hot sun. We stayed in Jumeirah Creekside hotel so we had unlimited entry to the waterpark. We only went here one day during our visit as we didn't have much time in Dubai and we had a fun day.When we were leaving and walking to the taxis a man approached us, which we thought was a taxi driver and told us a car was available and helped with our bags to a lexus car. It was only when we were in the car that we realised that the car had no meter and no sticker on the window, he charged us 3-4 times more to go to the mall than the rate should have been. It was our first day in Dubai and didn't know any better. So just a warning to anyone leaving the Waterpark to make sure you get into a proper taxi!

" Good day out ". Attached to the Jumeriah hotel, it was very easy to accessThe staff at the entrance were very helpful and friendly. Plenty of sun beds to use once you've been on the water ridesOnly down side was there were only a few rides ( been spoilt having been to water parks in Florida !!! ) but still a great way to keep cool Very clean and they also provide towels

Absolutely Fabulous!. This is a super day out for all the family. The rides are very exciting and the facilities are very well maintained. Food and beverages are easily purchased via an electronic waterproof wristband. A must activity.

Get wild and wet :). The best place for having a great family fun and enjoying dubai's hot sun and riding some of the most awesome and adrenalin-rushing water slides.The snack shops in the area are pretty good and have decent qualityThe staff are brilliant, very kind and helpfulThis place is a must-visit when you visit dubai

Great family fun. The weather was perfect , didn't need a towel to dry off . I found the water slides to be great family fun .If you enjoy the extrem water slides you might be disappointed . Plenty of spots to cool off and grab a bit to eat

Great Family Fun. Only visited here as we were staying at Jumeirah beach hotel and it is free, its a good park not so much for infants and toddlers, food outlets pricey, hefty price tag for what you get at DHS 285 which I would never have paid.

Wild Wadi is one of the must visit tourist area in Dubai. Wild Wadi located near the Burj Khalifah the 7th star hotel. And one of the awesome waterboom in the world. The location is in the Palm Jumeirah area. The place is very well known for tourist and must visit.

Awesome fun!. Was staying at the Mina A Salam hotel so had complimentary access. The park was busy but there was no long queues! Haven't tried the Atlantis water park so can't compare but i will say Wild Wadi was fantastic fun! There are many rides to try and every one is worth it especially the Jumeriah Sceirah which was the most thrill seeking! Overall you can't go wrong. Definitely recommend!

visiting wild wadi?. Wild Wadi near Jumeirah Beach Hotel was quite good fun though dated. There are several rides or activities for kids, but not much for younger kids and toddlers.There are several food outlets, we only tried one the food was not great.The staff were friendly and always helpful.

Money Money Money. Can you hear the tills – Fernando?. We did visit Wild Wadi for about 9 days running.This is what we normally do if we are staying in one of the Jumeira residencies.I was dismayed to discover that this year they had finished their promotion where if you buy one of their big drinks cups you can refil each time for 5-6 dirhams. Which with a couple of drink guzzling kids around, it was a no brainer.I had a lengthy conversation (argument) with Fernando at the food station by the kids play area. I did have the backing of my wife who during the discussion I looked around for some backing was disapearing into the distance.Honestly nothing personal as he was only trying to do his job but he didn’t have a clue what he was on about. He was trying to tell me that Wild Wadi had never had this offer? And that he was on the board that decides these matters? Odd as I still have the beakers with wild wadi on them from our last visit, I also have the beakers from Aquadventure by The Atlantis Hotel from last year where they had exactly the same deal.Now the deal is, you pay something like 80 dirhams up front and again some for the refill, but this only lasts a day. I would have to drink my whole bodyweight in fluids to make this work, would spend half my day in the toilet and would not be able to to take part on the rides from carbon dioxide poisoning.Come on Wadi board – That is mean.It just meant that we didn’t stay as long and we didn’t buy drinks there.By the way the rides were good!Would I go again, yes, if I owned shares in the company

water, water everywhere. If you think you have been to a water park think again, this park is awesome, it's not cheap and one of the rides was a bit dodgy. You actually get blasted up to the top of rides in a tube rider rather than have to walk

Definitely try Tantrum Alley!. We had a fantastic afternoon there. The rides are fun, the place is nicely layed out and very clean and well looked after. A little bit expensive but I mean, it is a waterpark in a desert! Shout out to all the friendly lifeguards, especially the South African ones! You guys have great attitudes.

Good fun. We visit wild wadi whenever we are in Dubai. The rides are fun and the wave pool is my favourite. If you are in Dubai during the summer months, go to the park in the night. It's amazing with the view of the Burj and Jumeirah, all lit up. This park is good for non swimmers as well.
Great day. Spent the day here just last week. We had a great day and the queues weren't too long so didn't really have to wait to do anything within the park

so much fun for everyone. there are so many slides that there is something for everyone. Im scared of big slides and still there was so many other moderate slides to go on. the views are incredible from the ones i went to that were fairly high. you can see the beach and its next to the burj al arab which is good to see.

best waterpark in Dubai. Perfect for all ages and a man made beach available for those who want to relax. Sinbad water park is great fun for those under 10 years old... lots of big water slides for those who like their splashes..
Fun day out!. Lovely water park. This is a popular choice for both residents and tourists. Great for a day out with the kids. Not for the summer, though.
Awesome, Perfect, Amazing. After trying a few waterparks, Wild Wadi is the best. The service is top compared to the rest. Very friendly staff. I like the fact that everything is accessible.

Great day out!. Great park!
Really impressed with the cleanliness, range of rides , slides
Great idea to use wristband watch to access locker/ pay for food drinks although beware because drinks are very expensive.

Wicked. Amazing water park for all ages even for a non swimmer like my husband still managed to brave the rides even the jumeriah scarier fantastic views of the resort easy access aswell just wait at the numerous buggy stops and have to wait a couple of mins and will take u where u want to go absolute brilliant time best time ever

had tons of fun there. if you were there, you gotta go to wild wadi. it's so amazing and big and such a great way to spend the day and even relax. the food there was tasty and not that fatty. the life guards were helpful but i didn't like the fact that i wasn't allowed to use my gopro on the big slide from the top which is a bump. but overall, it was money well spent.

Dubai Sept 2015. Had a great day in Wild Wadi, had lots of fun, love the place, have been before,but its good for both Adults and children, swimming pool there too & restaurants so you can spend the whole day!

Love it!!. We were on our honeymoon and went to wild wadi waterpark and we loved it! There are rides for evryone there from thrill seekers to children. As we went in Aug and it is really hot then there were no queues at the rides and sometimes about five people ahead of us. My friend went in October and another friend went in December the queues were a lot longer then. The staff are friendly and there are photographers at the end of some rides who are really good and captured some amazing pictures of me and my husband. The changing rooms are clean with cleaners always present. We bought our swim wear from the waterpark shop including slippers that we could keep on the rides, this was all a bit pricey but we can re use it on our next visit. We ate near the entrance i didnt really like the food as apart from burgers and hot dogs there isnt much choice and there is very limited seating for when your eating. Overall the water park is safety conscious with life gaurds at every corner and it is very clean for a waterpark, i cant wait to go again when i have children as it is a lovely place for children. The surroundings are beautiful and the rides are brilliant, would definetly recommend this place for a memorable and exciting day out with the family or with friends.

Great fun. This is a water park like none we have experienced. There are some newer parks that we have not tried, but Wild Wadi was a great day out. It was run smoothly and effectively. As usual you are not allowed to take in food, and the food bought on site is very expensive. There are limited loungers, so be advised to get there early. If you purchase your ticket in advance you will not have queue so long.

Amazing fun!!!!!!!. We went as soon as park opened so it was empty but by lunchtime it was packed. It was summer time when we went so it's their low season which may have also helped. Went on all rides, definitely the best water park I have ever been to and look forward to returning one day.

Never fails to disappoint. This is such a cool waterpark. You can go for an hour or for a day. It's well thought out, compact, accessible and easy to use. You can leave the kids to do their own thing and know it's not too big for them to get lost in. As a Jumeirah guest access is free and getting to and from the park from the resort side is very easy. You can put money on your wristband and spend it as you like. The only downside is the cost of food and drink, it's expensive and unnecessarily expensive. The rides are fun and last long enough to make the effort of getting to the top worthwhile. The queues are ok and the staff very helpful, friendly and welcoming. The wave pool is fun, having the life jackets gives the kids a lot of confidence. There's plenty of slides for the kids and enough rides to keep hen entertained. A good day out, you can get round the park in a day and ride the rides repeatedly. IDo wonder what will happen when the new Jumeriah hotel opens and whether this will have an impact on the water park which can get busy at times.

Great time. As a couple in their early 30's went a couple of times in the holiday for a relax/adventure. The lazy river is great a series of currents will push you around in aided to enjoy yourself. The water slides that use the rubber rings are great start off on ground level and they push you up a height and let you free all. (No hassle of carrying g rings around) Great experience. The surfing is out of this world the guides will teach you how to perfect your skills and spend the time explaining where you've gone wrong and how to do it better next time. All in all a great day out. Just wish I was there now!
Wildwadi!!!. Had so much fun very nice place I love it i want to go back soon! everything is nice a very cool place!!!
Great day out. Fab day out with the family, children really enjoyed it.The best time to go is in the morning as it gets very busy after 12.

Awesome fun for the whole family. We loved the variety of rides and the proximity of the various slides. It is much quicker and easier to fit in lots of rides than at Atlantis as the grounds are not as big. Really enjoyed the wave pool! Definitely make use of the free entry if you are staying in one of the Jumeirah properties. The buggy takes you up to the hotel guest entrance, free towels are provided so you don't need to take anything with you. As with all waterparks in hot countries, I would recommend buying pool shoes in the park. They can be used on all of the slides and make walking on the hot grounds a lot more comfortable.

Ok, But Rather Small. This is a rather small water park compared to those we have visited in places such as Bali and Abu Dhabi, this means you probably only need half a day to visit. The entrance fee is also very high (about £100 for 2 adults). Fortunately as we were staying at one of the Jumeriah Hotels the facility was complementary. Would recommend visiting in the morning, as temperatures get very hot later in the day, and the crowds increase meaning long waits in hot weather for most of the rides. We visited at 10.30am and it was fairly easy to get on all the rides. While not big there are some fun rides, so if you have half a day to spare and don't mind getting there early this facility is worth a visit.
Mildly fun. Wildly expensive!. Some fun rides providing you meet the height and weight restrictions. £50 to get in plus an additional £24 to rent a towel and locker. Total rip off!!

A day for the family - loved it!. We took up the opportunity to upgrade to use the cabana. As it was Ramadam the waterpark was not as busy as I suspect it would normally be. The cabana was great with a private fridge, free watermelons, ice lollies and a fast track pass on the main ride. Everything was great and we were nearly last out of the park! Best measure of how good it was - my youngest son, aged 13 asking if we can go on a wterpark holiday next time too!

fab day out never disappoints. We always come to this water park when we are on holiday in Dubai I have been at least 5 times on different occasions and it is still consistent. The park is clean and friendly with a great atmosphere and ideal for families. We always get the entertainer 2 for 1 voucher. We have also visited the aquaventure at Atlantis but for us this definatley beats it.This time my 6 year old was able to go on all the rides so she had a blast wild wadi is a must if in Dubai and if you had a choice between aquaventure and wild wadi I would say go for wild wadi, the rides the atmosphere and the staff just win it for us.

Nice Rides. I have visited Wild Wadi many times with friends and with family. I always enjoyed the rides, especially the rivers that go uphill which eliminates many stairs to reach up for some rides.
Absolutely recommended for families. Weekends and public holidays are very busy and this will impose long queues on the rides.

Top Waterpark. This waterpark is really the best in the UAE. It is free to guests from the Jumeirah Hotels. A great park to entertain the children and also adults.
Have a lot of fun or just relax while your children having fun.

Time for Change. Wild Wadi is good for kids and families on a first visit. However, if you have been there before you would like to see something new or some changes butvthat is not forthcoming. Still a good splash in summer especially in heat.

Good for staycation trip. Because of the location, Wild Wadi is great for a one day activity that you can do even on a whim. The staff are very accommodating to the point that when we arrived, she gave us a heads-up of an ongoing promotion that we weren't aware of.We ended up paying only 40% of the total cost which was super great for us. Heads-up, staff are pretty strict about wearing flipflops while riding slides. Even if you offer to wear them on your arms so that you wouldn't have to walk back to the start to pick them up again. So, leave your flipflops in the locker room :)Since it's a small waterpark, get ready for lots of stairs.
Great water park. Get the entertainer book online or you can buy it from carrifor shopping centre. Dubai Mall.copens 241 on dinning and attractions.

Had an amazing time. Better for kids.. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to wild wadi. Having been to Aquaventure so many times I felt like this would be a let down but not at all. We now have a 2 yr old and it was perfect for him. Admittedly the rides are a bit in need of tlc as they're rusting etc. And generally it's not as exciting for adults as Aquaventure but as a non - swimmer and mother of a toddler it was great for me and little one and there was enough to keep DH amused too as he's more of a keen adventurer. Food was extortionate ..paid like £10 for a shwarma meal. Lockers are about 35AED for a small one. Take your own towel as it costs like 60AED to hire. We also used the Entertainer 2 for 1 entry voucher which was fab and little ones under 2 are free. Overall we had a blast, one of our best days in dubai.

Whowhoooooo Big Splash :). Awesome rides you need to see this and the one at atlantis if you love water parks.Atlantis has newer rides TipsFood is a bit expensive inside but generraly ladies bags or kids bags are not checkedIf they find it in your kids bags tell them its special for the kid due to some allergic reason etc Bikini - avoid string types the more covered the better Try the fish pool with small kids its fun where these small fishes nibble on your dead skin flakes - yuck i know but its funPhoto gifts - Be wary as there are prople there who will offer to take a photo and put it on a souvinior mug , tshirt or snow dome etc and they charge really high prices .....instead i suggest take photos yourself and then google printshop4me - you can chosse from over 1000 products at wholesale prices put your image and text and get it delivered to your hotel the next day'Taxis - Difficult to get taxis so call a taxi is best option or have something pre arranged avoid 7-9 and 5-7 work traffic
Great Fun!. Superb day out.Good service and great rides.Plenty of rides to suit all ages.Pack the sunscreen though!Would recommend for families.
Great waterpark. one of the best watermarks, plenty for everyone, lots of sun beds, suitable for families as well as couples.loved it here

Dubai. actually I did not go inside of this park. This park is located just right between Burj Al Arab and Jumeria Beach hotel. You can hear kids are screaming so hard and water sprash out to side walk. This is must have atraction in hot Dubai but why you need to go to Pool???? You have one beautiful Arabian Sea infront of you.

Great way to beat the heat!. Had an amazing experience with my 9yr old son. Great facilities and slides especially the surfing,which we did in repeat. Staff is friendly. Food is quite expensive though.

Excellent and well worth a visit. Excellent as always our fist visit to wadi's was around seven years ago I'm so glad to see that over time the watermark hasn't been left to deteriorate it's lovely and clean polite and proffestional staff and as much fun as the first time I visited well done to all involved

Great place. We visited Wild Wadi on several occasions during our holidays as access included within our package at the JBH - one of the main reasons we stay there. We all love Wild Wadi especially our 6 and 15 yr old boys. Yes there are other water parks to visit, which we have, and suggest all do as they are all good - but we find Wild Wadi is always brilliant with enough for everyone to enjoy. If you can avoid Fri/Sat weekend days as can get v busy from midday. Great facilities and always kept very clean with great staff everywhere.

Great waterpark, not too big but great fun.. Fantastic waterpark, no queues at the time I was there. Great views of the Burj and Jumeirah beach hotel. The Jumeirah Sceirah is one hell of a slide, I was more terrified walking up the stairs to it!! It is hideous yet fantastic all at once...give it a go. Plenty of places to sunbathe, relax, eat etc. There are loads of deals online for bogof so have a look before you visit.
Dubai Summer time Pass. While my stay in Jumeirah Beach Hotel, decided to visit Wild Wadi Waterpark, and it was awesome. Outside was very hot! but You can survive with Wild Wadi :)

Wild Adventure it is. been here twice and i must say i would still go for a third time :)place is really cool staff are friendly and very helpful. great place to go with friends and for the love of water.
vice. very nice weather hug pool warm water next to the beach in jumeirah beach hotel great staff very helpful
Enjoy water.. A must visit place to enjoy water with family, specially in summer season. Affordable tickets. far away from public transport.

Average water park.. Visited here with my girl. It was complementary admission given that we stayed a couple of nights at a Jumeria Hotel. The water park was really nice, although it appears much bigger than it already is. The rides were very fun and refreshingly cool from the summer heat. It was, however, crowded. The lines were not terrible though. The food is just ordinary theme park type food that is overpriced. We stayed for a few hours, as we had done everything and had some time to just lounge. My girl and I are adults with no kids, so perhaps this is more of a family destination versus a couples spot. It was nice to enjoy the cool water and fun rides none the less, but I would have been disappointed had I paid full price for admission for two.
Water Park Dubai. Average water park, no the largest but some decent rides in there. Fast food outlets are not upto much.
Danger of sunshine.. I think its fees is more than its pleasures.weather is so hot and danger of sunshine is more than normal.
What a water park. And I thought TEXAS had BIG things. Dubai has them beat and all structures are beautiful. Do go and visit this part of the world. YOu won't be sorry you did with GATE 1 tours.

Loved it! The best in Dubai. We loved this water park as it had so much for everyone.
We have been to Aqua venture and Yas waterworld and still found Wild Wadi to be the best and original.
Even the kids aged 8 and 9 loved the slides here better.

Landmark but need upgrade. Very famous and lovely place
Its even great if you never been in Yas water world or Atlantis aquaventure
Give a try but avoid weekends.

Wow ...!. It's a surprise to see this kind of water park in the middle east, really! I visited the place with some friends and we enjoyed every moment of it. It was fun, fun, and fun until we dropped. Literally!
Fun time . This is a great way to cool off during the hot day. So much fun! Surprisingly is was not very crowded when we went.
Fantastic!!!. Fantastic!!! We really enjoyed there. Children were so happy and we will definitely come back!!! Nice place to enjoy with family!!!

Fun for old and young. We had free entry for the Wild Wadi as we staid at one of the Jumeirah Hotels. We checked it out as we did not want to spend the whole time at the beach.It was a really nice half day experience. The rides are fun and there is a good mix between scary/exiting rides and things you can do with your children. The park also offers a ladies night once a week. A really great idea!!!

Very nice Water park!. My family enjoyed very much. All rides are very near. Except Jumeirah Scarer. Since 1999 I know the park and seen this place. You don't walk too much like other park. My kids enjoyed very much.

A great day in the sun!. An awesome way to spend the day. With kids or as couples, wild wadi has an arsenal of rides that are built for fun and thrill. Unless you want to lazy around and do nothing, well, there's always that too. Lots of food options as well, with great diversity. Jumeirah Sceirah is a must try - But not for the faint hearted :)One comment would be to try going there during the week to avoid long queues as it gets very crowded during the weekend and you can spend an easy 20 minutes waiting in line to get on a ride.

Great fun & pleasure. Great rides, short ways and much fun. Esp. the surf machine is a must you need to try. Also the slides Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj as well as the action rivers / wadis are great.

great fun. We stayed at Al Qasr next door and had complementary access to Wild Wadi. They bring you there for free with a buggy and you get free towels. They got quite a variety of rides there. Great fun for everyone who loves water slides.
Can be quite crowded, depending on the day and time.

Great fun. To be brutally honest it's not really worth the 280 dirham to get in so unless you staying at one of the Jumeirah resorts (entrance is free) it's pretty expensive.To be honest there arnt a million rides but there is enough to keep you entertained for a few hours. Tantrum alley and Jumeirah Screirah are by far the best rides. Adrenaline rush of note. The rest are pretty tame but also are a great way too relax and "chill".Drinks and food are expensive. Hideously so, but you expect that from theme parks. Overall a terrific way to spend a morning and feel like a teenager again before heading off to the malls and downtown Dubai.I've heard it can get chaotic during peak times so check before you go. You can wait up to an hour for some rides and they can be pretty congested. (So I've heard. We've always been in September so it's not bad at all)Take good sunscreen with. The ones in the park are ridiculously expensive and the sun can be a KILLER
Not as good as Atlantis. Very good but Atlantis is better. It's free if you are a Jumeriah customer. Found the place a bit cramped and not as pristine as Atlantis.

Excellent waterpark. We took our 6 month old Daughter here and she loved it. The wave pool has an extremely shallow entrance with very little wave action so its ideal for babies. Lots of shade if it gets hot. Food and drink around the park were a little on the expensive side and not really that healthy but we had a chicken kebab that was very tasty. Definitely suggest getting the refill cup and going crazy to keep your fluids up.
Fab day out.... Fab experience, definitely worth going whilst visiting here.Plenty to do for adults and children,very safe and lots of fun.

Nice day with the kid's . I am a regular costumer, I enjoy the day and atmosphere in the park put I have 3 big issues first is the food quality not to good and dose not much the level of the waildwadi .2nd the attitude of some of the staff is unacceptable. 3rd is the prices of every thing you are forced to buy in the park is way high comparing to other places. Very expensive

Excellent - little expensive but worth it.. We got free access to the park as we were staying at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers. The transfers dropped us door to door and we had a que jump advantage. They give you electronic wrist bands which you can add money too and purchase food and drinks with around the park. There is a charge for lockers starting from 35 dirhams but dont get caught out like us - they are the small ones and for the large lockers is 65 dirhams - approx £10! You are only charged once for using them so my husband and I shared one. We didnt eat here but a bottle of water was about £2. We visited very early 10.15am and the park was quiet...perfect as it was already 36 degrees and we went straight on the rides with no queing. Rides 1-5 are brilliant esp the Jumeirah Sceirah. Pay attention to the ride rating if you dont want any hidden shocks. Something for everyone here and wonderful views of the Burj Al Arab. If you dont spend all the money on the wristband you can get the rest refunded. Also don't forget to tell them you are at one of the Jumeirah chain hotels so that you dont get charged for renting a towel 35 dirhams (£6.50). Would definately visit again.
Water theme park in the prime location. Wonderful water theme park in the prime location of Dubai. Wonderful water games. Don't miss the waves.

Better than Aquaventure.. So much better than Aquaventure, Wild Wadi is busy but very well managed, unlike Aquaventure which is busy but poorly managed and very overpriced. There is loads to do at Wild Wadi, its not overpriced , the food is ok and again not overpriced. well worth a visit for the day.

The huge slide!. Ace experience, definitely worth going whilst visiting here.
Lost to do, very safe and very exciting.
Suitable for all ages.

A LOT OF FUN. I've been to Wild Wadi so many times, and each visit leaves me with great memories. The customer service is great, and every tourist/resident must visit Wild Wadi. It's a lot of fun and a great way to relax after stressful weeks/months working.
Fun day. We were there for 10am when it opened, we did not queue for any rides so would definitely recommend getting there early. I did think that there would be more rides though

Enjoyable day out. Very enjoyable day with a good range of rides to suit all. Very clean and would recommend the use of the money band. We put on 50 dirhams each (about £10) and this just about covered a mid day meal. Must try the Jemeriah scream!
Kids enjoyed it. Nice way to spend a few hours esp if you staying at a Jumeirah hotel and entrance is free. Can get really busy though. Some fun rides for the whole family.

Had fun but only 6 real rides for adults. Being an adrenaline junkie I found it a bit limited although the jumerah scierah was amazing.
It's a good park and a bit expensive so bring your own towel and don't forget to bring an entertainer voucher. FYI if you don't want to buy the whole book lots of people sell single vouchers on eBay.

Great day out for the kids and a variety of things to do. This is the second time I have been to the Wild Wadi and I was not disappointed. I have kids aged 7 and 9 and this park definitely kept them entertained. Avoid going on a Friday or Saturday as it gets really busy. We went on a Wednesday and arrived at 10am. We were able to get on all the rides without having to wait in queues. Please note that it may be better to bring your own towel as otherwise you will incur additional costs. The lockers are great but a medium size locker was enough for 4 people. You cant bring your own food into the park but there is a range of food to choose from. You can top up your wrist band with money which means you don't have to carry cash around with you. If you don't spend everything, you can get the money back at the end of the day.
Great fun. Just a short trip to this from our hotel the Dar Al Masyaf and we had a great day of fun on the water slides and wave pool. a great place for families too
fantastic for all ages. I loved the fact that there was alot of sun loungers around the complex if you wanted to relax while the kids went round. It felt safe as there are alot of lifeguards around.
irritating queues. all the good rides had irritating queues. but the wave pool and the lazy pool were good. the lifeguards were also always on watch. but i enjoyed aquaventure more
Brilliant water park. Lots if really scary rides and slow peaceful ones. Great for young children and really safe. You can easily spend a whole day there, many people do.

Great Waterpark w/ Burj Al Arab View. This was the first water park I've been too in UAE and it exceeds my expectations.The place was really great. lots of water rides to choose from. Queue is always the issue so you need to be patient if you want to try any rides.I can't really comment on the rides and as i haven't tried most of them. But overallthe park was great. Perfect place for the family and friends alike.There's food available inside and outside foods & beverages are not allowed.Go pros are allowed so no worries for those who want to document their adventure.Some good offers are there during summer time so it's advisable to visithere when you're in dubai during that time.Highly recommended for all ages except for those who have heart issues.Just limit yourself with swimming and relaxing just like i did.

Really fun. Must do! Was a great day in the heat of Dubai, the near vertical drop was the scariest & most fun, once you pluck up the courage to give it a go! Eventually did it several times, all rides were great fun would defiantly go back

Fun day out. Well worth a visit been to both Atlantis and wild wadi, wild wadi is far the better park great staff minimal ques more compact and the ground is not as hot I know this sounds silly but u can leave your flip flops and walk around not possible in Atlantis. Jumeriah scheriah great and the views of the burj Al Arab ar great.
Fun day. Something for all ages. Exceptionally clean, and great staff. We visited regularly as we were staying within complex at Jumeirah Beach hotel and made full use of complimentary access.

Great family day !. Had a great day here, prefer the size of this water park to others we have visited, easy to negotiate in the August heat. The rides are great and kept my 10 year old happy all day. Plenty of sunbeds available here and lots of shaded areas which was a big plus for us. Would definetely return again.

Fun for all the family. I just love spending a couple of hours in Wild Wadi. As we were staying at Jumeirah Beach entrance is free so its easy to just pop in for an hour or two to go on our favorite rides.This is a very safe waterpark, with lots of lifeguards and life jackets available around the main wave pool. Unlike other parks in the area you do not have to carry the inflatables with you but collect them as your about to go onto the ride, which is much easier. A good water park with fun for all the family. Highly recommended

Not for younger children. Great water park but for my 2 young children not really much to do. They were bored within a few hours. Entrance fee is priced at 295 aed for adults and 205aed for children. Under 2's are free. Wild wadi features in the Dubai entertainer so not too bad for BOGOF. This park has numerous slides (pretty hair raising), a wave pool and children's area. Food prices are really expensive so I took my own (not allowed, only water allowed but I smuggled it in). Nice place but I personally think Atlantis Aquaventure is more for families
Good Family expericance. It was a great family experience. The rides were good and all free once you paid your ticket.. It can get very hot but plenty of places to relax.

Day full of fun!!. Perfect for any ages and with a great variety of rides - why not cope with the sun and have heaps of fun at the same time!? This waterpark is great for younger kids aswell and is something you must check out

So Expensive and so limited. So expensive and for the amount of money you only have 8 games to play for the whole day! We stayed there for 4 hours and we felt fed up. Although it was midweek we stayed 15 mins sometimes on a queue so imagine the weekends???
Fab time. Only reason that I have given this a 4 is because when we were there it was off season and they were doing work so some parts of the slides we being repaired. Had a great time otherwise!

Great day out for all. Great location near most of the beach and Palm hotels etc.
Good mix of family slides and some white nuckle ones too !
Drinks bought seperate are way too expensive but meal deals are reasonable when compared.
good. go there early to avoid the rush... so much to do.... gives you a lot of time to explore as well :-)

3rd Visit - give it a go. Every visit to Dubai we visit the effortless park- no walking up stairs if you don't want. Water rings on jets take you up and you get off when you have reached your ride- like I said effort less.A word of warning is that you cant take your own food in- you have to buy there but I recommend your share....The meals are gigantic
Good rides. Good water park, Jumeirah ride is teh best, the floor just drops out.good value park, food and drink is a bit over prices and you cannot bring anything in, but a good day out

Wild Wadi W/Park Dubai - Awesome place. Recent visit to Dubai - 8/2015 - went to WWWP with my wife and 3 boys (ages 6,8,11) - park entrance ticket based on height - tickets over £50 as everyone over 1.1 meters, less than 1.1 meters aren't much cheaper). We used Arabian tours company based in Dubai and they got us much cheaper tickets saved around £7 per person. The water park is compact, has lots of slides - our favorite was wave pool (plenty of life jackets for novices so need to spend any money), burj sooraj and tantrum alley (sit in tubes)- these rides my 6 and 8 year old enjoyed (but its a bit of walk up to the top) - the jumeriah scarer (probably misspelt) is a high adrenalin ride and near vertical drop my 11 year old loved this and went on it several times - he also enjoyed the surfer rideKids area with compulsory large bucket which empties every few minutes - amused my 6 year old every time - finally lazy river where you can relax and float on tubes There are plenty of eateries dotted around the park The park has free WiFi - tip connect at the entrance as harder to connect once in the parkYou have a watch like device which you can charge with credit so you don't have to keep cash with you (also used for locker - tip if you use this on wrong locker wipes off your cash credit so be careful)Tip - If family - just get a big locker there was 5 of us and we manged to fit everything in easily If you are deciding between this and Atlantis - I prefer this - why more rides my kids can go on (height restriction on Atlantis rides is 1.2 meters) - no WiFI at Atlantis you have to pay for it - Atlantis lots of landscaping so rides are far apart - no preloaded electronic cash so have to carry your wallet with you ? but you have access to the beach - the lazy river has a few nice surprises ( but the wave pool is a disappointment) - the kids area is just as large and pretty much similar - they do have a few different high adrenalin rides so older children may prefer this to Wild Wadi - eating places several with one large sit in restaurant which is great - the costs are similar! again cheaper through tour companies

A family trip we won't forget. . I was so excited to visit the Wild Wadi again with my son who had now reached the required height to venture on the rides. We arrived at around 10.30 and were processed through security and then waited whilst our tickets we had bought from the hotel were validated. Once in we selected a spot for our base. We brought our own towels and we were ready to hit the rides. We visited on a Sunday as this should be a quieter day compared to a Friday or Saturday. We were not dissapointed the longest we had to queue all day was around 20 minutes on the matter blaster due to a blockage around the course. We did almost every ride several times and it was great. I felt safe and the untold amount of life guards and staff add to that feeling. A great day out topped of with very expensive souvenir photos to remind my son and I of our special day together.

heart full of funnnnn. sliding in the watter with ring was fantastic.be care your children small in size to avoid ride it,dont take risk if it necessory go to the lifeguard to get a small ring.50 50 remarks as the staff was not ready to arrange the rubber ring.they must make a not that we have to collect ring our self to top if they dont have enough ring there.rather this we enjoied the surf/

Great Experience. Excellent rides but a better lazy river at the Atlantis. Please take a towel as the extra cost for it is unnecessary. Try to get there before 10am so you can avoid the queue for the rides. We got there early and went on the rides twice before the queues started.

Fun but small. This water park is not that big. Most of the rides go into each one so like 1 big ride. Wear flip flops as the ground get hot. come early when its quiet to avoid queues at the rides. Once you've finished, go to your locker, get your phone and go back to all the rides with stairs and you will get amazing pictures of burj Al Arab, beaches and Dubai skyline.I also did the fish pedicure here, which was slightly expensive but worth it.
It was a lot of fun!. We had a good time here, there rides were so much fun and the place is just set out really well. We would come again!

few rides. They are very few rides at wild wadi, only 11 in total of which 5 are for children, the 6 rides for adults are quite good but not really worth the very high price to get in at over £50.00, if you use the vouchers from the entertainer book it just about makes it worthwhile

Extremely Dangerous. My family and I arrived at the park today and the first ride we went on was the main water slide where you sit on small rubber rings. My 7 year old was put into an oversized ring by disinterested and frankly incompetent staff.They should not be wearing shirts with the word life guard on it. When he was shot up the ramp his back was scraped along the metal runners and despite screams of pain was completely ignored. I jumped out of my ring and grabbed him with again no response or question from anyone. I then checked his back and found multiple red welts where his skin had been taken off the length of three vertebrae having torn through his wet shirt. God only knows what would have happened had he let go in pain or if he was not wearing a shirt. He is a very tall boy for his age and he is now badly hurt for the rest of our trip. DO NOT TAKE YOUR KIDS HERE IT IS NOT SAFE THERE IS NOTHING STOPPING THEM FROM FLYING OFF THE RINGS EXCEPT THEIR HANDS. THERE IS NOTHING STOPPING THEM SCRAPING UP THEIR BACKS. The park managers response was"Maam this does not happen everyday"To which I responded that if it did happen everyday they would be shut down. This park had no clue about the safety of children in my opinion.You would be risking your kids if you took them.Needless to say we left immediately.

Lovely day out. Lovely day out clean water park with plenty of lifeguards to hand & other staff to help you. My tip would be to bring your own towels as they start at 30aed per towel. Not as big as Atlantis but also not as busy. They do a ladies only nite ever Thursday until September 2015. Which we loved. We loved it!
would rather go to the atlantis. was good to do and have at least tried, but not that many rides, more to do at the Atlantis water park and the Atlantis water park is cheaper.

Brilliant!. A group of 11 of us went here this included a wheelchair user, adults, children and infants. And everyone absolutely loved this place!30 different attractions and something for everyone, as most of the bigger rides have a height restriction of 1.1 metres some of the children were unable to go on these but plenty of alternatives to keep them busy! We paid 250AED for anybody over 1.1 metres (£44) and 190 for anybody under 1.1 metres (£33) a reasonable price.You need to buy a locker on arrival to store your belongings in this can be brought from the shop. Plenty of food and drink places dotted around the one I recommend is Alis BBQ. Very nice grilled menu and a good selection for kids. The Jumeirah Sceirah is a must!! Beware of the long waiting times as it's very popular but worth the wait.Also the wave pool is a nice place that all of us could hang out together. Overall if your visiting Dubai this has to be on the to do list!!!
Fun filled day. We visited wild wadi as we do every holiday and although peak season the park did not disappoint. Fun family day out ;)?

Nothing changed in 11yrs apart from the price.... What a wonderful place to go for a family, nice easy fun (as long as its not crowded). We had great fun but at nearly £60 person its way overpriced even for dubai, if the lockers, towels and perhaps water fountains included fine but boy oh boy £60 a head come on what are you thinking about?
Not as great as expected. Expected more. Have been to a couple of waterparks in Europe and Africa and this was not the best. Adequate.

One of the best water parks in the world !!!!. Great water park made even better if you stay at the jumierah beach hotel its free to go in and out all day.also if you go between 10am/11am only access for jbh-burj-madinat hotel residents empty nearly ,we loved the flow riders!!!!!
Great. Great. Great activities for families and things to do for children with a cool slide👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌❤️❤️👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌with a nice hotel

A fun day out making a real splash. This was a fabulously fun day out for our family. Not a great deal of rides but those they had were all exhilarating, particularly their signature ride where you free fall down a tube. The visit was well worth it. We were fairly lucky with the wait times for rides as we were in off season but I suspect at peak season the wait times could prove painful. Changing rooms were well organised though chaotic. The food choice was limited and fast food and the merchandise range was not that inspiring.

Lazy river V slow. Not the best water park you'll ever visit but well worth a day out and value for money.The large ring rides from high up are the best and suit all ages.( except small children)The lower lazy river ride is a little slow in places and many people get out and walk. There's Lazy rivers and Lazy Rivers but this one is " Bone Idle" and very slow in places.We found this the only disappointment in the park.
Great day out. Great day out, queue not a problem 10 mins max for most attractions. Plenty of food courts and great changing facilities with lockers and towel hire.

Fantastic. Best water park i can say. it has so much to do and you will not come to know how your day is spent over there. great place for childrens too. must go and best place to hang out with friends!

Great fun . It was a lot less busy than the other water park so we didn't have to queue for anything we wanted to go onSeemed more for the younger kids and less for the white knuckle crowd.Still good fun. Was a scorching hot day so make sure you use sun screen.

Great family day out. You love waterparks you'll love this place. Yes Yas park and Atlantis are bigger but this place is as good for a family day out. Lots of fun in the water, only one down side. You have to buy food and drink from wild wadi can't bring any in. This can be expensive and not necessarily great quality.
More rides.. but busy as usual. Good water park.. not been for a few years so a couple of new rides about.. still quite busy so go mid-week (tues/wed) to miss the crowds.

Brilliant family day. Absolutely great day out with the family, so much to do and hardly any queuing to go on any of the slides. The food is of a decent standard and it's easy to find your way around the park. Can't wait to go back!
"Unforgettable experiece ever". One of the best water park in the UAE. You will experience the unique, thrilling activities here with your friends and family.
Fantastic and thrilling experience. I liked the waterfalls the water adventure and the fact that it's sare even for children, will definitely bring the little ones too
Excellent. Its an excellent place. There r manyyy awesome rides like the black hole , jumeiah sceirah , tantrum alley and burj surj. They r scary but very very adventrous nd u shud visit tht place
Super Duper. This is the best water park in Dubai, very little que's, great walkways watered down, great eating and drinking areas, fantastic locker area and very safe. Fantastic rides for a levels.

Great relaxing park. All the rides are really fun. kids had real fun. they enjoyed thoroughly. Park is clean and hygienic. u want get proper Indian food but there are many restaurants serving pizzas, burger and sandwiches.

dissapointing. was told by the excursion man at the hotel this is the best waterpark in duabi. Wrong this is a 2 year olds park, as a young adult i was very dissapointed that i had wasted money when i could have gone to atalantis as i have heard this is twice as better. £8 for a locker is ridic when i had completed the park in 20 mins

Great day out. This water park is very enjoyable and that's why we come here so much. The only bad things I would say is that they need some more thrill rides and it's very expensive. You will need to spend all day here.
Terrible. This is a kids water park with about 5 slides which all connect. Absoulutely waste of time and money.

Awesome !!!. went with a group of 10 people from all age groups and all had a wonderful time, remember the part is open till 10 pm in summers, we reached there at about 5 in the evening on Friday and as the time passed there were few people left hence there were no long queues on the rides and the wave pool also wasn't very busy. Would definitely recommend this time to beat the summer heat.
Would go again to do more. Great water park which we all enjoyed get there early and make the most of the day as queues are long.

Great day. We had a great day at wild wadi,really enjoyed all the water rides.
Recommend getting there at opening time so as to avoid any queues for the rides.

Good water park. Wild Wadi is a "good" water park.Even though peak summer weather, while in park did not feel the heat. Enough shade, and water seems to be temperature controlled to keep it cool.There were only a few good rides. The Tantrum Alley and the Sceirah, the latter being good only if you willing to overcome fear of highs, and floor being pulled from under your feet. Other water parks have much larger variety of rides for people with various tolerance to speed, height and fear.Food is expensive.Honestly felt Yas World in Abu Dhabi was better.Ques may not be as long because most tourists are probably going to the water park at Atlantis.The ques for the rides during the last hour dropped significantly even though more shade and sun setting.

Really fun!. Really fun and has a wide variety of slides. It can be hot but there is coverage. The large interconnected slide is really nice how it connects to the lazy river. Only thing is that the "taxi service" barely had any taxis coming there.
Fun. Really good. Had a great time with my teenage cousins. Rides are very fun and staff is friendly and helpful
Don't miss to go their. Ny family and I like to spend some time their we always go when ever we visited Dubai it is really great place

Most amazing Place to visit if you love Water Park!. it's real fun to visit Wild Wadi water park! it give you really amazing experience with your family and kids too! most amazing rides a huge area and great place for dine and hangout!

Good Fun but expensive entry & food. The on the door price is now 295 dirhams which is nearly £60 per person, including kids over a certain height. Use the entertainer vouchers for the buy 1 get one free and then cost halves, although book cost nearly 495 Dhms now. We went on a Sunday, go there for around 9.30, no queues for tickets and waited till 10 am. but 12, kids had been on all the rides and by afternoon park was busy. Food was crazy expensive, they ask you to load up credit on your wrist strap but you can pay cash as well inside. Prices were around £10 a burger meal, lockers were also expensive. Rides are fun, we hadnt been for a few years so the Jumeirah Sceirah now has 2 slides but only one was working, the new Tantrum Alley ride was the most fun as 4 can sit at the same time. They also had a womens only night, you can check their web site for more details.

Not Family friendly. We stayed in dubai and made the decision to go to this park bad mistake the toddlers area is very small and you cannot go on the small slides as a pairing,and children's area is not shaded from the sun but the most disappointing is the there is no family changing room. A joke in modern dubai we will stick to Yas Waterpark in Abu Dhabi where they have all these amenities.

Nice. Thats it. . Nice water park if you have a complementary tickets. Else, it doesn't worth expensive tickets you need to buy.Not too big. You need not more than 2 hours to play everything.The hight restruction is overestimated for Most of the slides.

Good day out. As we were guests at JBH we used the water park everyday for FREE!!Towels given to us free and the wrist bands can be charged with money to save carrying cash. Locker rental is available too but we didn't use this.The Half Board vouchers can also be used too.Rides have been updated since our last visit and would recommend they are used early as the queues build up. The wave pool is fun, plenty of chairs and sun loungers too.

Make sure you get on to the extreme thrill rides. The park has a good range of rides and things to do. The food however is not the best. We stayed at Madinat Jumierah so we got in free. If I had paid £55ish per person for the family I would be disappointed to say the least

Wild wadi thrills. This venue if packaged with your jumeriah hotel is great value for moneyVery clean water, lifeguards everywhere meant i was comfortable with my young onesDont go on friday or saturday as too busy. Only about 6 rides i did the sceirah this year But enough to occupy kids for a day Body surfing is good fun pop out to jumeirah beach hotel for the 3 m pool
awesome experience. year 2007 when i first visited wild wadi water park and my experience was awesome, i came to visit again last july 2015 and still never fails to amaze me.
Wildwadi - wild waterpark. Great tourist attraction. Must visit tourist spot for some fun times with family or friends, especially friends!Cheers!

Lots of fun for teens. My cousins and I had a great time at Wild Wadi. The snack bar had good food, the wait time for rides were very short, the longest being 10-15 minutes. It's situated right in between The Burj Al Arab, and Jumeirah Beach Hotel. The only ride we didn't do was The Steep slide, because the wait time was about 1.5 hours. That was the only long line that day. Otherwise, the slides had lots of adrenaline, and the lazy river was awesome, as it was going around the entire park.

Shoddy Shoddy Wadi Wadi. My teenager son and I visited this place today. At £50 a head, we had relatively high expectations - this turned out not to be the case, we were in and out in 15 minutes.To begin, we queued up for 25 minutes in the blinding heat whilst one operative, on one till just casually chatted to other operatives, ignoring the queue. When we finally got to the front we just got attitude and had a wrist band literally thrown at us.We then proceeded to the changing rooms. Once we were changed we spent 20 minutes trying to put all our belongings into a locker which would not lock. It turned out despited having parted with £50 each, we had to go line up again, with all our belongings in our arms, to pay another £6 to lock the locker with our belongings in. It would have been useful to have known this in advance.By this time we were verging on heat stroke. On to the first ride. Trying to find a ride is not easy. Once there, you guessed it, another queue, we got to the front this time and the ride just stopped. Twenty minutes later I asked the life guard what was going on - I got a shoulder shrug and that was that.We tried to find another ride and failed. By this time we just needed a pool to cool down in - but you guessed it - no regular pool. There is a small wave pool really packed with small children - but to us the water as a result looked slightly suspect.We had visited this place to cool down, yet we were much hotter than before we started.So, if you want to part with a lot of cash, stand in a lot of queues, experience very few water rides and have no access to a regular pool to cool down, then this is the place for you.Like so much in Dubai - just because something looks the part, does not mean it is.More focus needs to go into the user experience which I have found to be generally poor- there is glaring plagerism everywhere but the essence of the experience is usually missing.
Situated in the upmarket area. Situated in the upmarket area.lots of rides and slides both for the young and old.a whole day outing.make sure to go early so that you can make the most of it!

Too pricey for nothing. There are just 7 rides. literally. its too pricey for that money. also they do not allow footwear in the park and in the afternoon it is really hot to step on the rocky ground. I regret spending that kind of money there

Probably the best water park you'll ever visit. We arrived just before the park opened at 10.00 and got in lots of early rides with no queuing at all. There are excellent rides of all standards that can be taken individually or with up to 3 others. The quality of the park, the rides, the facilities and eating options is excellent. Together with the sunshine and heat, you can't go wrong.

Underwelming and lots of lines..... Yawn..If you enjoy waiting in lines to use the few proper water slides, or if you enjoy being pushed around passively on a tube in the baking sun.... this park is for you! If you are used to proper water parks with lots to do, perhaps dive a little further to the end of a man made island in the shape of a palm. This park (small area) does not have a lot of slidesThis park has a long lazy river which you sit on a tube and get boredThis park is very crowded
Great fun. Great water park lots to do surfing good, the 3 second drop slide omg scary but fantastic lazy rivers with all push up slide areas great day out highly recommend

Brilliant. Second visit to the wadi and never disappoints. Good rides, reasonable queues, helpful staff, can't fault it..
Remember your suncream, have plenty of drinks and take some water shoes, stops you burning. your feet and you can wear them on the ride...
Oh and also free Wi-Fi, Skype, whatsapp etc to keep in touch.

Water park. As part of your hotel package we had complimentary access to the water park. We went one day just to see what is was all about. It was great. In the end we ended going back on three occasions. It is well worth a visit if you are in Dubai

Great Location, Great Deal. Located near the very luxury hotel, Burj Al Arab. Good location, you can go there even with a public transportation such as a bus, or taxi, you should try the very long slide, it was awesome!!!

Very cool pace for all ages . From those little fish who clean your feet to massive grips and wave pools for the little ones wild wadi has it all . I absolutely loved the water slides and the lazy river will definitely go again if in Dubai also it is a bit pricey but good for what you get
Great complimentary extra to our hotel. We had free use of this water park as we were staying at the Jumeriah beach hotel. Lots of rides, loads of life guards, spotlessly clean, great fun.
Lazy river all the way. Excellent and if your stying within the hotel free access is a bonus also you can even use your half board vouchers and have your lunch at no extra expense

Cracking water park, great service in an amazing place..... Well if you want a lazy day wild wadi is the day for you, not too many rides but what views....my personal view after going quiet a view times now is the Atlantis Aquaventure is by far the better water park in Dubai. There is more rides and the park is far bigger than wild wadi. Definitely worth a visit wild wadi but if you are only going to do one I would say Aquaventure is the one for you....

Ladies Night- Brilliant. Went for a ladies night on Thursday evening. This is a wonderful way for ladies to enjoy the park without any inhibitions. The park is monitored by female staff and lifeguards. The lines are also considerably smaller than what I imagine they would be during the day. We managed to do all the rides and overall enjoyed the experience.Used the entertainer voucher 2 for 1 which brought the price down of the ticket.
amazing park!. Amazing water park, in the heart of Dubai! a must visit in the summer if you are in a thrilling water park! ideal for kids + adults

Love Wild Wadi. We prefer WIld Wadi to Aquaventure. Perhaps because it is smalled and brighter.
Very clean and staff are helpful and friendly.

Worth a visit with complimentary entry.. We visited because we had free access with our Jumeirah Summer Flavours deal. I must point out that we are in our fifties and we enjoyed the less active rides like the lazy river, I was worried about my recurring back problem however we went on the high rubber raft slide and my wife was scared stiff.I would have thought younger people would love it.
Wild Wadi, Dubai 2014. Best of the water parks because there are hardly any stairs to climb at all with your innertube! We have a blast every time we go and look for coupons in the Entertainer!

Good day out. Wild Wadi comes across as being well-managed, with lifeguards on hand to 'catch' and 'dispatch' you at fixed points along the long slides and steps where you can get out at various points if you're not enjoying it. For families, there's a good choice of fast rides for kids over 1.1m to ride on, a wave pool and a nice kids' area with some water slides. it's not as huge as other water parks in Dubai - this could be a good thing for some people.It gets crowded on Fridays - the worse point was the groups of men who pushed and shoved and had no manners. Go first thing in the morning and avoid Fridays and I think you'd have a far better time.
Great. Fantastic location to go and enjoy with the family. Overseeing the view of Burj Al Arab. Great rides and connecting lazy river ride. It is great ride to go as a complete family to have fun.

Great Fun Water Park Close to the Burj Al Arab Hotel.. Great Water Park. A lot of water rides, close to the Burj Al Arab. I would recommend this visit as it will keep you cool and if your a fan of water rides, you will love this place.

Excellent water park but very busy. We wanted to visit Aquaventure but didn't found Entertainer Dubai 2015 voucher for it and we ended in Wild Wadi. The park is great, has free parking but in general everything is very expensive for our taste. Nevertheless with the vouchers we saved some 500 dirhams for the 4 of us. It was a pity that our son was little below 110 cm. and couldn't enjoy most of the rides as the staff made no compromise with it. It was also strange that some of the visitors didn't use swimming suits, but only clothes or underwear which is generally not allowed but in practice is happening. The park was also very busy even during the week and there are an hour queues for the most attractive rides. The staff is very friendly and well organised.

Great rides but I was thirsty all the time. The water park facility is amazing, I had lots of fun with family. There are two issues with the park. First, there is not any water fountain to drink water and you have to buy super expensive water bottles and carry it with yourself all over the park, while it is impossible if you really want to enjoy the rides. You cannot take money because it will get wet in the park. Specially in Dubai's weather which is super hot and humid. Second, you need to really take the whole container of your sunscreen lotion and renew it every half an hour. Otherwise, you will get really bad sun burn. It not actually a park's problem, this is Dubai's.

Fun place !. Great water parkWe loved every aspect of this water park. There are fast rides, daring rides, wave machine and a lovely lazy river. Something for all ages. Very clean and plenty of lifeguards all around the park so we felt comfortable letting the children have fun !There are food places on site and you can hire a locker

Thursday review. I definitely an amazing experience that tourists have to try it !. I went for the girls thursday night. The organisation was neat and on time. However food inside is not delicious at all.
Better than Aquaventure. Too small to get a very good rating but some good slides for young children and well laid out. Much better than Aquaventure at Atlantia

Great. The best watermark in town! amazing rides and a whole lotta fun. quite compact than the others so easy to get around. very attentive staff working there to ensure safety. all in all well worth a day out

August- Hot-Busy-still fun!. It was busy and not exactly cheap to get in- don't like the idea of having to pre purchase food tokens onto your wrist band, but can understand why- saves you having to carry money around.Some novel rides, surfing, large lazy river, wave park and a really different ride where the water takes you uphill in rubber rings to be thrown back down and up again over and over!Taxis outside for ease of getting back to your hotels.Would recommend!

Fun Day Out!. I have been to wild wadi a few times and it never fails to impress. The water park is spectacular and is great in the heat. The views are magical as you are next to the Burj Al Arab and looks magnificent.

Amazing experience. Kids spent an whole day in the heats of a August summer day. Well worth every single penny. Kids where 7 and 9 and greatest day out so far. The wave machine and back drops for photos is just amazing.Has to be a must do in Dubai...
Great day out for adults or children's. Liked all the rides there ! There is something for everyone and all ages ! Well organised and planned , also the food tastes good for a park
great day out. had a great day of fun here, don't think you would spend more than one day though as the rides are very limited,we did all enjoy ourselves though

Great Fun with and with out the kids. Great fun with and without the kids. Clean, no jumping the lines, never packed and not expensive. Plenty of places to keep out of the hot sun as well. Enjoy.. The Screamer is wild.. 9/10

Superb Waterpark. At first we did think it was a little expensive for a waterpark but when you get inside you will change your mind, as it is beautiful and worth the money.The layout is great, lots of sun loungers no problem is getting one, lots of variety of rides and slides for all ages and ability.Nice food, drink and retail outlets.The selling factor has to be the views of the Burj Al Arab!

Wild Wadi Water Park. The Wild Wadi Water Park is an outdoor water park in Dubai... its Situated in the area of Jumeirah, next to the Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, the water park is operated by Jumeirah awesOme moments this time in summer mindblowing place ;)wd 17 water slide 3 pools and more rides much fun with frnds any one can goofees Onle 9,500/- per head awesome parl i love it
Wild wadi. This is an amazing experience, well worth the visit when in dubai, plenty of slides, water fun for all to enjoy, good facilities and very clean
Good but crowded. Fun although we were there in off peak season and it was still crowded. nice place to escape the heat for the day but be ready to queue.
A fun place. I thoroughly enjoyed the trip , the rides were fun and safe as well , there were life guards everywhere in case of an accident . Must visit if you have kids.
Just Great!. Great place for kids and adults, big enough to keep you entertained for a day! Food available throughout the park.

Great day out. Well worth a visit, Its a fun day out for all the family, there is a variety of attractions within Wild Wadi for all ages. The system they run is very efficient. You have a wristband upon entry, you can add lunch money to this so you dont need to leave valuables laying around. Lunch venues vary and again there is something for everyone and very reasonable too. At the end of the day anything left is refunded. You can hire towels if you need to and lockers too.Admission is a bit pricey but you can obtain vouchers from hotels and some shops so worth asking. You can definitely spend the whole day here. There is plenty of shade to be found and because of the water it stays quite cool.

Great day out.. Smashing day out and well worth a visit, just remember to take flip flops! As the ground gets very, very hot! Well laid out and real helpful staff. We visited Friday afternoon and it was not so busy; we waited no more than 15 mins for the best attractions.

Great fun. A great day out for all the family- but its expensive. Many of the slides connect together, so once you have done one or two you tend to repeat as you pass the same places, but this does make them longer than other water parks.

Wild Wadi Fun fun. Its simple. if you re in Dubai, and you have kids...YOU HAVE GOT TO GO HERE. the rides are fun..its not crazy big so you wont be getting lost again and again. but keep it or buy from there a water proof phone cover. and also rubber socks. the floor get hot and its annoying to keep track of where you took your sandals off!

A great day out. Excellent day out. Enjoyed all of the water rides and felt very safe with the close monitoring of the lifeguards. No need to carry any money around as you were given a pre paid electronic band which fitted on your wrist and was scanned for food and drinks. Any money remaining was given back to you at the exit.

Small park for what you pay. Wild Wadi is good but perhaps better for families with smaller children. The food outlets there are very limited, but very over priced. Its a relatively small park....Aquaventure at Atlantis is bigger and better.
Nice but old . I think in Dubai always most the greatest thing and everything most be unique ,I have been in Yas water word its bigger and more interesting I think wild wadi need upgrade

Really fun...especially in 45 degree heat!. It's a great water park with something for everyone; Jumeirah Beach Hotel guests get in free but need to pay a 30AED fee for the lockers - once you get a locker you can open and close as many times as you like in a day.Restaurants only serve fast food and doesn't cater for vegetarians; mainly kebabs, burgers, Ceaser Salad (meal for one costs around 50AED) ..and you can't bring your own!Navigating the park is a bit confusing but you'll get the hang of it as it's quite small. There are places to store your flip flops but you'll have to make your way back to the ride to pick them up with barefeet. But the park is kept really clean.Tips: go early and look out for Thursday evening women's only. Rides are labelled based in intensity with red the most intense. There are a couple of andrenalin inducing rides for singles and families. There are lots of lifeguards around and they are easy to spot.All in all a great experience let down by unhealthy options for snacks!
Great day out. Super day out and good value for money. At least you can cool off from the scorching temperatures! Something for everyone in a family.
great for a group of friends. we went there as a group of 6, some parts were really exciting, just the food was a little bit expensive

Wild Wadi versus Yas Waterworld. I visited both waterparks a couple of times and came to the following conclusion: WildWadi is children friendlier and Yas Waterworld for older kids. The wild wadi rides were more child friendly and there were more that I could do with my 4 year old boy than in YasWaterworld.I enjoyed both very much and recommend Wild Wadi for younger children and Yas for the ones who are older and will be allowed on the rides.

A fun day in the sun and water at Wild Wadi. We visited the Wild Wadi last week as part of stay at the Jumeriah Al Qasr. Free entry to the attraction is a nice perk of staying in this hotel. My kids loved it. My 14yr old daughter liked the more scary rides while my 5yr old son had a fabulous time in the wave pool and the small kids section were the giant bucket drenches everyone every few minutes. Height limit I think for rides is 1.1m and while my son is a couple of cm's under the limit he didn't kick up a stink we denied access to the bigger rides (phew!!) We have been here many times over the last 10 years and still enjoy it as much as the 1st time.

Superb Water Park for all ages. Superb water park , even for a family who don't do thrill rides. We generally don't do much more than the lazy river in water parks. However we found we ended up going on all the yellow dingy rides , there are lots of them. We did avoid the steep tunnel ride and the surf boards as they were simply terrifying. I would recommend to get there as soon as it opens and plan to stay all day. Go on as many rides as possible in the morning before it gets too busy and you start queing up, approx after 12pm. Remember to take your swim clothes and towels (if you have a complimentary jumeirah pass , you have a free towel at the entrance). Lockers are expensive at £10 for a mid sized locker and food and drink approx £10 per head for lunch. You are not allowed to take your own food and are limited to 1/2 litre water. Also cameras unless waterproof can be pointless, they have official photographers everywhere, so make the most of them and get your tag after every picture. We ended up purchasing a usb with all the photos for £40.A bit pricey, but still an amazing fun packed venue for all ages.

Fun filled day. What an amazing place.We loved the fact that you can charge up a wristband with money to buy food,so you dont need to carry cash around with you.We also got a locker rental.The rides were amazing,try the Jumeriah Screimah if you are brave enough!!!

Best water park in Dubai. Amazing water park, spent all day here. Second visit and some of the slides had changed but even better. Staff very friendly and helpful, very laid back, had a nice relaxing time to say it was a water park, great for kids and adults.
Has seen its best days. Dubai had evolved, Wild Wadi didn't unfortunately. Its like frozen in time. Compared to newer similar venues it has a hard time competing,

Good fun for all ages !!. We visited WW on our recent trip to Dubai. We were a family of 5, 2 adults and 3 children.The entrance fee is expensive but make sure you buy the Entertainer voucher book beforehand, in there there are 3 vouchers which will give you free entrances for each paying adult. It is also extra to purchase a locker, but we bought one large locker and shared it between the 5 of us.We enjoyed all the rides in the park and sat on some 2-3 times, in between the thrill rides we just chilled in the wave pool.The best time to go is in the morning as it starts to get busier in the afternoon.There are also some really good eating places and we found the prices to be fairly reasonable and in line with general food prices in and around Dubai.

Wild fun, when weather is hot nothing better than be on the water. When the temperature is really hot, nothing is better than to be on refreshing water.The best are the two floating rivers, big fun for all ages and repeated till exhaustion. Others water animations are fun but much shorter, so you finish to repeat and repeat the one you love more, and they are for all the types. Arriving early is key to avoid the big number of people that arrive lunch hour. I recommend for all the people, you finish to forget the temperature cause you are always wet.

One of the best in the world?. Actually, for those, who like extreme there are only 2 rides that are really good. One, where you fall almost 90 degree down and one, where you go with somebody in the circle... others are for girls and kids (also nice pool with waves) and comparing price and quality I would not say that it is one of the world's best waterparks... one that is in Koblevo, near Odessa, Ukraine is not worst than this, just you have another view)))

Perfect Location. Wild Wadi is located on the Jumeirah Beach road just opposite to the Hotel Burj Al Arab. The total area is quite small if you see it from the top though its that well constructed with a good theme. Because of its prime location, you can see the coastal area as well as hotel view while on top. There are 3-4 thrilling rides for adults, specially Jumeirah Sceirah which speeds upto 80 km/hr in almost vertical angle. The entry is a bit high but you can always get some offers while booking online. The vouchers are also available if you are staying in some of the Jumeirah Group hotels. Overall a Nice Experience. GJ

Not bad . If you book in jumeirah hotels chain you have a chance to get free tickets to have fun in wild wadi water park.It's quite good but I really think that what ever they sell inside really expensive, one bottle of water cost 2.75$, and you can't bring any thing with you from outside.One ice cream cost 5.5$ ?!!!The children have fun, this the point.
Nice. Only one word .. amazing . i feel too relxed here. A cool water bath . I recommend this place for entertainment to everyone .......

Great Day Out. We were a party of two adults and three teenagers. The rides at the park are very good and the park was spotlessly clean. There weren't big queues for any of the rides but there were height restrictions on some of them for smaller children. Food at the park was readily available and was not too expensive. You can easily spend the whole day there and it's well worth a visit. The only negative was that there isn't a massive amount of rides at the park compared to other parks.

The cold water was a MUST in 48 degrees!. We visited this water park twice as it was 48 degrees so water was a must to keep cool and the sea was as hot as a bath! This park had great rides to suit all and was immaculately clean.
superb place to get fun. it was amazing place to get fun. we was there fully day with my friends and each an every minutes we enjoyed.

Visited in July 2015. Went to WWWP in July 2015. If you're planning a trip here. Do not forget your swimwear!! As you'll end up paying 200 AED for a pair of shorts!!
