The rides were decent and the queues weren't really that long. Food here was disappointing. I think they had 2 decents restaurants. They cost around 50 AED pp. The food was very average if not poor. Next time I think i'd go aqua park on the palm island, which isnt too far.
Wicked. I had such a good time, and it was so refreshing to finally find somewhere in Dubai where the water is not warm, it cool, thank God. So much fun

Awesome and extremely. I been here many times highly recommended for everyone... You surely enjoy every single
Attractions inside the water park..
Great Fun... Wild wadi is my favorite water park in UAE.. rides are good. Location is very good. very crowded in weekends.

Fantastic day's fun. During the 2nd week of a 2 week stay in Dubai, a break from lazing on the beach was needed. We did Aquaventure last year at this point of our vacation, so this year was Wild Wadi's turn and it did not disappoint. We thought we'd only spend 1/2 a day in the waterpark but got there around 11am and did not leave until nearly 7pm!!! Amazing value for money with more than enough to keep 2 suddenly much younger adults laughing & splashing between some fab thrill and fun rides. Lazy river is cool but it's the Master Blaster rides that had us in fits of laughter as they hurled us UP and around the park. Jumeirah Sceirah is a wicked drop chute (not as scary as the one at Aquaventure for anyone wondering) but it was Burj Surf that stole the show for us, as being a couple we don't get to go on the large 3 or 4 people ring rides normally. So glad you can at Wild Wadi as this ride had us belly laughing all the way down and had to be done multiple times :) AWESOME! Tantrum Alley was another in a larger ring and whilst a thrill was over too quick. Good layout to park with great food (if you go for the shawarmas, order for one and it'll be enough for 2 from the food outlet by the entrance/exit). Ample lockers and showers etc. Got some cool photos via the camera guys and auto cams around the park, great momento if a tad pricey. Overall though, thoroughly recommended. Oh and wait for near sunset if you can, the backdrop of the Burj Al Arab at that time is great - see photo ;)
Very crowded. i did not see single place for me and my family Think it over again and againYou can spend good time any where else
Great Rides. The rides are really amazing. How many times you go you are still eager to ride again and again. That's the specialty of the rides.

expensive. i have been to the water world park in mamaris in turkey and that was absolutely fantasic. wild wadi is expensive plus nothing wow wow. we went there due to peer pressure but would not go again for the price, eventhough we had bogof vouchers. was not worth it.

Beat the heat. Beat the heat if summer in this huge waterpark. Soak on the pool or try the numerous long slides or just lay on the sun lounge and get a beautiful tan. Lots of families come here so expect kids running around.

Smaller than Aquaventure but still good.. Bit dated by Aquaventure and Yas Island standards but still good, like most waterparks in the UAE can cost unless you're staying in the hotels next door who usually offer passes as part of a package.

A fun splashing day out for everyone!!!. This water park is one where there is something for every one! Full of slides, jet powered Rapids, lazy river and even little slides for children!! I thoroughly enjoyed slides and attractions that you wouldn't of dreamed of seeing in Britain, making centre parks look baby in comparison to the high intensity slides they have there!! The only down side is that unfortunately you are not allowed to bring your own food or drink into the park, which means you have to pay and purchase their food. Which you guessed it is expensive, however don't let that put you off!! Because despite that everything that you can do at Wild wadi is amazing, the highest adrenaline slide being that of the jumeriah scairah which is a slide in which you climb into a tube and the floor disappears and goes vertical down!! If you have the chance to go I suggest you do, as it's fun for everyone! Plus for souvenirs there is photographers and cameras everywhere on slides Rapids which are there to capture your fun through funny and amazing pictures which then they put on a wristband attached to your wrist so at the end you can check it out at the gift store!!! :) keeping the memories alive of wild wadi!! Good fun day out!!!

Not clearly signed but fun day out . Unlike other water parks it's not clearly signed and the rides aren't rated according to level so to say so you had to just try everything before you knew what it is. The food is mediocre Everything else was fabulous like the staff the locker rooms etc.The place is clean too which is importantThere's a buggy that can take u from one area to the other
Kids favourite in Dubai. Nice and clean waterpark. This year they have done several upgrades of rides, tubes and sunchairs. Kids love it.

Excellent...wow! . I was here last year with my family and been here few times before too. It was a wonderful day out and my son thoroughly enjoyed himself and went on every water fun he could possibly. We took many pictures and spent our entire day there. Fun and good place for families and kids all ages.
Amazing water park to visit. Great Fun for all .....Spectacular it is free access for all hotel guests of the Jumeirah group hotels.
Awesome. Go you certainly won't be disappointed! Such a wonderful experience. Why can't they bulild places like this in the UK?!!

OK Water Park. Visited during Ramadan which help cut down on line times. We really didn't have to wait at all. There are around 10 adult rides which are fun but after riding once or twice lose their enjoyment. for ~$70 USD would have hoped for a bit more.

Amazing water park in Dubai. Spectacular and it is free access for all hotel guests of the Jumeirah group hotels. Kids and Adults love it, we liked most slides which goes up to the hill and than bring you down by amazing tunels and slides.

Great fun for all ! . Various slides and pools, fun and friendly staff members! Clean changing rooms and showers as well as lockers. A great choice in food options within the park, and seating areas. Very reasonable prices across the park.
Dont go in the Eid Vacation. The Park is amazing, but i recommend not to go through the Eid as alot of Saudi people are there and they are not friendly.

Good fun. Great place to visit. Food and supplies a bit pricey but you have no choice as you are not allowed to bring in your own food. Rides are great fun. Go with a bunch of friends for optimum pleasure...

Good craic!. We had no kids in tow but this park was still worth the visit. It's expensive at €75 for an adult i think?? but we went free cos we stayed at Madinat Jumeireh - got my Nike flip flops taken from my sun lounger in here :-( See, it's everywhere! Photos are pricey also...but hey!!!!
Fun but dated. This waterpark was the original park before Aquaventure. It is fun but very dated and old. I would go to Aquaventure over Wild Wadi any day...

fab day at wild wadi. We went for the day to wild wadi we had a great day lots of slides and rides to use free the food and drinks were a bit expensive but thats dubai.pools were crystal clear the park was spotlessly clean everywhere definately a must
LOVE THIS PLACE!. The best water park ever! Such fun, great rides! You are never too old to Visit Wild Wadi, I have visited on so many occasions now!! ITS A MUST ON A HOLIDAY IN DUBAI!
Family fun. We arrived at 10.30, no waiting for any activities, plenty to do, open till 8.00pm and best of all, entrance to the park was free (part of the hotel deal)

Not worth the price. Wild Wadi is a good day out but value for money is quite poor. The price to get in is high, then if you hire a locker to store your stuff it's 30AED more. It has very few rides and the rides that it does have get very long queues around the middle of the day. I'd recommend going early in the day before most of the crowds show up.
Average theme park. Visited the park with my children.Place was crowded. Long queues for rides. Most rides have to be used with a tube. Crowded showers and change rooms. I dont think we will return

Fun but expensive!. We arrived in Dubai very early in the morning suffering from jet lag and the water park made a very relaxing and fun day out allowing us to enjoy our first day in Dubai! The park was big with a lot of fun rides and lazy rivers and pools. However, a cheap day out it was not. Each ticket was 50 pounds and on top of that when we arrived we had to pay extra for a locker!

If you don't have another place to go.... Well, as I was guest of a Jumeirah hotel, I had free access to the park. I was relieved because if I had paid for the tickets would have been very sad! It's a small park with a few "exciting" attractions. In my opinion, what really worth the visit was the view of the Burj Al Arab that is exactly next to the park.

Great fun day out. I love wild wadi and have done since it opened. It has a great selection of rides for all ages. It is smaller than others in Dubai but don't let that put you off. It's clean, fun and well staffed. You can easily spend a day having a great time at any age.

Nothing especial. Nothing especiall at all and it doesn't have many rides and for each one you have to wait in long queue that is really difficult in a hot and humid day.I do not recomend it especially if you live in State and have many better choices.

strongly recommend to visit in Dubai. second time visiting Dubai , I was not sure to attend Wild Wadi or not. I heard about it so much ,so I decided to go and enjoy. We were 4 and entered there on July 15th at 12 . The weather was so hot , so we changed the cloth and started the path . There you could find several different thing to do . At first we enjoyed surfing and a trainer first trained us ,then we did our best. It was fabulous. Then we tried the river . Can you believe it? We tried it more than 20 times to 7P.M as it took about 15 minutes from beginning to end. Surely I would never forget this experience ;you go up and pass different parts, come down through dark tunnel, etc. Even We tried high slide and it was really frightening. For some seconds you feel nothing .For the first time it was shocking and frightening for me , but then we were accustomed to the excitement . After that we tried artificial lake . I didn`t like it first ,but after a while the artificial waves started to move and we really enjoyed . As though It was real sea. It was about 1P.M and it was lunch time. We had lunch ticket ,so enjoyed perfect hamburger, french fries and ice cool cola . We discovered another thing to do, went up the stair and reached a high place ,got in the boat all and went down .It was perfect and awfully frightening , even we couldn`t open our eyes . At 7 P.M we went out ,but unforgettable memory of WILD WADI would never fade from our memory .Now I am really satisfied t to pay money and enjoyed there .

Disappointing.. A big cement jungle. Hot and not like our water parks here in Aus. My hubby and 13 year old daughter love water park rides but this wasnt something they'd do again. My daughter ended up with burnt soles of her feet from the hot cement and no shade. Not worth the big cost.

So much fun!. This water park is amazing! There are a lot of different slides to go on and you can try the surf machines. The whole park was very well patrolled by lifeguards and very safe. The food and drink available was good and I enjoyed my day out to wild wadi water park. I would definitely go back!

Best waterpark in UAE. Fantastic water park, great rides, large shaded areas to hide from the sun, sprinkled walkways not to burn feet from the hot pavement, perfect fun for all ages.Not to mention the great view of Burj al Arab.Each time we went, we had no idea when the day went as we had so much fun.The food kiosks are not exactly gourmet, it's just fast food of average quality, but this is the case in all water parks and amusements parks I have been to.Worth getting there right before they open, to enjoy quiet morning till the crowds come in.If one doesn't drive, the queues for taxi in late afternoon are quite long, so brace yourself for the wait (with enough water).

Amazing especially for kids. Wild Wadi Waterpark Dubai is really amazing, espcially if you go with your kids. For us, it was great fun, even my wife and myself - we are both in our 40s - it was really cool and espcially out children did not want to leave anymore.
Fun with family. Had a fantastic day here with the family.A great selection of slides and rides. Fun for all the family and we were able to go on the rides as a family of four. Good for all ages.

summer,sun,water. its not like anywhere ,its exclusive.just i recommend you to see there.I think Artificial beach is the best part.frequent wave move you up and down.High waterfall will take your breath.old-fashion design persuade you to think as if you are in the Alibaba period.
Fun and Thrills. A great selection of slides and rides. Fun for all the family and we were able to go on the rides as a family of four. Good for all ages!

Hold on tight !. I went to wild wadi in the afternoon, on a week day, it was wasn't too busy and there were hardly any queues for the rides. I had such an amazing time and even braved the highest ride there.....would certainly go again !
WILD WADI. Had a fantastic day here with the family. Especially loved the Jumeriah Schreich (!) water slide !! Couldn't believe how fast it was.

Good clean fun. We got there when the door opened and it was a dream, virtually no queues for anything. Used Entertainer discount so good value (by Dubai standards). It did get busy after lunch as would be expected. We enjoyed Burj Surge and Tantrum Alley the most. Of course depending on when you go it can be crowded like anywhere else. Don't go expecting the latest and greatest thrill rides but it was perfect for us.

Wonderful & a very Hygeinic Water Park!. This is the place that you gotta' visit if you're in the Dubai. With a wonderful set of Rides, Ready to Assist Staff, Smoking Zone inside, Food and Soft Drinks available at good rates, Life Jackets provided, Good ?Changing Room facilities, Lockers available in different sizes per one's requirement, provide water proof covers at additional cost for your phones to click pictures, they click your random pictures while you're on a ride too and share a copy with an additional charge if you like one. Overall experience was just Great. Yes, adventure exist in Wild Wadi for the Youth! they have Ladies Night too, with only ladies staff to assist in the entire water park. I just loved it, hope you love it too! Go Wild in the Wild Wadi. :-)
Entartaining. Well, the Wild Wadi is on of the best place in Dubai were you can relax and enjoy the water games. I would suggest to expand it if possible

Definetly worth a visit ..... I would recommend visitors to visit both Atlantis and Wild Wadi if you into water parks. I found the place to be clean, plenty of loungers and great rides. Buy the Entertainer booklet and use the voucher, this will save you a few dirhams.

great day out. it makes a great day out for the whole family. But they also have lady only days if you prefer to spend a day with just your girlfriends. but like most places in Dubia it can get pretty crowded

Great if in the price of your room.. Stayed at Mina Al Salam. The hotel included free access to the park. It does not appear to have that many rides, so good for a morning or afternoon only. Queues in the afternoon can be long. Some rides the queue was well over 30 mins, and in the heat it was not so good.

Fun rides - very busy and crowded. Some great fun rides here. Queues built up quickly so go early. Wave area was really crowded with 00s of visitors in life jackets - I don't think they were compulsory but most people wore them! ( I didn't see a need to) Great place if you don't mind a wait. Lockers are expensive and in the changing rooms so not much use for couples
Wild wadi. Went to park today what a place fantastic value for money we had a great time you have to go on burj surj what a slide staff brill all really helpful food nice very enjoyable day out
Fun. Fun time spent with friends. Enjoyed a lot . great place to visit and have too much of fun in this water park
M humair . Today I am going to wild wadi water park dubai with my family it's a great place to enjoy a day for you and yours family

Great option for a weekend to chill and beat the heat!!!. I've been here with a group of friends and have no real negatives about the place. The rides are good and so are the pool options. There is a good choice for food as well but a bit on the pricey side. The park is very particular about the swim wear so ensure that you carry the right clothes and dont need to buy the more expensive options inside the park.

Great family fun. We had so much fun. The weather was perfect and the variation of slides and experiences was great. Had a little injury on one of the jets that shoot the tubes up but was handled very well by their team

Great - no queues (Ramadan time). Good food options, good size meals, happy staff. Kids loved it. It was easy to sit near the wave pool and watch the children having fun, lots of lifeguards made it feel safe,
Beautiful . Wild wadi water park is fun and full on enjoy to visit. You can cover the whole place in half day.make sure to wear sunscreen.

Needs Improvement. We went to Wild Wadi on 22-July, 2015. Did not expect it would be too crowded. Had to wait approximately 30 to 40 mins for the rides like Tantrum and Burj Surj. But Overall is a good experience. No doubt, Wild wadi is one of the best parks in Dubai, but if you have choice, Yas Water world (in Abu Dhabi) is a better option.The only thing which we noticed yesterday which I never experienced before that the staff was rude , especially at changing rooms when the park was closed. Everybody rushed to the changing rooms to have shower and staff was very rude as they wanted to clear the park as soon as possible. I believe they should understand that if the closing time for the rides is 7 pm, park will not be empty at once. Of course it needs time for every body to settle down , especially for families with kids.
Fun day out in Dubai. Fun time here been twice with children good for all ages very safe and so much to do definately need all day to make most of it

Worth an afternoon to cool down. The water park is fun to visit. As a westerner with my sister we felt perfectly fine wearing our bathing suits and had a blast. It can be a bit crowded, but a fun break.

Fantastic. What a wonderful place for all ages to have fun or relax . My friends and I were lucky to have this attraction included in our holiday . We had been before and had amazing fun , however this time the experience was even better . The three of us ambled in our rubber dingy rings along the lazy river , so relaxing and fun trying to avoid the waterfalls . There is the pool with sea waves and super vigilant lifeguards . The children's water shoots looked so exciting , we would have liked a go . We went on the wilder waterway , which was exhilarating , we have never laughed so much . After all the excitement you can chill on the sun loungers or paddle or swim in the sea pool . The Wild Wadi comes highly recommended , put it on your list for a special fun day , making happy memories .

Its a fun place to go. Its a fun place to go, its not that big so you can cover the whole place in 3 - 4 hours (incl queue), once you enter there is a shop, so if you want to buy any hats, caps, googles, sunglasses, shorts, T shirts, Slippers etc. so if you forget you can get it from there (a bit expensive but ok) and you can cover all the rides in 3-4 hours, its not that big and there are separate changing rooms for men and women, and also got locker rooms available for a small refundable deposit.

So much fun. A very great place to have fun. you can enjoy it even if you travel alone. make sure to wear sunscreen. you can enjoy different types of food and drinks there. it is not allowed to take food or drinks with you inside.
Always fun. Love this place it's so much better than the atlantas water park as it's mostly hotel guest so the kids can go on their own without you having to worry

Choices a bit limited. Great fun with a couple of "lazy rivers" and a few adrenaline rush rides. However, there really was nothing in the middle - something in between a moderate ride and vertigo-inducing high speed slides.You probably won't spend more than a few hours there and that can be quite expensive if you're paying (we got in for free as we stayed at the nearby jumeriah beach hotel)

fun for the whole family. lovely rides, kids are safe and the variety of slides are good. go early to ensure you have a shaded area. valuables are safe whereever you put them, however be cautious anyway.

Great day out. Second time we have been there and even better than first time. A full day is needed to do all the thrills and water rides. once you are in its very easy to get round and familiarise yourself with all that is there. Plenty on offer to eat an plenty of ice cream venders etc. A great day for all the family. A must do when in Dubai

Great variety of water rides - good fun for all ages and degrees of water confidence. We are now on our tenth year of visiting Dubai and luckily for us, daily entry to the Wild Wadi Water Park is part of our hotel package! We have always had a lot of fun enjoying the water rides. If you are a hotel guest and arrive at the WWWP late afternoon the queues are much smaller as a great many of the day guests have had enough of the dun and gone home! The lifeguards are very attentive and also provide some great interaction on some of the attractions. My only criticism on our most recent visit would be relating to the large groups of rowdy lads/men that seemed to stampede through the Lazy River attraction without a care for the other guests. Their cheering and hollering was annoying and their blatant disregard for the enjoyment and safety of others was obvious. My faith in the staff at the WWWP was restored when I saw a few members of one of the groups being escorted to the exit! Well done!!

A good half a day attraction. An enjoyable time, not a full day (as not a huge amount of slides) but good for half a day. The major attractions kept getting closed down which was annoying. Went during Ramadan so it was very quiet however the queues to get in when we left (15.00) were huge.Booking online before hand was cheaper.

A Thrill Seekers Aqua Adventre. I loved it!It was amazing from the lazy river to the plummeting water slides it's fun for all ages and is should not be missed!One of the best water parks in the world.Get the pics and hav a ball!Don't do it solo, which was my only regret.

Fun in the sun!. Wild Wadi is the perfect place to be in Dubai, especially during summer to cool off. This waterpark is definitely not only for kids, it is a lot of fun for everyone. Fantastic and fun rides for all age groups including family rides for up to 6 people. If you get tired you can relax by the big pool on your sunbed, enjoy the view of the iconic Burj Al Arab and there is also a live DJ during weekends. Only thing to improve is the food, I wish there were some healthier lunch options instead of only fastfood. Prices may vary depending on the seasonality but approx. 200 AED / 40 Euro per person.
FABULOUS. Travelled here many years ago a holiday of a lifetime, memories to treasureDont go home without a visit to the gold souk

Great for kids. Visited the Wild Wadi with the family, they had great water activities. And lots of food especially for the kids. We went early around 11am, so is was not too full and the queue was short. It seem like a place for all ages, they had great music playing, it was like a "water disco" in the wave pool. We got great group/family package. By the time we left there about 4pm there was a very long queue to get in, and a lot of people all over. Besides the heat, we were pleased we went early.
Fun and relexing. Love to go here before summer come, nice place nice view from burj al arub and jumeira as well. Good for a group of friends, must try

Amazing :). A treat and fun for all ages, lots of rides and thrills for all. The ground gets very hot walking between rides so a good pair of "water booties" which you can purchase at one of the kiosks is advisable. Numerous life guards at all rides. Remember your sun screen. We went during Ramadan so there were no queues.

Water Park with a view, and what a view. Great rides, climate controlled water, impeccably clean, attentive life guards and with a fabulous view of the Burj Al Arab right next door. This is a great water park for the whole family, there is a dedicated area for the little ones, a great wave pool with life jackets and and a number of great slides and flumes . The food was excellent too (try the Sharma meal) If you buy the Dubai Entertainer guide there are two for one vouchers making it great value for money.10 out of 10

Great Way to Cool off in the heat of Dubai. Had complimentary access as we were staying at Madinat Jumeirah Hotel. The park was reasonably quiet (no queues) but this was most likely because we were there during Ramadan. There is a mix of rides suitable for everyone from young kids to thrill seekers. Enjoyable day out, worth a visit. The staff were very helpful and reassured me as I went on the scariest of rides - the Jumeirah Sceirah - that it would all be over in 6 seconds and I would love it....which I did.
fun fun fun!. it was so fun, stayed for 1 day!the prices are little high, but if you want one day fun and excitement, certainly try Wild Wadi Water park.
Nice . This nice aqua park was free for usBecause of our accommodation in jumerah beach hotelNice place with many facilities for any rang of ageBecause of my little baby we only stay for 2 hours

Awesome place!!. This was so much fun, very clean and civilized, loved it!The slides ranged from easy to advanced, there were no lines on the days we went but then again it was super hot and low season, however we had so much fun, the best ride was Burj Sclera, super long and scary.

Best Day out for the Family. If you love water then this place is a great day out for the family. My wife and two sons went here and it was hard to get them out. Fun, relaxing and therapeutic! Been several times and hope to gomany more times.Only negative is the lockers - expensive and not a good choice my the management to charge such a price for such a small space.

The best water park. We arrived as the wild wadi opened to be greeted by very helpful staff. The park is suitable for all ages and for the first few hours we didn't have to gueue. Food and drink is available at many outlets and doesn't blow the bank. We were here with our children all early twenty's and our grandson (3) and we've voted it the best water park Dubai has to offer.

Love those " Uphill Waterslides". Wild Wadi is a fun waterpark we have been to multiple times so far.It is not the biggest park, but has a few fun things to offer. The best part is waterslide system, including uphill waterslides, you can explore on a single or double tube.Besides that the park has two Flow Riders (one beginner, one advanced), a lazy river, a wave pool, a kids area with lots of kids slides, a couple of large tube slides, a step drop one, as well as another lazy river type (Sorry I have never been in that one). You can also have fishes eat the dead skin of your feet, but it costs extra (AED50?)There are plenty of sun loungers and chairs around the park.I wish that the park would allow you some beach access as well but it does not.FYI: The Entertainer Book offers 2-for-1 vouchersWe truly enjoy Wild Wadi and can recommend it!

No better water park in the world... A must Visit. Having been to Wild Wadi when I was younger with my family... maybe 10 years ago now I have been dying to go back and wanted my partner to experience it. We were lucky to get a free voucher through our hotel but I wouldn't for a second think about paying to go. Its a water park that carries the Jumeirah feel and is different to any other. Water slides start at the bottom and use water to push you up rather than the normal sit at the top of a slide and go down.. I mean of course jumeriah would do something different!
Moments happy and full of excitement and fun. You can also enjoy the water for hours in the sunMoments happy and full of excitement and funBlue tunnel, restaurants and lively atmosphere
Great fun for all ages. We had a fantastic time at the WWW park, they have a great range of rides for all ages, however sign posting to the rides could be improved

Had a great day with family. We visited Wild Wadi during July as a group of 4 (52, 22, 19 & 15yrs of age)During our visit it was Ramadan, but food and drinks were readily available during the whole day for purchase. Wild wadi was approx. $90AUD per adult for the day, but we had 2x entertainer vouchers that were 2 for 1, so we ended up paying half price.We spent about 4 hours here and had a great time, waterslides were fun with a range of different levels of thrill. We are into more extreme rides and we weren't disappointed. Another plus was the waterslide that pushes you up the slide to the top with jets of water, all whilst sitting in your tube. This was a bit of a novelty and something we hadn't seen before at other parks. We bought lunch here which wasn't cheap, but expected in a theme park. Would recommend for a fun day out, a good way to beat the heat in the middle of summer.
Free fun family afternoon. Didn't queue for any ride. Lockers expensive, but necessary. A few of the rides were quite scary compared to other water parks we have been to in USA.

just right. so we went to wild wadi in like the afternoon with the whole family and we did all sorts of rides and I would write a whole dictionary about wild wadi , its soo beautiful too . there are good places to relax and eat and its soooo big . I cant really use words to explain the place you have to go there to feel it .

A good way to keep cool. This is a well organised place to visit which is kept very clean. The rides are a real thrill with tamer rides for younger children. The take away food is of good quality for this type of resort and reasonably priced too. No cash exchanged hands as you load up a fob upon entry which can be charged to your room is part of the Jumeiriah hotel group.

Water park + family = great fun. One great water park to go in Dubai to avoid heat and have fun at the same time. A thrilling experience ! A little advice : the earlier you go, the more time you have to go on the water slides !

Wild wadi experience. We reached a bit late by the evening. My cousin got a great deal for the tickets and we went for it. It was fun. There are good rides kids and young. It's nicely maintained and we can walk around barefoot [Better to go barefoot]. I tried almost all the rides. We can get training for surfing which was the best part. I was able to get balance in the second try. Everything inside the park is very costly. A small bottled water cost me 10 AED and locker was 65 AED. It's better not to take cameras inside because of moisture. If you have Go Pro cameras you can try it. They have another costly photo printing option which we didn't even get time to check

Great Place! Lots of fun. Great place, great water rides. Really good experience in all. Food was a little pricey. We went during ramadan which is probably best time to go as there were no queues for rides! There are only four major rides for adults...Only downside is that its quite expensive, approximately £60 for entry and locker. Luckily we had The Entertainer wild wadi voucher which is a buy one get one free entry. Without that voucher i would not think the price was worth it.

It's good but not 5*. The water theme park is a really good day out. The park is built on top of each other and the rides are amazing. There were times where I was panicking of falling out. The park seems to be run really well and the workers are brilliant at what they need to do. My only concern is the cleanliness of the rides. There is a lot of rubbish lying around. The main attraction which is the lazy river section contained so much rubbish that it was hard to avoid going near it. For extra money I would go to the Palm water theme park.

I loved Wild Wadi. Dear Wald Wadi's Management, I loved Wild Wadi but just that the lifeguards do not pay attention because when I went there was fights and the lifeguards were just talking and plus they'rte were kids that were playing so they could have gotten hurt... But anyways the food was expensive but it was a really fun and exciting trip... Thanks again for your patience and kidness. See you guys later and hopefully it will e better... Azaan Dhrolia

Great fun but pricey!. Excellent water park especially when we first arrived at lunchtime during Ramadan as there was almost no-one there. However, on Mondays during Ramadan it's free entry after 3pm and the place became unbearably overcrowded.....wish we had have known that was going to happen earlier as we might have waited to have lunch and taken more advantage of the lack of queues for the rides. It is also quite expensive - there are 2 prices $275AED if you're over 110cm and $230AED if you're under. No discount for babies and none for pregnant women (even though they won't let you ride on anything!) It is definitely much better value at Wet and Wild on the Gold Coast......but then you don't get the incredibly warm weather and water - it's nice not to be cold!! Oh and the other benefit was that they still serve food during the day during Ramadan....however it is also ridiculously priced - $59AED for a plate of spaghetti and a drink!
Great . Its always fun to visit wild wadi. Greatly managed,, nice food options.. Friendly staff..great rides..always busy and takes a lot of time to go for one ride.. Rest all good
Fun times. A really great waterpark.I've been here a couple times now and both times has been fun and great.Diverse water rides ranging from mild to thrill seeking

Awesome. So hygienic so clean. You can lay down under the sun and make yourself comfortable . Life guard people are doing well and so careful. My 12 years old son was so excited and had cheerful moments. I loved the laziness of this fabulous place! There are no famous food brands and if there's just one snag, that's it. They HAVE TO think about it. Again, as a navy officer I really liked the way they cared about visitors safety.
Must Visit with Kids. Value for money and easy access, for a fun filled day for all in the Family. Staff is helpfull and looking fwd to serve, safety is given priority.

Kids water park. Got there about 10:30 am worrying about the crowds, again due to Ramadan the place was empty On the good side we never had to queue for anything. Food and water was expensive ,and your bags are checked when you enter. Save your money and go to the Atlantis for the day.
Fun but a bit small. Went there on a Monday at 11 am in July so no queues anywhere. They advertise 11 attractions but a lot of them are for small kids so for adults it is over quite fast.

Fun place for any age. My adult daughter and I went for half a day and did all,the main slides epic, all most enjoyable. The master blaster is great fun, just keep checking your swim costume / trunks as these are at risk with the water force!!, the lazy river and flood river good for a relax. if you feel adventurous the Burj Surj is a great flume ride, Tantrum alley is something else,....enjoy

Had a blast!. Just great fun.Was there during Ramadan with wife and 2 teenage children.Rides are really good. No need to carry tubes anywhere as their rides propel you uphill!! Good range of rides. Nice setting.Good thrillers - especially the Jumeirah Scarer! (this really is not for the faint hearted).Great views of Burj Al Arab.

Definately a must do. Wild Wadi was just that, a wild experience. The best ride has to be the one where you look out over Dubai before the floor drops open beneath you causing you to take a deep breathe and scream. Our friends enjoyed the surfing park however they are both popular parks so expect to queue. There are lockers to store your belongings, a good food spot and a places to rest your legs on sunbeds when the time comes to chill. Our experience was over Ramadan and was better. We didnt get burnt due to the humidity in the air and there were less people. We arrived at 1pm and left the park at 8pm. Be sure to purchase a memory of your experience on the slides on the way out.

Expensive but fun. Visited during Ramadan. Food and drink available for all. Food not cheap and very much junk food, the kids enjoyed it! Rides all good fun, most are fine to go on with kids of all ages. Good, reasonable size young kids area.

worth a day out. This park is one of the best I have seen. There really is something for everyone..from a lazy river to some pretty extreme slides..there are plenty of seating and sunbathing spots, and a good selection of eateries..queuing was minimal as the organisation was good, the staff are very good. The park, and the water was spotless all day.I spent 8 hours there and enjoyed every minute.Also, the views are fantastic. ? Well worth a visit, and a break from all the shops..
Good but not so extensive. the park in good in view of atmosphere. there are some amazing facilities, but the park in not so extensive.

WHAT a fun day!. young, old , children everybody should go there AT LEAST one time there are so many things to do, rides , lazy river etc etc lots of shade so dont worry about that even though I would recommend to take a hat and shades. they also food, burgers, pizzas and hot dogs. it just a great day out!!

A great day out. We took our son for his 6th birthday and he loved it. The park really is great for his age group as he can go on most of the ride and really thoroughly enjoys then. We all had lots of fun. We were staying at the JBH so we could escape at lunch time for a well deserved break and some shade which we did appreciate!
Love it. Loads to do, a bit far from our hotel, good value, was there all day, next to some lovely hotels, really good day out for the family or with friends
Great water park. Great day out , easy to get around and good rides. Best one is the tubes where you get transported around the water park with out having to walk.

Dubai 2nd water park. Wild wadi is a great water park, and has some great slides. I've been to orlando and none of the parks in Dubai much orlando, but are better then the European parks. Wild wadi has a surfing ride which is unique to Dubai, but the park overall just feels more warn then it direct competitor Aqua adventure. It's a great day out and I would recommend it as a must do in Dubai.
A fun experience.. Fun for all the family. Included in the price of our hotel so good value. Take water if it is hot. It was the hottest day of the year in May and I was faint with heat.
Nice but expensive. Me and my friends spent most of a day here. Great water slides and the wave pool is fun. You can get great views of the Burj al Arab from here as well

Mr Togobo. I have been to the water park with family and good time. I did enjoy the company of many families and my wife quickly bought the family swimming suit for everyone. My children went back the next day to enjoy their swim. We shall definitely return.
Wadi Wadi ..!!. Wild Wadi is a must do - it's fun packed and extremely enjoyable and not just for the kids - I think we were the oldest there but went on everything - give it a try
Fun in the sun. Thrilling; exciting - a wonderful day in the sun at a lovely clean and pleasant water park. Great fun!
acceptable. I can say a midium size waterpark- It is OK but smaller than adaland in kusadasi-turkey and Aqualand in antalya-turkey

definately recommended such a fun day out!. wow what a great day I had here! I felt abit sore from the sun so this was recommended to us by our hotel staff at the le meridian al aquah beach resort.im so glad I went that day, theres so much to do I loved it. I had agreat time even though im 30 years old and tried to go on every slide and attraction as possible! multiple times haha, the place isent that busy comparing so its not annoying or no waiting around! theres safe locker rooms and they supply you towels so u don't have to carry one there - of course for a small fee,.food and drink available and no cpm,plaints, massive choice and superbly clean

GREAT PLACE TO COOOOOL DOWN. Plenty of rides for everyone, even for the faint hearted like myself. Lots of rides with tubes and floats. Wave pool a little timid, but nevertheless great fun. Very clean and the lifeguards take safety very seriously. They are fantastic. You can have a pass out if you want to come and go during the day. Its free for those staying at the Jumeriah Hotels. You don't need a towel, towels are provided. Make sure you put plenty of suncream on and take flip flops as the floor gets very hot. Busier times in July and August, last time we visited in June and there were no queues for the rides. Its a must for kids and adults alike.

Awesome! . My wife and I had a great time at Wild Wadi! Not the cheapest day out but well worth it. The food and drink options were excellent and during Ramadan and everything was operating as normal. My favourite ride was tantrum alley, just amazing!

Great day out. Go for a package deal as you get the locker, towel and a cup for free water (you'll need it!). Masses of rides and virtually no queueing along with plenty of places to sit and soak up the sun. For a relax - try the lazy river on a rubber ring for two - great way to spend 30 mins just floating past everything. There are plenty of eateries (you cannot take in food or drink) at reasonable prices.You must do the slides as these are awesome - especially if you go down in pairs.This is a venue we will be doing next time we're in Dubai.

Jumeirah Scarer. The kids loved it.. Very well managed, clean, good crowd control, good food, interesting attractions (like to let fish nibble on your feet) and of course, the Jumeirah Scarer - a truly exciting ride for the young and brave.

Made me feel like a kid for a day!. What a great few hours I just had at Wild Wadi! I read from the existing reviews I should get there early, which was well worth the effort: I arrived at 9:45am (it opens at 10) and was the third person in the gate when it opened. There were no queues on any ride other than the flowriders (artificial wave generators you ride on. Board). I went mostly on the more adrenaline-pumping rides and the rapid tube ones that flowed uphill (very cool) to save you lining up further inside the park. I think it might have been a quieter day because it is Summer and Ramadan. The food options were really only fast food, which is very poor, but I can't let that get in the way of this being a five star attraction. Well worth a visit, especially if you are stating at the adjacent resort which entitles you to free entry.I'll also say that the staff were all very helpful and friendly, the place was very clean and safe, and it's great to see people from so many countries and cultures coming together in such a way to celebrate feeling like a kid again!

Excellent. Visited Wild Wadi in June 2015.I must say it is probably one of the best waterparks I have been to.Brilliant for all ages. It is a little bit pricey at about £45 per adult but that Dubai for you.Excellent

Great place to have fun in the heat. We had a lot of fun here during a hot day in Late June. I expected the park to be as big or bigger than Australia's Wet n Wild but it was smaller. Would like the water to be a bit cooler as it was pretty warm - but then again it is in a desert and it was summer. Good family fun.

WILD WADI ROCKS. Since 2005, been to Wild Wadi over 200 times. Already had 2 annual passes. Currently holding one. They improved everything over the years. I liked the old Jumeirah Sceirah better but progress ran it over.
a beutiful water park. most fun place on dubai where one can enjoy at its most and relif its energy by having fabilous foods and drinks and jucies available there
BEST WATER PARK. one of the best water parks I 've been, excellent staff, service with a smile, excellent service ! very friendly staff and helpful
Roller Coaster is too good. You do not feel like coming back from here and each water sports has its unique experience. Must visit place with family to have fun.
Very nice water park!. I always enjoy to go there. Well organized and full of things to do. Food selection should be improved btw
Wonderful place. i like the place very nice for family, very safety, the staff is friendly and co-oprative, i'll visit it again in my next trip to Dubai

a bit of thursday fun. great water park, if you go during the week it is better, hardly any queues and easy to repeat rides. Water is cooled so during the summer this is bliss. Food available but only fast food hardly many choices for a vegetarian other than lots of chips…or salad. Spending a few hours bouncing the waves you need more substantial food. The life guards are friendly but the photographers too much in your face..but a great place to have fun.

Falling Standards. This was my third and final trip to Wild Wadi as standards have dropped and it no longer represents value for money. Aquaventure, Dreamland and Yas Waterworld are all better water parks.The dress code is not strictly adhered to and queue jumping is frequent amongst certain nationalities! People dressed in pyjamas, vests and underwear whilst visiting a water park is completely unacceptable.Food is also expensive and they ran out of ice cream.
Fun Day Out. I always take family and friends who visit to Wild Wadi. Great water park for kids and adults who want catch up with the sun!
Good place for a summer break. Good place to cool of with the kids. Plenty of great rides for all ages and I just loved the surf pool.

Wild Wadi. The floor was too hot to walk on without shoes and many of the rides, including the long slide down, were closed for maintenance. Luckily admission was included with my stay at a Jumeriah Resort else it would have been a waste of $.

What a way to relax!. Went in August 2014 with 2 children 16 and 8. Had a wicked time. Was staying at Jumeirah Beach Hotel so was allowed free access every day! Kids loved it. My favourite ride was the lazy river. So relaxing. Will definately be going back. Best value is to stay at the JBH n get the free daily access.
Wild Wadi. small area, not so much rides but the place is clean and you feel safe because of the availability of life guards all over the place

Great day out . Had a great day at the water park , it was not too busy and plenty of chance to get on all the rides which again were all good fun. Food and drink at the park are all reasonably priced but they do pounce on you in the gift shop to try to get you to buy stuff . It's also a great place to take pictures of the burj Al Arab. Well worth a visit a great day out for all .

Modern water park. Great water park, not quite as good as the one in the Atlantis but still very good and modern. You don't even have to walk up stairs to get to the tops of most of the slides and you go up in a pool in rubber rings! Great idea. Also, they have a great way of paying for food of drinks ect, they give you a bracelet that you top up. Great idea if you have kids too.

a life time amousement. i can not discribe the experience in wild wadi.what a beautiful time which i spent in wild wadi.most beautiful people from all over the world are having the fun in there.pools and water swings surfing what ever i vist there is memorable.i wish i could be there again.it is complete enjoyment for whole family. i think dubi tour cannot be complete without tour of wild wadi.

Brilliant rides. We visited the Wild Wadi at 10am so it was still quite quiet. I was very impressed at the amount of shaded seating areas. The slides/rides themselves, whilst there are not many of them, they are the best we've seen. Even the most ardent thrill seeker would agree!

WOW what a wonderful water park :). The Wild Wadi Water park has to be one of the best water parks outside of Disney World. the rides are exhilarating and the queues in June were virtually non existent, I'm English we know how to queue. definitely worth a visit.
Another amazing experience in Dubai. Despite a big part of the park being closed for works, the moments that my wife and I had on the park were absolutely amazing!
Never boring!. I went to Wild Wadi park for my birthday last year. Amazing time of the year to escape the Dubai summer heat. Food and drink was served at the park despite Ramadan time.

Facinitating experience. It was a great experience bouncing in light and dark tunnels through beautiful and full of trees ways.Excitement reaches the most when you try those shared tubes with 3 other people that haven't seen before,but they are all friendly and nice.I'd really liked it and recommend it to those who are travelling to Dubai.

Fun day. Nice and clean water park in heart if Dubai. Compared to nearby Aquaventure on the Palm and the little more distant Yas Water World, Wild Wadi has less activities/rides. All are good though exhaust the possibilities faster.

A super place for family safe fun and a great work out.. Wild Wadi has great water rides suitable for all ages. Children will especially love it. Plan on spending your whole day there and bring water proof sun block.

Cool water, 3 great features (plus many others for smaller kids). We arrived about 15 minutes before it opened, got in line with our Jumerates passes (apparently tickets can be purchased at hotels as well as the two kiosk on site. There were two locker sizes in the changing room inside. We enjoyed the larger, longer, taller water features. By 1 hour after opening, the crown was building and lines were 15 minutes or more; by 2 hours the lines were 15-30 minutes. The "lazy river" was full of people. All in all, a good, clean, cool option for kids; but go early to avoid the crowd and heat.
best waterpark in dubai. this is probably the best waterpark in dubai. you will always find this place crowded with people especially on weekends. tad to expensive they could make it more reasonable.

Wild and Watery. The park is amazing with lot of water adventures. The biggest slide covers the whole park at one go. 3 hours are sufficient to cover everything in park . So go after 5 pm to avoid scorching heat. No doubt the park is good but also it is bit expensive. If u wish to go water park in dubai then visit Aqua-venture, Atlantis The Palm. It is cheaper and similar to Wild Wadi. Also you can have view of the five star if you go there.

Great day out. This was my second time at Wild Wadi. The new slides are great but in reality for the price I think they could do with some more slides. We were staying at a Jumeriah hotel and didn't have to pay in so we were happy to go-it is good fun. However, the food options at Wild Wadi are pretty appalling, fried and greasy rubbish. I couldn't eat my order, the chicken looked fake and rubbery...if you're vegetarian, good luck to you! A healthy option in my opinion would be very successful for example nice salads (not McDonalds style), wraps, fish, low carb...when you pay so much to enter you tend to stay longer and are therefore forced to eat junk and then swim (it makes no sense)! Notwithstanding that, we had a great day!
Fantastic rides. Amazing trip. Would visit again.... Tips: carry some extra cash with u coz food is expensive inside and u will feel hungry
fantastic. scaira jummeirah was excellent, try thisfood aren't so good.memorable time with my familyhaving a lot of fun

This place is awesome. Whether you are travelling with family or not this place is great. My 7 year old daughter did not stop from when we first walked in to when I dragged her out 5 hours later. The rides are brilliant with the new improved Skeirah and an absolute heart stopper. I have never been so terrified as when I went on this ride, so terrified in fact that I went straight back again to see if it really was that good. The staff are great and very helpful and friendly. This was our second visit and it was better then the first visit.
Fun Place. Very nice Water themed park in the Hot weather of Dubai, some crazy rides to enjoy a must see after the Atlantis though.

Fantastic fun for kids and adults.. A great way to spend a day in hot hot Dubai. No end of fabulous water attractions - from the mild for the little kids to the vertical drop water slide. Plenty of room and lots of deck chairs. And overlooked by the Burj Al Arab.All in all a great day out.

Fun. It was amazing to be there in hot weather of June. I liked all parts .although Our visit was in ramadan, we enjoyed the time. meal costs so much and the entrance fee was 80 dollar each and 35 dirhams for a small locker.

Cool experience for everyone. Situated by Jumeirah Hotel where you can also see Burj Al Arab Hotel too. Very clean, organised and efficient.There weren't many rides but they were enjoyable in the heat. Friendly staff to look after everyone. We had vegetarian burger with fries and drink which were in big portion. We liked the wristband where you load up money electronically so you don't have to carry cash and any balance left is refunded to you.

nice water park. I'm not too in to water parks, but this place is good. the Jumeira Scarer slide is crazy! scary and exciting at the same time! they have food outlets, they a few attractions mainly for kids. lockers available too, in the summer it gets too hot though.

The Best Water Park. Wild Wadi Water Park offers something for everyone, from small kids to adults and rides have been designed in such a way that will excite us in every possible way.
jumeirah sceirah and burj surj are two of my best rides in wild wadi.

Woow. You are in dubai the summer and sunny city with all those nice beaches nearby
But a day in wild wadi will be unforgettable experience away from the classic beach visit
Not cheap but worthy

Birthday day out. Spent the day here for my birthday last week. Had free entry due to staying in dar Al Masyaf hotel. Plenty of sun beds in shade areas. Very safe to leave your belongings whilst you explore the park. Lazy river was our first place but quickly spotted the faster version running alongside it. Can only be described as great fun, plenty of twists and turns, goes up quite high and you can see the busy road far below you at one point but adds to the excitement. Wasn't brave enough to try the ride that the floor falls away from you and you drop vertically ! The ride that takes up to four adults in a round inflatable is also great fun, screamed all the way down but didn't stop me from doing it again . I tried the feet cleansing with the tiny fish, not for me as I screamed for the first five minutes and it freaked me out. Didn't help when one bit me and blood was running into the tank, attend and told me I was unlucky as they only have one piranha and it found me lol .

Makes you want to stay in the water all day. This water park is one of the firsts in Dubai and it's still one of the best. I've had the opportunity to visit several times and the high quality standard remains consistent, always. Staff are helpful and not intrusive, lifeguards are vigilant and the operations always appear to run smoothly. The bracelet scanning method is exactly the kind of holiday service I appreciate where I don't need to carry cash. I will definitely return because that is my idea of a day of sea and sun
nice fun with friends. like the attraction, don't like the poor hygiene in common areas especially toilets.. the attraction are good but long waiting

Great to pass a couple of hours. Not usually a fan of water parks but we managed to visit 3 times in a week! Don't personally think I could spend a full day there unless you do the rides a few times each.......definitely worth going to visit.......master blaster rides are great (despite name) if you don't want to be thrown about too much but still fancy a longer slide ride! :-)

Nice day out . Nice day out something different then the beach. We had the benefit of getting in free because of are hotel which was good. On entry you get wristbands and you have to put money on then in the shop before you go to your lockers! (Wish they would have told us that! ) the floor is sooooo hot but it's definitely easier not taking shoes and walking round with them, but there are loads of sun loungers where you can leave them if you want to. It is quite small and definitely not a full day thing unless you have children then. It's perfect, loads of lifeguards around which is good. There is a smoking area near the food court up the stairs! You can buy a case for your phone which is waterproof it's about £20. Also if you want towels ask at the shop and you have to show your receipt ! Also if your getting a cab back just go out the front they are always there . Enjoy :)
Funnnnnn. My Kid loved it so much, like the wave pool just amazing with all the people around you having some fun, well maintained and good food.

A nice day out. Good fun but can get busy and is quite expensive. We had free passes with our hotel and could use as many times as we liked. Amazing fun but can be hot on your feet between rides. Jumeirah screamer ride a must
Great benefit of staying at the hotel. Lots of fun! Food was not overpriced. Lines were not too long. Nice change from the beach. Good for kids, young adults or adventurous adults.

Lovely water oark. I love taking my kids here - small enough to not get lost - big enough to disappear for hours while I sunbathe!!
Great lifeguards on all corners - fairly priced food - clean - all good.

Perfect. This water park has amazing rides for all ages and people .. I was on honeymoon with the Mrs and we had a blast of a time .. Hope to return again soon and visit this place again. It is awesome

Great Fun. Great waterpark, good range of rides for all ages from pretty hard core to very gentle.Food fairly priced and you can take on your own water.The park and changing rooms are spotless.Top tip: Go early for when it opens and ideally avoid the weekends and you get the first 2 hours or so with no queues at all.

Small but very enjoyable. For aqua park its on the smaller scale and dont expect latest and greatest rides in there, however it was very enjoyable half a day Most of the rides can be done singles as well as doubles

Great Waterpark for cooling off. Excellent water park near the beach. Perfect place to cool off during the hotter months. Be aware, it gets crowded during the high season. Plenty of great slides though for all ages. Lockers, food, drinks, etc. are all paid for via a wristband on which you load money. Easier that way so you don't lose cash/get your wallet wet. Staff was good and the park was clean overall. The wave pool is a good spot for kids, there's a variety of slides for bodysliding or tubing. Alot of fun overall. The slide with the trapdoor will send you rocketing down at high speed - it's worth it though. A great waterpark that's good for a day off from work or bringing the family for some fun.

Kids will love it!. Great waterpark with slides for all ages and a wave pool. You can charge back to your room if staying at Jumeriah, and hire lockers for your belongings etc. great day out for the kids!

So much fun!!. If you're struggling with the sweltering heat in Dubai and feel like a dip mixed with a bit of adventure then this is your place. A great variety of adrenaline pumping rides, lazy river ride and it's very own beach and wave pool this waterpark has something for the whole family. We thoroughly enjoyed an afternoon at this waterpark and would definitely return. If you're a family with young children there are plenty of aspects to keep them entertained.

Fun afternoon with friends. I went with several friends to Wild Wadi because of the free admission offered as guests of Jumeirah Beach Hotel. We stayed longer than we expected and actually had a really fun time! We went on quite a few of the slides and attractions in the park. They had rides for all levels of "risk takers," from a lazy river (which was mobbed with people) to super steep slides. The park was bigger than we were expecting and had a nice variety of activities. It provides a great break from the Dubai heat, and seems like it would be a great place for families (and as I can attest, even a group of adult friends looking for a fun afternoon!)

Jumeira scarier is the ONE!!. Visited the wild wadi water park for the day with family. Really good rides. The Jumeira scarer is the one everyone must try. The ride is very high and you gave to go inside a capsule. After a countdown the floor from beneath your feet disappears and you DROP straight down. Also the simulated surfing was really really good. Highly recommend this place will definitely go back.

OMG best water park in the world !. The most fun we've had in any water park ! The rides were amazing ! Being pushed uphill by water whilst sat in a rubber ring was crazy ! The slides, the rides everything about it was fantastic. Went twice and spent all day in there. Can't wait to go back. Much better than aquaventure
fantastic day out for my teenager. My teenage son thoroughly enjoyed the day going on all the rides. convenient to our hotel Jumeirah Beach and had a view of this from our window
Leave the teenagers here ,. fora whole day they can have fun , while the adults can have fun somewhere else, really cool idea , and right beside the city center of Dubai

Pleasant afternoon. This was a nice break from the intense heat we didn't stay in one of the hotels that offers admission for free and the entrance fee is quite pricey although once inside we found the prices of drinks lockers etc to be reasonable.The rides were fun and there was some different ones I hadn't seen before in other water parks we spent about 3hours here which we felt was long enough, plenty of sunbeds all around the park as well.

Fun. Its has many rides & others activities, ant one can easily spend their more than half a day over there playing in different rides. In some rides waiting is too long but premium ticket member can get benefited when their is queue, because their is no waiting for them generally.

Awsome!. Wild Wadi is a perfect destination for a super fun day! The rides are fun and safe, you have the ability to go in pairs which makes it even more fun! Staff is funny and sweet and I can just imagine how hard it can be to stand on that heat all day, vut they still manage to make their guest smile! We will return again! :-)

TRIP TO DUBAI. If you are staying at Jumeirah Beach hotel,Wild Wadi park is walking distance and the entry to residents of hotel is free. It is not a very big water park but has got bit of everything for kids and adults. The waiting time even on a weekend was very little.Good place to go for family with kids.

A very nice experience. I was twice in this very famous park and first time I was really amaized...It is the perfect place for people who like aqua park, different type of swimming pools...beautifull view of Burj Al Arab..The trafic of helicopters on the top of the very famous hotel increased a lot..The waves of the swimming pool are very strong and the feeling is extraordinary! I also could mention it is not a cheap place..but you may have fun an entire day!

get there early to avoid the rush. it is boiling hot anyway, so get there when it opens and enjoy the first hour or two before it gets busy. lockers and towels will cost extra and its not a cheap place but good fun and kids would love it. the waterslides are good but your feet will burn if you don't have something on your feet when walking around after midday. some queueing for certain rides. the views of the beach and the Burj Al Arab from some of the higher rides is spectacular. a good day out when it is 40 degrees!

Great day out. There is a wide variety of activities and suitable for everyone, my favourite is always the lazy river! Big fearty! Very clean and plenty helpful staff. Bonus for us was we were staying in the zabeel saray so got free shuttle bus and free entry. Great set up.

Perfect place to cool off; bring money though!. Very impressed with the number of slides and attractions. The line wait time on a weekday wasn't too bad, maximum of 15 minutes. Entry was a bit expensive and so was everything else on top like locker rental, towels and food. If you're going, make day of it to get your money's worth. Plenty of good photo opportunities too including a few with the Burj Al Arab in the back ground.

Lovely and well kept. loved the whole place and the environment - kids loved it
Food was reasonable inside and there was lots of shaded places to relax out of the glare of the sun

Fantastic place to spent time with family. Good place to spend a day with family. Kids will enjoy the place. Tickets are prices at about AED 270, which seems expensive. However, we had free entry passes (curtsey Jumeirah Bech Hotel) so read my review in conjuction with reiviews of those who paid for the entry ticket.Rides are good, however food items are over priced!! ( a fresh coconut for AED 30 ???, it's too much). I don't know how much do they charge for towels!!. there is no drinking water fountains inside & you can carry food / water / beverages inside. One 300ML water bottle costs AED 10 so go prepared if it's summer.

A Delight for Kids. We live in Dubai and go to Wild Wadi several times a year. Its thrilling for the kids and fun for adventurous adults. Watch out for the surfing pool. Its the only place in the park where friends and family have reported sustaining injuries. In the hotter season (March - October), opt for a late afternoon visit.

A fun day in the sun. A very nice and funny place to spend a half day..enjoy the rides and get some tan at the same time...for all ages and everybody will enjoy it..food selection not so good as expected in Dubai but you will survive....bring loition and a sun hat
Best place to get splashed in dubai. Well design and enjoyable place to get splashed in dubai. You can spend the day over there and best time to visit during the summar.

The best water park ever. If you wanna spend the whole day in extreme style - go there and do it. For those who ieat pizza with fork and knife - stay at the pool. Those seeking for the extreme feelings - try the kamikadze water slide (45 m high).

Great times. Park opens at 10am, you have to pay for locker (not expensive), but well worth it. They give you a wrist band that you can put money onto and use for food/drinks etc around the park, this saves having to carry cash with you. We went on a week day and the lines weren't busy. Had an absolute ball, tried all the rides. Fun for everyone, not just kids.
Best thing in Dubai. we went there on the last day of our trip in Dubai. it was excellent. full of excitement and happiness.don't forget go there for making good memory :)

Fun day out (included in cost of hotel booking). We had an excellent time at the water park. Not an awful lot for very little ones as you would expect. My two blonde blue eyed pale boys attracted a lot of attention from other patrons so people were stopping to talk to them and touch them! A very friendly place but we didn't stay very long. No fault of the water park, just that there was more for the boys to do at the JBH pool and it was a lot quieter. Great idea to have the pre loaded electronic money bands. The park felt very safe and secure. This would be much more suitable for older children and adults.

Good place to go in summer. Wild wadi is very good place to go in summer when temperature hitting around 50c. I went there with my four kids. They loved this water park. Rides are very exciting specially that very highly slide ride is very good. Ticket prices are same as UK theme parks.
Great water park. This is definitely one of the great water park attractions in Dubai...totally awesome! Lots of great ride options...a bit pricey however but the kids love it!

Huge decline in quality over the years. I've been to this park a few times over the last few years, and I must say, compared to the other water parks in the UAE, this one is definitely falling behind. I can usually spend an entire day at a waterpark, but the last time I went, we got through the entire park within 2 hours and got quite bored. Decent for value, but in comparison to others, pretty lame

So hot and super expensive!. Owing to the impossible heat (nearly 50c) I only managed the Jumerirah Sceriah and a bit of sunbathing. The Jumerirah Sceriah is the park's big attraction. It's certainly intense but I found it a bit painful. It plummets you down vertically into water. I had a sore chest afterwards.Most people go barefoot around the park which is great if you have feet made from asbestos! Overall it was ok but like everything in Dubai stupidly expensive.

Fab day out - exhausting but great!. I loved this even though Im not a fan of theme parks. the weather is so good that you never feel cold and for those brave souls or for those of us who want to earn kudos points with their kids, the Jumeira Scarer is worth a thrilling go. it's all pretty safe, with life jackets and staff on hand at all points. great for all the family.

Great adrenaline rush!!!. This park was full of super fun and wet rides. The lines moved very quickly the park was quite clean. One of the rides put u in a tube and the floor drops allowing you to fall straight down and the go sliding through water tubes. Super scary and I loved it. Also take a stop and stick your feet into the tank with little fish that nibble at your feet. I couldn't stop laughing, it tickled so much! Decent food at the park as well. Fair in price for the portion size. When you leave there is a line for taxis and you can get a free ride if you are going to the mall, which we did!

Great fun !. This is a great place to go whether with kids or not .. The lazy river is great ... the water shots are amazing and going down the tunnels is fantastic. The other attractiions like wake boarding are challenging - but for a day out in Dubai it is a must - one thing for women -wear a swimming costume not bikini as when you come out at the end of a water shoot you could lose your top!

Wet fun. Love this place, been a few times now and I'm never disappointed, the rides are fun, you can go on fast or slow, and combo runs.Can get chilli in the winter, but it's great for summer fun, make sure you take plenty of sunscreen!You cannot take and food or drink in, so as a captive audience, it's expensive for food.The price to get in is fair and reflects what's on offer.Get there early to get a bed of choice, or treat yourself to a cabana, expensive but can be split between a group.

Great Experience. This is a water part like none other. It is spread out wide and far and some of the rides are exclusive to this, atleast I think so.The water jets which propel you upwards with such force, are something I have not experienced anywhere else.The wave pool is nice and so are most of the slides.It does get hot during this period when moving from one part to the other, but then the result of the ride is coooling

A memorable day. We liked our visit of Wild Wadi Park. It was a lovely day. :)Pros:- Nice place with many tools and a big pool.- Some really dreadful moments with a few of the more nasty tools. lol- After paying the entrance fee you're free to use every tool you want for free until the park closes.- Mostly helpful and polite staff.Cons:- Water! Seriously, in the 50 degrees centigrade heat of Dubai, you guys hide every drop of water in locked cabinets for your staff, and when someone is thirsty you tell him go buy water for 10 Dirham (about 3 USD)? Don't you think someone might get dehydrated and sick? That's very cheap behavior and definitely needs to be punished with one less star. ;)- Expensive fee for lockers.- Very expensive food at restaurants (2x more expensive than the city).
Exciting!. If you are interested in water then go for it :) but remember not to visit on weekends since it is so crowded...

A fun day. Safe rides for all the family. Worth a visit. Fast food outlets not so good and expensive. My wife and I took 12 children there to celebrate a birthday party. We each took 6 under our wings and the park's staff were very helpful when needed. The kids all enjoyed themselves as did my wife and I.

Excellent value!. Great value for money and all the staff are just so friendly! Very clean and the rides were great!
Love the water slides also!

Extremely overpriced!. Wild Wadi gets one star for decent rides and one for an abundance of staff at hand. But what infuriates me about this place is that they charge 275 EAD for the entrance and then an additional 55 for renting a locker. 55!!! And they know you have to rent one. Yes, there are cheaper lockers, but they are overpriced as well. And I wasn't informed until after I was ripped off. I walked right in to the men's locker room, chose the first available locker and BOOM.... Was charged 55 dirhams. Even though the cheapest locker has a price of 35 that's still ridiculous when you pay 275 to get in. Use of lockers should be free in a place like this. Shame on you, Wild Wadi, for using such cheap tourist trap tricks. But then again, you don't really make your money on regulars, do you?
Awesome fun. A great day out with a variety of thrills from relaxing river drifting to life endangering water slides.

Could do with work. It was fun but there was room for improvement and they could build more rides for kids but it was very fun and the rides that we went on we enjoyed but like I said it could have more rides to make it better
Had loads of fun. We had loads of fun and enjoyed a free entrance to the park. Some of the slides we missed since we had a very limited timetable but overall thrilling and worth going to.

Unforgettable Trip. I visited Wild Wadi along with wife and two kids (2&6 years old). I have to say we enjoyed every single moment of the day to the max. It was truly a great day full of fun. lots of games for adults and kids. Ques were not long and boring, though we went on a weekend (Saturday). Life Guards are very cooperative and doing a job that they love. they interact with people on every minute of the day and boost more fun. I never felt that those guys are on duty or just doing a 9 to 5 boring job.It is worth to mention that it is a very safe place. we have place valuable stuff on table, and kept going back and forth to check and it was never touched. I noticed that other visitors have left their valuables around, and it seemed that everyone is comfortable and there no one worried to be stolen or something.I have to say, that my only concern is only prices are bit high. It could be affordable for single person or a bachelor to go, but for a family man like me with kids, prices are very high. and meals provided are very expensive for no reason. Yet, you can't buy food from outside.

Bring your own towel. This was a great venue with some great water experiences. However, be sure to take a towel, otherwise you pay 35D or 99D to purchase. Everything is chargeable in addition to the entry fee. Had a great day, but would recommend not going at the weekend (Friday or Saturday), it gets very busy.

Expensive but great fun. During our visit to Dubai we were told that a visit to Wild Wadi is a must.We paid almost £150 for 2 adults and a 5 year old which i thought was a bit much but hey nothing is cheap in Dubai.The park was clean, there were plenty of life guards about to make sure everyone was safe and the water rides were fun.I don't think it was worth the entrance fee though
Too expensive. Entrance fee £56.00, followed by towel hire £7.00 and locker hire £7.00. That's £70.00 for a swim and you cannot take your own food and drink. A total rip-off.

Good Time for all ages.. Visited on a lovely scorching hot June day. Welcome break from the heat. Free entry as we stayed at the Jumeriah Beach hotel. The park is lovely and clean. We'll sign posted. It's Just like being in a Disney Water Park. Great fun

Absolutely Thrilling! . When I had been to this place around 2 years back, I was the only teenager in my family who went. On seeing thoae amazingly thrilling rides , I was reluctant to go especially The Jumerirah Sceriah so I dint. But this time when I went wid my elder brother , he made sure that I try those rides not once but twice and so I forcefully took me twice to jumerirah sceriah and I must say IT WAS TOTALLY THRILLING. I recommend all rides n wild wadi to all who in dubai. Plss do visit.
Old place... but still good. If you are looking for a fun day with water slides then this is the place for you. I would not recommend coming here on a weekend as it is way too packed with people.

Great day out !. We were staying at Mina Al Salam so entry to the park was complementary,we went as 2 adults kids at heart, what a great park we spent the morning there, fab rides and with views of Jumeirah Beach Hotel and Burj Al Arab everywhere you go just topped it off! Spotlessly clean, lots of places for treat and drinks.Plenty there for all ages- have fun !

Great fun! . Wild Wadi was my first ever trip to a Waterpark and it was awesome, it's ideal for a family with children. One thing I would say. is that there isn't that many rides aimed towards teens/adults, that being said it's great fun to go with family and I would definitely go again.

Eagle eye?. Located in Dubai and situated in front of the stunning Burj Al Arab, Wild Wadi offers 30 rides and attractions for all the family. Wild Wadi is themed around the tale of Juha, a known character from the Arabian folklore.From June to August, the waterpark will open from 10:00 and closes at 19:00.
The very best. The best ever waterpark...love it. we always have a great day in wild wadi and keep coming back for more .

Expensive but worth it. My husband took our 3 year old for the day and despite the price (£150 by the time he'd paid entry, food, towel hire and photos) both had a fabulous time. It's not cheap (bags are searched for water bottles, food and towels) but in terms of experience, safety and customer service it's worth it. My husband was especially impressed at how staff have their eyes on everything- including making sure little ones have swim nappies on (and their courteous approach) etc. Special thanks to Johan who made sure we got our USB stick of photos delivered to our hotel - my husband forgot to check he was given it when paying for photos and Johan made sure we had it before we left Dubai. Expensive? Yup! Worth it? Totally!

A Descent Water Park. Spend a day at Wild Wadi this May, A good water park with a few decent rides but not a patch on Aqua Adventure at Atlantis. Prob best thing about Wild Wadi is the wave runners and the gorgeous views of the Burj and the Jumeriah Hotels.
It is what it is. Good fun for small kids. Get there early and it's not too bad. Later in the day and at peak season there will be lots of queuing. Very expensive

Fun and Fun. Most exciting water park in dubai..
Lots of games to try..
Lines are moving fast..
Well designed and well organised. .
Food and drinks are expensive. .
Staff are so friendly and professional
