Great day out. Brilliant place for any age. I usually hate water parks but thoroughly enjoyed this one. Even went in some rides for the first time in 20plus years! Great fun, very clean.

Best . This was awesome place and I can say best water park of Dubai. Awesome rides and water area. Overall experience was wow. I find it slight better than Atlantis aqua so try it and I am sure it's a one time experience.

Water fun!. I had a great time at the water park it is something that I might do again! You should go here is you have some down time in your trip or extra time to kill! The slides might look scary but they were amazing and whole lot of fun!

Great Day Plan. I visited Wild Wadi with my friends. We arrived just after it opened and spent the day laying out and enjoying the rides. I'd recommend to all age groups as it has something for all and even a few slides for the thrill seekers.Gives you a view of the Burj next door and the food, sitting area and entertainment you need to have fun.
very funny. i visited here with my friends it was wonderful experience that i had.played lots with my friends.I refer this to all who like to enjoy adventure etc.
Great Rides. Best waterpark to go to in Dubai.Great view of Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach hotel.Great rides and very friendly staff!

Great Fun for All Ages. As a 34 and 35 year old couple, we had a great day at Wild Wadi. Yes, it is just a water park, but there is lots to do and it is very well run and organized. We lucked out, as we went on a week day and didn't wait at all for any of the slides. Even the most popular ride was less than a 5 minute wait. it is great if you are staying in the Jumeirah hotels, as you get free access. The only real issue was with walking to some of the slides, as the pavement and stairs got very hot! We discovered the trick is to take the "water roller coaster" that drops you off close to the entrance! Good fun for all ages.

Such fun. Have done this a couple of times and have such fun here, the rides are different to other water parks we have visited. Remember to take flip flops with you as the floor does get hot walking between rides.
tons of fun. Visited with my 6 year old. It was a tremendous fun day for her that she remembered for a long time later. A good variety of rides. Helpful staff.

Worth the visit for sure. They have some new rides which are quite nice. Another advantage is, most of their rides are connected to each other. So in dubai's heat, you won't need to walk and stand in queues for every ride.

Very very good. This is the second time I have been here and we purposely went when it was a bit cooler. .. last time was in heat of summer and it was too hot...All of the rides apart from one were open and I think we collectively went on all of the open ones...There were 17 of us that went and we all had a great time... you always tend to lose people in such a big group but this time we agreed a meeting point on the grass and under the trees to meet if we mislaid anyone...The only downside that i have found both times is that it is a pain to take your flip flops but top hot if you don't. .. a lot of the rides make you leave your flipflop at the bottom and you still have to walk up hot stones but then the end of the ride is not near your shoes... a tiny inconvenience and even I am not sure how to solve but we managed and were there for ages...Tip is buy a waterproof wallet holder to keep your money in. Recommend renting a locker to keep everything safe. Take an underwater camera with you as they give you some great pictures...Enjoy
Great day out. Get there early to avoid the queues and the midday sun.It is expensive but there are plenty of rides to make it worth the cost.
water world. i don't know how can i describe it. it's the best aqua land that i've got there. with high technology and oerfect decoration.

Good day out for kids. Visited on a Wednesday with two kids aged 7 & 3, got there at around 11am, park empty, no queues for any of the rides for the next 3-4hrsBeing a guest of the Al Qasr hotel, the visit was complimentary which is one of the main reasons we book a 'Jumeriah' hotel as this saves you a fortune on park entry particularly as we may visit numerous times on our holidayThe thrillseeker ride where you climb a stairway and then are enclosed within a capsule really is fast and enjoyably scary, you are dropped nearly vertically at high speed, it lasts for about 10secsThere is also a wave machine pool which is great fun and also good for young kids as this pool has a large area where it becomes shallowThere is also an 'adventure' playground with small/medium sized slides for kids (in my opinion) upto 10yrs old to enjoy. My youngest enjoyed this the bestComplimentary life jackets are available FOC for the kids and are readily available, also loads of life guards everywhere  The main ride involves sitting on a single/double inflatable and better being jetted around the park. Overall, I highly recommend this water park, it's very clean and very well maintained , staff are very polite and helpful. My eldest really enjoyed all the rides including the lazy river and due to the location we had great views whilst on all the ridesI think if you have older kids, I would recommend Atlantis as the rides are more scary , but this is a great day out.I've been coming to this park many times over the last 10yrs and its still Highly recommended!

The best Dubai waterpark. Amazing water park with the most fantastic water rides I have ever been on. Spotlessly clean but not very many places to sit as it's all a bit squashed in. However it was a really great day out, get there early as it's busy and also use a two for one voucher from the Entertainer book.
A water park with scary rides. Some of the rides were not to my liking, but my children thought they were brilliant. The lazy river around the park is not for the faint hearted.
Great fun for all ages. We were here on holiday over winter and it was a great place, after spending time at wild wadi it just shows what kind of place Dubai is- The best place on Earth?

Water Park. Nice water park which is also part of the Jumeirah Group, if you stay at a Jumeirah hotel in Dubai you get either free passes or discounted tickets to this park along with a free bus service.
Superb for young water lovers. a few high thrill water rides for the daredevils, but more for the younger ones, great beach area with wave pool for the kids and kids play area is fun too

Very nice . Went wild wadi water with me to kids age 6 & 9 They really enjoyed it When entered promt you can get on with what you have come for get strap with credits so you can by your food an drinks with it an don't need to carry money An they give you 1 towel each Kids loved it spent over 4-5 hrs there in the afternoon Was most enjoyable Deffo recommend

Great rides!. The rides are great for children, adults and young at heart! Life guards are everywhere so you feel confident and there's a restaurant where you can eat and drink, a bit pricey than ordinary fast food resto though. The place is crowded during weekends and UAE holidays, if you want to avoid long queues plan your visit on weekdays. You can finish all the rides in about 3 hours but takes longer if you want to do it more than once. Entrance is free when you are staying in one of the Jumeirah Group Hotels. It is actually the best water park in the UAE.

Great day out!. Wild wadi was free as we were staying at the Zabeel saray so we spent the morning there and had a really good time!We got there for 10am on a Thursday and it was very quiet so there were no queues on any rides. The rides were good with lots of different ones from your more slow paced ring rides to faster slightly scarier ones.... we enjoyed them all!There are plenty of places to sunbathe and eat and drinks but realistically you can get all the rides done in 2 hours like we did so we didn't spend the whole day.We would definitely recommend the park though for all ages.

Absolutely loved it. The rides were great, I had so much fun, I love those chutes that take you everywhere, lots of activities to get engaged into. I love their idea of having a card thing for money instead of actual cash so you don't have to carry everything around. Worth it

Free when staying at JBH. This is a very well run and fun water park, with lots of exciting rides which are overlooked with plenty of life guards to make your visit safe in the water , but when my daughter(13) with her friends was not accompanied by adults felt uncomfortable in the queueing areas for the rides. When you stay in the Jumeirah beach hotel entrance is free. It can get busy after dinner with other paying guests visiting the waterpark.
Fun for family. My children loved this place. They had so much fun and wanted to stay longer. Lovely family day out where you can let your hair down and chill.
Just OK given the $$. It is a fun day out, but very expensive for what you get (like most things in Dubai I guess). Good escape from the heat though and quite a lot of rides

Far Better Than Atlantis. This is the original water park wild wadi, I think it is amazing here, a lot better than Atlantis I must say. Very clean helpful. I would highly recommend this water park to every 1... U will have NO regrets.

Great day out. We weren't quite sure what to expect, but turned out to be a fun and stress free day. Limited number of 'rides' so am not sure if you'd get bored after a couple of days, but worth a visit. Costs 275-300AED admission £50/€70/$75, lockers 35AED per day, but you can at least lock away all your valuables. They also allow wrist bands that you can use to buy things, so no need for cash. Fast food is about £8/€11/$12 for usual meal deals. Good day out.

Water fun in the sun. This water park was included within our stay at the Das Al Masyaf. The buggy from our hotel collected us and took us to the water park. it has some real awesome slides and caters for all ages. Some height restrictions apply on certain slides. Food on the water park is good and resonably priced considering. No more expensve than a theme park in the UK. Go early to avoid the queues and avoid Friday and Saturday as this is the weekend in Dubai.
Amazing. you wouldn't want to miss this experience even for me in the above 50's was sooooo much fun there is fun for everyone no matter what age

Fun day!. Great rides! Have to try them all... no matter how scary they might seem! Good quality of food, friendly and polite staff. A bit expencive ticket, they could at least give the towel for free at that price and not charge it for extra 35 AED! If you have many days in Dubai it worths visiting it.

brilliant hotel! cannot fault it!. absolutely love this hotel! been here twice now and have fallen in love with it! its worth every penny ! Room service is brilliant, every day your room is cleaned twice, at night they lay out chocolates and slippers even fruit for you! you feel like royalty!free shuttle bus service to mall of emirates, free pass to wild wadi which is awesome!love the private beach area! love the view of Al Burj from your hotel window!

Good mix of rides. This isn't the biggest of the water parks and unless you've got kids that want to stay in the pool area all day, you'll have probably done all the rides in 1/2 a day. That said, it's still worth a visit as it has some unique rides, like the body surfing.
Wild and Wonderful. Definitely a place to put on your planning trip for Dubai, excellent value amazing rides for all ages, plenty of good food restaurants if you feel hungry after the rides.
Famale Night . The place is wonderful and fun with many thrilling rides. The facility is also very clean and comfortable for covered women to have a great night without worries. I just loved it :)
Water park. Great fun lots to do You need to make sure you get there early to avoid long queues on some of the activities Food ok but expensive
Three words - Ah may zing . Great family fun day out, so much to do - must visit! I found everyone to be super friendly who worked there and and the food kiosks are great.
Worth visiting. Went here a few times as we had free entry (stayed in madinah jumeriah, Mina Salam). Not busy at all, went on all the rides, i'd say they need more rides. Aquaventure is better

Just Ok. This park is good for small children but the older ones were bored after 2 hours. There really is only 5 'big' rides the rest is just sunloungers, expensive food outlets and a big pool. It's a lot smaller inside that you'd expect and at almost £60 entry it's really not worth it in my opinion.
Fun fun . Amazing water park very clean lots of rides and huge lazy river.various food stand with good food options.would definitely recommend a visit.

Fun for kids and adults. If you are a fan of adventures, crazy rides and fun this place is for you. Get some sun lotion and get yourself the whole day in Wild Wadi. The price might be a bit expensive, but it's worth visit!

Great day out full of thrills. Amazing water park fit for all ages. Me and my husband went here having free tickets as we were staying at the Jumeirah Creekside hotel. Saved around £50 each on the tickets! amazing range of slides and features. We even went on the Jumeirah Secireh which was very scary! brilliant fun.

Good views, quality Rides, Lacks Variety !!!. Very well maintained rides. The views of Burj Al Arab from this place unbeatable. The quality of service is good and staff are very friendly.On the other hand, its an ageing institution which is struggling to innovate. Been there couple of years ago (when they had monopoly of water parks in Dubai), went there again this week, it is the same, only thing changed is the price, which is 275 AED now (ONLY for entry), the charges to locker etc are additional. The food / beverage cost also almost doubled !!If you have a choice, avoid this place and choose Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi, much better rides, greater variety, rides for all ages and good value for money (240 AED including entry and lockers). If you are stuck in Dubai, don't have time to travel to Abu Dhabi, try the Aquaventure in Atlantis.Tips: Book through Travel Agencies in advance, you will get some discounts. If you book any Jumeirah Group of hotels, you will get free entry to this place.

nice waterpark. Wild wadi was a good experience...managed to only go on a few rides as we were only there for a few hours...but the atmosphere was nice and got nice views of burj al arab from the pool and ride
Artificially Natural. Great rides to have a fun day with family or friends.Very good water rides.The best one to try if you have the guts is the big long slide which takes you down in seconds!

Average for Dubai... But still a tonne of fun!. Wild wadi being the original Dubai water park is a little dated compared to the Atlantis water park or the new one in Abu Dhabi, but it is still a bit of fun! A bit overpriced for a days outing but if you are allergic to your money, and don't wish rides with stupid lines, this is the place for you.Towels are expensive, food is good quality and its kept to a high standard, but to repeat, by Dubai's standards this is nothing special.Good if you have done all the other parks and want something New (old)
Fun fun fun. Loved that is was next door to our hotel and we got free use our entire stay (Jumeirah Beach Hotel). Loads of rides for all ages.

Showaddywaddy!. I've tried both waterparks in Dubai and there isn't really that much between them. The only thing I like more at aquaventure is the beach access. Oh, and there are sharks and stuff to look at, apart from that they are pretty much the same. Oh, apart from the shinyness of everything, that's quite nice. And the view. The facilities I suppose are a bit better too. And it's bigger with more rides. But that's about it. But!! I'll only be going back to Wild Wadi. Why? Because the queues are smaller, it's that simple. I don't want to spend half my day queueing up for a ride that lasts 5 seconds. Where is the sense in that? Showaddywaddy all the way.

A good day out, Bring your towel!. We came here on a day off and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The one ride i would recommend is the Jumeirah Scarer, which is over in about 6 seconds but it literally takes your breath away.
Cool your summer. I had visited long time back with my friends and we spent the half day over there. You have to try the thriller ones !

Great Fun in the summer. Visited Wild Wadi on 23 May 2015 . A group of 7 people , two couples and 3 young girls..All of us had a great day .The Park is well maintained. There are 3 rides which are thrilling and other rides are quite decent and suitable for anyone. even the thrilling ones are not extreme and my 5 yr old daughter managed quite comfortably . We chose saturday to avoid maximum rush on fridays. The idea worked and the queues were quite thin and the waiting periods were reasonable and short for a saturday. Various food options are available inside .Using Entertainer coupon helped us get 1+1 offer. We spent the whole day and repeated almost all the rides. Comparing to other waterparks in uae, Wild Wadi is as good as aquaventure waterpark but a little bit smaller . The lazy river was better in aquaventure . The parking is quite near in Wild wadi whereas aquaventure needs you to park quite far from the actual entrance. This is quite painful while returning back as the buses will be full and we will be too tired to walk the whole distance ( almost 10-15min walk ) back to the cars.

Prepare to get soaked!. This is great way to relax after a long day walking and shopping! What I really loved about this attraction is that it catered for me as a muslim woman. In Friday evenings they have ladies night, where it is only women allowed and we have the whole park to ourselves! It may not make sense to many people, but believe me if you wear a hijab and you want to enjoy the pool, this makes a HUGE difference. The scene in the evening is more clubby with great music blasting everywhere, giving you a great start to the weekend, and allowed me to really let my hair down...get it ;) But the only down side to that is that we were not allowed to take pictures to preserve the modesty of the other customers. The shop is great but as with most things in Dubai, it is pricey.

Loved it!. Enjoyed the free shuttle from the nearby hotel, and spent a couple of hours in the park. We enjoyed the rides a lot, from lazy river to the free fall water slide. Our favorite was the "boat ride slide" that doesn't only let you slide down, but shoots you with water jets also UP the hill. Great fun!

Good but not as good as Atlantis. . Great park loved you could go all round without getting off your ring but a bit dated compared to Atlantis. The plus side was not having to carry your ring around to each ride like you have to in the Atlantis. My daughter loved it as did we. Reasonable priced food and snacks also. Great idea putting money on a wrist band saves having to carry money around

Great time. Went in winter and still hot but not as busy as you would think so really enjoyable. The Entertainer made the slightly expensive cost very bareable. A limited selection of rides but all of then fun and the schreimah was awesome!

Did not fail to amaze us ....Superb!. Me and my hotelier friends visitedth waterpark midday sun last May 19,2015.The over all experience is impeccable and be nicely reccommended.It was my third time visiting Wild Wadi until then ,I realized that it got something better and consistent on its services.My friends were impressed too.The first moment I swum to the cold water ,my knee got bruised .But the fun i enjoyed while riding all the rides took over the pain.This time ,I did not try the Jumeirah Sceirah.I only waited downside to took videos of my friends challenging the scary fall.The waterpark is so clean with great ambiance of happy people .You can hear the buzz of excitement and laughters.I must say ,out of 10 employees only one cared to worry about my bruise .He suggested I must go to the FA station.I forgot his name (sri Lankan) ,I met him at the master blaster.The huge waterpark has only 1 first aid station (near the main entrance) so I ignored heading up to go there since the floor is very sun-heated.There should be one more station on the other side of the park.Prices of drinks are expensive ,not a good value.My friend asked for iced drink without cream on top ,but the staff charged her 5 dirhams. I double checked the condition of locker rooms compared to the last time I visited.All suggestions I raised were implemented ,that includes plastic bags for wet clothes and shower gels .Now ,there are drying stations as well.Before ,there were none.Nicely done! Water sprayer fans across pathways would be appreciated to beat the summer heat. At the end ,hoteliers or residential rates should have f&b and other retail discount as well.We did not bother to bring home our souvenir picture unlike in Yas WW ,they offered us 120 aed (1 a4 +2 wallet size prints and 2 key chains or 2 key fridge magnets).Congratulations to all staff for your hardwork and dedication ,well definitely be back.

What an experinces. I was there with my friends in december , we were supposed to stay in the park for 2 hours , and ended up spending 6 hours and changed our porgram to go to the dunes for the next day and landed there agian very early in the morning and spent the whole days , some of the rides are very scary yet very enjoyable , there is treat for all ages , this place is a rare collection of water sport and fun , lovely eatreys and we left our phones , i pads , shoes in the sits outs very safe , there are ample life guards , ............

Alright. Won't go again. . It's a good Waterpark to just have 'on the list'. However it doesn't offer a lot as compared to Aquaventure. Some of the rides in Wild Wadi are outdated and need some repairing. The staff is not even friendly. There is this one ride which is super scary and worth a shot, forgot the name right now (it's the most famous one though so anyone can guide you to it). The good points are that it's pool is nice which has 'waves' which is pretty neat and the fact that it's so darn close to Burj Al Arab, so you can have excellent photos. :)
Great fun. This was an exciting day had by all, with the different slide, it was just wow. What a day :) would recommend going if you are in Dubai

Water park. This water park suited me perfectly. I am not a swimmer but was able to ride every ride with no fears. This park is great for any age group. Food was good and price are reasonable. My husband wanted to buy swim shorts there and end up paying a 100 USA dollars (so come prepared) besides that everything else is reasonable price.
Who needs kids to have fun. Beautiful water park with fantastic range of rides and lots of lovely spots to chill out. Lots of safety around and no one meithering you to buy photos they take etc
Great park. Very nice park.. With variety of rides... Clean and neat.. I hope they do more rides for under 1.1 meters.. But in general we enjoy our day there...
Water park . It a very nice place for relaxing and have fun there is restaurants and some shops and the water games are crazy anyone should go there and have fun

A low down on the Wadi. During our 5 night stay we decided that a day at Wild Wadi was a must.It opens at 10:00 which is fine and yes we stayed till around 7pm... The cost as you can imagine is not that cheap - probably circa £100 for 2 adults.... once in you have to spend 5 minutes orientating yourself with where everything is....As you can imagine there is 10 minutes worth of faff as you decide what to do with your "stuff".... a couple of options.... take out a locker (located at the front) - they come in small, medium and large... you then can go backwards and forwards from it all day - the only thing is its a bit of a pain having to go back there throughout the day... we decided to leave valuables in the locker and find a suitable chair/bed to dump our stuff for the day (we left it for hours and no-one touched it)... I would only leave stuff that I wouldn't be 100% bothered if it was nicked (just in case)... That said many people were doing that!!.The second question is phones - Western problems!! I decided to leave it in the locker but you can buy these waterproof phone holders and take all the selfies and videos you want... my experience of waterproof and water is not great so I decided against it - that said many people were using them...The park itself has 2 "scary ish" rides 1) The Jumeriah Sceirah (screamer)2) Tantrum AlleyThe screamer was good - they build the tension up nicely and when you get into the pod at the top you are convinced you are on a one way ride to see Beelzebub... when the trapdoor goes and you drop the rush is immense... you fly down the slide at some speed and you may very well get a perfectly formed wedgy!!! Excellent fun!Tantrum Alley you are on a raft (up to 4 people) and the buzz goes from the height with which you climb and drop on the ascent - all good again....There are a couple of good flow rider things and lots of flying around on big tubes... Lunch time we expected to pay the equivalent of Afriaca's foreign debt for a sarnie but we were pleasantly surprised that it came to less than a tenner for both of us... imbetween rides we had some down time reading books and chilling... 7pm came along all too soon.... All in all well worth the money - would be just as good with kids - just remember they can only go on certain rides if they are of a certain height!!!
Super day out. Good fun for all ages.Good variety of rides for all swimming and fear levels. We had a brilliant day out.

Getting wet . Cheaper by £100 quid (4people) than the Atlantis.. More rubber ring rides nowadays... Good all round for the money...food expensive.... Worth a visit . Get there at 930 ready for a 10 open .try to get a entertainer voucher bogof...search eBay...
oh my god. It is not one of the best water park in the world. It is the best seriously. It is really wild and relaxing. I loved this park so much.

Well organized. Visited wild wadi with friends and unlike other theme parks its very well organized from the entrance to medical assistance.. The slides are nice.. If u wanna relax ur self jus get in the lazy river and ul have all the fun .. Dont miss out the free fall.. Its a must try.. The food inside is expensive and isnt that great but worth a try.. Tip : use public transport.
Wonderfull world. Just amazing especially for me. The attractions were really very nice . For every age of people can enjoy here. And you can find any food you like inside.

10. basically I dnt like to play with water a much but when I enter the wild wadi I cant stop myself. It completely changed my mind and I jumped into the water.....
it was the fun day I can say.

Thrilling. An adventurous outdoor water park with the most outstanding attractions. The lively atmosphere was full of jolly faces of all the visitors. The thrilling water slides, exotic beaches and the glorious view of the Jumeirah beach hotel; you can't ask for a better place than this. The changing rooms are very clean and there are plenty of lockers and cubicles. An absolutely exciting experience, very safe and enjoyable; there is fun for all the family. The lifeguards were really helpful and friendly. The views are magnificent and there was an adrenaline overdose for the thriller rides. Everything is well organised and the queues were no longer than 15 minutes but it was totally worth the wait. Families with children should definitely pay a visit and it's recommended to stay there for atleast 3 hours. This place may be rather expensive if you have to pay for the tickets for the entire family with the lockers and towels. Even though the rides are very thrilling, they are also very short and there won't be much to do unless you go on the rides again.

Amazing water park. I haven't been to many water parks as England doesn't have many. This was an amazing experience. One thing, they should have more water fountains around the water park and marked out more for people to notice and its very easy to get dehydrated and fall, as I nearly did, but just had a couple of scratches, I did drink plenty of all water and drinks but the doctor said to drink at least a litre an hour in dubai heat and the water park.

Great wild rides!. Well there something for everyone here. From sedate water rides to wild breath taking rides not forgetting the fish pedicure. A must do if in dubai for some fun times and you can spend the whole day moving from one activity to the next.

Great Fun. Its a really fun water park - the rides are a good variation from extreme thrill to lazy river. The kids just love it. Given the heat in Dubai it is also a good thing that a lot of the park is covered and yet there are plenty of areas for sun. The food available is also really good - my favorite is the pizza and the burger combo.

Great family day out. We try and take the children once or twice a year to one of the main water parks. For variety we have been to Yas Water World(YWW), Atlantis Aquaventure(AA) and of course Wild Wadi (WW). Wild Wadi is smaller than Aquaventure but not too small. It is slightly older than the other two but this is pretty much where the cons end.The pros are many. 1st the car park is right next to the water park. No buses, no standing around in the heat with overtired children at the end of the day, you just walk out, get in your car and drive home. At YWW you have to carry the rubber rings for the rides up the stairs for every ride, at WW you just go up the stairs and they are waiting at the top for you. For me, great, free exercise, with young children this is a huge difference. The changing rooms could do with being a bit bigger and need an update but the lockers work and are plentiful enough. The queues are never too long even in peak season. WW has an excellent wristband system allowing you to put money and locker in one safe, waterproof place on your wrist meaning that you do not have to worry about wallets or money all day with it safe in your locker. As for the staff, well the WW staff deserve their own paragraph, they are awesome. Every single member from the supervisors to the managers to the attendants on every ride makes the children smile, laugh and goes out of their way to be helpful. They represent the group very well and help make a great day out greater. Every question is answered with a smile and directions and the little problems you have on any day out are solved quickly with thier help.My little girl just grew over the 1.1m petres for the first time this year and was so very excited as now she could go on every ride. Last year she got turned away at most rides and spent a lot of tie crying becuase her big brother got to do everything including going on the Jumeriah Scarer aged 4. However this time at each station she was measured until 1 hr before the end one lifeguard said we can give you a ristband to show you have been measured. WHY ON EARTH DIDN'T they do that at the entrance! All day the poor littel girl thought she would get denied. She got on every ride but each one seemed a close call, these things are huge to young children so please WW take note just give children close to the height limit a wristband on entry and save a lot of tears!The food is a touch on the expensive side for what you get but we were all full. It would be nice to be able to eat somewhere a little more cool, perhaps some outside ac units or fans wouldnt go amiss.Overall though, good rides, nice variety of excitement, enough room things to do but small enough to not be exhausting with young children. All in all a very nice family day out. I would firmly recommend it for family or friends, colleagues days out and will definitely be back with and without visitors to Dubai.
Very good.. Highly organised. You load credit on wrist bands for purchases. Everything is working. Happy staff. Great experience.

Exciting full day enjoy. Wild wadi is a great water park which can easily entertain you a whole day. Its working time is up to sunset, so you should get there at the morning to have enough time for enjoying all sorts of entertainments.The park provides many water rides for both children and adults. The most exciting ride to me was the "Burj Surj" which I strongly recommend it.For eating you have to buy from local shops inside the park and you are not allowed to bring foods with you. There are 3 or 4 fast food restaurants inside the park but their prices are so expensive.Towel, shampoo, and all other necessaries could be found in local shop there but relative expensive. So its better to take all these with you.

Really good. Wild Wadi was a great choice for our 1st day in Dubai as we could just chill out then go on a slide to cool off.There is an excellent variety of slides and the park is clean with helpful staff.It does get extremely busy though and the lazy river isn't as relaxing as it perhaps should be as it just gets crammed with inflatables. The views of the Bury Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach from some of the slides is breathtaking.
Plenty to do. Loads of rides. For young and old.Queues never too long.Very clean and staff at hand to help.Don't forget sun cream.

Awesome!. This is an "old" waterpark for Dubai standards, but that may also be the reason it's not to busy. And it still looks great! We have visited this park twice now and we haven't seen any waiting lines. Also there's a lifeguard at every corner which is a very comforting idea, especially if you're with children.The slides that go upwards are brilliant, especcially the part where you oversee the city as you fall down!Another thing this park has going for it is that children must be 1.10 m to be able to use all the slides. At the aquavertura park it's 1.20. For us (traveling with a 4 year old) this made all the difference in the world;)It's not cheap but its a guaranteed day full of fun!
Summer Fun. Awesome park for adults and children. Awesome pre loaded wrist bands allow you to be able to buy at the park all day without having to go get your wallet. Awesome rides and heaps of fun!

Phenomenal. It's thrilling experience for all ages, so don't be put off by thinking that it's just for kids. It has a extremely fascinating view, you can see Burj Al Arab hotel and if your lucky at night you could see the remarkable building turn colourful heroically. Wild Wadi is a must visit if you got Dubai, if you love water parks you would love this.The rides are extraordinary, nothing you have every seen before, 1 step in the park you could see water flowing and dancing around. The rides were very high quality and extremely phenomenal. Also if you are tired and need to rest you could lay down for a while with no-one disturbing you.The only thing I disliked about the park was the very expensive fast food shop, although the food was mouth watering and out of this world it was extremely expensive. I highly recommend Wild Wadi as it is awesome and a thrilling adventure.

family fun in the sun. considering you don't have to leave Dubai for your thrills and spills, Wild Wadi is the perfect place to spend the day!The rides very from the lethargic lazy river to adrenaline rushing Jumeirah Sceirah!!There are plenty of places to relax and catch your breath too.....

Entertaining . My son was very happy because he could actually use all the rides is the water park. My wife and my teenage son as well had an amazing time. We actually celebrate my teenage son birthday in Wild Wadi on the 15th may 2015. The staff was very attentive and always around making sure that every thing is in order. The life guards at the rides were very entertaining and friendly as well. Will recommend it to all our friends.

Great water park, especially if free. Visited here every day as part of the inclusion of stay at Al Qasr hotel. Great waterpark, well organised, queues were very my normal and the rides top quality. Best of all: it's free if you stay with Jumeriah....

Great. I visited it 10th May 2015y Super ,fun, nice, much people. Be ready its rather expensive 275Drh/person whole day but not include any additions as box for saving, no lunch, no towels - all this things should be paid extra. But if you like aquaparks you have to visit it for sure :)

Great fun!. Im not a fan of waterparks - not great with running about with my flab out. But nobody cares! I felt completely at ease. The staff where great, the park is great too, amazing views from the rides. There is however only like four rides that where good. The others are skill rides, like surfing. I would recommend a visit though!
Fantastic Aquapark. It's a bit expensive but worth a visit, the new slides are brilliant. We enjoyed a wonderful family day out last weekend.

A great day out for the whole family. Great day out for the family. Plenty of beds for everyone. A nice place to relax or Lots of water rides, from low to high adrenaline. A nice break from the busy city experience.

Ok but not great . Visited the water park today - got there at 10 and left by 12. Not a huge amount of rides that would appeal to adults. If you are looking for more of a thrill seeking day I'd definitely recommend the water park at the Atlantis instead.
Much more suited to families.

Fun Day. Really fun, we have spend all day there between Adult friends,
The park is nice and well maintained, do not plan anything after the water park, we were exhausted, The best sleep ever after.
We found it really expensive by the way, and the food choices are not good at all, do not plan to have a healthy food day.

great. imagin heaven between hell :-)
just do not eatttt unless you want go out :-)
you can have a visit to ibne batoote mall, I think its on the way there.
:-)

THRILLING . I visited wild wadi today with one of my friends and we had one of the best days of our holiday. The new rides were excellent. Since I haven't been in 5 years, I was thrilled to see the changes and how much more exciting it was. Would definitely recommend wild wadi for anyone visiting Dubai in the future as there's rides for everyone, places to relax, great food & good activities. Great day out!

A MUST . We had a fabulous day out, visited on a Thursday which was ideal with little queuing time. We were able to go on the slides a fair few times! Lifeguards very friendly. Lockers, food (particularly Ali's BBQ) drinks all reasonably priced. Slides to suit all, Jumeriah Scariah was definitely the best thrill factor and loved the Tantrum Alley! River raft and wave pool great for all the family. Well deserving of there awards! Cannot wait to visit again!
Fun fun fun. Wild wadi is an aqua park with adventurous and innovative water rides. The only disadvantage is that it only has 7 rides for adults.

no value for money. outrageous cost. Was looking forward to a new visit of the water park. Felt like being at Disney x 10. Park clean but entrance fee very high ( 275 AED or 75 USD ) and then everything is extra rental of lockers and towels. I understand food drinks to be extra but even some attractions like Fisho is extra and not cheap either. Result this attraction was totally empty, was not the only guest to refuse paying. For adults, really only 4 rides are of interest. Staff are very pushy for up sales too. Photographers on most rides, snapping and sticking tags on your wrist. We handed up with half a dozen. Cost per picture in standard paper frame USD 25 Each. Not much new interest from my last visit, guess will give it a miss on my next dxb visit

fun filled day out... Definitely a must visit in Dubai, a water / leisure park with enough and more activities to keep the whole family occupied,,, The Jumeirah Sceirah is a must try, the thrill level is at the maximum... The other rides are also enjoyable..
average. its good, until you go to atlantis...then you realise how much better atlantis is. but an average water park.

Amazing water park fun!. Squeaky clean and energy thrills. Great story to follow next to the Jumeirah Beach hotel. Outstanding attractions and adrenaline rushes to be had.Beautiful beach and lazy river.
Don't expect too much. Pretty much full of fast food, I didn't see a decent salad or fruit but then I guess big kids don't count there ;)

Amazing. This is truly an amazing water park. There are 3 what we would call big slides and then one that has over 11 interconnecting slides of varying degrees of speed as well as other more peaceful rides. It was really quiet when we visited in May (hot season apparently) but that was great for us we only queued for 10minutes for 1 ride the rest we were straight on.There are lifeguards everywhere as well as staff and they were all so friendly and helpful. You can take cameras/go pro on most of the slides just not the jumeriah scarah.If you are staying in a jumeriah hotel and get entry tickets included in your rate this includes a towel so no need to take your own. Lockers are chargeable and come in 3 sizes. Middle was fine for us for 2 rucksacks and was 50dirhams. The changing rooms are really clean, with plenty of lockers, changing rooms, showers and toilets. We stayed for around 3.5 hours and this was plenty of time to get on everything 2/3 times (albeit we didn't need to queue and we didn't stop for food).It really is a must do and if you need to pay for tickets they are well worth the price. Also there is a great view over Dubai especially the burj al Arab.

Good water park with good view. Water park with very good view, you can see the Burj Al Arab hotel with nice beach. Since this park only few ride so better you come in the morning to avoid long queing. There are 3 rides that was amazing. The restaurants and the price is worth it. Some staff are awesome and very nice but unfortunately i met one lady wearing light blue t-shirt who attend the wave pool, she was not polite at all, to bad for her working in hospitality industry. The rest was simply perfect.
Free when staying at Mina a salam. It is very well organised and no time to get bored.. a great way to cool down from the heat of Dubai

Great family fun but good even if you're just going as a couple.. It's a great experience for all ages, so don't be put off by thinking that it's just for kids.There's not as many rides/slides as you might expect, but they're all of the highest quality and when we went, there was never more than a ten minute wait, which was perfect. It certainly filled pretty much a whole day (we left an hour or so early, but only because we were cold)The changing rooms are clean, tidy and well maintained as is the rest of the park - there's no reason to worry about walking around barefoot at all.All of the rides were fun, and I'd definitely recommend the Jumeirah Sceirah as the most exciting of them all - even though it only lasts thirty seconds. We spent most of the day on and off the White Water Wadi and the Lazy River, to be honest. For sure, the catering is the standard "theme park fayre" and a bit limited for that, but it's not as crazy expensive as it could have been.All in all, great fun for all ages. Highly recommended.

Surfing and white water rafting in the middle of nowhere!!. My husband and our two friends did both of these at the Wadi Park in Abu Dhabi in June 2014. It was really fun, and seriously if you are going to be all the way in Dubai, you should try it. We had so much fun. Yes, it is HOT HOT HOT!! The wave, although takes some getting used to, is fun, nothing world class, of course, but the rafting was a hoot! The "rapids" were actually really fun!!

Should have allowed more time!. We only scheduled about 2 hour for this which was a mistake! Lots to do and we should have made a day of it! Avoid the shops ridiculously expensive, even by London standards, About £90 for a cheap fabric sarong!

Great fun.... if you get there early!. There are two massive water parks in Dubai; Atlantis, which is situated in the grounds of the Atlantis Hotel over on the Palm which is quite a way out of the main areas of Dubai, and Wild Wadi, which is situated at the side of the Jumeriah Beach Hotel. Wild Wadi is the better park if you want crazy rides, more to do, and you are visiting with families. Be sure to contact the park in advance if you need to reserve a cabana or beach space.There are restrictions to what you can take into any of the parks in Dubai, specifically to avoid people taking in bags and bags of food. There are rules for a reason and much of this is to avoid rats and other unwanted guests which in this heat is unavoidable. They do everything they can however to keep things very clean, but some have failed respect the rules in the past and larger families taking in huge cold boxes of food and drink (including alcohol which is strictly prohibited in the park) have now been denied entry. There are places to get food there, but as with everything the park opens at 10am and starts to get really busy about 11am and manic around lunchtime so to ensure you aren't queuing and wasting time, make sure you get there early.You can understand when you see the dynamic at the park and the no alcohol thing is entirely practical and isn't simply because of restrictions in Dubai itself but rather because you really don't want to be consuming booze and then getting on these rides! Also, it is hot, and while you think you are safe because you're spending your time in the water, the sun is brutal. Drink plenty of water. Take a hat. You do dehydrate while you're at the park for sure. Between March and the end of May temperatures start to soar and you will get burned so take your sunscreen. There are lockers in the changing rooms in the park and close to the rides so safety of personal items aren't an issue.June through July is Ramadan, and whilst the park is open, the working hours are reduced. Also, June and July is extremely busy with vacationers from local areas like Saudi, Qatar, Pakistan etc taking their annual vacations through the Ramadan and Eid period (June / July this year) and the locals are much more used to the temperatures but even they know to take the proper precautions so they don't get burned.Open all year around (even Christmas Day!) and well worth a visit if you want to have fun, and you like water of course! Yes, its warm enough even at Christmas.... its actually very pleasant at that time of year - about 22-24 degrees usually.I prefer this park to Atlantis in that there is more to do, and the wave beach is a great place for the whole family, rather than the rides which are great if there are two of you. It isn't cheap, but then nothing is in Dubai, but they sure do ensure it is spotlessly clean and safe. TAKE YOUR FLIP-FLOPS if you are visiting in the Spring / summer months.... the floors get unbelievably hot and your feet will burn!Children under 3.5 feet aren't allowed on all the rides, so be sure to check when you book tickets to the park. There is a special area for the kids though with their own rides which is great for little ones under 3.5 feet tall! Don forget that sunscreen though!Great fun though for all the family!

Must do in Dubai. Wild Wadi is always my first choice of waterpark. The water ride are great, selection of food court everywhere, the staffs are super friendly and helpful. been visit Wild Wadi more than 10 times and will always coming back.Wild Wadi always fun...

Awesome. We went at the beginning of May 2015 to wildwadi waterpar and it was awesome with my 12 yersold and 9 years old girls...we had too much funfunfun...tickets are little expensive but everything inside is great...lockers..foods..slides.pools..

Good fun. We got complimentary access to this Waterpark with our room at the Jumeriah Beach Hotel.Lots of complimentary life jackets available and lifeguards appeared very diligent.Waves in main pool not very good for older children but good fun for the younger ones. Lazy river good. All the slides great fun. Nice to have some rides that didn't require lots of stair climbing. Towards the back of the park a large waterfall and another lazy river (supposed to have surges and waves but we did not see any of these ) and 2 flow riders. We found if you visited very early or late afternoon we didn't have to queue but around midday much busier. Lots of sun beds, but can imagine at busy times this would not be so. You can take water in with you. Food reasonably priced but must say portions were large so really filled you up.

Lovely day.. No cons about this water park. Everything about it was good. Whatever you do make sure you leave everything in the lockers (you rent these) don't even bother wearing slippers because some rides you have to take them off and going back to get them is a little long. Nice staff, wicked rides and nice food. Really nice for kids too.

Short and good. It was alright. Limited amount of rides and you could cover it in a few hours. I felt that it could have been a little more cheaper given that the amount of rides were so limited. But since it was a bunch of us we had a good time. The ride tantrum alley almost sprained my neck and I don't have any back or neck issues. So anyone with back issues should not take that ride or the other extreme ones

excellent. Another water park for free if you stay in Jumeirah Beach Hotel , the best park in Dubai - in my opinion , nice swimming pol with very cold water and attraction for everyone ( kids, adults )
Wet fun. Kids loved it , it was pleasant and alot of fun an all together a fun day for whole family, staff were amazing however very limited rides and very pricey from to finish
USA fun in Dubai. If you love water parks then you'll love this! Its not as big as WET N WILD in florida, but for the price and for what it is, not bad at all. Great for the family, or anyone.

Dissapointed. This water park Cost me to go into it and i lost my son and found him on the road the water park had too much water and i went there to take pictures and my camera got wet somehow and stopped working this water park only cost me $1254 and all i got from it was a kick in the bum

The best ever. It is one of the best aqua park experience from all over the world experience i've ever had. Very unique.Park is stunning, very clean,. Everything is very organised. classy and the views are stunning. Plenty of rides. suitable for all ages. You will never forget this experience and will always want to repeat it.

Adventure with a view!. I am petrified of these rides, heights, slides etc. Not that i haven't tried them out but i am not a great fan. But Wild Water wadi was one place where i tried out all the rides and the confidence i gained on the safety and the smoothness in which the whole place has been designed, i think anybody can do it. I was glad i finally experienced and enjoyed these adventures that i used to gape from below. Thanks to WWW for that!Its a wonderful place for a family where i got my mom and dad to try out most of the rides.

Worth visit with family. Best place for family with children, spare a day here and you will have some wonderful time. If you have the booking in the hotel there you can have a free entry to the park. This is a best place with amazing rides, best staff, and a clean place.
For children all ages 4 - 80. Kept us busy for 6 hours non-stop! Best way to cool down. Enough shade, so do not worry about getting sun burn.

Great Fun - Make a day of it. This is a great water park.
As with most things in Dubai, does not come cheap, especially for a family.
Take a whole day to enjoy.
3 hours is enough. it was great time. 3 of plays was exciting. its staffs was so kind and humanity. serving watermelon was very good idea

Excellent Water park. This is one the best water park located in the vicinity of Burj Al Arab. You can view scenic view of Dubai from to rides of water park,. There are various food options are also available.

Pricey but great fun and views. We had a long debate before forking out 245AED(~75USD) per person, but in the end it was worth it. We went as a family with small children, and even our 5 year old was allowed on many rides as she was just above 1.1m tall. Before I get into the rides, the park is right next to Burj Al Arab, and Hotel Jumeirah on the other side. So you get lots of opportunities and angles to photograph those two beautiful buildings that normally you can't get close to(esp Burj Al Arab).There's a big wave pool and 13 different slides. Most of the slides, except for the tallest ones allow for at least 2 and sometimes 4 people to sit together in a tube, so the little ones won't be scared. There's a water playground for children smaller than 5. For anyone looking for an adrenaline rush, the Jumeiah Seirah is sure to satisfy. Not only is it a long fast ride down, but you get to sit in a capsule where the floor is pulled out from under you!The food is mostly fast food and you pay extra for towels if you don't bring them yourself, but that's about the only negatives I could come up with.

Mid-Week Fun!. Tip: look out for vouchers throughout Dubai, you can save over 50%!Wild Wadi is everything it says on the tin. It was lovely and quiet as we arrived at 10am mid-week with only 1-2 rides closed due to maintenance and little / no queueing, There are so many staff everywhere you turn and they are all very attentive. It feels very safe with lifeguards on every corner and they really seem to take their job seriously which gives a nice secure atmosphere. Beware of the waiting time for taxi's outside at the end of your trip and also don't be talked into a private taxi, which is a general rule for Dubai anyway. The drivers target those leaving the attraction.

Perfect water park experience. The experience was perfect! The park has very fun slides with some extra suspense for a couple of rides.The drop slide was definitely the best! Adrenaline overdose!The location next to Burj El Arab also makes the place very picturesque!Highly Recommended!
Great water park. This is one of the best water parks i have been to anywhere. Great selection of ride types, good layout and spectacular views
Best waterpark!. I went there as a child and remember going underwater and coming back up and my hair was dry! It was such a lovely place to go to in Dubai. Dubai is a second home to me.
Spend the day. Great water park, loved the water coasters to get you to all the slides, theming is great.. About thirteen main slides.

Good family and friends day out. Always feel like a big kid for the day and always wish the day would never end . Staff are great and friendly enough and residents in the UAE have a good discount to enter the park. Only comment is the quality of food is awful considering the price they are charging and unfortunately you can't take food in - eat before you go and go grab some food somewhere close by when you leave rather than pick at the overpriced food they serve! Overall it's worth a visit with friends or family :)

Too many kids at 10PM. I haven't been to many waterparks but I feel like this was limited in rides. Whilst the park covers a reasonable area there are only so many rides to go on and it's very frustrating that even at 10PM there are loads of small kids running around when we were hoping to have a slightly quieter night.

Haven't seen it after renovation! . Wild Wadi is the first water park in the UAE. I still remember how existed we were when we first went there back in the day. As other water parks started opening, Wild Wadi had to excel to stay different which they did! The rides are amazing!

Great fun for the young and young at heart. My teen aged kids and I had a great 4 hours here mid week when the crowds were small, the heat was not too bad and the lines were virtually non existent. The electronic cash wrist bands work well, and lockers are available for storing clothes and valuables. The place is very clean and very well supervised. No hoons here. The rides are great fun. Favourites were the Jumeirah Sceirah & the Wipeout Flowrider (aptly named...). The surfaces are well padded and are non slip when walking, though can get quite hot so keep some footwear with you. Towels can be hired and there are plenty of fast food options. My main gripe was around our 3 towels being inundated by a 'flood' which occurs periodically just by the waiting area for Wipeout Flowrider. We did not know this was coming. Luckily my camera was off the ground at the time. We took our soaked towels back to get them replaced but were told we would have to hire 3 new ones. That was a bit rich, especially when it is no cheap exercise to take a family along at around 280 Dirham's each (about AUD$90 per person) before hiring towels & lockers.
My favourite waterpark in Dubai. The oldest and still my favourite water park in Dubai. Good fun with friends or solo! Enjoy the rides, the artificial body board waves and the scary Jumeirah Sceirah!

Cool, fun place to visit for wet and wild adventure!. We spent a great day in Wild Wadi last week with group of friends. I must say its continuosly improving after their renovation. One thing to keep in mind though is not to come too early nor in the middle of the day, especially now that summer is almost here, we arrive there at 3pm til 7pm and its more than enough time to cover all rides & we even did few rounds with some we like the best. If u want to save a few dirhams u could also bring your own towel, instead of renting, and if u want to avoid long que come on weekdays or even Saturday afternoon. They allow you to bring a small bottle of water only, but food is not so expensive and have lots of options as well like burgers, hotdogs, fruits and complete snack bar. Though its always advisable to eat before entering as with all the fun rides, you will not have much of an appetite with all the twists and turns. Great place for all ages, especially during the hot weather!!
Okay for a day out. Wild wadi is very clean and the amenities are good. But, there are really only 4 decent slides to go on and once you've done that that's it really.
Good but too expensive for the rides!. Had long queues the day we visited.There are several thrilling rides which are awesome.But too expensive!
Out of the world. Absolutely rock-star experience as tourist. Clean, exciting and huge. highly recommended if you have children with you.

Chilling and fun. This is my best aqua park in Dubai..Lots of games , rides and maximum fun.. all ages will really enjoy the different types of facilities. .Prices are reasonable and really worth it. .Prices for food and drinks are reasonable as well..Be sure that you play most of the games .. this will make not to forget this lovely park..

Great water park. We've been here every time we come through Dubai as the entrance is included with our hotel at any of the Jumeirah chains. My son loves all the tube rides and it is well maintained and clean. Most of the rides can be done in half a day and there are plenty of them. Queues can be long depending on time of day as well but so far we have not had to wait more than a few minutes. Make sure you have cover like a rash vest as it can get very hot. Food is reasonably priced but there isn't too much choice and we usually head to Jumeirah beach hotel next door for a proper meal after hours of fun at the park.

Some great rides and good day out for family if kids over 1.1 metres. A compact water park with good facilities and something for everyone of all ages. Bit of a faff actually getting in and takes a while to pay and get the wrist band sorted, but once in it is easy to get around. The best rides are Burj Surge and Tantrum Alley, both inflatable rides but really cool. Jumeirah Screamer was also great, standing in the pod and listening to the count down is nerve wracking and when the floor goes, woof, you bomb down the tube and it feels like you're going down a giant loo. Kids area is great, and wave pool really good too. Food is usual junk and overpriced, why can't places like this offer healthier, more varied cuisine which is less about making money and more about being good for you?Fisho is a great side line and worth it for the experience, our 5 yr old loved it.So, if you're looking for a good day out (but not the best food) with some cool slides and a lot of fun, Wild Wadi is worth a shot.UAE residents get in for 195 dirhams if you show your card so make sure you ask for this if you are a resident. But you can't do this in conjunction with an entertainer two for one voucher.

Brilliant Day Out. I'm not one for water parks but had a brilliant day out here.I was a little apprehensive about going but had such a fun day. There was something for everyone. We felt very safe and happy with all the staff keeping an eye on people.I loved all the slides and didn't want the day to end.

Amazing place to spend a holiday. Great place to spend the day with family and friends, it is a bit crowded on weekends. love their rides, mainly the surfing one. They have rides for all age groups. The lazy river is a perfect ride to have a swim after lunch.
Great Fun. Great fun for the family, all good safe rides, makes a great day for all the family. really good lazy river.

Fun for the family. we spent the day here with another family. We picked this place over Atlantis due to the height restriction as we had 2 kids between 1.1 and 1.2m tall. Atlantis usually starts at 1.2m for all rides but their lazy river.What is funny is that there were a few rides that I think are too much for the young ones. I didn't do the big drop but the 2 dads thought it was extreme so no kids went on it. We did go on an intense raft ride that I was scared for myself and trying to hold the kids in. They of course loved it. There are signs that mark intensity levels.I thought the place was clean, a ton of lifeguards, pizza was good, and overall is was a fun day. Go early so you have the place to yourself more.Enjoy!

Great day out. We visited here on our last day in Dubai and it was a last day well spent. The rides were great fun, although the park felt much smaller and more compact compare to the Atlantis waterpark which we also visited a couple of days earlier. The staff were really friendly and there were plenty of lifeguards who seemed to take their job seriously which is always reassuring. The food was great - we had chicken kebabs for lunch and everything was really reasonably priced and great quality for an attraction like this. Take advantage of the cashless system - it is well worth it for hassle free eating. The rides were great fun but if you are on your own there is less to do as a solo rider than Atlantis waterpark (I wanted to sunbathe but my boyfriend needed a play mate on most of the rides), the lazy river isn't as good as Atlantis, but zooming uphill on your rubber ring on their rapids was brilliant. Overall, would recommend but if you have to choose just one waterpark I would go to Atlantis.

spent some... nice time. if uwana relaxe urself from yr busy life then this will be favorite place with your family and amazing location as it is next to Burj and surroundings are very nice ;.'.must visit...

Good but could do for more rides.. I think its a bit pricey but limited rides, we went there on a Wednesday, it wasnt that busy, so not long queue. The flumes were good, and lots of sunbeds. There are also a good variety of restaurants, cafeteria with reasonable price. Just bring some suntan lotion as you could burn easily. Its a good waterpark but I thought for the price they should have more rides or flumes .

very expensive trip to wild wadi but lots of fun. cant take your own food in there, they take it away at entrance, food rubbish and expensive and had to queue for over an hour to get it! wasnt happy at all. I took 3 of us and it cost £200 with a locker and 1 towell and 3 lots of burger and chips.Although the rides are great!

Good But very expensive waterpark. First we saw this amazing place and went to the ticket counter and the rates were too highPls take ur towels as they charged for that alsoRides were fun but limitedThe rides which will be perfect for adventure lovers areJumeira SceirehTantrum AlleyFlood riverThey said they will close at 7 which I feel is pretty earlyPls keep ur kids with u as its very bigThe kids play area was perfect for themWave pool was good but waves came only sometimesLazy river was very averagePlace was clean and well maintainedU can find kids quicklyPeople were friendly May be crowded at timesat about 6 - 30 I went to eateries and they said they were closedI felt that was really dumb and I ended eating magnum with my 11 and 6 year old!!Taxi service was tried to organized wellBut 2indians were not in the line and told they dint want a taxi and ran and took a taxi!!But rides were fun and there could be 2 sections BUt my kids liked itGood but nit the best!!No value for moneyI suggest u to atleast stay for 4 hours if u want moneys worth!!
Always good fun. A must go to on any Dubai trip for young and old. My daughters aged 13&9 love wild wadi especially Burj surj and tantrum alley for good family fun!

Simply Amazing Water Park. This water is park is simply amazing. So well planned and well guided place. Little far from city but worth going. I have been to other water parks also but can't be compared. Fully day enjoyment for full family. However, little lacking on food options and it can be improved but must must go and have fun. Go with your swimming consumes and tanning lotions.

Great fun for all ages - Take voucher!. This was our second visit to the park. Both times we have used an entertainer voucher to get a buy one get one free offer. I would highly recommend this option (we saved £50). Entertainer voucher books can be purchased in Carrefour. Also see https://www.theentertainerme.com/Dubai-N-Emirates/products/print/Entertainer-Dubai-2015The park has lots of rides of different intensities. The 'lazy' river is great fun and is more like a ride combined with a lazy river. Plenty of seats and beds. When we were there in October there was a lot of sun beds. However in the Easter holidays these seem to have been replaced with lounger seats (probably due to more people in the park). There was still loads of seats/beds to go around - just have a good walk round the whole park and not just at the main wave pool area.Food is standard waterpark fast food. Not the cheapest but does the job. Lockers can be rented there. You can fit a normal sized backpack in the small locker. Towels can be rented at a cost so bring your own if you can.

Day visit with 6 and 2 year old . This was a great place, the children pool had plenty of seating which we used all day. The rides were amazing although we thought there would be more rides. It is quite pricey and all have to pay including my 2 year old who didn't go on anything. My 6 year old was taller than 120cm so paid full price. You have to pay for towel hire (35 AED/towel) and for locker hire (although we just left everything on our chairs). I did like the cash less system which meant we didn't need to carry any cash. Good wasn't to expensive we ordered a pizza, drink, chips, and watermelon for 75 AED and ice-cream from 20 AED. Take water as they didn't check our bags for food or drinks. They great thing was that u wasn't worried about anyone stealing anything and there was plenty of shade. Safety was on the forefront with lifeguards and jackets provided for all. The worse thing was there was no facilities to change a baby. I would go early as possible (near the opening time) as after lunch it gets absolutely packed and the queues are like those of places like Alton towers. Overall great time x

A totally wicked day out!. So much fun! The "rides" were an absolute hoot and loved every moment even if we were gripping on for dear life on a couple of them :) The whole place was spotless, plenty of changing rooms & showers. The food outlets were not exorbitant and it seems we were out of season in terms of the queues - there weren't any!

Fantastic day with kids . We were hesitating between wide wadi and Atlantis and we did have any regrets about our choice ! I don't even understand people that rated it so badly ! Staff super friendly and helpful, place really clean and activities fantastic for kids and adults ! Lots of chair to relax as well while kids are playing in the pool in front of you ! Many restaurants all around ! Honestly we will do it again ! Went on a Saturday (better than a Friday !!!!)

Fun way to spend an afternoon - food cost, well it is Dubai.... We were staying at one of the nearby hotels, so the admission was complimentary. (If considering a visit to Dubai with kids, that is a real plus to staying at one of the Madinat hotels, particularly when they will transport you over by golf cart.)The water slides were great and interestingly enough when compared to waterparks in the US, it's nice to see a crowd where everyone over the age of 17 doesn't have a tattoo!If this was a waterpark in the US, I would feel completely robbed by the 24 USD cost for three orders of fires and three sodas. But, it is Dubai and well, it's part of the deal.We stayed in Dubai for a few day stay before heading off to another part of Asia. For our kids, this was a great way to enjoy the sun after a long winter in the US.
Andy. Another of my favourite water parksIn many ways sim to the other on price as we did both deff go again and again

Great fun. my wife and i came to Wild Wadi waterpark while in Dubai and loved every minute of it.we made sure we were there early to get in and make our way through the rideswe never waited more than a few minutes to get on anything which was great.the park also has places to buy food which are usual prices for being in a park/attraction.also bring a towel so you dont have to pay to hire one.bring a camera as well as you get amazing views of the Burj Al Arab from the higher up sun lounger areas.

nice. use jumeirah hotels to have complimentary ticket to WW by using free shuttle bus go and back also do not bring any bottle of any water or cola which is forbidden to be passed in water park and do not forget to take your Slippers
Fantastic. What a fab experience, Jumeirah sceirah OMG a must must ride the park is amazing and you will end up staying all day!

Awesome. Do not come to Dubai without going here. This was a fun waterpark. My tip is get there before the gates open and attack the park quickly. We got on almost every ride approximately 3-4 times each within the first 2hrs before it got really packed!!!! Grab a seat by the wave pool and your pretty much in the middle of the park. They have a system there for your locker and food on a wrist band and any money you don't spend they refund it back to you which is super cool. They also accept American express card so save your AED money.. The park food well jus like any other amusement park its just basic food lol. Bring you own towel from the hotel and save yourself money for renting. Have a good time we would go back in a heartbeat!
Safe family fun. Well organised park. The towel rental was exorbitant and we got 'done' by a private Lexus taxi outside, but a fun day out nonetheless

Best Water Park in Dubai. Wild Wadi is the best place for kids and for adults there are amazing rides and its such a big place. I really like the tubing and most slides. Some of the slides scared me because they were high but it was still fun. If you ever going to Dubai you have to goto Wild Wali Water Park

Great Day out. We went to wild wadi with 2 small children both under 1.1m expecting to get out in a couple of hours since the kids would not be allowed on the rides...however 7 hours later we emerged with kids still wanting to play more.The childrens area with all the slides is awesome for kids n adults...clean safe and lots of eateries a good day out.

Great fun. We had free passes to the park as we were staying at a Jumeirah Hotel. The water park is well organised clean, safe and lots of fun. The slides and attractions were just right for my 10 and 8 year old, enough to thrill but not too scary.There were plenty of sun loungers located all over the park for relaxing on. It was a great day out. take your own towels otherwise you have to hire them.

A Gem In the Desert!. My family and I had a truly exciting time at this neat and spectacular water park! The rides were thrilling and there was enough choice for each of us. The toilets and changing rooms were clean as they were constantly serviced by attendants. According to my little ones, this was the highlight of their vacation in Dubai. The entrance fee of AED 275 ( approx £50 ) for anyone over 1.1m (which was all of us) was a tad steep. There was also a charge of either AED 55 or 65 ( between £10 - £12) for a medium-sized locker. Food outlets were conveniently darted around the park and guests are not allowed to bring in food from outside. We settled for the beef pizza and drink combo, which was so divine and had a price tag of AED 60 each ( approx £12). Children and young-at-heart adults would definitely have a memorable time at this water park!
"Busy". Great rides , however let down by dreadfully small entrance , very Few beds , noisier , and much smaller than Atlantis water park

Fantastic waterpark. Even though the waterpark was partly in renovation during our visit, the remaining, open part of it gave us so much fun that we spent entire days in it. It has attractions for younger kids and for adults - some water slides are pretty terrifying. Restaurant in the waterpark offers limited selection but of very tasty meals, including great pizza. Zipline is also fun

If your in dubai u must visit wild wadi . Excellent. I thought it was just another water park but it's not, slides are so good, one thing to do is if you bring a gopro make sure to have a chest mount or wrist strap as they don't allow you to hold it.

Great Fun for all ages!. We visited in September 2014 during one of the slightly cooler months! We spent the best part of half a day at the park. We were in residence at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel and entry to the park was free. So my advice if you are staying in any of the Jumeirah properties and are able to gain complimentary access you would be crazy to waste this opportunity. The prices for the park are quite expensive.We arrived just after opening time and set our towels down on a nice location and hit the rides! The park was not crazy busy to begin with and we rode everything we could.If you are first time visitor to the park this is not like Disney World in Orlando where you are worried that you will miss something if you don't keep moving. This park is relatively small compared to what we are used to back in the USA. A good 3 or 4 hours visit you will be able to get to ride all the rides and several of them more than once!When we broke for lunch we found reasonably priced and a great variety of food available in several different locations.We rested some in the mild afternoon sun and found the whole day to be very enjoyable. One of the party was in their late 60's and in delicate health and was still able to ride some of the rides which we found safe and secure for them!One of the nice things about this park is that you don't need to bring money with you, on entry you are given a wrist band and you add money to this wristband by charging to your hotel room (or credit card if you are not staying at a Jumeirah property) which allows you to purchase food and items from the gift store by having the wristband scanned! Makes visiting the park easier because you don't need to bring valuables with you.Overall a great experience and worth a visit.

Ideal place to take younger kids. Visited Wild Wadi today with family, including kids aged 7, 5 and 3. We were originally planning to go to Aquaventure at Atlantis but decided on Wild Wadi instead because kids over 1.1m are allowed on all the rides (lower height restriction than at Atlantis). We all had a great time and the kids had a blast! The kids' play area was amazing and suitable for kids of any ages - the adults had a lot of fun here too! The wave pool was also a big hit with the kids and we had a lovely day out.The wristband which functions as your ticket can be pre-loaded with money which can be redeemed at the restaurants around the park, which means you don't have to carry any money around with you while you are there. Any money leftover at the end of the day can be refunded in full at the gift shop. I've been to Aquaventure as well and while I would say that is a better option for adults and bigger kids, I would definitely recommend Wild Wadi for families with young children.
funtime. its one of the good water park, though the taste of the water is salty but quality is ineed good, there are various rides which are combination of thrill and lazy people.

Multiple visits. Great facility, efficiently run.Tantrum Alley was the most hair raising of the attractions, followed by the theatre of Jumeirah Sceirah.The flumes that shoot you uphill are truly extraordinary, and the surfing ride is excellent funExcellent value as a Jumeirah guest, but the list prices for outsiders seem expensive
A joy ride. This is one of the best places to visit in Dubai. amazing rides great service & ya the staff are amazing & always ready to help. Try out all the rides they are worth it.

Great Family Fun. I first visited Wild Wadi Water Park 8 years ago when I was still very young and had a great time then. I came back this past March and spent the day with my sister there. It was still great fun, even for teenagers! The park was completely empty as it is their winter there even though it wasn't even cold. Although a little small, you can still easily spend the entire day there. The food options are okay but a little pricey. I highly recommend riding the Jumeriah Scara as it is truly an amazing slide. Wild Wadi Water Park is both the best water park and best fun in all of Dubai. Worth a visit!

So much fun. I love this water park, I think it is much better than Atlantis. Love the slides, easy to use top up bracelets and lockers. A great day out and best of all you get it free if you stay at one of the Jumeriah hotels!! I've been a couple of times and would go back!

Fun, Fun, Fun!. Great family fun - possibly the best water park we've visited. Lifeguards are plentiful and very friendly and there is a good range of rides and pools. We visited with my 4 year old son and there was plenty of slides/tube rides he could go on and there is a dedicated children's area he spent hours playing in.Quite a surreal experience whizzing round the water slides and catching sight of the Burj al Arab on the horizon!

Fantastic and well worth a visit. Good for families too.. The park is exceptionally clean and interestingly laid out with lots of sun beds for chilling out. As for the important stuff i.e. the rides....totally brilliant. Ranging from gentle stuff for kids (who also have a fun looking section just for them) to near vertical drop slides. Would def go again. Look out for two for one deals.

Absolute madness and poorly run facility. Wild Wadi used to be the uber attraction in Dubai. Now its unfortunately old, and poorly managed waterpark with hordes of people that its a let down.It all begins from the ticket line. One immediately witness the chaos with all the tourist buses pulling up. The attendants ushering people into lines do their best, however the process of getting tickets for one family can take as much as 10 minutes per family.
