So imagine if you have 3 families ahead of you. They should have more counters and have better options such as ticket kiosks etc for single people or just adults so they can whiz by. Trust me this adds such frustration before even entering the park and let me remind you that you are waiting outside an unshaded pavement with a few fans blowing hot air and being Dubai it can get sweltering hot during the summer.Then once you clear the lines you get into the locker and changing rooms and besides a couple of cleaners there was no attendant to guide or help people figure out how to use the lockers. The poor cleaners who i will add early on were the best behaved a d friendliest staff in the entire park. I guess WW management do not study their demographic, im sure 80% of the people are either tourists or first timers. So they should have a few attendants. Only a couple of posters which didn't do a good job explaining. Then quickly moving along..qe went to the kids splash area. It was a weekday and early afternoon and there were no sun loungers available. No one manages them. So people throw their belongings or leave a say plastic bag and assumption is that the chair is taken. Some even hijack more chairs than needed. No one is managing this, no towel boys hence no one knows which chair is occupied and which is not. This was the worst part of the park. Besides life guards i did not see any management personnel on the grounds to run the show. Utter chaos and horribly democraticly run establishment. Lo and behold then we wanted to get pizza from the pizza restaurant. And after waiting 25 minutes just to place the order the lady informed us that it would take another 30 minutes to get the food. People were irate as food was taking long. I mean are you kidding me. They shoulf know better and prep and staff accordingly as they probably go through this daily. Lastly the water was horribly salty and warm that you dont enjoy it at all. By the time u are out of the water my eyes were burning and itching due to the salt content in the water and it was dirty. I saw bandages and ice cream sticks floating in the water.And the last straw was that when i went to retrieve my contents from my locker the wrist thing was not working. I informed 2 cleaners, as again there were no attendants and they went to get security. I waited for 15 minutes and still no one showed up. Then a gentleman named Mubeen who looked like management happened to walk in to use the facility and i stopped him and he left to get security. Before he could return my wrist band worked and unlocked the locker and by this time Mubeen showed up with security. I was grateful for that ut imagine waiting 15 minutes for just somebody to come and help you open the locker.Overall a beautiful park with great rides, great views and location, however it is poorly run and can be extremely frustrating that the joy soon turns to anger. Good for 1 time but will never ever go there again. Yas water park is 10 times better in Abu Dhabi or Aquaventure in Atlantis. Less rides at aquaventure but ur spoiled by the attentive staff there. Wild wadi had seen better days. What a shame.

Great family day out. We visited Wild Wadi water park for the first time last week and had a great day out. Our group consisted of children and adults, who all found pools and rides to enjoy. There are many lifeguards on duty and they ensure safety at all times. The resort map also clearly shows which rides are suitable for children and for the adults how 'intense' the rides are. On the day we visited there was a sandstorm which I assume stopped some people visiting because the park never felt very busy all day. There were plenty of sunbeds and chairs available but on a nicer day I would recommend arriving when it first opens at 10am. We only queued for 5 minutes at 10.30am and the staff were helpful and well organised. We also paid extra for the Cabana, which is expensive but provided a great private area for our group. Each cabana has a shaded area with 4 sun loungers plus a table with 4 chairs. The price also included our own fridge stocked with a large variety of soft drinks and water. We also had a food menu so we could order our food and have it delivered to our cabana (food at an extra cost). Only 1 ride was closed in the afternoon due to the sand so we managed to experience all of the rides and we didn't get burn't from too much sun! I would suggest wearing high factor sun protection when you are in the water park. Overall a great family day out.

the best Water park ever !. this is one of my favorite waterparks of all wateroark in the world , i love watermarks and i went to some, but this one is totally one of the best m its big has so much for kids and for adults , its just awesome!
Funnest water park. Although not as flash as the more expensive Atlantis Water Park, this has it all. Infact I think some rides are even better. Remember your sunscreen.

Fun in the water at wild wadi. have just been to wild wadi. Lots of fun rides to do. get there slightly before 10 to buy your ticket so you don't stand in long queues. Do the best rides first before you have to stand and wait for too long.Can buy food from the fast food outlets. You cannot take anything in with you.There are a lot of chairs to sit on but once again get there early if you want chairs under the umbrellas.The water park is quite pricey so you need to spend the entire day there to get your full moneys worth.

A fun day out. We got there at about 11 and left at about 4.30. We weren't waiting in line for any longer than 20 minutes and there's loads of shade so you're not exposed for too much time. There aren't that many rides but the ones that are there are really good! Definitely try and get to all of them. Food not extortionate, and the pizza was lovely

Small Park. We were a little disappointed with this park, having been to many water parks. There aren't many slides and it was quite busy the day we were there. It takes ages to get your tickets. We used the Entertainer Vouchers, if we had paid full price I would have given it 3 stars. The pizza we had for lunch was good!

One of the best water park. Everything is fantastic there ...staff are very friendly ...I have visited this place many times I have visited also Atlantis the palm its not impress me at all. I suggest every one to visit this water park if you are new here

Good but not excellent. We went there with two children ages 11 and 8 who largely enjoyed it. You will need to get there at 9.30am (opens at 10am) if you want to get a good sun lounger in the family area. The best ride is number 1 which includes about 11 slides but get in early as queues start to form. There were a limited number of rides in comparison to some water parks we have been on. The staff were good and well informed. The Tantrum Alley ride is very scary and unless your child is an adrenaline junkie you might want to check it out first as it has big drops that throw you around.

Splash, Soppy and Shout for fun.... My friend and i I always spending time here. The place is so clean, staffs are all friendly with a warm smile and always willing to help/assist you. We always spent more time to ride on the master blaster, tantrum alley and the burj sure. Jumeirah Sceirah all guests favourite even me and my friends the top thrilling ride. And i love it. Count 1 2 and 3 splash, soppy and shout for fun. You must try to take ride. Wave pool is the best for family... Family bonding. Thumbs up....It has also the best view of burj al arab and ocean. Feel free to take a picture with the stunning Burj.For only 275 sed for adult and 230 aed for kid, i enjoyed my stay and had a great day. Its priceless.NOTE: You can't bring any foods or drinks inside.Addition to that they can accept (admission) Entertainer voucher.I'll come back again for sure.

Good rides but expensive for what it is..... Good rides (but not that many) and the food/drink options are limited to the junk food end of the spectrum. The water rides and lagoon are lovely but with children aged 14/15 or older, this is not a whole day experience. We had a school group of 15 year olds who had had enough after a couple of hours.
Fantastic day out!. Clean family friendly and top rated waterpark! We used the entertainer vouchers to get a bogof deal. Food was not expensive and very tasty. Tip. Share a locker. Brilliant views.

Something for everyone. We visited with our 3 boys .... our 4 year old spent hours in the kiddie area which has maybe 6 or 7 slides as well as many things to entertain - as well as more lifeguards than you could ever need.... my daredevil 8 year old (who was over the 1.1m limit and hence could ride everything) went on everything... even the most extreme slides and even my cautious 11 year old risked a few of the middle-level rides.The helpful rating guide made it easy to pitch it for my two eldest and everything was nicely compact and well sign posted.Has to be the best water park I have even been to for sheer variety and range of options.

What a wonderful day. Wild wadi..awesome water park.really enjoyed my time there. Clean place equipped with lots of amenities.Little crowded but still had a lot of fun.you don't get tired of this place.good dining,clean towels and smiling staff and much more..

Our favourite water park in Dubai. We visited here 3 times in our 2 week holiday. We much prefer it over the Atlantis. The staff are much friendlier and it feels safer for the young children as there are lifevedrs for them to keep in and there are so many life guards we used to let our 11 9 and 7 year old go off on their own.

A great Water Place. Went to sepnd the day in this water park and it was a great place with all the water games in it. The kids had a greta time playing and we also as adult had the same. Its a crowded place, so you expect to manage your own place where you can leave your towels or sandls. The good thing about this place though its the first water park in Dubai that it still sustain ihe quality and service.

AMAZING WATER WORLD. in wild wadi water park here you can find all the water games you want, however if adult or children or family all people can enjoy herespecially if you go in summer the ticket price is 66$
Nice day with the family. Very nice water park, incredibly safe, there are lifeguards all over the place. Staff was attentative, restaurants were fine. Would go back.

Great for family entertainment. This is still a great place for the family to spend the day. It's not as big as Atlantis but imo has a better selection of activities for those with young children, as we do. Wild Wadi is located in between the Jumeirah Beach hotel and the Burj Al Arab. Best to travel there by taxi if you don't have other means of transportation. If you're a large family I'd advise getting hold of the Entertainer vouchers as you'll save yourself quite a bit of money. Remember you have to pay for all extras like towels, lockers. There are 3 different locker sizes. We had a pushchair and the big locker was able to fit that plus a small bag. There are several food outlets dotted around the park, each serving something slightly different. The food is pricey though, and if like my kids they don't have much of an appetite I'd recommend getting a pizza to share. We went on a Monday and got there for about 12. The queues weren't particularly long and you should be able to get through all the rides at least once in 4 hours. On the whole the staff were pleasant although there was one that gave us the run around trying to find the entrance to the lazy river ride.
Great Water Park. Really worth a visit. More aimed at older kids as the rides are a little more full on with big drops etc. Lots of shade areas and seating.Clean....

Waist of money. This water park is teriible. There are 2 rides that are fun, but at the price it is not worth it. Food is 3 times the price inside the park. The wave pool is definitely not a wave pool. If a fat person jumped in the pool it would create more of a ripple. Every ride you wait 15-30 min to go.
Great water park. ProsSafetyFoodThrill ridesFacilitiesConsPoor shade in hot daysExpensive (compared to european parks)

Nice, but totally overpriced. The offers of slides was not too big and the Price was much to high what is offered. Still a few slides were quite nice and the free fall very challanging. I would not do it again.

Nice place but... It was nice water park with some cool slides and rides but kinda expensive and unfortunately we've picked up busy time (a weekend and holiday time) it was so crowded so select the right timing and u will enjoy it.
Good day out. Not that many rides, in February there were hardly any queues... Value for money.... Safe, pleasant staff...
Great day out. Lovely day out for all. Note that if your child is below 120cm the only ride they can go on is the lazy river. Get there early to get a seat too.
Good, fun, but very expensive. We went to this park, it was fun, but it was expensive... not so many options...only 4 rides that could interest us. Everything cost triple.

Very good - but not amazing. A good water park, but if you want something really amazing, you should probably visit Yas Waterworld with teenage kids. If you have smaller children only, then this parc might be the best option and no need to go to the even more fancy parcs in the UAE. Don't get me wrong, this is a very nice parc, but slides are not as long and extreme as somewhere else. And - as all the other parcs - very expensive of course. 3 Adults plus three children will set you back around 440 USD.
Had a nice fun. It was amazing,had a nice day with my friend,,,very nice place to enjoy ,,,,,wild wadi is the best water park in Dubai...!

Thrills and spills. You get in your rubber ring at ground level and it shoots you up and down and through all sorts of rides with options of which routes to take down - absolutely amazing! The raft rides are fast and furious! The food outlets were delicious and really good value - same as we pay in Spain!

Best family waterpark, preffered over aquventure!. We are a family of teenagers, kids and adults and all of us couldn't fault this water park! Ideal for all of us, food available, everything was pretty self explanatory and we preffered this over our experience in aquaventure! Can't wait to go back.

Excellent water park . Been lots of times. Excellent rides. Main drawback is crowds - too busy on weekends and holidays. Can take an hour to get in and some of the popular rides eg jumerah scierah can have 1hr plus waiting times. They probably need to expand or reduce visitors when park is busy. The ticket staff are painfully slow. Maybe having automated ticket counters may speed up the process. They could do with a few more toilets

Family Visit. Wild Wadi is an excellent fun water park that everyone should visit.The downside for us is that we visited as a family and our children are approx 1cm less than the minimum ride height of the attractions.They were therefore unable to go on 8 out of the 11 attractions with one of the remaining 3 closed for refurbishment.Hopefully they will be tall enough on our return and the whole family will be able to enjoy.

Excellent time. Real smiles delivered as promised, great attractions and fun environment, be prepared to get very wet, bring your own towels and swim gear unless prepared to rent or buy. The food prices as are reasonable. But five stars all round.

A great day for the children ..... and those who have never quite grown up !!!. Much is said about whether Wild Wadi or the Atlantis Hotel water park is the best. In my view Wild Wadi wins. It is the complete package ........... and much easier to access. Go early to get the best locations/seating and it is usually better to book online (and if you are a large party consider paying the bit extra for the limited availability pagoda stations). Also there are many ways to reduce the entry costs (vouchers at hotels, Entertainer guide voucher, Sirius membership etc) so you never have to pay the full cost. Also bring things like towels with you and some food .... to reduce costs further. I am sure you will have a marvelous dayIf you are a guest of one of the Jumeirah hotel, this experience is free.

FUN all the way, if you enjoy water parks you will love this!. We are not you typical age group (60+) to frequent water parks, nor are we delighted by mild water slides, the wilder the better! This was our second trip to wild wadi , the last was 15 years ago. There has been some changes and additions to the rides all of which great fun. The vertical drop with the countdown before the floor disappears below your feet is to say the least frighteningly exhilarating. A awesome day of fun rides and clearly a great day for all those who are young at heart. Howls and squeals of laughter are par for course!

Great Water Park. The wild wadi water park is a 100% entertaining place for all ages. It has many rides. The prices are cheaper if you use your resident UAE card to show at the entrance. Highly recommended.
Nice. Nice place with rides for all age groups. Only draw back is the long waiting lines for the popular rides

Good park but very expensive !. It's a good place with nice slides and you can have a lot of fun !The only problem is that they are always a lot of people and you'll have to wait for so long before you do a slide.. You'll spend more time in the queue than in the water..

Best Place to Cool Off during the Summer. The rides are great but then it could be better :) The vertical drop and lazy river was actually the best I could find. Better take all the things you need to get inside the water if you forget anything then it will cost you a lot inside and since you don't have any other choice you will have to buy them. you will also get a better view of Burj Al Alrab from here.

Wild Wadi water park. Right next to Jumeirah Beach hotel and the Burj Arab, this is a great water park, with slides of all levels, surf waves and swimming pools. Great on a hot day and fun for all ages. Be aware of cultural respect and wear a covering swim suit or T shirt.
Great. Very first time we came to Dubai 2005 we visited here and we loved it and would definitely recommend a visit here for some great water rides and fun. The lazy river is great

Day out with the kids and big kids!. Wild Wadi is an old favourite, having used it since it was built. Slightly smaller than the newer parks at Yas and Atlantis on the Palm, but still a great day out. Tried some new rides which are good fun, and did the Jumeirah Sceirah for the first time, pretending not to be as scared as my kids! Good value day out if you use Entertainer vouchers, food on site is good but a bit pricey. Get a medium locker if you are more than a couple. There are also lockers around the site, which you don't realise until you are in. Some on the rides don't link well, so you end up walking a longer distance to where you want to go. Go early on a Friday to get on all the good runs without long queues. Still a favourite day out in Dubai!
Good fun. This is good fun and a change from laying by the pool. Because we was staying at the Madinat, it is free to enter, you only need 2-3 hours here, so nice to relax on the lazy river

Great day!. We visited Wild Wadi on Tues 6 Jan - it was a pleasure as it was not crowded and weather was sunny, mild and perfect! While quite an expensive outing, it was well-worth it - the park is immaculate, loungers a-plenty and food very good and reasonably priced. Nice variety of rides.

Great fun if you like water parks. It's a sight to see and experience. With rain and thunder storms on queue and going around the park in inflatable rings, it's just great fun for couples, groups and families alike.You've got to go if you;re going to spend more than a few days in Dubai

Great when staying at Jumeirah hotels.. It's smaller than Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi but when staying at the Jumeirah hotels, the entrance to the park is included. Great for all ages, we went with a 1-year old and a 5-year old and we all enjoyed it.

Great Water Park for Full Day Fun. The entrance fees is reasonable with a lot of offers to "Buy one get one free".The food is very expensive and not high quality; but Mall of Emirates is very close and you can go there after you finish the park.

What a day!!!!!!!. Really it was very very very fantastic day. My children enjoyed very much , view overlooked Burj El-Arab is amazing, its very safe for the children lifeguards is very focus.Whenever you are in Dubai, you should go there

Excellent day. That was great day- Family day out. However for the 3 year old was not so much fun as for 10 year old.This place have great selection of rides with excellent views on Dubai.Clean and well organised.Highly recommend.Be prepared for the additional charge for the locker- but you can claim it back at the end.

Total disappointment.. Total disappointment. Price was high (entrance ticket doesn't contain locker. You need to buy it for extra charge). Attractions were boring and there were only a few slides. The wild wadi may be suitable for small kids,but parents- they are bored!

The second best in UAE. My expectation was quite high on Wild Wadi, but if i have to compare with The Aquaventure. Wild Wadi will come second, i think they need to install some crazy rides there. The rest of the rides were actually good but not that great.

Wild Friends enjoying the Wadi of Jumeirah Dubai. Best time was last summer with my friends , we had so much fun with my friends from Europe. They were surprised and loved the games that Wild Wadi offers with its good prices. They loved the fresh burgers that is cooked with the best Chiefs in town. The cold Coco Cola that was woow on the summer times and the best taste of Watermelon that is Lovely. We all loved it and specially I'm from Emirates , Dubai and I am very happy and proud that Jumeirah hotels and Resorts are the best in Town offering the best services in United Arab Emirates. Well done to the management in Wild Wadi for making the waterpark amazing all the time I visit with my family or friends. :)
Brilliant. Loved this place. Very clean and tidy well run. Staff very helpful and courteous. Recommended for a great day out !

best water park. ive been going to wild wadi since the past 10 years and its never failed me, i always go there and have a blast with my friends and enjoy it to the max ! i'll still be always going there !!

OK but not many rides, Atlantis park better and cheaper. Quite expensive entry. Lockers weren't working due to an issue for first hour and a half in park so couldn't go on rides to begin with. Rides were ok but non had the wow factor of the rides in the Atlantis park. Food was also not very good in comparison. Overall this was a let down considering the price and the reviews this gets on this site. Better for younger kids than adults. Would not revisit.

The best. You have to go well planned and prepared with family. which slides you want. Weekends are crowdy. Resident offer or other offer can make a 50-50 difference. Jumeriah Sciera is must for all Adults. Tantrum alley is another good one .. Kids area and food services are good.
Great rides!. Nice day out. Right by the beach. Try the slides! or just lie on a lounger and watch the waves go by and the Burj Al Arab hotel.
Over rated!. Limited activities for toddlers, a bit disappointed. Good for teenagers though, try to avoid weekends (over crowded!).

Great Fun. This is a fantastic water park for all - adults and children. Everytime I visit I still love it - the relaxing trip down the river on the big floating tires gets me everytime. The big wave pool is still so much fun - I still haven't managed the big slide...maybe next time!

Fun in the Sun. Great rides for both those looking to relax and those looking for thrills.
Great atmosphere and sound track

The child in you will love it!. What can you say, it's a water park.. it's busy but well organised, the queues aren't awful and the place and clean. If you're a child at heart or have children it's certainly worth going.
Good. Either atlantis or wild wadi both are in the same lines but choose one of them, wild wadi a bit small but a good experience
Good waterpark. This is a good waterpark with a lot of different activities and rides to choose from. I prefer Atlantis with the beach access and greenery.

Fun! Fun! Fun!. If you're expecting a water park the size of Florida's water parks you'll be disappointed, but we loved Wild Wadi. We went on a Sunday morning in March, arrived just after 10am and we could virtually choose our sunbeds. There are loads, some under canopys in the shade, some in the sun. Lockers are pretty expensive 65 dirhams non refundable, so we didn't bother. We just took it in turns in looking after our bags. The water rides are great fun and there's something for everyone from the timidest to the most adventurous. Also great views of the Burj al Arab which is just a few hundred yards away.

Great place for a family. It's absolutely wonderful for a visit with children. And it's rather an experience for adults as well.Sometimes it's rather crowded, then it's not that much interesting because of endless queueing

Splash! In the Desert . .. Had half a day to do something different - and this was different from most other things you might do in Dubai. Loads of fun! Similar to water theme parks in Florida of course. Not too crowded either. On the whole, a good way to spend the time. Refreshing in a way that it's not got bars scattered throughout.

Good fun and great for kids. Firstly I must say that entry to Wild Wadi Water Park was included in our stay at Al Qasr and therefore we enjoyed the Park at no additional cost. It was adjacent to the Al Qasr and a free buggy ride took us to the Park - no problem getting in, apart from the check on our bags for foodstuffs (bottled water was allowed) so do not try to bring in your picnic! The Water Park is not huge, but offers a very large swimming pool and water attractions for the children (they looked extremely popular). With no children there is still plenty to do, we took several rides on the water slides - great fun and not too frightening for a couple of cowards. The food was standard stuff and not too expensive, but it could add to the cost of the day out for large families. Definitely worth a visit, but do not go there expecting the best Water Park in the world - it's good but not great. An enjoyable day out is enhanced by the wonderful weather - not really to be missed, but do not underestimate the cost if you are a large family (entrance, food, drinks and lockers).
Lots of fun . one of best water parks in UAE...very nice place to enjoy water games in this park...we spend half a day in this water park and enjoyed to fullest...
beat the heat.... omg...such a awsome place to be...fun n thrill,,,adventure all around....loved d feeling of adrenline running in my body....gr8 spot for summers...

Amazing Day Out!. Me and my partner visited Wild Wadi on one of our days in Dubai and it was a great experience.I wasn't expecting the park to be as big as it was but it was a very good size park with great facilities. As we visited on a Thursday I think that's the reason it was quieter but if possible visit on a weekday as you won't have to queue for rides. We never queued once for any ride!The prices were very reasonable for all extras and the place was extremely clean!TIP: Load your wristband up to save you time and hassle as you will get a refund on any money you don't spend.Take towels and/or a beach bag with a change of clothes in. You will want to keep everything in a locker as you have your wristband to pay for items and you can enjoy the whole day without worrying about your stuff.

The best water park in UAE. This is the best water park in UAE. There are many other around UAE. But wild wadi is the best. Amazing rides.... Better get all your stuffs like swim wear etc from outside as things are expensive inside.

Not as good as Aquaventure but still definitely worth visiting. If you only have time for one waterpark, then head to Aquaventure. But definitely aim to visit both.Wild Wadi has fewer group rides, but does have two amazing features. The vertical drop ride will max-out your adrenaline levels, and the waterslides that push you up hill make for a memorable experience.Advice: Aquaventure, for me, is the better park but I recommend both and personally alternate between them both.

Good day out! . We went here last week as our hotel had given us a discount voucher and we enjoyed the waterpark at the Atlantis on our last visit. We had a really good day - it was really quiet so we didn't have to que for the rides! Bonus! It was quite expensive for two people plus the cost of a locker I think it was £93 but we enjoyed the day. Our favourite ride was the Tantrum alley, you can have up to 4 people but we only had 2 and it was so fast/fun! My boyfriend went on the jumeirah sceirah and said it was scary!! You basically drop down through a trap door onto the slide. Overall a good place to go for the day, I probably wouldn't return but only because we've now done it. :-)

Wild Wadi Water Park - The Place to Be!!!. If you need to keep cool from the summer heat, need to keep wet and fresh, Wild Wadi Water Park is the place to be! I was there once, but it became my favorite every time I'm in Dubai. Very imaginative structures, sweet rides, super friendly staff around you, awesome facilities as well! Mad Fun! Mad Fun!
A lot of fun!. Really enjoyed rides! There a lot of them for any age! Not too many people and plenty of beach chairs to rest. Would recommend to visit.

Fantastic day out. OK so when it boils down to it, there is not a huge variety of things to do here, but what is there is fantastic. We tried everything once, and our favourite things multiple times - in addition to lengthy rest periods for food and sun, so there was plenty of time for eveything. The only downside - I thought the official photos were too expensive, even for Dubai.

The best water park in the UAE. People are always quick to go to Aquaventure at Atlantis because of the name...but having lived in the UAE for more than 2 years now and having visited 4 of its water parks, Wild Wadi is by far my favourite. Despite it being a small area, it has everything you need including being in a perfect location with wonderful views of the Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach. I have been 3 times in total and plan to go many more!

total FUN !!!!. amazing place to spend the day.the rides are amazing, everything is systematic and SAFE. total fun. perfect for family visit. the staffs greet you with smile and are very helpful & kind. loved the surfing thing over there. burj al arab & jumeriah hotel can be very well seen from the water park. the photos they click over there by the photographers are just too expensive ! 100dhirams for one picture :/ R U SERIOUS?? which is like 1,700Rs for one photo.

Still great fun!. It's been around a while now and and may not be as "wow" as Atlantis but for us visiting with a 4 year old, it couldn't have been better. 1.1 m is the minimum height for all the rides so our boy could go on everything which he duly did with the exception of the Jumeirah Scareh. It's a lot more compact and easy to get about than its newer rivals but we had a really enjoyable day and would go back again.
wet fun. I love this water park, not very big but defiantly has many activities to match different age groups and thrill level
Fun for kids. A middle eastern themed waterpark. The rides are fun but the water can be rather cold in Jan as it is not temperature controlled.
Super. The aqua park is great. From the other side is somehow expensive and has limited quantity of attractions. But if you are with kids - it's the best choice.

Good experience for water lovers!. Spend a day at the waterpark, great relaxing atmosphere, lovely facilities, well taken cared off, staff is always available to help and guide you around the park. The food choices are limited, guess some more choices would be a plus for the entertainment and if families intend to stay/spend a whole day there.Fun for water lovers, swimming pools are pristine and good.

Brilliant Family Day. Wild Wadi is an absolute must for anybody with a family visiting Dubai.It is located within the shadow of the Burj Al Arab hotel out at Jumaihah beach.The entrance is about £20 a head, but this is excellent value because once inside all the rides are for free, and you can sit beside the pools for as long as you like.Fantastic

Busy but Good. Very Busy! plenty of sun loungers to accommodate though, and plenty of places to eat and drink. Some great rides, but found the "lazy pool" over crowded and extremely noisey. Plenty to do and not just for the kids..Worth the wait to get in as you have to queue, but once in, you wont be disappointed ,

fantastic - breathtaking!!!. Any place built is just fantastic and out of the blue. Dubai is great place for everything EXCEPT BUSINESS- ITS A GREAT MIRAGE thats all.!!! be very careful when you do business or deal with guys suited booted and arriving in huge cars and entertaining you in huge villas or hotels- finally thats the bait finally its your own money which you shall be rooked off.. sad but true. the original locals dont do business they are rich. the outsiders are the ones who do it - crooks of the highest order. you can enjoy spend and have fun but not many have been able to make money and take it out to their countries. dubai is collection of the biggest crooks on earth all in one place trying to crook each other and make money. in this deal only local dubai makes money or assets as all invest there and when its time to go you have to leave all thats constructed there itself. BE CAREFUL. GO HAVE FUN ENJOY DRIVE MOST FANCY CARS BUT PLEASE THINK 100 TIMES BEFORE INVESTING AND DOING BUSINESS. A sincere true advice from many many years of experience and observation.
So much fun. An aquapark by the Burj Al Arab! Wow!! We had a blast! So much fun! Many slides, a big lazyriver, lots of chairs and place to relax!

Inept and amateur customer service. I turned up last Monday to go surfing having booked in advance. However, the customer service department mistakenly posted my booking to the following week (tomorrow). So I turned up last week after a 2 hour journey from Dubai to discover that the surf pool was down for maintence for the whole week. I was pretty cross to say the least and made this clear to the front desk.And today they are emailing me to check if I want to go surfing tomorrow! Utter incompetence.

Really good fun.. (Free entry too to hotel guests of Madinat Jumeirah). We are staying at The Al Qasr hotel on holiday this week.Today we took the free golf buggies from our hotel to The Wild Wadi. Entrance is complimentary to hotel guests of Madinat Jumeirah which is a real bonus.Towels provided free however you do have to pay for the lockers ( only £7 GBP ) .Really good wrist band system that you add money credit to on arrival and spend on refreshments and souvenirs as you go, simply scan your wrist band at the tills, thus avoiding the need to carry cash in your wet swimming costumes.Lots of attractions that provide fun for all ages. Our 4 year old daughter loved the wave pool and the slides aimed at juniors / inexperienced swimmers. However my 23 year old niece and I also had lots of fun on the faster white knuckle type rides aimed at older children and adults.The place was spotlessly clean with lots of staff on hand to answer any questions etc. Granred, the souvenirs and photographs and refreshments are not cheap - but hey, with free admission, we cannot moan.Great fun, completely worn our little girl out, as soon as we got back to the room her head hit the pillow, but just before she went to sleep, she asked me........ "Can we go back to the Water Park again tomorrow Daddy"........Anyone on holiday with kids give this place a try, you'll have a great time.

Great day. It was brilliant! Loved going. I came with my mother and she sat on the lounges all day so I was sliding alone. The workers were really helpful in finding me groups to slide with on the two or more people rides. There were more than enough single person slides to keep me occupied for a long time. It was a great day all round.

Somewhat sedated experience. This is the oldest waterpark in Dubai and it shows although new attractions are repeatedly added throughout the years. Great fun for kids in all ages - parents, not so much as the areas of retirement and relaxing are being evaded due to the limited amount of space. Rides are exiting, service is excellent and you should have some fun hours here. Still has the only water slide in Dubai that goes UP on waterjets!

Great to visit in February ! Hardly anyone there!. It was great to visit Wild wadi during our stay, the park was great ! Hardly anyone there and we could do all the rides with no queues! We also had a cabana that provided us with towels and drinks all day and a nice private area to relax.

Expensive, but enjoyable. A mate and I took the afternoon to explore Wild Wadi, and the lack of crowd made up for the hefty entrance fee. We didn't have to wait on any of the slides. There are really only two slides that are exceptionally intriguing - the high paced Jumeira Sceira, and a fast and wild one next to the Burj Surge whose name eludes me. There are some innovative rides on site (the aforementioned Sceira and the reverse 'slides' that get you around the park) and the staff are very friendly. It's worth it to entertain the kids, but there aren't really enough thrilling attractions to make it worth the price for adults.
Great fun. My friends and I visited Wild Wadi for a change of scenery from the pool! Although slightly expensive we weren't disappointed. It's great fun and a good day out.

Must to visit . This Aqua park is amazing to spend one day there with the family , both adults and young will have a lot of fun , we loved the place , the food , everything is such perfect , don't miss it .
Had so much fun.. This place is to be enjoyed by all - young and old. Amazing lots of shelter and outdoor umbrellas/covers. A must to go to at any age.

A good afternoon trip. Overall, my friend and I had a good visit to Wild Wadi. However, the size of the park is quite small and there aren't a ton of rides. I'm a big fan of traditional water slides and they didn't have any of those (that you go down without a tube). Their water slides went up and down and I ended up getting really nauseous from getting turned around backwards. The lazy river was also not so lazy, but filled with men tipping over each others' tubes. I do have to say that once I got some water and took a break, the rest of the afternoon was awesome. We went on the Jumeirah Sceriah and Tantrum Alley multiple times. We both enjoyed ourselves overall, and had a good time cooling off from the Dubai heat. We also had a coupon from the Entertainer book which made the price just right.
great fun day. this waterpark is great fun for the whole family and we had a lot of fun. the rides are great. It is a great day out.

Glad it was Free !. This park was a huge letdown. Thankfully as we were staying at JBH then we got free entry. The poolside seats were uncomfortable and not traditional sunbeds, the food wasnt great, only 2 decent slides. Lazy river had no force so pretty much a self paddle. Just overall disappointing considering other water parks I have visited.

Best water park I've been to. What is there not to love? Whole family had lot's of fun.
The food however is average and overpriced.

Great day out!. We had a lot of fun here. The slides are great and there is plenty to do. When you get there I would strongly recommend that you go to the tidal beach, head towards the photo and gift shops on the bridge behind the wall where the waves come from, go up the stairs and put your towel on the great sunbeds that have stunning views of the beach and Burg Al Arab. Then hit the slides! We didn't have to queue for very long on any of the rides and the lazy river is designed so that many of the rides come off it. You don't even notice you are queuing! You can also try your hand at surfing which was awesome. A great day out for all :-)

Perfect for our kids. We were staying at the Madinat so entry into wild wadi was free for us. We were in Dubai for one week and we spent a lot of our time here.There are an array of rides, from the shallow slides for our one year old to the more thrilling rides for my husband.Once you've had the luxury of a water park on your hotels doorstop, it makes other holiday destinations less appealing. So much so that we are coming back to the Madinat in Dubai this coming August and the main reason for us booking this particular hotel was for wild wadi.

Great fun. This is a great water park with loads to do. My 6 and 3 year old loved it. If I am honest it is not quite as good as Aquaventure but you will not be disappointed, especially if you are staying in a hotel where it is complimentary!

Friends Group Is a Must!. If you want to have a great time with your family or friends this a place you should do! I went like a year ago and we have nice time, the facilities and the rides are amazing, also the location is really good.

Dubai's best. Jumeriah Scerah best water slide and has the most amazing view of Burj Al Arab, make sure you get in there early,to avoid the que for waiting for a chance to slid down the Jumeriah Sceirah,

Great fun....... We were staying at the Madinat Jumeirah resort so benefitted from free entry. We found a good mix to do with 4 and 7yr old boys. The eldest is an adrenaline junky and certainly got his fix. The youngest spent most of his time in a VERY warm wave pool. Every facility needed.

Fun waterpark, great views of the Burj Al Arab. Went with friends for the day, was a fun day. Park wasn't too busy, and we had a voucher for reduced entry which is always beneficial. Great views of the Burj and beach, and good sundecks for relaxing. Park was clean. Food good and reasonable.

Great fun. This was a great day out. Lots to do and variety of slides and lots of chairs and sun loungers. Lots of shade and you need it when it's really hot. Lots of choices for food and you will always get something you like. Be careful as it is big and need to watch the kids but it's great fun.

Great!. We had a fantastic time in Wild Wadi. The rides are suitable for almost everyone. Only Jumeirah Sceirah seems very scary. We went on all the other rides and definitely recommend it. The wristband can be topped up with money which is very convenient. Someone had walked away with my son's flip-flops and we reported it to the Lost and Found Dept. At the end of the day, James found it and came looking for us in the taxi queue to return it! Thanks James.

Excellent family center for fun. Our visit was fine, noting that the cost of admission was included in our hotel reservation (part of the Jumeirah chain). The park is clean and family friendly, and the rides were a lot of fun. It was a nice way to spend a couple of hours (we don't have kids). For Americans, like me, who are used to mega-amusement parks, this one may not have as large a variety of rides and concessions as we're used to. However, I found the lines to be shorter than in the US. There was an unexpected glitch in our schedule: On the day of our visit, the park closed surprisingly early and our hotel shuttle wasn't aware of that. A ladies' night was being held, and we were barely tolerated by the staff at the entrance as we waited a long time for our bus (I can understand that a bunch of men hanging around the entrance was not what management hoped for on ladies night).. An unexpected treat was the view of the Burj Al Arab next door. We saw helicopters land on the heliport near its summit. The views of the beach, sea and Burj Al Arab are very nice and there is a deck where you can relax and enjoy it.
Good for half day. it is only 3 rides for thrill seekers.....one is the jumeira scheira.....simple amazing...31 mtrs high...80 km speed..wooooo

Find your inner child. I am an intrepid man in my 50's an my wife a nervous on rides 40's. Guess who insisted on going back day after day ? She did. Get the bracelet with some money as credit and spend the whole day if you can. The rides are fantastic and my wife was laughing like a child every day, it was wonderful for me to hear. Staff,as expected, were very helpful,kind and we now have a picture of us on one of the ride on our mantel piece !

Good fun, but expensive. clean, not as many rides as expected. I wouldn't rent a locker, as we just left our beach bags at the chairs by the pool. Forgot to take the discount voucher from our hotel ! Dont think I would do again, due to the cost, although my 13 year old disagrees! Very friendly helpful staff.

too crowded and horrible food. The park and the slides itself are great fun. But keep in mind, it is VERRRY expensive, VERRRY crowded (long queues - and hard to find an available sitting area) and the food is horrible (expensive and bad quality - as well they don't give you all you've ordered. You really have to check upon taking your order from the counter if all is there- I received 2 portions of French fries instead of 4 ! And the staff claimed all was on my tray.) And of course you are not allowed to bring in any food or drinks from outside. You spend a lot of money on a Wild Wadi day.

Enjoyable for all ages. This water park has rides which is suited for all types of ages. From swimming pools to high end dive slides it is totally enjoyable. It takes a whole day to enjoy all the rides. The admission tickets are fairly priced.

Awful . It was my third time in wild wady and real bad. The slides stopped working while we were in the middle of it! And we were under sun burn for 30 minutes and in the end didn't fix it. We had to get out of slide!One another slide wasn't working. Surfing was closed. The price of foods very high. Not many slides,just 3! When we went out it was a long line waiting for taxi and no taxi!Won't go again,even free. It was 65$ while in iran very better than it with more slides is 4$!

best family day out in Dubai. Can't fault this place for a family day out. Staff are brilliant, rides superb. Would be nice if the queues moved quicker - the main ride on the rubber rings had a 40 minute wait. We just laughed all the way down Tantrum Alley. Food is surprisingly good value and quality.

Good family fun!. This is a very clean park with many rides and things to do! We had a very fun time here! Highly recommend this park - especially if you are staying at the hotel and can access the park for a few hours a day!

Water slides are sick. The waves are awesome.. The water slides are very fun specially the tube slide which you need to sleep and launch like a torpedo!!! Awesome place for water slides and they have surfing also...!!!

Enjoyable. Had a good time here but only really need a few hours to be honest. If you are on holiday and going to DUbai and Abu Dhabi, only really need to visit one of the 2 waterparks as they are quite similar. Worth taking some spare clothes and being prepared. Be prepared to get wet.

Loved it!. Missed out on Wild Wadi last time I was in Dubai so made sure I visited this time. Great water park with some fab rides that seem to go on and on!! Pretty quite early on but got busier as the day went on. The only down side was the queue for the tickets was a bit of a joke. Only one ticket booth open before the main gates opened! If you had to pick this one or Aquaventure then pick Wild Wadi.

Excellent fun. Wasn't sure what to expect here due to previous reviews but didn't disappoint. Super efficient entrance system meant limited time queuing ( although be very sure which package you want beforehand as they do try to up sell packages) and we were quickly through and into the park. Wait times at rides must have only been a max of ten mins although the park was v busy. We ate there as food from outside is not permitted and it was expensive. £40 for the pizzas and soft drinks. Having said that they were huge and we could have shared two between us easily but they were the most delicious pizzas I have ever had. Well worth a visit

Still Being Refurbed!. Three days after opening from a month long annual maintenance and refurb closure there were still areas closed off, temporary facilities in place, and only one of the two surf simulators open. that left only 3 slides and the Rapids to entertain anyone without young children. It was a fun day but didn't really justify the price tag based on our experience of other water parks. Hunt down a 'The Entertainer' BOGOF voucher on eBay in advance of your visit as we did and save a fortune. Food there is terrible quality and really overpriced.

fabulous experience. amazing place for the family and you can literally spend a full day here. the rides are out of this world experience, the location is supreme. it will hit your pocket for the food but its worth the while
Another perfect fun day out for the kids and adults. Great waterpark for kids and adults .lots of fun thrill rides and relaxing rides .A must visit when you go to Dubai
Fun fun fun. A great water park for all ages, our favourite was the lazy river. Loungers go quick, but plenty available. Life jackets and towels provided.

Wild Fun!!!. In my humble opinion this is the best water park in the world. I've been to Schlitterbahn in Texas which is a pretty nice set up. I just enjoyed Wild Wadi more. If you have kids this is a great place for them. They will be entertained. The theme to the park will be a hit with them as well.Like Disney and other places in the world, the food inside the park can be expensive and the water park is pricey overall. However, you get a real good value for what you pay. The park is clean, the water feels fresh, and the view can be good too. I was staying at Jumeirah so access to the waterpark was easy. Jumeriah Sceirah was my favorite 'fast slide' but the younger ones loved the Breaker's wave pool. This place is worth your visit.
Brilliant slides. fab days spent here with the family, brilliant water slides some of which go uphill, lifeguards everywhere, couldn't fault it!
A place to visit. One full day entertaining park ... Food cost is little high but the rides are very nice ........ I will be back soon ............

Always the best. great water theme park,never been disappointed there.a bit on the pricey side but well worth it. I alwauys enjoy the up slides as well as all the tube rides and the warm wave pool. Great blast for all ages..on the down side a bit pricey on the food sides..

worth the visit. If you wanna try aqua adventures then you should not be missing wild wadi water park. The rides are amazing and you will have a view of Jumeriah hotel which is wonderful. All the rides are exciting and your kids can have a lot of fun as there are more fun stuff to do.

Wild Wafi Water Park. Wanted to go in January. looked at the website for opening times. Went there and we got there park was closed for maintenance. This should have been stated on the website, very disappointed

Great waterpark. I have been to wild wadi a number of times and returned during my sept vacation in 2014. I would recommend both water parks in Dubai as there both very different Wild wadi is right on Jumeriah beach next to the Burj with stunning backdrop and scenic views. The lazy river is great to relax and there are great thrilling rides at the park. You can hire towels and lockers at the park and there are places for lunch and snacks which are reasonably priced. This is a great place to go mid trip and spend the day. Fun for all age ranges.

Water Fun at Wild Wadi!. Great for the family, free if your staying at the jumeirah hotels! I stayed at the Dar Al Masayaf so you can get a buggie to take you right to the park for free with free entry. great!
Family fun!. Fab water park, and a great choice of rides for all ages. Nice choice of food options. We miss your family Day specials you used to hold each May - any chance of getting these back?!

Amazing place - well worth a visit. We spent a day at Wild Wadi during February half term with our 3 children aged 14, 11 and 11 and another family who we had met at our hotel who had been before who had a 12 year old. We had an amazing day, the kids were occupied from 10-4 and to be honest we could've stayed longer. The queues for the rides do get longer as the day goes on so it is a good idea to get there early. The park is kept immaculately clean and the food and beverages are good value. Even if you don't like fast rides the lazy river is so relaxing and there were plenty of sunloungers so you could just spend the day soaking up the sun with your feet splashing in the lagoon. Our hotel was on the palm so the Atlantis waterpark was our closest option but I'm so glad we choose Wild Wadi, we would definitely return.

Best fun I've had in years!. Me and my family visited this park on the 17/02/2015.We had originally planned to go to Ferrari world, but it was about an hour and a half drive away, so we went to Wild Wadi instead, which was closer.The place has amazing slides and rides, but the one I recommend is the Jumeirah Sceirah. There was a long queue, but it was worth the wait. Basically, you stand inside what looks like an air-lock from a space ship, the floor beneath you drops and you go shooting down at supersonic speed! I only downside is that as you go down, water goes into your eyes and mouth, so you can't see or breath, but it doesn't last that long so (hopefully) you'll survive.Me and my family had a great time at this water park and I would be delighted to go again.

Love the new rides. This is the second time I have been here whilst with family in Dubai. The entrance fee is expensive, but it is an activity for the whole day, we managed to spend 8 hours there!. We used entertainer vouchers which made it more affordable.They have introduced some new rides and I really enjoyed all of the group rides, as a group aged 12-40 we all had a lot of fun. Having had an awful experience on the old Jumeirah Sceirah I was not convinced I wanted to try this time, however having been co-coerced by a 12 year old I gave it a go. Not for the claustrophobic as they shut you in a tube and then the floor comes out beneath you! A must for an adrenalin junkie but not for the faint hearted. The food prices are extortionate but its a captured market! A great day out for kids and big kids alike!

Water sports.. This is fun filled day for adults and kids alike. If you have a residents visa use that to get a discount. If you traveling and planning a few things in Dubai it is well worth your while to buy the entertainer, buy one get one free vouchers. The water and food is expensive in the water park but well worth it. Get there early to get a good spot.

needs a refurb. Not an awful day but not great not enough for a full day - overpriced needs to be rethemed and refurbed, tired
However lady on pizza stand great and her food excellent
Flow rider and master blaster good fun
go to atlantis instead

Endless Fun :) . If you are in dubai for vacation than u must visit it for a great fun and adventure day. Try to go early as soon as it opens so that you can enjoy all the rides as you will have to wait in long questions for your turn. Jumeirah sukera is a must try!

Much less hectic than the Atlantis. I planned to go to the Atlantis with my two daughters. When I arrived, the queues were insane. We, instead, headed to Wild Wadi. The "rides" were similar, yet with none of the craziness associated with the Atlantis. Perhaps it's a best kept secret?

To many extra costs. Went with my son for a days fun and relaxation. It is an impressive waterpark, but anything you need is at an extra cost on top of the relative steep entry fee, and that spoiled the experience

Still up there with the best parks. The oldest waterpark in Dubai is still a fantastic attraction. First, it's location is unbeatable. Wherever you live in town, you can get there within 25 minutes max and totally relax. Great fun with friends or family, no need to walk for ages between rides.

Lovely Trip out. Going to the Wild Wadi, is an adventure itself. It is best advised not to wait for the weekend unless you have no other choice.It is very compact, and the crown can be over whelming. The variety is good for the size of the property, and you can have a great day out.Be prepared to wait for major rides, as lines tends to stretch do the spiral stairs for a majority of the time. But lots of lazy rides available, and if you like wake boarding there is several wake boarding areas there.The restaurants tends to get very busy so be prepared to wait, and be sure not to for get your sun screen.Advisable to go later in the day or at the opening time, mid day sun tends to drain you out, and the place can get very humid around the mid afternoon time.Before summer, up to april to mid May is maybe the best time to go.A lovely family day out to have if planned right.
Amazing. Lots of exhilirating rides & adventure. Many option more than atlantis water park and rate is lower too. Good location nxt to Burj al Arab. Lifeguards are very attentive and friendly.

Excellent Day out. The ticket prices look a lot, but judge it against other similar parks or theme parks and it isnt too bad.It is a full day and some fab rides and fun to be had, it does cater well for all age groups. The food onsite it pretty good, varied and not badly priced.We would visit again and its a consideration that you get free access from the Jumeriah properties. that may sway me to stay in them next time.

Wish there were more excitement to do !. I had a nice time with friends there. I found nothing much exciting activities in this water park. It's huge and great for family & relaxing time between friends.

Big Fun for Every One. Its a very beautiful place to have Fun with your nears and dears. The slides are amazing and you will feel very comfortable moving around and enjoying the rides. The entry is free if you are staying in the Jumerah beach Hotel.

Starting to look dated but a great day out nonetheless. Not a cheap day out, and the food is mediocre but some of the rides are still pretty good. The 'biggy' is the Jumeirah Screimah, the ride where you drop down a chute into mental oblivion...not for the faint-hearted, as it is slightly claustrophobic...the queue is not fun and the ride is over in about 7 seconds...long enough for your life to flash before your eyes...Wild Wadi could now do with a makeover and it ain't cheap...
Amazing place for the family. It's a wonderful Elegent place suitable for all the family members, you can spend the whole day there, it's worth to visit , and good value for money.

Good to visit. Wald Wadi is a good waterpark. Slides are good, different levels, that can make the day of every family memeber. Nice kids area.There is very long slide for those who is lazy to climb up on the top for a ride. Bunch of emothions and quality pictures at the exit.There several cafes to have lunch - pasta, pizza, fresh fruits and refreshing cocktails, fast food and some mexican specialities.

Highly safe. The most important thing was attract me the very highly safety in the park, lifeguard in all areas, but the park small and limited games, not allowed to enter the park with food and beveragesPrice list with high:Above 1.1 meter 255 Dhsless 1.1 meter 195 Dhs

Be sure to enhjoy some fun in the sun. The best time to visit wild wadi is towards the later afternoon after the Asr Salaah (2 hours before sunset).the sun isnt at its peak and the weather is bearable. Be sure to take you own towels and some snacks in case you dont like whats on offer.

Nice park, not enough rides and journey home is a nightmare . We opted to go here rather than the Atlantis water park after seeing the negative reviews about waiting 1hr for a cab from the park to their hotel. The park itself is very clean and the rides they had were fun, the master blaster which is like a lazy river yet has "master blasters" which jet water underneath your inflatable ring and propel you upwards so it's great fun and lasts about 10min as it is 12 separate blasters connected. They had three other good rides in my opinion and that was it, the wave rider was shut and the wave pool was not good at all. I was disappointed that you were not allowed onto the beach so we ended up leaving at 3pm as we had done all the good rides to death. When leaving there was a queue of 50 people waiting to get a cab (which is normal at Dubai mall etc) yet at this water park they have not arranged for any taxis to pick up so we waited in line for 20min and only 3 taxi's arrived at the rank. I asked a staff member if there was a station nearby and he said there was one 10min walk away so we opted for that yet it actually took 30min to get there (3km distance I later worked out). The staff were very friendly yet next time I shall be going to the Atlantis hotel water park instead and take the monorail back to the city.

Fun for the whole family. Great place to have fun for a whole day with the family... especially if you have teens.Avoid weekends if possible as they are crowded and you could have to wait to get onto rides.Weekdays would be better... some of the more preferred activities like surfing could be tried to your hearts content without waiting for too long between rides.

Great especially if you get free entry with the hotel!. Free entry granted to guests of the Jumeirah beach. Wave pool (tiny waves) for kids and lots of rides for all ages. Great fun if you love waterparks (I'm not a huge fan) but did do the scariest rides I'm told and they were ok! White water rapids was great fun - lots of levels of rides so you can duck the scary ones adn go for the lazy river if you want. Lockers adn restaurants inside so can lock items away. On a busy day, I expect you'd need a day trip here but otherwise, you can probably satisfy yourselves in a few hours and then head to the beach. Loads of staff to help out and lots of life guards.

One of the best water parks. You will not forget your experinces in Wild Wadi, it is one of the best water parks I've ever been. It has so many attractions, surfing, sliding and much more and is really worth a visit, whether on your own or with children.
Great fun. Thrills and chills this has it all. Great place with more attractions and in close proximity to Burj Al Arab Whenever I go back I have to come back.

Decent. Lack numbers primarily because several of their slides are connected, so we only had to queue once to take them. After 3 hours, we pretty much covered everything we wanted to and didn't have interest in doing the same rides repeatedly - they either weren't that fun or the queue to do the was too long. Fun floating in the flood river, overturning others and getting smashed by the floods. I may be harsh in my rating because I've been to better water parks for less than half the price and kinda expected more from Dubai which has a reputation for overdoing everything.
The best water park. It's the best water park i have ever been to. The water rides are amazing. It's a water park where both adults & young ones can enjoy. Looking forward to visit again.
AMAZING. Its like being a kid all over again....Jumeirah Skeirah...I think i lost my heart....and most of my swimsuit on the way down but some of the best fun ive ever had in a waterpark

Good family fun but slightly expensive. Went with family ... Not a lot of options as I have seen with some of the other water parks but still Good fun ... Their in park shop is extremely expensive ... We forgot our sunscreen and ending up paying almost 100.00 Australian dollars for a 100 ml sunscreen ... Carrying own food is not allowed however you can take a bottle of water each

Wet and Wonderful. Went here many years ago with friends from work had a wonderful day enjoying the water slides lazying by the beach area on loungers and just swimming around.The park has slides a surfing experience and beach lagoonFound that prices for food and drink are above average.Cameras are not allowed and has lockers for storage of items and separate changing rooms as well on site
Very Exciting. Wild Wadi water park is very exciting place to visit with family. Water rides are very nice and visitors of every age enjoyed the park. It is full of adventure and fun.

Good fun - but quite small.. I liked it - especially the main water slide where the floor opens and you shoot down. Terrifying!The only issue is that its quite small and the queues can be quite long. Get there early to have a more enjoyable day.Food etc provided. All in all not a bad experience.

Fun Experience. Amazing place to visit with whole family. Its Fun. Its amazing. Its beautiful. One of the most attractive attraction one should visit whilst in Dubai. Staff is much more organized, helpful and professional
Amazing place during the summer. If you visit Dubai during the summer period, the see will be boiling. This park offers cool water together with amazing attractions and view on Burj al Arab.

Nice fun filled outing. Its been a while so I'm sure they must have added plenty more stuff. Its fun, wet, relaxing if you want it to be, enough to spend 2-3 hours away from the otherwise hot Dubai weather. You will like it.

Fun Fun and only Fun. U have been to Wild Wadi 3 times and it got better every time. I have been to Aquaventure as well but it wasn't that much fun. Wild Wadi is properly planned with activities for people of all age groups. It's a must go for water livers who are able to handle the thrill!

Great Waterpark. Our family of 4 and a friend enjoyed our day at Wild Wadi. We booked ahead and reserved a private cabana with Butler service. This worked out well because my daughter was only 3 months old, and we had a shaded place for her. The cabana also came with a fridge of complimentary drinks. We also had our own entrance to. The lazy river. We were escorted to the cabana from the front entrance. The Waterpark itself is very nice. A good section for young kids as well as all the big, thrill slides. Although it was an expensive day, it was quite enjoyable. We would definitely come back to Wild Wadi.

Could be better. Compared to the atlantis waterpark, this one is very small, but my kids had fun in wild wadi. The staff seemed not well informed, and sometimes some girl from Thailand ask my girl not to sit in the swimming pool, which is at least curious, because if you are in a pool, why you can not sit in the pool??? A few steps always, some guy, saída that was no problem to sit in the pool... This kind of thing. In general, They should invest. In trainning this people. At this time we have stayed in both water parks, but They still prefer the atlantis waterpark.

Fun time. I love that you can just jump on the rubber ring and go with the flow, relax and get your tan on! The slides were pretty cool too, but some of the queues just take forever! I would recommend going really early.When I got hungry there was unfortunately only pizzas and burgers and other greasy unhealthy stuff to eat. You can use vouchers to get into the water park, pay for one ticket and get one free;-)

wild and fun. Well we went with my friends kids, they realy enjoyed few hours. the weather was great and this place offfers so much fun. UI was jusytseating to have a drink and th ekids disapeared for two hours, looks lik ethey had great fun and we too,just looking at the crouds andthe setup.

Average and crowded. Great location and nice views of the Burj Al Arab, however it is a bit old and could do with a refurbishment specially in the changing rooms. It is much smaller that Aquaventure at Atlantis and therefore feels very crowded. Full of locals and overweight people flaunting their huge bellies. Once you have been to Atlantis there is no comparison Atlantis any time!!!!

water fun. fun for the whole family. The most attractive place to be in. Entrance a bit costly, but no waste of money at all for the whole day fun. Like much better than in atlantis. Much more organized, much more professional staff from entrance, much, more friendlier and helpful. Prefer to go to Wild Wadi than to Atlantis. Worth of spending the whole day there.

Still has plenty of splash appeal!. With Atlantis' waterpark attracting all the attention, Wild Wadi still offers great entertainment for the family.Newer rides have given it more appeal to our elder children (9,13) yet still has plenty to keep our youngest (2) enjoying her time.Would recommend for families with younger children.

Nothing special and overpriced. We decided to pay the sky-high entrence fee after reading through the comments below. We were disappointed to say the least. The park was crowded and there were few activites and bad dining options. I'am afraid you can find much better water parks in places like Florida and Tenerife.

Lots of fun for the whole day. Entry into the park is quite expensive but it is worth your while if you are able to make a day of it. The rides are good and the life savers are plentiful and are mostly friendly and polite. The food inside is expensive and is really nothing better than cafeteria food, I would recommend that the park management pays attention to this as it will make the experience so much better.

Even good for old cogers. I have been holidaying in Dubai for 15 years and seen many changes but always take our family here they have tried the Atlantas and other water parks, but always love this one the best , the first thing they say is came we go oh please oh please, they even get me to go on and I am in my 60s it is a real treat something your children or grandchildren will never forget go on give it a try
Brilliant day out. Enjoyed spending a few hours here over the week we spent at the Dar. The girls thoroughly enjoyed their time here. Life guards on duty at all times.
Such fun!. Wild Wadi is one of the best water parks I've ever been to. It has so many attractions and is really worth a visit, whether on your own or with children.
Awesome experience. It was an awesome experience.The time to visit this place is best in jan-feb period as it is not very hot.The queue for ticket also moved fast.Overall great experience
Brilliant. Lovely water park... Kids totally loved it as well. a must if your going to be in the area... Cools you down in the heat and alot to do for the kids....

One of the best Experience. Its safe, its amazing, The Best is the word, as good as the view, the food, the services, the venue, cleanliness, the parking area of the hotel, The privacy offered, al fresco seating the suggestions and hospitality of the servers, met all the international standards . One must go while you are Dubai.
wonderful. It was a special visit to this place, it's very beautiful place, and you can enjoy water adventures, relax or swim.

Really good fun. It's really good fun here, lots of different rides and definitely enough to keep you entertained all day. Kids especially loved the surf rides, can get busy in afternoon with queues for the rides though so go early to be sure to get on the busier ones.
Good but little expensive. We are coming in Dubai every two years from 2004. It is always pleasure to go with children there.Al-dough in January is little bit cold water.

Still charming. My second trip to wild wadi, the first being many years ago. Jumeriah sceriah is not to be missed. Thrilling. Some of the blasters seem a little less powerful than previously. Great fun for kids
great place especially if you are a big kid or have kids!. a great place to go for either a full day or half a day. we went there early evening as it was cooler. fantastic fun!

Good... But worth the money??. We really enjoyed this water park but we paid 250 dirham each (£50) for entry, 35 dirham (£7) for a locker higher!!! And 100 dirham (£20) for 2 meals. The rides were great... But not 635 dirham (£127) great.... £127 for 2 people to go to a water park for the day!
Great fun. Great fun, lots of rides for everyone. Great view of Burj, good for pictures. lean, lots of beds available, definitely worth a visit.

Fantastic Water Fun!. We went there in the morning of January 2, 2015. There were several fun rides and our kids loved this water park. The weather was 24c but the pool water was warm. It's better to be there in the morning because the queues start getting long after 1 pm.
one of the Best water parks in the world.... It is one of the best water park park I have ever seen..!!!!! Thrilling rides, entertainments all makes us happy to go again and again.,...
Awesome family fun. This water park is super fun for the entire family. The resort is well maintained and really imaculate. Lots of fun water rides that the whole family can enjoy together.

Surprisingly Fun Water Park. The water park was well designed to keep you moving. Several of the rides shot you up a series of inclines before moving you around the park through a series of turns. The higher attractions had automatic tube feeders so you aren't carrying up tubes on the stairs. The highest attraction was just scary enough to get your heart pounding before the big drop.
Amazing. I love this place, whether you go with kids or friends, u will have a lot of fun for a splashy day to remember, highly recommended

Exciting and fun. Wild Wadi can be a good opportunity for enjoying your time with friends.Great view of Burj Al Arab.Plan your trip during weekdays to avoid standing for long in queues. We had memorable experience.

fab!!. Had a brilliant day, the place is so clean and well lookwed after. Well worth it! We went the second week in January so the place wasn't too busy so the kids went off to play and I found a sunbed and relaxed!

Fantastic Family Fun. An amazing time was had by all. It felt like we were all little kids again. Seeing our kids having so much fun and the rides were fantastic. Would definately recommend it. Great food and the staff all had the biggest smiles. We would love to come back again one day.
good for children. rides = average. but good to spend time with family in wild wadi.. changing rooms are available. not recommended in public holidays as it becomes too crowded.

Best place to visit in any weather!. I've visited Wild Wadi in summer and winter and I 've always enjoyed and have the best time, they've the best water rides! Love love love Wild Wadi! I Always have recommended all my tourist and local friends to visit Wild Wadi!
-A happy customer!

Great Park. We got free tickets as we stayed at a Jumeirah hotel... well all family enjoyed ... though you can find better parks but the idea was to have fun and we did have our share...Good concept and safe place for children to enjoy. Some rides have minimum height restrictions. I guess its four feet. Check the park website for detaols.
Good place. It is a good place but the weather doesn't permit one to have fun. The rides and activities are good and the food at the restaurants is delicious. Avoid in summer!
Good place. Wild Wadi is a really good place to visit, the water activities are quite amazing and will definately come back.

Wild Wadi is closed during January. Please note this waterpark is closed, as per their website"Wild Wadi Waterpark is planning its annual maintenance programme and the entire park will be closed from 11 January 2015 till 11 February 2015 inclusively. Wild Wadi will open its doors again to the public on 12 February 2015."We booked our holiday in March 2014 and there was no mention of this waterpark being closed. Even in November when I checked the entry prices, I don't recall seeing this information, although we had already booked out holiday so nothing we could do at this point.We purposely booked six days in Dubai to go to the waterparks with our children and have found the two major ones are both conducting maintenance at the same time. Why would they not talk to each other and conduct maintenance at separate times, then taking full advantage of all the customers.This has put a very sour taste in my mouth about re visiting Dubai, because realistically why else would I visit if I can't take the kids to the waterparks.
good times worth a lot. lovely water park.Large enough, very attractive games , good restaurants and pools. Despite being expensive but it deserves that. avoid summer times to be safe

Adventurous...Daring events. A theme park not to be missed if you are in Dubai. Jumeirah Sceirah, one of the best rides i have encountered in a theme park. The moment the floor beneath you opens and start down-sliding, u realize that this is the kind of adventure you always have been waiting for.

Fun in the dubai sun. The park was amazing , full of attractions for kids and even adults . You could honestly spend days there it's so good , the staff are so helpful as my sister who was 5 years old walked over the wooden planks to get to a ride and got about 10 sprinters in her foot at they were so kind and took them all out ... Also remember to wear sandles . Soft loungers for adults and they make candy floss faces of your self . Enjoy and certainly go .

Not dissapointing at all. You will expect what you are told in their website, amazing water slides, and on a weekday less rush and more fun...friendly life guards and an amazing environment to enjoy, the water is not that cold, luke warm so no one gets troubled jumping into the slides :)

Great but stolen shoes!. My boyfriend at the time and I visited back in 2011. We loved the attractions and everything was perfect apart from the fact that my boyfriends shoes were stolen which meant he had to buy new ones... Apart from that, everything was amazing!

great fun. A great place to go with the whole family, my teenage kids loved it especially the thrill rides and I could have floated round the lazy river all day. It isn't cheap but 'par for the course' in Dubai. If you are staying in the Jumeirah beach hotel, you get free entrance to the water park. We have been several times and I would certainly go again.
Claims to be much more than what it is.... This place is nice for a visit but please do not expect more than just 3-4 nice rides and 1-2 relaxing attraction.

A lot of fun, even for grown-ups. The water park is an expensive visit however the attraction is second to none when it comes to thrills and spills. The park has a large slide which takes riders all the way around the park (even up hill). The flow rider is an artificial wave which I would only recommend for experienced surfers (falling off hurts) and is worth the line up.

Enjoyable. If you are interested in sea activities especially water parks, Wild Wadi can be a good opportunity for enjoying your time with your family. Wild Wadi is one of the largest and most attractive water parks in the world. It has a great view of Burj Al Arab. Actually, there are some good activities there. For example, Surfing machine, wave pool, water slides, tall water fall and some others. In addition, there are some restaurants there. The entrance fee is 250 AED per adult. If you wanna go to Wild Wadi I recommend you be there from opening time at 10. Moreover, you can try the other one water park in Dubai that called Adventure in Atlantis hotel or Yas water park, but the last one is in Abu Dhzabi, a little far from Dubai.

Expensive. If you've been to Wet & Wild in Orlando this place will be a disappointment. There aren't many slides and it can be experienced in half a day.
