However, there was one slide very different to anything I'd experienced called the White Water Wadi ride. It is split into several sections (so make sure you get on it at the beginning) and you can either go in your own tube or with someone else in a double tube and it is like being on a roller coaster as it propels you up the slide before whizzing you round the chutes. I couldn't stop laughing the whole way round.Entrance, locker, food and photos are all expensive but having said that, the food was cooked fresh (we had a BBQ) and there were plenty of lifeguards about. More showers need to be installed (a school trip happened to be leaving the same time and took up the whole changing area).

3 - 2 - 1. Brilliant, not for solo riders.Try all the rides and in one particular it is written see the ride for yourself and decide.Too thrillingSaved a great deal with entertainer, carry your own swim wear.My take, do all the rides first, then take our phone or camera afterwards for photos.Again the scam of taking photos by there executives and selling at premium.No Hidden charges, food is priced steep.Anyways no point in eating there before going.Helpful staff and in abundance, designated smoking areas

Great Fun... Visit with Friends.... If you are touring Dubai with friends, then this should be a must do activity.Great fun not so crowded, wait time was maximum 15 min for some rides... staff were friendly.All the rides and slides were great, especially Jumeirah Sceirah & burj surj. Heavy discount if you have people with UAE resident cards in your group. Their wave pool is one of the best i've visited. Overall a best place to spend half a day with friends.General Tip:1. Carry your own swim wear, they do sell but at very high price.2. Also get water proof pouches for your phones from outside if you are going to snap pictures, i had to pay 120 AED just for the cover in the park.
Defo one for the kids!. Brilliant big water park with fun for all the family. The wave riders are the best, and my 23 year old, water obsessed boyfriend spent the whole time here!

Great place, specially for children. loved the rides in the park .. not to scary for all even the rides they say are scary (other than Screiah) are mostly easy to do even for kids my 5 year plus daughter attempted nearly all the rides there. the area was clean and adequate deck chairs were available. the kids area was very interesting as my daughter absolutly loved it.

Great fun and not too busy. . We have previously been to Aquaventure at Atlantis and enjoyed it and thought we'd try Wild Wadi at the Burj Al Arab this time. It is as good if not better, than Aquaventure and this was perhaps because it was less busy. The parks are very similar, with Lazy River rides through to white knuckle rides, but Wild Wadi felt more compact and the maximum queue time for the "top" rides was only 15 mins. The food courts and gift shops were reasonably priced and we got the daily deal on ticket prices which included a towel, locker and shower gel etc. All in all a really great day. The one issue was the lack of taxis when the park closed. We were waiting an hour and a half before the staff tried to sort it out. No taxis were available so Wild Wadi provided a coach to take people to the Mall of the Emirates where there were taxis available. Made the journey home very long and tedious.

Scary rides!. Loved most of the park found the rides a bit frightening but the kids loved it! Good food outlets nice shop whole place spotlessly clean, loads of sun beds and pool side chairs.A great day out excellent value for money and well worth going to see.
Premji K Bhudia. World's best water park to visit where you also find people from all cultures in the world visiting to have fun. Most amazing place to be in dubai
Great fun, little rides. It was a good fun experience but the issue is that only 2 rides are interesting and fun while the rest are not so much appealing

Wild Wadi. Kids and adults paradise. It has many slides, lazy rivers, etc for all ages. We really had a fabulous day there. I tried most of the slides and all of them were fun and enjoyment. The Jumeirah one(the scary one) is good adrenaline :). The food is normal for this kind of place(burgers, pizza, salads, etc). As were guests at Mina we didnt need to pay, but I think the entrance is about 60-70 Euros which I think its a bit too much.Anyway, its a good fun day. Go and enjoy.

Exciting and great fun. Fantastic family day out an absolute must when in Dubai. The rides are for all ages and being a swimmer is not essential. Kiddies play area also good fun. Plenty of sun loungers to relax and good food and snacks.

Fun day out for all. I love this place! I have been visiting my dad for 3 weeks in Dubai and in that time I have been to wild wadi 4 times! Absolutely love the place.. A great day out for all (Even my 83 year old grandad!) The staff are so friendly, the sights are fantastic and the slides and pool are second to none! Definitely good value for money!

Amazing Experience. One of the best water parks I have ever been to. We enjoyed all the rides in the park, some of them multiple times. Plan your trip during weekdays to avoid standing for long in queues. We were lucky enough to not wait for more than 8-10mins for any ride.The park is organized very well with enough food joints and places to relax. Maps are located at various places to help visitors find their choice of rides. Plenty of life guards available in the park at every place to prevent any sort of mishap....it really makes you feely very safe and comfortable.There is even a very special play area for children next to the wave pool.Jumeirah Sceirah is the most frightening ride of all but you should definitely give it a shot.I also liked the wrist band concept which can be recharged with any amount of money which can be used to pay for the locker rent or any eatables. It also acts as the key for the locker.Definitely worth a visit.

Great family fun day.. We were curious to visit Wild Wadi after visiting Atlantis and wondered if it could match or surpass the fund we had had at Atlantis. We had a great day at wild Wadi, we really enjoyed it and what is great about Wild Wadi is that the rides are closer together than Atlantis. The queues are relatively short and the lifeguards are friendly with a sense of humour. I did't get a chance to have a go at the surfing wave but I appreciated the variety of rides Wild Wadi has to offer and the rapids travel almost the whole perimeter of the park. One of the rides makes your heart miss a beat when it swivels out over the main road where the cars are passing by, but great fun all the same. Its definitely worth spending one of your days here to keep cool while having great fun at the same time. Well recommended!

Great place for familys. Such a good day out, so many different things to do. The slides are amazing, loads to choose from some a lot scarier than others! Would definitely recommend it, even if to just float along the lazy river all day!

We had a great time here as a family!. Loved the freefall slide, kids enjoyed it a lot, would go again 😍😀☀️🍭🏊🍹😈 weather was nice and hot, not too much waiting for rides! Great views of Dubai ! We def got sunburnt!

Fantastic. This was great fun and I had more fun that the kids. I have gone in the morning and evening and would highly recommend the eveing more as you can walk around easier without the heat. Tantrum alley and the Jumeirah Sceirah are a must if you don't have a weak heart.

Unhelpful staff, complicated payment system. Very busy and staff failed to explain that we had to put money on a card to use for food and drink around the park. I've been to better waterparks, very big and rides quite far apart which can be a problem when you have to leave your flip flops somewhere.

wild wadi is great. a great experience for all the family. An array of different rides including a lazy river and a flow rider. there is something for everyone whether it is a toddler or an adult. There is also lots of sunbathing spots. Meals are decent for the price and very exhilarating. Wouldn't think twice about going back. Can be quite expensive but worth it because it will be a jam packed day.

Excitement with a lacking flair. Oh the slides are wonderful and children are bound to have a fun and exciting experience. As most theme parks no where to have a healthy snack other than watermelon being the only option. Beware of the photo trap,approx 10/12 beautiful options are available but 100 dirhams for one is extortion. If these were reasonably priced or size options available perhaps more than one photo would be purchased. In a world where choice is abundant - surely this should be noted? We thought The plastic keyring which was substantially smaller - would be a cheaper option, alas...no ... 100 dirhams.

Expensive but lots of fun. We spent an afternoon at the Wild Wadi and enjoyed great rides, a fish pedicure, and plenty of available sun beds to drop off our towels and bags. There were a variety of rides from gentle (lazy river style), family and dare devil so this place suited everyone. Enjoyed watching the surfing challenge which was very entertaining. On the down side this was a very expensive activity, the food available in the park was very basic fast food and no drinks or food of your own were allowed into the venue. There were also fewer toilets than was convenient.

A fun packed day with great rides. We love going to Wild Wadi - fabulous rides, courteous and friendly staff and spotless amenities. Suitable for all ages, there are many attentive lifeguards on hand to ensure your safety. Our particular favourite rides are the Blasters, the flow riders as well as Tantrum Alley. For the more courageous, try Jumeirah Sceirah, a huge waterslide starting with a vertical drop.

Can be Expensive but worth t!. Myself, my husband and our family (consisting of 2 daughters, one of my daughters husband and 4 grandchildren whose age range is 8, 6,4 and 2.5) visited the Wild Wadi during Christmas week. we booked and prepaid in advance plus we paid for a Cabana. The Cabana is pricey but we arrived at 09:45 and left at about 17:30 so we made good use of it as we had an area where the little one could sleep, I could lounge as I'm not keen on all the rides and there were rides / amusements to suit everyone, plus our wadi helper took our order for food and delivered it to the Cabana. The Cabana also came with 4 loungers, towels for everyone and shade.

Great place !!!!!. I heard that this water park was not as good as Atlantis. Make no mistake maybe Atlantis has the edge as the set up is amazing. Wild Waddy is a fun place to be and caters for all ages with crazy rides and chill out rides. Worth a visit.

Great day out. I loved Wild Wadi and it was my favourite water park in the Emirates. The trick is to go when it is not super busy. The rides are great fun and my kids miss the old Jumeirah Sceirah, despite being so petrified when they went down it that both of them were in floods of tears at the bottom. I was petrified WATCHING them from the top. I though my superskinny son was going to fly off it. Terrifying. The new one is a vast improvement in safety! We had a great time every time we went there. You will too. It is better than Aquaventure!

Fantastic rides for all the family. Brilliant water park rides for all the family great if you like some rides with the thrill factor ,we hired a cabana which was excellent 4 sun lounges eight towels and a fridge full of cold soft drinks table and chairs and a large seat as well, right next to the lazy river ,all this comes on a separate space over a bridge with a butler (not my words the parks) this is next to lazy river so our daughter (11yrs) could go off on it and come back round to us again .This area is only for cabana holders and nobody else is allowed to get out here there is a lifeguard stoping them , when we were hunger our butler came and took the food order and went to all the different food outlets to get what ever we wanted just pay at the end of the day as our daughter was older we only went on the fast rides number 1 ride had exclusive access and VIP queue jump for cabana holders ,don't no about the rides for small children this is a great park and would recommend this as a full day out for a family park closed at 6 as it was december i think it closes at 8 in summer

not as good as i wait...... we paid around 50euro entrance and was full so we didn't found sunbets to have secure space for our bags...there are some fantastic riders but u have to wait long time to enjoy them..
Awesome slides - expensive though. A must do: Wild Wadi Sceirah - I've seen 3 people coming out and vomit! It was awesome!!! Great thrill

A Great Place For Adults And Kids. My husband and I took our 10 year old son yesterday, and we had a great time. We saw people constantly walking around and cleaning the park. Every staff member we came into contact with was friendly and courteous. When we ordered our food someone brought it to us. When we were on a ride we were greeted enthusiastically with a "Hello" or "Happy New Year!" We were approached while we were looking at a park map and pointed in the right direction. We never really had to wait in any lines either. However, we did get there fairly early. Having said all of this I do wish they had a few more rides, but the rides they do have are fantastic. We will definitely visit again!

Expensive but you are in Dubai. Enjoyed our visit to wild wadi although it cost around £50 each entrance fee, facilities were clean and family friendly. Plenty of parasols to stay under the shade. Kids had a memorable experiance.

Great Place for Young Family. We went on the 30/12, just me and my 3 year old boy, who is a pretty good swimmer. We were contemplating Yas, Atlantis or Wild Wadi, and choose Wild wadi because we thought it would suit younger children better than older children, and I think we were right. And we were staying closer.My boy did every ride he was allowed to ride on (and one he wasn't allowed on lol) and had a ball. We got there at 11am and got in quick, we got a locker, and 10 minutes later we were in the first of many fun moments of the day. I could see why it wouldn't be so great for older children/Tweens/teens, but at this age there was enough variety to create some great memories. We chose a couple of digital photos as well, not cheap, but I expected to pay.We only has two downsides; the wait for a taxi was 45 minutes at 4pm, even though there was an option for a free bus to MOE, which cut the taxi queue a little. Second was the hot food available. A disgrace. 15 minutes to queue to order and a 25 minute wait for crap, but it was kind of expected.Apart from those two downsides a great day for me and my son, which he is still talking about. Staff were very, very friendly towards us, congratulations.

Not as good as the atlantis but does the job. When you do both parks you get more of a feeling of space at the atlantis with young kids as well it feels a lot safer in the other park, this is not to say that you won't have fun and if you have not been to the atlantis one you will think this one is fantastic as it has some good rides, to us it just felt a bit clustered.

Great day spent in Dubai!. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Wild Wadi. I have a 9, 11 and 13 year old. They would like to rate the park 5 out of 5. They had so much fun on the slides, lazy river, splash park and flo rider. We spent 6 hours here and could have spent way longer. Only reason we stopped was the park was closing for the day. I am super impressed with the lifeguards around the park, they are vigilant and friendly. On two occasions. I saw two lifeguards jump in to help children. In one instance, the parents were too busy taking photos and were not watching their children. A small infant toppled over the life guard did not hesitate to jump in from afar and help the baby. They talked to this same couple several times to watch their infant and pleaded with them to keep a close eye on the infant. The only reason I am not giving this park a 5 out of 5 is the lack of bathrooms. We had to walk a long way from the wave pool to use the rest room and I also saw several people wearing inappropriate swimwear for the pool. 10 year old in street clothes and adults in jeans. This could be a great facility if they sharpened up on attire.

Good day out but get there early. Entertainer Vouchers can be used!. Park opened at 10. We were there by 9.30, parked the car and were 2nd in line to buy the tickets.We had the Entertainer Vouchers, so paid for 3 and also got the large locker.You can also load credit onto your wrist band to pay for food etc - this is refundable.The doors opened at 10, legged it to the changing room and were out by 10.10. Then found some decks chairs near 'Slide 1' and left our towels there.First ride was Jumeirah Sceirah - did this twice as no queue.Then did the slides (starting at 1), all interconnecting. THis was bloody awesomeThen Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley both twice.Then the 2 surfing thingsBy this time it was 12 and had done most of the rides. So chilled in the wave water area for about an hour and decided to call it a day around 1.30

great fun for the kids and parents (if you ever get the chance). The children had a fantastic time at wild wadi, only downside is that most of their time was spent around the swimming pool as they are too young to go on most rides. Its great fun if you go without children as you will be able to go and all the rides. Our kids are 5 & 7 and we had an 8month old baby so we were limited for choice, when the kids are at least 10years old, it's much more fun for everyone. The food was good too and price was right.In all, for the amount you pay to enter and the fun the kids had, it's not a bad deal.

Water in the sun is always fun. a great way to enjoy water in the sun, attached to Jumeirah beach hotel and open to anyone that pays.Floating rings on the lazy river take you around the whole park, slides and fun walkways.Go for it!

Closest water park. Wild wadi is the closest water park if you're staying in Dubai, if you are big on adrenaline rush and advanced rides then I would recommend you look further as wild wadi would be more appropriate for families as it has very limited advanced rides.

So much fun!m. Went on most things here was so fun he flames were great and so uplifting! The fact it's so hot makes it the great olacesp to go for the day and chill out literally! I was loving the way they make it rain in the outside area and played thunder noises through speakers!mjustbwhat u need every now and again to cool off!

Fun for family - especially if staying at nearby jumireh hotels.. Small but fun park. Kids had great time. No lines even during busy season. The slide where the floor drops out is awesome. So it the one where you go uphill.

Adventerous!!. If you are visiting Dubai and enjoy Water Parks, then Wild Wadi is a must visit! The slides are superb, specially Jumeriah Sceriah! I was wondering why no one was screaming during the ride. I guessed it must not be that scary it seems like. But when i experienced it, i realised that no one screamed since you would be in a state of shock! :D. It is a ride best experienced.Also, the anti gravity ride is a unique concept and enjoyable. Other rides apart from these two are also good.Food is affordable and delicious.Only thing I felt lacking was few more rides. As such, the entire water park has around 3 major rides and few other rides. I only wished there were more variety of rides.But overall, it was a memorable experience and I defintely recommend a visit.

Double wows for the view and food. The park is really big and really awesome place to hang out in Dubai. It was very big and contained a very long slide which was really fun, But only had like 5 slides which means we had to go on the same slide over and over again. The view on the slide is unbelievable the view of burj al arab and jumeirah beach hotel is unforgettable. The staffs were really friendly and really nicce <3. The food was restaurant quality and so many things to enjoy and to see.

Like every amusement park. I have read the reviews here which say that this park is absolutely fantastic. It is a good park with good water rides, no complaints about that. It is also true that there are lifeguards everywhere so it is pretty safe. Although the guy we saw with a giant bruise on his chest and chin plus bleeding from the mouth would probably disagree. We don't know what happened but parks always have some danger to them. When you get out of the water you get really cold quickly and there are like 5 changing rooms for a zillion people. There is a dryer cabin which would have been fantastic if it wouldn't have been out of order. A locker will set you back 35 AED and it's 250 AED per person to get in. We got in for free as we stayed in the Dar Al Masyaf but still had to pay for the locker. My wife said only one toilet was working so a long wait to finally have some relief. The rides are great but the experience on a whole was pretty simular to other parks, expensive, long waits, numb staff and no comfort.

Best Water Theme Park. Love the thrill slides!!! Be there early, as it gets later, the place gets real crowded. The queue were not too long as we went there during a weekday, the staffs were telling us, the weekend are crazy. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Must visit when you in Dubai!
excellent get there early. really fun but get there early to avoid the cues. Popcorn was well nice really clean and very helpful staff.
Amazing. One of the best water parks that I have ever visited in my entire life. I had a lot of fun with my family members as well as my friends

The dogs bollox. As all British people know the "dogs bollox" or DB's means brilliant.This water park is just great! I took my entire family, including grand kids, and we had a great day. There is a fantastic infant and junior water area and many fast and furious and meandering rides. Great for every age. There are also may park assistance in the infant and junior area which gives great peace of mind.Plenary to eat and dring for all food type. Get there early for value for money.100%
Eye opener for the kids. Very clean safe and friendly - kids had an absolute blast - felt very comfortable to let my young kids run around freely. Lifeguards and W.W. personel everywhere.

Fun park for the family. Super rides for kids (and adults) of all ages. Enough rides to keep it entertaining with some outstanding rides we did over and over again ... and great rides for the thrill seekers
No adrenaline rush. The entrance is very expensive and not worth it! Good that we had the Entertainer voucher. We stayed in wild wadi for 2 hours. No adrenaline rush, games are boring.

A fun day out. Wild Wadi - a water park in the UAE is nothing short of incredible. When we arrived we walked up to the counter and asked for a discount as we are UAE residents (show your Emirates ID) and we were promptly given a cheaper rate as well as tickets for lunch. Great start.This really is somewhere that you can go and have fun with friends, family or even a couple looking to do something different. On the day that I went the lines were short and we could keep going until we were tired. This ended up being a whole day visit.To make the most of Wild Wadi, I really suggest having a Go-Pro/Underwater case for your smart phone because there is lots of fun to be had having this too.Great fun and remember - locals get a discount.

Splash in the City. Wild Wadi is one of my favorite place to splash and enjoy the Dubai sun! Located in Dubai just in front of Burj al Arab its like having two awesome attractions in one! Very good for kids, couples and groups to visit all year round. Its an amazing place to bring your visiting friends or relatives where you'll guarantee fun, great venue and more more fun!

Public transportation. The cheapest way to go to by public transportation is through train and cab.Go down in Sharaf DG metro station. Hail a cab.Tell the driver that you are going to Wild Wadi. (Every cab driver knows the place)

Good in the morning. It's a lovely place with friendly staff. The rides where all fun and exciting. Lovely day out for the family. The only bad thing for me was how full it gets as the day progresses. It get to full and you wait a long time to get on a ride/slide.

A must go for family. The water theme park has slides that range for all age groups. It is a fantastic park! But because this is a complimentary to the hotel stay, otherwise the entrance fees may be a bit towards the steep side.The park provides a watch like band as an entry proof where you could pre-stored money value for locker and food/drinks. The locker was small, so travel light or without valuables unless you have someone seated there to look after. The food was simple comfort food. However it was disappointing to know that when my 8-year old asked for an extra serving of the sauce for his food, he was told that he needed to pay extra 2 dirham, though not much but this was unexpected.A few life guards were unfriendly. But there were helpful ones too, eg at the surfing of wave station and the scary twin slides. Other than these this park is a must go when you go visit Dubai.

lots of fun. this was an amazing place to come with your family or friends. there were thrilling and breathtaking rides and calm and relaxing slides. many places to eat and the position of this water park is fab. plus there are many pools including the wave pool. and i loved the flow rider.

Fun water park with caring staff. We got free entry to Wild Wadi as hotel guests at Dar Al Masyaf. Really had a fun day. We went as soon as it was open so there were not many people at all. I booked the private cabana for AED 1500. Not sure if it was money well spent though. We enjoyed just being able to hop up from the river directly to our cabana for a rest between rides. However the park was relatively quiet throughout the day so we didn't really benefit from the fast pass to the White Water Wadi rides which was one of the main reason we paid for the cabana. Apparently the soft drinks in the fridge were also included which we only found out when we checked out of the cabana. As to the rides, all are fun and as expected in a water park. What I found most amusing was that Burj Al Arab often popped into my view while I was twisted and turned in the water rides. A very funny way to "enjoy" the view of the landmark!I was also very touched when a passing by staff asked if I was alright when I was feeling sick after doing so many rides (after a big breakfast). It was nice to see caring staff in the park.The river connecting the rides were flowing rather slowly (a bit boring) so most of the people got off the tube and just walked or swam.The good thing is there are so many tubes available at the beginning points of the rides so you don't have to carry the tube yourself, unlike Aquaventure at Atlantis where you have to carry the tube with you to do most of the rides.

Great fun!!!. Had complimentary tickets from our hotel (Jameirah Zabeel Saray) so saved a bit of money!!!Free shuttle from hotel too!!Got there about 1030 no queues at all in fact pretty quiet all day which was fab. Went on all the rides etc except the Jameirah Scarer was a bit worried about that one lol. Really clean & staff very very helpful. Great wristband system for lockers & money. Had a great couple of hours with the wife had such a laugh highly recommend guess it gets very busy during peak times but it was very quiet for us.

Cheaper & better value attraction elsewhere. Been to Goldcoast (Seaworld) and Adventure Cove Sentosa (Singapore) Disney Paris & Tokyo and I did not have exorbitantly high price like I had to at Wild Wadi. Never am I coming back again!
One of the best water theme parks. Second best water theme park to Aquaventure. Had a great time here and tried fish massage the first time. Amazing ride and good to spend half a day.
Best and best. Friendly staff long rides. Even you ride Same one twice its fun. I'll come back again for sure because it has some thing than other places that i can't understand.

A great 2-3 hours of fun for us grown-up kids!. We had complimentary access as Madinat Jumeriah guests and were keen to try out Wild Wadi. It was certainly good fun: we went on a Monday when the park was quite quiet - there were no queues for any of the attractions. We tried everything at least once and went on a couple of the attractions twice and had a great time. End-to-end, we probably spent less than 3 hours there and that was ample. I don't think that I want to go when it's very busy: I got a sense that you could queue for >15 minutes for some of the rides.

Great place to take the kids. Although a little tired, we really love wild wadi! Like most things in Dubai, it is very expensive! The rides are good, and the food is relatively cheap. We go every time we visit Dubai!

Wild Wadi.... Great Escape in the midst of Dubai. Got to Wild Wadi on a chilly morning with my friends egging me on. The tiredness of Thursday Night vanished as soon as I touched water. The rides are plenty and good. After sometime I found some of them repetitive . Overall a good experience. Hope they have lesser Life guards around.. sometimes get too obstructive . But opinions are like ....... , everyone has one. One of the best things , it maintained very well and clean to boost.

Very clean and fun for all ages.. We had the Wild Wadi included in the cost of our hotel and I didn't see what it cost to get in so I can't comment on value for money. The park is very clean, not once did I see an old plaster or others people hair like in many European water parks I have visited. The park is fun for all ages, we went as a group of adults and had a great time. We were in the park for about 3 hours and this was enough time to do all the adult slides a couple of times each although the park was quite empty that day so never had to queue. It is well worth a visit and a great way to cool off in the Dubai heat!
Great Water Park!. A lot of rides, and if you book at any hotel from the Jumeirah group you have free access. The staff is kind and will help you.

A fun day for the whole family. What is special about Wild Wadi compared to other Water parks is for me:There are life guards everywhere. In the wave pool, at the corner of each slide etc. No danger to get hurt also for kids!In our real the towels were included as well and I liked to have not carry them there and need to watch it.The only thing I didn't like was the waiting time for a taxi of 30 min in the evening when we left Wild Wadi.
my first waterpark. Great day out with friends, good variety of rides from the group ones to surfboarding. Something for everyone, would love to go again.

Superb Water theme Park just below Burj al arab. amazing water theme park witha very limited but extra ordinary rides, the ones which has to be tried is the death fall which si a near to 90 degree fall with a sudden jerk jump ,men are supposed to wear polyester clothing in these rides,one day of week is booked for ladies food is not allowed inside you have ample areas to have food although its expensive

What a pleasant water treat :). Amazing establishment. Very safe with staff at every 10 feet keeping a close eye on everyone who needs them.Slightly expensive but worth the trip with the kind of rides and facilities offered. Must go for families!P.S. Wild Wadi Waterpark is planning its annual maintenance programme and the entire park will be closed from 11 January 2015 till 11 February 2015 inclusively.

Fun!. Wild Wadi Water Park is the best way to cool off with all the waters. If you can, don't go alone. Go there with friends or family. You will all have fun. It is a little bit expensive for a backpacker but you will enjoy it. And please don't rush. Take your time and enjoy. And you can see the Burj Al Arab since they are next to each other.

Wildest wadi. My best fun during our dubai visit. It just took the passage of time away. Itw as fun at every corner. The water pool, the water rides, the drops and the food.It was a pleasurable experience. If you are in dubai, you should visit wild wadi..and yes, It gives you one of the closest look at Burj Al Arab.

We love this park. Have been many times when staying at Jumeirah properties. We usually head in late in the day for a couple of hours. We have been on all the slides. Think the park could do with a bit of a tidy up and revamp. Sometimes the oaths and stairs can get very slippery at the end of the day.

A great waterpark to escape the heat. Wild Wadi Waterpark is an excellent place to spend the day to cool off in the heat. The rides were fun, lines were short, and there was a great balance of water attractions to fit people of all ages and physical abilities. The electronic payment and account system, makes purchasing lockers, food, water and other things a breeze. Staff were really friendly and helpful too.A shame the lazy river was quite short, prices for food and merchandise were exuberant to say the least. But overall I really enjoyed my time.

Compact but Fun. My last trip to this park was in 2003, and we found it almost the same after a gap of 10 years. Yes, the rides are fun but the best part was the assisting staff. People like me who get scared with even baby rides, were made comfortable by the friendly lifeguards. As the park map propagated the staff consisted of some 34 nationalities, and every one of them that we encountered were polite and helpful. We got stuck during the ride on Master Blasters and the lifeguard was very comforting and nice in helping us out from the slide. Jumeirah Sceirah was the star ride and there was a queue going up five floors, but the wait was well worth it. Food was average with not much choice but that’s how it is in most parks. On the way back, there was a complimentary shuttle service to Mall of Emirates, don’t know that was routine or seasonal, which we took and then from the Mall of E took the metro to our hotel.

A must visit for family fun. A great water park. clean, plenty of life gaurds on duty. A must do for all children and adults alike albuit a little over priced. It's not too over crowed like Atlantis so would. Recommend this park over it.
Love it . This place is fantastic rides like jemeirah scarah and white water wadi were amazingly fantastical marvellous

Awesome!. The most awesome place I've ever seen!! The water is sooo clean & blue. Staff are friendly, many activities to do for all ages. Rides are amazing! The view from inside is stunning you can see the blue sea and burj al arab. You can Sun bay and relax or relax in the water. Underwater photos are taken by staff & on rides. You get a wrist band which you can top up and use to buy good or drink so you would not need to return to you locker!! Clever hey.. I would deffinately be visiting this place!!

Very Cool and Great Fun. Go with friends and/or family and have a really great time. There a is great range of "rides" with something for all ages - from feisty young adults to tottering toddlers (accompanied by an adult of course). Plan on being there most of the day so as to get your full value for money as there is no suggestion that it is cheap. However, it's certainly worth at least one visit and you will want to repeat the adventure. The food is just OK (mainly fast food) but that's not really the main reason for going to Wild Wadi, is it?
Fun filled day. Excellent water park for the whole family. Have been on every visit to Dubai. Facilities at the park are good. We used the park as part of our stay at Al Qasr

WW Water Park Burj al Arab. Wild Wadi Water Park as the name suggests it is a wadi type of experience once you enter the park. There are so many rides, which thrill you and you love to experience it more and more. It is good treat for all your family. Kids truly enjoys a lot. It is a worth going there with family and friends, just try once, u will never forget the experience.

Fun for all . Wild wadi water park is a great place for all to have fun in water games. It's so well set up and organised that you feel you are in a different world. It is one of the example of Dubai authority who have set up an water fun sports near to hotel and beach area. Please don't miss to visit and enjoy your time when you are in Dubai

Underwhelmed. I have heard very good things about Wild Wadi so visited with friends during a recent visit to Dubai. We went on a Thursday, arriving at around 11am, so we missed a lot of ten crowds. I imagine that if the place is packed getting on a ride would be chaos as in fact there are only 3/4 rides which are really any good. There are two pointless surf based rides, which were awful and then the main pool area which apart from a wave machine had no other attraction. The Jumeriah Scarer (excuse the spelling) was great but will not be to everyone's liking and the water ring based rides were ok but not brilliant. As I say after some of the feedback I had before visiting, I was very underwhelmed for the price and I won't be visiting again.

Fun In The Sun. you will have a great time at the water park. things are quite expensive because you are 'locked in to the deal' as it were but this is no different from the water parks at the Gold Coast here in Australia. It wont stop me going back next time I'm in Dubai.

Superb Fun not just for kids. Had a great day at wild wadi, great intense slides and some less scary ones but equally as fun!Surfing riptide was great fun and my fav was tantrum alley....get there early as the queues get longer as the day gets on..got there at 10.30 and hit the big rides first virtually no queue so was able to do them all few times before moving on to the more relaxing side of the park....didnt try the food as we were done by 3pmStaff were excellent and park is very clean!!!

Splash Damage. My husband and I visited the park early November this year. It was super quiet meaning that we didn't have to queue for any rides. The park operate a great wristband system that you dan add money to for the day. The band can be topped up throughout the day and if you have a balance left by the time you are done the outstanding money is returned to you, this makes the day nice and easy as you arent running back to your locker all the time. They also sell a water proof casing in their shop for mobile phones. This item was fantastic, it allows you to record your park adventure. I was a little nervous of this but it didnt leak. We even went on ro use the case in the sea while snorkling! The staff were very friendly offering to take pictures at the top of rides etc.The rides here were great I would suggest a visit to the park if anyone gets the chance.My husband and I used a 2-4-1 voucher from the Dubai entertainment book, so the cost of the day was more than reasonable. Great views from within th park as well.

Nice outing. It was a pretty decent water park, not a lot of rides though. It wasn't that busy during the morning but got busier as the day went on. I think it cost me around £40 for a ticket, if memory serves me well. Tbh I did like the Wild Wadi, but I don't think it's a whole day trip. Me personally, I got quite bored after a while (Don't let that put you off, I've visited a lot of theme parks, and after I've been on all the rides, I get quite bored anyway, so it's probably just me). It's a clean park, food is quite pricey, it's a nice outing and if you have kids, they'll love it!

Great day. We visited on a Thursday, so it was fairly quiet with hardly any queuing for the rides. Loads of rides, many of which we did more than once.You can hire lockers and towels, and you can load an armband with money on arrival so you do not have carry cash around which was handy - anything left on it is refunded in full as you leave.Plenty of deckchairs available and various shady places to keep out of the sun.Food was a bit pricey, but quality was very good.Professional photographers all round the park taking your photo, and giving you a armband with the details on, but there is no pressure to buy anything after you have looked at them.Would definitely visit again - we had a great day.

Place to have fun. A nice place with a lot of fun rides, very entertaining staff and kind, keep in mind it sometimes gets very crowded and have to Q up for a long time, food items are bit too expensive and your get your bags checked at the entrance
Relaxing fun. The park was clean and easy to move around. No stress to stand in the queues, and run all day to manage to visit all attractions. Its perfect for relaxed day.
Nice place. Very nice place where to spend time with your family. Close to Burj al Arab and Jumeirah Beach Hotel.
great fun, all day. a family place, something for everyone and a beautiful view of Burj Al Arab. a place to eat and amazing rides for all ages.

Great fun!. An excellent day out but Not the best for a relaxing day but fantastic rides especially the uphill ones. Good food and drink selection but can be a bit expensive. Queues get big in the afternoon so earlier the better!
good as it gets. had a fantastic time with family, so much to do, i think i need to have 5 more visits to choose my favourties, shall do soon

Visited twice in 2 days. Talk about bringing the big kid out of the adult. I really enjoyed the park with my partner and tried all of the rides which were thrilling to say the least. The ride which drops you out of a capsule straight down through a closed tube after 3 seconds is indelible in my memory. There are plenty of thrills and spills to be explored. Enjoy!

A Fun Day. We had free entry as part of a package. Had problems with locker not working, which got rather complicated, and took a while to sort. It is much smaller than the water park at Atlantis, but the rides are fun, and we had a delicious pizza for lunch which was very reasonably priced for Dubai. I would recommend going earlier in the week, as it gets very busy the nearer the weekend gets. Also, if you have shuttle bus transportation, make sure you catch the last one, as the park seems to be poorly served by taxis, the queue long and slow moving.
Waterpark at our doorstep. Lots of activities that we enjoyed with the entire family. Numerous choices to grab a bite. Even ample space to relax in the shade away from the noise.

Great Afternoon at the Waterpark. My husband and I bought the entertainer voucher book in Dubai and used the voucher to buy one entrance get one free, allowing for a break on the price which was a great start. We went later in the afternoon, leaving ourselves about 4 hours to hit all the rides. This was the second best decision we made that day! Many people had already left for the day, leaving very minimal lines. We were able to ride every ride, some twice! The park is well organized, and labeled. We loved the idea of the bracelets so you don't have to carry money around with you or a key to the lcoker. We experienced the Dr. Fish treatment on our feet and loved it! The rides were great, a really good variety of comfortable to a little scary.. like being enclosed in a tube where the floor drops out and you go straight down a huge slide. Crazy, but fun.. even for people in their late 20s!

Excellent water park. We had a good morning here, before it got to hot, no que, really good lockers and money bands that you can put money on , then you didn't have to carry cash or cards around with you.

Great fun. we visited on a Thursday so it was very quiet and we loved not having to queue. Some fantastic rides and we particularly liked the Tantrum Alley and the Jumeirah Sceirah rides... However, it is not as good as Aquaventure, so if you have to choose one, then do Aquaventure.

greta fun family day out. Visited Wild Wadi in Summer and winter. It is really good fun. If you can get a voucher from The Entertainer or buy on Groupon it makes it more affordable. There is a good mix of fun for little ones using the little slides and tipping bucket of water ( even my 8 year old likes that) and for the older thrillseekers there are 3 great slides. We took a 6 year old, 8 year old and a 12 year old and although we accompanied to two younger one most rides they still were able to go on the scary rides tantrum alley or something like that. They had a ball. The food is not healthy and overpriced which is a shame. If you want a seat by the wave pool go early. If you want some peace go to the sundeck up the top!
SUPERB. Great place for family and kids not an great time to visit when the temperature is lower in Dubai however nevertheless great facility

A great place to visit. We visited the place due our kids request who had already been there earlier wit their school. It was again an amazing experience for them and we spent six hours going from one ride to other. The kids enjoyed the most the ride on Tantrum Alley which is a bit scary at the beginning but gives the expected adrenaline shock. The staff was always friendly and helpful, plenty of space to sit and relax, although the restaurants are a bit pricey.

Enjoyed myself even though i'm a grown up. This is a child's friendly zone, and great for the big kid in you tooMy friend had a go on a couple of the rides she could not resist lolSpent a lovely few hours in this wonderful water park - It's very big, with plenty of rides,plenty of loungers, lots of places to eat and chill zones.We enjoyed free entrance as we were staying at the Burj but i think we worked it out at about £25 per child - grown up's more expensive therefore shop around for vouchers.At the entrance we were given towels & i think you could purchase lockers at a fee.I feel it would be a lovely place to spend a day with the kids or even to relax in the sun and people watch.It was very busy but i could see no queues - just lots of happy faces.
One of the best. Wow!! A children's paradise...My kids loved it equally enjoyable by my husbandPlus point they have a ladies only evening!!
Fun and run. I love water park since my childhood. i love to play with it and can spend more and more hours playing with it, this park was very modern and made createvly. love this park.

OK but expensive. This waterpark was good fun and did have a good selection but for the price you pay you would expect a bit more.
I would recomend going to aquaventure at the atlantis, more rides and around a similiar price!

From here to infinity!. The queues were horrendous...snaking around the park in the heat waiting for more than 1.5 hours for a water ride that lasted 20 seconds. The only place you could just go into was the beach with the simulated waves. Didn't last long and hot footed it back to the Jumeirah Beach Executive Pool for some shade and rest!
A fun venue, and wow what a thrill!. A great place to spend an afternoon in Dubai. Thrills, spills, (literally) and plenty of fun for all the family.

Good compact water park... best in UAE. One of the oldest water parks in UAE but still remains the best when compared to Aquaventure or Yas Waterworld as Wild Wadi is compact in the heart of the city and has activities for all ages. Good options for food and to rest.
great day out. Spent a great day here, something for all ages of kids (and adults). Used Entertainer to get Bogof).
much better then atlantis. brillant for all ages found this much better then the atlantis theme park the rides are better longer and more variety

Worth a visit. Wild Wadi is definitely worth a visit, but be sure to get there early to make the most of it.
It opens at 10am, but by lunchtime it is pretty packed, and some of the queues were pretty hectic.
Cost for 2 people was around £130 for the day in total, when factoring in some lunch and a locker.

If you love water parks, this is the place to be!. Great place and location was easy to access too. You will require minimum half a day to cover all rides, if not full day is brilliant. Latest rides are mind blowing and take your heart away from usual place. If you love water rides, this is the place when you visit Dubai.

A must if you love waterparks. This is a waterpark to enjoy. The lazy rivers are relaxing and long, linking the rides, which is ideal.
If you can get there early, there are no queues.
The way they blast you up to the top of the rides, instead of climbing steps is great as it adds to the whole experience.
Great for all ages!

Fantastic Water park. really enjoyed this water park. though expensive according to me. But great rides and slides. Lots of food options, Carry your own swim wear, as I did. Not sure whether you get swim wear on rent. Super clean changing rooms. Fun day out for the entire family and friends.
Lots of fun. Smaller than Aquaventure but it only made it more convenient to get to different pools and water slides. We have been here twice and the children love it .
So much fun. Spent the day here with my husband & had great fun, got 2 beds beside the wave pool to use as a base between going on the water slides.

Awesome Water Park and Fun for All. My Wife, Daughter and I visited the Wild Wadi Water park in October.The park claims to have over 40 rides but in reality it's only around 10 or 11, with some rides having a number of options...such as the water slides, which is in one big area with about 5-6 different slides. This is more for kids. There are 4-5 different rides for kids under 1.10 meter tall and 11 or so in total.Kids will have a great time and our daughter who is not 1.10meters tall stayed on the slides most of the time. We also went on the 2 lazy rivers and their is a wave pool which generates waves every 30 minutes of so for about 15 mins. The adult rides are faster and good fun, such as the water ski boards, and the faster rides down the lager shoot and slopes. The queues we not very long and we didn't have to wait more than 10 mins for any ride. This was a Tuesday, however as long as you don't go on a Friday or Saturday(The weekend in UAE), it shouldn't be too busy.The price for the park however is 295 Dhirams for adults and 235 for children which is roughly £50 for adults and £40 for children. Note children is classes as anyone under 1.10 meters tall..after that you pay the full price, however they can then go on all the rides. The admission prices as you see are fairly steep, however we had Entertainer vouchers and got a 2 for 1 for adults and managed to find someone to do the same for my daughter, which meant it cost us £70 for the 3 of us as opposed to £140.The park is well laid out and you can do as much or as little as you want. There are lockers available to store your belongings, bags etc, and they vary in price depending on the size of the locker.I would recommend this park if you want a day to just have fun and relax at the same time. There are lots of deck chairs, but you may have to search for one if you come in late as they get snapped up quickly. Their are ample eating places however service is slow, and the food is not great, burgers, chips, wraps, pastas, and such are made to order but it takes 20 mins for anything to be ready for you. This is not table service, just fast food outlets..but none are very fast, and they don't all sell what they say on their boards. If you can, your better off bringing your own picnic.Overall a great day out for both us and our daughter and definitely worth doing with an entertainer 2 for 1 voucher, and probably worth bringing a Picnic. One thing to note when we left the park at around 6pm their was not a single taxi in sight, and a large queue waiting for one. If you don't have your own transport your best bet is to walk out and take a right turn, walking towards the Burj Al Arab...probably 8-10 min walk, where you will find ample taxis to get you back home.

Fun day out. Some great rides that vary from relaxing to thrill! Try to get there early to grab a lounger/chair as we went at half-term and initially had nowhere to sit or make a base. Not cheap, but worth it if you make a day of it.
Great place to go. This water park has it all, one of the best I've been to with lots of fun rides to go on with helpful staff stationed all over the park. I had to back and visit it again
BIG FUN!. was a good day out. refreshing and not so long queue. will come back here for sure! the view from the slides were amazing!
Best water park. Love the water slide. Not only that but love all the rides. The water slide is a whole new experience as it scares and excites you at the same time. Its a must visit if in DXB.

love it amazing rides great day out.. I have visited Dubai loads and every time I'm out I always find time to visit this park. its great the staff are all so friendly and welcoming from when you arrive to when you leave and always so helpful. The park is always clean and very hygienic. keep up the good work at wild wadi will be back real soon.

Perfect. Even that it is older than Aquadvature but it is still have perfect reputation and service , I have been there many times and willing to go.again and again . I think it only needs to add more restaurants to have more choice .
Family fun. It's a fun place to. Relax and bond with the family. Kids love it. It's a must if you have kids. Been there at least once a year for the last decade. Enjoyable.

Lovely place to play with different types of water slides.. If you visit Dubai and feel like doing outdoor sports to cool off this is the place i'd recommend.It's full of different types of water slides,pools and so many water activities that you cannot even get bored.Forget the beach and just try enjoy at Wild Wadi Water Park.Really enjoyed myself.
Fantastic fun. there's nothing not to like; unlike other parks you never have to carry a rubber ring to a ride, the ride takes up and down through 11 rides. Went round 3 times just to start!

Rides, but nothing else. I was very surprised how small - or compact area it was - compared to Atlantis water park (Aquaventure Waterpark). We stayed in Wild Wadi for 1,5 hours and had tried (almost) everything. There are very intensive rides, but also rides that are no rides at all. You have to work out to get your way till the end. Locker rooms, toilets and showers are dated like the all area. Just keep your flip flops all the time - there are places where you can leave them while you have a ride, as you can't were any shoes (except swimming shoes) when riding. The area needs refurbishment and in my understanding it's going to be closed from January 2015 for a couple of months for maintenance. We took the capsule ride Jumeirah Sceirah at first, so after that everything was easy. This park is more for the children than adults. If you are family with children and have only one option, I'd suggest the Atlantis, as there is everything for everybody.

I prefer to go to Aquaventure instead. about 3 years ago I went to Aquaventure of Atlantis Hotel and this time I decided to go to Wild Wadi, and for sure next time I am gonna choose Aquaventure again.

Not worth my time or money. I went here with great expectations having read all the reviews, what a complete letdown!!!The rides look old and are actually quite boring. There were massive queues for the half decent slides as the other were rubbish. Actually spent a couple of hours in this place having a sleep as i was that bored. I definetley would not recommend and would not visit it again!!!

Brilliant as usual. Friendly and inviting, fun for all ages. We booked cabana's for a little extra exclusivity - quite fun watching people try and gain entrance only to find they can't get in as we have it to ourselves - worth the extra - you get a fridge full of cold drinks, ice creams, etc.

Wild Wadi. Pros:Not far away from city centre.Just next to Jumeirah Beach Hotel and Burj Al arabStunning views from top of both hotels and the seaNot very large area makes it convenient to explore all areas/ridesGood mix of thrill and easy rides Some good choices for kidsHelpful staff all around the parkFast food restaurant all around the parkBasement parking availableLifeguards at most important partsLockers avalable for abt 35 AED Rental ( 10 $) Changing facilities for men and women right at the entrance.Cash is not accepted for purchases. Load cash on charge devices ( watch like device ) and pay with that.Load the device at the entrance shop and get the balance Refunded at exit. Cons:Expensive tickets abt 80 USD eachOutside food not allowed but inside food is expensive- A half lts PEPSI costs 15 AED/ 4 dollarsVery less CABANAS - about 6 only. So almost no chance of booking if not preplannedThe park can be best enjoyed from Nov to April. After this it can be extremely hot as temperatures may reach almost 45-48 C.

Great fun, excellent place for family!. We went there twice during our 4 night stay in Dubai - had a lot of fun. We stayed in Al Qasr with complimentary access and buggy to take the guests to and from. It is very well set up and you can charge your spend to your room if you stay in one of the Jumeirah hotels. All you need is swimmers and sunscreen!

Good fun.. Wild wadi was a good afternoon activity. We really enjoyed it. Only downside is cost. Luckily we had entertainer voucher or we wouldn't have been able to go. No queues. Was hard to get a taxi home but we walked out onto main road and got one quickly.

Small water park, nothing special.. I wouldn´t go there again. You can´t enter with your own food and drinks and then the cheapest drink costs 20 dirhams. The entrance is very expensive (295 dirhams/person) and not worth it! Good that we had the Entertainer voucher. I was there with my boyfriend and if we were there for a whole day we would deffinitely get bored. Btw not all the tobogans were working and neither the bathrooms were maintained. I have visited much better water parks in Greece and Spain, Wild wadi was nothing in comparison. The only nice thing was that you are pushing up by the water on some attractions, that was something new for me.

This place is not too big in comparison with other water parks, but it has lots for the size for kids and adulds.. Excellent,i have been before but always great fun. AS usual you will almost have to take a taxi to this venue unless you are lucky enough to be staying at the Jumerah Beach hotel OR THE BURGE AL ARAB
Worth going once. Small ... Clean ... User-friendly ... 3rd best in UAE ... Convenient location ... Friendly staff .. Little Overpriced
totally awesome!. like water? you'll love this! one of the most fun places in dubai you can visit. You'll want to spend a good few hours and get a waterproof camera with you!

Water park. I found the staff very friendly and helpful the park was very clean . There were lots of signs telling you where the rides were and there was always someone willing to help you. The food there was great and lots of choices. The good thing also was that you did not have to carry money with you as it was put onto a band that you had on your wrist. The rides were great and I would recommend a visit.

Nice place. Nice place to visit with kids. Entry to this park is quite pricey at aed295(SGD105) for adults n aed235(SGD83) for kids. The food in the park is pricey as well,nevertheless we had so much fun in the park with the rides and all! The kids will certainly enjoy themselves with the water theme playground with the water slides n all..safety is assured in this park as u can see alot of lifeguards on duty at various spots around the park. Recommended place to visit!
Great day out. We went to Wild Wadi Water Park with my family we went on all the rides without having wait very long and enjoyed them all

Superior Arabian WaterPark. The highest compliment i can give the park is that it's comparable to those found in Florida. It has a consistent theme throughout and a wider range of slides than that of Aquaventure. My wife and i especially enjoyed the 2 surfing rides and the rollercoasters sending you to the top of the slides. The staff are very attentive in their coaching (on the surfing rides) and the communal pool was superior to Aqua's too. The only downside was the amount of pictures the staff insisted taking off you and the vastly inflated prices of the photographs. To day out!
has become dated. not as good as Yas or Aquaventure - feels dirty and smelly too crowded. Would prefer other waterparks

Fun in the water/sun!.,. A really good day out with water to help cool you down. The staff throughout the park are very friendly and helpful if you need to ask directions etc Lots of choice for food/drinks reasonably priced. Well worth a day out there.

Wonderful Wadi. We have lived in Dubai for 4+ years and have 7 kids - so we have been to this park several times! It is a great, safe place to let the kids be kids. Teens can venture on their own - I usually stay with the little ones in the toddler area or wave pool. There is something for every age.

Great fun. I love wild wadi it's really fun for kids and adults. There are many slides and activities to have a fun filled day, it can be a little crowed in the weekends but if you are a tourist you can go during the week to have a better time with less crowd, besides that it's fantastic.

Fun. I enjoyed our day at Wild Wadi - would have liked more rides and slides for people scared of heights (like me!) but the lazy river is very relaxing and we had a lovely view of the Burj Al Arab from our sun loungers.

A Good Day Out. A good waterpark that has a bit of something for everyone. A couple of high adrenaline rides, but mostly slower rubber ring type rides to suit those not so adventurous. The park gets busier in the afternoons and evenings (has a late night opening). The park provides life jacket type bouyancy aids free of charge to those that need them for both adults and children and they are stacked up around the park. The ground can get very hot so you can either buy slip on waterproof shoes at the park or bring your own. Plenty of outlets for food and drink. Lockers are available. If you stay at the hotel. You get free entrance to the park as often as you want.

Amazing Water Park. Wild Wadi is an amazing Water Park in Dubai near the stunning Hotel Burj Al Arab. It’s located in Jumairah area on the beach side. It has lots of water attractions and features. There are many restaurants and cafes to have meals or snakes. It’s suitable for all family members, in addition that they have special nights for Ladies only for women who need privacy. It’s open from morning until late night. No need for advance booking, locker rooms are available for Men and Women. Water Park souvenirs shop are located inside the Water Park.

Fun For All. I Live 10mins drive away from Wild Wadi and i must say, i have only been to the park once but my wife and kids have been to the Park more than 5 times. Fantastic for the kids and adults,i recommend.
Ok water park... Loads of fun had by all.. Wave pool is a must.. Not many places to cool off out of the hot sun.. Footwear is a must as ground is so hot..

More rides than other parks and suitable for all!. I had one of the best days at Wild Wadi especially with their new ride, the drop from the large tower. Everything was well organised... the water temperature was a bit cold for my taste...
Great fun!. Not too crowded. Good value for money. Clean and friendly. The idea of loading money onto a wrist band is good as you do not need to keep going back to a locker.
GREAT FUN..... Loved it so did 3 other 40 year kids! food wasn't brilliant but really we weren't there for anything other than fun!

Decent Water Park. Took my two twin (teenage) nieces during a visit. I personally am a fan of water parks so had just as much fun. Not too many rides, so you end up spending most of the time in the wave pool which was fun. It was quite hot so finding a place to cool off once out of the water was not easy. the food was okay... to be expected. I'm an adventurist but hated the drop ride as it almost ripped my bathing suit off, otherwise all was pretty cool.

Sill one of the best water parks - in the world. Having been to Wild Wadi more times than I have fingers on my hands, it is still not getting boring. And this alone speaks for itself. The 48,000 sqm water parks offers 30 different rides and attractions. Despite having opened in 1999, the management very efficiently maintains and re-introduces new attractions to the park so that after 15 years of operation it still looks brand new. The park offers something for all age groups and all bravery stages, from "scared sea turtle" to "bring it on I'm a shark". One highlight of this park is its proximity to the Burj Al Arab hotel, which visitors can see from various areas. The lazy river is intelligently planned into the development, allowing guests to use its water streams to be carried form attraction to attraction, which makes for a lazy alternative than walking. F&B at the park is sufficient, however lacks healthy options - fast food it is for the day (as you are not allowed to bring in your own drinks or eatery - bag check at entrance!).Tip: if you are staying in either the Burj Al Arab, Jumeirah Beach Hotel or in either of the Madinat Jumeirah properties, your entry fee is waved (even with only one night stay). Something that is worth considering as the entry for 2 people ramps up to about AED 550 / USD 150.
Adventurous. This was the best that I have ever done. Enjoyes each and ever ride. Each one has its own fun and charm. Worth waiting for in a que. Loved every minute of it .

The inner child . You go for your children but the inner child comes out! Lots of fun, probably not as slick as its bigger brother down the road but still a great way to spend half a day. Puts the European water parks to shame.

Wonderfully Wild Wadi. Excellent day out with attentive staff who clearly make safety a priority whilst retaining a fun atmosphere. Queues weren't excessive. Easy to stay in the park from 10 until 5pm to really enjoy the fun. The Entertainer vouchers made this a good value for money day out at around £100 for 4 (I probably wouldn't feel the same paying full price). Lunch was the typical burger and chip type Fayre but it was very well done and considering the large portion size and inclusive ice cream and fanta I thought around £10 was an OK price to pay. (Smaller children could share 1 between 2.). Getting a return taxi was a bit of a nightmare so the complimentary bus to the Mall of the Emirates was really welcomed. Would definitely return if lucky enough to visit Dubai again.

The best water park. It is the best water park without a doubt, the facilities are great. Nothing is missing, many swimming pools, places to eat, and is in the best area of ​​the city, so if price is a little expensive, but worth it

Ok but too much concrete. In a place like Dubai which is already very built up I find it a shame that they didn't spend more time landscaping this water park. The slides are good fun but there are better parks nearby

Good fun but expensive. Great day out but make sure you have enough money. Simple burger and drink is £10+. They do give you electronic wristbands to charge your food to etc. Really quiet first thing in the morning.

Fantastic day. I spend a wonderful day with my lovely young girl . We were lucky because the park was not crowded with people , so we enjoyed the rides severe times . The negative point was the absence of strong waves in the water channels .

Good but expensive lockers!. Kids really enjoyed this water park. We stayed around 4-5 hours and got on all the main rides without too much of a queue despite visiting in the uk half term weeks. We were staying at the Jumeriah zabeel saray so we received complimentary tickets which was a bonus! We got a shuttle bus there. Arrived at 10:15 and got straight in without a significant queue. Showers are a good facility. Locker price was 35 dirhams (£6) which is a total rip off despite them being smart lockers. TIP: avoid taking items that then require you to need to pay for a locker!
Heaven in middle of the desert!!. Though there were very limited number of games in there...each of it was truly special. Different. I enjoyed the rides.

Good Fun in a Great Location. Went to Wild Wadi Water Park early enough (if you can call 11 early) and beat the expected big queues that people all complain about. Entrance and lockers expensive enough but there is no limit on how long you can stay inside. The water park is set below the Burj Al Arab 7 star Hotel on one side and the Jumeirah Hotel on the other so a nice backdrop all round. The rides are varied and some tame but others not for the faint hearted. The Jumeirah Sceirah was well worth the long walk up the stairs when your stood in a coffin shaped enclosure and dropped vertically. Its over quickly but still worth it. Remember not to bring your footwear to any rides with you as you cannot wear them on the rides. It can be a long walk back up for them.My other favourite was the Tantrum Alley. It was not too short and had a lot of changes and different parts to it so well worth it. Best place to lie down in is the raised platform on the Burj Al Arab side of the park as it is away from the stream of people walking around and has a perfect view of the hotel and beach in front.It wouldn't be something I would go to twice if on holidays but it is well worth experiencing.

Great day. I took two children 10 & 12 to Wild Wadi for the day. They had a fantastic time, although it was half term and the general time queuing for the rides was around 30 minutes. They rated this their second favourite experience in Dubai
Awesome . We went here after a 6 month deployment to Afghanistan. And what an amazing park it is awesome rides great fun to be had!!!!
Great day out, not for the faint hearted. This is a thrill seeking water park with great facilities. Plenty eating places and sun loungers for those who don't like to partake

Awesome , dont miss. Try and use the entertainer app for some discounts as these tickets are quite expensive. However , it is worth every penny. All the rides are fun experience. We visited during Halloween and the whole setup at the water park was amazing. Food is available at minimal costs. Carry towels , swimsuits as the same are available at a cost in the park. By evening the whole place is beautifully lit with a great view of burj AL Arab. WiFi is free and accessible inside the park.Do try water surfing .. It is a must!

Great fun!. We visited this park on a Thursday evening as it was Ladies night and it was kept open for longer. It was great fun and very tiring going up the steps to the main water slides especially as it was humid and hot even at 23.00hrs! I was not very impressed with the changing rooms and facilities as it was very grubby. Having to pay £20 just for a locker was unreasonable for others but as a guest at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, entry was complimentary for us so I did not mind the locker fee.
Excellent Water Park. Lots of good rides, make sure you take a camera like GOPRO you can wear on most slides or can hold, make sure you reserve a full day for all activities

The oldest yet the best. Wild Wadi is still one of the best outings in Dubai, location is perfect and next to Madinat jumeirah. The lazy river is my favourite, all what you need to do is to relax and the water will take you around..the park has many beautiful rides. Food is expensive and not something to talk about.

Must try at least for 1 time. Wild wadi is near jumaira beach hotel and madina al jumaira . There are some restaurants in there . It had lockers for rent . And a place for smoking . There are so many water games and all people can use them because they are not scary . It cast 40 DHS from city center to wild wadi . You can take some paper from malls and you can have discount with those papers . You can ask when you are in shopping malls . They are free and there are lots of them

Best Birthday treat. We took my son to this water park for his 8th birthday and he had a ball. In fact, we all did! It was really good fun with lots of rides. We especially liked the two family rides (the rides where you could all go on together). The one bad thing was getting your bearings in the place and some of the rides were quite similar. Having said that we had a great day and my son says it was the best day of the holiday!

The best day to spend in the Desert. This water park was right outside the hotel I was staying the Jumeirah Beach Hotel so it was ideal, I was able to walk from room to slide within 5 minutes. Would love to have spent the whole day there, but had other commitments looking forward to a return trip, and will spend much longer there next time. Rides were great even for a large fellow like myself.

Good fun, friendly and not as busy as Aquaventure. 3 of us visited WW in October half term. We had a great day with the only issue being the wait for lunch at ALl's BBQ. They lulled us with a very small queue but it turned out that this was just to order and receive a number. The "fast" food then took 45 minutes to arrive. Not a major issue as it was good to have a rest but it was getting a little heated with a few complaints from guests.There was a bit of a queue to get into the park at about 10.15 so I'd recommend ordering online before setting off as these people walked straight through.There are loads of photographers around the park taking official photos. These cost 100dhs or around £15 each at the end of the day. However, they offered us every picture for 325dhs on a memory stick so we stored the ones we had taken so far and went back around the park until we had about 40 pictures. They then worked out at less than £1.50 each. We got a 10% discount and 3 free prints thrown in to make the deal even sweeter.The staff around the park were superb, really friendly and helpful.We got sunbeds no problem and we didn't hear anyone complaining.The rides were all good with the longest queue about 20mins for the main drop slide. All others were about 10-15 mins at worst.

Great fun. The Wild Wadi Water Park at Dubai close to the Jumeirah Beach hotel and the Burj-Al-Arab promises a day filled with great fun, adventure and excitement for the entire family. We visited as two families with two children and am infant and had a blast of a day. Even the adults relived childhood memories as we zipped up and down the water slides, slid down rapid waters on a tube or just pranced around in the wave pool. A must do on every tourist itinerary in Dubai. Only, don't forget to bring along oodles of good sun screen lotion as the Dubai sun is blazingly hot and your skin needs the extra protection as you enjoy the waters.
very good experience. it was very good experienced in wild wadi. nice atmosphere, lot of thing to play in wild wadi. it was a friday and too much crowdy. the boys there was very helpful

Fun for all!. A great day out! Lots of rides all different to others to cater for everyone ! We stayed the whole day. The flow rider machines are also good. I advise if you have a surf/water skin t-shirt to take one if you are a female as it is required for some rides that you wear one. They do provide some however it is nicer to have your own. It states that you can't take any food but the bag search is very relaxed and they allow you to take in small snacks within reason for example an apple and orange and some crisps. However the food is very reasonable within which is a surprise for a water park especially within Dubai, a large pizza with a salad, ice cream and large drink was 70dirham. There so plenty of food variety, a good day for all. Lots of fun
Wowwww!!!!!!!!. I really enjoyed this water park! It was amazing and my whole family enjoyed it! The slides are awsome and I would definitely reccomend it to everyone!!
Great fun. What they have in this waterpark is great. The rides are long and fun. Food wasn't too badly priced for a park. Great setting in front of the Burj Al Arab, would definitely recommend.

Amazing. Open sesame! awesome enjoyment, eagle-eyed lifeguards, themed around the adventures of Sinbad, Flood River Flyer, splashy attractions, Summit Surge, diving down, twists and turns, adrenalin rush, Master Blasters, Flow Riders, packed with action, go on I dare you, thrills and spills, high-powered jets, aquatic roller coaster, gravity-defying, Rushdown Ravine, white-knuckle rides, Tunnel of Doom, expect the unexpected, plunge into the Lazy River, lie back and relax at 80kph, thunder & lightning, choreographed flash flood
Kids really enjoyed. We went to under 5's so could really only go on the kids bit, which was fantastic. Went on a couple of the adults rides which were really good.

A great day out for all. We got the day out included with our stay at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers which was a bonus. We only planned to spend the morning there but ended up being there the whole day. The park was more than enough for our 7 year old and 10 month old but older kids may get a bit bored. We got there as it opened and did not have to queue for rides. Our 7 year old surprised us by body boarding, something he had never contemplated before!
Excellent day,. Good day, second visit to wild wadi this time was even better due to a voucher I had, it's not cheap at £60 per adult but voucher was buy one get one free. Very good day.

Great!!!! . We went to the ladies night here, it was slightly cheaper but it was the best. The staff were very kind and chatty. The idea for ladies night is just brilliant. I felt very comfortable within my own skin. Just fab!!! Thank you. Beats the terrible experience I had in the other waterpark. Will return to wild wadi soon!!

Well worth a visit. Wild Wadi is a must if you visit Dubai - for both kids and adults. It's not cheap but it is a good day out and at the end you feel as if you've had value for money. The rides are "entertaining" and there are plenty of sun beds to relax on. Food is fine - a fairly fixed menu but all freshly cooked and tasty - no complaints. The staff there are also very very helpful and friendly - nothing is too much trouble for them. A thoroughly enjoyable day.

Very good yet overmarketed. We spent almost a whole day out there and we didn't get bored. However, if you don't like riding the very same slides over and over again you might get bored. It's way smaller than you might think it is, for the way it is marketed. Also the entrance fee is really high and the food is expensive and not the best. However, they have a few rides that make the experience worth, especially the super-tall slide and the four-people slide - at least for me personally. Also the surf-machine is a nice feature. Besides these, there are also some slides for kids and a wave pool. The haunting house is pretty good, yet I wouldn't go there twice.

Fantastic experience. In Dubai, must be go there. You can enjoy ur vacation for refereshment. I was with my wife. Really nice to do playing. Anyway, there is a little bit expensive to eat and souvinor items.

We all had a great day out!!. Kids were happy by hotel pool BUT our hotel Emirates towers inc a free day pass to Wild Wadi so we persuaded our 8,10,12 & 14 year old to go for the day..... Little did they know how much fun they would have! We arrived just before opening and had rang ahead to book a cabana 1500dhs which is about £250 but because we saved 300dhs per person on the entrance it was well worth it. The cabana inc a fidge filled with soft drinks and a small platter of water melon later in the day.
