We also got queue busting to some of the slides.The park itself is big appeared extremely well run and had over kill on life guards both in and out of the water. This I liked and because my children are all confident swimmers and I felt the park was well supervised I sat and read a book whilst the kids had a wonderful time trying out all the slides, popping back intermittently for food or water.The food menu was basic, burger chip style, but was relatively cheap for an attraction such as this.It's definately worth taking a sun uv protection top as it did get hot around mid day. We had a great day overall and will definately visit again and would definately recommend for all ages.

Enjoyable. Okay I don't like water parks so i'm basing this review on the people I went with. My family. They enjoyed it, although a little limited and small (ish). We have been since so its not a bad place to go at all. Its not completely like a western waterpark. it has a very arabic feel at times and I think that goes some way to help enjoy the culture. I honestly can't say too much in this review but it is worth the day out.
SO much fun. Have been here throughout the years of travelling to Dubai. Enjoy very much as an adult and with the children.

A good day out. Having been to Atlantis we were slightly taken a back by the amount of concrete and concentrated area of Wild Wadi. However, once we explored a bit and tried some of the rides, we were really excited to be there. There are some fantastic water chutes and rides at the park. We also enjoyed the wave pool. Food was expensive but that is to be expected in a theme park.
Fun Park worth a visit. a must visit with family in dubai good selection of rides make sure you go woth vouchers widely available in entertainer book save you a lot of money

SO MUCH FUN!!. We had a fantastic time here. We spent our first day here, and as 23/24 year olds we enjoyed it like we was children again. Lots and lots of flooms, you don't need to get off the rubber floats as they carry you around the whole water. Really do recommend it here.
Fun!. Not so big as Aquaventure and a bit more family friendly. Not cheap but great for the kids. Rides were excellent
Wild Wadi Water Park. Best water park there is. Very clean, very safe. Staff are very helpful. Rides are fun for all ages.

great place - better than atlantis. not so crowded and not so trashy as Atlantis. Lot of fun and if you want to spoil your selves, rent a cabana and you will have a place that can act as you base during the day
Fun Fun Fun. Decided to visit on Ladies night, what a lovely experience plenty of fun no queues. I wish they did ladies night all year around!!!!!

Good Fun Day Out. This is a great place to take kids, we had free admission with our accomodation so didn't have to think to much about the price but if I had three kids to take along it would be an expensive day out. Lots of exciting rides, something for everyone, my grown up kids tried them all and really enjoyed it. Masses of lifeguards so you feel safe and sound and all the staff were friendly and cheeful with the exception of the female at the turnstyle on the hotel side, who was rude, brusque and gave us zero eye contact, no excuses of a long hard day as we were the first customers of the morning, I did make a note of her name but I don't think it's fair to name and shame, sad that one individual can let her whole team down. The food is typical fast food burgers etc but I had a ceasar salad and it was nicer and fresher that any I'd been served at the Jumeriah pool restaurants. All in all an experience not to be missed.

Overcrowded, long queues, overpriced. One of older water parks in the UAE but well maintained and recently upgraded. Definitely too many visitors allowed into the park causing massive queues and lots of frustration. Lifeguards are intimidated and not able to manage some of visitors - mainly those above weight limit for the certain rides.Entry ticket is pricey, meals inside too so be prepared to spent quite a lot.Location is good, just next door to Burj Al Arab and (almost) walking distance from MoE Metro station
Fantastic Day Out. A great water park. We went during the week so hardly had to queue. Amazing rides and very good staff. Worth the pricey entrance fee.

Great fun, but pre book your tickets!. We visited here as a group of friends and having looked up the price of tickets online prior to visiting were surprised at how expensive it is.... having said that, it was a great day out and well worth the money!

Limited and expensive unless you are a Jumeirah guest. We were a couple visiting this time and having been before knew what to expect as there has been no changes since 2013 that we know of.There are only a handful of rides for adults albeit they are very good but there is only so many times you would want to ride the same ones. As we were guests at a Jumeirah hotel our access was free and I can appreciate the comments that it is overpriced for those that have paid. I expect that there are discounts about like we have in the UK for Alton Towers, no one goes without a half price voucher.There is plenty of room and lots of places for snacks albeit they are not the greatest of quality and pretty standard fast food junk.We enjoyed a couple of hours as it was very quiet and no queues- it was also extremely hot so beware !

wet and wild. Fantastic rides, some very fast, some just a leisurely float! Plenty of loungers to relax between rides and food and drink readily available. Great views of the Burj al Arab from the highest ride as the park is situated right alongside this iconic hotel. there is something for ages right down to the smallest toddler and lifeguards are everywhere for your safety. Wristbands are issued for entry and can be loaded with cash for purchases in the park. The only dampener was that when leaving, you have to hand in your bands and are reimbursed for unspent money. On our visit the systems crashed and it took a long time and a lot of complaining to get our money back and leave.That apart, we had a great day but I must say that the park was not very busy so I don't know what the queues would be like on a busy,(avoid weekends). We would certainly go back.
friendly staffs. where you go there always a staff over there to help you. nice experice. You must try fiish spa. its so cool.
Over rated needs updating !. Only 4 rides for teenagers / adults which were covered in the first hour so we had to do the same rides again, at a cost of £50 per adult it is not worth the money !

An excellent afternoon of fun. We love Wild Wadi. We have tried Atlantis but keep coming back to Wadi. Our girls are 7 & 9 and for them it works really well with nothing too scary just lots of smiles and laughter. Really well designed with lots of shade and lifeguards to make you feel safe and relaxed. Foods not great so try not to arrive hungry but otherwise can't fault it.
fun all the way. my two kids loved wild wadi, fun rides across the park. close to distance to our hotel, just 5 minutes by a buggy shuttle

Great day out with kids. I have been to Wild Wadi on 3 occasions with my family and had a great day out, it can get very crowded and in the summer heat the concrete ground can burn your feet. Late afternoon when it gets slightly cooler is a lovely time and there are great views of Burj hotel. Food and drinks are a bit expensive and they do not allow you to take your own drinks in with you.
Great place to spend a day. Many different pools, but not the biggest water park in Dubai... Good to spend a day once, good for families with kids - a lot of fun for them.

superb waterpark. This really is a treat for both Young and not so Young alike. The layout of the park is very well thought of and you can play around for hours upon hours without getting too tired. You go up waterjet slides on your inflatable rings, either alone or tandem. So it really is the optimal waterpark in every sence. The drawbacks are like most of these places the food that is too expensive for what you get and the crowds that can be just a dealbreaker. But it really is all Worth it and the views from the top of the slides over the jumeirah beach hotel and burj al arab are jaw dropping.

A Great Way to Keep Cool. This park was awesome, very well constructed and set out. Slides are integrated with others so this minimises waiting times, most of the time you don't even need to get out of the water or wait in queues. There are powerful water jets which push tubes up the slide. There are a great variety of rides, all close together, not massively spread out like at Atlantis, however the two parks are very different & both worth seeing.

So much fun!. Our visit to WWW was included in our hotel benefits, so we were driven there by the hotel cars, and it was fun! It was crowed but well directed by the Park staff. We spent there 3 happy hours.

great waterpark. great waterpark though not big but really very good. its absolutely clean and you have rides for all age groups. you should get there early and njy the place. really worth going there and have great fun

Needs more rides. Ride 1 takes you to the top of the park on jets of powerful water shooting yo ever higher. Novel concept, being pushed up rather than sliding down. Views are amazing, rides are a blast but the park needs more variety.

Splendid. It was fun fun fun all d way. Especially for d kids. Will recommend it to any tourist visiting dubai especially in d mth of sept wen it's very hot.
Will definitely visit d water park again. Awesome experience.

Great waterpark. This was my second visit to Wild Wadi and I have to say, even after the opening of Aquaventure at the Atlantis, this is still the best waterpark in Dubai. Whilst the rides at both Aquaventure and Wild Wadi are similarly good, the layout of Wild Wadi is miles ahead. For almost all of the tube rides at Wild Wadi, you only have to queue up once and then you are transported around the entire park as one ride automatically leads to another. This is great as it saves time having to climb up towers and queuing again and again. The surf rides are a nice touch and all of the staff appear extremely friendly and helpful.As expected, exrras such as lockers, towels and food is not cheap but the park itself is amazing. If you have to choose one between Wild Wadi and Aquaventure then in my opinion, Wild Wadi trumps it by far.

get there early. it is quite a small waterpark by comparison to others these days. the intro says 30 rides - I think this may be stretching things a bit. There is 1 very long ride which you can get on at various points so I guess if you break down each part it might reach 30. to me the real number is more like 6 or 7 plus a kids area. The Jumeirah Scarer is bl@@dy terrifying but well worth it. As you would expect, it gets busy so advice as with most attractions like this, is to get there early and do the most popular stuff first. It does get crowded.
Great fun. even if you dont go for the big slides you can still enjoy some tranquile moments .......... he lied !! great fun and well worth a visit
wild wadi. this water park is also v nice , if u compare with aquaventure , i dont find any mch difference coz i stayed in jumeirah beach hotel as well as atlantis so i went to both waterparks

Go to the other water park . We went here while we were on our honeymoon in May . I must say that this place was smaller than the other water park and probably work out twice the price when you include lockers and food. There was probably only two good rides on it . It's probably the only waterpark that I can say I would never return to. On the upside we saw the west ham footballer Andy Carroll while we were there

Great water park with long and exciting rides. This is an excellent water park. One ride in particular takes you right around the park and is good because it lasts a long time.The staff at the this place were incredibly friendly and helpful. It is a safe location but if you are worried about your possessions there are lockers available.Towels are also available to rent and there is a system where you get a wrist band and can add money to it so you don't need to carry your wallet around. When you leave you get back what you have nt spent, a good idea.Food and drink available, souvenirs, ice cream etc.Slightly expensive at 1200 dirhams (£200) for 3 adults but this included towel and locker rental as well as a meal. The meal included starter, main, desert and drink from a choice of 3 food outlets.All in all, it was a great day.

A bit dated but still good fun. We went in the afternoon, and we still struggled to get a place to sit but we eventually found a nice place to get settled. As the afternoon went on the lines got shorter and we managed to go on all the rides a few times. Jumeirah Scarer is highly recommended. After 7pm it was perfect. If you book your tickets online, recommend printing them before you arrive.

Fantastic waterpark. We visited 3 times as when you stay at the Jumeirah Beach zhotel, entry is free. We loved it and can't wait to return. The slides are great, the food was quite good and the wave pool was good. More importantly the water cools you down brilliantly.

I LOVE THIS WATER PARK. If you are the type that enjoy serious water fun irrespective of your age, then this is the pest place to be. a very sweet and cozy environment full of all water fun. Children will really enjoy the fun here and i bet you they won't want to return back to the hotel. This is really from experience with the children on our group tour.Is a place i will love to visit over and over again.I love the experience, its awesome!

Great for adults and kids. Great water park , excellent rides , always busy so queueing for BIG rides to be expected but nothing takes long and standing in warm sunshine Is pleasant anyway ! Lockers to store stuff provided . Buggies to and from all jumeirah beach hotels .

Good few hours if staying at Jumeirah hotels!. This a great way to spend a morning or afternoon if staying at a Jumeirah hotel as it is free, some of the rides are definitely not for the faint hearted but we had a go and enjoyed the experience. Can understand the grumbles about price if not staying at a Jumeirah hotel as there didn't seem to be enough to keep us entertained for more than a few hours.

advantages and disadvatages. I went there twice because I haven't been in a park like this so far. I am interested in it for warm and kind behavior of its stuffs and workers. Ne thing that made me disgusting was charging watch. Before entering we charge 300AED for 3 people as extra charges and chrged the fees of towels and lockers. they deduct those fees from our extra charges infact we had paid while buying tickets. When we went for lunch the stuff told there is no any $ inside of watches but we checked them on balance system it showed 2 of them have 120 AED. Only its finance made me confused.

Expensive water sliding!. My husband and son went to Wild Wadi. Whilst there are the requisite extreme water rides, at 300 Dirham each - it makes for a very expensive few hours. If you are on a Dubai stopover and have plans to do a few things in a day - this is a little expensive for those using Aussie dollars or the equivalent. So if you go - spend the day there!

Fantastic water park. Had a fantastic day at this water park with my family and friends. Really enjoyed the master blaster slides and loved the family tube rides. The wave pool is very mild but suited our relaxed day out. Had fun on the flow rider and the wave rider, the staff were excellent, teaching us to do 360 spins on the board.

A must if you are staying at Jumeirah Beach. This water park is great fun. It is not very big with only a few rides. If I had to pay full price then I would have been disappointed but if you stay at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel you have unlimited free entry. Staying for a week it is possible to go in for a couple of hours every day to take a few rides so it never gets boring. Big tip - on Friday, especially in the morning it is empty. You just walk straight on every ride without any wait at all, even the headline ones like the Jumeirah Sceirah and the Burj Surj.

Great day out. We had a great afternoon here. Not loads of rides but they were all loads of fun. The wave pool wasn't that big but there was enough room for everyone.All the lifeguards were so friendly, it was nice to feel welcome.The only downside is that you have to pay extra for towels and lockers, with the price of the ticket this should be included.We didn't realise until after we had visited but there is a free shuttle to and from the mall of Emirates. Also it was cheaper to book our tickets through our hotel rather than at the water park.

Bought out the kid in us!. We were staying at the Jumeriah Beach hotel and because of that you have free access to the Wild Wadi. I cannot say we have a great deal of experience of water parks but we thoroughly enjoyed it. A great variety of rides for all ages, and this bought out the kid in us, especially my husband who disappeared off to Wild Wadi whilst I relaxed by the pool. Looking at the queuing lines it appears to get rather busy so I would be careful when you chose to go. During the week it was really quiet. Lots of lifeguards as there are at Jumeriah Beach hotel and I have to praise them for the good job they do, very attentive.

Did I miss something?. I cannot explain how disappointed I am in wild wadi. After all these excellent reviews, I thought I was in for a real treat. We arrived from Madinet Jumeirah with complimentary access. We found a bed then set off to endure the slides. We went on two big slides then came across jumeirah scheriah then that was it! The lazy river was basically a ride but once you were shot up a hill once, the thrill was over. That was literally it! I would be extremely disappointed if I had paid £40 to get in. Luckily we could just leave losing only our time. Location is great and views outstanding , that's it
Wet and wild. The thrill of the rides, coupled with genuine courtesy of staff made my visit a memorable one. I would break the principle of not visiting a location more than once, with Wild Wadi!

wadi waste of time!!!. probably the worst water park av ever been too in my life, absoulte rubbish,terrible rides.how they can charge people to go in there I dont know, we got in for free and I still feel robbed.teRrible wave pool, boring slow slides. never again. wasted 1 hour of my holiday in there.

Good fun. Had a really god day at the waterpark, some really fun rides - try and look out for 2for1 offers as we used one of these and were happy to pay however not sure we would have been so thrilled with full price tickets!We spent half a day in the park - it gets really hot so make sure you drink pleanty as we didnt realise how hot we were until we came out of the water!

Over priced and smaller than expected. While we had a great time with our 2 year old, there is actually little to do for this age group. Feel conned by the VERY expensive entrance charge, given that once inside you still need to pay for lockers, food and drink.

Overrated and overpriced. Before we went to Wild Wadi we were so excited since the ads and everything said it would be an awesome experience.Well it wasn't.. there are not much rides and options to try. the rides are either short or boring and the place was dirty.Above all that they charge ridiculous amounts of money on regular things.Never again that is for sure.
Hold tight. A great day out and as it is part of the Jumeirah beach hotel, free and easy access makes it even better. Good food for those hungry moments but overall a must for kids and adults alike.

Filthy Wadi. We were enjoying our morning with our toddler in Wild Wadi children's pool , until a family of 7 arrived, removed their outdoor shoes by the water and entered the pool fully clothed. I don't mean those full body swim suits, they were in jeans, saris, cargo pants,belts, leggings and what have you and decided to "launder" their clothes in the children's pool, only one of them was a child. Four different lifeguards and other attendants asked them to leave the pool and to go change their clothes, but as the father decided to pretend to be deeply offended by this and argued with the personnel, the rest of the family sat in the pool soaking their dirty outer wear. None of the staff managed to get them out to get changed and an hour later they were still there. Looking around we started noticing more and more people in the pool in their outdoor clothes, even a baby buggy found its way in the pool. For an extortionate entrance fee , you would expect hygiene to be high on the list of things in WW, it's not. Won't be going there again. Yuk!

Average Experience. Spent the day at the park with my family (2 teenage daughters). After parting with £220 for admission for the day we found the park to be clean and tidy. It was a Friday so the park was busy and due to small area it takes up compared to the Atlantis water park it felt a little to busy. The rides were generally good with guide signs indicating the level of excitement, which on the whole were pretty accurate.After having spent a day at Atlantis water park we were a little surprised to find the water to be salt water and unheated. As with the other water parks in Dubai you have to pay extra for a locker and towels, which is a bit much bearing in mind the cost of entry. There were various food outlets that several different foods, pizza, BQ etc. the ones we tried were good and reasonably priced.Plus Points: The weather, the ridesNegatives: Price, could get cramped when busy, extra cost for lockers and towels
fun and safety. 200 staffmembers watching the guests for theyr savety and wellbeeing. Funny things to do and plenty of resting spaces. Cool location on the Jumeirah beach in front of the Burj!

A Fun Ride. Got in for free with staying at the JBH, so cannot coment on the price. It is not the biggest place, but what there is is good fun. The majority of the park has you following a set route getting pushed along at some speed by the water, with nothing too shocking in terms of slides. There are then a variety of other rides you get out and walk to, most of which don't last long but are great fun. With it being a small water park I can imagine things not being so great once it gets busy.

Nice water park, can get crowded and is relatively small. It was my first visit to Wild Wadi after I have been to another famous water park in Dubai a couple of times before.Let's start with the entry and pricing... we arrived by car and although it was public holiday and crowded I found the parking experience rather pleasant. The spots are pretty tight though and I have seen some bigger SUVs struggling to get in (one of the huge advantages when you are driving a small rental...). Pricing is steep with only one price for full day access (295 AED), other options would be a good idea (e.g. 4 hour ticket, reduced entry for early birds, online booking offers,...). The prices for 'add-ons' leave a bitter taste though...the base price is giving you entry only: you want to rent a towel? That's 35 AED (no, you cannot keep it afterwards). You want to lock your valuables? That's another 35 AED. Prices of food and drinks within the park are similarly high, a photo of you on the rides will set you back a whopping 150 AED (so if you are planning on having some pictures better bring your own GoPro or other cam).The park is relatively small and offers not as many rides as I expected based on my experiences with competitors' parks. Also the 'connected rides' are not as extensive as in the other park.Overall I had a nice day out but will probably look for an alternative next time in Dubai.
A THRILLING EXPERIENCE. Well managed Water Park and I feel there is room for more thrilling rides.The most scintillating one-Jumeirah Sceirah-please take this ride and have great fun.

This place is a hold-up!. This place was:- Too small- Terribly expensive (330 dhs / person)- Too crowded (waiting was at least 1/2 hour for each activity)- Not enough attractions and rides !!!!!We left after 1 hour and a half...
Brilliant Fun. We enjoyed our trip to this water park,water rides were great fun,very well organised staff,all areas were immaculate, would recommend to all ages, such a laugh.

A Great Day Out With 3 Young Kids. We spent a day at Wild Wadi during Eid this October (2014) with our 3 young children, aged 8, 6 & 2.All of us had a thoroughly brilliant time! We spent all day here and there was enough to keep all of the ages amused from the water play area and lagoon ride with the toddler to the surfing and 'thrill seeking' rides for the boys.Food is reasonably priced for an attraction such as this and the staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful.Free lifejackets were available for the kids (and adults if you needed them) and there are lifeguards everywhere. The park is very clean too and has the famous Burj Al-Arab as its backdrop.
Lots to do. World class and special mention to the great ride crew who hail from many nations but are all friendly. Go early to beat the heat and crowds would be my tip.

Need a swim. The park was under renovation when we came but their have great rides fro the family. I found the park no big enough for us but they have surfing jets and others rides that no other parks in Dubai provide.

Great Fun For All. Fantastic fun place in a hot day - rides for all grades, families and couples. The staff (line everyone we have met in Dubai so far) are so helpful and friendly. If you stay at Jumeriah Hotels entry is complimentary which makes it even better ! The Burj Al-Arab makes for a great backdrop.
Good fun. Nice time to spare on summertime, avoid weekends and let them know if you are resident to get discount.
Excellent. Fantastic day out and great fun. Make sure you get a 2for1 voucher to make it better value for money.

Splash-tastic Fun. Only 15mins taxi commute, which was really cheap compared to taxi fares within the UK, to get there from our hotel. Staff were very helpful in explaining all the various price packages & we did not feel pressured to pick a specific package. Park is nicely laid out with plenty of shaded areas. Would advise people to keep flip-flops or sandals readily available as the floor gets extremely hot & can burn the soles of your feet.

Great. These have it sussed! Most rides, you don't even have to get up and que! you just point to what ride you want to go and and they take you right there! some of course you have to walk up. But the emirates have it sussed. I hardly queued at all. Perfect

Exactly what you need...some refreshing rides. What you see is what you get: nice refreshing and cool water rides, excellent recreation when you are in the hot Dubai sun.There are some rides without tubes, however for most rides you lie down on a tube and you are channeled through pools to the next tube.In my opinion, the stand-alone rides, such as the very high slides, from which you were launched, were the best.Another thing is that when you sit on the tubes, it is sometimes difficult to stay balanced and actually I fell off one time. Not only was this an unpleasant experience, I was also thoroughly interrogated by the staff why I had fallen off and they didn't believe me when I said I hadn't done it on purpose. In short I felt a bit humiliated and treated like a child and this felt a bit awkward.3-4 hours hours is enough, but if you stay and relax at the pool you can always enjoy more.

A day of endless fun. We have been to the Jumeirah hotels and every time we go we make the most of the wild wadi with our 3 children. They never seem to tire of it! We can't wait to go back again in December!!

Great Sized Water Park with Stunning Views. Wild Wadi is the perfect size water park to spend a whole day, without feeling run-ragged. The rides range in thrill level, and a large wave-pool is fun for the whole family.Several seating areas have direct views onto the ocean and the Burj Al Arab hotel. Views from the highest rides let one look across most of Dubai.Make sure to use coupons from the Entertainer to save on entrance costs, and share a locker as one is large enough for bags of 3-4 people.Water shoes are recommended (though they must be removed for the most intense solo-tube rides) as the ground gets very hot and slippery. Also, water shorts will come in handy for women, as the tube rides shoot you uphill, resulting in major swimsuit shifting...

The best time. We visited the park twice during our week long holiday. And it's just the best, the rides are amazing from the Jumeirah sceirah to the lazy river there is something to do for people of all ages.The walk in beach style wave pool is the perfect place to sit and relax after adrenalin rush of the rides. It's just great fun.

Fun for the big kids too!. We stated at Al Qasr LN the Madinat and had free access to Wild Wadi. As adults we didn't really know what to expect, but after a long haul flight there is nothing better than floating in a rubber tyre around a water theme park that shoots you up and down without much effort on your part. It is so much fun and an amazing place to take kids. Although you wouldn't be able to get them to leave!!
5. Good park! But very many people! The amazing river, end dangerous exciting attraction! I screamed all my voice! Very very like this! Good either for the families)

A good fun day. I loved it! My first time at a water park. So much fun! It was designed well, easy to use, friendly staff, plenty of lockers, good, clean facilities and queues moved quickly. Could do with a few more shaded areas as the heat is oppressive, but plenty of food and drink facilities and rest areas. A great day out.

Superb!. Great place for both children and adults!
You're totally immersed in atmosphere of relaxation and childhood.
I advise to visit this park for the hole day!

Fantastic Time. We arrived here by 10:30am and there was no queues at all, we were 2 adults 1 child of 7yrs but because of hight he paid full adult price. We were given option of getting a medium locker for 50dhm and food on the watch swipe thing. Got in settled in and found it was already busy, we enjoyed all the slides. The speed slide is not for the faint hearted,was a long way walking up and the grounds are very very hot so take some pool shoes for children(must) and adults if you can. We tried the Tuntrum Alley and may oh may was it fun, i would highly suggest to the management to take pictures just before taking of and customers can buy them like all the rest. The Juhar family area is wonderful for small kids. There was a good restaurant with plenty to eat and choose from. There is also a shop where you can buy just about any pool stuff you need including children. Family pictures are all available but at an affordable price. Overall it was very pricey, we paid for 1 medium locker, food for two adults and 1child. 2 pictures as souvenirs and 1 fish pedicure which was 40dhm, 1 small bottle of water, and 3 slashes total 1800dhm equivalent to £300. Yes its expensive but worth the fun. I wouldn't bother getting a locker as we ended up taking our stuff out and putting everything close to us,everyone around us did the same and all was safe. I will highly state that the customer service was absolutely spot on, they were all very nice and kind. Very helpful and kept an eye on everyone,helped kids and adults wear there safety jackets on the Breaker Bay area where the pool has waves. Everyone smiled and seemed to enjoy doing there job,i talked in length to a few girls at the restaurant and they seemed happy to work there. Will differently come back again,thank you very much for your hospitality. If you have kids and in Dubai,you have to go there.

Great day out. Visited the park on the first day of the holiday. Really great way to get used to the Dubai heat.Some very good rides for me (thrill seeker) and my girlfriend (much less thrill) to enjoy. The wave riders are very good fun as the lifeguards there provide some excellent tuition.Would defiantly visit again.
Great time. Had a lovely time with my 3 young granddaughters. Staff were lovely. Not crowded so was great with young children.

Pretty good. Beat the heat at this place. I've been to numerous water parks in the Midwest USA (4 bears in Michigan, Soak City at Cedar Point, etc.) So not much new to see here, but it's good and its safe.

Had a wet whale of a time!. Went as a family and had a great time. Thursday afternoon is a good time to go and one probably really does not need much more than 4 hours. It is quite a small place and when we went the queues were almost non-existent so very little waiting, which meant we were able to experience most of the rides quickly. More suited for those with older children or at least over 1.1 metres in order to benefit from the more exciting rides.It is difficult to highlight which was the best "ride", but in my opinion the Jumeirah Sceira was the best. Although my children voted for other rides. All in all the experience was well worth it and very popular. During the holiday periods and weekends it could be a slower experience, but weekday afternoons seem to be the best times to go. One point to note is that speedos for men are not advisable, in fact they might not even be permitted. Best to wear shorts.

Lots of fun. Fun packed water park well worth a visit. Free if you are staying in any of the Jumeriah hotels which is a really nice touch. Plenty of food options. Perhaps lacking a little shade in the midday sun. Plenty of easy to use lockers.
Very good. We were there all day and we had fun.we have a child 5 yers old that she wants to go buck in Dubai next year only for this place.good job.
A great half day. We got in for free as we were staying at the DAM. Some great rides for all the family. Good luck with the surfing simulator, I made a big of a fool of myself!
Where Adults can be Kids Again!!!. Great fun, you never stop laughing, my wife and I have been lots of times, we love it. A must do in Dubai.

Get fresh at Wild Wadi. A truly great experience and fantastic opportunity to cool down while in hot Dubai. Rides are great and some actually relaxing down the lazy river. My expectations were that of a larger and more varied park but once being there I realised it is more compact (and therefore manageable!) than I thought. In just over 2 hours I managed all the fun. So i guess it was a fantastic opportunity and worth the visit even if entry and facility prices are on the high side of things. A must when in Dubai.
not only for kids. we stayed in Al Qasr, so free admission in Wild WadiFun for young and old.Its so nice to see the lifeguards are treating you so sweet!Rides are really very spectacular, and fun

Probably an amazing place for kids. I went there with my gf and it was fun and all but not amazing. The place is kind of overpriced and the food is really terrible. All service is good and staff is nice. There are amazing views of Burj al arab and other hotels. The rides are really cool but the lines are soooooo long.

I could stay here all day.......every day. Ah I love this park great fun, especially when the wife goes down the dark tunnel and screams her head off, great service by all staff very friendly made to feel very welcomethe rides are great, I especially enjoyed the Jumeirah Sceirah good facilities good food and the gift shop is reasonably priced

A fun day out. Had a great day. No line ups for any rides made it more enjoyable. A lot smaller all around than Atlantis. Rides smaller, park is smaller and of couse price is smaller. Still worth going too. Beware food is not allowed to be taken into the park - not even an apple

Excellent. We stayed at the jumeirah beach hotel and it was great to have the Wadi Wild Water park as part of the hotel. The water park was the main reason why we booked the hotel because I knew my daughter would really enjoy it and I was right. We hope to return as soon as possible

Amazing. We visited the Wild Wadi Water Park on the final day of our stay in Dubai. We are both in our thirties but had a nightmare stay at our hotel in Dubai so needed some cheering up! When you stay at a Jumeirah hotel you get free entry to the water park (which is really welcome as it would have cost about £80 for 2 adults) The park is incredible - we went on all the rides including the super scary Jumeirah sceirah - a vertical drop, travelling at about 80km/h - which takes about 10 seconds if that! The park is really well maintained and organised and if I had children I wouldn't hesitate in taking them. The changing rooms are clean and you are given a wristband you load money onto so you don't have to carry any money around with you.The rides are all awesome! There are the intense thrill rides like the sceirah and tantrum alley, the thrill rides like the Burj Surj and the incredible 'Master Blaster' that blasts you in a rubber ring on up and down around 11 slides that go around the entire park - we were like big kids all day and all the rides have the stunning Burj Al Arab looming in the background so its quite scenic too! The food is okay too - nothing gastronomically amazing - just burgers and chips, nuggets etc - but it isn't too expensive.A great day out - I would definitely visit again.

Fun Day. Very good water park with everything you need, and something for everyone. Rides are great fun and easy to access. lovely surroundings and seating areas are very clean and tidy. Would visit again.

Fun and relaxing. We visited the Wild Wadi Water Park with our two children There were things to be done by all of us from the big slides to little play area for the smaller children Staff were very friendly and just wanted to please us and make our stay even more comfortableThe kids had so much fun that we could not get them out of there A fun day out for both adults and children

The best aquapark in the world. I read that the Wild Wadi is the best aquapark in the wolrd, and I did not belive it! But it is true! I have to see it once again in my life! Very smart solutions for having fun to everybody. Like children, adults, grandma's . Those wo are not as brave for the adrenalin adventures, and those who are adrenalin fun! Amazing adventure for me this day in Wild Wadi. They know how many ways you can enjoy the water!

ladies night - fab. Loved the ladies night, starts at 8pm and finishes at 12pm. You will need a good 3 hours there minimum to fully enjoy it. As it was the ladies night hardly any queues, all women run amazing, plenty of food and drink around, lockers should be free but have to pay 35 dirhams for one locker. Need more showers, staff are very freindly. MAIN PROBLEM: They should keep the ladies night open after September, that is not fair for the ladies, as I want to travel to dubai in November when it is cooler but I won't get the ladies night, So please please please run the ladies night open after September. Thank you

Amazing. The waterpark has many rides and there all so much fun! There for people that love danger to be honest. Theres great foods there and many friendly people. The waves was so much fun,everyone was dancing to music and it was one amazing time,make sure you go there!
Amazing watermark. Relaxing place to have fun with the kids, it's a safe and fun place to be. My daughter is absolutely in love with wild wadi.

A very good day out.. In my view this is so much better than the other overhyped water park in Dubai. There is a lot more to do and enjoy here. There are rides to suit all ages. The wave pool is amazing and definately a positive for the park and there a a lot more rides for the young ones. Like other parks you pay tor the locker and towels.

A good day out.... Still a good day out but much preferred Atlantis Aquaventure. Wild Wadi was very busy and difficult to find a sunlounger even though it was off season. Food was expensive too on top of the cost to get in, pay to hire a locker and pay to hire towels. The rides were fun but not a relaxing 'lazy river'.

excellent park. stayed at jumeriah hotel and had free access to the wild wadi, didn't have much time at the resort, but visited the waterpark for about 3hours and its very nice park, I found it very confusing to get around and about, it wasn't very well mapped, we went round in circles quite a bit and ended up in the same places often looking for rides, its hard to find the start of the rides, was quite frustrating when the weather is so hot and all you want to do is dip in

Nice park nice view. Right near the Burj Al Arab, a nice water park to visit if you r in Dubai in summers. Nice rides, decent food. Though I always find water parks messy. Don't miss the 'drop', your heart will mss a beat.

110 cm Gestapo police. My son was 5 cm under the height limit for all of the cool rides so it was a little disappointing. It's a tightly run park with plenty of lifeguards watching your every move so it's a bit restrictive from what we were use to. Also a bit pricey but worth it if your there for a good part if the day and use all the rides. Key tip. The main ride starts at the bottom so you can't just pick up a tube and walk to the top you should therefore do the main ride before 12 to avoid the ques. And don't take any hats glasses or shoes to the scary tunnel ride at the top because you will have to walk back up to pick them up.

Cooling down under the desert sun. We visited wild wadi water park and wow what a brilliant day we had.Everything was so well organised with plenty of staff about including lifeguards.Plenty of rides to suit all ages.There were 3 places to do surf boarding each one more difficult than the last.Well worth a visit when visiting dubai

Still fantastic!. Third time here and still never fails to impress. Brilliant attractions for all levels of bravery! I enjoyed scaring myself several times on the water slide, From getting inside the 'launch pod' to hearing the countdown to the evential release and thinking I'm scared but dont have time to be scared and just trying to get my breath back before the rapid deceleration at the bottom. Brilliant! If I can do it at 45 years of age anyone can do it. I loved it and will come back again next time I'm in Dubai.
Great fun with kids!. Great day out and good value with the Entertainment vouchers. Give the nibbling fish spa a good, couldn't stop giggling all x4 of us!

Nice park. We went on a Sunday (planned so that it wouldn't be there weekend over there so hopefully it would be quieter)Which it was we arrived at around 11 and wasnt too busy, by around 3 it started to get busier i.e having to que for rides. We got a deal on cobone where we paid about £30 for entrance and a free meal. Lockers cost AED35 for a small locker which we managed to squeeze 2 bags in there. overall nice clean park, a few bits under maintenance but still plenty to do.
best water attraction. very nice water park, great attractions, fun events, i loved the surfing waves games , food was ok , a must visit

So much fun!!. One of my favourite water park, perfect for the whole family, with so many attractions, and nice restaurants.I even organised my son's birthday there: it is really safe with all the life guards checking the guests at all time in all possible corner.

Great day out for a family with young kids. So well aimed at families. Life vests everywhere for free, so well staffed, there was always someone at hand to assist and all were so willing and helpful. The wristband/watch loaded with cash was a fantastic idea so you didn't have to carry your wallet around. We had an 8 year old and a 3 year old and there was so much to do for both. Neither got bored. So good we're going again. Didn't plan to but we all so wanted to. Just make sure you have dry clothes to go home in as taxi drivers very fussy about wet/damp clothes.

soo much fun for a family. I liked all the activities and I would suggest one goes as early as possible and stay till closing time to get the best value for money spent. The things are a bit expensive though so be prepared.

Awsome!!!. Wow I am already a bit older but I had really fun there with my friend. We came around noon time which is enough time until they Close at 7 pm unless you also like to lay down and relax. We went from one attraction to the other and all of them were cool. I wished there would have been the one or the other more thrilling attraction but it was great. ONLY big minus is the entrance price. About 60 Euros is just too much. But besides that I can strongly recommand to visit this park.
WET. Great way to spend a DayWas included in Hotel cost.Wear a rashie if possible.Get there early to avoid queues

Wild day. This is a great place to spend time at. It is extremely safe with lots of things to try out. Loads of loungers spread around the site, so even when it's busy, you are not crammed in. You will get wet!!!

Not value for money. After hearing the statement of wild wadi as the best in the UAE we left today feeling disappointed. At 275 dirham entry made it more expensive than its competitors yas water world and aqua-adventure the palm. There where 2 rides that I would say gave me a buzz and some excitement the rest where ok. The big problem tho is the rides that push you along when in a 2 man or 1 man ring. There wasn't enough power to push me and my friend up and the ride had to be stopped as we came back down highly embarrassing when people start laughing as we where stuck. And at 12 stone each I expected it to have worked no people at the other parks. All in its an ok day but the price compared to Yas water world it's not great at all.

Great Waterpark with some adventurous rides !!. Wild Wadi is what you will hear from any adviser when you visit Dubai in summer, being a regular tourist to Dubai, I will say that everyone visiting Dubai should visit it but don't keep your expectations way too high, which happened to me, don't get me wrong, it has some great rides lilke TANTRUM ALLEY, JUMEIRAH SCEIRAH and WHITE WATER but that's about it, although these rides are worth your money, it isn't the best water park in the world, just a fun place to be with so many cultures simultaneously present in Dubai.
Best Water Park in the World. I love this place been 4 times before never get tired of it even though am a grown adult..lol Anyone with kids this is a defo place to go

Lovely Desert Oasis. A water park is probably the one attraction you would not expect to see in the middle of the desert. However, it's the most clever and wonderful thought. I enjoyed cooling off in the tidal wave pool. The park also had some incredible rides for all ages and levels of thrill seekers. They don't call it Wild for nothing. Be sure to carry additional money for lockers, towel rentals, and souvenir purchases. And make sure to pack loads of sunscreen. It's hot out there!!!!

Superb theme park in town. There are 2 theme water parks in dubai, amongst both wild wadi is my favorite because of its exciting slides to ride and unforgettable water park experience, i suggest plan your trip on weekdays to avoid queues.

Amazing. A water park not to be missed when in Dubai. Although it was hot, the water was cool enough to make you enjoy it. Rides for all the family and friendly and helpful staff especially first aiders!

WILD WADI WATER PARK. This park i feel has been inspired by Wetn'Wild in Orlando Florida.Nevertheless it's a beautiful water park with excellent water rides and adventures of different sorts.If you are into water sports,don't miss it when you come to Dubai!

What a fun way to end the holiday . If you stay in any of the Jumeirah resorts entrance is free. Great way to unwind after visiting the town. My two favourites was burj surge. 110m drop at speeds I couldn't even imagine. You step into a capsule. Count down from 3 and the trap door opens and you fall vertically down for about 25m before you finally start feeling the slide under your back. Adrenaline pumping so hard your hands shake for minutes afterwards. The second is tantrum ally. A raft ride down chutes where at some points the raft lifts so high up the tunnel you think you going to fall over. Great fun but the rest of the park is more for kids.

Fun even for Grown ups. Water so much cooler than the ocean - great layout so it was easy to get around and not too hot. Queues on a Thursday not a problem. BurJ Surje a real favourite. Can't help but smile! FUN

Compact but a great day out !!. I went here in Sep quite late in the evening around 6:30pm the queues for rides were minimal to nil we completed the whole park in an hour and half with some rides doing twice. The rides are excellent and definitely worth visiting, I have read some of the reviews and I do understand it isn't as big as wet and wild but the safety here is second to none there are life guards everywhere an I mean everywhere! And that to me is the most important thing with children.

Best Water Park I Have Every Been To. Visited with family 2 boys 7,6. Everyone had a brilliant time and lots of fun. You load money onto a watch you wear so everything else can be stored in lockers. Drinks,food,gifts etc can all be paid for using the watch type fobs. Great for the kids as they can toddle off for ice cream,drinks etc with no worries. Make sure you have a go and the water shoot ride that sends you around the edge of the park. Best laugh we have had in years. Lifeguards are everywhere and there is a large wave pool with hundreds of life vests for the kids of every size so they can enjoy the waves. Make sure you do the rides etc early on as we found around 3pm it got very busy with the locals. We visited this and the Atlantis and we all preferred wild wadi but maybe that may be the ages of the kids as most reports said the Atlantis was better but ages of kids were a little older. Worth noting that keep applying sun lotion as it gets rubbed off with all the rides. either that or buy the swim tops as they are factor 30/50 resistant.
What a great day!!!. MUST GO!!! What a great day - something for all ages. Best water park I have been to so far!! We loved the wave machine for the surf!

Way too pricey!. Wild Wadi is awesome, no debate there. The rides are awesome in the desert heat. However, I went in 2010 and it was about $30-35 usd per person. Now it's more than double that. They charge $10 to rent one small locker, and another $10 to rent a towel. Those photos they take on the slides? Don't get too attached because they cost $30 per print. All of this left a sour taste in my mouth and my once fave water park is no more. I won't be back.
best attraction in dubai. There is no better attraction in Dubai. Burj surj, Jumeira sceirah, tantrum alley all were wonderful. Will visit again on nest visit.
Never disappoints. This is the fourth time I've visited and it didn't disappoint. Only downfall is that it's quite pricey. Lockers worked out around £7 and food expensive too

Not very big .... We went to this water park as we had free tickets. If we had paid I would of been a little bit disappointed as there is not many rides and it is not very big. We did have fun on the rides which were there but there's not much of a variety.

Go on a weekday. The Middle East, although an open city, remains to be a conservative country. If you do not enjoy men gawking at you in your bikini or asking to take photos with you then avoid this place during weekends. Same goes for public beaches.

Great family fun. Brought my kids here and they absolutely love it!!! it is huge and lots of fun rides for adults too. They provide free goggles and life jackets even free water diapers for the infants. Food in the area isnt great though - dont have much options available.

it was fun!!. i've been here twice, my first visit was about 4 years ago and the 2nd one was 2months back. there's an improvement but not a lot I guess u shoud add more rides and different slides so that it will be more fun and enjoyable!! but me and my friends had so much fun! thanks!

Great day out. Fun fun fun amazing for all the family or just big kids with no children very clean food not bad either the layout of the park is great and the slides are brilliant cant wait to go back
very expensive. very expensive to go , you need to pay 290 dhs for each . if family not easy to go. they should re-check the fee for this place.

If you love thrills and water you will love this. We received daily free entry to this park as part of our recent visit to the Jumeirah complex (Dar Al Masyaf Madinat Jumeirah - brilliant review to follow) courtesy of Jumeirah and the people who have been finding our trails for over thirty years. We had a great time although we did not visit on a daily basis (the first visit took two days to get the lactic acid out of my system - I am finally realising that I am getting a little old for vertical slides, although the lazy river is wonderful). You can get a fabulous tan here, but always remember to be careful, especially with little ones. If you have to pay it is still worth it - there is something for the whole family here, and it is great and actually not expensive day out.

Awesome wild water park. Awesome wild water park. The rides are really nice and exciting. Watch out you do not get sunburned when you're all day in the park. The food and drinks in the park are expensive, so do take enough money with you.

This place is just brilliant fun. Spent a whole day just whizzing down the slides, rapids and drifting along the lazy river. Great fun for all ages - spent the day laughing and getting a great tan in the water. Really enjoyable and as we used our vouchers to get in we only paid for one of us ( Dubai Entertainer ) Recommend you go for it !!!

Wild time @ Wadi!. My husband and I really enjoyed our time at this waterpark. The views are amazing of the coast, looking over the Burj Al Arab. With so many options of waterparks to choose from, we were happy with our day spent at Wild Wadi! It has the 'coldest' wave like ocean in the whole of the UAE, and in summer, it was like striking gold to find something this cool and refreshing! We loved the slides, and had the best day together. We would recommend it. There is something for everyone!
Excellent fun. What a great time with our family. The price is worth the fun. Very safe with lots of lifeguards. Highly recommended.

A water park like no other!. My family had a brilliant morning here, although only lasted half the day as it was just so hot! Floor is super hot so wear flipflops that you don't mind getting wet!! Will definitely go again!

Very enjoyable day out. What a great day out (for 2 adults who didn't want to visit the mall). The park is well organised and the queues for the rides are not too bad. The most we waited was probably about 10 minutes. Buy your tickets online for quicker park entry. Some tips: don't wear a necklace if you're going on the speed slide (it has to be removed). The ground gets quite hot if your feet aren't wet - be warned. Some people wear sunglasses and flip-flops. Put some credit on your wristband if you think you might want lunch/drink - it's SO much more convenient that going back to the locker rooms. There aren't a lot of maps around. The taxi drop-off can get a bit congested so get dropped off at the souq or nearby and just walk up. Such a fun time.
Brilliant place, so safe, so friendly & wow!. Safe, friendly, well organised and never experienced anything like it - fab view of the burj Arab. Florida just doesn't compare to this!

A Fun Day Out. A really fun day out for all ages. As a guest of the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, unlimited entry is free of charge. Hence, I can't comment on the cost of entry. The park has wave pools, a lazy river, water slides, racing slides, waterfalls, water chutes, sun loungers, kids area, places for snacks, and so on. As it's the UAE, there is a ladies only night once a week. So check your dates. Although it usually starts late evening, with little impact to the parks normal opening hours. Enjoy

water fun for all. great day out
defo prefer this than Atlantis Aquaventure
there are a lot of 2-for-1 vouchers around for Wild Wadi so keep your eyes open (eg on back of receipts etc), makes it even more worthwhile if its cheaper

Dont bother, got to Aquaventure instead. Recently stayed at the Jumeirah Beach hotel so had complementary access to Wild Wadi. What a disappointment especially after visiting Aquaventure at Atlantis.I visited with my husband and 2 small toddlers. The wait for a couple of double doughnuts with a child seat in each took over 15 minutes. That's 15 minutes of standing waiting & watching the spare doughnuts go round looking for what we needed. There just aren't enough.The water is cold. This may be a good thing if you're boiling in the Dubai heat but its almost too cold. The concrete walls & base of the channels tear your feet apart. Its jam packed & the queues take forever & those queues are not pleasant. We'd just spent 4 days at Atlantis where entry to Aquaventure is complementary and what a difference. If WW is the only water park you visit you may be impressed but do yourself a favour & visit Aquaventure for a truly amazing experience.There was one particular event that wrote WW off completely for us. A child defecated in the childrens play area in Wild Wadi. The staff on patrol evacuated the area & turned the water off in the area. The life gaurds told us 'safety test'. I felt it was well handled at the scene although a child was allowed to wander around not wearing any pants in the lead up to the event. If the child, or childs parents, had been told that the child cannot enter the area without wearing pants then the situation may have been minimised.My family left the park straight afterwards as were not keen to enter the water again & a staff member at the exit asked if we had enjoyed our time. I replied 'no because a child had defecated in the pool'. The staff member laughed at me and joked about 'poo in the pool'. I was very serious with her & said that its disgusting & we are leaving because its unsanitary now. Once again she laughed and didn't understand my concern. She should have taken my complaint seriously. We had 3 days to access WW and did not go back. Instead enjoyed the pool at Jumierah Beach hotel.
Great wet fun. Loved most of it. Fun for both swimmers and non swimmers. Hated expensive photos and the shops. Take in your everything!
Wild wadi water park. Best water park, my kids loved it and cannot wait to go there again.Good easy rides for all the family. Great views of the Burj al Arab and Jumeira beach hotel.

So much fun. It was the most adventure I had in Dubai, breath taking loops and please try the Jumeirah Sceira. Also go loaded with cash to pay for food, locker rooms and photography. Take an average of 500 AED

Great water park. Well set up waterpark, I have visited a number around the world and this ranks up there with the best. There weren't huge line ups, food options were good and affordable and plenty of different ride options from thrill seeker to easy rider. There is an area set up for kids and the wave pool is good fun. My wife and I felt a little uncomfortable with some of the European tourists sporting bikinis, given you are in an arab country it would be respectful to cover up somewhat. Great way to keep cool during summer.

Had so much fun!!. We had a blast at wild wadi!! The rides are soooper cool and fun!! Must visit with friends. Please make sure to carry shorts without any buttons or chain poking out. Coz u make not be allowed to climb on the rides and end up buying super costly shorts from the shop inside the park. the entry fee to the park was AED 250 but I had to spend AED 225 for a normal shortss :(

Good but not enough rides.. Although we stayed till the end which was about 7pm, I thought there were not enough in the way of rides. We spent most of our time at the wave machine but saying that we did really enjoy our time at Wild Wadi.

Great Day Activity. Wild Wadi was a great time. I went with my girl friends and we were entertained all day and felt like kids again. Price is great and it's just as good as the big places without the crazy crowds. They have enough rides to keep you entertained and great sections for kids and people of all types. The slides are definitely a thrilling ride and it took a bit of convincing to get us all up there ;)

Great Day for all ages. 11 of us spent an afternoon here ages from 21-65 and there was fun for everyone. The wave pool and lazy river is where the older adults spent most of their time but did branch out and do some of the slides. The younger adults walked around the entire park and rode all of the slides and water rides. Bikinis were worn at the park, but I would recommend taking a tank top if wearing a bikini out of respect for the Arab culture. It is not required but respectful.

Fantastic. What a fabulous place, you can spend the whole day there well into the evening, as it is lit up at night. The rides are great fun, plenty places to eat, plenty of places to relax also and just soak up the sun and relax!.
good to try. there is a lot of aqua games and you can enjoy your trip more in this area i have gone to this place 3 times and i will do it again
The best water park in UAE. It's certainly the best water park in UAE , well organized , clean ... If you're looking for a well spent day , you found it .

Fun. Loved the rides, great staff. very friendly and really helpful.
Food is a little expensive inside so be prepared to spend!!

Fun for all ages. This water park is the best I have ever been. The bodyboard attractions were my favourite. The employees are very keen to learn you how to do it.
You also have to try the Jumeirah Sceirah slide. Just awesome

beautiful waterpark. This water park is connected to Jumeirah Beach hotel and madinet jumeirah.. It is still nice though looks a little old..make sure to purchase your tickets prior visiting through your hotel or online or you will end up standing in many hours line..tip: don't go on weekends go through week days less crowded and if you are staying in a Jumeirah hotel the wild wadi water park entrance is complimentary

Wild Wadi not so wild. Definitely more of a family water park. Only 3 thrill rides (in my opinion.) Park clean. Loungers cushioned and comfortable. Plenty of shade. Food and drink good and reasonably priced. Wasn't busy when we went so no queues. Overall a good day out.

the best waterpark in dubai. I rate this waterpark better than the atlantis, you don't have to carry a massive rubber ring around with you everywhere & the floor is not hot there - very important when travelling in aug!

Great water park fantastic slides and great. great water parkI had free entry because i stayed at madinat jumeirah al qasrlots of things to do even if you dont like water slidesits a great way to spend the day in the heatthey have special days where they have women only and special days where only families are allowed so look out for theseover all a great attraction
Great fun but over price. A great day to spend in this water park. Amazing rides but you have to wait long to get the rides. Most amazing fun is water surfing & artificial waves

Cool Off on a Hot Day Here. When it is hot in Dubai this is the place to go. You can relax by the wave pool, or you can ride the many thrilling rides. Jeumerirah Sceirah was thrilling when they close the shield and count backwards your heart pounds, then the floor drops out. Also enjoyed Tantrum Alley was a fun with the group of four. We also enjoyed the Master Blaster as well. Get there early and get a chair near the wave pool then enjoy your day. there are lockers to lock you stuff away, you also can load money on your wristband so you don't have carry money around. You do that at the gate when you go in. If you don't use it the money is refunded.

Great day out. Arrived early so loads of vacant sunbeds. Used a 2 for 1 voucher out of the entertainer Dubai book so got in for half price really.The water here was the coldest anywhere in Dubai!!! Was lovely getting in to the water.Some of the slides in this water park interlink with each other so you get on a ring at the bottom of one slide and you are whisked up and around and down and up and around and down loads of times. What a great way of doing the slides!!Got a refillable drinks cup so after paying for the cup all fizzy refills were 5 AED or you could just fill up on free water - this was a great idea..... As it is so hot you are drinking all the time.Some great slides in this waterpark - A really enjoyable day. Would definitely recommend a visit here.
Good fun. Went on a Saturday and it was heaving by early afternoon but apart from that we had a great time. Had long queues for most slides and was slightly over priced but still good fun

Standards Slipping but still great fun. I recently went there for the fourth time and the rides are still amazing -some (like the giant slide) are better than before. However I noticed that while most of the staff are still really happy and helpful and make the experience great - there are quite a few exceptions. Previously all staff seemed really fit, sporty and very people-oriented - whereas now some seemed disinterested in both what they were doing and the customers, which affects the experience.Another thing is the price-gouging. You pay a lot to get into this park, and food, drink (including water) and other things like sun screen are EXTREMELY expensive. Just plain nasty to pay $40 for a small bottle of sunscreen for example. Finally, the pavements and walkways used to be always damp and this helped reduce the heat on your feet. This time many of the walkways were dry and it was easy to burn your feet. Having whinged though, I still had a great time and would go back again

Wild Summer. I love the place itself. Never stops to amaze us everytime we visit. Its one of my recommended place in Dubai, especially when your staying in the city. When you start entering the place, you dont wanna go out!!! The water slides are all amazing!!

Hot, hot, hot!. Only place to keep cool in Dubai besides the air-conditioned shopping malls. Best leaving everything in the lockers and going about freely. Might even bump into the odd celeb at this place. Great rides and restaurants dotted all around the park. Worth spending the whole day here.

Fun to the maximum limit!. Be ready for a lot of fun by going to wild wadi, been to it over 5 times and each time is amazing, rides are very cool, very well maintained, staff are kind and you will have a blast by going there, in weekends it might becrowded but aside from that in summer or even winter wild wadi is a great choice and you will never regret it
best water park. wild wadi is the best water park in dubai .it is old but very fun .all the staff are helpful.i visited other two water park in dubai but i do not get best experiences like wild wadi.

Dubai Wild Wadi. when then opened it, it was the first, it was unique and it was sooooo much fun (and still).after that, they open Atlantis and Yas water world.Comparing wild wadi to Atlantis (the nearest one), it's more cozy, smaller, and you don't have to walk alot between ride unlike Atlantis the big.I found it amazing and fun
Fun Waterpark. Wild Wadi is a fun waterpark. The suggested season would be spring. Its too hot to go in summers as there is limited shade, so take lots of sunblock and have lots of fun!
Get Wild at the indoor Wadi. Ohh... I would say that this mini sized indoor water theme park will make you go wild once you start exploring each rides.

Adventurous!. Thrilling rides and we have so much fun that day. The souvenirs slight expensive, we really like the two rides that arart from the top i forgot the names of those may I'll call it sick ride if your a beginner it was fun and we'd enjoy it from the most.

A must visit water park if only to escape the emerates heat. Staying wet but cool in Dubai heat great day off with family. Very good vows from the top of the big water slides even if they are almost virticle.
wild wadi waterpark. Its a good place for family who loves swimming,, great slides,, summer is the best time to visit,,,,

Great water park. Excellent for children and adults of all abilities. Variety of water slides and water activities for all ages from the super new slide to the lazy river. Plenty of sing or double rings available for the lazy river or a selection of slides. Plenty of water safety jackets available. Food and drinks available at the water park. Ideal for a great day out.

Love it! Heart wants to be there again!. We were a group of friends and really enjoyed the day! All the rides in the park one are better to another. Getting a chance in Jumeirah Sceirah is time taking but experience is great! Burj Surj and Tantrum alley are really pumped the adrenaline but also great fun if you are a group! Wipeout and riptide is for veteran surfers but nice to experiences the power of water.Entire park is well maintained and enormously landscaped.

Wild wadi visit. Went to wild wadi with family. It is relatively small and can be congested. The lines were relatively small (competition from aquaventure and yas water world). There is enough for kids and adults. Food prices are exorbitant. Recommend taking snacks. With children 6 hours are enough. Again park prices are steep and coupons or deals are recomended

Nice place once in a while. I have been at Wild Wadi Waterpark with my son in June and had a great time. However the surf wave attraction wasn't working due to some maintenance which was not mentioned at the entrance.I woudl highly recommend a visit during the week since the park is to crowded on weekends. Also avoid regional public holidays otherwise you might end up waiting one hour for a single ride.Food offers could be more healthy and is basically limited to pizza and burgers.Have a splashy day

Dont wear expensive swimwear!. Had a great time at Wild Wadi even though we had no kids with us! I must say it is a very expensive day out and couldn't believe we had to pay extra for a locker when we got there!It's not an easy park to find your way around, we got a bit lost and couldn't locate where we left our shoes! I would recommend wearing flip flops which you can take off and leave on a shoe rack by each ride otherwise you will burn your feet.We had a really great time and laughed till our sides hurt.One thing I will mention is I would think twice about going on the Jumeirah Sceirah which is one of the scariest rides there. I managed to rip a big hole in my bikini bottoms on the ride, luckily I had bought a spare pair. I was also left with a very painful friction burn at the bottom of my back which is still sore and weeping. It is agony to sit down. I saw really small children going on this ride so for this reason I would think twice about going on this one. But there are plenty of others!Overall we are glad we went and it is a great way to get out of the August heat.
Great water park. Great slides, brilliant wave pool. However could do with more seating as young children need to be in the shade quite a bit. Fast food - very tasty!

We were not disappointed!. We actually went to Dubai to go to this park after seeing it on TV about 8 years ago... and we were not disappointed! The weather in March was about 26 Celsius so we wore short sleeved wet suits.... and we were the ONLY ones in the park with them! But we were very comfortable in temperature. We arrived about 11am and left about 5pm. We bought tickets at the gate. If you stay at Jumeriah properties you get free entry. There are lockers for rent. You must buy food there. There are lots of slides and rides , including surf rider type wave rides where you lie on a boogie board and try to ride a 'wave'. These are all included in the price. There is a large wave pool where most people had on flotation devices! Coming from an island, we take it for granted that everyone knows how to swim......The best part was the 11 slides that are connected by jets that push you uphill up each slide so you can sit on the tube the whole time. It was fabulous. We also went on the speed slide that went straight down.... I think most of the men were amazed to see two young girls (7 and 9 yrs) on this ride but they loved it. They were able to go on every ride. Can't wait to go back next time... hopefully in hotter weather!

Great aquapark for adults. Big territory, has 1-2 really extreme attractions for adults, not enough attractions or pools for smaller children (under 3 years old). - It is not permitted to bring own food, but there are some overpriced places to have lunch or drinks inside aquapark.- 1-2 smoking areas do exist.- Be careful when exiting this aquapark (I accidently leaved pair of shoes while leaving, but when I tried to come back for them in 5 minutes, cleaning guys couldn't find them).

Great fun and a must when visiting Dubai. We visited The Wild Wadi Water Park in Aug this year while staying at The Jumeirah Beach Hotel. Access was complimentary as part of our stay and my girls (aged 12 and 10) were in there every day without fail. We have visited Dubai before and done The Atlantis waterpark too but both my girls say The Wild Wadi is far better. In Atlantis there is a lot of dragging your tube to go on rides which you don't have to do at Wild Wadi and the lazy river is a great way to relax for adults too. Definitely in the hot temperatures a visit to the waterpark is a must and a great way to cool down. The park opens at 10am and if you go first thing you can get on all the rides straight away. Being August and local school holidays it did get very busy from lunchtime onwards. Food is very expensive (but always the way with any theme park). At roughly just under £200 for a family of four it is not a cheap day out but as we had it complimentary could not complain. Great fun and worth a visit.
Great fun. Kids love it!!! Me too water lovely and cold which is must in temp around 50. Something for everyone
It's a good day out. Quite small but lots to do. Keep out of the sun. 11 rides to go on. So e places to eat. Provide towels, lockers etc

Not as good as Atlantis!. Came here when staying at a Jumeirah hotel. Spent a good couple of hours here. There seemed less rides than at Atlantis and felt like they were more disjointed. Still had a fun time though and would come back but only if complimentary with a stay at a hotel.
ok park. this park is okay, a bit overpriced but good views of burj arab. The park is next to the beach. good rides

My Kids find this the best in Dubai. I can certainly vouch for the expressions my kids have when their wild wadi trip is scheduled - They always rave that this is the BEST water park in Dubai ... The Rides, The Experience et al.
An ideal place for beating summer. A safe and cool place for water lovers, equally enjoyable for kids and adults. Family entertainment water park.

Must with Kids But Very Expansive. Full time enjoyment for all ages specially for kids. Is organized and well laid out catering for each small detail and assistance available at every corner. However, like everything else in Dubai, the park is too expansive and everything is very costly. No need to spend 35 AED on towels, one really doesent require them. Take your own camera, use it for your own snaps and then store it in your locker; do take small locker for your own comfort and avoid their photographers by politely refusing their services as one snap would cost you 125 AED. Snacks and drinks are available but again on very expansive side. Visit in the morning around 10 am as the weather is bearable and due to less people you can take and enjoy many rides in less time; after 1130 the place get hot and packed with people and you may have to wait upto 30 minutes for a particular ride. Kids really love it and thereby is a Must Visit place irrespective of its cost.

Funniest day in Dubai. The Wild Wadi Water Park is an unmissable stop in your Dubai day. You have fun from the very beginning and the only limit is your resilience to go up and up again to restart the slides. Going down is exciting ... coming up makes you fit. What else? What are you waiting for ???? Buy a ticket (ah ... if you're a Guest in Jumeirah Beach Hotel the Wadi is complementary).

Fun even for grown ups. Spent a day here and i love the indoor wave pool. I was given a surfboard and they had pressurized water spraying on a curved ledge so that i could surf down. It was pretty hard at first though there was a long line to get to try again.

Excellent water park. 3rd visit to Dubai and been to this waterpark about 7 times. It is still an outstanding fun-filled place for children and adults. Be careful of the floor in some areas which gets very hot in July/August so better not to walk around barefoot. Highly recommended.

No sprinklers in Aug!!. Had a great time on most of the rides however getting from ride to ride was a nightmare as they didn't have any sprinklers on to cool the concrete down. We had to leave early as our feet were burnt!!! Also one of the staff quized a friend of mine whilst half way round a watercoaster on his age, weight etc and gave no explanation as to why he was being quized! This left hime feeling like he was too heavy for the rides and very paranoid. The rides are great, food is also decent, but the negatives could be so easily rectified and would have made a big difference to our overall experience!

Just what u need to relax!. Great day lounging about in the lazy pool/scary slides/wave pool/surf pool/more scary slides!!Just wear loads sunblock. Definitely worth a visit, no big queues which was great especially in 40 degrees...

Best Waterpark in Dubai. Not the biggest park but definetly the best organised and the cleanest; attractions are close to each other, you don't get mud on your feet and usually alleys are not burning from the sun heat; food and beverages are of course overpriced, but less than in Aquaventure; staff is very polite and you don't have the feeling of being rushed out from the park at closing time; unlike Aquaventure, you have a wave pool with cooler than usual water; beside the park itself, views over Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach Hotel are awesome, especially after sun down; gear in the park is of fine quality; In fact, after visiting the Wild Wadi waterpark and some of the group's restaurants (Beachcombers, Al Muna, Arboretum, Al Mahara, Skyview Bar), I can say that, though expensive, Jumeirah in an impressive brand, worthy of the slogan "Stay different". I hope some day I'll afford to enjoy their hotel accomodation and private beaches also;

Water rides galore. What a fantastic day, great fun, lots of rides. Don't miss out If you're not up for some of the more hair raising water rides, there's plenty of spectating to do, watch others master the surfboard ride, glide the lazy river, swim the wave pool or just sun bathe or relaxe at the many sunbathing areas. My only moan is I personally think the lockers could be free, as you need to re-enter them for different reasons, sun creams and especially for get money out to eat and drink. I sugest visitors should enquire about the locker situation before you put your clothes in, your wristband allows one access, however you can pay to have unlimited access for a small locker throughout the day, approx uae 35

Nice and cool. given the scorching temperatures, it was nice to be in the chilled pools of wild wadi. The rides are excellent, kids love it, the pools are great and time can fly by as you enjoy all this place has to offer.
