Greta views of JBH and Burj too especially as it gets dark and the lights all come on. Food stuff not the best and very pricy but expected due to the where you are
Fun day out. If you are tired of sun bathing and want an exciting day, then Wild Wadi is the place to be. Great slides, great atmosphere amazing people.
Busy. This water park is mega busy... But lots of fun.. Best water park in UAE,, better than the one in Atlantis if you have kids..

Good for something fun to do in Dubai!. I recently went to wild wadi, not for the first time, but I haven't been in a few years and it has improved! They now have the chambers that you stand in and drop you down after 3,2,1 on jumeriah sceriah!! Pretty terrifying but fun! I love the fact the rides take you up and you don't have to climb up stairs! All though there is not that much choice of rides they are all good. The choice of food was pretty good for a waterpark too! Not just hamburgers you could get salad and fruit! And it was reasonably priced!
better than aquaventure. Better selection of rides and fewer queues. Great views of the burj and because we went with a friend who works for Jumeirah we went in for like 40 dirhams.

A Decent Day visit and should be visited. This is a nice water park and good with families. The cleanliness was very good and remarkable. Also the rides were good and there are offerings for everyone be it children, youngsters or elders

Water park in UAE, Dubai. The water park was a refreshing surprise during the summer heat. It was a bit crazy getting into the parking lot, but after that it was fun and refreshing. It was the first water park where I never had to get out and que for a ride. You go down or along the water slides and end up on a travel after belt or water jet that pushes you to the next ride. You do have to que up for the wave machine attractions, but they push you through quite fast. The place is nice and clean and the food is a typical theme park. You put money on a wrist watch type gizmo which allows you to hire a locker and buy food. You get the balance back at the end of the day. Allow the full day to enjoy the fun and cool water at the park.
Excellent facilities. We all really enjoyed especially our 5 yr old son. He loved all the rides & wanted to go over again & again. Recommended for everyone.

Great - get there early. Had a wonderful day here - we got there at opening time and were able to secure a good spot where we could keep an eye on the kids easily. As the day went the park filled up, but as it is so big you don't notice it. Food and drink were surprisingly pretty well priced which is a bonus at 40 degrees.Would highly recommend for a great day out.

Pure entertainment for the kids. I stayed at the Jumeirah resort in Aug 2014, and my kids ensured we went here everyday. They simply cant get bored as there are a number of water based activities to do to keep them busy for hours! In fact even my wife and me loved the experience - particularly watching the kids enjoying themselves so much. There are slides going upwards by water jets, than more daring rides like Jumeirah Sceirah and Tantrum Alley which my 6 year old went on. There is a place within the park called FISHO - where you dip your feet in water full of fish who nibble at your dead skin on your feet. 20 mins = 55dhms which is just under £10.For those observing the islamic faith, you will feel extremely comfortable here as many of the park visitors wear islamic dress (mainly women) so you will not feel out of place.Wild wadi has lots of fast food restaurants, that actually make the food fresh, so waiting times are 10-15mins upon an order of food. A meal on average is about 52Dhms or £9. This includes a large drink, large fries, and chicken kebab or chiken tikka or burger etc... My 3 kids could easily share the chicken tikka meal.Also a few shops on site selling Wild Wadi merchandise like swim suits, burkini's for islamic women, shorts, sunglasses, hats, sun cream, swim shoes, keyrings, toys, fridge magnets etc,Would recommend if you have kids as it is fantastic day out.
Amazing but not value of money. It's important to visit it when u go to Dubai, but actually it's soo expensive 300 AED without store box.

A lot of fun. My kids are aged 17, 14 and 11 and they love the Wild Wadi slides. They did say that the Wave pool could be more thrilling though. The great thing about Wadi, it is open Friday nights til 10pm to beat the heat while queues are not so crazy.

Wild, Wild Wadi. All in all a good day, with all the rides tried out, with the Jumeirah Sceirah my favourite, a bit of a queue/wait but well worth it. They have a good arrangement for purchasing items which negates the need to carry any money around with you, as you go in you can buy credit to use in the park, it’s registered on your wrist band, with any spare being refunded when you leave.  If you go there in the summer I would recommend you wear some form of water shoes as the floor (concrete and wooden) gets extremely hot and burns your feet as you walk (our as in our case) run between rides.Try to get the two for one voucher before you visit as that will save a good few pennies. The only thing that disappointed me a little was that on one of the rides my other half twisted her ankle, whilst they were prompt in looking at problem, they basically left us to our own devices after they had given her an ice pack, they didn’t even advise us where the first aid area was on site, we only found it by luck, they also asked her to signed a disclaimer before we left the first aider. I have now tried this one and Atlantis water parks and I would say they both have plus points and good rides with Atlantis just edging it as its larger and has public beach areas for everyone to use.
Great, would go back. Really enjoyed our day here. We want to try Atlantis to compare next time, but would definitely return.

Nice but overcrowded. Spent a good time with the attractions along with my two Little daughters. Concept is good and service is acceptable however tends to be overcrowded and could become frustrating very quickly. Get there early to secure good seats.

Uk traveller - good time. Stayed at JBH next door so had access to park. It was good fun and a good system with regards to loading up with cash your wristband on entry - for use to buy in park and lockers etc. good rides. We also visited Atlantis which I think was a better park. Bigger and busier but better rides.
Great Experience. It is a great experience and a must do in Dubai .My kids loved it.But was very hot in July . So make sure you stay hydrated.Will go there again for sure.

Fun day out..... Still a boy at heart! Great fun and a great day out. Limited waiting at the start of the rides, which are thankfully shaded. The restaurants are good considering this is a water park, and the prices are not to bad either. However they could be a little creative with the menu as it tends to be burgers. Worth a visit.
Really nice with childs. We really enjoy a nice day with all the family. It's nice to visit this acuatic park in that nice city. I visited in August and it was a bit hot
Fun. great experience, loads of fun, especially the pool with the wave machine but Atlantis has more to offer in terms of slides and more thrilling rides.

Excellent fun!. When you need to escape the heat it's so worth spending a few hours or even a day here. We went as a couple, no kids and had a ball riding all the rides. Tip - wear shorts and a t so you have no swimming tog issues like wedgies!

Wild Wet Fun. I have been staying at the Jumeriah Beach Hotel for 12 years, so its free to go to Wild Wadi for all guests. I went with my 16 year old daughter and we had a fun morning out. There are rides for all the family to enjoy. The wave pool is always good and felt lovely and cold in the Dubai heat.We went on most of the rides individually and on a double ring and enjoyed every minute.Wild Wadi may not be as big, or new as the water park at Atlantis, but having been to both I like the fact that at Wild Wadi you do not have to carry your own ring around with you, you get them at the start of the ride, There are plenty of lifeguards, plenty of sunbeds and plenty of food outlets.All in all a great day our for the family
Great. Lovely water park and one of the biggest. Fun for all the family lots to do.No fee if you stay at any one of the Jumeriah Hotels.

King of Water Parks . We have done them all in UAE and Wadi continues to be the best. Queues are normal after 1130 so arrive early to avoid lines. 30 to 45 min wait will be norm. Foood at park is reasonably priced. New rides are great and kept our kids entertained all day. Dubai Entertainer coupons used in park and outdoor restaurants 2 for 1 were great value to help ease pressure on pocketbook. Will come again.

The park is not up to date. First very nice that the sunbed was new this summer. But the maintance of park need heavily work. Several of the attractions is not anymore close to what they were for 10 years ago, bad water presure or totaly lost in several rides.

Not as good. Was told that this was the best waterpark but I wasn't impressed at all. The staff don't keep on top of the lazy river and it tends to get blocked by rubber rings which you have to move put of the way to get past....kind of defeats the point of a lazy river really. Also not many slides there, was provided free tickets from the hotel but I would not have paid to get in.
Good Wet Fun. Family of four got good value in 5-6 hour visit, lazy river a bit slow and queues for rapids even in low season the only disappointment
Still a great day out!. A few years on and this is still a great fun day for everyone. It does get very busy so starting out early is best.
Great fun. Go early if its during peak times (weekends, public holidays, good weather). Parking is available, Might be a turn off if the ques are too long for the rides
amazing park. the park was great memorable day of life :D thank you wild wadi , and the staff of wild wadi you made my day :D , this park is amazing <3

Love it love it love it. This was our 8th trip to Dubai and Wild Wadi is always on our agenda. Our children were a louder this year so were able to go on a lot more which made it more funny. Highly recommended

Amazing !!!!. We visited this fantastic aqua parc with our 2 kids, aged 4 and 8 and they literally LOVED it ! And so did we !Now our kids only refer to Dubai as the country if "Wild Wadi".Entrance price is quiet expensive when you are a family if 4 but it really worth the money you pay !You can find food everywhere for a reasonable price.Enjoy !

Great way to spend an afternoon. Go early- this gets very busy!In terms of rides, not as many as waterparks Ive been to in Egypt or Spain, but still the quality of them were brilliant, including one where you stand up straight in a pod, and the floor drops from beneath you! Bring food, as predictably its expensive. I did hear rumours of being able to get cheaper entrance tickets buying a book of tickets online...

Had its day. Its been a few years since I have been to wild wadi and this time it was evident that its starting to show it's age... The rides were dull and the height restriction of 1.1m meant that my daughter who is 1.08 was not allowed to ride..which left the slow river, and the wave pool... Very disappointed.

Fun day out. I visited this water park with an 11, 13 & 18 yr old. We all enjoyed all the rides, the kids loved the Tantrum Alley rides. The staff were very attentive, which was reassuring as I cannot swim. The main pool with the man-made sea waves was very good with a DJ. Ample float jackets are available in different sizes, which I wore. Overall excellent day, especially as it was hot in Dubai.

Wow. The water park is a must visit in Dubai. Personally if I have to choose one water park to visit, I would visit Wild Wadi and not the Aquaventure in Atlantis. Obviously if you are living in Atlantis, the Aquaventure is your best bet. Wild Wadi is for the whole family, but try not to visit on Friday or Saturday or any public holiday as its very busy. When anyone asks me we have only two days in Dubai, I tell them, make sure you visit Dubai mall, wild wadi and Desert Safari by Arabian Adventures.

Fantastic fun and good value !. Must -do attraction whilst in Dubai, a good way to keep wet and fresh in the summer heat too. imaginative structures and great rides and slides with friendly staff and good facilities. fun fun fun

Unforgettable experience. So on the third day of our vacation last ramadan we went to this wild wadi and its very nice except for the price of the clothes in the souvenirs shop. We tried all of the "water ride" and the nicest one is the one where you need to go inside the capsule and then as soon as the counting is done you will just drop down and start screaming. They need to make it long because its too short and you need to walk to the high tower just to experience that one.

Laughed and screamed all afternoon. What an awesome way to spend an afternoon! Me and my hubby came here to have some fun and it really was awesome. The water is cool which is good in such hot weather. We got a cab there. Queues weren't too bad for a Saturday. Staff seemed quite friendly. There's enough rides to keep you busy for a few hours and longer if you have children. So many great views of the city from various rides. The tandem ride is hair raising, I only did it once. My hubby did the big drop and enjoyed it. It all looked very clean. The only negative comment I'd add is there was an unpleasant smell to the place at times. Definitely worth a trip.

Exciting and Fun. This is based on a resident review..being brought up in dubai I feel like I need to put my review out there for Wild wadi. Now this is a fantastic water park and also voted the best one in UAE.At the moment its about 295 dirhams per Adult however after my visit a few days ago I would highly suggest to purchase tickets online if possible as the queues tend to be longer. Another suggestion would also to go on weekdays between Sunday-wednesday as the days like Thursday-Saturday are peak weekend days and the park is packed up and you may have to wait for an avg of 15-20 Min just to get on a ride and that can be quite annoying. A small issue I had at the locker room which i feel needs to be shared is that the water park has 3 different types of locker form small to medium and large. Now if you buy the medium locker for example but by mistake use you wrist band watch and swipe over the small locker instead then the funds are deducted immediately and you can't use the medium locker then in case you wanted to change after you realised it was the wrong locker!. I had this issue whereby I mistakenly used the small locker even thou I paid for the medium locker and I had to wait for almost 30 minutes! just so the security guard can take my wrist band and go back to the cashier counter or wherever it was he went to sort it out. This could be quite frustrating having to wait there just because you used the wrong locker. Other then this the water park is great and has lots of rides. The Jumeirah Sceirah is a MUST try and is the best ride that they have. A Burger meal with fries and a drink will cost you 49 AED and you have to pay 2 dirhams extra just for a slice of cheese as it doesn't come with it! so I suggest you put some extra money on to your wrist band for meals and also they have a store in the park where you can get some really cool Wild Wadi merchandises. I bought a water proof case which can be used for any phone and its really cool if you want to have some under water pics for memories you can take away with you. It will cost you 120 dirhams and its better then paying for the pictures which the wild wadi staff take of you during different slides as one pic may cost around a 100 dirhams! If you have any money left on your wrist band you can get it back later on when you leave and it will be refunded to you as cash even if you had used a credit card to pay for it. They won't refund it back to the credit card they will just give you cash instead. I hope this review may help people out there. Do also check out other exciting water parks like Aquaventure at Atlantis and also Ice land!

Smaller than I thought it would be.. Smaller than I thought it would be but still enough to do to have a few hours of watery fun. Plus it is overlooked by the 7* Burj Al Arab hotel so something to look at for a while whilst you swim around.

the staff are awful. their promise to the guests is a fun day and memorablewhat they managed to do for us is exactly the oppositethe staff is poorly trained in relates to costumer service, and they leave the impression that they hate their jobs and their costumers

Can't go wrong with Wild Wadi. I've been to Wild Wadi numerous times and have always thoroughly enjoyed my visit - there's something there for everyone. The new slide, Jumeirah Sceirah, is very good fun and definitely has the thrill factor. Tantrum Alley is also excellent too. The lifeguards at Wild Wadi are very enthusiastic and friendly as well.

What a wonderful and wickedly wild water park. If you get the chance to visit Dubai while in transit to or from Europe, then this is a must see and do attraction. Located on Jumeriah Beach, near the base of the distinctive Burj Al Arab, Wild Wadi Water Park is a water theme park housing around 10 different rides, slides and pools suited for people of all ages. From the pleasantly relaxing Juha's Journey river ride to the 32m tall exhilarating Jumeirah Sceirah tower slide, Wild Wadi will keep you entertained for the better part of a day, or until you can't handle the Dubai sun anymore. With that said, the abundance of refreshing pools and rivers keeps you cool for longer than you would expect. I particularly enjoyed the Tantrum Alley ride which seats up to four people and shoots you down into three tube like structures at which point you are buffeted from side to side and drenched from head to toe. I was fortunate enough to go during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan which meant the park was a lot less crowded than normal. Wait times for rides was virtually non-existent which allowed me to make multiple use of all the rides. This probably enhanced the experience somewhat, but even if the park was at capacity, wait times according to the signage littered around the park was no more than 30 minutes. Basic food and beverages can be purchased at various vendors around the park and there are ample locker facilities to store clothes and valuables. Whether you are an adult travelling with friends, or a young family with kids, I highly recommend Wild Wadi to firstly escape some of the Dubai heat, and secondly to feel that sense of wild fun an excitement that is usually only reserved for children.

Excellent place for kids. Kids love it and so do we , as it's a place which is very close to our heart.Nice view of Burj Al Arab. Very nice system of handling the queues. Must visit place when you are in Dubai
Good day out. This was linked with our hotel so we were able to wander in and out during the day. Amazing water rides that take you up a slope!!

wild wadi water park. aithough i am over 65,i enjoyed some of rides & seeing other people & children enjoying therselves.we found the toilets a bit of a pain,as the mens was one side of the park & the womens was the other.

A great place to be. If you like water and water related events, then a visit to Dubai without going to Wild Wadi would be incomplete. The water slides and other attractions will surely keep you going back and so it is advisable to ensure you have sufficient time for all the activities. They have lockers for one to keep their valuables but you get the lock at a fee. It is a nice place to enjoy, especially if you have children who love water games. It is child friendly and there are enough restaurants within the facility is one would like to eat while there. I recommend it.

A exciting experience!. Wow! i don`t know what to say... but it`s all exciting, from the first to the end, from its very high slides to very calm pools, that was a fantastic experience with water, i didn`t i can enjoy water like this

Lots of fun!!. We got free access to the water park as stayed within the Jumeirah group. Had a great day, park is clean and staff friendly. There's life guards everywhere you look. Changing rooms at entrance with lockers to put all your belongings in though you do have to pay a small charge for the locker. Prepaid armbands are a great idea meaning money does not have to be carried around for the eateries/gift shops and any money not used on armband is refunded at end of day. Photographers at all the rides taking photos you can buy as a momento. Not a lot of shade around the park so wear lots of sun cream. Would definitely go back on our next trip to Dubai!!

Take a waterproof camera! . Have to say the Atlantis water park is still my favourite due to the aquarium rides but for those thrill seekers Wild Wadi did not disappoint! My only regret is leaving my iPhone / camera at the hotel as whilst the park did not sell waterproof cameras they did sell iPhone waterproof covers ! We missed a perfect opportunity for some photos with amazing views .That said you can opt to buy any of the photos they take of you on the rides etc. You get a locker when going in for a small fee. You can put money on your wrist band to save from carrying cash / cards around and if you buy one of the novelty cups you get free refills of water throughout the day. You can also hire towels. There are a good selection of eateries & places to get drinks which were also reasonably priced. Seemed to be adequate sun loungers and seats. W.C & changing facilities were good standard , well maintained & clean. Great for all ages you can opt to make a full day of it : or like us spend a morning there. We done every ride in a couple of hours. We were staying at the Le Meridian Mina Sehay & found it easy accessible & to get a reasonable priced taxi to and from. Wild Wadi is wicked fun!
Pretty god damn sweet. Nice shade, nice attractions, waiting lines weren't too long, beautiful views of the Burj al Arab and the Jumireah beach hotel, well populated by life guards, fun for all ages
Cool place for a family... Spent the day with my friend and his son. We went on a weekdays and it's crowded. However we still enjoy a refreshing day in the sun.
Great family fun. Great water park for kids; they enjoyed the wave pool and the slides. Great that my 5 year old could ride alone or with me on everything.
good waterpark, a bit limited for small kids. Nice waterpark - clean and well organized and staffed. A little smaller than I expected but nice. Not much shade so bring plenty of sunblock!
Great waterpark for relaxed fun. Nice and calm and relaxed waterpark. Only a few tough rides but those are really cool. Stuff extremely nice and helpful.

Wild Wadi. Average = Good. I visited place during public holiday with my wife and daughter who is below 110cm. We spent whole day there but for family with small kid Atlantis is more entertaining. If you are not coming early is hard to find place with shade. IMO the best thing here is a surfing, be prepared for a queue (it is worth).There are some Food bars but I had feeling there are little disorganised. This time they have been advertising free lunch for residents on their facebook page, which is not applicable during public holidays (weird).

Great place for all the family. I have been to this water park a few times here in Dubai and love it. I have also been to the one at Atlantis and Yas waterworld in Abu Danbi. I much prefer Wild Wadi. The others have so many steps to get to all the rides whilst and wild wadi you can get to most of them using the rings and then only a few steps. It's compact but with some great rides.

Very small and very expensive. I found this water park too crowded, two expensive and too small. I have been to several water parks all over the world and here (for a total of 7-8 attractions which are nothing spectacular) you pay almost double as compared to other places. And there is so many people which you have to be in a queue for everything. It was fun for 1 hour maximum, then you had no other rides to actually ride. You basically pay extra for everything, including the lockers.

for all ages. beware food and drinks from outside the park arent allowed. but there are few dining options inside that can provide you with fast food and little snacks so you can keep enjoying the rides. there is somthing for all ages and all kinds of visitors, if you would like to relax or thrill difinitly somthing is there for you. dont miss it . and try to make use of the whole day access arriving early. try to avoid visiting during jun-aug.

Must visit. We went here and it was great fun. A lot of rides, a little expensive to get in however well worth the fun. You could easily spend the whole day here, A very clean facility. Changing rooms and showers always clean
Crowded but Refreshing. Good crowds, and sometimes as a woman in a bathing suit it was a little uncomfortable, but I didn't care and just enjoyed my day. In that heat, it was soooooo refreshing.
fun, cool and the best in town. so much fun an so friendly liveguards!! it is for the children and the young at heart; big fun, thrill and cooling down are guaranteed

Very nice water park in Dubai. This is an excellent water park in Dubai, next to Jumeirah Beach and the Famous Burj Al arab Hotel. You can spend a whole day there where good food is also available. Recommended the whole year excepting summer period since it is very hot.

need company!!. Hey guys!! I am here visiting my sister in Dubai for couple days. We were planning to visit Wild Wadi on Monday 4th august, but she got called at work so she cant make it.It s hard to enjoy there alone so if there are people who are going on the same day we can get to know each other and have fun all together there!Cheers!
Great Fun For Eveyone. Wild Wadi is great fun for all the family. Some rides will make your heart jump but are still a great laugh. If staying at a Jumeirah resort entry is free. Enjoy.

A classic and still improving. It has always been a fun place to go, and I am glad that they keep improving the rides or building new ones. Choose the time of your visit carefully as it can be very crowded with queues for the more popular rides. Good fun for all ages...

Great Escape from the Heat. We visit Wild Wadi regularly and enjoy its facilities. One tip is to get there early on weekends to beat the crowds. It is also quite safe on account of the platoon of lifeguards available on hand. Highly recommended.

High density of thrilling water slides. If you have been to the Atlantis before, you already know what you are up against, but besides from their drop-tower, wild wadi easily tops the variety of attractions suitable for any age. If you are staying at Al Qasr, frequent buggy rides pick and drop you of, making this a very easy event to go to. And from the highest point, one can view the exciting Dubai skyline.

Te best waterpark. Wild Wadi is probably the best water park in Dubai, the rides are longer and you spend less time going between the rides. Great for the whole family, entered when it opened are were the last to leave. Tantrum Ally you feel you are going to jump onto the road.

Really nice especially in the hot weather. One of the main highlights of our holidays was the visits to the Wild Wadi which was complimentary as we were at the JBH. We spent a lot of time there on two days. It was nice to be in and out of the water. My son loved it.

Great Fun for the kids. Our 2 boys (18 and 16 years) had a fantastic few hours while we went shopping in nearby shopping Mall. We booked on line (Emirates Yoo) the night before and got a good deal 245 AED/adult ticket) but had a nervous few hours the next morning waiting for the voucher via email (Tip - allow at least 1 full day to make sure of receiving the voucher if not booking direct with the water park)

A good day out. We went here last weekend as waterparks are a great way to escape the July heat but still be outside and it was also the last day of their 241 promotion. Its a good watermark, the two big raft rides are good for thrill seekers but also good for wimps like me as you feel quite safe. The jet slides that take you round the park are good fun, you can go in these as a two or solo, however later in the day they get really busy and you have to wait in the pools in between the jets. I was quite disappointed in the lazy river as it really was lazy! It was better to walk than float through it. Its also quite layered so you don't have the space that you do in Atlantis nor do you have a beach which is a shame although you do get an excellent view of the Burj al Arab. I would visit this again if there was a 241 promotion but wouldn't pay full price for it.

The absolute best!. This is unbelievable good - fantastic, superb! I cannot begin to describe how good this place is. So clever! Water going up hill- only in Dubai. No queues. Great value, Modern, simply the best water park in the world!

Worth a half day even without kids. We were on a couples holiday and this was included. In two minds whether to go but decided to and we did enjoy ourselves - especially the 2 four seater wides over by themselves a bit. The start of the slides is interesting......but without children probably half a fray is enough.

Wet & Wild. Great place for family fun! The rides and slides were great and the food was beyond expectations. Staff were all friendly and went out of their way to help with anything. Only complaint - too many people! Went on all the rides without waiting when the park opened but towards noon and beyond, the lines were too long. The prices are a bit on the high side though. Otherwise, great family outing! Thanks for the great memories for my family.

Overpriced. Well I can't say this is the best water park I have been to. There are only three major slides. The majority are horizontal water jet type slides which take you around the park. They are fun but probably only need to be done once. The largest slide is definitely more intense than the rest of the park by far and worth a go if you like fast slides. The thing to be considered most about this place is the entry price. It is 305 Dirham (about $100 US/AUD) each. which in my opinion is not worth it. Located all around the park are photographers who take pictures throughout your visit and are available for purchase at the end of your visit. Common practice for most tourist attractions. Not a very common price though. We had 9 pictures taken of us in our visit and were offered to us at a 'sale' price of 325 Dirham (little more than $100 US/AUD) for digital copies only!!! 9 pictures for more than the the actual entry price! Maybe visit this park if you have young kids and are prepared to pay but don't expect too much.

Very good rides, Perfect for covering 4-5 hours. We spent 4.5 hours in this water park in the last Friday of Ramadan month (July 2014). The park has many rides including the breathtaking Jumeirah Sceirah! Do not try it if you have ever had a heart attack or something like this.The park is very nice but it has 2 weak points:1) The entrance charge is high (about 75 USD per person)2) They charge you 35 to 75 Dirhams (10 to 20 USD) per locker.Other things are nice. Especially, the staff are very polite and friendly.

Best water park in the world. After 10 years of coming to Dubai ,we are never disappointed with wild wadi park ,it's clean the staff are true professionals. The rides get better every year , the up keep is always there priority never seen any rubbish on the floor. Our daughter is a daredevil so she tries every ride and her favourite is the jumeriah scarier.
one of the best. It was one of the best water park ,I have ever been to .The rides our of good quality and most importanly the hygine of the entire park is good.This is worth a visit

Fun thing to do in Dubai.. Being hot as it is in Dubai, this is a fun activity to do there. I really liked the water park but for value, it would be best to stay at a Jumeriah Hotel. At JBH you get complementary, unlimited entry as the ticket price as a stand alone is too much I think.

Really good fun. Wild wadi isn't an enormous water park, nor does it have a million water slides, however for an afternoon's visit, there's more than enough thrills to keep you excited. The jumeirah sceirah is a must-do, but not for the faint of heart if you haven't done this type of high-speed, trapdoor type of slide before.One of the most novel things about this park is the circuit of the park using uphill (using water jets) and downhill slides. I went solo, but this would be a fantastic attraction for families to escape the Dubai heat

Who says three ladies of a certain age cannot have fun !. On a short break in a Dubai with two of my friends we decided , with a certain apprehension to visit , the Wild Wadi Waterpark . It came with free admission , as part of our stay at the Dar al Masyaf . Wild and Wadi it is , just great fun from start to finish . There is a lovely sea side feel with the sea effect pool . Great seating and sun beds , and to top it all fantastic water adventure rides . We took to our big rubber rings to meander down the lazy river , having great fun trying not to get soaked from the waterfalls . There is no limit to how often you wish to go round , it us peaceful , fun and relaxing . Our next trip , this time just two of us , one very sensible friend decided the fast water rides were not for her and she would stay gracefully floating . Myself and my other friend took to a double ring and shot off down the rapids screaming , whirring in a Bob sleigh like fashion down a waters Shute . Next came a very wet long dark tunnel , (why did I close my eyes ) . We screamed , we laughed . This can be a place for adventure , or to relax , try it , you will want to return . A little tip , wear full swim suit , your bikini bottoms can ride down a little when facing the rapids !  .

Fun, but hot!. Well designed park, many good rides, with a large slide as fierce as any other- where the bottom literally drops out from under you! A few suggestions for the future: 1) it is noted that water fountains are throughout the park, but we didn't see any- so bring H2O 2) towel not necessary in the intense heat, unless you wish to lie in the heat 3) have $ put on your bracelet before you leave the main gate- that wasn't made clear to us, and 4) in intense July heat, a visit longer than 4 hrs is trying! But the trade- off was short lines everywhere..

Brilliant again!. Love wild wadi, we haven't visited it for 2 years so there are new rides since we visited last. The park is clean and safe, plenty of sun beds and fab view of the Burj! We visited during Ramadan and it was superb. No queuing for any ride and the park was so quiet. Temperatures were in the high 40's which did make walking on the concrete with bare feet painful. Some good food deals available for around 50AED. The wristbands area great idea for loading on money which you can use for pay for food, drinks or souvenirs. Any money not spent is refunded at the end of the visit. Love the new rides particularly the one where you are locked in a capsule and after the countdown the floor vanishes beneath you! The life guards are plentiful and very friendly and great fun too. We gained access as a Jumeirah guest - staying at the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray (one complementary visit per stay including towel hire).

Great fun. I visited with my kids during Ramadan and we had a great time. Given summer and Ramadan, crowds were very sparse (no waiting for any rides - even the popular ones), and with temperatures over 45C it was the only outdoor place in Dubai that was remotely bearable - a big plus is also that food and drinks were available.

brilliant family fun. superb water park, bit confusing to begin with but doesnt take long to get the hang of it.you dont even have to walk up to the rides, they will shoot you up on a rubber ring to the start of 11 different rides.good to go during Ramadan, very quiet and they still serve food.stay at the Jumeirah Creekside and the entrance is complimentary,, win, win

Wild Indeed. My Kids love this place... and so do I! The wife likes to relax on the lazy river while the kids and I venture off into the playground. Once it's mom's turn to supervise, I'm off to the races on the maze of gravity defying slides!I want to go back right now.

Disappointing. It might be nice if I had not previously been to Aquaventure waterpark. The rides lack of true adrenaline. The place is very tight and with few signs indicating the way to the rides. It can be a bit confusing. Most of the rides are all the same.It can be a good place, though, if you are experiencing a waterpark for the first time and don't want big thrills.

Fabulous if not a tad painful!. Great fun but picked up a few bruises from the steep, albeit short, drop near the start of the ride. Lots of fun and a great way to to cool down in the heat. Seemed well managed and highly recommended as a fun day out. Only slight downside, changing rooms a tad chaotic.
Excelent. Rides are just crazy and fast.Was a bit concern about having to go and spend the day in an out door park as it was the fasting period but food and drinks were freely available at the park.

Even under pressure the staff were fantastic!. Wild Wadi had a Ramadan offer whereby you could exchange three items of clothing for an entry ticket.Very excited at the prospect of a free activity in the massively expensive summer holidays, I went there with my son (aged 5) and his friends (both aged 8).As you can imagine it was insanely busy and the queues were long. They did have a fast track queue for paying guests though and the queue moved as quickly as can be expected. I could see management were out in force ensuring that everything went smoothly and then we were in. Despite the high traffic, the park was well maintained and clean.The life guards were as consciences as usual and managers were available to point out that although my sons friends met the height requirements, they were too slim to sit comfortably in the tubes and it was unsafe.We had three hours of water fun, before heading home, when, as you can imagine with three kids in tow, I realised on driving home that I had forgotten to remove the credit from my wristband.I called them immediately, they took my details and I went back two days later to collect the money, no problem, thank goodness I had kept the receipt.My only observation for the day would be that I would not return on a busy day in a pick up truck as the car park is not very generous if you have to go up to the next level. This is not a complaint, merely an observation.

Fun, adrenalin-filled adventure. A great experience, all ages will enjoy. Arrive early before the queues and the heat become overwhelming. My only complaint would be that despite two being shown on the map, there was only one block of female toilets (near the main entrance), this meant a lengthy walk from the centre of the park.

Wild Wadi water park. Wild Wadi Waterpark was good for.all family members. It's also free if you stay at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel on family package. The biggest drop ride was terrifying, I must be getting old as the kids kept going back again and again.

Great Way to Cool Down. We arrived 15 minutes before opening time which was great because no line for ticket. You can hire towels and lockers there. The slides are great and if you go early there are no long lines. I have two teenagers who really loved the park, it was a really good way to cool down and we were all done by lunch time so spent the rest of the afternoon doing other things.

current 2 for 1 ticket deal is great.. Wild Wadi currently has a 2 for 1 deal on tickets until the end n of the month. Then person at the ticket counter doesnt automatically givrnthis to you unless you say " as advertised on your web site 2 for 1 deal".?afternyou say this, they are happy to do itThe water park is a bit of fun. Get there at 10 and spend a couple of hours before the que get too long.Asnpeople have said, take thongs as the ground is very hot. Also take some snacks as the food is pricey.
Fun at Wild Wadi Waterpark. Wild Wadi Waterpark is really fun. It has a fantastic view of the Burj Al Arab. It's also free if you stay at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel.

Great Day Out!. We were a family of 4. We have a 4 year old son and 6 year old daughter! We had an awesome day out. They are very organised, it does get very crowded, but everything works well. Not much to do for under 4 years of age and better if your children are confidant in water.An awesome place to go with friends or another family, as some rides were not suitable for the kids. But really is a great day out !

something for everyone. My husband, 13 year old son and I have just returned from a 10 night stay in the JBH which included free entry to the Wild Wadi. We visited the park 3 times during our stay. we always went late afternoon for about 3 hours as we felt it was too hot to be in there any longer. We all enjoyed it, there were no long lines to stand in and a range of rides. We only purchased water as we didn't need anything else but food and drinks are expensive. We didn't have to pay for towels as hotel guests. We would certainly say it's worth a visit if your in the JBH but not sure we would go again if we were in a hotel which didn't include free entry.

The best Water park Ive ever been to!. I have been there several times, tried it on different days of the week and its always very well organised. There are plenty of staff who are wishing to help and they give you the locker and smart wristband as you get into the parl. technology used in the park and the service quality is really high and creates an enjoyable experience. I would get back there again in a few weeks time and suggest you to try it too! you won't regret it!

Brilliant. Great, feel like a kid again. Something to do and this is one thing for the kid and you to enjoy. Well worth going to, bring at least one child. Try and join in the fun and not be a spectator as you will miss out. I WOULD go back, but when its not so hot. Its hardly disney land though but a bit of fun.
Fun time at. Wild Wadi. Great fun, good to cool off out the sun. Wear your flip flops if walking on the concrete in July and August ! For an adrenalin rush jumeirah Sceirah is great fun 3,2,1 boom!
Great Water Park. Plenty of slides and things to do, its a little tired but great fun, plenty of eating outlets and sun loungers, also free if you stay at the Jumeirah hotels

Great day out!. Wild Wadi offers a great day out. I went on a Sunday and there were no queues for any of the rides. This was fantastic because we got to go on our favourite rides 3 and 4 times. The tantrum Alley ride is amazing! We got the Two Play One Pay offer. They advertise this offer on the website but not at the pay desk. You need to specifically ask for this offer when paying. Would recommend.
Excellent!. The drop was brill but is not for the faint hearted. Loved tantrum alley. The drop was brill but is not for the faint hearted. Loved tantrum alley.
Great fun -and free as staying in JBH. Fab fun times spent here and it was all free as we were staying in the JBH next door. Lots of water rides and pools so fun for all the family.
Wet and Wild. Great day for all ages, lots of fun, pack plenty of sun lotion, you'll need it. Lazy river, slides, tidal waves and more....enjoy

A very big disappointment. I had to spend in Dubai about eight hours between flights and I decided to spend it in an aquapark. Bad decision! Taxi from airport to aqua park took us 97 AED, but entry for 2 adults and 2 children was 1.100 AED. For 2 towels also had to pay another 70 AED. For a dressing, although I wanted a medium had to rent a big one I paid another 65 AED Overall I paid 1235 AED In July is extremely hot and therefore it is impossible to travel without slippers. Unfortunately they do not have areas where you can sit in air conditioning, in the shade are 46 degrees celsius ... Everything in the park is exorbitantly expensive (a bottle of water is 100 AED, a bottle of juice is 150 AED 200 AED is ice cream, etc..)Unfortunately nothing spectacular

something for everyone. We went during a week in the quiet time of July. It was a pleasant surprise that we didn't have to queue for any of the rides. Food and drink were of the fast food variety but still openly available during Ramadan. There were only a few different rides but one of the rides opened up a whole experience of uphill chutes and slides. The surfing ride was excellent and the staff took time to give you enough instruction to make the most of your turn.Toilets and changing facilities were under renovation at the time of our visit which meant men's and women's were at opposite ends of the park. Also the lockers were not in a place accessible to both men and women which was inconvenient when we were sharing a bag. There were plenty of sunbeds for a relaxing time whilst the teens and not so young fun loving adults enjoyed the slides.A good day out made better by the free entry given by staying in Jumeirah Creekside hotel.

Great day full of action. It is by far the best water park I went to! The games they give you adrenalin rush and you enjoy it! You have to try the deciding tube! The moving river that you go all the way up! And the extra thrill activities. The average time is 5 hours unless you want to tan! Get slippers because the ground is too hot or you can buy sth like socks from the gift shop that you can wear for the games and no need to take it off. Get the tickets online they are cheaper! And the best is to be charged with money rather than going to the locker to get it.7

Fun, fun, fun!. We stayed at JBH and thus had a complimentary access. It was just as the title says. Lot of fun! We would enjoyed it all day long! Some attractions are freaky and some of the even dangerous (we hit the heads on one of them and my head still hurts after days). You just have to be really careful and hold yourself. The park is very big - just lot of fun for everyone!

Fun For All. Every year in June (when the heat is at it's hottest in Dubai) my friends and I take a trip down to Wild Wadi. We've been going there now for about 3 years in a row and it has always been a fantastic visit. The rides are fun, especially the Jumeirah Sceirah (giving you an adrenaline rush). The wave pool will keep you cool from the hot and burning sun. The staffs are always friendly and you can never go wrong with getting a snow cone after a fun filled day. I recommend anyone who's in town for awhile to come down to Jumeirah to visit this park and have a great day. Two thumbs up for Wild Wadi!
Great day out!. This is a must if your in Dubai! A great day out for all the family, we really had a great day! Not to be forgotten, we will be doing this again when we go back!

Wonderful. We have never been in the water parks before! We thought that is mostly attraction for children rather then adults.God! We were WRONG!We got free tickets from our hotel and decided to give Wild Wadi a try.That was brilliant experience and great fun for both of us , even in our age group - 30-40 years old :)We spent a whole day here, enjoyed the rides and have absolutely lovely day!Our personal favourite was "Tantrum Alley" - very nice!Only one downside - as we are both a healthy eaters we couldn't find any healthy food here. Only pizzas, burgers, etc, we have not children yet but I think that little ones deserve real food, not a junk.

A place where dreams come true!. I love Wild Wadi, its well set out, you don't have to do to much walking, my favorite part it the lazy river (can pretend your in the jungle). They do good chicken burgers at the BBQ place. Make sure you go on a weekday! Other wise its packed and you will end up queuing for ages.
Good fun. A fun few hours...helps to deal with heat. I had free entry but I saw that entry prices are quite steep, but still worth it.
Wild Wadi. A brilliant place to go to, either for a shot while or for the whole day. Pictures taken great and the choice of getting them on a USB stick great!

Great day out. Had a fantastic day at Wild Wadi. Went with my 4 year old son and he loved it. The kids area is great fun and has a good selection if chutes for younger kids. The pool with wave machine is lovely and cool which is needed in this heat! Great choice of adult rides too and a lots of nice sunbed areas to relax in between water slides! Highly recommend :)

A great way to escape the heat - but it will burn a hole in your pocket!!. We spent a day here in June when it was 40+ degrees outside and we were wondering how to keep our four year old cool. We were in Dubai three days at the end of our main holiday in Mauritius. So we spent the Saturday at Wild Wadi - a great choice. There is something for everyone, and our son loved the family dhow and lagoon area in the middle of the park and the slow floating river where huge water showers rain down on you at the beginning and end. We got there early and with free tickets form our hotel were ushered to the front of the queue and got free towel hire. Towel hire was 35 dirhams each otherwise and then you have to pay for locker hire too 35-65 dirhams, so with the entrance fee at 275 dirhams per person it all adds up.Saturdays are very busy, being the last day of the weekend, so get there early to find seats/sunbeds with shade. We were lucky and found three right by Leila's oasis. Our little boy enjoyed it so much as did we, that we ended up staying there all day and we had a great time. We ate pizza for lunch as all choices are fast-food, not ideal for us healthy eaters, but for a large pizza and a big drink it was about £10, so not too bad at all and it was cooked to order.One big issue for us was the lack of toilets for ladies in the main part of the park. Men have the luxury of toilets in the changing rooms at the entrance and in the middle of the park - us ladies have to go back to the entrance every time. This proved a problem for us with a four year old wanting the loo and finding it hard to hold on, while I sprinted, carrying him (as the ground was scorching in places where it wasn't cooled by water) from the dhow/lagoon area to the entrance ladies toilets.I read reviews before going about the maintenance, but the only thing we had issues with were the cargo nets on the dhow/lagoon area. Our son fell and grazed himself and medics appeared from nowhere and cleaned the graze and put a big plaster on.All in all a great day out, but not a cheap one if you have to pay your own entrance fees.

Fab water park. I love this water park. Less crowded and better value for money than the Atlantis. It's pricey to get in but if you stay at one of the jumeirah hotels you get free entry throughout your stay. Plenty of sun loungers for those who prefer to soak up the sun rather than go on the rides. The snack bar serves a good range of food from salads to burgers and all reasonable priced. Amazing view of the Burj al arab from the higher slides.

COOL OFF & HAVE FUN. Wild Wadi is an outstanding fun water park packed with features, an oasis from the heat. Great family venue with safety and plenty of attendants. However you need the whole day to enjoy all the features. Best to arrive at opening time. There are many rides and most have combinations, so you can try moire than once. Food and beverage facilities are plentiful. A great adventure for both tourists and residents.
Fantastic!. This is the best water park I have ever been to in my life, we didn't want to leave! I would recommend Wild Wadi to couples and families!! Truly amazing!

Great fun! - Better than Atlantis. If you are only visiting one water park then visit Wild Wadi. More family rides which are much more exciting and a long lazy river which easily connects to plenty more slides. There's also a wave pool that comes on every 15 minutes, large range of restaurants/snack places and a big children's play area.
Fun day out. Everything you ask for in a water park. Nice rides, decent food and conveniently close to the heart of the city. On this particular occasion however, a bit over crowded.

Nice place. Nice place to be but I have seen overweight people and felt rely sorry for themas the lot of the slide & rides are not powerful enough to pull them through.So there was staff which had to push them which I found really a bit embarrassing.F&B is fully over prized for the given quality I have to say.Otherwise fun place to be and surely should be on your bucket list if you are in Dubai.

Fun day out. My husband an I had a great day spent slashing around, being lazy on the lazy river.What Fabius views, take a water camera for the unexpected fun and breath taking views.  We didn't go on the extremely wild rides buy the place is suitable for all ages. The hotdogs were a great snack time meal too.Make sure you take plenty of sun cream as you will be here for hour. I don't know the cost as it was free to entire if stopping at the JUMEIRAH BEACH HOTELEnjoy :-)
Best water park imaginable!!. All grades of rides for all ages, under six to over sixty. Some serious challenges to lazing down the 'river' on a tube.We thoroughly enjoyed our day at Wild Wadi!!

Superb water park, you must vist!!!!. This is a excellent water park to visit whilst in Dubai, locker/changing rooms on arrival, lots of rides to go on from lazy rivers to thrill seeking drop flumes, plenty of places to get food and drink, lots of sun loungers spread all round the park to relax and recover after the flumes!!!! there is a huge childrens section aswell which is fantastic for the smaller ones. the most important aspect of this attraction is the amount of life guards they have on duty handing out life jackets to the non swimmers and checking constantly that everyone is safe and ok, they never slack or take their eye of what is going on, Wild Wadi is well worth a visit if you in Dubai and want to cool off.

A litle old but very nice for families. Wald Wadi is a bit old but we appriciated that there was a lot of rides for our son (6 years) And there was attractions that the three of us could ride together. If you have samll children Wald Wadi is beter that Atlantis- (Atlantis is a bif fake with Russians smoking everywhere)On Wadi they had special smoke points so you never had to sit beside people smoking. Thats a big plus. Thanks to the manegemant that thinks about our childrens health!

wonderful time. a wonderful wonderful water park. the slides were all great, the water temperature is perfect we had a great great time... a must visit place i recommend to go there during off peaks though to prevent long lines and avail of the parks promos :)

Awesome!!. Visited this park on 3 separate occasions during our recent stay in Dubai. Loved it! Went with my husband and 4 year old daughter. Our daughter loved the fantastic kids area, my husband enjoyed the crazy waterslides, I enjoyed it all. We stayed at Al Qsar (see separate review) so we got complimentary access to the park each day, which was fantastic. Fantastic fun, highly recommend.
Excellent day out, children couldn't get enough of this place. All the water rides were great. Would be good if you were allowed to take your own food as the resort serves mostly fast food .

Best Water Park. We went here most days on our recent stay at JB hotel. It was such great fun and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had to queue for some of the rides but they were such fun you just wanted to do them again and again. The main pool has a wave machine that happens every 15 minutes and is such fun. Try and get the early and get a lounged at the front of the main pool. No shoes are allowed on the rides so you need to make a run for it from your lounger to the slides as your feet will burn on the ground. Will be returning next year and will definitely visit again.

WOW. Very nice place to visit with the friend, location is really good next to Burj Al Arab
A lot of fun during the day, we will come back again

The best fun in the sun. Great rides and slides, very well organised set on the ocean with fabulous views. Even did the plume 6 seconds of terror water slide drop! The overpriced food outlets were ok, would not rave at all. But did not go there for the food, went there for a fun day with my daughter.Even though it was a 38 degree hot day, the water was refrigerated and cooling.Being Aussies we can swim so I was thoroughly impressed by the presence of lifeguards at what appeared to be every 30 metres along every section of water. There were obviously people who were not quiet so confident in the water.Definitely worth a visit if you want to have fun!

wild water fun! With beautiful scenery!. We went to this water park, and it turn out to be really fun. If you want to take many pictures of the Iconic Burj al Arab of Dubai while enjoying the water park, this is definitely the place, as you could find so many great spot to take pictures with Burj al Arab or Jumeirah Beach hotel as your background. The water is clean, and the staffs are all super friendly and expert at teaching us how to use the water attractions pool especially at the surfer's area. While I was there i had my knee injured and I was asking the staffs there for a band aid, and the staff was quick to respond, they not only gave me the band aid but also help me cleaned the injured part and stick the band aid on it. The water and the facilites are also clean and not smelly at all considering the high heat hot temperature. You could play all the attractions as well as relaxing on the fake beach pool area and sunbathing. Definitely a must go if you are around Dubai.

So much fun but not enough shade. We took our one year old a few times during our stay in Dubai. The staff are so friendly and very helpful. The lazy rivers (there are two) were very relaxing and the children's pool was lovely.Food was good and not too over priced.Our only criticism was that there wasn't enough shade!
Fun experience, beautiful scenery.. Located in one of Dubai's hottest locations, this place combines elegance with fun in an exceptional experience. Totally recommend it
elderly surfers. Frightening drop on highest flume, once may be enough nice to cool off in the heat some hotels give a free pass, if not its £40 for adults too expensive in my view.

Fabulous fun in the sun. Great selection of slides and rides to suit all ages. Attractively laid out and well organised. It is a bit expensive and the food offerings could be better, but it is a great day out and well worth visiting for adults and children alike

Speechless. This fantastic water world is filled with every enjoyment any child or adult could experience. It has wild adventures such as the 90 degree drop that was exhilarating !!!! The friendly service was helpful and reassuring.
a nice place to relax. good place for waterplay in the middle east tuesdays only for women.clean and good.be careful and avoid sun burns.

The Best Water Park. With having children we have been to lots of water parks around the world but The Wild Wadi has to be No1.In most water parks you have to climb up steps to get to the next ride but on The Wild Wadi you sit in the rubber rings and the jets of water take you uphill to the next stage.There are rides for all ages and I took my 75 year old mother on the new ride and she absolutely loved it, there were a few swear words in fright but still went on 3 times.Turn up as early as possible as it fills up very quickly.

Great fun. Fantastic water park. Lots to do for all ages. Main pool is fabulous with waves every 15 minutes. Choose a sunbed near the waters edge for the best experience. Also take your own towels if you are able to, or you will be charged for towel hire. Great place, great fun.

Fun in safety. This water park is great fun, but not for toddlers when the wave machine is on. There are many life guards on duty and they all seem to be on the ball. A teenage girl got onto difficulty when the waves were in motion and whistles were blown to alert everyone; lifeguards dived in and other life guards quickly took their locations watching over the water. The girl, and her companion who also got into difficulty were very quickly made safe. The after care was very good.The park is good, but at my age they do really need a lift to get older people to the top of the high slide. I made it and the experience was thrilling to say the least.Well worth the visit

Great trip for the Kids. And everyone else i think, I have been to the park a number of times and took my kids and wife with me on the second trip. It has to be the easiest way to keep everyone occupied and happy for a day with something for everyone. Well worth it for a family visit, a couple or even a day out with the boys... Brilliant fun
Good but not as good as Australia's Wet & Wild. We spent a day here. Was good as weather is so hot but was quite small compared to Wet & Wild in Australia.
Fun!. I liked the water slides, the wave pool and the lazy rivers. The locker rooms are well equipped and practically safe. The shower rooms tend to be full before they close so we needed to line up.
Fun day. Well established watermark, lovely atmosphere, can get a bit busy during peak times but overall a fun day out for young and old alike

Awesome Service. This place is amazing, they went out of their way to return a lost item and posted it back to NZ. The park is great for young kids, our son was too small to go on the "big boy" rides but he had an absolute blast on everything else. The kid slides are really cool and the drenching we got was great. We will definitely return when he is 1.1 m tall. Great job by everyone at the park
Just keep swimming, just keep swimming!. Decided to go here and not Aquaventure Waterpark. Conquered ALL rides. The main ride Jumeirah Sceirah is AWHH-SOME!

Splashing!. Wild Wadi Waterpark is an exciting place to spend your day if you want to have a carefree day and just have fun. There is many things to do for all ages and there are restaurants, toilets and disabled entrance. There is: a children's area, many slides for different ages, restaurants and a lazy river is you are one to lay around in the water! Every thursday night it opens later for a ladies night! Ladies only! This is really good as the lines are shorter than the day. First, on thursday, it opens normal time for everyone, then 8:00 pm ladies night starts. I highly recommend it:)

tired and too busy. got in free as part of hotel deal. Its getting a bit old and tired now, too many people in too small a place, queues build up quickly. floor too hot to walk on. Simply can't compare to Atlantis watermark-go there instead much better .

Excellent water park. Variety of games and places to relax. food is available, little pricey but delicious. If you come during hot summer make sure you have sun protection. It is available inside the park but double priced.
Great if no lines. Would be worth a visit if you can get discounted/complimentary passes and go early/soon after they open to avoid the longer lines later in the day.

Fun day out. Brilliant water park most of which I'd connected by a lazy river. Make sure you use plenty sunscreen as not too much of it is in the shade. Very busy but managed to get round it all as it is not too big.
Too hot. Went for the day would be good as we had been before to hot at this time of year and far to many people allowed in at one time

One of my favorite things in Dubai. Dubai was not my favorite place in the world but Wild Wadi was a shinning point. Like the rest of the UAE, the park is a bit pricey but is a day of fun in the sun. For more see my review plus pics here -
http://www.thislifeintrips.com/like-dislike-dubai/

Fantastic day for all of the family. We went in January so the water was a little cold but still the day was excellent. The rides were fun for all the family and the food was not too expensive. We basically rode all the rides and the time waiting was not too long. For a day to kill in Dubai it's a good family adventure.

Good fun!. Since this was included in our stay at JBH, we visited many times during our stay. All our visits were short ones, few rides on the Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj, then long easy ride on that long ride (with the uphills and downhills, don't remember the name now), and then back to beach or pool.Reasonable short queues, no problems. If you are a hardcore waterpark freak, I think this is little on the "lame" side, but still, I would recommend a visit.

Wet and Wild. Was a very good water park but can be very busy and we found ourselves waiting in a queue on the water slides and getting very burnt.It is definitely a water park with potential.Glenn & Louise Day

i dont like it. it's not realy clean.the water was sour so my little girl eye have problem with water,i don't like it ,the clothes changing room is not good,50 dhs for box to put clothes, in men area isn't any box ,just my 7 years girl like it

Nice experience again. We stayed at Jumeirah beach hotel for 6 nights and visited wild wadi almost every day for 2 to 3 hours. Since it was kind of low season the queues weren't bad at all and we had a great time. Just a few things can be better.Firstly, the water in most of the rides is freezing cold. Coming out of the scorching sun into freezing water isn't a very pleasant experience and your body doesn't ever get accustomed to the temperature of the water.Secondly, it seems there is only 1 toilet in the entire park. The main changing rooms are signposted for toilets but there are no toilets there. The only toilets I found were behind the children's play area.Finally, the food is decent but the variety of the food can be a little better.Also, please have some sort of indication posted as to when the waves will begin in the pool. It's no fun waiting in the hot sun for the waves to start.
My Family Loved It.. My Husband and 2 Adult Kids visited Wild Wadi and loved it. One of them even went back the next day and they took some really good photos to.
Excellent Family Fun!. Clean, smiling and supportive staff, safe for kids, good restaurants within the Wadi, and full of non stop fun; this was our first time & my kids refused to leave!!

Everything you would expect from a waterpark in Dubai!. We returned to Al Qasr hotel for the second time and had to pay Wild Wadi another visit.The park is complimentary to guests staying in the Jumeirah group of hotels on Jumeriah Beach. We took advantage of this and went twice during our stay.The park is fantastic and brings out the kid in you! If you have children it would be the perfect place to spend the day. We went as a couple and had two days full of laughs.The slides are amazing,the park is set out brilliantly and looks fantastic with views over the Burj Al Arab.If you are in Dubai this is definitely worth a visit and we will be visiting again when we come back!
Jumierah guests enter free. Jumierah guests enter free and I was a Jumierah guest so just went all the time. A great theme park for all the family.
For the kid in you. My daughter took some friends, who live in Dubai but had never been and they all loved it, good place for children to let of steam.

Great time. We had free tickets as we were staying at the nearby Jumeirah Zabeel Saray. We went on a Monday morning which meant the queues were practically non exist for the couple of hours we were there. My husband loved the Jumeirah Sceirah and became a little kid again. There are plenty of sunbeds with lots in the shade. Lots of lifeguards around the park. They have the usual fast food and drinks outlets.We found it to be a great way to spend a few hours.

Great fun for the family. We had free entry due to staying at Al Qasr and visited every other day. No queues at the rides and plenty of choice for all ages. Our 5 year old went on the Jumeirah Sceirah twice and loved it. The adults were more frightened! Definitely try it as it is a great experience. An excellent water park.

Excellent afternoon at Wild Wadi!. Went in early afternoon.We had free entry as we were staying at the Burj Al Arab hotel, although I did notice entry would have been AED 275 each which I think would be expensiveOnce inside, there's plenty to do. Burj Surj was my favourite!Queues were no more than a couple of minutesLunch was ok, reasonably priced

Good but crowded. This is a good place but lacks somewhat in maintenance, the water is salty and stairs for higher rides slippery. Its crowded and thrill seeking rides even more. I would advise to visit once but if you can visit the water park of Atlantis the Palm as its more clean and better maintained.

great day out. great time with friends, friendly staff, good for adults and kids. much better then Aqua venture. good price too, especially using the entertainer books. visiting again soon, highly recommended.

Good experience. Did not have much time to roam around to each and every corner.
Nice concept, small and precised, very well planned theme park.
Fun place. Fun place in center of Dubai. Various games for adults and children and there are several places for tanning. Enjoyable games and exciting.
Fun, Fun and Fun. We had so much fun playing in all the games. I didn't find any game boring. as for the children they enjoyed the water park as no other park. I highly recommend this to be visited.
Wild Wadi. As we had free entry from our hotel we decided to give it a try. The rides were good, the food prices were reasonable but there really needs to be more shaded areas.

My Fav Waterpark In Dubai. Small, intimate and engaging. Everything is available within a walkable spectrum. It ups on the fun quadrant and saves on the effort. Living in Dubai- I go for the sundowner tickets - it is more than enough time to get a good experience of the cozy park and enjoy the sunset, lazing on raft, that is hurtled up or down by strong streams of water.

Great waterpark - the original Dubai waterpark!. This is a great waterpark and admission is free if you are staying in any Jumeriah Beach group hotel. You will definitely lose a day in this place. It seems a little dated compared with the waterpark at Atlantis but don't let this deter you. You will have a great time here
It means FUN. If you come to dubai and wants to have fun you can approch this water park. it's organized and equipped properly with a fantastic water sliders and the staff is friendly.
World class water park. Best water park I've ever visited. No queues and spotless surroundings. Catering facilities are plentiful, and reasonably priced.
Great Waterpark. We had a great time at the waterpark - there are many different levels of slides and rides for everyone to enjoy

A good day out. Expensive on entry but once in the food and drinks are fairly priced! take your own towels as they charge you for renting them and also charge you separately for the lockers which is not refunded! a really good day out all in all the views of the burj al arab was amazing some beautiful photograph opportunities
Awesome. Our kids loved this place and had an absolute ball. My eldest got stung by a bee and the medical staff were superb, he quickly forgot and carried on with his amazing adventure.
Great day out . We went today as it is included in our hotel price and was a great day. We have a four year old so she wasn't tall enough for the rides must be 1.1 meters but still lots today do.

Best waterpark in Dubai and Abu Dhabi. We visited Wild Wadi, Aquaventure and Waterworld in AD while on tour in the UAE and found that we enjoyed Wild Wadi the best. The lazy river that shoots you up so you can ride slides down is a great way to spend all day in the water and still get thrills without having to climb steps and wait in hot lines lugging innertubes around.The view of the sea, the Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel were spectacular from all parts of the park, especially from the top of the Jumeirah Screamah ride!

good but needs some improvements. Got the tickets for Wild Wadi from one of the Jumeirah hotels.The parking is free which is good.The washrooms needed some cleaning.The park is good but not too big, after 3 hours (on a friday, meaning busy day) we did almost all the rides we could do and we even repeated some of them.The staff was good but some of them seemed uneasy to handle some of the situations criated by some guests, meaning disrespectful behaviour towards other guests.The park offers the towels, which is really appreciated.The rides are fun but other kinds of rides would be apprecciated, like water slides, etc.
ladies days. pleasant for Moslems and others; during Rhamadan timings will be accordingly; don't miss out any of the attractions, they are all great!

so much fun!!. my husband and i made an unexpected visit to the water park during our honeymoon stay in Dubai. Since we were staying at Jumeirah Emirates Towers, we got a free shuttle and entrance to the park. I must say that we had the most fun at this water park than anywhere else in Dubai! We enjoyed this more than the beach, especially since it's so hot in June. They have alot of fun rides! We also loved that everything was so clean and organized. I strongly recommend coming here!

Fantastic. We had a great day at Wild Wadi, well worth the money. We spent all day here with our children aged 6 and 8, they went on all the rides and especially loved the Burj Surj and master blaster. We will definitely go again if we are lucky enough to go back to Dubai.

A must, when visiting Dubai . We were at Wild Wadi on 5/6/14 and must say it's the best waterpark I have visited. This is a must for anyone whilst in Dubai. Although entrance is quite expensive 275 AED (GBP£45) food and drinks etc are reasonably priced. Park open 10am - 8pm except for Thursdays till 6pm (Ladies Night)

Really enjoyed our day. I spent the day here with my husband on 6/6/14. We really enjoyed it. Although admission was expensive, I felt the park itself wasn't to expensive inside for drinks and souvenirs etc, in comparison to other water parks we've visited over the years. There were a number of rides but the surfing rides, we're by far the best. I thoughly enjoyed myself on those, and made this park a little different from others. Easy to locate the park, just off the E11' and easy free parking. The staff joined in the fun also. A great day out, with plenty shade if you want to stay out the hot Dubai sun.

Go Wild at Wadi. An excellent water adventure park which is family friendly, and most rides are suitable for all ages. Includes the lazy river and water jet slides, flumes and swimming pools etc. No outside food allowed, although lunch options are aplenty. We visited an Italian restaurant serving fine quality pizzas and ice creams, and we highly recommend this one, near the smaller lazy river. Although Wild Wadi is one of the oldest watermarks in the United Arab Emirates, and still going strong, I recommend also visiting Abu Dhabi's bigger Yas Waterworld, in Yas Island situated next to Abu Dhabi International Airport. Wild Wadi is a great place for the day out, get a discount with your Entertainer vouchers.

Wild about this Wadi. We stayed at JBH partly because of the associated complementary entry to Wild Wadi - and it did NOT disappoint!Our children (11 & 8) loved it and spent hours each day enjoying all the rides and pools etc. Although busy at times, it never felt too crowded and we were always able to secure loungers in the shade without being on top of other people.The staff are very courteous and well-trained and the sheer number of lifeguards on duty helps with peace of mind as the children enjoy themselves.We found Wild Wadi to be a fantastic, clean and safe environment where the whole family can enjoy the fun of thrills and spills to suit most tastes - highly recommended!

FUNtastic!. Thanks to Jumeirah Hotel chain for giving us a free access to Wild Wadi Water Park. A great gesture of generosity and luxury of Jumeirah Hotel management.Since Dubai is in hot weather for a year round, having a water park in Dubai is an excellent idea.WWWP is a great venue for family bonding and recreation. My son really loves the waves in the swimming pool. We had a real fun!

Great Family Fun. Great place to spend the day with family/friends, especially with the heat of Dubai!It's a really well designed park & something for everyone (ie tame floating & more extreme rides). Suggest arriving as early as possible & avoid weekends/holidays etc. - so crowds/waiting time isn't too bad.It's a bit pricey (285Dhs each), so also recommend using Entertainer vouchers to buy one/get one free, which was really handy when 6 of us went.A good selection of different areas to hangout & also a variety of food options to choose from. Thoroughly recommend this place as a place to visit at least once, residents & tourists alike.
Water Fun. Excellent day out for the family. Our children loved it! A great range of water slides, wave machine, surfing and swimming.

Great day out. Great family day out. Kids loved the water park and the big slides. The lazy river was a great way to relax but not so sure about the uphill flumes with the water jets that just about blew my trunks off!

Great waterpark for families. Visited lots of waterparks over the years and this was one of our favourites as it had lots of rides that we could do together. Had really great fun. The pod one was scary and I nearly chickened out but so pleased I did it.

Hillarious!. Had the best day, loved the fact that many of the rides can be done as 2-4 people. Me & my boyfriend had prevously visited in 2010 and had not realised the changes to jumeriah scarier! The pod cocept definitely adds the scare factor... Legs like jelly after! Worth it for a one off. My sister was with us for the first time in Dubai and commented on how well run the attractions are in Dubai safety is paramount and clealiness is unbelievable. Loved it.

quality!!. Visited every day of our 7 day stay and my children loved it. Pefect for 9 & 12 year olds and they loved the rapids that go uphill, absolutely bonkers. very clean, great staff, plenty of lifeguards and very safe. couldnt recommend high enough but only if youre staying in one of the hotels where you get free entry othwise it's very pricey to get in.

Fantastic fun for kids and us big kids!!. Great experience for all no matter what age you are. Sheer convenience as you can access the water park by walking straight in from the hotel if you are a Jumeirah guest and don't need to take anything with you really - just yourselves !

Family Day at Wild Wadi. We have been to a few water parks in Florida etc, but although this was a little smaller some of the rides were better, and without too many crowds got to go on them 3/4 times each, great day out our youngest child is 8 and oldest 11 they both went on the Scheriah ride which is not as scary as it looks on you tube, but my favourite was Tantrum Alley fantastic even if you not a great swimmer I was never out of my depth.
Great fun.. Lovely way to cool off. Good rides though mostly very tame or extreme, not too much in between but we still all enjoyed.

Fun but much smaller than Aquaventure.
