We found this park to be a lot of fun, but it ended very quickly, after less than 3 hours, pictures were very expensive and the ticket didn't included anything else, unlike Aquaventure, were we went the next day, and included lunch and aquarium entry.So... If you got to pick just one, go to Aquaventure instead. But if you want to do both, you'll have a lot of fun, they are different enough.

So much fun!. This is a perfect way to escape the heat in Dubai and I promise the whole family will enjoy the thrilling rides and the cooling rivers where you just float along. Quite expensive but worth it if you spend the whole day there.

Extreme!. The best water park I have ever been to. It was so fun for everyone. People can go in with all their clothes on and the weather is so warm even in december. The food is nice. The souvenirs are good. The changing rooms aren't that bad. And once you get past the naked people at the entrance then you can start to enjoy the rides. There are good rides for scared people and some for adventurous people as well. it was simply amazing.

Wild Wadi waterpark. My husband, 3 daughters and I spent a day at Wild Wadi in April 2014. We went at opening time and stayed till closing time. Entrance fee to the Wild Wadi is a bit steep but we had a very good time. You cannot take food and drink inside. We were offered at time of purchase of entrance tickets, meal vouchers at a discount which we refused. With hindsight we should have bought these meal vouchers as it was a good bargain. The place was packed for a midweek visit by us and it was a normal school and work day for the people of Dubai. Also pay a deposit for locker to store your personal belongings at time of purchasing your entrance tickets. There are several rides but we went on a few rides we enjoyed a few times. I think visiting a waterpark is worth a visit at least once when you visit Dubai

Best day ever. My husband and I and our two daughters (16 and 12) spent 7 hours here and thoroughly enjoyed it! The three of them went on the adrenalin pumping rides while I went on the more calm river rides. Plenty of food and drink outlets and great photos able to be purchased at the end of the day. Highly recommend this water park for an awesome day out.

Great family day out. Fantastic day out at Wild Wadi with the family. Great rides for all. Arrive early to get a good spot under some shade. Better for families with young children compared to Aquaventure. The floating river could have been better if tubes were removed to avoid clog up of inflatables- also potentially dangerous as small children can get lost in the mass of these. While staff are generally friendly and helpful, there was a lady at the gate who was not so helpful/ customer friendly when we inquired about free meal for holders of Emirates ID cardholders. She not so politely told us that we should know about this promotion and ask upon ticket purchase- is it really a customer's job to 'know' about promotions and ask rather than staff being proactive and sharing information? Other than that- great experience and will return.

'Great for all Ages'. We visited this fabulous location a week ago . The age range was from 5 to 61 years. It's a great place for all the family. It appears to be geared the same as Florida because it has the waves like at the Blue Lagoon and the lazy river. We visited for 3 consecutive days as we were staying next door at Jermeriah Beach Hotel. The rides are colour coded from easy to hard so you can choose which ones to go on. It is a well organised place. Make sure that you apply plenty of sun screen and drink plenty of water which you are allowed to take in with you. However, you are not allowed to take in food as there are plenty of eateries once there. I would definitely recommend going here.

Exhilarating. Wild Wadi is quality water park and keeps getting better with new rides and attractions every year. The place is huge, well maintained and has some of the scariest water park features I've ever been to. The vertical drop slide is not for the faint hearted. It's a great place to get out with friends, especially when it's hot in Dubai

Family day out. There's something for everyone at Wild Wadi! We went with family ages ranged from 3 years to 60 plus and there was something to suit all of us. Plenty of space, although not enough loungers, plenty to do and definitely an all day stay!

amaizing place to spend a day. this place is so nice, it has a lot of game variates and restaurant, you can have your own locker to put your stuff and enjoy your day with water games. showers also are available. recommended for families with kids

Amazing cool effect in the desert heat. It has various interesting water rides. It is close to the Burj Dubai hotel. You can spend the whole day there soaked in water and have time of your life. You can also buy waterproof camera from there.

Good. Water park is excellently placed, In small place they have made good rides etc. Even though we don't know swimming, we were not afraid since the life guards were plenty. Also life guards keep on rotating so they also don't get tired. Locker prices are on higher side. If you are a couple like us please note the lockers are in ladies and gents changing rooms so as a couple you will have to adjust.

Great day out. Great day out for all the family or in our case, day out with friends, spent all day there until it closed plenty to do slides etc very good, or you could just sunbathe and relax, food ok but you won't really be going for that, it's the slides and rides!

FUN day at a superb water park overlooked by two classy iconic hotels, the Burj Al Arab & The Jumeriah Beach Hotel. I've been here a few times & I'm never disappointed. It's a funtastic day out for all the family & good value for money.Spotlessly clean with friendly staff. The rides are a good mix with nothing too hairy & just right for my 12yr old girl. Adults & kids alike can enjoy a great day at this park, in particular as the Dubai heat soars from May onwards.Ok the 'meal deal' on offer is nothing special & it's basically fast food. It's not overpriced given the quality of the park, it's what you'd expect at a venue like this.If you're visiting Dubai with your family, with friends or as a couple go to Wild Wadi & have some fun. You deserve it!

Value for money. Enjoyed a day here. Reasonably priced for a full day entrance. Lots of rides and different areas to enjoy. Managed to find a quiet elevated sunbathing area with great views of the Burj Al Arab too.Food mainly of the fast food variety and not of a particularly high quality.Would return.

Wildest Wadi.... Awesome Staff... Awesome Life Guards....Awesome Rides.... Jumeirah Sceiarah is the most exciting one as per me... a must visit for all water activity lovers....and the backdrop of jumeirah beach hotel on one side and the majestic burn al arab on the other.... awesomeness reinvented.... must must must on your Dubai itinerary...

full day out for fun. we spend a full day there.Lots of attractions where you can have fun for the the whole day.They rent towels in case you forgot yours.You should go early to grap a sun bed.Water is nicely chilled...food is not so gud and expensive and you are not allowed to bring your own food.All in all worth to spend a day there to relax and have some exciting water rides.

Fun for all ages. Our group of four adults and four kids (11,7,4,2 yr) had great fun for nearly six hours.felt very safe with so many lifegaurds people at every step.entire place maintained neat.can happily spend an entire day if you love playing in water.
Fun!. Nice attractions, we enjoyed this. we got luckily 2 free tickets, otherwise I found the entry fee a bit expensive (but everything you do in Dubai is expensive)

a place to escape from the Summer. Since we live a bit longer already in Dubai, we visited Wild Wadi a couple of times. It is always a lot of fun which makes it a great place to spend a day off or just a few hours free time. The Slides are exciting and in perfect conditions.Wild Wadi is a safe place to come with small kids as well. Everywhere you will find Staff and Life guards.The only minus point I give is for the variiety of the Food which you can Buy. compared to Aquaventure or Yas Waterworld you will find less Restaurants or Bars.For me personally is that not a problem because I go there not to eat. But it is definately a difference to the others.

Great water park, better rides than Atlantis. Great water park for adults and teenagers, but not as good for toddlers as Atlantis. If you go please use the Entertainer 2- for 1 vouchers as they save you a fortune.

Big kids again for a few hours. Great water park, lots of different places with sunbeds to set up for the day. The master blaster is something different than I've ever tried before, a water 'roller coaster' if you like which also provides great views at some points. Great memories!!

Cool, cooling, and very fun. If you are in Dubai and its hot, a beach here is not going to give you much cool water. Wild Wadi will. Compact and jammed with fun, this park boasts rides that blast you UPHILL, surfing, gentle floating, and a very long drop. This was a perfect way to handle the heat of Dubai - we had a ball.

Awesome Water Park. I have been to many water parks in the world, but none thus far have combined thrilling dare devil rides with authentic middle eastern design and theme like Wild Wadi. We conquered every ride in the park with ample time to relax. The water park is located next to the Al Burj, so when you are at the top of the giant water slides you get fantastic views of the famous hotel as well as the surrounding suburbs and mosques before take the leap of faith down the slide. If you have enough time in Dubai I recommend spending at least half a day at Wild Wadi you will not be disappointed.

Super fun. Me and my wife had one the greatest times of our lives on our first visit to Wild Wadi. Though there had been some confusion regarding our booking confirmations that took a bit of effort to solve, it was a memorable experience from start till end. The day was not busy at all, and we had many chances on all rides, without any queues. The atmosphere was very friendly with staff all cheery, smiling and even joking with us. The rides were fantastic, especially the fast river ride #1, Torrent Alley and Sceriah. The showering water in one of the shallow pools was like being under a water fall. The body boarding was very cool, and we both enjoyed having a go at it, though I couldn't last more than a few seconds. We took several photos in between and some of those were not available by the end of the day, which was a bit disappointing. Also, it would have been great if the fast rides had allowed us to carry a head mounted camera. Hope you can make the experience better by adding some faster and longer rides. We found the lazy river to be a bit too long for its pace. It would have been excellent fun if it were a slow down-hill ride from a height allowing views of Dubai city and the ocean in a lazy way. I usually had to get off the tube and push her forwards for the entire tract of the lazy river, as it just was a bit too lazy. Also, it would have been great to experience a longer faster river ride leading up to the lazy river. Similarly, something that is 3 times the length of Torrent Alley or Burj Surge will make them an even more exciting experience. All in all, a very awesome water park, probably the best in Dubai and we are sure to return.

Awesome Rides. As we stayed at the Al Qasar resort we got free entry into the park, which was a nice little touch! We spent the whole day there doing the rides, I just wish I had done the big one where the floor drops from beneath you!I shall be returning to Dubai and will be returning to ride that ride!

Old and Tired. Been to quite a few different water parks in different countries, this looked good from the road side, but there were only 4 different rides one of them really long which was fast and slow the other 3 faster rides, wasn't worth the money. There is a new water park just opened which we was told is 10 times better.
Super nice!. The park has very nice oriental design and plenty of water activities. It is one of my favorites. I wish they are more indulgent on smoking areas though.

Excellent for all ages. Was part of the Jumeirah Beach Hotel experience. Even at 67 years old (at the time) I went on all the water rides. Also good for relaxing both out of water or on the lazy river. Excellent fun.

Best waterpark ever!!. I have visited Dubai about 8 times, and always make it a priority to visit Wild Wadi. The park is brilliant with lots of rides to suit everyone. The Jumeirah Sceirah is by far the scariest ride! It has been recently updated, and now, is terrifying!! The family rides are great fun too. Staff are always so friendly and willing to help. In comparison to Aquaventure in the Atlantis, Wild Wadi is much better!!

Fun Family Day. If you purchase the entertainer book, you will receive three buy one get one free tickets for wild wadi. if you are in a group this will save you tremendously on your trip to Dubai.There are a number of rides for everyone to enjoy and a few eating places as well. Money can be loaded onto your wrist bands so that you do not have to carry cash around. Unused money is refunded at the store before the ext turnstyles.Take your own towels so that you do not have to purchase a loan.Overall a nice fun filled day for the family!! the Jumeirah Shera is an awesome ride for the dare devils!will definitely be visiting again.
Nice for children & adults for all age groups. 1) Nice for children & adults for all age groups.2) Very well maintained.3) Do not go on weekend - friday & saturday

Good...not Great!!. Its a nice and fun place to go with friends and family...one must do ride/slide is Jumeirah Scara... Rest of the rides are quite average...so i would say its not a must do but good to do place!!
Not as good as Aquavenuture. Good water park, but aquaventure is much better, Wild wadi was very crowded and in my eyes is over rated

Not what it used to be. I've always been a fan of Wild Wadi I last came in 2008, however it seems to have gone downhill! There locker system for one thing is an issue, we were told we have a locker wristband, but actually everytime you touch a locker it deducts money, we tested a locker and it wouldnt open again needless to say after a security staff helped us we got a refund. the rides seem to have taken a turn to the boring side, they used to have a large lazy river, its now been split to create a flood river? which did not appear to be that different. although the attraction was on the downside the staff were friendly and helpful when needed.

Love the park except for the changing room. Compare to aquaventure at atlantis, wild wadi is much more organise. At aquaventure, for rides you have to carry your own tubes which is annoying. On aquaventure river rides there is empty tubes floating around everywhere and no staff to pick them up. Wild wadi rides are much more convenient as you can just go and queue up and tubes will be ready for you at the start of the ride. But changing rooms are a bit messy. The lockers are too small. Other than that I have a fun day at wild wadi. Keep it up!!!
Go Wild.. Spent a lovely day at the waterpark. you need atleast six hours to really enjoy the place. Suffering from a bit of wear and tear.

Beat the heat in Dubai here..and FREE if you stay at any Jumeriah Resort. This kid friendly theme park is located right before you get onto the Burj Al arab property and right next to the Jumeriah Beach resort Hotel. (both are owned by Jumeriah) .This is the place to take the kids to cool down on those 110 degree plus days which are common for 6 months of the year in Dubai. This park is well done and you can rent lockers on site and more importantly you load money onto a" faux watch" that you can use to buy things throughout the park..Theme parks in the US can take note here as the watch idea is perfect as u can wear it in the water, use it for snacks, drinks, pictures anthing the park sells and it is reloadable. No need to shlep a wallet or purse as you do this when you enter the park, put your stuff in a small locker and enjoy your day.Whatsmore, any funds you put on the card you dont use is refunded when you leave. We stayed at the Burj Al Arab and were pleased to find there was no fee for entrance as it was a Jumeriah property and all guests staying at any of their 5 properties get free admittance. This was like a $120.00 saving for the two of us! Even though I am 50 plus I had an absolute ball here at this park!

A little low rent. My wife and I were really looking forward to Wild Wadi, we'd looked at lots of You Tube videos to get a feel for it, and staying at the Burj Al Arab entrance was free, however, we did have to pay for a locker, a little odd, you'd think given the price you pay to stay at the Burj they'd throw in the locker.I have to say, after we'd look forward to coming here we were both really disappointed, the changing area was smelly and quite dank, the lazy river had an extremely rough floor. There aren't enough sunbeds and you are really crammed in, after about 20 minutes of being there we decide to leave and go to the beach. For Dubai this isn't what we expected, especially with the location of this water park. We've been to a number of water parks previously, and I have to say this one was a real let down.

Water park fun. I paid several tips to the waterpark on this visit as entry was included as part of the hotel stay in the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray in the Palm. We also got free shuttle from the hotel and back.We went on a Friday where it was rather busy and there were long lines for several rides and one of the main rides seemed to be unreliable on the day of our visit. We returned on the Sunday in the afternoon and again it was doing brisk business.My son who was previously too short for some of the slides enjoyed it the most as he was now tall enough. We had a fun time but I reckon that at the prices charged this is expensive.

Well run, safe & fun. Wild Wadi is not cheap, so if you are a party of 4, make sure you buy the Dubai entertainer. The vouchers for this alone almost pay for the book. It is very well organised & safety seems to be taken very seriously

A Great Way to Escape the Dubai Heat- A Little Expensive Though!. We visited Wild Wadi in April 2014. This was a great way to escape the Dubai heat.The ticket price was quite high- however lunch, a drink and an ice cream were included in the admission package that we bought. I was disappointed that you had to pay extra for lockers as well (try not to bring too much stuff because the price of the locker is more if you require a large locker).There are rides ranging from slow and relaxing to the more scary rides suited to the thrill-seekers. I loved the Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley!There's a great view of the Burj Al Arab from Wild Wadi too which is a bonus.
Great fun. Good all round water park. New plug hole type slides are great but one is too extreme for under 10s in my view
Some experience. Just be careful when doing the rides.From there you can get the best views into Jumeirah Beach Hotel and Burj Al Arab.

Golden oldie of water parks. ONE of the original water parks in the UAE and still going strong.It's probably best to visit before you head to the likes of Yas Waterworld or Atlantis as you'll be a tad deflated otherwise.When it is not busy, you can do the attractions in a couple of hours, but that also means you can keep going back for more. It has one of the best river runs around and location means you're close to the Madinat Jumeirah Souk for dinner later.Great views of the Burj Al Arab in a park that is well suited to young kids as most of the rides are non-scary.

Ok just average !. Visited for 1 day and we were only there 2 1/2 hours then decided to leave. The park itself was large but there wasn't really that many slides / rides. We got there early and within the 1st hour of opening the place was heaving. My son who is 8 didn't think it was as good as the Atlantis and said he only really enjoyed 2 of the slides, it was a little disappointing for him.Would not have liked to have paid full price, we got as part of our hotel's package which was a bonus. We won't return back to this waterpark on our next visit will probably go back to The Atlantis instead.

Rides for all!. Have you ever been on water ride that goes uphill?? Well here you can, a ring whooshes you up to the next level where you stay, hopefully, on your ring then you go down a flume, then up again! And so on, I think you go up 7 levels. There was a nice area for small children, and plenty of shade. What I particularly liked was the cashless wristbands, you load up your money, either at the entrance when you pay to get in or there are machines around the park, which you can use at the restaurants or the shops and there is a special reader in the wristband to open/close your locker, if you paid for it at the entrance. So no cash or keys to lose. Great day out.
Good fun. We had a great day at wild wadi water park, next time we go it is a must to take the children to, good fun for adults as well as children
A must in Dubai. Go and have fun in Wild Wadi while in Dubai. The best way to beat the heat. You will enjoy every minute.

Fun way to spend a stopover day in Dubai. This was my younger teens pick and she was very happy with it! Food was surprisingly OK. Not as large as other water parks we have visited (like Disney in Orlando) but they weren't bored. Fortunately the queues weren't too long so they could go on their favourites a few times. I did see quite a few attentive lifeguards which is always a good thing for a water park. We were able to load money onto one of the wrist bands so we didn't have to go back to the locker. I think they rent towels but ask at your hotel as ours lent us some from the spa. Any remaining funds are returned at the end of the day (cash) so a great way to handle spending in the park.

Best water park For teens and everyone like the best. This waterpark I expected to be ok but compared to the ones in America, like the big ones six flags or Disney world or kings dominion, this place is so much fun. It's definately worth going, it has beautiful views too. Just go with a lot of people so it's more fun. Also**** u can get free admission if you stay at burj al Arab. Idk about Jumeirah beach but check!

Great for big kids too!. This was our first visit to Wild Wadi and as a group of four adults we thoroughly enjoyed our day being big kids!Wild Wadi has a range of rides from siting on big rubber single or two person rings on White Water to four person rings on Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley, surfing or lazing on the beach.The White Water Wadi ride was our favourite, the longest ride with uphill water jets to push you along rather having to get out a regular intervals to climb upstairs, the ride also has options at various locations, so you can chose a different chute and try a different experience. We took the advice of other reviewers and rented a cabana for the day. The cabanas are quite tucked away in a quiet corner, which was great for us as four adults, as you felt you were leaving the hustle and bustle of queues to lie on a lounger and enjoy a break. The cabana was provided with four loungers, table and four chairs, eight towels, fridge with complimentary water and soft drinks, waiter service for food and fast track access to White Water Wadi which was an advantage as the day got busier.The bathroom/shower/changing facilities are quite small, only a couple of each in the block nearest the cabanas, but are kept very clean throughout the day.Overall a great day out in Dubai!

Yee-ha!. We spent some hours here as a part of free experience while staying in Jumeirah Emirates Towers hotel. Wave pool, two water rides is just what we needed (+ some kids rides for parents). Rides were fine, lifeguards were omnipresents (I wonder whether it's because of tourists or locals). We didn't try surfin' rides as there was a huge queue in front of each one... But for a free entrance, it was worth it. Don't expect something huge, but for 2-3 hours to enjoy especially if it's included in your hotel stay, it's really worth it.
Great with kids, but also a thrill for big kids. Great rides and a nice half day out, impressive setting just in front of the famous burj al arab hotel and jumeirah beach hotel.

Great rides, Cabana disappointing. This was our first visit to Wild Wadi although we have been to the Atlantis Waterpark twice. I would say for a family with younger children (8 and 11) Wild Wadi is slightly better as it has two rides that you can do as a family in a four person ring (Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley). The White Water Wadi ride is also great to do as a family and is quite a long ride so makes the wait in the queue feel worthwhile. We took the advice of other reviewers and rented a cabana for the day. The location was disappointing as the website says 'prime beach location' and I expected something close to Breakers Bay or Juha's Dhow and Lagoon area but the cabanas are quite tucked away and you cannot supervise younger children without leaving the cabana. It's convenient as you are guaranteed a lounger and have somewhere to leave your valuables but given the price, I would rent a locker next time. You do get fast track access to White Water Wadi which on busier days would be an advantage.

Fun day. Spent the day here during our holiday staying next door at Jumeirah Beach Hotel. Lots of exciting things to do however adventurous you may be. Many lifeguards on duty and queues went down very quickly. Plenty of areas to sit and lockers available while you try the rides.
water park. My grandson enjoyed the park. It is similar to the one on the Gold Coast Queensland but a little tired looking. Safety at Wild Wadi was a priority with lifeguards alert.
loved it. loved this water park, really enjoyed the rides, went on time n time again, would definitely come again

Peace in a cabana. We decided to visit this waterpark after sampling Atlantis, this park had a fewer rides but we all thought they were better, a little more energetic, we hired a cabana which was set aside from everything else in a quiet spot which was nice, set with beds, towels, table, chairs and a fridge stocked with free water and soda drinks, we also had our own server who you would order from and they would get what we wanted and bring it back! - lazy or what!A very good day out and as one of the best rides gets very busy we had a fast pass wristband so well worth it!

Good with young kids. A friend informed us that with young children it is better to go to this park than in the one in the Palm.In this park all is just abore or below 110 cm. My older son is 111 cm and he could go everywhere!The parc is small and doesn't have many slides/attractions.If you pay the entrance, it's not cheap. You have cheaper prices into their website but even better buying at "travel agents" in your hotel or in town.The food is acceptable.We spent a very nice day.

Lots of Laughter!. This was my frist time visiting Wild wadi and i was really impressed; never laughed so much in my life specially on the surf boad machines. Food supplied was gorgeous we dined at the bbq sections loves the humous!!

Good but not as clean as yas water world. The rides were all very good but I found a used plaster in the pool and it just seemed quite unkept. But I can imagine it is quite hard to keep such a big place clean, it in yas waterworld, Abu Dhabi everything was very hygienic. But since I did go there for the rides, which were great I will still give wild wadi water park 4 stars.
Wild wadi water park. Very good experience. great place for the family.it was a great time to take a break with the family. Thanks wild wadi.we will come back again. See you..

Overcrowded. This was included as a free amenity for staying in any of the Jumeirah hotels. The trouble was it was overcrowded with nowhere to park yourself. After walking around it twice, we simply left. Disappointing and a waste of time. On the other hand the only thing we wasted was time. I would have been angry to have paid to get in and find this level of overcrowding.

Poor value for money but some of the rides are pretty cool. I hadn't seen some of the rides in this park before and was a lot of fun trying them out. It's well overpriced for what you actually get, the queues for food are atrociously long and you need to watch out for the girl at the ticket desk randomly charging you more money - sneaky.
nice outing. Wild Wadi was free to us as residents at the hotel and the kids went twice - they had fun, although it was busy.

It was more expected we have seen better once. It was very full as we have been on a friday which is Holiday!Also attractions have been not as good as expected.In total you have a small choice what you can do.
The smaller kids area is excellent. It's very big, lots of people but you always will get something to do - and the smaller kids are is excellent for them. Bring lots of sunscreen!
Great. Had a ball. So much fun. Loved all the rides, and the staff are so friendly and helpful. Can't wit to go back again

Good Fun. Considering we are both in our Fifties we thought that this might be a bridge too far. Went with my son who lives in Dubai. He did comment that there is a better and bigger one but it involved around an hours travel. We plumped for this and were not disappointed. Clean and tidy changing facilities with very helpful guides/attendants. We did all the rides and enjoyed all equally but once was enough for the Jumeirah Sceirah (the sudden drop experience).Did enjoy the relaxing float around too. Went for a meal prior to leaving the park. Didn't want anything advertised but very helpful chap directed us to a good value shawarma. All in all a cracking few hours spent. Tip: go early before it gets too busy!

Fun...Great Location. Great Water Park. In a great location near the Burj al Arab. Enjoy a great day at the park and then enjoy cocktails at 360 nearby looking at the Burj.Tip: Check Ebay for buy one get one coupons...saves about 75 USD
The kids did not want to leave. We had 4 hours here and they kids did not want to. They said this was the best park ever in the world. We had to agree very good like more than the Atlantis

Thrilling and relaxing!. My husband and I went to both aqua venture water park and wild wadi water park. We had a lot of fun in both but I think wild wadi river rides are longer and I liked them more. In addition its famous sceirah is more exciting. On the other hand atlantis was more modern and the rides are more various and you have alot of options to try. Both have kids friendly rides too
Not as good as thought. Ok but really expensive. I would pre book. Plenty of sun loungers and nice shaded areas. Very clean. Hardly any queues and shade queuing which is needed. Food lovely though
Great day with the kids. Wild Wadi is situated near Jumeirah beach and with a view on the Burj Al Arab - it offers a huge water park with entertainment for young and old

Good but the Atlantis is better. This water park is very good and you don't have to carry your rings around with you. Also a good feature is you can put money on your wrist band so you can lock your valuables away and don't have to keep returning to the lockers. Any money left on the bands gets returned when you leave. The place is clean but a bit dated in parts. We had been to the Atlantis first so compared it to that which we thought was much better. There was lots of sunbeds and chairs but I'd recommend you get there early if you want one. Also a lot of the sunbed areas had sail like shades over you so not very good if you want to get a tan but good if you like to stay in the shade. The wave pool was good but a long wait for the waves to start. Lots of places to eat we had a pizza which was made to order and was very reasonably priced. My daughter & husband had a great time on all the slides although they did have to que for a while.

Awesome waterpark. We came here a couple of times while staying in Al Qasr. The proximity to our hotel and ways of transport made this a very easily accesible park. We had great fun here. The park is really good, it won't disappoint. We really enjoyed the bracelet concept for paying, made everything more easy and relaxing, specially when travelling with kids. Overall a great answer for the extreme heat of Dubai!

Great Waterpark. My wife and I went to Wild Wadi on our honeymoon in April 2014.The water park great! The use of the waterproof bracelets that you pre-load money onto is a great idea (saves a lot of time walking back to the locker rooms if you wanted a drink etc). The bracelets can also have photos (taken by the Staff) saved to the bracelet so you can collect all your images at once. The rides were great, all in great condition. The location is perfect with the Burj Al Arab in the background of a lot of your photos.Food is reasonably priced and of decent quality. I haven't been to any other water park in Dubai, but I would definitely recommend Wild Wadi to anyone who visits Dubai!
Love this place !. This is the third time I've visited Wild Wadi and think its great.It's well run, the staff are all very professional and it's a great day out.Not to be missed !

good water park. nice water park which i have see in the past
have a lot of fun there
good for every one to visit
i will introduce to all my friends

Worth it, only takes a few hours. There was hardly any lines when we went. It was easy to find and there is a large free car park. The park itself was great, plenty to do but still only takes a few hours to do everything. There are great places to take photos of the burj hotel too.

Fabulous entertainment worth the pricey entrance cost. We loved it so much we went twice during our 9 day holiday. The girls 7 and 8 went in all the slides. The fact that you could get pushed up hill on a tube was great fun. We all loved it. We tried surfing too. You could borrow t shirts to avoid any embarrassing moments.It is expensive about £50 per person but worth every pound. We got there at 10 and left at 6 only stopping for a 30 minute lunch. A little crazy. If the children are older then take a book whilst they play. If you get travel sick remember your travel sickness pills!!! You can load up a wristband so you don't need to carry any cash with you which I would advise.

Great waterpark, a must see!. If you want to go full out then take a Cabana. It is extremely high priced, especially on busy days but very comfortable. So no value for money but extreme luxury. You get your own fridge with free refills, 3 beds, towels and a table with chairs including a parasol. Plus you get VIP access to a single but busiest ride. The package also comes with a butler that will take your order and bring your food. So no standing in line.The rides in the park are great for all ages. Ranging in scariness :-) The least scary is the pool for the very young and the most scary is a vertical drop from a very high tower.In the middle you have different rides, again ranging in scariness depending on speed and turns.There is only one issue which is that when one of the rides is closed, too much water pressure goes to the other rides and in that case it is really recommended to use a single tube for you and your kid.Security is fantastic. Very kind staff. Even if you come without swimwear you can buy everything you need in the store. You don't need to bring a camera because professional photographers take your pictures. Of course they're very expensive but then again they come in a nice frame.In the pool every now and then there are waves. The life guards are everywhere and very attentive.On-site there are life vests for guest who cannot swim but still want to enter the pool. There is music for all kinds. Popular, Arabic, European, etc.I recommend you go early, it opens at 10 and if you don't take a Cabana then quickly find a chair. There are not only chairs around the pool but also in higher areas so don't give up too quickly.Lockers are there. You can use an electronic wallet and pay using it for everything. No hassle.

Exceeded expectations. My 13 yr old son and I had a wonderful time. Excellent customer service, very friendly staff and really great fun. We had such a great time, I would highly recommend it as a super fun day out.

fun for all ages. lines were not too long. Plenty of choices for all ages. Water was comfortable temperature. I like the wristband option where you can charge food too. Saves having to bring money with you. Even if you can't swim, you can have fun here because they provide swim vests for all ages.

Perfect water destination for below 6 years kids. Excellent place to spend your time, if you have kids aged less than 6 years. The place offers many small and medium slides for the kids, an artificial sea with waves and splash zone. Relax with a double tube with your kid in the lazy river and keep floating till you are content. Many food outlets inside, so don't worry about food, drinking water etc. There are adequate changing rooms and lockers to store your stuff. Try to go with as lighter clothes as possible, so that you can adjust all your clothes in a smaller locker.
expensive but super fun day out!. Expensive place but oh! so much fun! small but big enough with a great surfing school , nice on a hot AEU day! Well worth it! and better than aquaventure we thought.

Very enjoyable although not huge. We really enjoyed spending the day here and overall we had a good time although it's not great value for money. Even though it was a weekend, it didn't feel too crowded and the queues for rides went down reasonably quickly. The rides are well attended with hundreds of lifeguard staff. We really enjoyed the lazy river rides!However, I would say it's showing it's age a little. It's not huge and there aren't really that many rides - the advertising saying 30 attractions is really quite misleading as there are 9 or so main attractions and a good looking kiddies section. They could do with one or two more big rides and after a while it's a bit samey. The layout of the park is also a bit confusing though once you get the hang of it you realise it's small! There is a bit of a funny damp smell around the park at points, but I suppose it's to be expected given its age. For the price of the ticket, we expected more rides. Also you have to pay for the use of a locker when you get in - an extra 35 dirhams for a small one. Given that everyone is going to need a locker, we thought this was a total rip off and should be included with the ticket price as standard. On a side note, we booked our tickets through Ticketmaster. When we arrived Wild Wadi said that these were not valid this year as their contract with Ticketmaster was for 2013 only (despite us having called Wild Wadi before booking to check that they accepted Ticketmaster tickets). It was annoying and wasted some of our time when we got there but they did sort it out in the end. The main thing to note is don't buy your tickets through Ticketmaster - just go direct through the Wild Wadi site, even though it's more expensive - it will be worth it.

Good long rides!. More queuing that Atlantis although really not that bad. We spent four hours and had lunch there which I didn't think cost that much. The park is quite small but the rides are longer, I preferred WW to Atlantis but my family disagree. Good time to go is either first thing or at 5 pm.

Fantastic. We had a great day here, although the oldest of the water parks it was our favourite with some great rides.We hired a cabana for a day and it was really worth the money for the towels, private area, sun beds, table and personal attendant.

Happy day!. A full of fun day in wild wadi, lots of rides, specially a long ride with tube around the water park. Must go water park in Dubai, full of joy and excitement.
Dislike : expensive, few food and drink options, much crowd and long queue.

Very nice attractions for a day stay. We were on eastern Sunday in this water park and had a nice experience with the different attractions, the beach option is very expensive so do not plan a park beach combination, due the access to beach is more expensive than the access to the park.

Very good - liked it. Visited on a lovely warm day: so, t-shirt on to avoid sunburn!
Kids paradise; but also for grown ups.
A bit expensive (no vouchers - management just adjust the price rather than antagonise those without vouchers) but worth it as it's a full day's entertainment.
The big drop was scary.
Lovely day. Not many rides but the ones there were different to normal ones which made it fun! No need to cover shoulders and knees - normal swimwear was fine. No food or drinks allowed in.

It's very average for the price. Went here earlier this week after having spent a day at aquaventure at atlantis, wild wadi for the same price is a rip off, it's catered for children and that's where it ends. Getting good takes far longer than necessary and we had to stand in the sun while we waited for our horrible plastic food as options are very very limited and expensive. If you have the option then go to atlantis it's far superior!!!

Clean, organized, lots of staff, plenty of fun. Keeping a place this crowded clean isn't easy but I never saw any trash or anything out of place. Staff are everywhere and very responsive. Queues for some popular rides were up to 20 minutes but got much shorter nearer to closing time. Some of the rides are truly take-your-breath-away thrilling so even though they were short we waited to do them multiple times (Jumeriah Sceriah is 11 seconds, and Tantrum Alley is 55 seconds). Wristband system for lockers and stored money is nice.

Brilliant family fun!. Fantastic water park - Still all round good fun.Better value than the Atlantis (Aquadventure) but it was very busy on the day we went (Friday - not a good choice!) Also, music very loud!Real pain was that there were no toilets other than those in the changing room area (where you go in) - Not helpful with young children!

Good day out. We spent quite a few hours at the Wild Wadi Water Park. Don't compare to Disney, as it really isn't at the same level. There are less rides and a mixture of extreme, thrilling and family. Take towels as hire charge is expensive at about £5 each, when you get your ticket you are offered food vouchers which are probably worth getting and you can put money on your wrist band which is worth doing, any unused is refunded at the shop before you leave. Locker hire is available, but you would probably be ok to leave your bags on a lounger. We want during the week, and the queues were ok. A good day out.
Very Fun!. This Water Park, is a great place with lots of things to do. There are lots of slides. It is great for family's with children.

Good but not the best. Decided to come to Wild Wadi for the day as it was recommend by a friend. I was impressed with the views of the Burj Al Arab, the staff in how polite and friendly they were and the rides of courseDon't get me wrong it's a great water park but in going to the Atlantis a few days before visiting Wild Wadi.... The Atlantis wins for me I'm afraid
One of 2 nice water parks in Dubai. Nice rides on inflatable and open slides with a nice view of the Burj Al Arab. Nice kiddie and adult wave pools too.

Fantastic Day Out. We had complimentary tickets to Wild Wadi as we were staying at the Jumeriah Zabeel Saray hotel. My young children really enjoyed the kids area and swimming pool with waves. They did not want to leave and had to be dragged away. Happy kids = Happy Parents. One small complaint was the locker facilities which are controlled by wrist tags which can be topped up with monetary funds and can be used to purchase food, gifts and hire lockers in the changing rooms. My tag did not recognise my locker when I went to get something out of it for a second time. The problem was resolved by the locker room attendant. ....but it almost took 45 minutes and I missed out on quality time in the water park with my wife and children. On a sour note.....a very rude member of staff named Lydia refused me and my family entrance to the adjoining Jumeriah beach hotel via the side / beach entrance. We had planned to eat at one of their restaurants with our half board vouchers which can be used at selected places in any Jumeriah restaurant. I explained that I was staying at the JZS and showed her my vouchers which clearly stated that I could eat there. She dismissed them and said they were not valid. I gave her my hotel room number to do a security check, which she refused. What was worse was a security guard next her said we were ok to go in. They were arguing between themselves. She insisted we had to leave the Wild Wadi park from the main entrance and walk on the main road to get inside the Jumeriah beach hotel. This is a 10 minute walk with 2 very young children who are tired and hungry. I made an official complaint to the duty manager Ralph Fernandez. Ralph was fantastic and very understanding. He arranged a table at the pizza restaurant on the beach and escorted us in person via the side entrance.

Really, Really Fun!. We arrived at approximately 4.00 pm with about two hours until closing, the entrance fee unfortunately remained full price and once we added two towels and a small locker it was quite expensive…. However, we went into the changing rooms which were very clean, spacious, had toilets, showers, hair dryers, etc and changing cubicles. The lockers (and any spending money) are loaded onto and operated using a wrist-band which is all easy to use. We went and found a lounger to leave our towels and sandals and headed straight for a tube and the river. The river was so much fun (when my husband and I shared a double-tube, I’ve never laughed so much), it enables you to stay in your tube and pushes you up (!) where you can get off for other rides or eventually go back down as a ride itself (or simply float around like a real river). There is a kiddy area, wave pool, ‘flow-riding’ wave and various rides with different ‘thrill’ rates (we rode most and my husband did the scary Jumeirah Sceirah twice and both times was anxious but completely exhilarated).The park was slightly confusing getting around and finding rides (when we weren’t on the river), we referred to the various maps quite a lot. It’s done nicely though, is really clean and tidy, with a pretty waterfall, rope bridges, loads of loungers/seating, little shops and great views from the top of some rides. There were also a large number of lifeguards and staff at various points on the river and at each ride.I’m slightly self-conscious and together with being blonde and not all visitors being entirely ‘westernised’ was nervous about walking around and being in swimwear, however took a sarong with me and found that people were generally ok anyway (other people were wearing sarongs, t-shirts and some ladies were obviously covered up).We had such a brilliant and fun couple of hours, it was reasonably quiet so only had to queue once for about 10 minutes and the experience was all helped by the lovely warm weather. We could have done with a little longer than two hours to do some of the rides again, however we’re not the kind of people to sit on a lounger so wouldn’t have lasted all day and found that it just about right for us anyway. We would recommend a trip to Wild Wadi if you have a spare day in Dubai, or love with waterparks.

Excellent family location for young & old. Fantastic family entertainment for young & old. You will need the whole day to fully experience all the games, slides & rides that Wild Wadi offers. Various areas for youngsters under 3 years old there is a separate section & for different age groups different areas. Location is fabulous, fantastic views of Burj Al Arab & Jumeira Beach Hotel. A great day out.

Good. This is worth doing. Nice park - small by American standards but some good rides. The rides interjoin with each other so you get propelled along 11 different type of routes. Other than that there are 4 other proper slides and a coupe of surf type bits and a lazy river. BBQ food was quite nice at Ali's BBQ

Fun day in the sun. Very suitable to spend all day-best enjoyed in a cabana. However, it comes across as slightly awkward when the cabana prices are manipulated by staff rangeing from 1200-1500 AED. The price appears to depend on how busy they are...or the time of day. We have not come across this type of nonsense in any of the other waterparks. The deal comes with a nicely filled fridge/drinks. The rides are good fun.Still after spending 2 days at Wild Wadi we decided to get a taxi to Yas Waterworld which is still our all time favourite waterpark.Wild Wadi is still better than Aquaventure waterpark. Saying that, if you wanted to use all the other facilities at Atlantis like the dolphin bay it may still be worth a visit.

Lovely place to hang out in water sports. if you got water fear or you love to stay in the water, this is the place to visit in Dubai.... Especially if you are tourist its more enjoyable in my view in comparison to Atlantis aqua venture1.If you are tourist you don't have plenty of time to stay at one place to enjoy each & every part..Wild Wadi is best in this way in which you can get rides like Jumeirah Sceirah & Master Blasters etc which cover all most every ride of wild wadi (its interconnected) so it saves allot of precious time of tourist to get an Que for each & every ride2.its near Jumeirah Beach so you can plan with that 3.Best View Of Burj al Arab & that too freee

Great fun for all ages. It is a clean and safe water park (lots of life guards all over the place), with amazing environment. We enjoyed all individual and group rides, there are rides for all ages. I highly recommend the place.However don't visit Wild Wadi during weekends and Dubai official holidays , as you will have to wait long time to take turns on the rides.
Great Fun. An excellent full day out if you like getting wet and swimming. No end of things to do and experience - make the most of it by going early and staying all day.Exhausting!
Wild Wadi. It's a good park. Depending on your preference it could be an excellent park. I prefer more space/wide open places to relax. But the rides are great.
Water fun family day. You can spend your day full of fun while enjoying water slides swimming tanning , even if you want privacy , book a cabana for adults , but sure it's a great family day
for sun and water lovers. excellent place to be with children they will enjoy as variety of marvellous water games, nothing in comparison in Dubai

Wonderful. The place is wonderful , so many activities to all adults and kids , can't get tired of trying them all however what impressed me the most the life guards and the staff , they are so friendly , always smiling and the guards are so attention to kids safety. Every time we visit wild wadi creats a new memorable experience.

Couldn't tear the kids (or husband) away!. This is the most amazing waterpark my family have ever been too. The range of rides is great, and for the price, as long as you stay for a good while, is good value for money. My two kids and husband didn't want to leave the place, they had such a good time. My experience was a bit more sedate but I enjoyed it too. Highly recommended.

Excellent for the entire family. Wild wadi is a great place for the entire family. It has many activities for people of all ages. Food is a bit expensive. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Safety is a high priority for them and it can be seen in their policies and work ethics.We spent very little time in queus - and the weather was perfect for the month of April

Dubai stop over. Decent water park, too expensive though and nowhere to rest as a parent with a child. All the sunbeds were taken with towels and no people which was deeply annoying. Fabulous for children but way too many adults which seemed a bit odd.

Best place to forget about everything and just relaaaax.... I've been in the park twice and I'm sure that during my next trip to Dubai I'll visit it again. I think it is a great place to spend your spare time with friends or family cause there are too many things to do! I love the location of the place, its atmosphere and, for sure, water attractions! Jumeirah Sceirah is the best! I highly advise all the travellers in Dubai (especially with kids) to visit this amusement park. Believe me, you won't regret it!!!

A fab day out. I visited on 2nd April with my teenaged daughter! We had great fun trying out all of the slides! The Burj Surj was our favourite. We used an entertainer voucher to get in (buy one get one free) so felt it was really good value for money. We had a truly wonderful and memorable day out.

Wild Wadi!. A great outdoor waterpark taking advantage of Dubai's excellent climate. Personal highlights included the flowrider (standing wave) and the multi-person slides which make you feel as if you're about to go over the edge at any minute. Loads of fun.

A good dash of water and fun in the desert!. I was dragged by an adventurous friend to wild wadi before now I never considered the tourist attraction because I could not swim. Nonetheless my friend insisted and made sure I bought a pair of board shorts the day before.I'd like to add the board shorts were purely for my modest self as bikinis and one pieces were allowed for the more modest the wadi shop sold full coverage swimwear. First thing I noticed my footwear (frivolous) and glasses were totally unnecessary they would not be allowed on the most of the rides so I had to drop them in the locker allotted to us. Call me chicken but my favourite rides were the more sedate ones, there were many for the more adventurous all of which I tried once at least.I have to admit it was fun I enjoyed my self ( when I stopped screaming) :)) Tip- go there early in the day to beat the queues on the rides as they can be long and tedious. Food in the park is expensive as is normal with most parks don't expect mall rates

Poor byDubai standards. Nothing to shout about in comparison to Slide n Splash ,ALGARVE and the Disney water parks.Overpriced for what there is,nice clean tidy as is all of Dubai ,but given everything else bit of a let down , no slides as such . Uphill rollarcoaster type ride is good as is the big drop one,needs more though.

The best in Dubai. This waterpark is my favourite in Dubai. It has something for everyone. I believe that it is much better that Atlantis also. We entered using the Entertainer vouchers where we had 2 buy one get one free. We used the money we saved and got a cabana for 1200 aed. This was the best thing to do. You have a fully stocked beach bar, private sunbeds and butler for 8 people. It really is the way to go.

Top tips!!. We visited on 3 April. We had a Entertainer voucher for but one get on free (can buy on ebay). We spent 245dhs on admission. We also brought a meal deal voucher for 55dhs - valid at all restaurants. Choice of pizza / chicken or beef burger or hot dog with salad, fries and either a ice cream or watermelon plus a soft drink eg coke. When we got the food we paid another 2dhs to supersize the fries and coke. Plenty of food for 2 people. They even allowed us to go back and get the ice cream once we had finished eating! We got there at 1030. No need for a locker as we had no valuables. Dump you bag, sun lotion and towel on a sun lounger and head to the rides. There are several to choose from but do the big 3 first when there are no queues. You easily warm up / dry off so we only went back to towels twice. You can't take food and drink in - they check bags. Try the single surf wave machine first as usually a shorter queue. On leaving walk around the corner to the Jumeriah Beach Hotel to get a taxi home as the queue can be long, there were buses to Mall of the Emirates but not sure if free. Go and have fun and enjoy the wave machine. We were big kids again and it was brilliant!! 2 people in early 30s from London!

2nd childhood. Arrived as the doors opened, which is probably advisable to avoid the queues. You pay entry & pay for a wristband for your locker. No food or drink is allowed on the site & they do check your bags on entry! You have to charge credit to another wristband for refreshments. There was 2 of us & we spent around AED200 on 4 coffees & 2 Caesar salad meals with extra chips & watermelon. I was pleased that you weren't stung on the prices. We spent 6 hours there on the rides & laying around on the sun loungers.

Wasn't keen, very crowded reminded me of an 18-30s. I've been to water parks all over the world including other Emirates waterparks Yas and Aquaventure on The Palm and this was the worst, the most expensive and the worst concern the only toilets are near the entrance I walked around for half an hour looking before asking staff so keep your mouth closed in the water, it's probably more suited to the under 30's

An amazing experience. You would love and remember the one day you spent at this place for the rest of your life and so will your kids. I would surely come back to this place for another day of fun and joy. Loved the water slide. Awesome.
wet n wild. Its a very good water park with some cool rides..If u have an extra day in dubai itinerary then go for it!,..good for a change!
Awesome fun. It is an absolute blast. Fun for the entire family but also very expensive. Arrive early and spend the entire day there.

A perfect getaway destination !!!!. A perfect getaway destination especially during the Summer days in Dubai. Worth going out with friends couple of times. Food very good and can be expensive to some people.

Wet and fun. A fun place to go even as a couple! We enjoyed this so much, I was crying with laughter! The food was a little expensive, what you'd expect at an adventure park. Overall well worth the money.

Needs updating but still very good. Its a good water park. Quicker to get on the attractions than Aquaventure but I would say a little bit too expensive.
But nevertheless, due to the lower waiting time to get on attractions, I would say its better than Aquaventure.
Must Visit. If you are in Dubai with a day extra, you should visit this humongous water park. The best ride is the 90 degree free fall and the 11 rides in one go.
wow its so good. Must visits if you are travelling dubai, advise for all dubai expertise is visit on weekends to release you're stressed life style.

Loved it. I was like a kid. Loved it. Just one advise avoid locals, they just spoil your fun! Service is excellent. However, avoid holiday time as it will no doubt have the headache of noisy kids, and families who don't know how to control their little rascals. But if your going with family, it will be a great memory.

Very well laid out. It was very well laid out, well run. We might have been lucky on the day we went (a Thursday) but the queues were almost non existent - it probably helped it had rained the day before and put people off

Good fun. Went their with my 7 year old . He's a water baby. Loves to play with water.Found the entrance a lil expensive at 240 dirhams but the buy 1 get 1 free from the entertainer app made it worth it. The park has 3 big thriller water rides n a total of some 11 attractions.Luckily we went as soon as the park opened and so found 0 lines. could do the major rides twice n some thrice. We were kinda all done by 1:00pm. Then took a lunch break . Found the food cost reasonable.After that there were huge lines at most of the rides. Luckily my son follows my footsteps and was in no mood to wait for half hr for each ride. We were out by 3:00pm. Enjoyable day for sure. Park very well done. Tonnes of life guards everywhere and they take very good care of you.

Fun Fun day out. Was a really cool day out nice weather and great water activities available. I really loved the long slide they had the experience of going down that so fast was crazy.The water falls in the pools was great aswell, standing underneath them whilst in the pools felt like a full body massage.Clean changing room space and great views from the top.. We could view the Burj Al Arab from the top of the water slide.Was nice views great photo opportunities, I would recommend for kids great day out for all the family

Wonderful Wild Wadi!. This is a fun place to take your family. It's clean, there are a variety of rides whether you are adventurous or not, and it has some great views. It can be a relaxing way to spend the day!

Water park. Great place to spend the day with the family, especially if you have children. Once you are finished with the water park you can walk across the road to the Madinat shops. The Burj Al Arab hotel is located outside the water park. You will not be able to walk into the Buri without being a guest or have a prior booking.

Really Good But Expensive Once In. Immense Water park it has everything you could think of. even a wake boarding machine as well.There are plenty of lockers for you to put your stuff in take a pair of flip flops with you as you have to move around the park and it is hot on foot at timesthe que at the different rides can get log but it is worth it. my only down side is once you are in the food prices and drink prices are very expensive so b warned on that. you can defo spent the whole day there as lots to do.not just rides but also see sum of the sea creatures etc they have there and feed them
Experiance the water. wild wadi water park is nearest from the metro station so you can easily reached there by local transportation

not for fat people lol. loved the experience of wild widi park but it gets complicated when you are chubby like me as you can get stuck or the gliding is not so easy.... lazy river is definitely for me lol...
Good for kids. A bit overpriced not enough activities, good for kids, very professionally run, worth a day trip out for kids
Really cool place. One of the absolute coolest places i have been to. Great slides, great view, good staff, a must seeA bit prizey - of course
Fun times. This was a very fun day. The place was clean, the staff was great, and the ark was fun. I felt like a kid again.
Very NICE. An excellent water park which gives plenty of options to choose from. There are many attractions to choose from. All the rides give you thrill and chills. Over all a wonderful experience.
fun, fun, fun. if your in the area for sure worth the visit, it has 4 slides and some wave pools, adrenaline will be pumping for sure!!

Great kids day out. I think I'd rate this better that Atlantis when comparing water parks to water parks for toddlers. Wadi has heated was e making facility which caused hours of fun for our four year old!

very crowded on weekends. It was nice but very very crowded on friday. The water did not smell that well and there were not many places to lay down. We wanted to go to lay down at the beach, but that is impossible unless you are a kind of 'club member'

wild wadi drives you crazy. A must for youngsters.A full day of fun.Great view of Burj Khalifa.Safe rides and slides with lots of fun in the water.Safe for young children as lifeguards around.Food available inside.it is a must place while you are in Dubai.

Excellent for family and kids. This is a great waterpark. Everyone raves about the Atlantis waterpark which is newer and a bit bigger. But the Wild Wadi offers the same things. I think it is even better because you have a great view of the Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel.

Good but beware HOLD ON!!!!. Good things: Fantastic views of Burj Al Arab, Friendly staff, Not so busy between 10-12 so got on all rides within minuits, Plenty of Sunbeds, Cashless wrist thing works great and u get a refund if any credit left on at end of visit, First aid first class, Lifeguards plentiful and very professional.Not so good: Wife was thrown off Tantrum Alley ride at first vertical point az the dingy practically flipped over she and had to slide basically from the top to the bottom of the ride a very scary experience, The staff at the bottom appeared horrified she wasnt on the dingy, So my advice is hold on tight and go on in a group of 3 or 4 persons....It needs looked at safety wise in my opinion but hey other than tht was a great day, Oh one more thing guys if your heavier than 120kg they wont allow you on some rides....check the maximum weight on the rides as a solo rider and a couple b4 you grab a rubber ring...it will save you the embarrasment of the ride stopping halfway and having to be rescued lol....believe me it happens on that ride that shoots you uphill, if your too heavy the water stops flowing and you get stuck lol....seriously,,,but have a nice day.Ps....food priced reasonable, never tried the gift shops they always expensive.

Great fun - even without kids!. Fantastic slides, wave pool and comfortable loungers. Spent 3 hours there which was enough. Lots of lifeguards, usual fast food eating options. Body boarding wave pool looked good, but too long queue.

Strangely out of place. The water park is a good place to cool off, but look out for the sun. The rides are spectacular and it was not crowded when we went. It is a strange outpost of western attire in this islamic country.
Great for smaller kids. Great for kids cheaper food than wild wadi acne let us bring in lots if water and snacks for younger kids! Loved it as family trip out - could be cheaper for younger kids
Amazing. Went here with my fiancee on Valentine's Day. Best Valentine's Day ever. If you're thinking about coming here, do it, it's great.

Good fun but pricey. Read a few reviews was better than I expected looks like a canyon with rock formations. Positives - One giant up hill water slide that circumnavigated the whole park and took you to every ride to save you walking. There was a lot of walking up and down stairs etc to get to the slides didn't mind the walking. - The staff are friendly and came up to us to offer assistance in directing us to slides and explaining how the park operated, there are lifeguards on all features, the body boarding was excellent to watch show boaters showed how it should be done and lifeguards helped to get the most out of the boards. - There are plenty of sun loungers and chairs to put towels, t-shirts - There were good amount of rides I thought I tried them all but actually only managed four: tantrum alley went on TA three or four times, jumeirah sceirah, master blasters all were briliant. - Discount voucher we got from the hotel leaflet corner gave us 35aed (approx £6) off entrance fee - Life jackets for all ages - clean and well manned - Food was good we paid £8 each for set meal - included a boxed salad, drink, beef burger, fries and ice-cream filling and god sized portions. There is a lot of food options and there is an option to load up a wrist band so as not to carry money around or pay up front from lunch menu.Negatives - Price 255 aed £40 per person - Paying for locker and getting no refund the locker was 20-35aed (approx £4-6) for a small locker adequate to get 2pairs of trainers a bag and valuables into with space. - 6 toilets in the womens changing rooms for the whole site?! We spent nearly £100 for the pair of us, not including journey there and back, I have never been before and enjoyed my day but having been to water parks in Turkey that might not have the same views but have similar slides the prices are more like £12 per person I can't see why or how Wild wadi justifies the price really and much as I would like to go again I'm not sure I would because of the cost.

very good water amusement park. brilliant !!!!! it was a full day ...i didnt even realised that the time passed soon. we wish to have more hours in a day... defenitly i will visit one more time there beacuse i love that place. good and standard crowd and all the entertainment were awesome
best when it's really hot. visited in September when outside day temp was > 40°.Perfect to spend the day outside, fun slides but also just Floating on the tubes is nice

Great water park. Great rides and being shot up on water jets so no carrying your rubber ring up the steps a bonus, body board rides closed for maintenance so not able to try them a bit disappointing , great views of the Burj. Get your sea shoes from here as a lot more expensive in Atlantis.

Great Fun. Wild Wadi Water park is a fun place to be, it caters for all ages. All the slides are great and the staff are ready to assist. Its full of adrenaline.
Nb. You need to go early and enjoy before the queues become long.

small but sweet. best for riding the drift-along river in a rubber ring and body-boarding - there are two of these body board areas...go to the second one first if you don't know what you're doing (i.e. me!)
loads of taxis if you are worried about how to get to your hotel or next destination afterwards

1st visit to Wild Wadi. we had a great day at Wild Wadi but it is not very large and the choice of slides is limited. That said the slides there, are great and the Sceriah one was a hit with our 6 and 8 year old girls! We had 2 slides break whilst on them but I'm sure this is just bad luck. Summary - expensive but worth a trip.

fun in the sun! great place!. A 40 something screeching down the slides, not a good look heaving in and out of rubber rings all day after such a delicious breakfast! But its gotta be done, get dropped off in buggy, grab your towels and get in those rings! Fun had by all!

Good fun!. Not a huge water park but enough to do to spend the whole day there. A couple of the rides were being maintained so were out of action, which was a bit disappointing, but the rides that were open had no queues, so we definitely made the most of our time there. Try and get there as soon as the park opens, it's a bit hard to find a sun lounger but as we spent all of our time in the water, we only really needed one to leave towels, shoes, sun creams etc. Entry price is quite steep, 245AED per person. However, if you are staying in Dubai for a few days, I would definitely recommend you buy a book called The Entertainer Dubai, 395AED, it is full of two for one vouchers (including Wild Wadi, the Atlantis Water Park, desert safaris, numerous restaurants and other attractions), so it paid for itself just by using two vouchers for our entrance to Wild Wadi. You can buy the book in most newsagents and book shops. Would go again as the children loved it!

Not very big but fun!. So if I had to pay the entrance fee, I might have been a little disappointed as there are not tons of rides here. But since it was included in our hotel room rate, I can't complain. My kids loved it of course and I had fun too, but again, not a great variety of slides. Wave pool was fun, kids area was a good size plus there were areas for surfing which was fun to watch. Not sure how it compares to other water parks in Dubai. With that said the grounds were very clean as was the water. Workers were very friendly and lots of lifeguards on the lookout. Decent amount of food choices (rather pricey though of course). If you're used to vast water parks you might be a bit bored, but do your research ahead of time to see if this place is right for you!

Not worth the money. Go to atlantis aquaventure better. There are few rides only (11) with 2 out of service and under construction. I couldn't imagine that they charge 245 AED for that other than the locker which is for 35 AED. Better you can go to atlantis aquaventure with more rides and better fun.
Good fun. A good all round destination for a day out. Sun loungers are hard to find but we found we spent much of our time in the water anyway!

Ok. Im not a huge fan of waterparks,but my OH wanted to go.We got there early,we were the second ones in.Not too busy to start with,we went on the rides twice with no waiting.(i didnt do the sceirah,too high for me).Enjoyed them all,but i soon got bored,did relax on a lounger for a couple of hours,the weather was perfect.Used the bogof entertainer voucher.Definitely worth a visit.

A nice day out but not outstanding. We travelled to Dubai in December 2013 for one reason - my son wanted to see three things in Dubai; the Burj al Arab, the Burj Khalifa and the Wild Wadi Water Park.We had a nice day out at the water park. However the attractions were nothing exceptional. If you have been to other water park attractions around the world (as I write this I am thinking of the major water theme parks on the Gold Coast Queensland Australia), I would suggest you not put those into comparison with Wild Wadi, otherwise you're bound for disappointment. Also make sure you go prepared for the weather/sunburn as there is very little cover from the sun anywhere in this water park. A nice day out, but nowhere near what I expected from Dubai that likes to pride itself on being the biggest and best at everything engineered and man made.

Excellent for the Kids. Both my kids absolutely loved this. The kids area and the beach were excellent. Eventually i managed to convince to try the rings and then Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley adn they enjoyed every second of the thrills and rides

Ok...... Took our children (10 & 11). They were very wary of the bigger rides. Both had sore backs the following day. They did love the 'crayon city' and the wave pool and woild have gladly stayed there all day.Get there early or you won't find any seating. Food and drink was surprisingly reasonable in cost. Wouldn't have been happy to have paid for admission (had a free pass via our hotel).Worth a visit if it's free entry for you. Plenty for kids to do if they don't fancy the rapid rides.
Nice park but .... the Atlantis one is better ! And lot's of attractions where in maintenance even the toilets and they just reopened. They should have used the closing days to do the maintenance !!

Great park but expensive if not staying in jumeirah hotel. Great water park. Free to jumeirah guests otherwise about 40 pounds to get in. Great slides. Amazingly clean. Safety high priority. Many lifeguards. Good family atmosphere. Only criticism is that sun loungers get very busy and hard to find any that are not occupied.Great family day. Fun for all ages and will definitely go back.

Stunning setting , great family environment for fun times. Love this water park went twice last week when in Dubai. Something for all ages , clean setting, helpful staff. Great family day out. A must in Dubai if you enjoy water parks .
fabulous. A must. Stunnung location. Great fun. Good facilities. Good food. Clean and safe. Great value for money.

Old, tired and a bit boring. Not many slides/rides and the lazy river is nice but no way near as good as Aquaventure. The way it is set out is nice, and feels like a western but we got a little bored.We managed to get cheap tickets on groupon but i would not pay full price. nice vews of the Burj and Jumeirah but this feels dated and needs some investment!!

Fun in the sun. A good combination of rides from gentle to the extreme. The jumeirah scarer even too frightening for the most adventurous in our group. For those non riders you could relax next to the wave pool. 245D per person makes it quite pricey but worth a day out
Reall Fun. we went to wild wadi as part of our stay at Dar al Masyf hotel this is the best water park i have ever been to and would recommend this to anyone
Day to remember. One place I suggest to all not to miss when your in Dubai it's outstanding place to spend value time with loved ones and family all ages can have fun

not bad not good. this is a water based theme park of jumeria hotel. nothing new in this water theme park. as every theme park has almost same rides. lockers r very expensive. according to me its time waste and money

even not close to an excellent service. was there on 17th Feb, water is really 28 only in main swimming pool with waives, almost all attractions had really cold water and after lunch it's really windy there and thus it's COLD to stand in a queue, not all attraction were working, one of main attractions have a great queue, not working part (we have to take our circle to the next area).It's really messy in dressing rooms, no hairdryers that is especially uncomfortably for women. There are not many changing rooms and I wonder what happens in a high season. The same for attractions - labels in queue: 30 mins till you get fun looks unbelievable. After there was a very large queue for taxi and no taxi came within a 5 min time thus we had to walk to metro station.Also, it's really EXPENSIVE for the service provided - almost 70$ and you have to pay for a locker. Are you kidding?

All day fun. We visited here with friends and family ranging in ages from 8 to 67. This place caters for everyone, They have a section for younger children and plenty of shaded areas for the older family members.We based ourselves within east reach of shade, sun and the childrens play areas, and also pretty close to the lazy river entrance, which is great for seeing the place and just as it says - having a lazy trip! One member of our party was brave enough to go on 'Jumeirah Sceirah' whilst one had to come back down the stairs before reaching the top after changing their minds!!A great day out and highly recommended.

One of the best water parks. If you are going with your children, then please do not miss it. They will love it and it should be a must in your program in Dubai. And it just next to Burj Al Arab hotel, one of the best in the world, you can easily take pictures for the hotel from outside.
Amazing. We had a great time at the park. The rides were amazing. The staffs are very friendly and caring. The place is very systematic and worth the price.

Great fun. We had access to this park as part of the hotel package and I'm glad we didn't have to pay the entrance fee but we could come and go as we wished which was fantastic. The rides were great and the children adored them - they even persuaded their "old" parents on rides that went faster than the Lazy River!!! On the negative side, it comes across as a public resort eg the smell of fast food, and chlorine can be over powering. However we had the luxury of dropping in, charging down some rides and then returning to our sun beds and thoroughly enjoyed the resort. The negative reviews seem to focus on the entrance fee which wasn't an issue for us. Also the park is incredibly well staffed to ensure safety at all times - presumably part of the reason for the high entrance fee.

Great place for young and old. We took advantage of the complimentary access as we were staying in a nearby hotel and I have to say we (wife, 2 boys (6 & 4)) loved the place. It was perfect for us as we could come and go as we pleased, and we where in twice a day, avoiding the hot hot sun of July.There's a limited amount of rides, but there was enough to keep us all entertained whilst we were in the park. Enough so that the boys are raring for another trip back to Dubai to go here.
Fun. I visited Wild Wadi with a group of friends. We had loads of fun, and I got to ride all the rides. We had a great time. You would need at least 3 or 4 hours to get to enjoy it.

Liked it - a fine day spend. It is a big area and you can easy spend some time on the water rids. Food could be better - I would not stay for dinner but nobody expects you to. A lot of people but still ok space
