one of the best water park in Dubai.. one of the best water park in Dubai for all family member.
many activities , restaurant & fun !!!
there is privet lady's nights for covered women.

I've been twice, and I'd go again!. Quality water rides, whether you want high speed scares or a float down a lazy river. Wild Wadi really has it all. A beautiful view of the Burj Al Arab finishes off a great day out. Quite busy though, however the queues are very well handled. Thoroughly recommended to anyone in the UAE.

So Funny! Pure adrenalin!. It's absolutely recommended! You can spend a whole day and once you are there you don't want to get out! It's really funny, and there are games and funny stuff for every age! If you are with your friends, your family, your children, I recommended it anyway! One of the best days of my life!
Amazing place!. Love this place, amazing rides, open for long hours and lovely staff! Me and my sister really enjoyed, a must go place!

A Bit Tired. Whilst still a great water park in the GCC - with Atlantis and Waterworld now offering alternatives it is time that Wild Wadi spent some time on updating and refreshing their facilities to stay in touch with the rest. Always a great day out - but is getting harder and harder to be the #1 choice.
What fun!. Great fun. Brilliant slides, Excellent day out. Food very reasonably priced. Staff great. Book in advance, cheaper.

Fun filled day. We went to wild wadi during our holiday trip in dubai. This was indeed a fun filled day for us. Tried surfing, all the rides including the list dangerous one the capsule ride. It's located at the very nice location on jumeirah beach and burj Al Arab can also been seen from here.

Fun Times. this park is pretty big... its very westernised so you kind of forget you are in UAE but its great if you like water rides or you want to take the kids out for some fun... there are some very very tall slides and also some relxing lazy rivers so something for everyone
Great Fun. A great mix of rides for all ages. This is a must do while in Dubai!! Great views over the Burj al Arab and photos during the day taken by the staff.

Fun, But Over Hyped. This is a fun water park with a number of different rides and experiences to enjoy. We had a great time here, but I do feel like there is a lot of hype surrounding this place and it is not as great as it is made out to be.
Awesome experience. Very awesome water experience. Wish I didn't have to leave. Water water everywhere. The slides, the beach, the fish massage, ice cream. All unbelievable. Will definitely be back

Ideal fun for the family in Dubai. We went to Wild Wadi as a family and it was my second trip to this park. it really is seriously a good fun day out. Don't go for only a few hours as there's the water slides/rides, a beach and lounge chairs etc to ensure you get plenty of value. I read some reviews complaining about the cost: it cost us about 1,400AED for 4 which included locker rental, towels, lunch, ice creams, drinks and park entry. It doesn't matter where you go to a fun park across the world - that's not too bad. Yes you can save 35AED per towel if you take your own, but as a traveler - who wants to pack a beach towel each?I've been there in Summer and now in Winter. I think summer was better but it was still great in winter (although cold later in the day).Just go be a kid again for a day! you will laugh and have fun.
brilliant day out. you will spend all day here its great fun. lockers available to store stuff, plenty to eat and drink

Loved it, felt like a child again!. Given it's not very big, this waterpark was amazing. Thrills, smiles and a good burger is how I would describe this! All the staff were so helpful and smiley also. Definitely recommend to all especially those who like a thrill!
Woohoo!. Fun. Loved every minute. So many rides, so much fun. Not to be missed in Dubai, especially on a hot day.

Fun times. We had a lot of fun at Wild WadiIt is a great place to take your kids. We all came to dubai just the girls and left the kids at home, we still had a blast there. We got free entry with our hotel we were staying at so thought we would try it out. We only stayed for around 2 hours as there isn't loads there to do, id say around 8-9 rides. Ways really fun though, would definitely go back
Exciting!!. Wonderful pleace for all the family. Never seen a waterglide where you move upwards. Almost faster upwards than downwards. Nice vieuws on Burj Al Arab.
Fun!. We stayed at the hotel which is part of the water park, so went here a couple of times, heaps of fun, no lines.

Wild Wadi is a must-visit on your Dubai itinerary.. With interconnected rides following a theme about an Arabian adventurer named Juha and his friend Sinbad the sailor, who get shipwrecked together,Wild Wadi, an attractive, compact Water Park is one of the major tourist attractions in Dubai. The location is brilliant, with views of the giant sail-shaped Burj Al Arab hotel and the Arabian Gulf when you ride your tube on the unending water slide. High-pressure pumps, which shoot you back up from ground level to the top of the slides let you do the same . The 33m-high Jumeirah Sceirah slide that drops you at a scary speed of 80km/h is said to be the fastest and steepest slide outside North America and the new slide tower featuring 'Tantrum Alley' and 'Burj Surj' is great fun, You will find gentle rides for young ones, a big-wave pool, a white-water rapids river. You can alsotry out your body boarding skills on Wipeout, a permanent wave machine. Though not cheap,Wild Wadi with its very friendly staff and beautiful setting it's a must-visit on your Dubai itinerairy.

Fun filled visit with kids. Wild wadi is one of the most entertainming water parks I have visited offering vide variety of rides for both kods and adults. I took one of my relative family along with us and we had a great time there.

Great place. I came here back in 2009, and it was great. The slides were really fun, the lazy river was a thrill, and the kids were sorted in their fun area. It was a huge park, the pools are very clean and refreshing, and for those staying in the Burj al Arab, it is completely free, to my knowledge. Although atlantis has their waterpark, this is great as it is located more conviniently. I also got lots from the shop, go!

Great day out. So much fun! If you are into laughing, screaming and the odd adrenaline rush there will be something for you to enjoy here. My girls (9, 12) had a ball and rated it as good as Waterbom park in Bali. The staff were great with the kids and added to the fun by looking at my 9 year old before she went on the "Jumeirah Screamer" as if to say "you may never see her again!"
Best water park I've been to!. Brilliant place. Been there many many times but always feel like being there more. The rides are innovative, also has some good views of the beach from a few places.

Wild fun!. bring a little first aid kit! Kids can really scrape their knees on the kiddie pool floors! Other than that, an amazing day! The water slides are so creative! The surf lesson was insane!! Cant wait to go back! Dont forget your hat and sunsceen!
must go. this one is a great stay for the end of the afternoon. the pools and services are clean and well done.

Great day out. Its worth going early as you need a whole day to get through the rides as you have to queue for most. Also be aware that its hard to get a taxi from 3pm onward after as Tax drivers tend to change shift, this can be a problem upto 6pm

cabannas make it a much better day.. We went here for the day, and got there early so we could secure a cabanna. This is definatley worth doing as I do not really do the water slides, and have been to water parks in the US and end up trying to find a chair. With the cabanna you get towels, fridge full of drinks, comfy beds and much needed shade. Also if you want anything from the food places they get it for you so you dont have to queue, plus you get 'fast pass' to the busy rides, which my teenage kids thought was great as they got to walk past everyone 'like they were famous or something'! plus I got a quiet place to chill out and read and the lazy river flow past in front of you, so I could take a dip in there to cool off.The rides I was informed my family were brilliant. They went on just about all of them more than once and voted it a much better park than the Atlantis one.Only complaint is the toilets are busy and not too good (should have own block for the cabannas!).Also we left when park was closing (around 5pm) as gets dark and there is a REALLY long queue for taxis and we waited for over an hour, plus then traffic bad so took nearly 2 hours to get back to hotel.Good day out for all the family , get there early for full day and if you can get a cabanna.

Son loved it very much... Went Wild Wadi with family of 11. Luckily my brother bought Dubai Travel voucher 2013.we got buy 1 free 1 voucher so we saved big time as we travel in a big group. I don't really into water park exspecially with the pricey entrance like this somehow I wanna see what make it so expensive.1. The staff are great...very attentive,happy, friendly and helpful.2. There are medic everywhere.Very profesional. Saw one kid almost drown and the life guard get to him and at the same time medic arrive.They check on him and joted down his particular.3. The place are so clean and there are a lot of place to sit.4.Good view ..just next to the sea,Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah hotel. Loved it.5. Most of the rides are enjoyable but the best for me is the Scariest Jumeirah Sceira.Also love the surfer ride don't know what it call but I try it 3 times.Overall we have fun the down is the expensive food and entrance fee for children are only for children height less than 1.1m

must see! but I want more than that... fun fun fun!!!its really nice there but first I thought there will be more than that. actually if you do everything what they offer you are done within 2 hours.. its actually nice and for sure the one water slip is amazing! its nice if you are traveling with kids! for a funny afternoon!its easy reachable from the metro station. mall of the emirates. we walked down the road, approx. 15 minutes but you can also take a cab approx. 15 dirham.. as you like!the park entry is quiet expensive, 275 dirham.. and inside is nothing included in this price..but definitely a must see of Dubai ;)
Good day out. Enjoyed the rides especially the jumeriah sceira! Go early avoid queues. Lots of sunbathing areas too

Fun and enjoy. This place is a collection of all fun filled activities. We had a visit there with my family. The place was at a distance of nearly 20 minutes from the hotel where we stayed. Initially I was a little worried about the expenses I am going to bear in the park but later got relaxed because it was overall not that much expensive. We had so much fun and our kids enjoyed all the rides pools and puzzle activities there. I personally had a very good experience with the food verities available there and really enjoyed myself. When we came home and made calculation for the expenses incurred I was amazed to see that almost half of the expense was pertaining to the food items we had there. My family them started making fun of me because initially I was worried about the expenses and then later it turned out that it was me who spent the most.
Best in world. A great day out , thoroughly enjoyed by adults and children alike . Possibly the only place where water flows up hill . Don't miss if you visit Dubai

Wild Wadi. We visited Wild Wadi as part of our hotel excursion.Did think it was over priced considering it was not overly big.Towels and lockers were well overpriced, make sure you take your own towels.Bags are searched at entry, so you cannot take food and drink into the park, which means you have to eat at their restaurants, the food was good.Like the idea of the wristbands, so your not carrying cash on you.We enjoy the rides, our daughter and the husband enjoyed the wave pool....Lazy river could do with a bit more waves to go round a bit more quicker!!Will return in April again, management should visit Atlantis and check their rides out as could be as good.
Dated compared to Atlantis. You soon get bored of the slides! This water park now needs to be updated to make sure it is the best!

sooooo. much fun!!!!. imagine a water slide going up rather than down. although we were there in December-Dubais winter it was still warm for us. I laughed for the 4 hours we were there. Again the queues were lengthy but worth the wait. You can hire towels & lockers for a small fee. approx $7 Australian for a towel & a bit more for the locker. The food is fresh although most of it deep fried. You can't take any food or water of your own into the park. Everything available but at prices that you expect from a theme park. A good idea is the bracelet they give you which is your locker key, entry pass, & can be your bank roll as well so you don't have to take your wallet around with you. You can also hire a private kabana which looked cool. The down side was waiting for a taxi back to our accomadation. we learnt that often it's easier to get a taxi out in the street rather than wait in the organised queues.

Wild waste of money!. We spent a day here. There are only approximately 10 attractions in this park and mostly for very small children. The price is far too high and it is not worth it. There are far better water parks in Central Europe for instance. Waste of money.

Wild Wadi Park. My two kids (Boys 18 and 14) wanted to go to wild Wadi. However, my younger daughter of age 7 did not. We made a plan to send our two kids to enjoy Wild Wadi and My wife, daughter and myself went to a mall nearby, where we spend three good hours.It turn out that everybody was happy. My kids loved visit to wild wadi, whereas remaining of us enjoyed visit to nearby mall (walking distance from Wild wadi) and enjoyed a boat ride.
Had a great time. I went with my girls aged 6 and 8 and they had a wonderful time. The only snag was the difficulty of getting a taxi out of there .

Must do. While you are in Dubai and already feeling suck from hanging around Dubai malls this place would refresh your mind it's a lot of fun for kids & Adults too but i wish it was a bit bigger with more games, however, some times it can be crowed and you will have to wait around 20m up to 30m for your turn. Definitely recommend.Always check online for deals & discounts to Wild Wadi you might save decent money for the tickets.
very expensive. great attractionexcellent ridesbe warned children over 1,1 m charged as adultsfood and water removed from you on entry, and you must buy everything inside at exorbitant prices

Highly overrated. They would charge you around 250 Dhs pax just for a single stupid water ride........don't go there....if you want fun in water better go to Jumeirah beach, even your hotel pool will be a hundred times better

Excellent Water Park in Dubai. During I stay in Burj Al Arab I visit Wild Wadi water park with wife and child. Its unlimited Free for in house guest. I visit many time early this but after adding 3 new rides my first visit and I can say there is no better than this water park.

Good, but expensive inside. It's a water park,- plenty of water, plenty of slides, plenty of fun. Slides for kids/adults of all ages and bravery.One issue though was that everything inside is very expensive, including food and drinks. They have you captive and they milk you for money.We got complimentary entrance tickets through staying at a Jumeriah hotel who are the same company I believe.Good place to take kids and let them spend the day.

Good day out. Wild wadi is one of the older water parks but is still good value and rides have been updated food was decent and even though we went at a peak time it wasn't to busy. Queues were no longer than 15 minutes even for the most popular rides.

Nice Water Park. My wife and I visited wild wadi during our Dubai trip and had fun with the rides there. There were 3 main rides we liked ... can't quite remember the names. Good for a visit but Atlantis is larger and has the beach front. Also visit Atlantis.

Fun for all. outstanding day out with the family. 4 teenagers managed to keep well occupied all day. The wave zone instuctors were brilliant with the learners and kids had an oppotunity to try something new. We arrived at 9.30am perfect time to book a chair etc. Spotless and well maintained with attentive staff throughout the resort.
not much. two times i went there in1999 and 2013, in 2013 it was bad , not so much to play there, but it's fun though, a very busy place , you can take your children there,

Good Experience. Well first of its kind in Middle east but now been overtaken by its siblings like Aquaventure and Yas Water World. It still has good charm of enjoyment. Its free when you stay in any of the Jumeirah Group of Hotels in Dubai.
Amazing place for the family..... The kids love this place, I enjoyed the pedicure. The warm pool was just right on the cool (yes in dubai was cool). Love to come back here but it's pricey.
Thrilling. Brilliant, with a lot of choice. Thrills and spills on fast or slow rides. Wonderful for all ages - safe bathing and the usual ever attentive lifeguards.

GREAT waterpark with some top notch rides.. Not for the faint of heart of course, but an excellent way to spend a few hours! We had passes through the Jumeirah Creekside hotel which was a nice perk for sure!

Okay... good outing for kids. Cons- expensive entry, poor service, crammed and little place to sit. Bathrooms badly in need of an upgrade. Pro- the ride we did as a family was great... it was like riding rapids upwards! I lived that it led from one ride to another. It is one if the coolest watermark rides I've ever been on. There were plenty of food outlets with a decent variety of food for sale. Their prices were reasonable too. I guess we are spoilt in South Africa as we have amazing concept water parks (ironically developed by the same hotelier that developed Atlantis) and with this being Dubai I was expecting something over the top. We paid for Over the top and got okay. Fortunately, we are all 'water babies' and still had fun though.

Amazing. We loved it! We all went on the rides together as a family, the camera was waterproof and we had a wristband that was used to pay for food, drinks, etc..The other items we had were not valuable (suntan lotion, sunglasses, towels), so we felt safe leaving them on the sun loungers! Family friendly, very safe, and the staff/lifeguards were very helpful :)

overpriced experience. Park is having some nice slides and it is overall clean place. However, compared to similar park in Canary islands, this is fitted to much smaller area and the prices are much higher. Also for some western people it may feel a bit too excotic place as most of the visitor are from Asia and e.g. bathing their clothes on in the pool area.
Good for a half day activity. Make sure you go with a group of four or more people. More fun! Food is a bit expensive inside so it's better if you finish all the fun the go eat outside.
Great alternative to Atlantis. Smaller than Atlantis but with some spine-tingling rides!! A good day out. If staying at a Jumeirah hotel then entrance is free which is great for the kids.

Amazing. I loved Wild Wadi! I have been before but you don't get tired of going to this water park! The rides are just amazing especially when you have views of Jumierah, Burj al Arab .. Just simply amazing! I would definitely recommend this not just for teens/kids but the whole family!

One of the Best Water Park. One of the best water park i have ever been. At entrance you pay and they will give you a a Waterproof Hand Band which also opens your Locker at changing room. The place gives superb views of Landscape and Building around while on ride. The artificial beach and rides are awesome here. A Must visit place with friends or Family when you are in Dubai.

This is NOT just for kids!. We had an absolutely exhilarating AND relaxing time here recently. The staff were all smiling and helpful, the food outlets ok and the rides we went on (the scariest!!) were stunning, exhilarating and FUN!The rest of the time we were able to relax and soak up the sun, reading, people-gazing or taking great pictures from the top of the rides of the surrounding and amazing architecture.We are old enough to be grand parents so DON'T be fooled into thinking this is just a kids park..it most certainly is not..it provides fun, sun, excitement and relaxation for all!
Fun!!!!!!. Very exciting and safe water park to enjoy and relax . Superb service, great food selection and the best water rides ever!

Good theme park. First of all, even though it has been around for so many years, but the place has still got it. Rides are nice and safety wise very good. Not heard of any incident at this place, food was expensive but portion size was also nice. Shawarma is a must try at the first food outlet. Lazy river was nice too, some rides had good amount of waiting time on weekend. Will recommend for families... Things to remember,Bring your sun block, small towels, waterproof bag, with a few spare plastic bags to store wet cloths.
Good for 4 year olds and older. Like: its fun.Dislike: really no water based playground facility suitable for under 4 year olds. No sunbeds available.

Excellent. Even though the park is fairly small, we had an excellent time. Friendly staff, lots to eat at very reasonable prices. The warm wave pool was our favourite. I would definitely recommend it for a family.

Memorable Experience. We had a lots of fun there, it was really amazing and helps you to release your energy in a good way, amusing , fun , relax and totally to be there feels good, and this is very important to feel good. that park located in a jumeirah, beside two famous jumeirah hotels as Jumeirah Beach and Burj Arab. this park is much more famous than the other water parks in dubai, I am planning to go to other water parks of Dubai such as Aqua-venture Park in Atlantis , Dream Land Water Park and also the newest one is in another city of UAE , in Abu Dhabi and the name is Yas Water Park.Hope to enjoy there

Kids loved it!. Really nice waterpark next to jumeirah beach hotel- some really cool rides, for both young and older... I think Atlantis perhaps has a few more slides with wild wadi probably having a few more tube rides and things are closer to one another.... We went. In winter and happy to note a heated Main wave pool... A big plus!! Food was expensive but expected but all in all a nice experience. Will be back for sure
Brilliant fun. We spent the whole day there and never got bored. It was a lot of fun and the next day the teenagers went back for more!

Good Experience. Locationally, in new Dubai, near a bunch of major attractions. Above average slides, mainly targeting the younger crowd. If you are into the thrill of the fastest or tallest rides, this is not the place for you.

EXTREME WILD WADI. i truly enjoyed the fun and adventure i got to experience with my siter,mom and friends here even if we had to catch our flight the same day after being exhausted hehe! thanks to my friend who got us in with a very good discount
Wild Wadi. Mixture of rides for all ages. Deeply enjoyed my last visit, because I had some friends with me. One of my highest recommendations for first-time visitors.

Lots of Men Wearing Suit Trousers on Waterslides..... Weird crowd at Wild Wadi...There were men in what looked like baggy white nappies, suit trousers and shirts. They were loving it but i was slightly offended by the see through nappies in the queue infront of me.Its alright but Atlantis is better.... 6/10

Crazy!. This is somewhere you have to take the family!
Much better then Alton Towers or Thorpe Park, all water activities, you will enjoy it immensley

Great rides at this water park. Wild Wadi doesn't have a huge selection of rides but the ones it does have are a lot of fun, there are a couple of hair raising ones (lots of fun!) and a couple of more chilled ones which are great to relax on.There are a number of pool areas including a wave pool. Get there early as it gets busy as the day progresses.It is right next to the Burj Al Arab (the sail building) which provides a great back drop to your day in the water.

Fun fun fun!. Definitely worth a visit and much more fun than the water park at Atlantis.Very exciting and safe water park to enjoy and relax .Superb service, great food selection and the best water rides ever!

Brought out the child in me :). This was the best day ever spent... it certainly brought out the child in me; i even surprised myself by going on the same rides twice! I like the idea of the wrist band which opens the locker and has credit in it (as much as you want to put in) so you dont have to carry money around. The whole park was really clean and the attendants and life guards were very helpful.

I've been to better waterparks. I came here with a free pass from one of the Jumeirah hotels. I'm a big fan of waterparks and have been to a fair few - I thought this one would have been better as everything in Dubai is supposed to be fabulous! Found it quite hard to navigate to the start of the rides (although my hangover could have played a part in that) and thought the queues were pretty long. Stopped for a sandwich at lunchtime in one of the food outlets - it was edible but not great!
A happy day in wild wadi. Very exciting and safe water park to enjoy and relax for all member of family. You should spend at least half a day.

Great fun!. Probably THE best water park I have even been to. Definitely worth a visit and much more fun than the water park at Atlantis.Put some credit on to a wrist band which means you can leave your valuables in your locker and use the wrist band to pay for drinks/snacks/shopping throughout the day. Really useful.At around £40-ish to get in it is a little on the expensive side, but if you purchase 'Dubai Entertainer' you will get 'buy one, get one free' tickets for this and a lot of other Dubai attractions, meaning you can save a shed load!
Family trip to Wild Wadi. Lots of good water rides; can be hot on your feet in the summer! Water is free! Not as good as Atlantis.

Nice and clean. The Sceriah is a must if you like thrills. I did this about 4 times and each time the drop would thrill me as much if not more.The other must do is the Tantrum Alley. The float in t he lazy river.

Great Day. We visited as we had complementary vouchers from staying in the Jumeirah Creekside hotel. We've been before but there are a lot of changes. Loads more slides and seating areas now. Hardly stood in a line for a ride all day.

Best day out in Dubai. If you are in Dubai on business or on holiday, do not miss a day at the Wild Wadi. Superb service, great food selection and the best water rides ever! We went on a Saturday and we didn't have to queue at all. Great for adults and kids.

great day trip. Some of the best waterslides in the world. Fun surf park and unique rides. Love the river canals to get you through the park with no walking. Wristbands to preload with money so you don't have to go back to your locker is a plus. No worries for women to wear non-muslim swim attire. It was a relaxed setting.

Great fun!. After reading some of the comments I was a bit anxious about how the people behaved and the dress code. There was no problem, most people being decently dressed, everyone behaved very well. the staff was very nice and helpful. We really enjoyed ourselves and had great fun!

Absolutely Unmissable. Truly brillaint and amazing place.We are in dubai for 3 weeks with 2 young children, my son 3 years old and my daughter 10 months old, we have been looking forward to wild wadi from the moment we had been saving up for our dubai holiday over a year ago. It truly lived upto all the expectations and great reviews.Absolute amazing staff and level of customer service especially for those with young families and children.It was my wifes first time ever in a swimming enviroment and water park, the life jackets for all sizes from babies to large adults are great. As soon as you pay on entrance you are given a digital style watch/strap that you wear on your wristband, this can be loaded with money so you dont have to carry cash around and it used for payment for all types of things around the park, remaining balance is refunded at the end of the day.large lockers are 45 dhirams, small lockers are 35 dhirams, although we didnt actually use them as it was very safe and easy to leave your stuff on your loungers.Best thing to do is get there early as in winter months now it closes at 6pm, so to get the best loungers arrive early, we got there around 11 as my driving was a bit slow....lol but we still got good place to settle down.No food or drink allowed at all, yes you will be checked at security so please dont embarras yourself or the park staff, if you do have stuff they will keep it in special security areas, baby stuff was no problem.Towels can be hired but recommended to bring your own. You can easily spend whole day here as we did with the kids, there is something for everyone, the rides are amazing, lazy river nice and relaxed,jumeirah sceirah must be tried and absolute thrill.Some amazing views of the burj al arab, and if your a photo lover than there is hundreds of great places to take photos here.There are so many food places and drinks and juice bars all around the water park, just be prepared for that it is a bit expensive as is expected with any theme park attraction park like this so take this into account when budgeting your day, food is approx 45 dhirams to 60 dhirams per person around £10 max for a very good sized deal or combo meal and everything else a lot less, ice creams around 10 dhirams so about £1.80 which is a good price on average.We had such an amazing time here with some very unique memories that will last a lifetime and I just wish we could go back again, as im staying here for 3 weeks on self catering basis in an apartment and with the cost of a rental car and food shopping etc unfortunately our budget would not allow us to go again. The people who stay in any of the Jumeirah group hotels must be so lucky, as they get access to the park for free by staying in those hotels, unfortunately even those hotels are very much out our price range. It is our 4th wedding anniversary on december 13th and i had considered booking a jumeirah hotel for the night for my wife so we could get access to the park again but the prices are crazy, so if you are one of the lucky ones to be staying there please please do go and definitely enjoy this place.Thank you to all the staff, and thank you Wild Wadi, our best part of the holiday.

Great water park. Wild wadi has a great selection of rides. There are also many areas that you can relax on sun lounges. Don't forget your towel because you will have to pay either 35AED to hire or between 55-100 AED to buy. Great scenery of the Burj from here and a short taxi ride to Emirates Mall.

A great day out but get there early.. Thought it would be a good way to cool down on a hot day and we weren't wrong. Really good flumes particularly Jumeirah Sceirah which frightens the life out of me, the burn surj and tantrum alley, both great group rides guarenteed to test your stomach and the master blaster, a great all round ride. Good wave pool and some novel concessions selling whole coconuts or pineapples. Definitely get a wristband for your money as well. We went for opening and left by 2 pm as it was getting really busy after 1pm.

Great for cooling off and for high thrills!. What a great facility to have amongst such stunning hotels!Grab the free bus from the front of the hotel, or walk along the path by the beach.You can easily spend several hours here.Free to hotel guests.

Great Fun. jumeirah-sceirah was amazing and scary but a must do. However, do it at the very end so that you are able to enjoy the other rides. Once its done, all other rides lose their appeal. Take your own sunblock and swimwear as they will rip you off on that. Islamic women swimwear (Burqini) is available at the store for AED 400. Any muslim woman who wears hijab / abaya should get thier own burqini as they will not be allowed to take any ride without it and it will probably cost much less from outside. Check the dress code policy before going. Bikinis are allowed.

Excellent and very fun. Visited here with a friend, this is great fun, a real kids day out even though we are in our 20's! So many different rides and swimming, the pools have wave machines which are incredibly fun, and the giant whirlpool ride was a memorable one in particular. The most famous and for a good reason the Jumerah Scarah... I had no idea how high it actually was until I was flying down it leaving my stomach at the top. Brilliant, a must do in Dubai!

not for the faint-hearted!. If your'e all for fun and adventure, then you shouldn't miss Wild Wadi Water Park when you're in Dubai. I went there months ago with my friends and I must say, that it totally beat all the aqua parks that I've been to. The Burj Surj, Tantrum Alley and Jumeirah Sceirah are just a few spots that you shouldn't miss. I wish there were more slides though, but over all, the place is great not just for kids but also the kids-at-heart.

Great way to spend a few hours. Superb choice of rides from the lazy river to the masterblaster (uphill slides) to the Sceirah (steep freefall slide) there's something for everyone here. If you don't have complimentary access am not sure the £40 entrance fee is worth it but if it is part of your hotel cost then go for it. The rides will make you laugh and it's all a lot of fun.

Surprise is Winter. Year round, this is a fun and lively experience. Being a granny, it was very easy to get around and enjoy the fun features and water adventures.All ages and swimming skills will feel welcome and enjoy.

Showing it's age. Visited both Aquaventure & Wild Wadi whilst in Dubai and it has to be said, Wild Wadi was a huge disappointment (wish we had done Aquaventure again). The two master-blaster slides [both very long it has to be said] are great fun - did them a lot of times. The lazy river that they all drop you into is very lazy, i.e. slow - just about everyone was jumping out of the donut rings and walking through the water. Do like the RFID wristbands that Wild Wadi use for admission / lockers / in park purchases. (If Aquaventure had this, it would be perfect). Just a word of warning - if you are male & go on the surfing rides, make sure your swim shorts are done up tight. Female guests are made to wear a cover-up top to avoid the risk of the surf wave whipping off their bikini / swimsuit top, rendering them topless, which would obviously offend in the UAE. We say a guy who was relieved of his swim shorts as his body was a bit too low below the surf board (yes, everyone watching did laugh).

Wonderful experience. I went there almost 3 weeks ago. it was great like the last time i visited almost 10years ago! Last time i was around 10 or 11 years old and i was with my family i had such a lovely memory of it so this time that i went to Dubai with my husband i decided to visit again. It was wonderful me and my husband tried everything there and we had a wonderful and memorable time. i will definitely visit every time i go to Dubai. You will enjoy it with everyone, friends , family or as a couple. i reallyyyyy recommend it.

Good fun on a hot day. We received complimentary Wild Wadi water park tickets with our accommodation, okay water park, nothing special. Good on a hot day. There's a lot more locals here so less touristy. Worth a visit for half a day or a full day depending on if your travelling with children.

Great Place to relax and enjoy. Wild wadi water park is such a nice place , its neat and clean. Overall environment is very good. Water rides are very enjoyable, especially I recommend to enjoy tides.You need to wear shorts, you can buy from here but its little expensive its better to bring it with you

Fun..but to expensive!!. I live in Dubai so my opinion maybe a little different. There are other water parks to choose from besides this one. It is very conveniently located but this makes it very busy! The price is a little to high for me. There wasn't any where to sit. But it does have some good slides. If you are single or a couple you will have fun, just make sure to get there early. For families, I would say make the journey to RAK Iceland.
Wild Wadi. Amazing, Scary and exciting rides. Excellent maintenances and quality.Recommended rides: Jumeirah Sceirah, Master Blaster and Tantram alley Overall Best Water Park ever!

Great Water Park. A great day to be had here at the Wild Wadi Water park.Watersides that go uphill! Saves having to climb up too many stairs.Some great rides on the tubes that take four people at a time.Crazy fun on Tantrum Alley. Not recommended for small kids or the timid. Only criticism is that after each slide down you end up in the slow paced lazy river style trench pool that most water parks have. Takes atleast 5 mins to get to a point where you can get out and go back to another ride.
Great experience. We did this the fist day and it was lovely. Great choice of water slides and pools to go in. The staff are so friendly to

This place is awesome. it was great experience especially "Jumeirah Sceirah"
it's the tallest and fastest slid of the park and the most scariest too
but i like it
life guards are every where so don't need to be worried
great place for kids

Love It. All the Ride Are awesome Staff is good to.too kind.changing room staff is just average...no towel available you have provide towel in this price to...but live time experience i will visit every day if i lived in dubai
Amazing. Grabbing a float tube, strong water currents pushing you up different sloaps, barely lifting a finger...AWESOME!!! So many things to do there that end with FUN!!!
Best in Dubai. Visited both water parks (Wild Wadi and Aquaventure) and our family group voted Wild Wadi the better water park. More rides, longer rides and less queues.

Should up their safety. At the wild wadi park I was put on a dinghy behind my young son for the ride, my feet were over his chest, but when the ride took us up and down, my feet became embedded in his chest, he couldn't breath and it was terrifying! Fortunately he was ok, but we had to visit the first aid office! I thought I'd crushed his chest.

Extreme fun. We had an awesome day at Wild Wadi. It was so much fun! We were lucky enought to arrive first thing in the morning and get a turn on all the rides with out having to stand in any ques. After lunch it started getting really busy, but the ques weren't all that bad. We went there on Sunday so it wasn't a weekend. All the staff were really friendly. The food and drinks were really expensive. There is free water there, but you aren't allowed to take any of your own food or drinks in with you.

Fun - very family friendly!. As a waterpark enthusiast, I was super excited to visit the legendary wild wadi! Staff were polite and knowledgable and rides were fun.Unfortunately it does not have anywhere to "relax" unlike it's competitor. And the food outlets let it down.That aside, a great day out!

Water slides start at the bottom and go up - Interesting!. Great water park, was younger when visited and had an amazing time and know I would love it if I went again, which I plan on. The flumes shoot you upwards so there are no annoying stairs to clib whilst you wait, and there is the lazy river for when you just need to chill out.. If you are in Dubai, then this place is a must!

Great place for kids. Spent a day there - not too busy as we went on a Wednesday. We were not that interested in the slides/rides/etc. Spent most of the time with the kids in the wave pool, lazy rivers and water play area. Entry was BOGOF with Entertainer vouchers which gave us a healthy saving. We stayed there for approx 4 hours, arriving at 1 pm and leaving at 5 pm. Fed the kids before we arrived and therefore they only really needed snacks while we were there. Admission ticket and cash is uploaded to an electronic wristband which can be used to pay for any purchase in the park. Remaining money can be refunded at the end of the day. Prices of food and drinks seemed on a par with Western theme parks. Lots of staff, particularly lifeguards, etc. who were very helpful. There seem to be a lot of rides/slides/etc. for older guests but younger children are well catered for. Various photographers will take your photos but the prices of photos was exorbitant. Prayer room available in both male and female changing rooms.This place seemed more "intimate" than Aquaventure which we visited earlier in the year.

Great day out! Not cheap but search for tokens/discounts. Second visit this year and for a single day entry i find it expensive at around £40. However if you search out for discount its possible to get a 2-4-1 deal.Great layout, ques for the rides not overly long. Plenty of "upgrades" to spend further money on coupled with a huge tacky gift emporium.You are not allowed to take any of your own food/drink inside excepting bottled water. There are water fountains situated inside the park. Fast food only is available. Be prepared to pay over £10 for burger chips and a drink.Overall a good experience and just what you need on a hot day!I will no doubt, return
Great fun. If you are staying in the Jumeirah Beach Hotel you get free access - in which case if you go around 4pm the queues are significantly shorter.

Great experience, well worth a look. We got free tickets to the park through our stay at the Jumeirah Creekside but we were planning a day here anyway. We were very very happy with our day, with the staff being amazing and the facilities super super clean. Highly recommend Wild Wadi for a great family day out, keep up the great work guys, you may not have some of the whizz bang rides some others do but your friendly, helpful and courteous staff make the difference. Cheers from Australia

Cramped but plenty of fun. Wild Wadi has some fun water rides; I especially liked the White Water experience but the whole place feels cramped and busier than it actually is because there are few open spaces. I prefer the Lost Paradise Water Park in Bahrain.

Watertastic. As far as water parks go,this was the best one I've ever been to. The staff were great and very helpful. There is a great selection of rides to cater for all and the water slides that shoot you up hill to get around are great. There are sprinklers that keep the paths cool to walk on and the food is of a average price. We did not go to the Atlantis water park so can't compare the two but we had a really great day.

Excellent Family Fun. Firstly I would recommend that you purchase a Dubai Family Entertainer, in that you get two for one tickets for Wild Wadi so you nearly make your money back instantaneously and get vouchers for lots of other attractions and restaurants. I love Wild Wadi, its nicer if there are a few of you though, then you get to go on the 4 person rides and scream away together. :) The new ride, sceirah, is amazing when we started to queue I didn't know what we were getting on. As we reached the top 10 minutes or so later I saw we were queuing to step into a chamber where the floor below gives way. After nearly having a heart attack all ended in smiles at the bottom. Get to Wild Wadi as close to opening time as you can, it gets extremely busy in the afternoon so queue times go up. Food is excellent, though not cheap for what you get. You are given a band to wear around your wrist which you can put money on at the entrance, this is then scanned at all outlets and you are given a new balance. You then get a refund when leaving the park of the remaining balance. The fish foot eating experience is also a lot of fun, if you can tolerate the tickling sensation.

Meet in the middle family holiday. A great day, clean tidy and lots of fun for children big and small. We organised a Cabana which was fantastic as you didnt have to worry about finding a spot to base yourself, also gives you quicker access to some of the rides

Very enjoyable. Very well thought out! We got there early as we had read that it gets busy in the afternoons & there was hardly anyone there! When buying your ticket it's very well explained what your buying, I.e electronic wrist band you can put money on so you don't have to carry cash around & what you don't spend gets returned to you once you've finished.Initially didn't think the signs for where the rides where very good, but then I realised that when you go on a ride it will lead onto the others! This was on the "White water wadi (Master blaster)", which connects to 11 other slides, so you can get off& join the other slides without going far. There was plenty of lounges around & the staff where all very pleasant & cheerful. The views where amazing from the higher points & the snacks etc where healthy with a wide range of fresh fruit & water. I did see a drinking water fountain near the entrance to the park, but that was the only one, which I thought was a shame, but maybe I wasn't being observant enough! Defenatly a 10/10 for this park, no queues, excellent staff & rides where excellent!

The highlight of our stay. We spent a day here and had the best time ever. The entrance fee was free because we stayed at a Jumeirah hotel. The views of Burj al arab are really neat as you travel around the park. The scary rides had the longer waits, but there was plenty to do and we tried all the rides. Loved lazying through the little river that takes you around the park. It was good fun and smiles all day. Highly recommend this park!

A word of warning about motion sickness on the tunnel of doom... i was unaware that by going in the Tunnel of Doom that it would be so twisty and dark (my fault for not checking) I do suffer from some motionsickness but after exiting after only 30 seconds but seemed an eternity-I felt so awful that it ruined the rest of the day as I had to lie down in the shade and my rides were limited to the Lazy River.....The twisting and turning in the dark enclosed tunnel hit my inner ear balance instantly-so just beware in case you decide is it for me or notAndy UK

Most amazing day!!!!. This beat all our expectations!!! If only you could have seen my little children's faces it was priceless. Best to get there early as you not get any sun beds, food was good value and fantastic photo opportunities. Spend most of the day there but could have done with a few more hours. Time to get on rides was ok, nothing like when u go to an attraction in England. Would defo go back there again!! We'll done.

Best waterpark in Dubai. So family friendly, excellent rides, lifeguards everywhere , feel very safe, a bit pricey so buy dubai entertainer voucher buy one get free voucher you will save a bit of money
great fun. The rides last for ages and are great fun and I don`t like swimming so it's a must. If you are staying at the jumeirah zebeel saray you get in free but get your pass from the hotel.

Great fun but tiring. As part of a family this place had everything we could possibly want for a day out. Sun, water and lots of refreshments near by, a little pricey but nothing more than you would expect. Would recommend it but get there early!!!

Dont forget to try jumeirah sceirah :). We visited with a big group so it was fun.towels and lockers are chargeable around 100 AED. the must done thrilling excitement is jumeirah sceirah!they lock you in a standing capsule and take away the floor under your feet! craziest water ride i have ever done! but in few sec you land safely down. other 1 or two rides are also thrilling one. the park also have wave-pool, food stores, and kids area. nice place for a day out.

fun fun fun and fun. life is refreshed whenever i go to this outstanding place.with variety of activities its only time that limits you.food is available at a pocket frienly cost and the staff are there to help always with information.just amazing experience

Perfect place for fun but saw a staff with hicky/kiss mark. not good!. i heard a lot of feedback from this water park from my friends, workmates and some reviews online..They said that the place is good, the staff are friendly and the food is totally awesome. So i had my rest day last October 26 and call my friends to have a road trip from Abu Dhabi to Dubai. We arrived there around 11 in the morning. we were welcomed by the staff. I was really excited to do the rides after trying the one in Yas Waterworld now i want to see which one is better. The place was clean and organize. we started taking pictures. i tried slide number 1 and 4. it was perfect. however number 3 the so called Jumeriah Sceirah was breathtaking (yet fun). it was a nice experience but when my friends and I decided to try the Fisho massage i was really disappointed to see this one man (i dont know if what's his nationality) but he seems like Arabic. while my friends were freaking out and screaming because of those nibbling fish i couldnt take my eyes off from this guy standing infront of me. He was hell full of hickies/kiss mark on his leg and it look so annoying. I don't think Wild Wadi should tolerate this kind of staff, its not good to be seen by the guests. (especially kids). This is just an opinion because in our company. Visible hicky is a big NO NO.

Wild wadi waterpark - think twice before visiting here. During a late afternoon visit I had to pay full admission for adults and teenagers of around £50 each. No discount for late entry unless you are local or Arab. The place is looking a bit old and shabby and has not really changed much in the last few years which you would expect at this price. As can be expected all food and drink is a rip off and small locker costs £7. No sun beds or anywhere to sit on our visit as park very full but they do not tell you this of course. If thinking visiting here do yourself a favour and look elsewhere to one of other water parks
Good fun for the entire family!. Liked: the infrastructure, the number of water activities which suit every age;Disliked: a bit too pricey

Great for tamer rides. We headed straight for the big slide and ridesw e thought we would have to queue a lot so managed to geta round everything in a couple of hours. Get a base on the sunbeds leave your stuff and head straight off. The double seater inflatables are popular. If your children are light, ignore the height chart for the ride which goes around the whole park. I saw a slight child tipped off their ring by the surge of the jets which push you around....nobody hurt but just beware.Feels a bit tired in places but all in all a good outing. The queues don't seem to move that quickly, unlike Atlantis.

Good but get there early!. Some very good rides and all very secure and safe environment. However, to avoid all the lines get there early and plan what rides you want to go prioritise. We got in complementary because we were staying at a Jum hotel I'm not sure if its worth the money if I had to spend all day in line!

Amazing!. Stayed in the Media City and came here our second to last day. I had high hopes and expectations after going to Aquaventure at Atlantis earlier in the week but Wild Wadi did not disappoint! Felt like kids the whole 5/6 hours we were here, absolutely loved it and would recommend to all ages! Very child friendly if you have a family but also great for couples. Tantrum alley was probably one of my favourite rides and I'll never forget it after going on it about 10 times, the guys up the top of the ride ended up laughing at us we went on it so much! If you're planning to come here then you will have a brilliant and fun day!!

Fun time but crowded. We aren't usually huge fans of water parks but on our trip to Dubai we visited both Wild Wadi and Aquaventure. We preferred Aquaventure but Wild Wadi had some fun rides. Pros - loved the Tantrum Alley and the big slide. The master blaster type slides were just okay for me but daughter enjoyed them. My husband really liked the flow rider. Cons - the park felt cramped compared to Aquaventure. Also the crowds were terrible. We got there a little after 10am and waited in line about 15 minutes. Almost all the chairs were taken. We changed and went to the flowrider first where my husband waited 10-15 minutes for a ride which lasted about 30 seconds. He wanted to do it again but later the lines were even longer. Next we went to the "master blaster" which has 11 slides (forget its name) and waited 30 minutes. The lines got longer after that - usually 45 minutes. So we spent a lot more time in lines than in the water. While there are towels to rent I think $10pp is pretty steep and would take towels the next time. Locker however is a must. If we were to return to Dubai we probably would not go back to Wild Wadi. It was fun but we did about everything there and as far as the ambiance of the park we preferred Aquaventure.
Great Fun. A must visit with the kids, but be prepared, it's expensive and there is queuing on most slides but worth it. Food and drink is pretty reasonable too.

A great family day out. Wild Wadi has added extra rides and it's good to see the continued investment. Difficult to get away from their relentless radio blasting out all over the park, but it was never going to be a relaxing day!

Awesome!!!!. Get there early, to avoid the crowds. If you can manage cooler weather, then do it, to avoid the crowds. The food is okay (but who goes for the food????). The views are pretty nice. The rides are great, my favorite, a continuous ride in which you get on a tube...a ride...float a bit...ride...float a bit...ride...and so on and so forth. Go there, it's a lot of fun.

excellent day out.... great day out with the water park well positioned near the Jumeriah and Burg Al Arab.Lots of thrill rides and lots of fun if you want to get wet...well worth the money and also the food on offer inside is very well priced.

amaaaazing. ohhhh myyyy god .. am totally in love with this place .. we stayed in Al Qaser hotel which allow us for unlimited access to the park . all the facilities are available there . love all the rides .. the life guard are available every where with their eyes open @@ I would love to visit this place again and again :)

Fabulous family fun. Let your hair down and be a kid again. Remember the sunblock because an hour quickly turns four hours and before you know it you are spent and smiling, wondering why you don't do this every weekend.

not that much. you know i didn't like it because you have to wait more than 30 min for the peer game in the weekends or summer or holidays and that is not fun at all. but the view is so woooow i lived it from the jumeirah hotel. agai i didn't like it that much because of the waiting in rush hours like summer and weekends

Great way to spend a few hours. Free entrance to this water park as guests of Al Qasr. Not sure I would pay unless I had kiddies to take. The park is not very big but had some good water slides that even tempted this OAP. Nice lazy river tube ride too.

A bit outdated. I cannot write about Wild Wadi without comparing it to Aquaventure - the other water park at Atlantis. Wild Wadi just feels outdated and as if it has not adjusted to the growing number of tourists in Dubai. It is small, the water corridors are quite narrow resulting in major crowds in the water where you can never properly relax even in the "lazy river" because there are tons of people around you who push you aside, splash water, etc.There is a huge wait line for nearly every ride which sort of removes half of the fun.The changing rooms are quite spacious but I still can't believe there are just 4 toilets!The food is nothing exceptional and is quite expensive but at least the watermelon that you can get as a dessert is delicious.It was really quite a disappointing trip and it seems like the crowd is mostly of young guys who are quite disrespectful of personal space....I did not see many women and not even too many kids.As an overall, I think it is too expensive (275 DH) for what the water park is offering. If you have the choice - go to Aquaventure!

winter sun at waterpark. we stayed at the madinat Jumeirah so entrance was free, went there twice both times quite busy.but there are plenty of things to do, some queueing but nothing majorno problem to get a sun lounger or space to lay your towel.had a great time there and would recommend it.
Ladies Night. Thursday evening was great no queues for any ride not as busy as we expected it to be and was nice to lounge and not to hot in the evening.

Fun day out for the entire family!. We liked this park a lot. Booked a cabana for 950 dhs. Recommend it! Kids loved the surfing spot and we all took the white river ride several times together. The size of this park is perfect, you don´t get lost and can let the kids go by themselves.

something for everyone. Despite being a waterpark, everyone can find an activity to fit their thrill factor levels . I psyched my self and went for the ultimate jumeira scarer. Wow! what a thrill. The queues may seem daunting but dont be discouraged cos they move fast

Try a cabana. If you're in a group of ....say more than 5 people then book a cabana. It is really worth the extra dirhams. Excellent private space and service from attentive staff all day. Sun loungers and beds and hammocks cater for around 8 people in sun or shade. Plenty of cold water on hand, and beautiful cold fruit comes as part of the price. Security lockers on your patch for your possessions while you have a splash about.

Enjoyable but busy. We visited Wild Wadi three times in the space of a week. The kids loved it and there is enough to keep them occupied for hours on end. The lifeguards are very alert and friendly, particularly on the ride where you get blasted up by powerful water jets. I would echo comments about safety that other posters have mentioned. I was on a double slide behind my son's and we came off the top of one slide at high speed. His float had not moved out of the way and we hit his with some force. The lifeguards looked a little overwhelmed as though too many people were on the ride. My tip would be to ask them to hold you back a bit and put more space between floats. It wasn't major enough for us to report it. I liked the cashless system and the changing rooms are okay. We'd come back and I'd recommend it as somewhere to go in Dubai. Bring plenty of sunscreen though!

Waterpark. It's always best go visit wild wadi early in the morning, when they first open at 10am. The lines are shorter and it is much more pleasant. I visit this waterpark quite frequently and always have a good time. A fun park to visit.

The original and still the best !. This was the original and in my view is still the best water park in Dubai.It has been up dated over the years."Jumeirah Sceirah" is not for the light hearted but exhilarating.Entry price (for Dubai) is not that unreasonable for a family,but if you are staying at a jumeirah hotel, depending on what packae you are on, entry will be free any way.Well worth a visit.

Enjoyable way to escape the heat. Others have told me the Atlantis waterpark is more impressive, but for people who enjoy but aren't obsessed with waterparks the Wild Wadi was just the right size for us. We don't like our rides too scary and we liked the winding river layout.We rented a cabana which was expensive but worth it, with our own stocked fridge and food service. Good service, food was ok, better than at some other parks we've been too. The day we were there the park wasn't that crowded, but on a busy day we would have appreciated this even more. Well stocked shop.Many women dress conservatively here, so I would recommend women wear a rash shirt and board shorts rather than a bikini (also good for avoiding sunburn!).
Rides and prices!. There weren't many rides but they were fantastic! BUT THE PRICE OH MY LORD! But it was okay for one day even the price was about 70 euros which is pretty freaking much!
Visit. Good fun but not nearly as polished as Aquaventure and limited number of distinct rides. Piped music simply awful. Needless to say expensive. Would strongly recommend ear plugs!
must go place. you must go here if only to cool down. A real must if you are going with children great hotel next to it also

So much fun. We spent a day at Wild Wadi and had such as blast. I was hoping for a few minutes on the wave rider but ended up spending an hour riding the waves as it was a fairly quiet day. A big recommendation from us.

Limited and quite expensive. Before you start - get a Dubai Entertainer voucher to bring the cost down to something sensible - otherwise it is expensive for what you get. There are only a few really good/thrilling rides - then there is LONG lazy river, with what I best describe as uphill rides. You are blasted up the hill by water jet, which makes for an exciting if not very comfortable experience. Highlight for us was the Flowrider - worth the relatively short wait and was great fun.Other top tips - take a towel (will cost you £6 each to hire) and an empty water bottle - otherwise you will be in for a big cost hit.If you have done one of the USA waterparks then you will find that you can get round this in a couple of hours. On the plus side, the queues were short, so you CAN get round in a couple of hours.

Great time. We had a great time at this waterpark. Yes it is not like aquaventure but still you can have lot of fun and beautiful views especially for burj arab and the beach. There are lot of waterfalls and beautiful slides and pools with waves...we had a great time....

thrilling. you have to go to wild wadi even if you don't like water rides. there is ample beds to sunbathe,there are places to get food.and there are lockers for your valuables even though you can leave them unattended and they wont get pinched.there are life guards every where and are very quick if somebody is in trouble.overall great. first time we went I lost my sunglasses on one of the rides and they stopped the whole ride and found them for me..fantastic
Cool time....... Although park is not that large the variety of rides is great. Great place to cool off for several hours - wave pool was really relaxing. Bring plenty sun screen.....

One of the best waterparks anywhere. This place has got to be one of the best waterparks anywhere.The slides are just amazing. The jet slides go on forever and are so much fun. But be careful picking up your tubes to make sure they are fully inflated cos I didn't on one occasion and had to make the walk of shame off one of the slides when the jets weren't powerful to send me up (I'm only 85kgs).I chickened out of the the bomb bay style one but loved everything else and the fact that you don't have to rent tubes is brilliant. I also really appreciated being able to preload my wrist band with money saving me having to go get cash all the time for food and snacks.Definitely worth the money if spending the whole day there.
wonderfull. I loved it so much,... its really really amazing for adults and any age .. Full of activities and full of challenge and excitement.

A Fun Escape From the Heat. We recently visited Wild Wadi and had a very fun time. It's not a huge park, nor does it have quite as many rides as some water parks I have been to in the U.S., which is one reason why I can't give it five stars. The other reason is that it's pretty pricey considering that they only have a few slides that would be impressive to adults. Still, if you enjoy water parks like I do, you will have fun here. We arrived around 10 (when it opens to the public) and were able to walk right in with our printed voucher. There was no line to load money on to your wristband, and stashing our stuff in a locker took only a minute or two. Then it was on to the rides. The park wasn't busy in the morning so we were able to go on the Jumeirah Sceirah and the two other big water slides several times with not much wait, which was really nice. Take advantage of this while you can, because it definitely got busier as the day went on, and we ended up waiting 30 minutes or more for the best rides in the afternoon. They have a wave pool and a lazy river that were nice, but the lazy river was a bit TOO lazy. People kept abandoning their tubes so you would find the river clogged with tubes. It would be nice if the lifeguards cleared these out more efficiently. I do recommend going on the Jumeirah Sceirah. I've never seen a water slide with a trap door like that, and it was awesome, if a bit scary the first time. Definitely an adrenaline rush as the door latches shut behind you, you hear a voice counting down "Three...Two...One..." and then the trap door beneath your feet falls out from under you and you are hurtling down a water slide. It's not the absolute scariest water slide out there, but it is fun if you like tall water slides. I do wish there were more food options in the park, but we survived just fine. You load money onto your plastic wristband, which is very convenient since you don't want to be running back and forth to your locker to get your wallet all day long. I appreciated that the dress code was not strict at this park--plenty of bikinis and speedos right alongside women in abayas and Islamic swimwear. Anything goes, I guess! The staff were very friendly and, all in all, we had a great day. I just wish they would expand and add even more big water slides!

Very expensive---much more than expected. Costs quoted in guide books were much lower than the actual cost on the gate. It was very expensive for a family of 5. Cost of drinks and snacks inside was also very high and you are not allowed to take in your own. Cost of lockers also high. All in all visit spoiled because of cost.

Out of this world. This place is nuts, you have water slides that actually propel you "UP RIVER".The whole place is fantastic. One felt safe and secure with lots of life guards and cleaners keeping the place spick and span.Loads of beds and shady areas as the sun does get hot hot hot.Food and drinks a plenty and reasonably priced for theme park fodder but good quality.

Super fun. We had so much fun in each and every ride and slide. Staff are always smiling and helping. Park is not too big so you don't waste time getting from one place to the other, yet includes lots of rides. Food and drinks are a bit expensive (as in any attraction around the world). Lockers are a bit small, so don't take unnecessary valuables and keep it only to your clean clothes after shower. HAVE FUN.
So much fun!. Had a fantastic day out at this Water Park - try and get a 2 for 1 voucher as it's £40 each so not cheap!

Love Wild Wadi. We have visited Wild Wadi several times and it never gets boring. It may not be the biggest water park but the staff, rides and service are all excellent. The staff always have smiles on their faces and are really engaged. The food and drink is very good and the rides are loads of fun. We love the (not-so) Lazy River!!

Great Fun. Felt like we were teenagers all over again. We spent about three hours on the rides followed by lunch. The rides were amazing, lunch was sad. We were lucky with the crowds - went on a weekday morning - didnt need to wait for more than 2-3 minutes for any ride. I presume weekends would be packed. Easily found a few sunbeds to keep our towels and other stuff. Must do are the Jumeirah Sceirah, Tantrum Alley.
Wild wadi. Good water park but if given the choice I would say to go to Atlantis as there is so much more to do

Great Day for children and adults. Been many times, get there early and avoid the tourists! queues can get long in the afternoon but its still a good day. Try and use the BIGIF vouchers you sometimes see, makes a big difference on cost.

A great day out. I've been here a number of times when staying at the jumeirah beach hotel as entry is free. It's worth considering that the cost for a family is around 100 pounds, so if you go there 5 times in a week, reflect that in your thinking around hotel prices. If you stay in any jumeirah hotel it's free. It's perfect for families albeit the best rides are not for children. We braved the jumeirah scheirah! All I will say is don't expect to still have your trunks on at the end! The majority of rides are excellent, life guards everywhere and safety buoys for kids are plentiful. It's not cheap to eat and drink, but neither are hotels! It's a great day out, and if you go to Dubai in 35 degree heat, it's the best way to get a tan and stay relatively cool as your soaked all the time! Locker at £5 is a rip off but necessary. There's now also a fish feet eating session but that didn't appeal! We will try aqua adventure next time as were not staying in a jumeirah hotel!

Definitely worth a visit. We had free entry as we stayed in a nearby hotel - this place is certainly worth the visit. Fantastic rides for all the family - ranging from nice and relaxing rides to the terrifying! There are lots of sunbeds around the park with shaded areas. There are also lots of food outlets with reasonable prices. Tip: This waterpark opens an hour early for hotel guests - which was fantastic and got on the rides without queuing, This is great fun for all ages and we would definitely go again.

Great day out. Staying at Jumeriah beach hotel we had free access to the wild wadi, it was brilliant, for kids and adults.There are so many life guards you feel totally safe, particularly as we had 6 children in our group of varying ages.The rides are great fun, the queues are not long, it is spotlessly clean and the food and drinks are not extortionate. Would highly recommend it.

Lots of fun. A very entertaining park for water and thrill seekers. A must for families. There's lots to do for adults and kids. Food courts provide a variety of snacks and drinks. Try the jumeirah scarer IF you have what it takes. Bring lots of sun screen.

An unforgettable day in Dubai. A day full of joy and fun we had there. The park had a map,which means that you could start from a place in the park,play all the games and not miss any of them and finish in the last play. The only negative point was that sometimes one rich man comes and rent a game completely for himself for an hour for example and no one else can use it on that time!! Which I think it is not fair.... Dubai has another water park too which I think next time I will use that.

Best water park. Wild Wadi Water park is easily my best water theme park across the world, the fun thrilled experience makes you visit the place again and again, will surely recommend this park for all the ages
Great day. Great water park great to cool down for the day even when you walk round you have a water mist sprayed on you

Great fun. A little more expensive than I expected but when I got there just the number of life guards explained that. It was great fun and nice way to spend some time in Dubai. You don't need to be a child or a teenager. My girlfriend and I had a great day out. My only comment is arrive early as we did as it gets busier through out the day. Definitely worth a visit.

Fun filled day- Made me feel 20 years younger. Had quite some fun. If you like water, then is a great way to spend a hot day.The rides are simple and quite exciting. The locale is clean.I was trying out my new Go Pro3 and thus enjoyed it quite a bit.Disappointing that they did not let us use the camera on the wildest ride down the tubes. I do think that they should allow the Go Pro atleast as the fittings are designed for rough use.Anyhow enjoyed ourselves.

brilliant. got free passes because i booked my holiday early.had a super day here never laughed as much in my life. nearly lost my bikini bottoms on one of the water slides ( i think it was the one with the big rubber ring you sit in). any way i thought it was great .took a packed lunch so didnt have to worry about finding something to eat. a great day out for families .
Truly family holiday. This is the place to go with all the children and grand parents - everybody will find something interesting

My husband 's time to play!. We were staying at the Dar Al Masyaf, so you could go to the water park as much as you liked for free, I carnt swim so just sun bathed and went in to the wave pool to cool off, but my husband was like a big kid and went on everything and said it was one of hype best water parks ever and we've been to loads of different ones over the years when my daughter was younger.

wild!!. The Wild Wadi is without doubt the finest water park around..super clean, super exciting and as with everything in Dubai just well organized.We got in for free as part of the deal while staying at the amazing Dar Al Maysaf hotel.We did not try the food but ceratinly built up an appetite whilst there.First class..

A M A Z I N G fun. Such a fun day out, so many rides, and so amazing to think that you are in a place which is its far removed from the sand which was its base not so long ago. No matter how many times you go there you will enjoy it each time as if it was the first, don't miss it if you have a day to yourselves with no fixed plans.

Fun but crowded. If you can afford to travel to bani Yas for the new water park, wild Wadi is the place to visit. All attractions are fun to ride. The only problem is during holiday season when it gets too crowded that you waste precious time queuing. The pool is cooled during summer, but the number of swimmers is relatively large. Recommended except in GCC countries school holidays. For ladies wearing Hijab Thursday night is ladies only. Also fare is expensive.

wonderful place. We visited Wild Wadi back in July, it was our first visit to Dubai and the water parkwe spent the whole day there, and my children didn't want to leave.Fantastic place, well worth the money, we'll be visiting there again next year.
Fun day out. Had a fantastic few hours at this water park ,and our average age group is 60, we went on all the rides and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves..There is a small lagoon where you can make base,

Great fun. Great day out. Quite expensive if you haven't got an entertainer voucher. The park was really quiet on the day we visited so got on all the sides without having to queue. Food was a bit over priced for what they serve (fast food) but all in all a great way to spend the day.

Great Day Out!. Wild Wadi has been around for over ten years but has recently been "upgraded" and it still a great day out. The waterpark is easy to get to to but can get quite busy - so plan to get there early to avoid the queues. Our kids has been there a lot and still loves going.
Fun day out.. An excellent water park and not too busy. Very much like the Florida parks - just as good. Again, very clean.

Ride the Jumeirah Sceirah if you dare!. A thoroughly enjoyable water park with a variety of rides suitable for all the family, though some had a height restriction. All the rides are signed to show how scary they are, and scariest of all is the Jumeirah Sceirah. By the time you get to the top of the tower to get into the pods to commence the ride, the tension is evident in the air. The staff prepare you very well for the ride - but it is very scary!!!! On the day we visited queues were very long which was a little frustrating, but we still managed to try out all the rides we wanted to. Allow at least half a day to try them all out.The staff were very proficient and life guards were evident on all the rides and patrolling around the park. They were very strict in enforcing park rules which was very reassuring. Sunglasses have to be removed for most of the rides, but are otherwise useful. I would recommend bringing your own towels, and flip flops for walking around in when you are not on a ride. We didn't eat at the park as we were staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel (thoroughly recommended), but there were plenty of food outlets, if a little expensive.The park and the rides are not very suitable for those using a wheelchair, and could be difficult for those pushing children around in a buggy. Overall for a middle aged couple we consider it an excellent experience.

AMAZING. The price is right. The slides go uphill and each set has 6 or more slides. Plus, they have a few added slides that are fun. I liked that they give everyone a watch and you can load money on it to pay for your items i.e. food, drinks, souvenirs, locker etc. There are life guards everywhere. I lost my sunglasses and when I called the next day I was told there were found. Plus, they have children slides. I would suggest to go early to give yourself a lot of time to enjoy.

Best water parks experience ever...yet! Worth your while when vacationing in Dubai. With AED 205 each, I and my wife purchased an all day pass (till 1800 hrs since it was ladies night) to a wonderful aqua adventure experience. The park is cashless so you have to load whatever you might spend on a rubber wristband given at the entrance; the process is quite straight forward and unspent funds can be redeemed afterwards. Things are relatively expensive inside the park so come with your towel and swim suits else you rent a towel for AED 30. There are 11 rides & attractions, the scariest of these is the Jumeirah Sceirah (seriously, don't try this if you think you don't have the heart), the Juha's dhow & lagoon is exclusively for kids.Flowriders and flood rivers are fun. Lifeguards are always around to ensure safety. Wonderful experience

Brilliant fun!. I thoroughly enjoyed this water park! From death defying drops to lazy pools to relax, I had a brilliant time exploring the park with family and friends.The water was extremely clean in all the pools/slides and a lot of lifeguards are stationed around the place. A few eating establishments around the place in case you get hungry which you can pay for with a wristband you are given at the start which you topped up with money. This is very handy so you don't need to bring your wallet out with you and keep it locked in your locker.The wave pool which is designed after a beach is very enjoyable, even for those who find it hard to swim as they provide life jackets for you to float around in. This water is warmer than the rest of the water around the park so you could just sun bathe on the shore.Please visit this park!

A fun day out. A really good day out & a break from the heat! Wild wadi is great fun and definitely worth a visit. There are lots of rides that you can jump on and off at various times and there are also the more daring ones which we did and although petrified it was definitely worth it! There are lockers for all your belongings and they give you a wrist band which you add credit to to get you meals and drinks on etc so you don't have to worry about. Arriving money or belongings around with you. Sun beds are free and and there wasn't any queues for the rides. It's also fine for ladies to wear bikinis. A great day out.

Fun park!. We went on a Tuesday and it wasnt packed at all. My wife and I were able to get on a few rides multiple times. The tickets were pretty expensive but we are in Dubai. This waterpark is right in front of the famous Burj al Arab. While on the rides, the workers try to take many pics of you to sell them. Paid about 50 bucks for two picture smh.

A MUST. 4 hours after landing at the DXB international airport I found myself at Wild Wadi and I must say it was worth the almost 70usd entry fee.
