Dubai is handsdown the hottest country I've visited and i'm African so I know hot.My inner child came out to play as I went trying all the rides one after the other. The Jumeirah sceirah ride was the scariest but it had the best rush ever-if u are into that kind of thing. The view of the Burj al Arab, Jumeirah beach n it's hotel are also mega pluses. However I'd advise you take your own flip flops,towels,sunscreens everything - you'd need them and they cost ridiculously. Pictures taken also cost a fortune so I'd advise group pictures so you can split the bill. Other than that I'd say it was totally AMAZEBALLS and I'd def do it again... and again.... and again!
Waterpark. Intended to just go and have a look round and maybe a swim, instead we ran about like a couple of teenagers, enjoying all the rides and facilities.

Great day out for the family.. Spent near to a full day here and it was great. Lots of slides and choices for those that like action and speed and those that simply want to laze around a pool. We found the entry price very reasonable as were the food prices inside (sadly its mostly fast food based but it was ok). We caught a taxi here and back to our hotel (taxis are cheap, clean and you never have any issue). It did get rather crowded as we went on a Saturday. You can hire lockers to store your things and they use a system where you charge money to a wrist band. We hired a cabana for the day (which was expensive but worth it in our view). And you can get 8 in them so great to split with a couple of families or a larger group. They have covered sun beds, a fridge with cold towels and water and pool towels, and the staff will order and bring your food and other drinks from a menu (extra). It's in a secure location with easy access to the pools/slides. Best thing is, the most popular slide (slide 1) which links 11 slides around the park in one long ride you get priority access to it and skip any queues. As I say, worth every cent and didn't have to search for vacant spaces or sun lounges to relax and eat. We also went out onto the beach (had a pass if you stay with a Jumeirah Hotel) and a swim in the ocean was nice. Good to spend a day. Open every day and times vary depending on time of the year but about 10am to 7pm. Oh and you get great views of the Burj al Arab and Jumeriah Beach Hotel so bring a camera.

Great day. Great day, very well organised water park, there are wristbands you charge with money so you do not need to carry your purse round all day. Lockers (which you pay for with the wristband) are available in male and female changing rooms. Lots of different rides.Only advice would be to maybe keep flip flops as the floor was so hot, also if you are not planning on using the rides and sunbathing instead, try and get a sunbed near to water as its so hot I had to sit in the water.

Wonderful fun. Brilliant for kids of all ages form 3 to 103. Everything provided, clean and well looked-after. They have thought of how to make it so you do not have to carry stuff around with you, which is great.We have been a few times, and there has always been a bit of a wait for a taxi afterwards. Enjoy - it's great fun, and good to spend the whole day there.

Amazing waterpark. The best water park I have ever been to. The park has an amazing feel to it. It has great attractions like the White Water Wadi (Master blaster) with 11 slides and the Wipeout Flowrider where you ride a water flow with a bodyboard.

Don't go to Atlantis. I went to both wild wadi water park and aquaventure water park. Aquvavrnture is newly built as compare to wild wadi so I thought it will be better than wild wadi,however please note that its nothing as compare to wild wadi, the slides, rides , other fun , food every thing is better in wild wadi. You may not be able to spend more than two hours in aquaventure but in wild wadi even the whole day is not enough . Those people who are having kids please keep away from aquaventure water park as I am young 28 years of age even I got hurt in one of their slide however I survived, I was just thinking what would have happened if same goes with some kid.

better than Atlantis Aquapark. You dont need to go and collect the rubber tube to sit in the lazy river from the pool in wild wadi than hike it up several stair cases which you do have to do at the Atlantis. Also, the floor was so hot you could barely walk without hopping everywhere at Atlantis. The park also closes far later here compared to Atlantis, and at wild wadi you can add money to your wristband and use it in the park whereas Atlantis you have to go back to your locker everytime.
Amusement Park .... Wild Wadi is the only themed amusement park in the UAE situated on Jumeirah Beach road in front of Burj Al Arab.

amazing fun. Best time to have fun in the desert sun is Oct to March. It's fun to feel the warm sandy breeze while sliding down into the cool waters of the fun rides. The wave pool is awesome!! Spend hours doing nothing and challenge yourself to beat the laziness of a 'Hippo' in the pool.

Still the best water park in the world!. This is my 4th time to wild wadi and I still think its the best! Better than Atlantis and all the Florida parks. It's smaller with less queuing time with longer rides. Friendly helpful staff and efficient service! A feast day out! The only down side is that the floor gets very hot so water shoes a must!!
Great. I haven't had so much fun in a long while, not too many queues the rides were very good, some were really long which is nice, some are very scarey ( but safe ) it was a great day.
Enjoyable. Alot of rides and good service. If you like to spent a day with family or friends it's the place to get wet....definetly recomended....

excellent day out. We went with 3 young children and they were able to go on most slides/rides. Food is overpriced though this is expected. Toilet, shower and changing facilities are clean. I find the staff are helpful and you can easily find your way around the park. children and adults would have a fun filled day here.

lots of fun. not as many rides as I would have expectedwhen I went there for 1st time in 2007, hotel residents had priority entrance before the park opened for the public, was great as it wasn't busy and we enjoyed it very much, since then, on return visits, they have stopped doing that, so now its very crowded with queues etc.not great for toddlers as on water slides (even the baby ones) u cant ride with your little one, so they are scared to go alone, hence my little one (2 year old) did not enjoy it.

Wet day in hot Dubai. Surprised to see good rides in Wild Wadi. The best of course is their signature Jumeirah Sceirah!!
We had complementary tickets as we were staying in a Jumeirah hotel and the hotel even provided free transportation to the Wild Wadi. It will get pretty crowded on a weekend but manageable.
Its fun for the family!

Fun. The water park was so much fun. I went with my friend. We loved every minute of it. Amazing slides, full of excitement, a brilliant day. And I'm completly satisfied with our experience. We cant wait to go back there again

Who says don`t go on a friday?. We visited on a Friday which is meant to be a no no and had virtually no massive queues for any ride and found that we did it all in 4hrs. It is a compact fun park and we have visited a good few waterparks over the years. Best slide has to be Jumeirah sceirah which terrified me but ended up doing it twice lol.Well worth a visit

Fun Day in Dubai. My husband and I were staying at Al Qasr hotel so we decided to spend a day at Wild Wadi. What an awesome day it was. The sun was out and was around 40 degrees. The water park was just what we needed on a hot day like that.

Amazing. Brilliant, the water park was next to the hotel where we were staying, therefore we were able to access park free of charge. The staff were all very friendly and efficient the range of rides were fantastic and well supervised by life guards enabling safety for everyone.

Excellent. Excellent place to spare your time and having fun specially if you have little kids or you're young traveller looking for fun!The only thing they need to improve is that they should provide in house flip flops as you could really damage your feet by walking on the hot grounds!
Fun for all ages. This was a fantastic water park. Our youngest was amused for hours in the kiddie area while the rest of us enjoyed the grown up rides. Perfect for a hot HOT day.
Dubai Tour. It is fun filled experience at wild wadi water park. rides are chilling and thrilling with all safety norms. we enjoyed a lot.

GREAT DAY OUT AND THRILLING. You must visit this place when you are n Dubai. What a fab place even for an oldie like me !!!!!!!! This is an excellent day out and you can stay all day in the water park. They have the best rides ever. So if you are a thrill seeker, this s the place!

Great fun but you'll spend a wad(i) of cash. There is something for everyone here. The rides are graded by how scary they are and then there is also the "beach" area where you can lounge or swim in the water, and the "river" which flows gently round the park. The waves in the river and the beach use to be quite vigorous and exciting but sadly they have toned them down in recent times. Probably the most spectacular and impressive water park I have ever been to (going to give Atlantis a visit next time though so this might change), partly because you don't just go down but on some of the rides you are carried uphill in the water too. However, it is really expensive- both to get in and to spend any money there. I would recommend timing your visit between meals because the food isn't even any good- standard fast food fare. Sometimes have to queue for 30mins for some of the rides but a really fun day out nonetheless. They are very efficient at the entrance so despite going on a very busy day we didn't have to queue to enter.Overall it is worth the cash because if you are reading this then it is probably not something you get to do every day.

Great day out!. My first experience of a water park, and defiantly going to be unforgettable.
Rides are fabulous, defiantly get the adrenalin going, ques aren't long. It's clean and is a fabulous day out!

Great fun. Having teenage children we've been to a few water parks over the years. Wild Wadi water park was the best organised and we found value for money. The park opens at 10 am and we arrived around 9:50. There was no waiting, you purchase your ticket and get and electronic arm band that you can charge up with money for purchases, a great idea. The park was relatively quite and we went on many rides humorous times. There are only several rides suitable for teenagers, which was ok for us. There was a lot of chairs in shaded areas and the food outlets were the usual. Everyone was friendly except for the stick on tattoo kiosk staff member. We did only stay half the day but had a great time.

Wild Wadi suits young and old alike. We were staying in the JBH so we had free entry to the Wild Wadi. We went in every day as soon as it opened and we went on all the slides, chutes etc I loved it. What I didnt particularly like was when my daughter kept asking if the rides were safe for Grannies!!! Wild Wadi was clean very well supervised and there were plenty of life guards on hand. Would recommend Wild Wadi

Cool, clean, safe, and fun!. Wild Wadi is a great waterpark right in the heart of Dubai and only minutes from the Mall of the Emirates. We chose to visit as a fun family outing for my teen son's birthday. As we have already visited a couple of other waterparks in the emirates, he chose this one as a way of trying something new. Although we initially planned to arrive at opening, we had a slow start and after the drive from Al Ain arrived about two hours after opening. I expected to find a long line at entrance, difficulty finding available loungers and long lines at the rides as well. The first two did NOT happen and the lines for the rides were long, but not unbearable. Our only complaint was the number of older, hairy and potbellied men wearing Speedos. Of course, the park has no control over that, but it was uncomfortable for us with my 6yr old daughter constantly pointing and commenting. Surprisingly, though, there were not as many bikini-clad women to the dismay of my teen son, the birthday boy.
enjoy it most times of the year. amusing location & water part , high safety standards , friendly staff , always updated with new theme , good value for money especially for families

Still as good as ever!. Clean and safe water park - benefits of staying in a Jumeirah property is free entry. Plenty of sun beds, food reasonable price and cooked to order so not luke warm and stale like some fast food outlets in UK.Plenty of water rides and lovely wave pool to keep cool in heat.Got to be on anyones list to come back to over and over again.
good fun. Staying at the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray hotel, you get free access to the park. Great fun but would be really enjoyed by kids. Had a great time and felt like a kid again. Loved it
Excellent Water Park. Worth a visit - you will not be bored, the rides are what you make of them, catering for your entertainment - gentle to wild.................perfect day out from Shopping!!!!!

The best place to avoid the Heat. we were here for four days in super hot August so wild wadi was an oasis of fresh breeze. i only tried the lazy river and the pool that were super. the wave pool was cold so you can cool of from the 42C+ that Dubai had when we were there and the lazy river was just perfect a little warmer and more comfortable . i did not try the rides as i had a surgery few months ago but my nephew did and loved it ...

So good. This is a brilliant water park. We also went to Atlantis on the Palm which also has to be experienced but the wild wadi is more compact and there is much less climbing of stairs. The water blasts are amazing and propel you up hill. So much fun.

Only a few waterslides, a major disappointment.. I had expected everything in Dubai to be the biggest and the best. What a major disappointment this place was. Wet n Wild on the Gold Coast is so much bigger and the waterslides so much better....They have two identical speedslides, with a trapdoor. Thats kinda fun. But the ride is not as high as others I have been on. There is two raft slides. One slightly more adventurous than the other. They were both good. Apart from that, there was just the slide river thingo that went around the outkirts of the park. It was OK, but not thrilling. I found the place boring, and left after 2 hours. Not enough variety. The park was very small. And I think the entry fee converted to about $70-$80 AUD - so its definately not cheap.
Wild and Wet. Fantastic! The kids loved it and it is a great way to cool down on a hot day. The place is not cheap but then what is in Dubai? A great day and highly recommended
Refreshing & Thrilling Venue. A nice and large water fun venue of dubai....It has got some of the thrilling rides and very well maintained ambiance..

Keep your cool. Wild Wadi has the handle on want you are looking for in our long extra hot summers. The walkways are not only shaded but also spray you while you walk and most of the rides whip you up on a jet of water rather than walking up steps. The few that do require you to walk up have staircases built like wind towers to keep you cool. A much "cooler" experience than Atlantis!

Cool way to cool off!. Had a great day at Wild Wadi with my fiancée, really enjoyed having the chance to try the flow ride a couple of times and all the other rides were very good. Staff were very friendly and helpful throughout which is an abiding memory of our trip and the rides were all very exciting. Felt it was relatively expensive for what it was worth, would expect it could get busy which would put a downer on a day and felt there was potential for a few more rides. However, well worth a visit if you have a week in Dubai!Thought the bands with money on was a very good idea!

Great day out!. I visited Wild Wadi on 4th September 2013 - our hotel gave us a voucher for 30AED off the gate price, so we paid just over 200 AED each. Great variety of rides, didn't go on the Jumeirah Sceirah but a member of my family did and said it was excellent. My favourite ride had to be Master Blasters - where jets propel you up a serious of different slides - a really different and exciting ride, I went on it three times! The longest we had to wait for a ride was 10 minutes, as the park was quiet (we arrvied at 10am), but as midday approached, the park understandably got busier. We paid 25AED for a refillable bottle for soft drinks, and you have to pay a further 5AED each time you want to refill it. Good selection of food outlets, although we only tried the snow cones (10AED each). Everything is paid for via a "watch" that is loaded with money and is scanned when you purchase something. Plenty of photographers throughout the park taking photos aswell but pricey.One problem we encountered on our day at Wild Wadi was a hydrant-type sprinkler which was on the high footpath just behind our sun loungers. It burst and water sprayed about 10 feet into the air, which soaked all of our towels and belongings. However, security came over instantly and we very helpful and reassuring, giving us new towels from the Jumeirah Beach hotel.We didn't go to Aquaventure in Atlantis, so I couldn't comment as to which waterpark is better - but Wild Wadi seems to be the better choice based on other reviews and what the locals say!

Just Brilliant!. Spent a great day here which was complementary as we were staying at the Jumeriah Beach Hotel. We loved the rides which were perfect - even the Scheriah wasn't too bad. Very clean and fantastic staff.

Great for the kids. The place looked fantastic but quite frankly we left from the crowds the lines were horrific and of course the 48 degree heat made it even more unbearable to be at. Had it been quite would have been fun for the kids

Nice Water Park. I went with my family including children and we like water activities. We spent most of the day there. Outside beverage and food are not allowed. There are crowded people since the season was at the peak. The price is quite expensive. In general, I recommend to visit it.

Chilled Out Water Park. Wild Wadi is a relaxed family orientated water park with a little of everything for everyone - from a flume where the floor drops out to a lazy river ride and everything in between. The wristbands that operate lockers and can be charged up with cash for the day ate a great idea. There are plenty of places to take time out or grab a snack or drink. Its very clean and the floors are sprayed with water so bearable underfoot in sun. There is plenty of shade so the worry of burning is alleviated. A great half day out.

Wild Wadi Is Amazing! Limited rides but FUN!. Jumeirah Sceirah is AWESOME!! By far the best water ride ive ever done!! They also have these tube rides that connect to other tube rides all over the park which are awesome!!! The water shoots you up and pushes you UP slides!! Thats about it though. they have some lazy rivers, few tube rides, the Sceirah and 2 other big tube rides that are fun.. Its a great park and well worth a visit or 2!

If you love a good water park, go here!. Loved wild wadi! I went on a ladies night when it was cooler, I love fast flumes, and I would recommend the one where the floor disappears beneath you, very thrilling! There are also some lazy rivers which are relaxing, but if you want anything (food etc) you have to pay a lot extra.

Very strict. I believe in SAFETY but not to the extent that Wild Wadi does! I found myself -- while visiting along with my child who is just over 2 1/2 years -- limited only to three areas: the boring slow river, the children playground/slides, and the beach (shallow area only!). We were denied in other areas/slides. Can't there be a solution where parents can enjoy some of the big rides along with their little ones? Like a small vest which can be strapped to a parent's body or something.
WOW. Cool! A section for the kids to play in safe and fun! Lots for older kids 8-whatever scary rides, slow rides, spinning rides, surfing rides so much fun I loved it!

GREAT WATER PARK. Great water park for all the family, It's a fantastic location on the beach, with a great view of the Burj Al Arab.Can get very busy but it's worth it.The family loved the place.......
My favorite fun place. Even I'm over 30 yo but in Wild Wadi I feel I am younger :) and can play the whole day like a little boy. I really like the games there & will not stop visiting.

A Ton of Fun!. Wild Wadi is a MUST when visiting Dubai.. We were only there for 2 nights, but don't regret spending a full day at this water park. It is the most fun we've ever had at an amusement park. Great for kids of all ages. No cash money needed, money gets loaded onto waterproof watches which can be used for the locker facilities and for buying food. Definitely a must for anyone going to Dubai who enjoys spending time in the sun.
Relaxing. Finding time is always difficult in Dubai so much to see and do, when shopping is over spend a couple of hours in Wadi Park come out refreshed, the only thing I disliked was leaving........

My trip. It was good , fun , comfort , safe and very busy.\The Dubai Wild Wadi Waterpark opens daily at 11am, but has different closing hours throughout the year. In January, February, November and December it closes at 6pm, while in March, April, May, September and October it closes at 7pm. During the summer months (June, July and August), Wild Wadi closes at 9pm and Thursday is an women's only day.

Fun time. We had complimentary access to Wild Wadi through our hotel. We found the layout slightly confusing when we first got there. It took us a while to work out that the 'river' type rides all merge into one, you can just get on and off in different places. The kids(11 & 8) and my husband went on the Jumeirah Sceirah - they loved it and are braver than me. We nipped out to the Wave hotel for lunch - which meant we could get out of the sun for a bit. Good time had by all - but next time we would give one of the other water parks a go.

fun filled day. We were 2 adults and 2 teenage boys and by using our vouchers from The Entertainer it made it a very cheap day out. Never saw the boys all day as there was more than enough rides to keep them occupied which gave us time to relax. We found a great area of loungers on an upper tier above one of the poolside shops, it was overlooking the Burg al arab and very secluded, only saw a few other people up there the whole day. Brilliant day had by all and far more rides than Aquaventure plus the food outlets were far more reasonable with water stations to top up your drinks bottles dotted around the park.

Glad it was free entry. We spent an afternoon at Wild Wadi as we had complimentary access from our resort. Not a wide selection of water rides for adults, we went to Yas Waterworld the week before and much preferred it there. Would have been disappointed if I had to pay an entrance fee!
Fantastic for kids and adults. Great for kids and adults staying at our hotel we had free access all the time. Not enough time was the only thing to dislike
Amazing watterpark. If you go to dubai go to this watterpark. Its in front of Burj Al Arab and its worth the money. Amazing fast rides...
very good but atlantis is somthing else. its a very good water park on its kind but atlantis is something else and more fresh than wild wadi , the only advantage of wild wadi is its cheaper !

Fun day out!. Great place for children and adults alike. I took my nieces and nephew and they loved it. They were happy to hang out there all day. Diverse range of rides and a lazy river for those who are to scared to attempt the more daring rides. Cost of entry is a little steep but the kids rated this one of the best attractions so therefore it was worth it.
Too busy. It was an experience, the rides are different but it was just far too busy and hot for comfort, we only stayed for half an hour. We preferred the Atlantis water park.
A JOY Ride. Must visit this water park if You are in Dubai. It is located near magnificent Burj Al arab. From any where in Dubai you can reach in 30 Min. I enjoyed all rides .
Family. Great adventure for family and kis combining bitween fun and chill, time to relax and have swim with the sharks

a great time for enjoy. one of the great waterpark in the world, eventhough qouite crowded with the people coming from arround the world, but a lot of fun can do in this water park. all ages can enjoy this very good theme park, wild wadi very awesome for me....it cool and great....

Wild wadi. Great theme park... Lots of fun... went during the holidays . it was very busy with long queues. good system where you load your money onto your wrist band . and you use the wrist band to pay. you are refunded with the balance tthats not used.
must go place in Dubai. I liked this water park, especially it has a very nice burj al arab view.. food was not good and it is very crowded in weekends but in weekdays it is so good.

fab fun. Well organised water park with lots of rides. It even has elevator water rides so you don't have to climb too many stairs, luxury! Queues moved fairly quickly. Range of rides catered for all ages. Quite expensive to buy food and drink, mostly fast food options.

Wild Wadi - Family fun in Dubai. Wonderful theme park to enjoy the day. It has artificial surfing which was greatest fun to do.
Then from wild wadi we had a awesome view of Burj al Arab.... waoooo
Nice but usually crowded. It is not bad but Atlantis is much better and bigger. Wald wadi is little bit old now and usually crowded

Wonderful time!. When I visited dxb, I tried this water park wild wadi and I am so glad that I did ! All water rides are connected and you can just lay in your tube while you are being pushed from one ride to another! Helpful staff! One of my most favourite places in dxb!

Wild Wadi. regardless of where you are from in the world and what ever language you speak , Wild Wadi water park fun is international , no need to carry cash just wear the waterproof token topped up at entry to electronically pay for food and lockers and just explore the miriad of water parks slides surfing and fun for all ages from babies to grandma's. Up on the main water slide the view of Dubai and the Burj Al Arab and the Madinat is supreme

Great fun for all!. This great water park has probably the longest and most fun water ride I've ever been on ... around 10 minutes. Water jets shoot you upwards, then you ride down flumes before being propelled back up again, eventually settling in the lazy river (wild wadi!) :)
Fun for all ages. Had 24hrs in Dubai this was the highlight great views from the slides all rides were smooth and fun all good not extremely big like in Q/Land but all up pretty good a must see

When adults play. This is the fun time you were looking for. Avoid going in public holidays as it get pretty crowded. And if you're non-Muslim lady, don't go to the ladies only duration or they'll charge you the normal full day fee for few hours access. The place is spacious and filled with great attractions, my favorite is the surfboarding. Great for friends outings, families, and kids.

Fun. A nice place to get wet and excitment. Close early in thursday at 6 O'clock, as Ladies only night start from 8 to midnight, which was anouing to us. We were in Abu dabi Yas waterpark which was bigger and more recent. there were also a place called Dreamland aquapark but we did not go. Last visit we enjoyed staying in Atlantis when you can have all the waterpark for free :)

Relief from the Summer Heat. We spent just over 7 hours at Wild Wadi and felt like we managed to squeeze in every ride. With lifeguards every 20 meters and far more rules and Acquaventure you got the feeling of being safe and we had no reason to question that.Wild Wadi was most definitely busier than Acquaventure with us waiting up to 45 minutes in some lines to experience the slide, but this was self-inflicted as we had already experienced the slide and wanted to go back again when it was busier.There are short-cuts for some lines like renting a Cabana, though a very expensive short-cut.It would have been nice to see more tubes available at some of the entry/exit points around the slides, instead of forcing people to return to the bottom just to start riding some of the master blasters.The food outlets around Wild Wadi were a little disappointing though, as was the quality of food served.
Just average!. I didnt enjoy the water park much, I didnt feel their were many rides and it was far too busy and hot!
OMG AMAZING FOR ADULTS!!. My hubby and I spent our second wedding anniversary having an absolute blast here! Totally recommend. Bring your own towels, we spend £20 to buy on as none on rent!

It was OK. Having visited lots of waterparks, this was OK, but nothing more. Atlantis on the Palm was better. Ones in Florida are better still. The Lazy rivers could do with being a bit faster, they are just too..... lazy! Would be better with more rides too.

Amazing New Jumeirah Scarer. My daughter loves wild wadi and if a guest at JBH 2 minutes to the entrance which is fantastic, my daughter and husband tried the flow rider it was fab and we all had a fish pedicure again fantastic. An amazing day.

Very,very busy. We opted for Wild Wadi because we had read there was more variety. I couldn't believe how heaving it was midweek, so many people which meant large queues for everything. An experience worsened by the fact that the little kids' river ride was closed for almost 2 hours whilst the staff searched for some kid's poop. Seriously - they should enforce a swim nappy rule - totally gross.Other rides were fun, there was a large wave pool, kiddy playground, and many more fun tyre rides.

Wild Wadi. A great family day out. No need to book online- you can pitch up for the same price. Quick entry to the park, with loads of kiosks and no queues. No more expensive than other similar attractions. Loads of staff on hand to help with directions, questions etc. Cashless environment: You pay for lunch and purchases by charging up a cash wristband. Venue restaurants were the usual junk food style, but service was excellent

Wipes the floor with Atlantis.. In April 2010 and 2011, we went to Atlantis and never bothered with Wild Wadi. We loved Atlantis but after going to Wild Wadi this year, there's no competition. Wild Wadi wins hands down. On the Monday we went to Wild Wadi, and on the Thursday we went to Atlantis. Me and my dad arrived at Wild Wadi at about 10am and was greeted by a very happy and friendly member of staff who explained to us how the lockers worked, where to get towels, how the wrist bands work etc. We then went straight for the rides. I absolutely loved all of them, particularly the water jets that send you uphill which was quite a strange sensation. I appogise that I don't know the names, but I loved the two large waterslides where 2-4 people can ride at once. The best ride, though, was the Jumeirah Sceirah. World class. Before coming to the waterpark, my father and I were concerned about burning our feet on the floor considering the heat outside in the summer (46C). Our fears were soon relieved as the management have obviously taken the heat into consideration which is more than what can be said for Atlantis. At Wild Wadi, they had a sprinkler system which kept the floor wet and therefore cool on your feet. At Atlantis, I have never felt so much pain in my life. They didn't bother to do anything.Thank you Wild Wadi!

Excellent fun, You cant miss this!. Let me start off by saying that this water park is just the best! Much better than the Atlantis (dont get me wrong Atlantis is still nice but thats another review Wild Wadi is like 100x more fun with more rides!!!). I went to Wild Wadi in August and I went on a friday as the park was open from 10am to 10pm but I think those times are for the summer only double check on their website before going because honestly you need at least a day to proper enjoy yourself here. The price is AED265 which is around £50 and then a small locker is AED60 which is around £10. Expensive yes. The food was lovely you can see from my pics what we had, I can't remember how much food was again but water was always between AED10-13 which is expensive, just be ready cause nothing inside is cheap. I remember reading reviews about no cash is allowed when paying for things inside the park thats a lie, you can bring cash with you but they also offer an option where they give you a wristband which can be loaded with money at the entrance so you can spend around the park each to their own really. No food or drinks are allowed to be brought inside the water park they will search your bags and remove those items so be warned.Where the photoshop is on the right hand side there are these stairs that will take you to the top where you will get an amazing view of the Burj Al Arab and take some great pics, there are sun beds up there so you can relax and enjoy the Dubai atmosphere. (amazing)There are rides for all age groups no doubt from thrilling rides to relaxing chilled ones. I found the water park very clean the staff was 5 stars so helpful one guy even went around the park with us all over to take pics for us that we then purchased in the photoshop with a cute Wild Wadi Frame. The staff really make this place so much fun. The Queuing up system is well done, it goes really fast just talk with family have a conversation and before you know it you'll be going on the ride. And for me I found that I couldn't walk around the park barefooted its just so hot the concrete floor next to the restaurants so have your flip flops at hand :) Its an amazing water park, go because honestly you wont be disappointed ! :)

Great!. A great waterpark. Plenty to do, rides never boring. Late night on a Friday, ladies night on a Thursday. Expensive to get in and to get food etc. Recommend you buy a re usable plastic flask from any of the food outlets, you can get all day refils for 5 Dhms at a time.

Fun day out. We stayed in the Jumeriah complex, so the water park is free to come in and out. We love the big rings, at the back, you can fit 4-6 people on, and you really think you will go over the edge. The rings are fabulous, you jump on at the lazy river and catapulted up by a jet, then whirl up and down around the rides. So no climbing with rings up the stairs the jets do it all for you. We have been several times, the no thing hi need to queue for is the surfing, but ou are on holiday, so it's to a big deal.

Great water park and great life guards. We (family with two children 8 and 11) always have a very good time in that water park. Good idea is to still come really early at 10 AM so the park is still empty. The water park lifeguard team is always in a good mood. I like to specially mention Caroline from Kenya. She always spreads good mood and my children are always crazy to see her. Thank you.

Excellent fun for younger kids. Our four year old loves Wild Wadi. Guaranteed fun. I witnessed a life guard training session - at least I assumed it was a training session. It was in the wave pool - suddenly one of the life guards shouted and jumped in the deep end and grabbed a guy and started to swim to the side; when all the other life guards started to laugh - so I assumed it was a new life guard and a training session. For me it was great, I was completely re-assured that we were all safe.
Great Day Out. Best water park - ever. Done loads in USA but this one takes the biscuit. Allocate a day to it - you won't be disappointed....

Awesome!. Wild Wadi was wild!! This place is a must for any new visitor to Dubai. The rides are amazing and the wait times are bearable. Price is a bit steeper than Aquaventure but it is well worth it.

Good day out. Rides are very good... when they don't suddenly stop in the middle of your ride! Queues for some rides are long and the heat can get a bit too much! The staff are helpful but some are very rude and picky! My older daughter took my six year old in the play park part and was told she couldn't go on the slides with her sister yet several other siblings around the same ages had been down the slide plenty of times with out a second thought! Disgraceful!

What a great day out. Had a great day here- opens at 10 am and closes at 8 pm. Very family orientated. Something for everyone. We had BOGOF vouchers. Take your own towels. Food etc....can be bought from different locations paid for from a prepaid wrist tag. Loved the wave pool & huge bucket.

Great Fun for everybody. Have been at Wild Wadi towards the end of school holidays with family and friends of my kids.Personally think that Wild Wadi is the best aqua park in the UAE, if you have younger children. Good location, attraction for every age, no long queues and enough space.Wild Wadi offers a variety from really thrilling rides to gentle streams and a great children water play area. With this Wild Wadi has the perfect balance. The wave rides are also very nice and exciting.There is no VIP access to the rides in Wild Wadi. I like this. Hence there is only one queue and not a queue for normal tickets and a queue for fast access / VIP ticket holders. Even normal tickets are expensive enough. Using vouchers from the Entertainer book is key if you do not go alone to Wild Wadi.I also like some other smaller points like covered free parking area, no long walk from parking to Wild Wadi, no long queues to get tickets or for the rides and a convenient drop-off zone for the family to name a few.There are only two downsides.- Hygiene is decreasing. One can see more people wearing street clothes in the pool. Should not happen but there are more and more people enjoying swimming in Wild Wadi in shorts and t-shirts or long skirts. Even worse there are babies with normal diapers splashing around in the child area. Pool attendants / life guards do not care.- Food as always: double price and half the quality of McDonalds with long waiting times.
Honeymooners. Fabulous no complaints at all. Brilliant fun with the hubbie. Slow river was my fave where as the extreme slide was hubbies

Pretty average. We went here in mid august. There isnt much available for younger children only one play area and the wave pool. The rides are quite good. The men have a serious staring problem so it can be quite uncomfortable me and my sister bought a tshirt and shorts from their shop which cost £40 each. Get in as many photos as possible as you can purchase the whole days photos on a usb at the end of the day max 50 so its good to have lots of pics. Wouldnt go here again as there are better waterparks in Europe.
wild wadi park kids love it. wild wadi park,kids love it,me too, take sunset shots of the Burj Al Arab hotel,great experience,visit marina too,drive with metro etc,.

very clean. not the best water park we have been to most rides a bit slow, two or three pretty good, queues none existence ,food not that expensive, free parking , got 2 bogof vouchers of out of the entertainer book saved £80,book only cost 55,plenty more voucher worth using aswell
Fabulous!!!. It's worth a visit and the fact that it was included as a free entry in the hotel stay is a refreshing change!!

Kids loved it. We went during Ramadan weekday in the evening so it was not too crowded. The rides were great and from most of them you could view Burj al Arab lighted up so it was extremely pretty to see it so close.

Great waterpark, very clever design and great slides!. Have just spent the day here at Wild Wadi Waterpark and it was great fun!Entry cost was around £50 (AED265) which is a little pricey but considering what you get for your money, the location and the service it's well worth it my book.The park is very cleverly designed with a series of uphill slides which you can ride on up towards the bigger slides or just enjoy the ride as they're pretty rapid themselves with very powerful water jets sending you shooting up the slides on tubes or dinghies. There are also some bigger slide attractions which are AWESOME in comparison to waterparks in Europe!For cooling down there is a large chilled swimming/paddling/wave pool with lots of sunbeds etc and life vests everywhere for those who are not confident in water. It slopes in from a beach style entry to around 2m deep.Lots of stalls are dotted around which serve drinks, slushies, ice cream and such like.... Don't worry about cash getting wet, you are given a smart wristband which can be loaded with digital money at the entrance or one of the main shops! Very handy as you just swipe your wristband and voila :-)Overall, I'd have to say it's 9/10!

Great day .. This is an excellent water park lots of fun, well laid out. Having also been to the more exclusive ..and expensive water park at The Atlantis hotel Queue are sometime unavoidable but lots of pleasant areas to enjoy the sunshine and spend the whole day there .A good mix of rides for fun and fear !! Always be aware of restrictions during Ramadan doesn't present any problem so long as you respect it .

Magical Time. Spend a whole day here. You'll need to. It beats most water parks. Queues were at a minimum and the staff were quite exceptional. Anybody standing waist-high in water for hours yet still managing to keep smiling and being so friendly, now that takes a lot! Food a bit pricey but you are guaranteed the sunshine and warmth. For a fabulous family day out you'd need to be made of stone not to come away with a smile from this place.
Just fun with kids. This water park is very close to the Hotel Burj al Arab and Madinat Jumeirah. The entrance fee is expensive with two kids. But it's just fun to go there.

Escape the heat at Wild Wadi. After two days of sweltering it out on the beach or hiding in malls, we decided to head to wild wadi waterpark....the best place to be when its hot, the park is perfectly designed to enjoy the warm weather without over heating, the walkways are kept cool with fountains, the queues are all undercover and the rides are fantastic.

Okay. I agree with some of the other reviews ,it was much too expensive to just get in there. My sister and dad like the scary rides so they went on one but they had to queue for ages! Me and my mum went in the kiddie pool and slide area however there were more adults than kids! It was quite fun until I realised the dirt.I went on a scarier ride which did take ages but was worth the wait!! I felt as if I was going to fall out but realised it was safe. The food was not cheap and was tasteless and the staff was exceptionally rude. However I did like the swimming pool. I think that it needs to be cleaner and cheaper; if it was I would've enjoyed myself more.
Nice day out. I liked more this water park than one at Atlantis. This is older but to me more interesting rides and plan of the park is more practical.
a very interesting WaterPark. it is crowded on weekend, so try to visit it on weekdays.They have a new excited rides.you can book online to avoid queu

My top pick for UAE waterparks: a comparative review of all six. Which of the UAE waterparks is best? This is my opinion:1. Wild Wadi: has the best selection of rides in my opinion: the fastest, biggest thrill rides. Very compact park with a definite focus on the rides as opposed to general ‘just being in water’ experience. Enjoy sitting in your rubber ring and being shot up & down along the fun ‘routes’ as well as some great individual and group ‘high thrill’ rides. Must be older kids/adults to fully appreciate. 2. Aquaventure: a more beautiful park than Wild Wadi with a good selection of rides though a little tamer. Massive fish/shark tank with some rides based around this. Access to beach with gorgeous views is a bonus. Can easily spend the whole day here as there’s enough to do. Suitable for all ages. We’ve taken parents, pregnant friends and kids along to Aquaventure as there are gentler rides for them to enjoy. 3. Yas Waterworld: Yas has a cheesy theme running throughout the park (‘the legend of the lost pearl’) but at least that keeps you entertained when queuing to get in. I'd say the rides are better than Wild Wadi and there is incredible attention to detail but what lets this park down are the enormous queues. You can supposedly jump these with a rather expensive VIP pass though I gather even then you will be queuing for some time. It's only been open since December 2012 so perhaps when the novelty wears off and it becomes a little quieter will it supersede Wild Wadi as top waterpark experience. A friend went on ladies’ night which sounded chaotic: women with iPads arguing because attendants would not allow them on the flumes with them!4. Dreamland Aqua Park: if you have kids under 6 years old, this is your top pick with lots of child-friendly water play areas and water-based entertainment. No particularly innovative or thrill-seeking rides, but great for a young-family visit especially if a couple of the adults can escape every now again to explore the bigger rides. Head to one of the above parks if you have older kids/adults.5. Iceland: got a fun penguin theme running throughout the park. Some enjoyable and original rides but go with an even number of people as all the fun rides are geared to pairs. Park is a little hard to get around, especially in the summer heat when the water is also a bit too warm for comfort. Lots of boisterous lads splashing around. The park is strangely set around football pitches which remain full of lads all day. There was a weight limit of 80kg on one of the big rides and stewards were actively weighing people and turning them away. A minimum height 1.2m is enforced on a number of the rides so if you have daring but shorter kids, go elsewhere as they may be disappointed (a couple of cute girls were turned away but at least able to skip the queue to the ride next door)6. Wadi Adventure (Al Ain): great (but expensive!) for surfing, kayaking, water rafting. Has an ‘air park’ too. Need to specifically want to do these watersports as opposed to spend a fun family/friends day out. See my July 2012 review on this waterpark. We’ve had a fun time at each waterpark for different reasons, but ultimately this is how I’d rank them even though there’s not much in it with the top 3. Expect queues at the top three parks on the weekends. Quieter during the weeks (Sunday - Thursdays) and during ramadan.Tip 1: Food is similar at all: deep fat fried cuisine. Make sure you credit your wristband at the entrance to save you from carrying around wet cash. Any unspent monies will be reimbursed at the kiosks or shops by the exits.Tip 2: SAVE CASH: With the Family Entertainer (395AED from supermarkets and book stores), you will get ‘buy one get one free’ vouchers for Aquaventure, Yas Waterworld, Wild Wadi and Dreamland. Considering entry is 225AED+ per adult, this is totally worth the investment, even if you are just visiting on holiday. Remember that the Entertainer itself will save you 100aed’s on so many other attractions/restaurants/snacketarias.Tip 3: Take flip flops! The ground can get very hot especially in the summer months. All the rides have storage spaces for your footwear and even though you may need to detour a little to reunite yourself with your shoes, it will save your feet in the long run.Hope this helps you make a decision on which one(s) to go to!

disappointed.... having read that this was the best waterpark of the major 3 around Dubai, we were disappointed at the Wild Wadi...we enjoyed the rides that were there, but it just seemed quite small - especially for the price...we were left wishing it was more like the Aquopolis in Salou, or Orlandos water parks ...On the plus side, it was safe, and well run, and I think it worked well for people as a first waterpark...so dont let us put you off ,as Im sure you will enjoy it, but dont expect a massive park.
A fun day out. Decent value for money and love the idea of travelling uphill on water rides. A great day out and well loved by everyone

brilliant. We absolutely loved this place loved the uphill slides and just floating around the river on my tube, but the kids loved the faster rides. There's quite a few people about but the queues are faster.. You definitely need lots of sun block as it can get steaming hot out there, and you need your flip-flops as the ground gets so hot it can burn your feet. The views of the Al-Arab 7 star hotel were just absolutely spectacular! Definitely go there if you have a spare day. A great water park and a really great experience.

Conveniently Located on jumeirah Beach Road next to The Burj Al Arab. A good day out, full of thrills and spills. This attraction gets very busy and is a little limited for space, it can also get very hot during the summer months not only because it is enclosed but also the heat radiation etc. Some great photo opportunities inside with the Burj Al Arab in the background. Great fun for teenagers most of the time but for younger family (under say 10 years old) I would recommend visiting on work days (Sunday to Thursday inclusive) as it is generally less busy apart from school holidays. Can be quite noisy inside when busy.

Gone downhill. This place has gone very downhill.A number of places around the park smelt very bad. The crowds were just too much with people brushing you on rides and in your privacy space. Jumeriah really need to sort this place out
Ok if you like waterparks. We visited the park for free as we were staying at a Jumeirah hotel. The staff are really helpful but we had to queue for over an hour in 40 degrees for one ride.

Brilliant fun !!. Took my teenage sons to Wild Wadi we all had terrific fun. Loved the rides although probably did cause serious embarassment to the children by my screams !! Good thinking behind the wristband idea and not having to carry money. A good day out to be recommended. We went early in the week and arrived at 10am perfect no queuing for the rides !!
Busy Place. Be prepared to wait for some of the attractions available as it can try the patience a little. The surf pool is hilarious.

Disappointing. After staying at Atlantis in 2011 and using Aquaventure we were overall disappointed with Wild Wadi. We stayed at Jumeirah Beach so had free access, one of the few plus points was the entry from the hotel via their private entrance - very short queues. However that was about it, we found the park small, sunbed areas cramped and dirty, queues were very long (over an hour for some rides), loud music causing a lot of UAE youngsters to be even louder and the park just felt shabby compared to Aquaventure. The lazy river was very poor and although there are advertised 30 rides, a lot of those are a number of rides chained together.

Great rides - better than Atlantis. We went to Wild Wadi for the day and had a great day. We went with our 7 year old son and he thought the whole day was 'awesome'!!We paid to get in and they gave you a wrist band which worked the lockers. You could also load money onto another wrist band which was a great idea as this meant that you didn't need to carry cash around with you or keep going back to the lockers for cash. If you had money left on it at the end of your trip it was refunded to you.It had a very good selection of rides and lots of lifeguards all over the place. There is a bit of refurbishment and building work going on which is not disruptive but sometimes the signage is a bit lacking!The height restriction is only 1.1m so our son could go on all the rides. Some of them were quite scary and I felt that they could be a bit much for some young children, despite being tall enough. However, our little boy loved them. We didn't go on the biggest ride, which he was tall enough for, as we found out that he would have to go on it on his own in a single 'ring' and thought perhaps that would be too much. Just a personal choice.There is not as much seating as at Atlantis but we still found somewhere to put our things.There are also plenty of places to get something to eat and drink.They have a lazy river for the unadventurous and a wave pool. There are life jackets of all sizes hanging up in various places so you can just help yourself.There are photographers all over the place and they take lots of photos and then attach white strips to your wrists. The photos are worth having a look at as some of them are quite good. One guy was in the wave pool and got our little boy to go under the water and he took lots of shots which came out really well. In the end we took all the photos that were taken of all of us and put them on a cd. It was £50 which isn't cheap but if you get enough photos taken then it could be worth the money. We had a great day out and if we went back to Dubai we would definitely go back to Wild Wadi.

Probably Timing. Hubby, I and 2 girls 18 and 19 staying in the Mina A Salam had free access to Wild Wadi, this being one of the reasons we decided to stay at Mina, we stayed right after Ramadam, from 11th August. Eid was in full force and the hotels were full, which meant the waterpark was very busy, it was also full of locals and residents outside of UAE who had extended holidays, it seemed like everyone was at this waterpark, it was full, you couldnt move in the very small lazy river, it was full of people and empty rings, not a very relaxing experience. There are 2 slides which you walk up a small incline to get there then you have to leave your sunglasses on a shelve, climb loads of steps to come down the slides, which were great fun, but as my glasses are prescription sunglasses I found it a bit of a hassle getting out at the end of the slide, cant see much and then going all the way back up the incline to pick up my glasses. I tried both slides and then avoided these slides. The other slides, pushed you up the slide first, great fun, but almost an hour queue, with no shade, I was dying by the time I got on the slide, did this once. The wave pool was the only clean part of the park, but the waves took forever to be turned on. To be honest we only visited twice because it was just not that interesting, not clean in places and packed. It was too small for the amount of people in there, a little old fashioned and in need of a refurb, we couldnt even find an empty sunbed. We did get free towels but had nowhere to put them, we ended up putting them on a wall and hey ho when we returned they had gone! it's a good job the hotels dont record how many towels you take in. This waterpark is no way in league with the Atlantis waterpark. Perhaps, if we were to visit at another time of year outside of school holidays and Eid it would be more attractive and pleasant experience. My girls said it was ok but too small and too much waiting in queues.

Loooooooooooooooove it ! It's a must do in winter time.. Loooooooooooooooove it ! It's a must do in winter time. I recommend during the week. Weekend you're waiting too long grr.... but the pools are nice and prices ok for a Dubai attraction
Fun Day with older Children. Went to Wtaer park with my spouse and teenage children. All Rides there were really fun especially one named as Jumeriah suckhera

A Super Fun Day for All!. Went to Wild Wadi in June 2013. I arrived at 10am when the park opened and spent 6 hours. Apon arrival i bought my tickets from the counter outside (i had 2 for1 ticket from Entertainer book) was given a wrist band which also had money loaded on for food, drinks and locker rental. The wrist band is good as you dont need to carry money with you. Arriving early is a benefit as there are less waiting for rides. It was very hot when i went so regular sun cream application was essential. Food is more fast food with pizza, burgers and sandwiches available. Food bought as meal deals work out cheaper and each person can eat for £6-£7. Free water fountain are available around the park. The views from the waterpark are amazing as you can see a closeup of Jumeriah Beach, Jumeriah Beach Hotel and Burj Al Arab. Be sure to take a waterproof camera as pictures are expensive to buy. Also food and drink from outside is not allowed. Taxis are plentiful outside the park. A bus stop is also outside on the main road.Overall a good day out for children and adults. Arrive early when it is quiet and cooler.
Fun times. Kids & family loved it. Lovely time of year to go nice & warm. Service good. More seating would be good

very very expensive for what you get for your money. We went to the wild water park about 3 weeks ago. Although the park is ok ,its very small and cost almost 250 euro entry which is way to much for what you get.also some areas were quite dirty and equipment seemed to be broken.Park is a little dated it seems .we left after 30 mins would not go there again really not worth the money ,not enough slides .

The most fun I had this year.. Think my soul was craving the adrenaline rush that I got in this place. One of the highlights of my trip. Must do Jumeirah Scierah if you are an adrenaline junkie. Not many ride options thou. 12-13 in all excluding the ones for small kids. 4 of which are for surfing I guess.
Loads of fun on a hot day. A good way to cool down while having lots of fun. The Jumeirah Scarieh is a must for a good thrill. A bit on the expensive side but still a nice way to have some fun.

fun for all ages. We stayed at the hotel next door so we were able to get in for free. The water park is not as big as the ones we have back home in the states but since it was free I was not complaining. We mostly stayed at the kids area which was fine by me and my son and I enjoyed it.

Great day out. Great fun , would advise to get there early to get sunbed space as we got there for 11.00am and already most sun beds taken at the wave pool , but to be honest didn't matter as we spent most the time in the pool and rides, piece of advise though they do not care if you have your towel there they still take your sun bed so always put a bag or clothing on it aswell and then they think twice , and you don't have to worry about anyone taking you things as it is very safe and no one will steal from there, we left are hd camcorder and camera, wallet , phone ect. For over 30 minutes while we went on rides and nothing went missing and we didn't even feel like it would go missing .great day out with the kids go and enjoy
Needs a facelift. A very clean and well laid out water park,but it does get hot here so if you walk barefoot be warned.

Very well-run water park. The park had some really awesome rides and slides. Plenty of fun stuff for all ages. We went during the week and it wasn't too crowded.Wave pool is awesome.The water park is also very well run. The lifeguards are very kind and alert. It's very clean and comfortable as well.

You wouldn't get enough. I went there with my 4-year old kid. We could never stop playing.The place is very refreshing and fun. They also have good burgers. A must visit water park.To me, it is better than the Atlantis aquaventure since it has more varieties. The water is also cooler.
FUN FUN FUN. Great water park, lots of different rides and fun for a group of people. The lines are not too long so that's a good thing, but make sure you go when the weather is hot.

A good mix of water rides for all ages. Went to Wild Wadi on second day of Eid.Was the first few at the gate at opening hour. Best to go when it opens at 10am ti get to the rides without having to queue up for long.U can take the metro to mall of the emirates n then take a taxi frm there....abt 10dirhams thereabts taxi fare.Loved the "rollercoaster" series of waterslides where u r propelled by powerful water jets along a long series of slides around the park while u sit on a single tube.Had fun in the family rides, where 3-5 people can sit in a big float n slide down a series of water tubes.The wave pool was very cooling n we had fun soaking in the cold water on tht very hot afternoon.U can rent towels there too.Was told tht we cld get access to private beach nearby at a cost of 150dirhams! Looks like a great beach, very clean n clear waters.Foodwise a tad expensive but servings were generous. Tried their burger meals n nacho chips. Quite filling.Kids lived the mango sorbet! Really authentic n fresh!Changing room n toilets were clean.Lockers aplenty for rent.Even though it was a blistering hot day, the pathways were 'sprinkled' with water periodically by staff carrying huge bottled water containers. V thoughtful.After 12 noon, park got very crowded n long queues were common in all the rides.As we already had our fair share of the rides in the opening hour of the park, we just spent the day lazing ard by the wave pool n kids water playground.
The Best. Amazing the best water park we've ever been to the high rise family tube slides are the best and most thrilling.

Best so far. This is by far the best waterpark. In Paris with young and teenage children at the moment. The aqua boulevarde is not to be compared at all.. Wild wadi and ski dubai always a must for for family especially kids. Thumbs up

Fantastic Water Park. We were able to enter this water park foc as part of our hotel package at JBH....staff were fantastic, everything was very clean... rides were fantastic. Make sure you get a ring that is well inflated when doing the uphill rides.......
You don't wait to long in the lines!. Great experinence, many attractions! Very good place to go and enjoy the weather freshing up while you have lots of fun!
Always amazing. Wave pool lovely and cool.Some rides have sashes with their eats which if a child gets stuck can be scary.This needs to be looked at
Fantastic !. Best waterpark everrr...recommended for everyone! Fun rides, great stay at golden sands...wud defiantly go again.

Fun for adults and children. Fun for all of the family- all I will say is it was a bit if a struggle to get some sun beds, it really was packed. The rides are brilliant and there is something for everyone, there is a lot of fun to be had. All the staff are really friendly and professional in what they do. My younger sibling went missing, as soon as they realised we were panicking they shut all of the gates in and out if the water park and had a team search for him! He was back in 2 minutes flat!
Too expensive. The kids did enjoy this enjoy this but this can drain your pocket if you are more than 3 as was our case
Fun fun fun. We stayed at the Jumeriah beach hotel and the facilities at the water park are included. Great fun, great rides, clean and extremely helpful staff. Highly recommend to all ages.

Really Good Fun. Water park was really good fun and four hours passed in a flash! You are not permitted to take in water or food and this will be taken from you and returned at the end of the day. We had Entertainer vouchers which allowed buy one get one free and kept the costs down. The water park needs money spent on it as it looks tired and has a lack of relax areas. Having said this we still had a fun day!
Meh!. Not all its cracked up to be. Only 2-3 good rides and then a float along ride that goes basically all around the Park. Far too expensive as well as 45 euro each for entry.

Great water park!. This is a fantastic water park! lots of variety for all ages. exciting enough for adults too with one slide in particular only being for the brave! Very clean and not too badly priced. Easy to get to. Brilliant location with views of the burj al arab! I would definitely go back to this water park! I visited the atlantis in the Bahamas and I much preferred wild wadi! I would say it is on par with those water parks in florida too!

Great but way to busy!. I spent the day here with a friend and it was a very enjoyable! However, it was also very busy and it wasn't even peak season. It's a great day out if you don't mind being around lots of other people.

refreshing. it`s a good refreshing park. you can pass all your day in and take pleasure with your family or friends. Specially in summer time, it`s very hot but you will be refreshed immediately. Close to Burj Alarab, & Jumeirah Beach Hotel, you can enjoy your time. I propose to reserve your hotel in Jumeirah Beach Hotel, you will have an extraordinary stay and close to the attraction park.
Too family oriented. the park is way too crowded with families and you only have a couple of thrilling attractions for which you usually have to queue for ages. but it is still refreshing!
Fun place. Loved the rides. The Jumeirah Sceirah was wicked cool. Kids had loads of fun too. It was a great place to beat the Aug heat! Make sure to carry sunscreen, and hats/caps.

So much fun!. Rides avaliable for people of all tastes! The ride with the vertical drop was my favourite but very scary, not for faint hearted! Loved the trip. Great for families. Food avaliable also very good.Bring sandals or flip flops, floor gets very hot!

Brilliant - Although the staff could liven up a bit.... Went back to the water park for the 4th year running as part of the complimentary access by staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. All the rides were open except for one Flo Rida, which was no problem. The new Jumeirah Scerah is absolutely insane and must be tried at least once! The only downside is some of the staff and lifeguards stand there all day with long faces! A WaterPark is supposed to be fun and games... liven up a bit guys!

Busy Busy. Wild Wadi is a great place if you have kids. The waterpark has plenty of slides for all ages the kids area for the younger ones is great fun.Wave pool is good fun but keep an eye on the youngsters it is quite deep.The lifeguards are quite strict and take their job very seriously which can only be a good thing.If you're going at the weekend get there early to secure a Sunbed. If you can look for vouchers to cut down on the entry price also some of the hotels do deals on the admission rates which can be quite expensive for the whole family if not, but all in all a good day out. Food is that typical of this kind of attraction, burgers, hotdogs, chips the usual fast food fare. If you are thinking of taking your own food be warned they do search your bags on entry and confiscate food items so as you're forced to buy from them. Of course at inflated rates.

Fun and crazy rides. It was a day full of adventure at the Wild Wadi, the craziest one was for sure the Tantrum Alley, the quad tube ride! They say if you eat pizza with forks or safe remove your USB, don't go!! The staff were nice and facilities were convenient. The restaurants were a bit over priced, but that is the way it is!

Good way to spend a day. Our family spent the day here and really enjoyed it, although we preferred the Atlantis Waterpark at the Palm as it is cleaner and feels larger. Nonetheless, this is a great way to spend a hot day in Dubai and we found the queues reasonable (under 15 mins) throughout the day, although before 11am it was very quiet so this is definitely the time to go!The only other issue we had was with the drinking fountains ... only 1 worked and this became hot during the day so we had to pay for water which was priced at rip-off prices (although this is no different to Atlantis)!
Great time. I spent an afternoon here and it was a great way to relax and have some fun! Reasonably priced and lots of excitement for your money.

great few hours. Had lovely morning in Wild Wadi. Took my 22 month old Granddaughter and she had a lovely time. Have been many times before but this time it was very quiet and couldn't have been better.

Enjoyed. We went to wild wadi during Ramadan. Not much rush because of Ramadan, we were able to enjoy same ride 2-3 times. If you like thrill then try Jumeirah Sceirah, other rides are not as crazy. Other facilities like lockers, food and shop are good. Shop is little expensive, but that is true for all Dubai :-) You can definitely spend one day here.
Cooooool. We really had a fun-filled day at wild wadi.. Very affordable and the rides were really great.. Very clean sorroundings and friendly staff..

Lots of fun in the sun. Great rides and fab for young kids too..just make sure youre up for waiting in lines as the sometimes the wait can be upto 15-20 mins per ride..but all in all in this heat and humidity it is a blessing.!!

Treat the 40 deg heat with a afternoon at the park. We took our eight year old. It was a great afternoon at the park. Allow a half day at off season. No cues. You may have to allow for more time at other times of the year. It was a fun afternoon. Easy access from the Al Qsar. Take your thongs and some cash for a locker. If you plan to sit around and not get into the water there is no air conditioned areas. At40 deg this is not an option.
Absolutely fantastic park. Had lovely time here. So much to do for all ages. Came with a bunch of toddlers and older kids.In a nutshell, we all didn't want to leave. Lol

Really cool water park, but it misses some rad attractions. I certainly recommend the park if you have a free day in Dubai, but be aware that the ground gets really, really hot during summer, wear your flip flops!There are some cool attractions there but if you're looking for massive amounts of adrenaline you should set your expectations right.
Amusing and fun. This is a must if you a hotel guest as it's free. If you're not a hotel guest be prepared to pay a hefty enterance fee. We went 3 days in a row as hotel guests and well worth it.

great park. Loved this park but I do have to say the Atlantis water park is better. The difference being the Atlantis is newer and the slides are more adventurous. This park could do with being fixed up a little bit. but having said that if i had not been to the Atlantis park I wouldn't of said this was great.

Fun. Alot of rides to choose from. Tantrum Alley, Burj Surj and Jumeirah Sceirah being the top three. Amazing views of Burj Al Arab and the arabian sea. Good value for money. However at least one free meal and drink should be included in the ticket price

Impressive water park. Stayed at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel so had free access - this review is based upon not having to pay for entry.Best integrated water park I have been to - the rapids were mightily impressive allowing to travel almost the whole length of the park on elevated sections.Couple of 4 person rides, one of which was particularly scary - funnel type that is tilted so that it appears you are going to fall out onto the main road some 30m below (you have been warned !).The drop tunes had to be tried - quite extreme so I only had one go on those. You stand in a cylinder & the staff lock you in, then a 3-2-1 countdown & a trap door flies open & you go into freefall. Tube is completely enclosed so no danger of falling out.Kids loved the place, must have spent 3 half days & one full day here. On the full day paid for a Cabana - expensive but worth it in my view - very relaxing, waiter service & private entry / exit to the lazy river (which the rapid rides exit onto).Would definitely recommend - if having to pay entry would suggest early arrival & get a Cabana.Note/ Fri & Sat are late night - great fun to whiz around in the dark/reduced lighting on the rides....

Wave pool is the one. We had free entry so was great! Lots of slides the water is so nice and cool hardly any lines, staff are cheerful and friendly, great lunch time food worth going no matter the age I saw a 50 year old ish couple there having a great time on the slides!

Family fun :). Its a fun place, if u start compairing it with other places u can never have fun. Kids specially love surfing zones where they teach u basic lesson. We all love jumaira sukhaika which was a different ride. They enclose u in a chamber and then a door opened at ur feet and zoom u go, this is the tallest ride and was fun. We also like the raining zone and wave pool. I think when ur with family and water is around its always fun and u dont have to drive out of city

Great but needing some TLC. Great fun and all maximum height restriction 1.1 which is great compared to most theme parks. Wild wadi have added more rides in the last 6 years since I was last here but still think the Atlantis has the upper hand.
Really good & fun times. My 1st visit to a water park, lots of fun with friends. There's a lot of rides to get on,with good food & friendly staff.
Run down. Hardly any sun loungers and umbrellas. Park was a bit run down, although it has some great slides! I would go to aqua venture instead.

Lots of fun!. Staying at Mina A Salaam, we were given complimentary access to the water park. Definitely worth going, especially as our pool was closed for refurbishment. Try all of the rides, some are longer than the others, but worth trying all!
If you are used to US water parks you will be dissappointed.. This is a small, tired water park, with relatively few features. Feels overcrowded at peak times. Evening can be a good time to go.
Lovely and fun. I think this park personally was worth the money and really had lots of fun.i dislike the location because it was far from my hotel

Crowded. Despite the renovation, we feel Wild Wadi shows its age, may be due the lack of space compared to Aquaventure or Yas Waterworld. We are returning guest of both but probably not of the Wild Wadi. But it seems attracting a lot of adolescents, much more than the other two.
Best ever water park. Don't miss this experience. It is the best water park I've ever been to. I visited wild wadi more than 6 times and I have enjoyed it always.
A great waterworld. A great day out with the family and friends. With some new rides its a better than ever. Although a bit smaller than its rivals, but still one of the best.

Dubai´s best waterpark. A great way to spend a day! Skip some of the shopping malls in Dubai and enjoy this waterpark!You can be active on the slides or just enjoy the beach and the pools, great for families!
Fun by the bucket load. We spent a full day sliding, splashing and having a great time. The park is excellent value for money.

A little small but good for younger children. There are not that many rides but our children loved it and we spent about 6 hours there. Immediately next to the Juimerah Beach hotel and entrance is free if you are staying there.

Uphill Water - doesn't get better than that!. With free access from Jumeirah Beach hotel (or any of the Madinat Jumeirah hotels) this is a great extra to have as you can pop in and out as often as you like. Great water slides and fun for all ages! Love it.

Best water park I've been to. Totally recommend, loved loved it, so many rides, so much water so much fun, a deffo for all the family, we even took part I. The Guinness book of records biggest swimming lesson which was a fun experience. I would recommend take a pair of cheep flip flops with you as the floors can be a it rough, but over all lots of laughs and thrills where had by all

Best during the summer!. Been there today, It's summer and Its Ramadan so there were no queues and it was very quiet!Advice - Always get there for the 10am opening ( as Jumeriah Beach Hotel guest have access at 9am so theres always the best loungers being taken already)Make sure you add money onto your wrist band and remember your towels ( its Dhs30 each to hire)Get one of the refillable bottles Dhs60 as it works out cheaper than frequent drink purchases!
Awesome Day. Whether you have kids or not you must visit Wild WadiI loved the idea of not having to carry cash in the park. You pre loaded a wrist band and used that to pay for everything.

Best Waterpark ever!!. If you are staying at hotel jameirah beach you get to access this attraction for free. I didn't and paid for the day. It was great value for money and fun for all ages. The slides can push you up so you can (if you want) continue for a long time up and down slides. The park has a prime view of the Burj Arab, which set the scene beautifully. All slides end back in the lazy river, which was nice as you can go from one slide to the next without a queue. Loads of food available including fresh fruit and snow cones as well as more substantial food! The park has its own was of dealing with currency. Load all your cash on to a magnetic wrist band that you use to pay for things. This means your cash cant be stolen from your sunbeds when you go swimming nor do you have to fumble for cash whilst sopping wet. No charge for this and you can get back every penny you don't spend at the end. Great park, a trip to Dubai wouldn't be the same without it.

Awesome but quite old. The water park is really good and as too enjoying place for end users.. but for me in such modern city like dubai, this place requires upgrade for its rides and design. .. However its still one of the fun full time places to visit.
Great public water spa. There was something for everyone, even the on swimmers can get a fish spa done, washrooms were clean

Fun day out. The kids loved it, Not the cheapest day out but I loved the idea of not having to carry cash in the park. You pre loaded a wrist band and used that to pay for everything. Great idea. The park was busy but plenty of sunbeds and lots of great fun rides

Wild wadi turned out to be quite tame after all!. Highly overpriced at 235 AED, Wild Wadi is for those who have either grown tired of the sea or cannot go to the shores during the summer months. Go there if you have kids in your family coz most of the rides are meant for them. Pleasant surprises were Jumeriah Scleriah and Tantrum Alley. Check these out if you happen to visit.

Good fun. We were staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, so access to this park was complimentary to our family. Otherwise it is about £45 per person to get in. We went here every day apart from one during our week stay and really enjoyed the rides repeatedly. There aren't a ton of them, but our feeling was that there was more variety on offer than at Atlantis - we went there one morning and, quite frankly, found it a bit boring (on paper more rides, but all seemed the same). It was also a bit large, sizewise, and not as compact as Wild Wadi.

It's hot! So why not cool off. We had a great time here. Lots to do and so much fun. Plan to go for the day and don't waste your time hiring a towel like we did. It's so hot you don't need it. Also where cheap jandals it's so hot you don't want to walk around barefoot.

very enjoyable. i took a trip to wild wadi with my younger son earlier on this year while he was on a visit here, this park is set in one the most desirable scenic areas around. we went to the kiosk and were dealt with immediately and no fuss, the assistant asked if we wanted to load our tag with some money if we wanted to eat or drink in the park, (any amount can be exchanged for cash when you leave the park) upon entry we went to the changing rooms which we clean and comfortable. the first ride was the one my son had been talking about for a long time, the big one! so i went up the steps towards the starting point, upon arrival we were asked if we had any sharp buttons or toggles on our trunks. then i was asked to remove a gold chain i wear all the time, this is not considered suitable for the ride?
