entry to the platform had my heart beating in anticipation of what was about to happen, the thing that made it worse was some of the people that were at the top refused to go down the slide because of its height! so they had to walk embarrassed past the whole line of people waiting. i wasn't going to let this happen to me! so after a deep breath i walked into the loading capsule which was closed around me. there is a countdown to its release then the trap door collapses at your feet and you are on your way. the whole thing only lasts for about 8 seconds but feels a hell of a lot longer! i reached the bottom pit of water that slows you down and skimmed across the top of the water and slowed down to a halt, it was then that i took my second breath of the whole ride. oh and finally opened my eyes for the first time since the top! this is a spectacular ride but not one for the faint heart! there are many other rides in this park that are equally as much fun and i enjoyed most of them, even going up hill in water on a scenic tour around the outside of the park, the only one i didn't go on was the surf board i have enough trouble keeping upright on a rubber ring so a board was going to be no good to me. on the whole this park has many rides ant attractions and you will find it hard to complete all of these in one day!
Enjoyable day. Free with the Burj but was a fun day out for the famaily Nothing else to say but it is insinsting I write more. recommended with kids

Great addition to Jumeriah Beach Hotel. My husband and I loved the water park. We managed 2 hours with our 8 month old taking it in turns on rides while she was entertained in the kids section. Can't comment on the price as this was free for guest staying at Jumeirah Beach Hotel.

A must for families traveling with kids. It's very safe, contained, no worries... Kids will have a full day and will request more.... If you stay at any Jumierah Group hotels, you get unlimited entries for free, as long as you are staying at a their hotels, they even give you a free ride . The water park has all the features of five stars hotels... Clean, organized, safe

Perhaps the better of Dubai's waterparks. My sons (ages 10,13) visited Wild Wadi. It's not as new as Aquaventure, but it's an excellent waterpark with a greater variety of slides. The pools are cooler (much needed on a July day) and the walkways are regularly watered down so you don't burn your feet. Plus, both admission and food at Wild Wadi is cheaper than Aquaventure.The payment system is better than Aquaventure. You are issued a wristband which serves as your locker key (if you rent one). You can also load it with money to use for food throughout the day. It's nice not to have to carry (and potentially lose) wet money.Finally, bring your camera! You can lock it in the locker when you're not using it. You can get the best photos of the Burj al Arab from the rear of the park. To see photos and get other ideas of what to do with kids in Dubai, you can check out our blog at www.aroundtheworldin72days.com.

Highly recommended. Spotlessly clean throughout. The staff are friendly, helpful and professional. Recommend all of the rides. Everything reasonably priced for one of Dubai's top visitor attractions, including all of the souvenirs in the on site giftshop. Plenty of sun loungers spread out around the park whether it be next to the pool or higher up on the terraces next to the slides. Planned on staying here for a few hours but ended up staying for a full day. Although we did encounter some queues for some of the rides we didn't have to wait longer than ten mins max and in most cases the queuing area is under cover from the sun. Clearly very safety conscious with equipped lifeguards everywhere, on the alert for anyone in trouble. Would definitely pay a return visit when back in Dubai.

Fun day out but overpriced and not enough rides. Wild Wadi is way too expensive for a waterpark that has around 4/5 rides only. I heard that there was one in Atlantis that was similarly priced but bigger. We kind of felt hard done by in terms of price and of course, the extra bit for the locker.However, the day itself ends up being fun if you spend half in the pool, a few on rides and get something to eat. Food isn't expensive at all and is tasty! My favourite ride was the family slide which makes you feel like you're about to fall off the edge into the streets of Dubai. Such a good ride and I also liked every other ride in the park as well. My company were too scared to go on the Sceira ride but it looked awesome and I regret not going. Not recommended for those with back pain, I hear. The swimming pool is a great relief from the hot floors and tiring queue lines. The day we went, the queues moved super fast and it was busy as well! I'd recommend WW as a good day out but you might be better off spending your day at another waterpark if you want to get more for your money. I just wanted to say a huge thanks to one of the team members (whose name I cannot remember, oriental male) who made the effort to somehow find us half way through our day just to tell us that we forgot to take our change when paying for tickets. It was around 100DHS which we had forgotten about! However, it was so kind of him to find us and give the money back. Applaud the service.Shame about the price, but good day out for families and friends.
Nice place but expensive... I liked the lazy river but found the food very expensive and the most amazing is food you get in with isn't allowed :-(
Fun day for all. Wild Wadi was great fun for me and my kids. The rides were great and the play area clean and safe. The locker room was a bit too far from the action and very dark inside.
wild wadi water park. Way to busy and the lines were too long. Jumeirah beach hotel gave us free passes, without them I would not have gone and spent the money.

A good place to be on a very hot day. We visited on a very hot day in July (temperatures in excess of 45 degrees). We really liked the fact that there were no queues (at least on the day we went) and it is cleaner than the Australian water parks (which seem, frankly, filthy and crowded in comparison to Wild Wadi).I ended up reading by the wave pool while my family did the rides, so it suits both those people who want to do 'extreme' things, as well as those who don't. We stayed for the whole day.
Fun Time. Grandchildren loved the lazy river, we went on it as well, great to just float along in the cool water. Kids enjoyed the big bucket dropping water on them.

Not much here.. WW is good if included in your hotel stay but definitely overpriced if you pay separately to get in. My 2 children 8&9, were bored after a few hours. No food allowed in and food prices inside very expensive.

Lots of room. We went with a 16 year old & there were enough high thrill rides for us to enjoy. Go past the sunbeds on entry if you want a base to come back to - there are lots around and further in, so if you hate rides and want to read a book, there are some lovely shady spots.

Best water park in the world. We have been to many water park across the world and this is just the best in terms of rides, food and service. The life guards are also very well trained and are always been tested by management. Well done for running such a fab park

What a day at wild wadi. What can I say? Such a fantastic day out! Reasonably priced throughout and photographers around to capture your day! There are also water fountains dotted around and the pool water is so cold and refreshing in the hot sun!
we love dubai. gets very busy.sometimes it is smelly.onen year we caught a skin infection.also the walking area gets to hot to walk on.the ques are very long,best to get ther as soon as it opens

No queues a super fun day out!. After trying out the aqua park at the Atlantis last year I was keen to visit Wild Wadi, we visited the park during Ramadan and as a result the park was not very busy, there were no queues and the rides were fantastic, I especially loved the lazy river rapids were you meandered around the whole park and could hop on and off. My boyfriend preferred the thrill factor rides and was not disappointed! The large wave pool was also great for a cool down in the soring heat. The staff were all very polite and friendly, with water photographers taking our pictures on the rides, its just a shame the photos were very expensive. The only slight negative was the changing and locker areas which could do with a refresh. Overall a fantastic day out for any age group!

Brilliant waterpark. If its busy book your tickets in advance, we went during Ramadan so wasn't really busy, when you arrive they give you a plastic watch which you can top up with money so you can leave your bag in a locker, has showers located in the changing room areas. One tip the floor is very hot in most places, so bring sandals/ flip flops which can be left at the bottom of the rides, good selection of rides some really scary, some more relaxedHave fun

Best day out in Dubai. Excellent rides, no queues, very clean and not overcrowded. We went to both Wild Wadi and Aquaventure during our stay. Both were excellent but Wild Wadi was more enjoyable as the rides are better and there were no queues (as we went here in the week day).
Best water park. This is a great water park. U hardly have to get out of your ring to do all the rides. Better than aqua adventure.

Better than Disney. We spent a few hours here during July on a Thursday morning and had a great time! On arrival, we loaded money onto our wristbands (fab idea) and purchased a small locker for 30 dirhams, non-refundable but well worth the money.The layout of the park is really good and it's great that you can come off the majority of the slides and can stay in your rubber ring and join the lazy river!We decided to do the fish foot spa, it was 50 dirhams per person and a really fun experience.There was a good choice of rides for everyone, we are both in our early 20s and found the rides great fun, especially the ones labelled "intense thrill"!When we return to Dubai next year we will definitely spend another day here and have already recommended it to others.

Enjoyable experience but staff could be friendlier. We visited here as part of our stay at the Burj. The slides were excellent and quite an experience - but perhaps a little too much for my poor wife. The wave maker was plenty of fun. Changing rooms were a little bit dirty and staff were a bit unfriendly.

So much fun. We went to Wild Wadi park that is on the doorstep of Burj al Arab so it offers a great view to the hotel.
The whole park is so much fun, the slides are very long and there are great ones for those who want some adventure and to those who are with children as well.

Magical!!!. What an amazing expereince, while (due to the exchange rate, we are from South Africa) the water park is quite expensive, it was worth every cent.
TIP: if you have access to one of the Dubai Entertainment Voucher booklets, there is a voucher for a 'buy 1 get 1 free' entrance to the park voucher. This was of great use.

Good fun. We visited Wild Wadi today (09/07/13) arriving at the park about 1pm. The park wasn't busy and we did not have to queue for the slides. The park's set up is good and the slides are great. Love the wrist band idea where you don't need cash as long as you have pre-loaded your wrist band on entry. They is not many rides/slides but what they have will not disappoint. All staff that we came in to contact with were polite and most helpful. The only negative comment I would make is regarding the walk from each ride. Be prepared to have the soles of your feet burnt. The walkways are not well covered and are not adequately cooled.

Great Staff.. This place is awesome, my 10 & 7 year old love it. Big ups to the staff who are interested and caring the girl&guy operating the surf/wave ride who took time with my daughter to give her the technique to get the most enjoyment out of the ride. We climbed to the top to do the Jumeirah sceira twice but didn't quite have the courage to follow through but next time !!! Tantrum Alley is awesome with lots of O M G moments. It's hot and there r queues but that's life and everyone is having a great time. One thing take in wet shoes if you have them as the concrete gets hot. I love the wrist band system so your not worrying about cash and you have to get a photo it's a great day out!!

Fun, Hot and well organised. We could only spend 3 hours 1030-130pm here due to our two day stop over in Dubai, but would have spent longer if we could.It costs $80AUS each. We met a couple on a tour who gave us their vouchers from the Dubai entertainment book (get if spending a week in Dubai) so got a buy one get one in for free deal. You can also rent lockers and towels for a cost. We did not eat at the park so not sure on the prices. Maybe take your own water as we did.When you rent a locker (at entrance/ticket gate) you get plastic armband, much better than Australian ones (also used for photos in gift shop). However the lockers are located in male and female change rooms not in a neutral area. You can get big or small lockers also.There are 3 thrill rides with tubes that you do not have to bring with you up stairs like other parks. There is also a tube ride that goes for about 30min. This ride takes you around half the park up and down water jet slides, hills and eventually to their slow lagoon ride. Best ride of park. There is also a kids area, wave pool (nice and cold) and a wave ride (Pay for).You can not wear thongs on rides but there are unsecured places to place them if you want (the ground can burn your feet). You can not wear sunglasses on rides (even though the sun is blinding). There are allot of signs about line cutting so be aware it is a general practice of the locals. Note the park is open till 12 midnight some nightsSo if you dont like the heat of the day maybe go then. However im sure that is when most of the locals go. Also Fridays are ladies night. So check they might not let men in.
awesome. it is a must for families. so much fun. adventure. you wont want to go home. lots of activities for all ages. close to Burg Alharab. make sure you go with your cameras.

So Much Fun !!. My husband, 3 year old and myself had a fabulous day here. It is so well organized, super clean and so easy to navigate.You can put your things in a locker which are dotted around the park. You can then buy a bracelet where you can electronically out cash onto via any of the kiosks. This way you don't have to carry anything with you for the day and can buy drinks, foods, souvenirs as you go. If you don't spend all your money, you just get it refunded at the end of the day. Brilliant!The water park is fun for all ages. My husband spent the day going down the "vertical" slides and tried his hand at surfing. My son and I stayed in the wave pool, went on a tube along the river and played in the enormous water playground. We arrived at 10am and only left at 230pm because we had another tour booked. Otherwise we could have stayed there for hours more. Also, if you stay in one of the Jumeirah chain hotels, you get free entry and transfers to the park. We stayed at Jumeirah Creekside ( see my separate review) and had free entry, mini bus transfer and towels included. A great day out for all ages.

could be better. A good way of spending the day during hot summer, but they should have half day ticket, more and diversify rides and slides and a better organisation. Also, the temperature in the changing area is soo law that you freeze there. The price for the photo is hilarious. 150 dirhams. Overall, it was good, but could be better.

Good experience. Kids loved it so did we! not very crowded the day we visited which made it very enjoyable, the attendands are very keen to satisfy you and look after you as much as they can. Will visit again for sure!!

great day out. This a a very good water park and there are a good variety of slides. The layout of the park is good and they do a sysem where you can put cash on your wrist band so that you dont have to go back to your locker when you need a drink/food.This is refunded if you dont spend it all

Good for everyone especially kids. Very good to be in this area and have fun with your kids.
Life savers are everywhere ,lifejacket is there for your kids, ..
Good. It was a gud day spent dere ... Too much crowd but kids love it ... Ongoing music with water rides n slides make it fun .. N one can enjoy surfing ... Gud quality food available in d park

Amazing value if you stay at jumeirah. The park is beautiful and clean - only complaint would be the ablution and toilet facilities could be bigger . The slides were fabulous and the park beautifully run!

Super Place. The Wild Wadi is run by a TEAM of extremely friendly and proactive staff who were available to assist visitors with a smile.We had a look around of the entire park and found the rides and food area extremely well maintained and clean.KUDOS to the entire team at WILD WADI you make JUMEIRAH proud.Cheers and all the very best for a great experience.

Expensive. Liked the water activities. Hated the price. They close at 8pm so get there early. There is no half day pricing. You pay full price no matter when you arrive. We wanted to go in the evening to avoid the intense heat of the day. Not recommended.

Enjoyable Day Out. I spent 4 hours here. The park is very clean and has excellent views of the Burj Al Arab. There`s about 8 main slides and a lazy river. There`s some nice healthy options for food too and not the usual fast food type you get in theme/ water parks. Its not a must see for Dubai- but if your looking to kill a couple of hours its worthwhile.

great day out. this is an excellent water park and located very centrally. it is best enjoyed when it opens in the morning and on weekdays outside school holidays. the new rides are fab and the kids pool/play area are great too. the towel and locker rentals are crazy, though.
Best Water Park. Recently I visited to wild wadi, I found many new ride/slides added. Wild wadi is one of the best water park of UAE.

Fun water park. Wild wadi is a great place to spend half a day, especially in the dubai heat. Lots of rides and pools for all ages. The only criticism was the food was expensive and not great, and the walkways are so hot, would be great to have more shade. Lots of people but still fun.
Swimming fun. Water Games beautiful... forget the summer heat....I spent a beautiful day can not forget the appropriate atmosphere...
Great fun!. A great way to spend the scorching hot days in Dubai. The rides cater to all and range from the mild ones to the extremely thrilling ones.

Lots of fun. We were staying at the hotel, so had compilmentary access. Tip No. 1, perhaps leave your towells at the hotel and do WW in bursts to avoid paying for a locker (not that it was overly expensive). It takes a while to get the hang of the park's geography. There are really only 4 or 5 rides/ride entrances and the rest is pools, kids water area, snack bars etc. Tip 2. If you do the tube rides as a double you avoid going backwards which can be slightly disconcerting. It was lots of fun and although nowhere near as big as the waterparks we have back home, we all enjoyed it immensely.

Amazing ,fun-packed and thrilling !. It was a great trip I had to Wild Wadi water park ! They have great thrill rides , amazing pools and a great scenic view ! The only thing which I found a problem with was that the queues for each and every ride very so long that I had to wait over 40 min in one line which was frustrating ! but I enjoyed the water park and look forward to meeting there again!

Not for the faint hearted.. I am over 45 and have a daughter of 12. She insisted I accompany her for the WILD WATER WADI rides.The rides are brilliant, but a late evening visit is advised due to the heat. If you wanna get tanned then anytime is good.The rides are excellent and unlimited. Some of them can be hard and if you are afraid of water, darkness and sharp falls, this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for thrills, A MUST GO

Feel like a kid again. I honestly feel that kids don't have as much fun as the adults do in this theme park. Wild Wadi was so much fun. The rides are so different and exciting that we couldn't stop going on them over and over again. The food was great and reasonably priced. The storage lockers available were easy to use. We had free access to Wild Wadi because we stayed in The Jumeirah Emirates Hotel. So we saved a lot of money there. So staying in a Jumeirah Hotel is worth while.

Perfect place for fun and new experiences. Its good to be here., as the water park was awesome with good views and the surrounding shopping centres are well planned. I couldnt imagine how i spent my 4 hour there without even realizing it.

Nice experience but overpriced. Wild wadi was a nice experience to have and the park is well managed but comparing to the park and rides, the entry ticket is overpriced, moreover the food inside is far more expensive and very limited options for the restaurants.

Thank goodness this was included as a Jumeirah guest. Don't think I would pay the money for here with a child under 4years old. The slide selection for the wee ones is limited to the lazy rivers and the climbing frame, which is good, but with all the spraying water it can make it a little chilly for the wee ones. He wave pool is a good attraction for them also. Feels like the distance between each slide takes forever to walk and remember the whole time you are not covered by the shade, so burning is more possible here - remember your sun cream. I think for older children its great but if you have under 4's or under 1.1m in height, I think it's limited. Didn't eat here but certainly there was a vast election of eateries.

Best water park in Dubai. If you are staying in Jumeirah you get complimentary access to the park or you can pay a small fee for entrance.its the first and best water park in Dubai.Its not as big as aqua venture in Atlantis which is now more popular and also has dolphins but talking strictly in terms of slides and water activities its any day better.If you have time then I suggest you visit both places but if you have to choose one then aqua venture wins only if you want to meet the dolphins.If you want to go for waterpark alone then I suggest you should opt for wild wadi.Good fun for both kids and adults.Best way to beat the heat in Dubai! Don't forget your waterproof sunscreen.

Awesome. awesome rides, bit pricey, best thing they had more variety of food then Atlantis Aquaventure. Wild Wadi is usually full of locals where as aqua is full of toursits. You should definitely experience Wild Wadi, then the views outside the park is awesome too, pic opportunity in front of Burj Al Arab.

Fun time. Stayed in Dubai for a family celebration arriving from Kuwait(we are not Kuwaiti)had an excellant day at wild wadi water park. I first used the park back in 1998 wehn it first opened and i have to say that nothing had changed and most importantly everything works and was kept in great condition considering it was 15 years old. Great fun and looking forward to going back
Splash. Its Good but it doesn't have a lot of rides, and the smoking areas are far and a little bit hard to reach, for a smoker its a problem but other than that it is average.

Loved it. My 3 year old daughter will not stop talking about Wild Wadi, she just loved the water slides there! My family also enjoyed the slow 'Lazy River' inflatable raft ride. A great way to shake off a long flight

fun water rides. we spent the whole day at wild wadi there were lots of different water activities we were a group of 7 with three children there were kid friendly rides as well as extreme thrill rides so all had a great time

good fun. tickets sell for 200 AED/visit. It is not worth that, but only the very stupid or very lazy (that's me) will not have found a discount coupon somewhere. The revamped slides are a lot better than they were and with the competition from the Atlantis waterpark it is also not as crowded as it was anymore. Certainly worth a visit, but look for the discount.I tought WWWP was better than the Atlantis park.

It's good. Wild wadi is good, but if you want to visit a water park while you are in Dubai I would recommend the Atlantis, out of the two the Atlantis is better in my opinion, Wild Wadi have more rides/slides than the atlantis. Wild Wadi feels a little bit like they have packed everything into a small space, we couldn't find any sun loungers to put our stuff and ended up sitting on the floor which is not good when you are paying a lot of money to get in. A good day out but my preference is Atlantis

Beyond AMAZING. The place is beyond AMAZING, you can spend up to 7 hours without feeling bored for a second.Overall, it's not very crowded in week days, yet I advise to go in the early morning to have the maximum enjoyment...

Great place for adults and kids!. We stayed at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel which is just a stone's throw away and went to the water theme park over two whole days. It was the height of Summer (end of June) and I was worried about it being unpleasantly hot, but the various attractions (especially the cold water tide pool!) kept us cool throughout the day. Food and drink (including icy slices of watermelon) are easily accessible and there are many shady spots. There are many lifeguards and service staff scattered all over the theme park to monitor the safety of guests and oversee the various rides and activities. Everyone was really friendly and helpful. My 6-year old loved the kids play area and there are slides suitable for kids aged 3 to 12. Parents/guardians can enter and enjoy the slides together with the younger kids, and there are lifeguards stationed at the entrances to the play area of and at every slide to oversee safe play so I felt comfortable leaving her to play by herself. There are slides for the adrenaline junkie as well as gigantic floats for those who prefer a slow, relaxing float around the park. I would so definitely go back again!
Good place. There is something for everyone. A good place to have fun and enjoy yourself. It is more fun to go as a group like family outings.

Great fun for everyone!. This is a fantasic water park with rides to suit everybody! We loved relaxing in the pools but also having the thrill rides, especially the newly refurbished Jumeirah Sceirah - scariest ride I have ever been on!!!Would recommend this water park to anyone. We spent the day here and I would do it all over again. Changing rooms are as basic as you need with good lockers and easy to look after keys.Would definately recommend putting credit onto a wrist band to get drinks and snacks easily in the water park.

never forgat. Water fun of games forget the warm summer atmosphere beautiful day enjoy a swim
Eating with the availability of good taste

Fun day out. The water park is like no other that we have been to, The rides take you up with powerful jets of air, We spent the whole day there & it wasn't enough, All the staff were very attentive and looked after all our needs, The weather was so hot that all you wanted to do was be in the water, Amazing day out :-)

Change rooms dirty. Cost of photos way too much... Change rooms were extremely dirty. You have to pay to use the locker facility(not included in ticket price). Too few rides for the value of ticket price. Rather go to Atlantis and do one of the dolphin encounters and get your pass to Aquaventure free.

Amazing staff for an amazing experience. I visited Wild Wadi twice.The first time I came, my friend forgot his Blackberry in the taxi and the security lady called Meri helped us getting it back. The way she handled the situation let me speechless. She was so professional, efficient and customer oriented. Her kindness and help made our day and that is what made us return. (My friend is so thankful to Meri for what she did !)Second time was at night and I have got to say that the scenery was wonderful ! Great time !

Great for kids and parents alike. We visited the Wild Wadi park in June 2013 and had a great time there. All the rides were great, safe and a lot of fun. Based on my experience I'd recommend:1. Set aside at least half a day, preferably pre lunch hours. 2. Put some credit (around 50 AED per person in your party) into the wrist strap for later use on food and drinks. 3. Pay extra for the large locker. 4. Begin your rides with the Burj Surj if you are a family with kids and try Tantrum Alley later.

wild-wilder wadi. i recently just visited Dubai and had to go to this park. This was one of the best decisions made so far on the vacation, all the rides were awesome, beautiful experience both for kids and adults, so much to eat and to do....this is especially good for the kids as a day at this park will surely wear them out!!
Great fun. LOVE Wild Wadi, it is so much fun with rides for everyone. To top it off you have the most amazing view of the Burj Al Arab and beyond which makes it extra special.
Great Fun. Very good for family and some great rides. They have an awesome tower slide which is quite thrilling. Drops you down from 4 story height :)Food choices could be better.
Fun all the times. Great park with lots of activities and pools. Excellent choice for children. Sometimes is crowded but is still worthing.

kids loved it. we were staying at the jumeirah beach hotel so came and went as we pleased otherwise it would have been mega expensive. Didnt think it was quite as good as Aquaventure at Atlantis. The kids enjoyed all the various rides especially the Sceirah and Burj Surj. Get a drinking cup and then you can get cheapish refills all day.Plenty of towels and sunbeds even on a busy day and really liked the idea of loading your wristband with money as you go in.

Fun slides. Really enjoyed the waterpark. There were lots of types of slides, especially liked the one that went upwards! The only downside was I went on the really tall slide and although it was fun, it scratched my back quite badly so there must have been a part sticking out along the way that needs fixing. But I didn't let it ruin a good day!

Great. Excellent day out, no need to carry money because you get a pre-paid wristband. The ground gets so hot so you do need something on your feet but there is somewhere to put them while you are on the rides.

Fun for Adults as well as for Kidz….. It’s a fantastic place to chill out during summer although the admission fee is high. You are not allowed to bring Food or Drinks from outside (they search your bag at the entrance). Restaurants are available with reasonable price. Tried the Fish Spa (for extra fee not included in the admission fee) it’s tickling but fun.I noticed this time that the water was cold which cause me stomachic!!!It’s an expensive place. The admission fee includes playing with all the rides, but you need to pay extra for lockers; towels; swimwear. So, be prepared and bring a lot of cash…

The craziest water park ride I've ever been on!. We had free passes as we were staying at one of the jumeirah chain hotels and were fast tracked through the queue which was great as it was very hot, although the queue seemed to be short and moving along quickly at 11am when we arrived. The park is big, but not so big you get lost. The rides are great, the lazy rivers and the interconnecting slides are good, the craziest of the rides has got to be the jumeirah scheirah! Absolutely nuts! There are plenty of sun loungers with plenty of umbrellas to get you out of the sun. The flooring gets very hot as your walking round the park to the rides, the yellowy orange surface gets super hot, whereas the light coloured rough surface is OK. We stayed from 11 till about 4 and managed to deal with the heat and sun, both of which were plentiful! Drinks from the catering outlets were reasonable, we didn't buy food so don't know on that score.

great day but spoilt by one thing. great day but if you have teenage girls in your family or group watch out for dirty old arab men,my daughter was touched up while getting out of the lazy river ride.by the the time she had told me it was to late and could not find him,if this happends to youcall security they will be happy to deal with it as it is a common problem.k.maynard12.6.2013

Expensive water park. What I liked about the park is how well staffed they are, how helpful they are towards your needs/enquiries and they can speak Enlish well.What I disliked about the place is how expensive it is, including food, photographs, even getting your feet nibbled by fishes for 50 dirham! Come on, that's too much! And why do we need to pay for a locker? It should be included in the price.The rides, water slides, whatever you call it, there isn't many of them. Lucky for us we went there during the week, so there were not too many people queuing for rides. You don't get value for money here.

Enjoyable Day. A very well set up park, we found the facilities clean and there seemed plenty of people to help with lockers. Hired towel and locker which was about A$60 including entry. Fun for all ages.

Fun Day. We had a fun day here. The park is well organised with lots of helpful and friendly staff. We had complimentary entry as we were staying at a Jumeirah Hotel and the entrance also included towel rental. They have a wristband system which you load with Dirham so you can then get a locker, buy food etc and what you dont spend they give you back at the end of the day. The park wasnt as big as I thought it would be but it was not overcrowded and there were not many cues, we went on a Tuesday. Would i go again, Yes it was good.
Water park heaven. I would have expected nothing less, pure class. Some seriously fast slides, and tube rides. And u must see the artificial rainforest it's great

Excellent. Excellent variety of rides, staff very informative, lifeguards very helpfulStayed at JBH so free entry included, and visited twice during stayNo queueing at the times we visitedHighly recommend a visit, Tantrum alley and Jumeirah sceirah rides were awesome!!!

Fun, Fun, Fun. We went to Wild Wadi Water Park with the kids (8, 6 & 3) and they all found rides, pools and slides to their liking. My wife and I also had a great time. Nice and close to the Hotel and separate entrance to external customers. Amazing views over the city and the Burj al Arab from certain parts of the park. We had a ball so we went back for more.

Well worth spending a day here!. Great fun for family or with friends. Don't miss the Jumeirah Sceirah!!!! Great value for money, especially if you spend the entire day there. Plenty of sun-loungers for resting, relaxing and sunbathing. don't plan too much for later - you'll be exhausted!

Terrible. 2 points: at 10:30 am it was almost impossible to find a place to stay in the shadow. The air was impossible for breathing, due to the smell and vapors of chlorine, which was added to the water. we left the park 5 minutes after we dropped in and never come back!

EXCELLENT FUN. Me and wife LOVED this place, free and private entrance from our hotel Jumeirah Beach Hotel and this place did not disappoint. The place was gr8, lots of different amazing water shuts / rides with very little queing needed. Longest water shute / ride that went up, down and everywhere lasted about 15 mins and was very very impressive, had wave machine in a pool plus lazy river, body boarding experience - the whole place really was great and we cudda quite easily gone her everyday and would've if we'd had a longer stay - VERY IMPRESSED !!

Fun day in hot Dubai. The water park is located right next to the Burj al Arab, has fantastic views of the building from the high points in the park. We had a fun day although I enjoyed water parks elsewhere a little better (Atlantis in the Bahamas and Waterbom park in Bali). I am not sure what the aquaventure park is like at the Atlantis in Dubai but I would like o see that next time. Wild wadi was definitely a fun day out, there are a lot of canal type lagoons around the park which you get on to at various points which were not working throughout the day, apparently when larger people get on it it sometimes gets stuck, so we spent a bit of time waiting for these. There are two slides where you go on with 4 people and they are really fun, also two slides with a scary drop which are also fun (you get put into a glass box and the floor drops out from underneath you). The surf machines were also fun to watch. The park is easy to get around as it is not that big and is a fun thing to do in Dubai as it is just so hot. Price wasn't too bad, around 220 dirhams which is around $60 Australian dollars.

Great rides. Fantastic afternoon. A good selection of rides and the wait time wasn't too long. A must is the Jumeirah Sceirah and Tantrum Alley. Very proud of us all for going on a water slide with a difference.

Must see love it. Amazing brilliant out of this worl....so much fun.well worth the price. The staff are lovely too. Every ride was fun especially sure burn and tantrum alley. Leave your stuff at home to save on lockers (can be a little pricey). You can put your money on your check in ticket and get it back. Take sun cream because you will get wet

Water Laugh. Great for a morning off the beach, plenty of rides but go early if you don't want to queue for everything. Its very well run and friendly. The Jumeirah Sceirah is brilliant, you meet more people walking back down then those who go on the ride.

Great park. It was a great park, best to go during the work days, there were no queues. I imagine it is too busy during the weekend. Because there werent too many people we went to each ride about 5-8 times and got bored after a few hours. In general, recommended!

great fun. It was a great day out for us. It is safe for kids and there is lot for kids to enjoy. Plenty of lifegaurds too. the rides are all superb. you can jump in the lazy river after going through the slides and jump in, float, swim or just walk with friends. we are enjoying the pictures a lot too.

Great Day out for everyone. Brilliant day spent at the waterpark, get there early to make the most of the day. Slides like no other i've came accross that push you up to the top so you don't have to walk up stairs carrying your tube! Ladies, don't wear bikini bottoms that tie at the sides incase they come off! Staff could not be nicer or more helpful. Really enjoyable day.
Free tickets from our hotel (Part of package). Waaw, was very nice, me and my family enjoyed 2 full days in Wild Wadiall the entertainments are wonderful.
What a blast!. We had loads of fun at Wild Wadi. There are sooo many activities to keep you busy and happy. Recommended

Close second to Atlantis. We went to Wild Wadi the day after going to Atlantis. ATLANTIS is a nicer park, much friendlier staff, far nicer facility, cleaner, very well managed, overall a better experience than Wild Wadi. If you have to choose, go to Atlantis. However, if you have time to go to both, do it. Although Atlantis is a nicer park and the experience of going out over the man-made islands out to the resort is very cool too, Wild Wadi had a better assortment of rides. Based on rides alone, WW is better (and although the entry fees are about the same, WW is cheaper once you factor in food etc and the cost to ride the monorail out to Atlantis).

Fun Water park. It was fun and exciting. It had a lot of water rides but not scary enough but it was fun. The staff were really nice and the park has a great view of Burj Khalifa. It provides lockers and they have their own restaurants and cafes

Worth a visit. Children of all ages will love this place. Even during summer you can walk barefoot despite the stone flooring because it is water cooled from below. Great attention to details which most would not realise. Fabulous rides

Disappointing in all aspects. This attraction is awful. Small, dated, old, run down, unfriendly staff, poor food outlets. Avoid at all costs. To explain, this is the worst "water park" ever experienced. I understand you are in Dubai, and not Europe or Americas, but this park is a joke.

Water fun heaven. Yet another visit to wild wadi & it never fails to deliver. All of us thoroughly enjoyed every minute, especially our youngest who is now tall enough and confident enough with the water to go on all the rides. Our only minus point being, on all of our other numerous visits, there has been a live dj playing, noticeably absent this time.

Some tips. It is great though small yet everything is there. If you have kids come early so that they have enough time to enjoy. If the parking is full you are in trouble but it gets kinda empty after a while so just wait till they allow you in. For children and those with senstive eyes bring your googles with you.The people there are friendly and very helpful but the queues are sometimes long.Food is a little bit e pensive but the problem is with its quality.In general its a great experience but i do not know about the Atlantis Aquapark yet, I will check it out and get back to you. Greetings from Egypt
Good day out. Plenty of beds to laze around, was quiet in the morning busy around lunch time then quiet after 4 was open till 8 pm . Not too many queues and food was reasonable

Expensive but worth it. Cost about £170 for a family of 5 for the day, just for entrance. Spent another £50 on food and drinks. Well worth it - all had an absolutely fantastic day - even our three year old.

Great fun even if this is not really your thing!!. My wife and I visited Wild Wadi with friends during a recent stay. Not really our normal thing, but it really was great fun. The rides are excellent and the general facilities are very good. One word of warning though. On some of the rides, you are very exposed to the elements and there are some delays at certain points during the rides. So when its 39 degrees, wear sun block!!

An ideal place to cool down. Wild Wadi is very nice to spend some time in on a hot day. You can spend almost the whole time in the water floating on the inflatable rings which is good as the footpaths are quite hot sometimes. It has a variety of slides with different excitement levels. We were lucky as it was not an overly busy day so the waiting lines were quite short. There are some places for food but the quality is not that good. There are plenty of lockers, private changing rooms and showers with soap. Although there are many lifeguards around they do not really seem to care a lot about your safety but more about keeping the flow of people going and taking unwanted pictures of you. The rides are not all very save and I got hurt on some of them mainly because it is hard to control the spinning of the rings you are on.

The time of my life. this place is heaven if you like water parks, the game are amazing and you will spend a lot of time being there. going with friends a great memory. im sure after a couple of games you will come back year after year.
so much fun. Very organised and clean. Loads of fun rides. you will love it. There is a surf simulator and loads of sunbeds as well

Best water park ever. This is one of the best water parks iv been to. The surfing thing is amazing although i need alot of practice. Its great fun. There are many slides and rides and you need to be there all day to really try everything.

Fun Guaranteed. I lived in Dubai for 2 years. The only thing we wanted to do was go to Wild Wadi. There are tonnes of fun filled activities. If you have a big family with a youngster the it is probably best to go to the wave pool or the family ride. I went on most of them. My favourite by far has to be the tantrum alley it was epic. Here is a tip:If you want to go to the lazy river it would be best to rent a cabana because when you show the members of staff your band on your wrist they will let you skip the queue. HOPE YOU WILL HAVE FUN!!!!
Go Wild in Wadi Park!. Great fun for all the family! Expect to scream on the Sceirah drop! For the main water rides kids need to be above 110cms.

our first water park experience. we loved three rides the most Jumeriah scary as well as burj surj, tantrum alley....i guess we took tantrum allay many many times....also we enjoyed the wave pool a lot, the only thing that we dident like was the heavily chlorinated water...lol i would recomend every one to go there at 9 40, the doors open at 10 am so you have the park to yourself, on weekends/holidays its over crowded and you have to wait for hours to get these rides,
Amazing. We've had a great day at wild wadi!The rides are awesome and not to much queuing!Will visit again soon!

Not bad.. We had a fee ticket to the park as part of our hotel deal and I', glad it was free as I wouln't have paid the full price!The rides that there were, were good, particular the lazy river and the big flumes. I felt there wasn;t enough slides to keep a whole famiyl entertained.On the positive the ques weren't too long even though it was half term when were visited.The food and drink within the park is grossly over priced so I would recommend leaving the park for lunch

A lot of fun. A great day spent at the water park. The rides were great. Be wary though of how many rides are advertised. They advertise a lot of rides but several of the rides are combined when to honest it is just a continuation of the one. Anyway, it's what you make it. The Scierah ride is great but pretty daunting to start off with. Staff throughout the park were friendly and very professional. I saw them demonstrating many of the activities to people and giving them a fair go. Food can be a tad expensive. Great view of the Burg Al Arab.

A funfilled day activity for all. Tried almost all the rides but not the rollercoaster screw. That is not everybody's cup of tea. But enjoyed surfing and the other rides. But too many rides to cover in a single day.
AWESOME!. Excellent place to go with the family and friends, all rides are awesome! Floor can get very hot though so make sure to take flip flops

Get discount vouchers first. I love wild wadi waterpark and highly recommend it however I do think it is more expensive now than I would like It to be. This was the first time I had taken my family so had to pay entry for 4, we had two vouchers to gain entry for the price of 2 which brought the admission down and we credited 200 dhms to our account for food and drink. This got us 4 drinks and 4 basic meals just. Your not allowed to take and of your own food and drink into the facility but there are water fountains to get access to drinking water. Get there early before opening to ensure a good sun lounger location. Overall the kids loved it I still love it but be aware of the costs. We stayed there happily from 10 am till closing at 7. Still a great place and a must do when in dubai. Free parking at the entrance is also a great advantage.

Wild wadi wasn't like what it says. We when there at last as my family came for visit from the UK.we took all the kids there and it wasn't quite what i expected. it wasn't impressed me at all.but the kids loving it though..

Great for kids and adults!. We've had a great day at wild wadi!The entry isn't cheap, so I'd recommend using the entertainer vouchers you can buy in most supermarkets here and benefit from their two for one entry offer. At close on £40 per person it's not cheap, and you'll get little change for £10 for lunch per person.That said, it's brilliant fun and well worth it. The rides are all great and quite unique, in that they force you up hill with water jets that are so strong you'll need to make sure you've got you swimming shots tied on tightly!!They cater for all ages and the staff couldn't be more helpful if they tried.There's a life guard at every corner and parents with young children should feel safe in the knowledge that kids are in very safe hands.There's lots of shaded areas to find cover form the sun in the summer months and cabanas for those that want to splash out.I'd highly recommend it for a family day out. Brilliant fun!!

Small But Fun. My "Very Good" score given to Wild Wadi reflects the location of this Water Park (Dubai). It does not really compare to Disney Water Parks, or Water Parks in many cities in the United States. It is, however, nice, although quite small. You must try "Speed Slides (Jumeirah Sceirah), or "Tantrum Alley & Burj Surj". A good place for 3 - 4 hours adventure with your kids, or friends.
Fun fun fun. Children absolutely loved this amazing fun water park, lazy river and the new rides are fantastic, try to treat yourself to a cabbanna worth the extra couple of dirhams.

excellent place for adults and kids. a lot of fun for our children and for us too.There were a activities for all ages, the best in the water. the heat was great and food was reasonable prices. Fun fun fun

Didnt live up to the hype!. Before visiting Wild Wadi you are led to believe it will be a giant and un paralelled water park. The problem is its not! There are limited rides there, which all have long lines. The entrance fee was really quite high for what is was and then you get charged extra for lockers!In reality it would be better if it had a few more big slides. The big ones they do have are very good though. Go for a few hours but no more

A fun day out. A real selection of water rides available - some relaxing and some real thrill rides. All very good fun and well maintained. Spa treatments are also available for the ultimate relaxation.

World's best. Wild Wadi is by far the best waterpark I have visited. It surpasses all of the Florida waterparks by a long shot and whilst small, is packed full of attractions.The White Water Wadi Master Blaster slides are excellent and have a fast moving line due to their high capacity, and propel you all over the park, even working as transport if you wish to get around. The new raft slides are fantastic and well worth the climb up the stairs.Staff are excellent and the range of food options is great for the size of the park, providing healthy options in the form of fruit smoothies and mixed fruit boxes/salads. We did not pay for entry as a Jumeirah hotel guest, so I cannot comment on the pricing, but the park is a must see in Dubai, even if you are staying at Atlantis which has its own waterpark.

OK to spend few hours. I had heard it was good but after Aqua adventure it was let down. It needs renovating and cleaning up. Rides were not fantastic and most just push you up. having said that it was free as we stayed at JUmeriah beach hotel and my daughter loved it as she was able to go on the rides. She was not allowed on Aquadventure in Atlantis!!! They give you the float at the beginning of the ride and you do not need to lug it around like at Aquadventure. The children's play area was lovely for small kids. It gets very busy so go early. Be careful as some nights it closes early.

Slow Moving rides!. The whole park revolves around conveyor belts that push you forward. The whole time you are gonig up and you never have a strech where you go down the slide fast. This is a very nice park but it isn't as fun as the Atlantis Aquavdenture. Tip: pick up coupons from your hotel before heading to Wild Wadi.

Great Oasis of fun. What a refreshing find in the middle of a hot day! Loved the sprinkler system to keep the feet from getting burnt! Rides were fantastic fun, lots to experience, a great place for families, the water was cool, the rides were exhilarating!
Great Fun!. Wild Wadi is great fun and a great way to get a tan and keep cool haha, i have been a few times, they have a good selection of rides to suit all ages.

Wild. Wow, what a great few hours. We had vouchers for 2 for 1 entry which helped. Arrived at just before 10am on a Wednesday of UK half term week. Hint: only hire one locker to leave valuables in and take your own towels to save money. Walked straight in, helpful guy advised us where to go for good sun beds by wave pool and how to navigate round the park. As a family with a 13 year old not very brave girl and 10 year ' I'll try anything' boy this was the park for us. Started off on the 2 raft rides - burj surj and tantrum alley, great fun as all together in one raft and full of surprises. Then onto the master blasters which shoot you up and down all around the park and connect with different slides. This can be done in double rafts or singles. We went all the way round in both and advise single for the adrenalin rush. Time for the Jumeirah Sceirah which was braved by the 10 yr old. Stand in a pod, floor drops away and off you go. SCREAM! Our aim was to hit it and by 12.15 we had done the raft rides 3x each and been all around the park 3 times without queuing for more than a couple of minutes for anything. Stopped for lunch Hint: we had 2 supersize meals at 49 aed each which was sufficient for us to share as a family. Then fun in the wave pool and a play in the kiddies area and left by 2pm. By lunchtime the queues were starting for everything but we had done it all. This water park does not have the widest variety of rides but for family fun I prefer it over the Atlantis. The views over Dubai are amazing too - an added bonus.

Great fun!. Had a fun couple of hours going down the slides. Not too busy so no queues for the rides. Free entrance if you are staying at one of the hotels. Plenty of Sun lounges, very attentive lifeguards.
fun. Very good slides. Various danger level. Convenient lockers. Worth to stay with kids for a day. Reasonable price.

refreshing water in a hot wither. i went with my 2 kids afternoon,
we had a free access as we are resdent in one of aljumairah hotels (alqassr).
my chilrens enjoyed very much.
I recommend it for chid and adults.
OK, not great. Good to go if you have free tickets, but I think the aquapark from the Atlantis is better. Avoid fridays, it is to crowded.

wild wadi. I took my sister and her children down to wild wadi it was fun, friendly and professional staffs the feeling was we didnt want to leave.Now I plan to go ladies night I think it is a lot of fun.My only comment is it is way too expensive in their the towels are small but @AED30 RENTAL refreshments and food very expensive considering the admission fee.
best water park in Dubai. Had an amazing time at Wild Wadi - it was definitely better than Atlantis. There were more rides/slides. Even the snacks at Wild Wadi were better.
Great place. This was great fun and had free entry for our hotel. You get a towel on entry which is helpful. Great rides and great fun. We took the buggy from our hotel to the waterpark.

Overall a good fun day. My 7 year old son and I had a good time but in fairness it's was a bit of a 'bunfight'. The park is well thought through but the changing facilities are dated and not so clean albeit was extremely busy. There were also queues for the showers. The 'cashless' facility ensures good controls for management but is not so customer friendly. Overall a good day.
BETTER THAN ATLANTIS. Brilliant water park. Best I have ever been too. They have slides that take you uphill, a surf machine that was brilliant fun and the staff are lovely and friendly!

Great fun - the laziest water park ever.. Been to Wild Wadi a few times now and love it. Go on a Mon - Wed as it is quiter, if you go on a Thu it closes earlier for ladies night.Make sure you read the map and get to all of the rides. There are two raft rides which i have missed on previous visits, one of which is the best ive been on.

Great time out with the kids. Great water park,lots of activities, not too much queuing, convenient location.Difficult to get a good sun lounger, unless you come early or book one of the private gazebo.food, as often in these places, is fast food of averag standard.Do not come with kids under 5, they will not be able to do much/ be scared by some (like the pich black tunnel)

So Good!. Absolutly loved this park, would recommend to anyway, the staff and rides are great! Me and my sister were there all day and the staff didnt mind, the food is good and so is the lazy river :)

Time too short. this was next tour hotel and we had free entry. As were trying to pack a lot in during out 5 day stay we only managed an hour on our last day, We did the two tubes rides and although a bit apprehensive, as were over 60 , we thoroughly enjoyed them . Even though in mid afternoon we found empty sunbeds leave our clothes etc and were sorry we could not stay longer - next time for sure

its a waterpark. well.. not my favorite place but I do go occasionally with kids. I like it as its everything in not huge area, you can spend weekend afternoon. Kids love it, has enough slides to get tired :) hate staying in lines to get few minutes ride, but what to do??
Great Day Out. This is a good waterpark had a great day out the highlight is the Jumeirah Sceirah water ride its a must for any thrill seeker. Overall a great day out.

fun day !!. Just take your kids there for a great day out. water rides are the order of the day. you have lockers, towels, showers and everything is so clean. Lifeguards are always there plus security is also there. But it is a totally safe haven !! Do not miss it
Good Family Fun. The rides were very enjoyable. The kids had a lot of fun. It is a small place and oeven 3 to 4 hours in sufficient to cover all the rides.
Lovely evening with kids. Love the water park it was great fun for the kids and after 5 pm it's cheaper then day time plz visit great fun

Fab day out and good value for money. Stayed at one if the hotels linked to the water park so access was complimentary, a good perk, believe it is about £40 to get in otherwise? Very safe and clean with plenty to do from lazy rivers to the more daring scary slides for the thrill seekers!Food was good too and good value.

OK for a day. Kids enjoyed it, but limited sunbed space if you did want to rest for a while. Lazy river is nice with the kids and plenty of slides and the usual wave pool. Food outlets are your usual burger/fries places with just about edible food.The bracelets that let you load up credit on them to spend around the park are a good idea to save you messing around with cash in the park.Staff helpful and polite.Worth a visit, although we only went once, plenty more to do in Dubai!
Very average. This is truley a theme park with very average food to match. Lots of rides to choose from but very busy with long waits.
Fun guaranteed!. Adjacent to the JBH and entrance was free - we went in and out of the water park all day long. Our sons loved it!
Great Day. my bf and I had a great time in WW....the rides are great, the atmosphere and food was delicious....we spent the whole day in the park

Still the best waterpark in UAE!. After two years of living in Dubai we think Wild Wadi is still the best waterpark in the UAE, at least if you have children below 110 cm. There is a good variety of rides, but the main reason is the layout of the park with the children's play area very central makes it easy to have a base camp there and the larger children can roam free around the park and they always pass by now and then. The park is also very well run and over the years they have ironed out most of the things we find annoying in the some of the other parks, for example stupid queue systems. Even on days with lots of people, most things run relatively smooth. It is also well maintained and clean. Even the fast food is ok, although some people will find it a bit pricey.Our children (age 3,7 and 10) will pick Wild Wadi every time if they are given a choice. It's simply an excellent day out, but watch out for the crowds on big weekends or arrive early so you can beat them to the main attractions.
A Fabulous experience. Wow. What an attraction. This was a brilliant experience whatever the age of person. Definitely worth a day or so there. We will be taking our kids next year.
Brilliant Fun for family. Kids really enjoyed the surfing rides and it was a unusual experience being fired up (not down) the water rides.

The best!. I love this waterpark! It has rides for all ages and my children love it here. We spend the whole day here! The only downside is that you are not allowed to take any food from outside and buying food at the park is quite expensive. If you have children who are regular eaters then you will be spending a lot of money on food, snacks and drinks. If you stay at any of the Jumeirah chain of hotels then you have complimentary entry to the park so we went more than once in our stay. All children must wear buoyancy aids so that is a sense of safety that you needn't worry about. A great time you will have at this waterpark. One more thing it is quite expensive to get in too! Around £45 each so it can be worthwile staying in a Jumeirah hotel
Not the best. Have been here a couple of times now, its getting tired and lots of queues to join the slides that shoot you up to start the rides. the better park is at Atlantis.
Fantastic! But too hot to walk on ground!. Only regret, needed flipflops, the sprinkers were not working so feet were burning when walking. Otherwise great slides, great fun, a great day!

Fantastic experience. We had free entry to the park because we were staying at an adjacent hotel, so we cannot comment on the cost of entry.You get an electronic wristband when you enter that can be used as a key for your locker, but surprisingly after paying to enter as most people have to, you then have to pay for a secure locker for your belongings. We would have thought that cost could have been included in the entry fee.Notwithstanding that it is important to get there early during hot weather because it does fill up later in the day which can mean waiting for some of the slides. Try to avoid the weekend days of Thursday - Saturday when all locals have time off.For smaller children smaller than 1.0m there is only one dedicated slide area, as well as "beach type" area, for everyone else it is simply a matter of how courageous you want to be.The Jumeirah Sceirah is probably the highlight but it is all over very quickly.Hint for those who have difficulty climbing, or perhaps afraid of heights, the 3 best rides all require substantial stair climbing.

Excellent day out, amazing uphill water slide. Great way to beat the heat when it's 41 degrees!I'm used to much bigger water parks but this kept us thoroughly entertained all day. I even went on the flow rider after seeing the excellent instruction given to everyone who went on it and I'm so glad I did, it was a fantastic highlight of my entire trip. Every staff member gave fabulous service, I have not seen such consistently exceptional service ever.By the way, do try the slide that goes uphill, it's surprisingly good and completely different experience on the two person tube compared to going solo. Ps Carrefour give 2 for 1 discounted entry on the back of their dockets. We were going to go to the other park that was heavily advertised but I'm so glad we went here, it wasn't crowded on the Wednesday, there are some fantastic rides and we got great photos.

water park in the middle of Dubai. Very convenient located close to Burj Al Arab, it is crowded and need to be entered in the morning in order to find a place to put your stuff. However have a lot of attraction both for parents and kids. More expensive than the closest water parks of Atlantis or Dream land however convenient for whoever is living in Dubai for reason of distance.
Lovely water park. Plenty of rides for all ages. Try and go between Sunday and Wednesday for less queues. Lovely food as well

Good but expensive. Admission per person 225 AED including kids over 110 cm height. This is quite expensive but there is option to get a discount. Most of hotels has stands with advertising prospects with 30 AED discount per one ticket so it is very easy to reduce costs. Even in Carrefours on the reverse side of receipt offers the same promotion.

Great place to cool down and relive your youth. As a couple in our 50's we had a great time reliving our youth and keeping cool at the same time. The rides are great for young and old. The staff were very helpful and made the day extra special. Great fun - highly recommended.

The best water park we have been to. We have just come back from Dubai and as part of our trip we spent a day at Wild Wadi. We have been to many water parks in Europe and this was by far and away the best water park we have ever been to. We loved the experience of the white water rapid type slides. The water park is very well organised and there was no excessive queueing. The cashless system made the experience even better. If you are looking for a great way to spend a day while in Dubai we highly recommend going here and we will definately be back. Suzanne and Kieran

Great place to chill to chill out!. Been to many different water parks, this one totally stood out, very friendly staff, clean, great facilities. There is abit of a que at some of the rides but all and all a fantastic time and great way to spend the day!

So Much Fun!. After speaking to many people, we were advised to go to Wild Wadi as opposed to the other water park near the Atlantis.It was a really fun day (2 adults and 2 children). Glad we went on a Sunday - try and avoid Fri/Sat which is the weekend in Dubai - its a lot more crowded. We didn't have to line up long for any rides. Also turned out a perfect weather day to go - not too hot.Tips: Get some money loaded onto yr wristband - min AED30.00 each person for some lunch. Get a large locker - the small ones fit hardly anything. Make sure you are completely dry before trying to catch a taxi back to hotel - our driver wasn't going to let us in unless we were!

Fun and frolic in the sun. Best watertheme park in Dubai with absolutely no competition! Great staff and wonderful facilities. Only downer is that the restaurants are quite boring and low variety of food across the different shacks around the park. All priced very high too. Shower and the Dr. Fish facilities are pretty cool and well-maintained. Worth many visits.
amazing. so many different water activities,muslim women are treated with respect although they are covered up,thursday nights are ladies night,hot water and showers in the bathrooms

Didn't want to leave. Awesome water park, had a great time, felt like a kid again and was great to share it with my partner. Think we both had a great laugh and met some great people from other countries, amazing that such an attraction can bring people together from other cultures too.Great staff and management. A real family environment and the rides are a lot of fun. Sitting in inflatable tyres and water jets that project you upwards.

A great day out for the family!. We spent a couple of days here whilst staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel and we had a fantastic time. We have young children and there were plenty of rides for us all to enjoy. The staff were very helpful and there were plenty of lifeguards around at all times. I would definitely recommend a visit here - we will be back!

superb for family. This park is absolutly superb for a family. Staff is outstanding, lifeguard every 5 meters (or less). Security is a priority. Attraction are very good for all the family. From 10 am to Noon, it was easy to do all attractions without more than 5 minutes of wait. All in one, a must go if you are in Dubai in Family.
Wonder Full.. A nice place to thrill and chill and to beat your boredom away with the heat I must recommend this place to all you travelers.A good place to go,nothing like it in Dubai.

Best water park in the world. What more to say !Rides that suit all ages and interest from raging to chilling. Located conveniently in Jumeirah right beside major world class hotels like Jumeirah Beach & Burj AlArab and the Dubai Marina.

Awesome Experience. I was there with my wife on our honeymoon last February and even though we didn't get into the water, just watching adults and kids screaming with excitement was enough fun. They had so many lovely attractions and it was surely an unforgettable experience.

Best water park in UAE. I may say that Wild Wadi looks best on the map of UAE water parks I have tested and this is the only part I have been returning to. Slides are properly constructed, safe but exciting, place offers multiply relaxation facilities including options to swim, just relax, and of course - take slides. Gets overcrowded in peak times, with insufficient sunbeds but this is the only major disadvantage. Food selection in food courts is fast food style, but this is acceptable in this type of venue. All in all - great place to spend full day relaxing - enjoying sports, water and good read.

A fun escape. We had tickets to Wild Wadi included in our stay at the Jumeirah so we visited for a day when otherwise we probably wouldn't have given it much thought. Although it was just the two of us on our anniversary trip, with no kids, we had a blast and it was a great afternoon of fun. Terrific slides.

great. Swimming in the summer what a time the water park to swim the place is great to swim very clean pools to swim .don't be afraid to swim if you don't no how to swim the very qualified instructors are the to help that was great to have them around
park. Fun, fun, fun for childrens and older.... Food is ok. We were on sunday, it was good idea becouse there was not so much people. I woudl return again.

Great time. I went there with my daughter (8) and we had great time, there was not so many people and we didn't wait too much because it is end of season in Dubai (36'C). All attractions are fun, there is also beach for those not willing to spin and jump.

Best water park in the world. Whether you have children or not, this place is top notch. Whether you seek slow movement idling along in the extensive lazy river, or you want more exciteemnt than normal people should seek, this is the place for you. most especially, during warms months (almost all months in Dubai) soaring around one one of the Wlid Wadi rides after dark is an amazing experience as you are treated to nearby continuous lightshow at the beautiful Burj al Arab tower and other nearby venues. For whatever reason, the massive thunderstorm timed to explode on the hour is something to see and wary observers can always catch the surprise in newcomers when it kicks in. Even if you have no children or grandchildren with you, give Wild Wadi a try. You will leave with a smile. Guaranteed.

Wild Wadi Water Park. When my little sister and i went with our parents (last year i was 10 and my little sister was 8) we had been taken as part of our holiday, i have 4 words to say... OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!I have never been to this great a waterpark, the rides were fantastic, the food was amazing! I don't think this water park could get any better!I definitely recommend this to everyone! Adults enjoy it, kids enjoy it... who doesn't enjoy it!!?!!

Almost perfect. I visited Wild Wadi with my family end of April. We have been there once before two years ago, so this was our second visit. It has been updated with new rides since then, which was nice, The rides are excellent and the park is very well maintained, There are rides for all ages and thrill factors. The food is ok and reasonably priced and cheaper than at Yas Waterworld and Atlantis. We went on a cloudy but warm day so the park was not over crowded. The entry was quick and we got sunbeds in a nice area. The only downside was that the water was not heated anymore and was rather cold as sompared to the other two parks we visited during our trip to Dubai. There is also no possibility to purchase tickets for a follow up day with lower price. I also have to note that I tried buying tickets online from home in order to get the advertised discount but unfortunatelly it did not work for some reason. Anyway I would return again when in Dubai next time but I hope the water will be warm then.

No waterpark compares to this one!!. I've been to water parks in US and Sentosa Island one in Singapore, and even the Atlantis park in Dubai...but this one always steals the top prize!What sets this park aside is that they are constantly re-inventing rides and experience zones, they've put in at least 4 new rides since the last time i visited it. Having been going to this park for the past 11 years, the value and the experience never diminishes ... even though the Atlantis park (its closest competitor) may seem more glamorous, this is the best park when it comes to thrills and that is for all ages!
A GREAT DAY OUT. This is a great waterpark and good value too!!! Lots of rides, helpful staff ... great fun. The only downside is the foodcourt/cafes ... not too good.

Awesome place to visit. We loved our time at Wild Wadi water park, they offer plenty of rides and shade to use and relax. When you buy a ticket get ready for some quick questions, do you want a towel to hire ($30 durum), do you want a locker to use ($40 durum) and do you want money to be placed onto your wristband (you will get a free wristband and can place money on it to eliminate the use of real cash which is a great idea), total cost for a person over 1.1 meters tall was $225 durum ($60 AUD). We purchased the Dubai entertainment book for $40 AUD and this park alone saved us $120 AUD, and the book has hundreds of eating outlets and things to do while in Dubai. If you are a daredevil (like me) then go on the Jumerai sceirah which is a 30 metre high water ride where you are dropped into the ride and slide on your back at high speed. Also the water rides are up hill which has to be a first!!
Fun Fun Fun. For the best laugh and to keep utterly cool. Need to wear a hat all the time. The rides are fun and somewhat scary. Others are calm and serene. Get used to the looks if you are my age!!!

Great fun and nice and cool. Loved everything about this park. Food was reasonably priced. I would recommend you get there early so you can grab a couple of loungers which are a great meeting place if everybody wants to go off and do their own thing. Wild wadi runs a money-free system which is really good. You load up your waterproof watch with money and then buy your purchases throughout your day with said watch. Any credit left over is paid back to you when you leave. They also sell swimwear and protective shirts if you don't have them (at a premium, of course).All in all a great day out.
Have a Fun Day!. Excellent place with plenty of rides and slides. Don't forget to take your swim suits as things can be very expensive inside wadi.

Wild Wadi totally awesome!!. We spent the entire day at wild Wadi today and had loads of fun. Having been to aqua adventure a few days ago, this was an even better experience. We have been to lots of water parks but this was by far the best. The rides are fun and there is something for both young and old. The parks opened at 10:00 around the time we arrived. We managed to get loungers at the waves which was an ideal location as we could watch the kids and relax. Food and beverages are not allowed in but there is plenty of fast food outlets. A pizza and pepsi is round 50 dirhams. They operate on a cashless system whereby cash is loaded onto a watch and all payments are deducted accordingly. There is also a fish spa which is 50 dirhams if u are adventurous. Taxi's are readily available to and from the park. Overall a day well spent.
Nice water park!. Its a great water park! they have nice rides! and lovely staff members, very helpful. They have nice food.

Great fun for all ages. We have been to the water park a few times & had fun with all the family - young & old. Even at busy times you can get a sunbed etc. There are great slides etc no matter age or swimming ability.

Fabulous water park for families. I unfortunately wasnt well the day we visited but the rest of the family had a great time whilst I lay in the sun! Our 6 year old son had the most amazing time & was a total daredevil and didnt skip a single ride! The park was clean, staff on hand and the food fresh & tasty with pizza cooked to order. It's quite expensive but you do expect that in Dubai

Heaps of fun for all ages. Mid week not crowded. Good variety of water slides ranging from insane to children's wading pool. Free entry if you are staying the Jumeriah Beach Hotel. Walk ways can be slippery so be careful.Towel supplied.Food is burgers and the like.
So much fun!. We had an absolute blast here! The rides were fun with just the right amount of scary, there was something for everyone! The queues were not too long and the staff were fantastic!

Best water park we've been to. We visited both Wild Wadi and Aquaventure whilst in Dubai and were a party of 4 adults. For us Wild Wadi was hands down the best park. Most rides use inflatables and there are 2 rides where 4 of you are in the inflatable together. Tantrum Alley was our favourite ride. There is a real variety of rides, they have a wave pool and areas for sun bathing. The park is compact. You feel like you are getting value for money with the length of the rides. We went early in the morning to miss the queues. If you go as soon as the park opens or late afternoon, you will miss the worst queues.

Perfect for children and adults. Fun, fun, fun. This is how I would describe the whole adventure. Lots of things to do, both for adults and small children. things where you can be quiet while they sleep or be loud and wild. facilities are great, located conveniently from any scene. If you were to choose, I would suggest this one over Atlantis water park.

Kids entertained for hours!. We had a great time at Wild Wadi, the park is spotlessly clean, well organised and all rides are very well supervised. My kids loved the slides and played for hours in the wave pool.Photographers are all over the park taking family pics and impromptu pics in the middle of the rapids. The photos came out very well but I felt they were quite expensive. There are a variety of food options in the park for lunch and snacks, shops selling swimwear, T shirts, flip flops etc. We arrived as the doors opened and got sunbeds by the wave pool, this was a great location for us right next to the kids area. The staff were all so friendly and helpful and the whole day was great. My kids did not want to leave ! Can't wait to visit again next time we are in Dubai.

Splash And Fun. Great way to beat the summer heat in Dubai. An ideal location for tourists and a common location for residents of the U.A.E, as Summer hits. The water is always temperature controlled and the rides are exhilarating!

Superb. Great facilities and amazing rides. Waiting time at the surfing station quite long but the rest were just fine. Clean surrounding though not enough deck chairs. Had to fight with one of the pushy locals who conveniently removed my towel and placed hers.

Great fun as good as Aquaventure. I was wondering which water park was the best Wild Wadi v Aquaventure at Atlantis in Dubai so I just went to both and Im glad I did. They are both super and as good as each other so try both if you can. Not allowed your own food in which is a joke so I just head my tuna rolls in my towel lol.If you have to go on a Friday or Saturday get there early as the queues at lunch and the afternoon are crazy. Very popular destinations.Both parks are part of hotels (Wild Wadi is Jumeriah and Aquaventure is Atlantis)

Really good afternoon out. Really enjoyed the waterpark and it's good to see everyone joining in no matter what religion or sex. If you go on any of the bigger rides, get your own inner tube - don't share!
