Good Day. My family found this a little tame compared to the rides at Siam water park in Tenerife( the wave pool there is just terrific) and the water parks in the US. Very busy at Easter - queued for over an hour to do the body boarding which was a new experience for everyone.

Fun Day out.... This waterpark is the best one in Dubai. Everytime we go we have a fantastic time. The best rides are Tantrum Alley and Burj Surge....Tantrum Alley maked me scream like a small child. The lazy rivers are good and have rides every couple of minutes as you flow around. Another good thing about this place is some of the ride push you up rather than down if that makes any sense. The day we went was quite hot but the floor was being sprayed with water and the lifeguards were throwing water over everyone. Thank you for such a great day Wild Wadi.

had great fun. went to wild wadi during December with my cousins and and spent whole day. it was fully crowded. you have to wait in long queues for every ride but it is worth waiting. the staff were very friendly. Some of the rides are very thrilling. I would love to go again during summer

A bit of a splash. Well worth a visit. Not as good as atantis water park but still worth going. Food is available whilst you are there. There are sun beds too. Nice and cool flooring as its sprayed with the water

A fun couple of hours. Went as free entry with our hotel. As with all the jumeirah properties it was spotlessly clean, very friendly staff and loads of life guards. Rides were fun and we had no queuing ( went thurs am). Didn't eat in there and only spent money on locker hire ( which we didn't really need as you can't quite happily leave basics on your subbed )

Best family day ever. Great fun for all ages, mum and dad too, spent the whole day there and it was fantastic .nice places to sit and chill out, good variety of food, and thrill seeking rides that suit all levels.

Great family venue. Good attraction with a host of rides for all ages within the complex.Plenty of space for a chilled day out but all food is held at reception to ensure that the client has to purchase onsite which can result in a great expense for a medium sized family.Good view of the iconic Burg Al Arab hotel.Book online for easier entry.Car parking is abundant and close by.Enjoy your day here, I did.

Best waterpark going..... This place is awsome....great rides / shoots, relaxed atmosphere, a great day out for all....think the adults have more fun than the kids....the fod available needs a little work though....

Awesome day out. I visited both waterparks (Aquaventure and Wild Wadi) when visiting Dubai. Wald Wadi seems a bit older and weary but the rides are faster and more thrilling. If you have younger kids (under 1.2m), I would suggest Aquaventure, if you are looking for more adventure, go for Wild Wadi.On Thursday evenings, it is women only.

Very refreshing. Whist attending a conference we had the chance to enjoy Wild Wadi. It was such a fun refreshing time.It has enough to keep you entertained for a few hours, without kids. If the kids were here you would need the day!Enough to do and the queues were okay.The highlight was the big drop ride, whatever it was called, not for the fainthearted. Loads of rides/slides to go on.Loads of people to help on the day so all good.

Amazing / Fun / Awesome / Wooohooo!!!. Atlantis is so overrated….go to Wild Wadi instead!!!The queues are shorter than its competitor out on the palm, the staff are always smiling and friendly and you can tell they genuinely want you to have fun….and the rides are AMAZING!!There’s no need to take a camera around as there are photographers everywhere and you can purchase your photos before you leave the park. Lockers and change rooms are available.It’s a great water park with fantastic views of the Burj Al Arab and surrounding area, once you get through the front gate you will not be bored.The only negative I have is their unfair discount policy which is for Navy personnel only, Army and Air Force get nothing.
Fun and Water. A great way to spend a sunny afternoon, with a bit of a thrill thrown in.First time the crazygroup has experienced a water slide uphill

Wild Wadi. Dislike Expensive a family of four i had little change from £200 I went twice what the hell i was on holiday.Photos from wild wadi start at £15 each, take a waterproof digital camera Not allowed to take your own food or drink.Avoid Friday and Saturday very busy.Food and drink bit limited to fat food and cesar salad. Taxi hard to get at closing time should be a taxi stand formedPositivesThe smile son my kids faces said it all to me and the smile on my face, be prepared for the kids to run riot in a good way. Food and drink reasonably pricedgreat place to chill and relax..... need to review pricing though as it is not cheap.

amazing. amazing amazing amazing 100 times better than aquaventure totally wacky and outlandish so much fun and excitement you can even spend the whole day right from open till close and you will not get bored, i have to say the food tastes very much processed like burgers not fresh but then again that is down to so many ready made stuff now given in theme and waterparks. but overall great water park best in the world

SQUISHY SQUASHY. My top of the best during my stay in the palm dessert state...Loved every single slide ride especially the one that takes you right through the pitch dark tunnel where everyone starts screaming......Awesome...One tip....don't try the Jumeirah Sceraih slide if you eat pizza with a fork...

Excellent water park just gets better every time 5stars. Been to wild wadi twice and it never fails to thrill excellent water rides for all ages and an excellent play area for kids and adults too and watch out for the revolving drum which dumps hundreds of gallons of water every few minutes no need to carry any cash around as credit can be added to a wrist watch and will deduct anything you buy in the park any remaking credit is refunded on the way out thrilling day out with the kids is always on my list to visit whenever I'm in dubai with the family

Just The Best. A completely wonderful day out. The park itself is just marvellous with an wonderful choice of slides and activities for all levels. The staff are just great and the speed with which you get Horus he queues is fab.We spent a couple of hours the day before at the Atlantis watermark - which is a complete dog's dinner in comparison. The WWWP is just stunning in comparison. Everything works, then paving doesn't remove the skin from the soles of your feet and you don't have to go one on one with every Russian in the ark just to hold you place in the queue for your toddler!!!Well worth the money and a fabulous event to remember the holiday by.

So Much Fun. Wild Wadi Waterpark is an amazing place! I had so much fun there, it is a very enjoyable experience for everyone! Some of the rides are more intense than others, but for me it was a very enjoyable experience. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rides are awesome! I went on everything at least twice.The Jumeirah Sceirah appears VERY intense and scary, I wasn't going to go on it at first, but I changed my mind and did. I won't lie, it was scary but it is over within a few seconds and it was actually fun. I recommend Wild Wadi to everyone looking for a fun day out! :)

Exciting Day out !. We visited the wild wadi park in March 2013 again and were pleasantly surprized by the renovation work and the addition of some new exciting rides. Although we were not able to enjoy the rides which were not for the faint hearted however we thoroughly enjoying watching them. Overall it is good fun ,full day adventure - one Tip every hotel has got brochures of wild wadi on which you get a good discount(coupon inside) .

Amazing Fun For Everyone & Anyone!. Had Amazing fun here couple of weeks ago with my wife who was hesitant to go here but she enjoyed it more than me. Has a wide variety of rides for all ages from old to young and it is simply amazing really enjoyed it here.Also has a good variety of cafe & food shops but very expensive but for a day it is not going to matter. However I would advise to bring your own towels as it costs 30AED but better to hire a locker. Approx time here at the water-park spent around about 4-5 hours as otherwise will get very tired.Pros: Nice Location with Great View, Over 12+ Rides, Lockers & Toilets everywhere, Easy to get on rides without waitingCons: Towels Expensive, Food Expensive but you would except that, sometimes a bit overcrowded.Out of a rating of 10 I would give this a 9. Simply AMAZING!!!!

So Thrilling. Wildwadi is so thrilling. you never know how the time elapses. The guards are so keen that you feel safe. The slides , pools and rides are so good that they remove Adrenaline out of you. The artificial wave is so enticing

Wild wadi is a place to be. Wow! what a breath taking. some slides make sure your Adrenaline is high. Time flies so fast that by evening you might not have covered all themes. This place is fun. This is a must visit for everyone. Dubai is a must visit. The artificial wave..... this is just too god to resist

Splashing. We had an absolute out of this world day ! All the rides are great and the staff who we dealt with were all very friendly and helpful. The life guards are very alert and ready to assist if necessary. The park is well kept. We enjoyed a wonderful lunch at Ali's BBQ.Jumeirah Sceirah was the utmost favourite !

Fantastic water park.. A great range of watery slides, pools and rides. I thought my friend and I would be by far the oldest there but there were heaps of adults enjoying the fun. The views of Dubai throughout the park are wonderful. Be prepared to wander around all day in just your swimmers (fortunately there are very few mirrors!).

Great. Great for all ages... Lots to do, and places to eat and relax! JUST DONT GO IN SUMMER!!! you can bearly walk on the ground though they try their best to wet the ground as much as possible so that it cools it down it makes no difference in summer! however, I enjoyed it the first and second time I went but would not visit it again, once is enough to get the full effect and not get bored. The large lazy river is for the parents whom have come along with their kids and just want to unwind! water is clean and for the most part the life guards and attendants are friendly and speak/ greet you in your respective language!!

Great antidote for the heat. Great for young kids and great for fun seeking young kids. It's also not bad for adults to chill out whilst their offspring run themselves daft but it's pricey without a voucher and the food is fairly shabby and of the burgerchain strain. Good fun but I wouldn't return.

Be sure you'll have a fun-filled day. It is a wonderful place for everyone: family, friends, teens, children... whether you like the attractions or even if you're there just for the pool and sunbathing. Avoid Friday as it gets extremely crowded. Some attractions are moderate, others are wild, so everyone can find their deal. Security and guidance are at its best at this place. There are nice places for eating or for a snack. Entrance fee is very reasonable for the quality and services.Tip: Don't miss the fish spa! You'll get amazed at how your feet look yummy for these little monsters lol

Water Everywhere. This was for our kids. Unfortunately we-parents- could not go inside to watch even though we had no intention whatsoever to use the facility. This we found a bit hard as the entry fee is not cheap at all. We dropped the kids off and upon return had to wait for them to come out as we could not go inside. The kids enjoyed themselves.
Great family waterpark. This is an excellent place to go when the weather is hot as there are so many rides to get wet and cool off that it almost seems endless!

Wild Wadi 1 v Atlantis Waterpark 0. This is the second time I have visited Wild Wadi (the first being nearly 2 years ago, my husband has been 6 times), we visited here but this time with our 2 teenage girls on Good Friday, the day before we had gone to the Atlantis Waterpark. This waterpark is so much better than the Atlantis, we arrived and went straight through. Bearing in mind our previous visit (we had stayed at the jumeirah beach hotel which was free access to the waterpark so we didn't take towels as we were given them last time as part of the access), this time though they weren't included so I dont know if thats because we were residents or not, anyway, we had to either hire them or buy them. For AED30 you could hire them or for AED45 you could buy them... we bought them. The cashier asked us about the meal deal which was something like 40% cheaper if you bought it on entrance so we did but in hindsight we shouldn't have because this entitled you to only certain meals (this consisted of a burger, chips, side salad, melon and drink - a bit too much food when you are in a waterpark to be honest). Also once you had purchased your meal deal/locker/towels you are given a plastic watch which is credited with the money so you dont have the trouble of having to carry cash around with you, which is not good when you are in a waterpark (certain parts of the Atlantis food/drinks kiosks you have to pay in cash). There is also free water fountains here at Wild Wadi which is a nice touch.This place just seemed so better organised that it made it throughly more enjoyed. Even the queues for the rides seemed quicker. You generally got to a sign that said 15 minutes wait from here and it was no where near that.Since we went nearly 2 years ago the Jumeirah Scerah has changed, it is now enclosed and you climb into a box and there is a countdown until the "trap door" opens. There are so many photographers scattered around the place but unfortunately they are very very expensive (3 photos and a USB for I think it was around AED650 or if you didnt want the Wild Wadi picture frame you paid about AED120 for one). If they made the pictures cheaper it would be a whole lot better.Its not the newest water park in Dubai but in my opinion its the best and I will definitely be back.
well managed. temperature in wave pool was warm and nice, staff was very efficient even upto finding you a taxi. overall a fab experience and this is mainly because they have so many employees.

Great Fun - Expensive, but Good Day Out. I found Wild Wadi to be a very pleasant water park, especially since there was something for the entire family! There were four-person max. rides that were very child-friendly, while at the same time thrill-inducing for everyone else. You are eligible to ride every single water ride at the park, as long as you're 1.1m tall! ;) Don't worry, there's a measuring station for the little ones at the entrance. I enjoyed the rides, and there were frequent little ice cream stands, and several places to dine - but no one comes to water parks for the food! One thing I found helpful which I hadn't seen at a water park before was hot chocolate! Hot chocolate is the perfect thing to warm you up after another swim/water ride at around 5pm, which was sold at all of the kiosks at the park. There were a total of 11 rides - not too many to get lost in, but not too little to get bored of, which I appreciated. Although if you have older kids that want more, wilder rides, the Atlantis would likely be the better option, Wild Wadi is definitely a good deal smaller, easier to navigate, less overwhelming, and better for younger children!

Fun!. Great waterpark with lots to offer. For the big rides, the kids have to be 1.1. meters so our 4 year old was left out of most of the fun while our 6 year old got to ride. For the little ones, there was only the kids play area (which was huge), the wave pool, and the lazy river. The staff were all very nice! I suggest buying tickets online to avoid the huge lines. We went on a Tuesday and got there at 1000 and there weren't any lines. Starting around 3pm, it was very busy.
Smelly. Unfortunately the place smelt of fried food and the chlorine smelt horrid too. The queues weren't too bad but you felt like you needed footwear on the stairways as they felt slimy!

Good day but I think I prefer the one at the Atlanta's hotel. Just returned from Dubai and we had a wonderful time at this attraction. If you can cope with being pushed out of the way by Russians continuously then you will probably enjoy it. However, manners of many take a lot to be desired! The lazy ride round the entire park is not as good as the Atlantis. I would say in all the rides are better than the Atlantis. Security and safety seemed to be going pretty well I would say on average there are more lifeguards than there are at the Atlantis. However, there are far too many empty rings going around and around which get in the way. The food is pretty bad but if you like hot dogs then you will love it. All in all, it's a great family day out but with some simple and straightforward improvements from the management, things could be improved considerably. I love Dubai and I've lived there for many years previously. For me if I were to go back to a waterpark I would go the extra mile or two and go to The Atlantis.

Wonderful time at Wild Wadi. I had a wonderful time. Lockers a little expensive though, but in general I was very satisfied with the staff, attractions, prices, temperature of the water and cleanliness of the park and water. I would recommend you to give it a try.

Could have killed my daughter. I went with my 7 year old daughter on the ride which goes all around the park. The double rafts are supposed to have a closed bottom for kids to fit in safely. Unfortunately they are all broken. I was holding my daughter with my knees, a lifeguard forced me to keep my daughter sitting on my feet instead, this was apparently the decision of the "safety commission" of the park, rather than buying proper rafts.The raft was poorly inflated and on the tallest corner my daughter bounced off. There are no protective nets and she skid along the edge of the 60 ft fall on the verge of falling off. I could not stop the raft and was about to run her over when finally I managed to get off it and head first had some level of control. The water jets propelling the rafts upstream were not switched off and the little girl tumbled helplessly up the slide among shouts of terror. When she finally reached one of the intermediate pools the lifeguard did not notice. I was right behind and brought her up. She is a good swimmer, but paralysed by panic could not get out of the water. I am young and fit, my girl is a good swimmer. I was cautious on the ride and followed the WRONG safety instructions I was given. . I practice extreme sports and I am not easily scared. This time I was petrified and can only thank god to have my little girl peacefully sleeping here with me. The park management will respond and blame the lifeguard, mind you other guards and the supervisor told me that as a remedy to the broken double rafts the "sit on dad's feet" safety position had to be adopted. They will present their outstanding safety record, but are you willing to risk your kid's life for a slide?I have been to the park before and know for a fact that the kid's rafts used to be there, few in numbers, many broken, but some used to be available. I looked long for the kids rafts, asked the life guards but none exist anymore.I got lucky once I won't try again. In short: don't do it to your kids!

Too expensive for too little. This place is not worth the money. We were 2 adults and 2 kids (3 and 5) and paid almost 300 dollars for just a couple of attractions for our kids. Jumaira beach is much better alternative for families with young kids.

It's good but pricey. I had complimentary pass from the hotel so I thought I'd give it a try. I tried the water slide (the really high one, forgot the name) and I have to say it was quite a thrill. As a couple it was fine but I took a few kids I can imagine it to be an expensive day out - £6 for a small locker?!
Kids had great fun. It was really the best place to go in 45 degree heat throughout the whole day. We didn't even see the kids!

Exciting Rides. Entrance can be expensive so look out for the offers in Dubai Explorer and Time Out. The cashless system is perfect for this kind of activity, just load up your wrist band and use it to activate a locker / buy food drinks and souvenirs - anything you haven’t spend at the end of your visit is refunded. The rides were exciting and fun and the whole place was really clean, the staff were great too. We went in the school holidays so weren’t really surprised at having to queue for 25 mins for some of the more popular slides. Bikini’s can be worn although they take some hanging onto on some slides - the park provide rash vests to put over bikini's to avoid embarrassment on the flow rider surf rides. Overall great day out!

A decent water park with stunning views. Whilst visiting my dad in Dubai with my mother, we visited Wild Wadi and it was enjoyable. The first ride I went on was the water coaster that consisted of about eleven slides with small shallow pools and friendly, helpful staff between each one, although the bumps on the upwards slopes were a bit painful. I also floated along the lazy river and went on an intense waterslide on a raft. The other things I liked about the water park were the wave pool that was pleasant enough to swim in; the sun lounger area where we got incredible views of the Burj Al Arab, the wave pool and Jumeirah Beach Hotel; the wristbands where money could be added and used to buy anything around the water park from souvenirs to generous servings of watermelon; and the cleanliness and the privacy of the changing room. Some of the slides were hard to find initially, but I got there in the end. Overall, Wild Wadi is a decent place to have fun whilst staying in Dubai. 4/5.

Expensive but overall worth a visit. For two of us it was about 85 Gbp however this did include Locker higher and a towel... Being the best in the world I was expecting more... I have to say typhoon lagoon in Orlando has much scarier rides and more adrenaline pumping ones but it was a good day...like the fact you don't need to carry rings anywhere as the rides shoot you up inside them.. Few scrapes from the walls where you have to use feet to stop but all good
crowded. You need to get there early to get a lounge chair, as they fill up fast. Bring your own towels and flip flops. You can put them in a locker.

Wow.. Wow.. Wow... Brilliant waterpark.. much better than some we have been to..nearly on a par with the waterparks in Florida. Family loved the huge kamikaze water slide..but not one for the fainthearted..has got fantastic views of the gulf from the top. Definitely worth a visit.
The best water park in Dubai. Dont bother with Aqua adventure, Wild Wadi is the original and best. The uphill water-slide especially worth the ride.

Very good fun!. A great waterpark that actually caters for both small children right up to adults with some pretty good white knuckle rides. i was impressed by the number of lifeguards on duty and they certainly keep their eyes peeled.The only downside is its quite expensive. Me and my 7 year old daughter went and it came to 400dhs, which is about £80Overall a fab place

The best fun ever!. I've been to most of the aqua parks stateside but this far exceeded my experiences there, it is sooo much fun, we laughed all the way round!There are special shoots to carry you up the water shoots in your doughnut; you don't even need to get out and climb up steps, it shoots you up to the tops of the slides! Well except for e mega high one which still, to my disbelief I went down. It was scarey and exhilarating.....and one I won't do again!It's an all day thing for the whole family, there's lots of places to lay on sunbeds if you just want to watch, food is available and good changing areas and showers. Definately an all day funday that I would highly recommend.

A good day out for all. This water park was good fun. Not too big that you'd lose your friends but big enough to chill out and relax after taking in some of the slides etc. the main slide is not for the faint hearted though!!! I almost had a heart attack! Hahaha

Good fun, but could be improved.. Wild Wadi has a whole range of unique rides - it's overall very fun and I would definitely go there again. My only complaint is that at the end of some slides, you arrive too fast and end up slamming your feet into the walls - some walls aren't padded and I did get a few scratches on my legs and feet. Another thing that could definitely be improved are the locker rooms - they're grotty, look dirty and smell. Other than that Wild Wadi is great fun for all ages. I've been on both my visits to Dubai.

great. really nice water park and about 9/10 rides could be queing about 20 mins on some rides food expensive inside the park and they charge for lokers so take less and share locker with who u go with

Inadequate protocols mar what was otherwise a great family holiday. The stay at the Jumeriah Al Qasr Madinat had up to the trip to Wild Wadi been nothing more than idyllic. One hour in to our long awaited trip to the water park the visit came to a grinding halt when my daughters 10 & 8 were suspended halfway up a water powered flume because the water had been turned off as a young boy above them had fallen out of his rubber ring. I was still waiting in the holding pool at the bottom of the slide.The resulting action by the “Life Guard” was to deploy a piece of wood across the entrance to the slide preventing the queuing people behind (which included me) from accessing the entrance. Next the life guard walked up the slide to escort my daughters to the bottom. She then started to panic and asked the resident photographer what she should do. She then asked my eldest daughter to climb over the partition which involved climbing over the now installed piece of wood which we were to subsequently find was raged along its edge. As my 10 year old tried to climb over the obstruction I realised there was a height difference between the level of the bottom of the slide and the floor of the holding pool - but by then it was too late. She slipped coming down hard onto the edge of the wood. I helped her over as she was by now in floods of tears and shaking uncontrollably. A French guest waiting in the holding pool next to me informed me “she has blood coming from her bikini.” The guard by now seemed even more disorganised and bewildered than before not knowing what to do as the whole catalogue of events unfolded. We received no attention from this or any other members of staff. I then escorted my daughter now in shock back to our sun beds to meet my husband and collect our belongings, I now realised my daughter was bleeding internally. We organised our own return to the Al Qasr. The nature of the injury meant for the following few days my daughter could not swim or walk any distance as the wound was open and she sustained bruising around her crouch. Although the number of guards at Wild Wadi seemed adequate this incident can only ask if the training and strategies employed to deal with such incidents are adequate. This will not deter us from holidaying again in Jumeriah but next time we will not be visiting Wild Wadi

A great day out.... Woop Woop...What a great place....I think it needs a lick of paint as you can tell its over ten years old..The slides were great the water was lovely and warm.. The eating areas were priced and great and also lovely sunbating platform areas..In all a great day out overlooking two fantastic hotels..

Fun for kids and adults. We visited Wild Wadi in January.I am not a fan of water parks and so was expecting to NOT enjoy myself - i don't swim! But, my husband and I took our two kids (aged 4 and 5 and a half and learning to swim) and we had a blast!We stuck to the attractions that were suitable for their ages - we started out at Juha's Journey. The staff were professional, if a bit brisk and my butt was numb from being in the somewhat cool water but it was a nice float around the "river" in our large doughnut floaters. Juha's Dhow and Lagoon was a hit with me and my kids - we spent hours on the slides, being water-dumped and screaming like banshees each time!A piece of advice: rent extra towels for the kids - it tends to get chilly and their teeth start to chatter from the cold!I would have rated Wild Wadi excellent but for the fact that the toilets are in one location only - at the entrance. I had to make the long trip to the toilets twice, scurrying along with my toddler doing a skip, hop and dance all the way and with both of us yelling "hold it! hold it" all the way!

An enjoyable experience. Although I kind of expect more from the famous wild wadi dubai in terms of water rides, i still snjoy my visit. Its a plus factor that burj al arab and jumeirah hotel are its backdrop, just amazing..

some good water fun. Wild Wadi cannot be compared to Atlantis. Atlantis is more large scale...bigger,bolder, better. Wild Wadi is a smaller version of the same kind of water park theme. It is definitely more small children friendly with lots of rides and activities geared towards the younger children too. The surfing looks super fun. The only negative that I have for the place is the use of wristwatch type of bands when entering the water park. They are not the most cleverest of designs. My son went on one of the slides and the wristband got stuck to something on the way down scraping his wrist. Not a big injury but still for a child its a huge issue. My word of warning...once in, take the wristbands out and keep them safe till you have to hand it back to the staff before leaving the waterpark.
great fun. we had free entry passes with our hotel booking (Jumeirah Beach) and I had great fun with my 8-year old son.
Wet, wild and fun. Simply super - a must for adults and kids alike...Thursdays is Ladies Day - so as a male - dont go on Thursdays! HA :-)

Overprices and crowded. Wild Wadi waterpark is an experience I would never recommend to anyone. 1. Overpriced - $70 for entrance per person, $10 for towel rental etc2. Very small and tighly-packed territory - you're constantly risking to run into someone but struggling to find a start point for slides3. The park claims to have over 20 slides however they are not separate attractions but just a few sequences of slides - means there are only a couple of entrances to the slides - you can easily wait for 40 minutes for just ONE RIDE (long one but still - only 1 ride!)4. After your long ride you finish on a completely different side of the park and you have to go long way to find you slippers (walking barefoot is not comfortable)5. Very few sun-loungers/chairs - hard to find a spare one6. Overall - very, very crowded even outside of weekendA few things which were good:1. Bracelet cash system (but it becomes industry standard already)2. Personnel is extremely polite and helpfulHowever - again - I would not recommend this waterpark. I've visited waterparks in 5 countries - Czech, Egypt, Turkey, Ukraine, Russia - but Wild Wadi was the worst of all.

Wild Wadi - A fun family Day Out!. Located next to the Jumeriah Beach Hotel. It can get a bit crowded during school holidays so arrive early. Admission and food prices are a little expensive. Some good rides. A fun day out. The kids will love it!
great assortment of rides. excellent family fun with something for everyone. Not cheap (but then what is in Dubai), but a great day out.

Worth a visit just to tick off list. We got here at about 10.30 so queues were not too bad we had an Entertainer voucher so saved us some money. We opted to get 1 locker and share when we got in they were seperate in the mens and ladies changing rooms which was a pain plenty of people just buy 1 as expensive so there should be a comunal locker area. The rides were ok we were disapointed as 2 adults we couldnt share a double ring for the rides that push u up the slides that took away alot of the enjoyment of them. The freefall ride was great and a must do just a treak to get up to. We had done the rides in a couple of hours so tried to find a sunbed to dry off took a while but found 2. We then left. Was a little disapointed as not a huge amount of slides expected more but worth a visit. The kids area looked great. TIP dont go on a Friday as we were leaving it was jam packed and the queues were massive.

Laugh at near death experience. I have been to this water park on many occasions, however, I would normally have chosen Atlantis, for the overall "day out experience"A number of new rides are visible from the coast road, so we ventured back in. Fantastic! The park has the same feel, not as spacious as Atlantis, but the new rides overcome any issue with space. We laughed all the way down... again... and .... again.

Great family fun. But the food and beverage is awful. Wild Wadi is a Dubai institution. Come on holiday here with children and it's mandated that you'll end up here. The rides are great and staff are professional. So far, so good. But watch out for the food and drinks. Extremely expensive for the usual pizzas, deep fried chips and burgers. By the way, when are 5 star venues going to realize that spaghetti with tomato sauce does not constitute the "healthy" kids option? But as with all similar theme parks you are stuck with this, because you are not allowed to bring in any of your own food or drink. ( last time they checked my bags, sheesh! ) Never mind, you'll still have fun and your children will see it as a holiday highlight.

Like all waterparks in Dubai.....completely overpriced. I'll say for this exactly what I said for Aquaventure waterpark: The park is not bad but its hugely overpriced for what you are getting. If you are with kids under 8 years old, there's also not many things they can go on which is a total waste. There are other waterparks outside of the cities which in my opiniion are way more worth it. - i.e. Iceland and dreamland.

great views and normal slides. went there with my wife..first of all..it s too over crowed....can't find a place to settle also...After 20 min of looking for sunbed..we got it ..staffs are great...except from some egypt guys...all the slides are normal but fun...i rather go aquaventure...Overal we had fun day.
Splashing Time. We had a splashing time at Wild Wadi Water Park on our visit to Dubai in March 2013. A must for your Dubai itinerary. It has something for all ages to chill out.

Fun but overpriced. wild wadi is a nice park but it seems a bit small there was a waiting line for the rides with the rubber bands which is never good food and admission are overpriced 40 pounds is too much

Fantastic but lift your bottom as you go over the jets!. Brilliant place, went with two teenage sons and had a blast. Very organised, unbelievable amount of lifeguards and staff on hand at every turn. Good clean fun.
An oasis of water. There isnt a water park in the world the Wadi has to envi. It has great slides, waves, canals and all the ameneties and bells and whistles of an outstanding water park

A great afternoon's fun. It's not a huge park, but for a few hours you will have a lot of fun on the vertical drop slides and as a couple or group of friends, the rubber ring slides are a huge laugh. Definitely worth going to, although my tip would be to do the sun downers time - when it's cheaper but you can still get everything done.
Great place. very family friendly ,enjoy hours of fun in water ,great theme ,very clean ,very helpful staff .You will defenitely enjoy the challanges specially the great slide from the top!!!!

Go early in the day. There are some good runs for all ages from about 4 upwards. Most are on rings or inflatables and do not need a lot of energy as they blast you uphill to come down again .... a great idea and a lot of fun. It is not as big as other sites but worth a 1/2 day out.

Fun afternoon. Went with a group of nine The rides were great everyone had fun but you probably don't need a full day there. Food was nice, nothing special and rather expensive, but not unexpectedly so.We rented a cabana which was GREAT! Again, not cheap, but totally worth it. Having shade with a six year old at a water park is important. They provide towels and cold water in the cabana as well as restaurant service. Anything you want they will get for you. Leeza was our hostess and was really great!All in all a nice day and glad we went!

Fun and Relaxing. TONS of fun water rides for the whole family - it was awesome!! We spent two days there and never got bored. The food was good, our 7 year old daughter (who was just a little bit too short for the rides at Atlantis) could go on all the rides here and she still enjoyed the kid park and wave pool. Relaxing in the chairs was great too!Get there at opening time for no lines and a lounge chair. Local hotels have discount cards. Towel rental prices were a bit pricy - recommend you bring your own.Next time, we would stay in the hotel attached to this water park - it was that much fun!
The best. Can't think of anything but the best to describe Wild Wadi, I've been going there for years and years now, same good old fun place. Nothing beats it for a stress relief! Full of excitement.

Amazing rides - relaxing lazy river. We went with 3 small children - something for everyone. The lazy river and the kids splash areas are fantastic for the children (and us) to cool down.Top tip - keep drinking and use lots of sun cream - cover up your children as your always moving and you can't store sun cream by the pool - need to keep going back to the locker (kids hate this) We used factor 50 swim safe (good for a few hours) and used uv tops for all children and husband!!

Wow, please try the fastest waterslide. If you are a thrill seeker this is one all bad bottie waterslide! I think about it months after I was here. It's a lazy man's water park, the slides shoot you up to the top on a little tube so you can come down without having to trek up stairs, pretty cool!

Aqua Park. Went this weak to wild wadi , like always i go ,only this time i took my mum 76 year old , she wanted o stay next to the kids play area to see the grand child playing ,unfortunatly no seating or lounges avaialable , there should be some for older people, but then i meet Celine what a help , very nice person helpfull , polite , educated , all the best i can talk about her , immediatly try to help me , she helped me and alocated me a palce where i could accomodate my mum.Celine u r the best help i got in wild wadi

Confusing. If you get motion sickness, beware - you can be on a 'blue' ride and suddenly you're going down a 'red' bit (the clue was in the title - 'Tunnel of Doom') with no choice in the matter. None of the staff could direct us to the 'yellow' or 'green' rides, they didnlt even understand what we meant, even though (obviously) we got these gradings from the signs in the park. Not impressed.

A very cool waterpark. I don't have much experience with waterparks, but this one is big and offers plenty to keep one occupied, both adults and kids alike. From tube rides, surfing, water dunking to the lazy river rides, as well as eating and curio shops, this is definitely a great way to cool off in this hot city. It does get busy though and you may queue for some of the rides, but it will be worth it.
yes! perfect. great fun for me .. and the kids I am sure :) we spend a morning and most of early afternoon enjoying the rides and the waves. come early if you visit on weekend

Exquisite experience for all. Wild Wadi is a wonderful place to hang out for whole day.Awesome rides and excellent experience for everyone.One of the most interesting and tough ride i found was "water rafting"You won't find rafting ride in Atlantis aquaventure.Rest all rides are funYou will also have an profound view of Burj Al arabAdvise: If visiting first time and want to save money for taxi, get dropped at Dubai Internet City and catch a cab which will approximately cost 20-25 dirham.

Heap of fun for young and old(-ish). I cannot compare this with other parks in Dubai, but we had a lot of fun! The lines start at the ticket booth and continue from ride to ride. I think in 7h we only got 7 rides in (and then 1h for lunch). While the park claims to have over 30 rides, it is actually much less, but i.e. ride #1 is described to combine 11 rides (it has 11 rapids, each has its own name, hence they get to over 30) ... but nothing much to complain about it. This way you only line up once. In the end I would say the most fun ride was the Jumeirah Sceirah (nearly free-fall), but you line up 30 minutes for a 45 second slide. I was positively surprised that the lunch options were not a total rip off (other theme parks take note, I am especially looking at you Disney). The cashless payment system is also nice. They ask you at the entrance how much you want to put on that, before you have any clue how much things are. But worry not, what is left on your wristband can later be refunded.Highly recommended!
Average rides but enjoy. This water park is included in our hotel stay at Jumera Bach hotel. Activities limited, but on the action with child and families you can enjoy.
Wet & Wonderfull. Excellent variety of shutes, rides ,waterfalls and pools to keep the adrenalin flowing fast. Well worth a visit if you like getting wet and adventurous.

Great Place for Families and Friends. Wild Wadi is a place for all ages from 100 to 6 months old. Kids will enjoy their time there. My brothers and i spent the whole day. In my opinion the food inside is overpriced, but other than that its great for families. Finding taxis are easy and no hassle. One important thing Lockers are PAID!!!! =(

Horrible place. Well first of all I spoke to that guys who are working over there and they told me that they change water only once or maximum twice in a year, second is unbelievable crowd and row when getting in and that's half of the problem even when you get inside it's the same horrible blasted row on rides.

Amazing. An oasis in the desert! I truly recommend visiting Wild Wafi just next to the Burj AL Arab. It will easily cool you down and take you away from the shopping, shopping, shopping for at least 4 hours!

Family Fun..!. It was real fun for the whole family...
Plenty of water rides, breathtaking views of the Arabian Sea, Beach, Burj Al Arab Hotel (dubbed as the only 7 star hotel) and Jumeirah Beach Hotel...
Tad expensive @ $ 60/- per head..
Avoid going on Fridays as it tends to be overcrowded, specially during October-March months..

full day. This really is a great water park. The slides are some of the best I have ever been on. The large main pool and wave machine are excellent. Food and refreshments on site also very good. Loads for the kids to do. They thought it was brilliant.

Fun for a few hours. The kids enjoyed the rides but found that after 3 hours they Had done everything they wanted to do. The park is well set up with pleasant and helpful staff. A fun half day outing!

Disappointing!. If you visit this park and are expecting to experience an amazing water park you may well be disappointed as we were. It is very small by comparison to others we have visited and it is heaving with people. We attempted to visit twice at different times before actually going in at different times but sheer numbers of visitors seems pretty constant and there appears to be no better time to go than another. There seems to be little control over numbers allowed in and there are long queues for the few rides there are and for example, you are not allowed to spend longer than one minute on the flow rider. It is very expensive too at 225 Dirhams per person (approx. £40 each). Staff were helpful and plentiful though.
Fun but not the best. Wild Wadi is great fun but if you are visiting the UAE, and love water parks, Yas Island in Abu Dhabi is a step above. That said, Wild Wadi surpasses Atlantis for sure.

Nice place but extremelly crowded. Wild Wadi is great aquapark betwen Burj Al Arab and Jumeira Beach hotels.As guest of mentioned hotels acess is free but for others you have to pay 225 dirhams.Aquapark is very small by area,at least 3 times smaller than Aquaventure but is very charming.Main problem is number of visitors which sometmes can be 2-3 times more than its capacity and will destroy your day.Waiting in long queues to slide or to use the attractions is not worth.Only pool with waves and lazy river can be less stressfull.I do not reccomend,unless you want to visit on weekdays between 10-13
funfilled. its an amazing park next to Burj Al Arab. you can definitely have fun time with kids or friends.but i prefers aqua venture over this park!
Whao. The water park experience was so great, and since there us none like this in my country, I will visit again when I come to Dubai.

Great for all the family. Plenty of attractions here for all the family, from sedate water rides a wave pool etc... I had a go on the surf board great fun, ideal for all age ranges. Go early and spend all day, lots to see and try.

Horrible experience!. It was unbelievably crowded and they were ALL MEN, who were staring at us so much it made us very uncomfortable. The water was gross and you can see hairs in there, we felt so uncomfortable we left after one ride. It needs to be cleaner and establish a male- female ratio because we felt we were being raped with their eyes.

Children (young and old) love it. We stayed in hotel next door and had entrance into the park included in the price. Although Jumairah Beach has a lot to offer, our children wanted very day to go to Wild Wadi. Plenty of opportunities there, from soft and lazy floating in channels, towards the Jumeirah Sceirah where you almost vertically fall when the ground under your feet opens, and you reach dizzying speeds. In between you have long rides around the park in a system of boosters pushing you up, before coming down further. Also possibility to practice surf simulator, or some other more thrilling rides, unless you prefer to go to the wave pool. Having a chair close to it is almost impossible, but there are many other places, and overall you can stay quite protected from the sun if you want. Once inside some of the food comes at quite inflated prices, and the pictures definitely are priced outrageously high. But the kids enjoyed every minute of it, day after day...
Fantastic.. Wow. Great. This turned an ok holiday into a fantastic one. The leap of faith was awesome. The slides and rapids were awesome. Visited it twice, and both days were.......awesome.

What a fun place.. Great fun for all the family, It does get busy, so we arrived early, the rides - there are so many! The staff are very friendly,easy to see and able to help with all questions with a smile. Really recommend this as a day out.

Best Water Park in UAE. It was great fun , a bit pricy comparing to what you get , my wife was pregnant and hardly walk but still paid for full admonition fees , what a shame I felt they are pinnacles

A great day out. A great water park and if staying in the Jumeirah beach then access is free. We stayed in February and there were minimal queues, helpful staff and plenty of sunbeds. The rides were exciting with a good range from the lazy river to those for the more daring!

Fun & Enjoyable water park. We went to Wild Wadi while we visit Dubai and it was really fun. Very good place for family and kids. It is expensive so it's better if you stay on Jumeirah Beach Hotel so you can go to Wild Wadi for free. If you like water theme park, definitely you need to go to this place. If you want to have fun without the queue, avoid going there on weekends.

Pure fun. The best place in Dubai and everyone's favourite. I take all my guests there, and this experience is what they write home about. Pure fun. don't take water or food as it will be confiscated at the gate.

Expensive but fun. Good day out for adults and children. We were told to avoid Fridays and the weekends. So we went on a Wednesday and it was brilliant. No queues. Take your own towels or pay to hire a towel.

Wet Wet Wet. Not a great fan of these places. Hate water, hate not been in control and even scared of the deep end in my bath. So why oh why did I go? Well I went to force myself to lket go and be a little daring and I am so glad I did. I ended up on most of the moderate rides, with lots of laughs and maybe the odd scream or two. Loved the layout, as you follow the route as a family. There were loads of get of exits for those like me, so if you are a ilttle unsure please give it ago, I am so glad I did!

Great fun (but Aquaventure is better!). Wild Wadi is excellent. My 4 year old did not want to leave - ever! Having since been to Aquaventure though, I think that is better (but probably more expensive).

Even Big Kids Liked it!!. it was just a brilliant day out on all aspects. You dont even have to walk to any rides as slides will take you any where you need to go. Worth going to for the day. ITS A MUST

Still as good after so many years. Has another great was at ww. Rides are very good, safe and place was not too busy. As staying at JET we got free entry which was nice and Defoe worth a day out, some very wrong sights in and around the pool and good to see them not allowing people in the pool and on rides in underwear !!!.

Great for kids!. This park would be great for kids. As a bit of an adrenaline junkie I found the rides quite tame but also relaxing and definitely enjoyable. There are also some great views from some of the higher rides. You could definatley spend the day here cooling off. There was a fun and relaxed atmosphere but I do have to mention that strangely whilst standing around (in my bikini) some tourist men asked to take my picture. Before I could answer they were happily snapping away! I have to say that did make me slightly paranoid for the rest of the day!

A regular to Wild Wadi. I have been many times to this attraction since moving to Dubai and have to say it is an excellent day out if you enjoy water or lounging by water. A compact venue compared with Atlantis water park but more fun. Great the way you start some of the rides at the bottom where their poweful water jets fire you on your ring to the various stages and eventually to the top. There are then several choices on the way down as you wind through tunnels and round tight turns. The larger more exciting 2 - 4 man rides are well worth the climb up the stairs and once done, you will be wanting to go again. Only downside is that these rides can get busy by late morning onwards so well worth doing early. Plenty of sun loungers so you should always have a place to park yourself, lockers are available if you need one and they have a clever system by which you can have money added to your wrist band that you can then pay for drinks and food; saves carrying money. The food choice is also good and the various eating places have different choices all of which are good value for money given you are a captive audience (no food or drink allowed to be brought in, even your water will be taken off you on arrival so be warned). My friends and family always want to go to Wild Wadi every time they return; they always comment just how friendly the staff are, they do make you welcome and have an excellent attitude.

A fun filled day. Fantastic for kids. Although we are in are 30 and still had a fun day. My husband did the drop ride which you get up to speeds of 80 mph. It was off season when we went and there were no ques, I dont think it would be that fun if it was busy as you would spend a considerable amount of time waiting for a relatively short ride.

Its Good but Not Excellent. If you compare it with Aquaventure than I would give more marks to Aqua. Because its in Palm and it has more rides :) and somehow wildwadi is old now. But we had excellent and quality time at the park whole day. Hell tired and hell enjoyed. So its just a matter of right people you are going with.

Great park to cool off.. While I was not over impressed with overall quality of rides- this is still a great water park to visit.With one major slide broken down into sections, the entire slide is completed in around 8 minutes. While families will have a great time, it would push it to 5 stars if it had more variety of slides and the quality of food was better.The staff at the park were fantastic and very friendly. The locker rooms are very well equipped. Visiting the park in March is considered off-season. Temperatures reaching a max 34 degrees, we had no ques for any of the rides. Great park to kill a few hours.I would visit this park again.
Fun day out in the waterpark!. Fun for child minded adults, good fun rides and adrenaline rush. Good place to spend 2-3hours on a day off. Go in the morning to avoid crowds.

Wild wet fun!. The Park is really good value for money with the kids being allowed unlimited fun all day long! Just remember to rather go in the afternoons as the sun will be at you before you know it! the park is clean and has some of the best amenities for families around.

Amazing water park. We spent most of our day at Wild Wadi. This water park is great. Be careful when going on the longest slide as it tends to hurt!!! and grab onto your swimwear as it can come of! Great water rides - we will be going back again soon!

Fantastic rides but poor food.. I have been to this park few times and compared to other ones in the city for me its the best one regarding rides. It has rides of all types, soft, medium and hard cores. Its a really enjoyable day when spent there. My only complain is the food which is really poor, not very taste and really expensive.

WWWP. Certainly enough to do to fill a day! A lot of the rides are ridden on inflatable rings where jets of water send you uphill, so need to climb endless flights of stairs.You do experience some queuing at the most popular rides, but not to bad, weekdays anyway. Selection of food and drink is good and not too expensive. Worth a look at the Entertainer voucher book as it has two "buy one get one free" vouchers for entry in there. Probably worth departing a little while before closing time, as the Taxi queues were worse than inside.

A lot of fun, just don't go on weekends. This place will provide you with half a day full of fun the rides are really nice and they keep improving them... just don't go on the weekends because the queues on the rides become too long

Go Wild!!!!!. We travelled with our children aged 21 and 23 respcetively and my did the 4 fo us have a fantastic time. Cash free area which was excellent, all rides link from the lazy river, really good fun. The views from certain parts of the park are spectacluar. Staff courteous and many lifeguards on duty. Well worth a full day visit. Tip, buy the Wild Wadi water bottle, as each coldrink top up is only 5 dirhams....plenty places to eat, try the nachos and buy a family photo taken somewhere during your day in a beautiful wild wadi frame.........

Had so much fun :). Had so much fun in this waterpark, had a good laugh with friendsGood service, good location, good slides, didnt have to queue much, loved the lazy riverGood good on-site and not too expensiveHighly recommend and would definitely come back!!

fun filled day. This water park is a great one to visit with just friends or even the family. I went here and I had a great time, The shoots and slides really were exciting and the views from the tops of the slides were fantastic. The beach is also located next to this park as well as the hotel. Well worth a visit.
Summer coolant. Some good rides and cool water to take the heat out of the sun. Take your own food as it's not great and expensive.

It's fun. I have been to wild wadi befor and this is my second time . I enjoyed the rides and atmosphere of the place . Something I liked is there staff are very welcoming and caring ! They do there best to see you safety . I would recommend buying the tickets from hotels as they have them discounted
Amazing place. Wild Wadi is a Great place, so much to do a all day activity and staff are great. You can spend the whole day there and it's 2 minutes from Jumerieh beach.Great for kids and adults

wild wadi. had a great time at wild wadi, make sure you use your entertainer vouchers to get one buy get one free entry, even for kids because the price difference is not much. plenty of lockers around the place which you pay to use for either 30 or 40 dh depending on the size which are opened and closed by a programmable wristband they give you which can also be loaded with credit so you don't have to carry cash around (lockers can be repeatedly opened and closed),plenty of food places and to purchase swim wear but very pricey.not as many rides as expected especially for young kids, but they do have the outdoor swimming and paddling area which is heated. some great views on top of some rides of Burj Al Arab and the coastline.showers are available in changing rooms but are limited in number.but overall a good day out

Fun day for kids and adults. was there this past week...loved the Tantrum alley ride...if you go there choose a day that is not a weekend and not public holiday to avoid long lines...also get your own beach towels otherwise you will have to rent towels...you also have to rent a locker...you can't bring food or water there since they inspect the bags...I recommend you buy the Entertainer book since it has buy one get one free vouchers ...you save a lot
Wild Waters !!!. Awesome rides !!! Amamzing wave pool !!! Devilish water slides !!! Great fun !!! Breathtaking views of Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah !!!

Good waterpark. We only stayed a couple of hours. It's a nice waterpark, decent sized wave pool. The rides were easy to get on. We first came in an afternoon and it was packed, no sunbeams available so we returned the next morning at around half 10 where the were plenty of sun beds. I guess once you have been to the water parks in Florida or Atlantis in the Bahamas it's tricky to compare, but nothing wrong with this park.

This water park is near Burj Al Arab, the 7-star hotel.. Like: is the fact that this park is near Burj Al Arab, the 7-star hotel. Dislike: I've ridden more rides that are way better and unique than the ones in Wild Wadi Water Park.

Great Fun. My two teenage daughters, had a wonderful day on the slides, they could just be themselves, laugh and have fun, It does get busy so try go early and book a spot to sit. The food there is awful, so suggest you go out for lunch or wait till you finished
Fun at wild wadi. Very nice place to go with kids , u can spend the whole day there, go early to avoid the rush hour , local people come late to the park so always better to go eraly possible

Great fun - Expensive though!. It is a great park! Loved the coaster that is made up of multiple slides that go around the park.Also great that the things like 'surfing' are free and no additional costs to entry (unlike in Australia where you have to pay extra to try them!)ConsQuite expensiveAlso they search your bags to make sure you don't bring in outside food or drink 'for health and safety reasons'

It is very much for your kids. years ago I went to Dubai, and practically wanted to live at this water park. I thought it was huge, the rides were incredible and i didn't want the day to end. However, now being a bit older, I went a few months ago and well, found it a little out of date. I know water parks are quite unhygienic but I felt that wild wadi needed a huge clean up. It is great for young kids, and it is very safe, with life guards being everywhere but I as an adult you won't want to spend too long there. The food is well... water park food so not very good. Over all Its good value for money, your kids will love it and there is one or two rides for us older people, the life guards are great and you will feel safe with your kids running around on their own but it is a little gritty.

Limited rides but great fun. This water park is a title tired in places. Has some great rides but they are limited in number. We were all done in around 3 hours. Good variety of food available....try the scremiah..vertical drop...fab!
FUN. Not many slides, but thay are fun! The experience has been made easy. You can rent a towel, locker and get a wrist band that you can load money on. So no worries about lost keys or money.

Something for everyone - best water park I've been to!. It can be difficult hitting the balance of fun for those who love water parks and 'something else to do' for those who don't. Wild Wadi hits the mark! My brother and I love water parks; my parents couldn't think of anything worse. For my parents, there were areas set out which were quiet and let them sunbathe while we explored the park. The flumes are impossible to count, and each one more fun than the next. My favourite was Wild Wadi's take on the classic rubber ring flume - except this onw has jets of water to fire you UP the flume instead of down! Genius! There is something for everyone; from those just looking to sunbathe to the wary and the most adventurous! An absolute must for any Dubai tourist
F.U.N.. Fun place to visit. And specially with a ladies day very convenient to go around with friends for Muslims women usually like myself....

The best water park I've been to.... The title says it all - it really is the best water park attraction we've been to. The place is spotlessly clean, the staff and life guards are very helpful, friendly and smiling and the rides are great and in some cases (Jemeriah Scarer) scary! There are also additional attractions such as the Flowriders which were superb. On entry you are given a watch like tag which you can also load with cash to buy food etc (worth doing this and you can also get any money not used back at the end of the day). It is also used for tagging you when they take photos of you so that on exit your photos are readily available. We paid a ludicrous price for entry (dhs900!!!!) for family of 4 but TOP TIP if not with hotel or tour group you can use Groupon vouchers and get 45% off - so book this in advance - which makes it a very good price !!

Good Fun. included in our hotel was a trip to Wild Wadi, we went early, around 10am, it was quiet with spare loungers, the view is great overlooking jumeirah beach and the Burj, queues went quickly and it was good fun, a good selection for children and adults, food and snacks reasonably priced.

Fab time at Wild Wadi :). When coming to Dubai it's always worth coming to Wild Wadi! Lots of fun to be had on the all the different rides and a good couple for hours can be spent here. It caters for everybody from more gentle rides/attractions to those who prefer a bit of a thrill! The park was clean and tidy, plenty of places to go and sit as well as brilliant staff. All in all a good time to be had at Wild Wadi :)
Fun,fun,fun!. I loved it all through.I spent the whole day there and had the time of my life.The slides were so long and sooo fun but i love the wave pool the best.
Loads of Fun. We had loads of fun, only had a few hours, but this is a must-visit if you are planning a family visit to Dubai. Book a private cabana for first class service.
wild wadi. Brilliant attraction, staff very friendly and helpful the e wallet system to aid not carrying money was a great idea

Loads of fun!. We stayed at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel so we got entrance to the park for free, so were able to come and go. Had a fun few days on the slides when were sick of lying on the beach! Great for a family day out!

excellent water park. We visited because we had free entrance as we were staying in a Jumeirah group hotel, but I think it would have been worth the entrance fee. Spotlessly clean and more life guards than I have ever seen anywhere before. The photographs on offer are incredibly expensive!

Fun fun fun. Overall, a fun day out. There arn't tons of rides like you'd get in America, but enough to make a great day out. Food is reasonable as are the drinks etc. Friendlier staff than are at Atlantis. We loved it!

Amazing WildWadi. Wild Wadi Dubai or Wild Wadi Water Park is considered to be among the top ten Dubai attractions. This is one of those few places, where you can spend an entire day with your family and friends while having loads of entertainment and fun. It is ideally located in Jumeirah, very close to the Burj Al Arab. The Jumeirah Beach Hotel is also nearby

Fun for all the family. Love this place lovely food, great rides and perfect if you stay at the Jumeirah beach as you have free access and it's right next door!An added bonus is the fact most of the rides are on rubber rings and you get propelled up the shoots to the top so you don't have to walk any distance carrying your ring! It's a lazy persons heaven!

It's much smaller than you're expecting. If you arrive after 10:30 you wont get a sunlounger anywhere - but they will rent you the towel at the entrance which you wont then be able to put down on a lounger.The site is really small compared to other water parks, it was a bit sad, tired and tatty in our opinion - this is not Atlantis the Palm but is pretty much the same price - go there , it's amazing.It all felt a bit cheap and dated but was way over-priced for what it offered. The tubes are good but they seem to have no limits on guest numbers at this place - they just keep letting them in and taking the money - to hell with the queue lengths you have to wait in to use the rides, you're not coming back anyway and we've got your money - keep letting more in !

Surfs well for an old fat bloke. Visited the park several times whilst on holiday in August 2012. Free entry to the park as we were staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel which offers complimentary entry to hotel guests.The kids loved it. ( 2 & 6 years old) Especially the wave machine which is great for the whole family. Plenty of lifeguards and complimentary life jackets. We never bothered with renting a locker as I am happy to leave our stuff on a sunbed whilst we go and do our thing. Great lunchtime burgers and bbq stuff available.The best bit for me is the Flowrider, even at my age it is tremendous fun and once you catch your balance you quickly feel like a pro.I guess it is quiet expensive if you dont get comp. entry but I think it is well worth at least 1 visit.

Great Fun Waterpark. This is free if you stay at Jermiah Beach resort otherwise about £40 entry for the day. Its a bit tired looking and doesn't compare with Disney but its good fun and some good tube rides.I wouldn't have paid the entry fee had I not been staying at the resort. Towells provided and an extra £6 for a locker which was not really good value.
Best water park ever. No walking what else is there! You don't walk up to any slide the water takes you. I love it as the floor is so hot in Dubia

Clean and good fun. We took at trip to see the burj al Arab and right next it was wild wadi water park so decided to have a go, entry was around 30-35 pounds sterling, but although a little expensive the park is very clean and tidy.We arrived at around 4:30pm and with the park closing at 6 and the temperatures not exactly hot in February we pretty much had the whole park to ourselves which suited perfectly :-)Only a handful of rides but the big one is the best with a straight drop from an enclosed pod. If you with children they will love this place and onsite there are restaurants and other attractions. Plenty of decking also to take time out and sunbathe is necessary.Overall, good park a little pricey but enjoyable few hours in the sun

Worth it if you can muster some vouchers or group on deal. Claims to have 23 rides but in reality it is less then 10 rides compared to other parks. Facilities are neat, clean and very good. We purchased an Groupon online coupon for 1 of us @ AED 125 and other 2 purchased the BOGOF (buy one get one free) deal for AED 225. They have made teh premises cashless so you don't have to worry about your currency. Suggest don't carry any wallets, jewellery or other items.. just carry some cash that they will put on your electronic wrist tag.

A great water park to visit, great fun for everybody. I spent half a day here, and it was a blast. They have a bunch of different rides for everyone from children to adults, so there's plenty to do. There's wading pools, water slides and of course the Jumeriah Sceirah ride, which is the bomb!The staff are great, friendly and a pleasure to talk with. I didn't have a towel with me, so I ended up having to pay for one. No big deal, but it would've saved some money.I really enjoyed the water jet rides, and you could literally ride all over the park just on that ride. Overall the park isn't that big, but it has a lot to do inside. I definitely recommend it.

Fantastic day out. We had a brilliant day out here, spending time on the amazing rides, swimming in the wave pool and then simply relaxing on a sun lounger soaking up the sun. Would recommend taking a towel with you to avoid paying the 40dr hire charge.

AWESOME FUN!!!. this is a place to go if you really want to have fun with friends and kids, the kids will love it, and you wont be able to get them out, its very safe and the staff are very very helpful, and not much to walk around as the rides are all near by, and so much fun

The best experience ever. You can spend one of your best days of your life there.Happy and clean environment.Exciting and has fun for every member of family.Sun and water are amazing.Food is expensive but nice quality.Very crowded in holidays and weekends.

the ultimate water park. There are many water slides for all ages. It was fun to watch the body boarders on the artificial wave. I was amazed to see water pressure moving swimmers up the slides and another water ride had a conveyor belt to move the tubers to the top for their long slide back to the bottom.

My 1st visit. I don’t know way I didn’t visit the Wild Wadi before although I live in Dubai!! It’s amazing; love it and next time will bring my family… a lot of rides to choose from, the only irritating thing was the childish act of some boys while waiting in line…The restaurants are limited and the food quality is not that good while the price is not worth it. Bring a lot of cash as you will need it!!! If you like saving; book when there is offers such as “relaxing night at … Hotel inclusive of Buffet Breakfast – Includes 2 Tickets to Wild Wadi”. or simply book a room in one of Jumairah Hotels around Dubai they normally offers a free tickets to Wild Wadi.

Exciting!. you dont need to know how to swimbut you hv to be able to tolerate high dropsdefinitely an exciting experienecshighlight is the U-TUBE jumping tower at the topmust try, definitely a lifetime experience

Make sure you have 2 for 1 vouchers (you can buy them on e bay). Yes, make sure you have 2 for 1 vouchers (assuming there is 2 of you) or this will set you back about £55 (when time of visit). This is NOT a big water park. You will not need more than about 2 hours here to do all the rides that appeal to you - because not all rides will appeal to everybody. Very pleasant to walk around, and like just about all Dubai, spotless and litter free. Actually the changing area was a little on the dingy side. But there is one thing you MUST be aware of. The park is NOT very near a metro station and if you leave near closing time, as a lot of people do, you could wait in a long queue for a long time (up to an hour) for a taxi. So pleasant enough for a few hours, not near closing time, but very expensive if you don't have 2 for 1 vouchers. Oh, and Tripadvisor asks you to categorise who was on this visit, so I got as close as I could, but daughter left her teenage years a few years ago.

Brilliant way of keeping cool in the heat!. great range of water slides from the tame through to the pant wettingly scary! Perfect for half a day with the family to stay cool in the midday heat. A number of slides are great for smaller children however most are aimed at adults

Fun, exciting and worth a look. My forth trip to dubai I thought I should finally do Wild Wadi and I wasn't disappointed.The rides were simply the best water park rides I've been on. The speed slide is definitely recommended! Almost no lines at all, simple bracelet system lets you buy food, store things in lockers and have photos taken.Worth a look!

Must do with kids. This is a must do ! They have rides for everyone ! The rides on tubes are great - some lazy, some bumpy while some through the dark. The rides categorized "thriller" are interesting but not too scary. I did them with an 8 year old and had fun. Don't eat a lot and go for these. The rides marked " extreme thrillers" are a bit more scary but not over the top. I did not do the tallest fall .... Too scaredIt is tiring though - was happy that the kids decided to leave me for a nap while they ventured out on their own. The technology they use to allow money to be carried around is smart and convenientDont miss
Great fun rides. Really good fun rides with the kids, some very exhilarating. A real hit and we went twice in 4 days.

fantastic! no issues. absolutely brilliant. a must. very cheap too...walked there from mall of the emirates (about 4km, flat walk) different opening hours for different season. but for AED 500 was able to have a bite to eat, complete entry for two of us, and had a ball. there are some really really scary rides, and overall a great day for all ages.they provide a great system of a wrist band to which you charge with money and use it through the park. and lockers are cheap AED 30-40.

Family fun. This is the perfect place to bring the family for a day of fun. You get respite from the heat and a whole lot of laughs too! Like any theme park, it gets busy. So arrive early and try to avoid peak times.
Great fun!. Great fun for all! The big slide is a must for thrill-seekers! It's free for guests staying at Jumeirah properties.

Fun fün fun!. Love this water park! I love the perimeter waterside. You sit on a tube and get jetted upwards with a choice of 2 or 3 slides to direct yourself down. you can stay on this ride, relaxing for a good 20 minutes!Can't wait to try the Jumeriah Scarer this weekend!
The best waterpark. Having been to wild wadi on many occasions, i had went to atlantis to see if it was a better park. Not a chance wild wadi was and still remains the best park in Dubai!

Good fun but needs to do a few things to help visitors. The rides were good, and the staff were great. The signage was very poor and it was a while before we worked it all out. No food or drinks of your own allowed - supposedly for health and safety reasons. We all know that it's nothing to do with H&S - it's about the high prices of food on site. Not good. The photos taken on-site for sale later were outrageously expensive which was a pity and I didn't buy any. Some £15 for a single copy - really!!!

A must attraction to vist. this water park is fun fun and more fun. Ive been to allot of water parks around the world and this place is one of the best. have so much activities and well structured in every way. I loved the man made wave beach.

Wild Wadi Water Park. Hi everybody. My family and I have been at this park on December 2012. Our 3 kids were excited there same as we are.I don't recommend trying surf-board if you are not well trained. There are some visitors-donkeys who are staying in front of this attraction just to laugh only for mistakes and fails of others, but they have never tried to swim themselves. That moment was only the one what I think very disappointed me.The staff of Park is very helpful and kind. They are always smiling.It's very nice place for family with children.It's better to visit park on Tuesday and Wednesday.

A fun day out. As part of our stay at the Jumeirah Creekside, we were given passes to Wild Wadi. We normally prefer Atlantis, as Wild Wadi can get very busy queuing for the Master Blaster rides. These are best described as "water roller coasters", where single or double rings are propelled uphill by high-powered water jets, which can get painful after a while. The force tipped me over a couple of times.My son and I enjoyed the new Tantrum Alley & Burj Surj slides. Tantrum Alley is a "extreme thrill" slide with a combination of 3 tornados, tackled in a cross shapped ring; while the slightly gentler Burj Surj has 2 bowls in a circular raft.All in all a nice day out. Get there early to avoid the queues.Visited 1 February

Great Place to go and Enjoy.... Hi Guys,We were four friends but only three could make to enjoy the fantastic water park. Its situated next to Burj Al Arab, so, you would be able to get some nice pictures. Things to remember:1 - Take water proof camera with you. I was told that they dont allow cameras but nothing apparently happened when we used ours. Wish we had a water proof camera.2 - Its expensive therefore, try to come as early as possible to enjoy all the slides. 3 - Avoid coming on weekends - Thursday / friday as it will be crowded4 - Arrange your transport as it might be difficult to find taxi at night. We had to walk long way to get a taxi.

chill and thrill. We had a wonderful experience at wild wadi except that the weather was changing at the kids got hypothermic and had to be withdrawn, rubbed and kept in the sun for a while... the rides were fun and we really wished we had more time to take the tube and raft rides again and again!!

Great way to spend an afternoon. We went on a friday in February, and it wasn't too busy, the only "long" queue was at the new 'Jumeirah Sceirah, we had to wait about 20 minutes, because only one of the two tubes was being operated.The only other queue was at the Tantrum Alley and it was about 10-15 minutes of waiting.We got 35 AED worth of credit loaded onto our bracelets for free, because the wave pool and the kids playstructure wasn't open, due to maintenance.The wipeout and riptide were great fun, and all of the coasters seemed to be in very well conditions, and everything felt safe.We were very happy about how the staff treated customers, you always feel welcome, and you're met with a smile all around the park.The price for the pictures being taken on the rides and in front of the Burj Al Arab was pretty steep, 650 AED for 5 pictures loaded onto a USB flash drive.
Good but very tight on space. great waterpark and very central in Dubai but it can get very busy and feel very tight. Not the best therefore for a relaxing day with the kids.

Nice waterpark. I think that this waterpark is better than the Atlantis one. Both have their advantages and disadvantages. The Wild Wadi is great. The slides make a lot of fun. If you come during the week and in summer there are much less people in the waterpark and you dont have to wait so long to go on a slide. All over we had a very nice there at Wild Wadi.
Great waterpark. Fantastic waterpark, great rides! You can start at one ride, and the waves take you all the way round all of the rides, great as you do not need to get out to queue again.

Best Water Park In Dubai. Best water park in Dubai especially for a family with kids. Summer is the best time to visit.......and you can spend a whole day as it will cool you down during summer. Love the lazy river with big tube.......really fun?
Good attraction for everyone. Had fun, different from any water park had visited in the past. I would visit again in my next trip to Dubai.
