Very Good But A Little Old. Obviously it's great! And the new additions are fun but the older rides such as the Jeremah Scarer and other older rides could be improved. Good but not incredible.

Best Way to beat the Heat in Dubai. If you want to get out and about in Dubai but are afraid of the heat but want to please the kids (and also yourself), go to Wild Wadi Water Park. This water park, which is extremely compact and navigable, is on the Jumeirah property, right outside the gate of the Burj al Arab and next to the Jumeirah Beach Resort. If you are a guest at the Burj, admission is free, but in any event, it is probably not that expensive and is sure worth it. On the premises there is a snack bar and they also sell sunscreen, flip flops and all of the essentials to have a good time. There are a couple of inner tube water slides, a kid's water complex with smaller slides, wading pools and water which falls out of pails and shoots from water guns. I find that it is best to go after 4:00 pm when the heat is more manageable and will be the perfect way to refresh yourself and cap off a hot day in Dubai.
Great afternoon out. We stayed at the Jumeirah property on the plam and visited a couple of afternoons. Well worth a visit. Great fun... even for adults!
WOW!!! I love Dubai!!!. We were firsts time in Wild Wadi water Park and were really happy with our time there!!! Great service and very attentive stuff!!! Looking forward to come back!!!

kids llve it. Our five years son loved it! What else do you need when you travel with small ones.
the twisted tube from the very top of the park was awsome, scary and blowminding. I left all the stress there)))

great in summer, packed full. Some things work out in Dubai, and this was one of them. Sometimes the local folks have an idea, build something, and it just flops, like "wonderland", but this water park was a hit. Packed full of people in summer. Great to cool off. Winter a bit cold to use it. Find some coupon specials, there are plenty.

Let down by (best at travel yet again). Just flown into Heathrow from Dubai,stayed at Mina al salam for the 8th time and have been going to dubai since the early 90s,Still a fantastic place however i have been badly let down by my travel agent (best at travel) for not tellling me about the fact that the Wild wadi has been closed for repairs since begin of Jan until the end of Jan.This was extremely dissapointing because i was spending the week with just my 13 yr old daughter and she was looking forward to going to the Wild Wadi.I Cannot beleive this is not on their website(best at travel) and when booking the holiday i was n t told of this closure,if so i would of gone to the Atlantis
Fun, Amazing, Awesome. Its so goodso many good rideswell maintainedyou have to see this!!Good place to cool down!!amazing!
Great water park. Good range of slides.. including easy ones and wave pool for younger kids. And awesomely scary rides that older kids/teens/brave adults will love if they like an adrenalin rush
great fun. this place is amazing. u can spend the whole day here. it has all the water activities. great drops , rafting, beach and hotel all.

Put this on your Dubai 'to-do' list. Wild Wadi is an absolutely fabulous place to spend a day in Dubai. The venue is well maintained, service is outstanding and the facilitates available are excellent. There are many rides, ranging from those for the soft hearted to others more suited to adrenaline junkies, I was amazed by the tube rides that shoot you uphill on your way to a multitude of down runs. Food served in the venue is also great value for money. It is certainly worth a visit

Splash and dash!. In the August heat of Dubai, this water-park was heaven. Loads of water rides for everyone from kids to the most daring. I particularly enjoyed both the tube rides (for single/couple and the big family sized tube). The single/couple tubes would go all round the park through tunnels and bridges and end in a ring shaped pool covering the entire length of the park where you can swim around. The good thing about the tubes was you didn't have to climb a million stairs for a few seconds of adventure.The huge and adventurous drop ride was a joy but i couldn't bare climbing the stairts again but definitely worth a try atleast once.The park has a good locker/storage facility and separate changing areas for men and women.ps. If you search around enough online before going to the park, you might find a few good deals. i found myself a good 25% discount :)
Fun fun fun. Lots of cool rides .... Go early or during the week to avoid the queues? Wear sunscreen.... Go on the flow rider and the jumeirah scarer ...... Really scary ....

It's ok. The park has free parking which is nice. You can rely on the weather which is also nice.Had a couple of amazing non alcoholic cocktails. As for the actual park.....if I hadn't been to Disney's waterparks, this would have got a better review from me, but it is not as good as the Orlando waterparks, so a three rating is the best I can give it. Thumbs up to the food and drink available and it's a nice waterpark. But the rides are limited making the queues large and waiting around in the Dubai heat is not tons of fun. The wave pool is the tamest wave pool I have ever been in. The thing is, a lot of the locals can't swim and so they have to make the waves milder than they would in Europe or the USA. Most local adults wore safety vests in the wave pool. It's water you can stand up in and when the waves hit, they all scream 'whoooooo, whoooooooo'. Crazy times.We had a nice relaxing day. The place needs more rides. It's ok. Go to Disney. Even Centerparcs in the UK is on a par with this.
LOVED THIS PLACE!. In the blazing heat of Dubai we spent a whole day splashing around in the water-park. Highly recommended for a fun day out for everybody.

Lots and lots of fun day round!!!.... Wadi water Park is AMAZING, worth some hours there!!!... With direct acess to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel and complimentary, I've been there for hours...specially enjoying the waves pool and the surfing waves pool and track. Lots of fun for both kids and adults,you won't leave it untill night... The cascade is terrific too, refreshing a lot under the very hot sun. Staff are amazing too!!!...

Fun but cold!!. Make sure you go when the weather is really hot as the water is rather cold!!! Some good rides and a nice family day out even if your not into the big slides, as the family pools are good.
Good but long waits. Enjoyable experience for 3/4 hours. Two complaints1. Long queues when we were there. 2. Quality of food is not great (expensive bad quality burgers and chips)

Still The Best - Great New Jumeirah Screeamer. Having lived in Dubai for 15 years, and now visiting Dubai often, this is still the best water-park in Dubai and a really great fun day-out, with more variety than Atlantis. They have some new slides this year, and the new-and-imprived Jumeirah Screamer slide is just awesome, and scary yet fun.

A great day out. I have been to this park on every single visit to Dubai and it gets better and better as they keep improving the rides. It's free if you stay at a Jumeirah Hotel which if you have small kids is well worth it.
Must visit. Forget all the other water parks, you must visit this one. Great staff, very friendly, best food ever had in a water park anywhere in the world. Great rides and heated water.

A good day out. An enjoyable water park with a good variety of rides. Thre are good quiet places to lounge when not in the water.One tip: The staff can make alot of noise trying to sell things when say their kiosk is quiet. Hard sell is never nice to see.

great day out!. lots of rides and things to do! prefer this water park over the park at the Atlantis
Wild Wadi is affordable and easy to access.
good attraction. The wild wadi park is jst close to burj al arab .we njoyed a lot there.besides all other rides the ride which give u a fealing of surfing is the best in my view.

Great fun and queues flow well. This is the second time i have visited Wild Wadi and with some new rides the excitement it is still good. Beware that if the wind is blowing and the temp is sub 25oC you will feel the chill.
Good fun and well run

Great day out!. Wild wadi was excellent fun. It was suitable for all ages and was a large venue that did not have too many queues. staff were very pleasant. definately do try out all the rides, they give a great view of jumeirah beach and the burj al arab.
definitely try out the jumeirah Sceirah. very scary but great fun.

A must visit attraction for all family members. Wild Wadi is the place every resident or visitor in Dubai should visit.
A perfect waterpark for family fun specially with the newly added family rides.
Their ladies nights during summer are a success too.
Only negative is that they became overpriced since the place is aging and is not the only one in the country.

Had a Great time. Wild Wadi was a huge hit for my entire family. We spent every once of energy we had in this place. For young kids to adults it is a blast. We did Atlatis last year, and I have to say Wild Wadi was more enjoyable due to the fact the kids could ride everything. Would absolutely go back...

Best waterpark at Dubai. Fantastic !!! Some of you may know those lazy rivers that have in all those waterparks - here you have a furious river ... awsome. By the way, you have other 3 choices at UAE - there is one inside the country (very difficult to find and get), other one at Abu Dhabi (just opened) really kicks on all the others (it has even a roller coaster !!!), and the last one - is located at the Atlantis Hotel - don´t go , few options, and more expensive than the Wild Wadi wich is much more cool.

Great for all ages. Our boys love wild wadi - the smaller children area is getting tired but then it is shut for 2 weeks in January so I would be unsurprised if that was being replaced. the new rides are very exciting. Height restrictions are very strictly enforced, our littlest was borderline going on the bigger rides but he was allowed. Rightly so of course, we will have to return! a great day out, food ok too

Good attractions but food made us ill. We had a great day at Wild Wadi, there are some great attractions like Master Blaster and Burj Surj. It was great to see the pros on the flowriders and almost as fun to see those who were not so good! You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink so you have to buy in the park. Me and my hubby had different meals and were both laid up the next day with bad tummies - so be careful. I think we bought food from the barbecue but we won't do it again.Shame that an awful experience spoiled an otherwise great day.There are plenty of sunbeds should you want more sun and there are lockers to store your valuables.
Great Day Out. Great waterpark, book a cabana, this is very reasonable and well worth it, private seats and fast pass for main ride.

Kids. Totally focused at kids however the new Jumierah Scarer (spelling?) is one the adults will enjoy too. Avoid on public holidays, weekends....and when the kids are off school. Also avoid when it's 50 degrees C!!!

Great fun. This water park is just amazing, if you stay in certain hotels you get in for FREE plus you get in an hour before it opens to the general public, Slides that go up thats right up not down, AMAZING.

fantastic. there were soo many different slides to choose from, i didnt pluck up the courage to go on the huge drop slide but watched my brother when he did, great viewing area at the splash pool. The lazy river is fantastic and has optional rubber rings to sit in, either solo or double rubber rings! There are life guards in the water strategically placed so if you do come into difficulty helo is at hand. There were shoot up slides which were fantastic and lifeguards at the top, also there was a 6 person rubber ring ride which was great fun! The wave pool is rough so unless you are a confident strong swimmer dont venture into the deep water. Queuing for the slides doesnt take too long and is always shaded which is a bonus, also they have sprinklers which are activated periodically so you never overheat when you are out of the water. There are free lockers available for items of clothing and plenty of food outlets. Would highly recommend, fun day out for all ages!

A pleasant visit. Great for families with young kids. They didn't have that many rides but the ones they did have, were thoroughly enjoyable. Get there early if you want to bag a lounge chair and hit the rides early without having to wait for long.

Thrilling and fabulous. The slides and rides are out of this world. What more with the dark tunnels. The guides and staff are very courteous and understanding. A must do for family visitors with children. We reaaly loved it.
Recommended.. We spent the whole day there. Not packed like our theme parks, max 10 minute queues for any of the rides. Man, it was totally enjoyable.

GET THERE 15 MINUTES BEFORE OPENING. See my review of Aquaventure at Atlantis as well. Wild Wadi was the first big water park in Dubai. While it is slightly tired, it overalls an overall great experience. Get there at opening to make the most of it. The lazy river is goof for the entire family and Master Blaster is great as it connects to multiple other rides - unlike Aquaventure which is all single rides. Food is overpriced as expected though Kebab and Hot Dog at the BBQ is not too bad for park cuisine. Worth a visit with kids or for the young at heart.

very expensive , but cool for children. if you have a children they will love it so much , but if you are adult alone ,, not alot of gamed for adultalso it is very expensive there if you want to buy anything from there

Amazing water park. I've enjoyed a great experience in Wild Wadi however the weather wasn't good as I expected but the place has an amazing facilities and atmosphere and the staff were very friendly and helpful

Wonderful experience for kids. My kids absolutely loved the day we spent at Wild Wadi, being there in the most busiest period of the year did imply a lot of queuing for the rides and food. The experience remained great.
hard to inter to the park. It was very hard to get into the park. the food in the park was very expensive and if you have a day to go to an aquapark, the best choise is not wild wadi.

Waterpark for all ages.. Wild Wadi is a great water park for all ages. The new Jumeirah Sceirah is just out of this world. I have been living in Dubai for over 7 years and say every year me and my friends go to Wild Wadi at least 12 times a year, so every month. There is a place for little children that has slides and every thing you could imagine in a kids water park. The atmosphere there is lively and great!

Good water fun for all ages. After living in Dubai for 5 years I finally jumped in the queue to Wild Wadi. It's a typical water park with good rides for people of all ages,sizes and interests. Rides are pretty standard (check out the new Jumeirah Sceirah (which I've nicknamed "the flusher") which drops you down from a 32m tower through a 120m tube. Food is uninspired but that's what one can expect from most theme parks (expensive and bland) so it didn't bother me much.

Wild Wadi water experience. I had a great day out with my husband at Wild Wadi, just a couple of big kids looking for something to do (We are well into our 40s). The day was great the water was warm the staff were very friendly; the food was what you expect in an amusement park (burgers, hot dogs, pizza etc…). We went on all the rides a little bit sore the next day from walking up stairs all day but well worth it.

Exciting. It is an amazing place to be there with kids. There are rides for all types of people. The tallest slide is there and it is very thrilling. the atmosphere is very lively. The best part is, it is very safe.

Fun times. Wild wadi is a fun place for spending an entire day away from all the heat. The smart card based lockers and cashless payment facility at restaurants is very useful. Rides such as Jumeirah Sceirah, Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj are a lot of fun specially when you are with friends. Purchasing pictures from the souvenir shop is very expensive so try to have a "designated photographer" wherever you can ;)

Best Place to have fun. Wild Wadi Dubai is a popular water theme park with several options for entertainment and fun. It has a wave pool, along with several water slides as well as artificial surfing machines. It has one of the largest water slides that are located in the region. There are also two gift shops in the theme park from where the guests can collect their souvenirs and gift items. There are three restaurants where the visitors can order for sumptuous meals. In addition, there are several snack stands as well, from where the guests can pick up items for their munching.
Wild Wadi. Very relaxing and very clean. This is a perfect place to go to get away from the heat. You can go for a quick swim or stay for a few hours. The staff was helpful.

Brilliant. Fab water park which was free if you were staying at Jumeirah Beach Hotel.No need to take a towel as it was provided free of charge although lockers were extra.Rides were great and there were plenty of beds to lie on to recover after!Tons of lifeguards on duty which was very reassuring.Highly recommended experience.

Much better than Atlantis. Fantastic water park, right next to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel (and free if you stay in any Jumeirah property). Visit early in day to avoid queues. Much, much better than water park at Atlantis.

Not much for younger kids. travelled with 3 boys aged 4,4 & 6.
They could only go into two bits. Wave pool and a children water tower. overpriced for what it was. Kids did enjoy it, but we felt we has to stay there longer..

Thrilling Adventure! Great Family Fun. Visited on 20 Dec 2012, with family ( parents and 15y + 6y).Variety of adventures- lazy water river to thrilling tunnel of doom. Pluses: Fun for every one, variety, plenty of space, well organised, lots of life guards at every stageMinuses: Over pricedWhile planing we took care of the following- AND this made our visit very memorable.(a) Arrived at the park right at the opening time- 10 AM, found very little crowd, almost no queues.(b) Choose day other than Friday, Saturday or public holidays- to avoid crowd.(b) Carry small plastic/ waterproof bag for towels and double water proof pack for your camera. This you can carry as you enjoy the rides. Keep rest in AED 25 or 35 lockers in the changing rooms. Towels are available for purchase or hire but are very expensive.(c) Rubber slips-on or flip flops.(d) Get your water park wrist bands charged for min. AED 200 to take care of snacks/ lunch for 2 adults + 2 children after rides. Any balance is refundable at the gate. AS SUCH ITS VERY EXPENSIVE!!(e) YES you can carry your own water/ energy drink. But NO food items!(f) About 3 hours are sufficient, although children were insisting for a longer stay, may consider as per your itinerary. We were out at the lunch time.

Well organized and thrilling adventure for the whole family. Variety of adventures -soft and hard but sometimes very long queues. In the time we have been there it was really crowded and also very hard to get bed and places to store your belongings.

Great way to spend the day .... I love water parks and wild wadi is no exception - try and pick a day when there won't be too many crowds if you can ... i.e a week day or early in the morning on a Friday/ Saturday..

Great WaterPark - shame about the greed. SO, you turn up to Wild Wadi, and pay a fairly hefty entry price.It is a fair price, considering what is on offer. A great environment, great rides, very friendly, and extremely well staffed.However, it is the hard sell add-ons that disappoint. 25-35 AED for a locker? should be free.HAVE to buy their water and drinks and can't bring your own? THey even search your bags for water! insane.On site captive food and drink prices fairly hefty as wellJumeirah Sceirah is awesome. A great addition!!THe kids love it, and we'l be back -- but courtesy of The Entertainer to be able to afford it!

Good Place with few issues. we went there for a day out we had a good time in the wave pool and the food in the stand is really good . we went to the lazy river and was fun the water was good tempreture but when we went to try one of the slides the water stoped when i was on the way up to one so no water i started sliding down and got a really nice bruse on my leg. they closed the ride for a while and then opened it again so i guess it was just a small issue and i was unlucky ...
A great time. Excellent for adults and kids. Get there early for a bed near thekids pool area which is central to all the rides. Safe and fun and not too pricey. You can spend the whole day there
Ultimate destination. Absolutely amazing experience in the water park. they have great slides, very helpful staff and yummy food places. The only bugger is long lines but they are so worth it. :)
Great Rides for all. I had been here several years before and they had a few new rides, moreover, it was good to get out of the heat. Loved it

A great day out.. We thouroughly enjoyed our time here. The rides or should that read slides were good. Definately something for everyone young and old. Just be aware if you are going with children , they must be at least 1.1 m tall as they will not get on, as we heard when a man got rather irate because his kids couldnt get on even some tame rides.It is a little pricey at nearly £40 per person, but we used a coupon from the "Entertainer" booklet and got 2 for 1, so cost was good for 2 of us. At 40 years old this definately brought out the kid in me. The Jameira Sceirah ride should not be missed, being dropped through a trap door into a vertical drop had the adrenaline flowing.I also had a go at the "Fisho" stand. 50Dhr to have small fish nibble at your feet. Once you get over the tickling, it is very relaxing. Dont know how much good it did for my feet, but enjoyed it none the less.For a day out highly reccommended.
Fabulous!. The rides were awesome and so were the staff of the water park. We had a great time over there and would definitely come back again!

What a amazing Water Park in the middle of Desert. you will love water park which will give you amazing experience. Different kind of ride and can gain alot different activities. best place to visit with childern and family.
one of the best. We liked Wild Wadi! We prefer Wild Wadi Water Park above Aquaventure of Atlantis! This park has better waterslides.
Worth Coming Back. Sure I will be back again. Had always great times during my visits in Wild Wadi. Rides are great, for families and for those who like thrilling water rides.

kids paradise. we went when it was cold but a very definite place on list if you have kids, very impressive arrangement, lockers pricey and take some shower sandals as showers a a bits of a challenge and slippy

No country for old men!. I am only joking:-) my poor butt and thighs were aching the next day after spending five hours at the park with my two teenage sons... those towers are quite high you know? We started off by parking easily for free and getting good explanations from staff as to how the wrist band payment system works (and it does very well). Started on the Jumeirah Scairah and well, I will let you decide when you go there... perhaps start on one of the smaller rides? Had a good lunch half way through the day and in the end it was getting a little cool so we left at about 5pm. The place is very well staffed and all of the facilities work, nothing 'out of order' here in Dubai!Possible improvements? the signage is a little vague. Finding your way around can be a bit frustrating.

Great Fun. Awesome rides, fantastic people working there who are very friendly and helpful and fun to be around. You visit is turned into an experience through the little touches from colleagues there. There are a couple of new rides as well which are thrilling. It was such a great day out.

Great fun. Wild wadi is great. It is worth charging money onto your wrist band for food. This saves carring money and needing to visit a locker frequently though it is so safe to leave your stuff on a sun lounger. The rides are great fun. If you have limited time and can only get there for a short time reduced entry fares are available from 3pm with closing around 5.30 (in winter-December) but be warned you will wish you could stay longer. You can also get discounted tickets at the supermarket but beware the date on the ticket is for when you want to go. You can also get discounts in the Entertiner magazine. You don't need to worry about safety with young children as there are large numbers of VERY attentive lifeguards.

Quieter than the Atlantis - gets my vote. It didn't feel like a zoo.We were in free as part of the DAM package. It was smooth and well organised, but I am not sure about the cost.Definately worth half a day, but probably avoid the weekend.

You can buy a day gift pass but. You cannot buy the food or pay for the towel and locker charges in advance to include as the gift. I saw many people carry their own big bags and towels. I wonder if most people even bother with lockers. Parking is free.If you buy a gift pass it is valid for 6 months however you cannot get the 50% price off for another time. Very crazy idea! We would have totally ought another pass or another day too!

Feel like a kid again. With the Burj Arab as a backdrop, and world class slides to match a trip to Dubai would not be complete without visiting this amazing water park. Do yourself a favour and purchase the Dubai entertainer booklet for families and save yourself some serious Dirhams. A group of six, we saved a total in excess of AED600, and the 2 volume book only sets you back AED350, well worth it considering your saving at Atlantis, Ski Dubai, Dubai mall aquarium and much much more.Be prepared for the steep food prices though, and the photographers can get in your face a bit although provide a momento for your memorable family trip!As a Muslim visitor, the halaal food and prayer facilities just makes this top of my list of Dubai family attractions.

great experience for whole family. You must must must visit this water park in dubai amazinnggg experience with the family. I have been twice to dubai and when i went back 4 years later it was still at the top of my to do list

Amazing place, a bit expensive.. Based on online recommendations we included Wild Wadi into our must visit places in Dubai.We visited the park, my wife two kids (5 and 2 years old) during September and it was such a blast. We tried almost all attractions except for one as it has a huge queue of people.Staff are very friendly and extremely trained. restaurants were clean but food taste was average.It is a recommended attraction for any one who is visiting hot Dubai. I will for sure go there when and if I visit Dubai again.
EXCELLENT !!. Lots of rides ! Saw some of them for the 1st time in my life life. Some of them are even scarry ! Lots of sensation and fun Guaranteed !

So Fuuuuun!. We went just after Eid and it was quite full. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Some of their cafes for the food was not really worth for the price but still fine.All slides are awesome and exhilarating! I can remember all the names but try em all it's a must

Great fun for all ages!. The rides have been updated recently and makes for a fab day out. Especially if you are able to get your hands on an Entertainer voucher for two for one entry!We loved it and spent the whole day there even though we hadn't planned to.

Great fun!. Really fun for the kids. Less pricey than Aquaventure, with very helpful staff. Kids around 6 years have more to do, and can go on more rides given the height restriction is 1.1m (not 1.2 like in Aquaventure), and less walking... the loading of credit on your wristband is a nice idea too.
Such fun!. Water Parks are not my thing at all! BUT this one is so different.Clean, comfortable, fun and well laid out.Can't wait to go back next summer.

Fab day out! Better than Atlantis.. Much cheaper than the aquaventure at Atlantis, and more compact so less walking between slides and if you're on the doughnuts water jets will blast you to the next slide. The slides are more "thrilling" than those at Atlantis (and there are more of them) so not all suitable for young children, although they do have a childrens area with plenty for kids to do.Other reviews have complained of long queues, however on the day I went in early December, I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a slide, even the big ones at any point in the day.Staff are all very friendly and entertaining and I wasn't made to feel uncomfortable at any point by the locals when walking around in a bikini.It's even safe enough to leave your valuables on a sun lounger all day unattended, although there are lockers available. You also have an electronic wristband that you can charge with money for lunch and drinks etc, which is very handy so you don't have to carry cash. The wristband are also used to collect digital photos from the photographers around the park and on the slides. My only negative point about my experience and that is when we went to view our digital photos at the end of the day using our wristbands, only about 3 of the 8 or 9 pictures had been saved and some photos of strangers had made their may into our file, which was shame as I think there would have been some good ones in there. It's a shame also because the exact same thing happened at Aquaventure.

Nice day out. The price for this has been going up over the years but I think it is worth a trip. Couple really good water slides and the pool that takes you around the park is a must. You also get some great views of the sea and the main sights. Food is not great and the air conditioning in the changing rooms will make you ill if you stay in there long enough. Changing rooms are also a bit of a mess.

Great day spent. It was a great water park and worth it if you get the two for one voucher from the city booklet. I think it would be a bit pricey for what it is at full cost. Very enjoyable rides but you must get there early ~9am before the crowds. When the crowds arrive, you can expect a half an hour or more wait per ride.
excellent. went with family..it was a great day i went there every day for five days during my stay at Jumeirha Zabeel Saray hotel. assoreted water games.

Great fun. I'm not a water park kind of guy but my kids wanted to go. We all had a great time - get there early to avoid most of the crowds. The Jumeira Sceirah is great - a nice bit of theatre, locking you into the glass capsule, pushing the 'launch' button and then having the floor drop away. How long you get on one of the flow riders is up to 'management discretion' (the other has a timer). If you're not a chick, you'll get a short run (my son had about 30 seconds and when he fell off that was it, whereas the two young ladies before him got personal tuition for close to three minutes each. Not very fair. Great day overall though - got there at 10:15 and we'd had enough by about 2:00.

Fun family day out. We visited Wild Wadi several times as we were staying in the Jumeirah Beach Hotel where entrance was included. We thoroughly enjoyed it, especially the Burj Surj ride where up to 4 people ride down a flume in a large rubber ring! The park has a good selection of different rides, despite being squeezed into a relatively small area. We also visited Aquaventure whilst in Dubai and were rather disappointed as we felt that although it's a large park the rides are all similar, preferring Wild Wadi. The wave pool was nice for little children but the waves were more like ripples than proper waves! It was quiet whilst we were there so the longest we queued for a ride was 10 mins and that only happened once, however it looked like the queues could be long at peak times. Would definitely go again.

Best water park I've ever been to. It's not cheap but you cannot expect it to be given that you are in Dubai and right next to the "wave" hotel and across the way from the Burj. What I like best about the park is that it is so compact and easy to get around, compared to the unnecessarily sprawling water park at the Atlantis hotel. The ride on the big float around the park is great fun as is the frighteningly high main slide that feels like you're about to fly off on the way down! Definitely worth a visit but i'd recommend wearing swimming shoes/rubber socks as in the summer your feet will scorch on the pavements between rides. visited mid 2006
Loved it. Spent a day here and loved all of it. I even got my wife to join me on the Jumeirah Sceirah. Best rides were the sceirah and tantrum alley.
Most amazing water park !. Everything was so amazing! my most recommended theme water park in Dubai... Breath taking rides! Two thumbs up...

Good but not worth the £40 entry fee. Good with some good slides though the best one has just been built recently. I do think that the entry fee is a little steep as I have been to alot bigger water parks? Not what I expected from Dubai! Also expect plenty of locals staring at your girlfriend/wife if she is wearing a bikini! I thought some of the young boys eyes were going to pop out of there heads!?

Fun!. The lifeguards are brilliant and really friendly, the food is over-priced but, that's pretty much uniform in every waterpark! I had a brilliant time, safe for children as there's an area specifically for the little ones and another for 5 to 12 year olds. The bigger rides are very good, and I know that they've had some new ones put in since I last went so, I'm excited for my next visit!

Good Variety of Attractions. I went with a group of friends and we had a great day! There were some scary/exciting rides but there were also some for small children. Lockers are available to put away a change of clothes. Consider putting some extra money on your bracelet to get food later on (50 Dhr should suffice per person). Tip: Although you can see people wearing a range of bathing suits from bikinis to suits covering women from head to toe, wearing a good bathing suit that stays in place even in more challenging rides will prove to be useful.
Dont miss it. don't miss water park visit you will enjoy lot there lot of entertainment i prefer go with your close friends so it will more fun,

Best of the best!. I visited this water park with my wife and 2 kids. I am actually not a fond of such activities but my wife and kids love water park that's why I decided to go there. One more reason it was close to the hotel I was staying.
The overall experience was simply great and value for money.

Affordable Fun for all of us. Enjoyed there with my kids they just loved it. Not so long waiting times, clean fresh water and lots of smiling staff helping you doing the first moves on the wave board. Very patently helping them to get back on the board. Great place to spend an afternoon and excape the heat. Check out they have copons in Magazines and books to get discounts...

An enjoyable day. I came here for the day with my boyfriend (we are both in early 20s) and whilst waiting to get our tickets a very kind couple in front gave us a buy one get one free coupon so this saved us LOTS of money, was quite thrilled! The park has a really good money system which lets you put cash on a wristband so you don't need to carry wallets with you (something that many other water parks in the world should really get in my opinion!). The jumeirah scairah is a MUST DO for any adrenaline seekers!! Love this ride!!! The park was generally nice and clean, typical fast good available all around. There are fantastic places to get a photo with "professional" photographers both underwater and around the park, although the prices were a bit steep for my liking. I preferred the photos I took on my own camera in the end. Lots of places to get your snap of the Burj Al Arab from inside the park too. Chose this park over the Atlantic because of the distance it was from our hotel and the price. Overally I really enjoyed my day here!!! :)

wasn't worth. I have tried some other water parks in Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and Turkey. I think Wild Wadi was quite moderate and a bit expensive for its facilities. There are only 3 real slides in whole the park and the rest are not exciting at all. The good thing for lazy people is, there is a mechanism for push you up by water, so you don't need to walk up the stairs. But I'm sure if they replaced these with some exciting slides, it would be much better and amusing.

If you like water go there. Wild Wadi is awesome water park to play and have nice day there is all sort of rides and the water is carrying you up words with tire like float and then in the top level you cam down nicely it so fun see your self here http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ce3LWKeLreI&feature=colikeyess...hj.

Have to visit!. So much fun and many rides and activities to do. Its around 45$ dollars for kids (under 1.1 meters tall) and 55$ for anyone who is taller than 1.1. meters tall. It was a lot of fun and definitely should be done!
Great fun!. A great experience for both adults and children - some of the most scary and exhilarating rides I have ever been on! Staff are very friendly throughout the park too! Highly recommend.

Good day out!. Its a good day out, there are lots of flumes, lazy rivers, places to sit, and places to eat. Overall I would say its a little grubby, and perhaps not as nice as Aquaventure, but there are way more attractions in Wild Wadi.
Wild!. A great day out - very conveniently positioned just of the main road and loads of fun and quite exciting slides including ones that take you uphill!
Wild!. A great day out - very conveniently positioned just of the main road and loads of fun and quite exciting slides including ones that take you uphill!

Great Rides and wonderful landscaping. The water rides were fabulous and we enjoyed it throughly, especially the kids. The place has been landscaped well and offers great views of the Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. There is a direct bus (#8) from Bur Dubai, which was very convenient. Only had an issue with one of the life guards at the wave pool, who needs training on how to speak to guests.
Great fun!. Great fun and a must if in Dubai. As good as Atlantis in Dubai.Will return if in Dubai again for sure.
Great day out at the water park!. I had so much fun I didnt want to leave. The rides were so much fun and was really relaxing. A great way to spend the day with the heat.

Great park. I visited Aquaventure, as well, so I can compare the two.Aquaventure is bigger, I guess, with more sunbeds. Aquaventure is a bit more spacious, and the scenery is nicer.Wild Wadi was labrinth for me, it was hard to find the slides. There are slides, going upwards - amazing.There are two thrilling slides; you have to use rubber-rings for 4 people; even if you are only two of you. Thrilling!!! :) Try it! :)You can have fish-spa, which is extremely funny.You can by a plastic glass, which you can refill with Pepsi anytime for a few AED.
Great fun. Had a great time at the water park, went on a Saturday and was expecting it to be really busy, but only spent a max of 5 minutes queing. Would definitely recommend the Riptide!

great rides, but can get busy.. Been to wild wadi quite a few times already. very well laid out. It is a well run water park,with lots of water slides, and with more than enough life guards on duty, so safe fro the whole family, and stops people being silly, jumping queues etc. Lots of places to get something to eat, although expensive ,seeing that the entrance costs a lot. Over weekends, and public holidays, the lines for rides are long.Can get very hot in summer, but then you relax and cool down on the lazy river.

"too hot". The place was too hot but I can't blame the water Park for the weather but most of the ride were closed for renovation and the life gaurds were not the friendliest.The park has stict rules that I think is very pointless.if your look for a water park go to "aquaventure"

Hold onto your trunks!. Visited wild wadi with my wife and 3 kids in Oct half term and we had a fabulous day in a great setting. The park is a good size and getting around is easy. The rides themselves are fantastic fun and the Jumeirah Shakira is absolutely amazing, if a little terrifying! All my boys enjoyed themselves and would happily go back next time we visit. Only small complaint would be the 30 - 45 min queue in hot sun to go in.

Awesome day out. We enjoyed our day here. We were looking for a park that was a little more wild with the rides it had rather than the aquarium experience like the other park. We had a great day out and enjoyed all the rides. Worth going to. Karryn and Jason. newZealand

worth a visit. It really has a view of everything especially as it is so clear and expect its always that clear. We went at 12.30p.m and although we were told by a taxi driver night was the best I don't think so as really it would be all lights.

Fun fun fun!. We hired a cabana for 8 of us which was great as they were so busy and there were no beds left?! Not sure id have been so happy if we hadn't shelled out the huge expense for this. Friendly staff, nice environment and lots of fun.
Fun!. Water slides were great, the staff were friendly and lively. Large kids play area and relaxation area for parents to chill on sunbeds. Food was a little expensive but was tasty.

just ok and only if you get in for free. Staying at the DAM, we got in for free, I'm pleased we did as i'd have not been happy paying for this. The slides they had, were good but some of them were broken and there just wasn't enough to spread out the crowds....so queuing for slides took ages. We just popped in for an hour or so and after doing the 3 or so decent water chutes we left....as i say ok if you can get in for free and want to have a bit of a break form the beach

Great time with the family. It is a very nice place, I believe better than the Atlantis as it is smaller in size (more manageable) with less people and less cues. The rides are very fun and safe yet full of thrills.

Cools you down. Good for cooling down on hot Dubai days. Lines are nice and short and lot's of water everywhere to keep you cool. Food is very reasonably priced compared to the gouging of the american parks. You can eat for 10$. They also have these neat bracelets that carry your pre-loaded currency on that you wear in the park and you can get a full refund at the end of the day. Excellent for not having to return to your locker. This bracelet also acts as your locker key.

Fun for all ages!. This is not as a big as the Aquaventure Park at Palm Atlantis but just as good! It has one big lazy river which connects to 11 different slides and a major slide which isn't for the faint hearted! The are several areas to relax on sun longers with great views of Jumeriah Beach and the Burj Al Arab. You can pay extra if you want access to the beach.

Fun water park. We got free access to the water park by staying at the Jumeirah beach hotel. Well worth it. The water slides are very good and the park is clean and organized. You can easily kill half a day here.
Pleasant surprise. Got free passes because we were staying at the Burjal Arab next door.....a nice clean waterpark....actually had an amazing time!!

Very Nice But Expensive. The Wadi is an excellent place for the family though a bit expensive if you have more than two children accompanying you. The place have fun filled activity for everyone, your age not withstanding.

So fun for all ages!. I loved all of the rides and the fact that you go up and not down! I brought my mum who is her early sixties and we had such a scream. Although she ended up with the biggest bruises on her bum ha ha
Great time!. Was there three days ago and the weather was perfect. Quite a lot of people so if you plan to go, go early. The slides are sooo much fun!!
Good for all ages. There is a lot to do here. The thrill factors don't lie... some of the rides are actually terrifying. Thoroughly recommended and go back every time I am in Dubai
New Slides. New slides, great day, no lines, and lots and lots of fun. It couldn't get better than that. You also get a great view of New Dubai from here.
A fab day out. This is the best water park in Dubai if you're going there for the rides, try to get there early before the queues!

Very good park but avoid holidays!. In general, the best time to go to water parks in Dubai is actually in the middle of the week, this way you could avoid having to queue for long times waiting for your turn. In general the park is very nice, they added new facilities recently.

great waterpark, very safe and clean, good for spending an entire day. We had to choose between Aquaventure and Wild Wadi and picked Wild Wadi because we saw a very long line at the entrance on the day we visited the palm. Got there around 10.30 and didn't have to wait long to enter. Was quite hard to find 2 free chairs, but during the day we always saw free ones in the more remote areas of the park. It's located beautifully next to the Jumeirah hotel, the beach and the Burj al Arab, so views from higher points are great. So are the slides, and the large pool. Tubes don't need to be carried 'up', the have a very inventive system of pushing you up in upward waterslides, great! Everything very clean and lots of staff to keep you safe in the water. We spend the entire day in the park and didn't get bored. Also lots to do for small kids. Not so many healthy food options, mainly fries, burgers etc.

Wet, but not too wild. This is efficiently and well run, very clean and safe. The friendly staff supervise all the activities closely and are always on had to help if you need it. They obviously don't want to be sued. Maybe two of the rides get the adrenalin pumping - surfing the waterjets or riding the waterchutes - but the main attraction is drifting along a circuitous channel in a pneumatic doughnut, with occasional fast and steep sections to keep you awake. I didn't notice a lot of garden areas for relaxing; the park is quite densely built without much open space.
Another Great Trip!. We have been to Wild Wadi 3 times now and it is always very clean with a great selection of activities. Just a little crowded at certaion times which can lead to queues.

Holy macaroni. Oh boy, we went to a wedding of a work colleague at Jumeirah Beach hotel and got free access. Talk about reverting to childhood. Again, again , again ! But go early in the day as it gets packed out after lunch, esp on Fridays

Great. Your kids will love it ... DONT miss....
Little bit expensive but worth it .... Make sure to avoid holiday or elase would spend 1 hr in queue for ticket. Opens from 10:00 - 19:00.

Great place to enjoy but beware the locker room. The place is fantastic, especially for kids.Just don't take much stuff with you for which you may need a locker. This is because you have to pay 25 or 35 AED (£4 to £8 depending on the size) for the locker !!!(why not have a refundable coin system like most swimming pools in the UK?).The lockers are tiny, even the so called larger ones are awkwardly L shaped, and if you take more stuff , you will have to rent more than one. I decided to keep only my wallet, camera, watch etc in the locker and left my clothes hanging on a clotheshook - only to be told off when I returned by one of the attendants there. He said that I was not allowed to leave my clothes there(what are the clothes hooks for then?).He said thet I might accuse the park for lost belongings (anyone wants to steal an old T shirt and used cargoes?). When I said that I assume responsibility for them if they were lost, I was told that it was against the rules. But apparently you can leave shoes behind in the open(so someone can nick your new £120 Nikes). When I asked as to why the park charges separately for a locker when it can include it in the entrance fee, I was rudely told not to come again if I did not like it. Rant over - other wise it is definitely recommended.

Good water park. You must go on the 'Tantrum Alley' it's amazing! Not much for smaller kids, probably aimed at 7+yrs, cashless system and lots of lockers make it easy in the park. Amazing views of the 7 star Burj hotel from Wild Wadi.A bit pricey on the entrance fees (around 200 dirhams per person)Not as big as I expected it to be and the food is poor and over priced. But definitely worth a visit.

A great place to have fun. I recently visited Wild Wadi. The entry process was smooth. The day that I went, there was a huge group of kids. So, the locker room was, um, loud. However, the attendant there did a good job of quieting the kids. I great thing about this park is that you can load money onto a wristband (provided), so that you can eat and buy things without needing to use cash. If you have money left over, it's refunded to you.You can rent a towel. I brought my own and, unfortunately, don't know the price of a rental. I think that it might be best to rent. Who wants to remember to bring a towel?The rides were good.

Good for small children. Its not massive and contained with food outlets at every corner your small ones will never tire - and the Young kidz bucket slides are a blast If you arrive late in day it gets very very Busy. so get in early to enjoy a fun day with kidz and find a sunbed needs a new lick of paint - otherwise a nice day out in what could be a very hectic trip

My kids favourite in Dubai. This is one of the best water rides in the world. Professional and modern operation and tons of fun for all ages. If you have kids, it is really a must. Go as early as possible so the lids get enough and not rushing to try all the rides towards the end of the day. Way to go Dubai
Excellent family day out. The rides here are great for all ages and there are also areas to paddle around with younger kids. Lots of places for food and drink. Clean toilets and changing rooms
a day well spent. the ambience... the rides and the location of this place is outstanding.....we had a great day there and will always look to go back again and again

Wild Wadi. Spent a day here, had to queue for 1 hr to get in and left at 6pm. Family/kids area is good , my 10 yr old loved it, and its suitable for younger ones. The other rides should be more varied, as 2 are surfing type, and 2 large rubber ring ones. There were queues for all, and some paths were abit slippery. Expensive to visit if you don't have any vouchers.
Great slides. The park is great, especially for kids. The new slides are really cool, you'll love it if you have kids. The park is not too huge, so you won't get lost!

Faster than Fast!. To be honest I am a big kid at heart and I generally look for these places on trips abroad for the family. Wild Wadi is quite amazing. I am no thrill junky but this is complete family fun. Flood River is a cool wave machine, perfect in the shallows for the little one's or metre waves in the deep end for the adventurous types. Master Blaster is great for adults and 7+ kids. Takes you on a tour of the rapids throughout the park, but mind you watch out for The Tunnel of Doom! The scariest ride is the Jumeirah Sceirah, 80 km per hour of sheer speed excitement - keep your legs crossed - it goes super fast!!!What is just pleasant is the backdrop of the Burj Al-Arab 7* hotel next to the park. You can spend all day looking at the sheer magic of the building and it's architecture.2 x adults and 2 children (5+7) was around £150 GBP - no food allowed in and lockers and food cost - put on credit watches which you take with you around the park and refunded credit, in cash on exit. Tip - watch the time as you leave, as the taxi queue can get pretty long, when all you want to do is get out of the heat!!! Visit Wild Wadi - it's super FUN!!!

Was expecting something MUCH better for Dubai. Nothing special in this park except the nice view. The ground is dirty, you have to queue a lot, people working there are nice but very slow. When it's time for lunch, you have to queue again! We went for a burger close to the entrance of the park, it's was terrible, DISGUSTING, don't go there.

Safety first for kids. This is for sure one of the greatest water parks we had been to.This is an absolute must , if you are visiting Dubai with kids. Amazing rides (water slides that go up the hill, so no climbing up the stairs), pools filled with sea water ( no chlorine which is a bonus) and all the kids must wear life jackets when playing in the pool area. There is heaps of life guards, more than I've seen at any other water park. Even parents with small kids are able to take a bit of a break here. Yes, expect the food and entrance to be more than usual, but it's totally worth it.The water park staff is very friendly and when it comes to food expect the usual Fast foods you would have at any other amusement park. There are so many rides and so many things to do, that you can easily spend the whole day there. Website included with opening hours and admission fees http://www.jumeirah.com/Hotels-and-Resorts/Wild-Wadi/

Expensive but awsome. We had the luck that friend of us stayed at the Jumeirah beach hotel so we could go in for free. Otherwise it would've been very expensive. The park itself is great and you won't be bored, I promise!

Great half day out!. Super enjoyed this - long queues for the surfing rides but over all good - perfect for family with teenagers as suitable for all, less so for a couple, not alot of aircon if bringing smaller kids but depends on weather if needed

queue management could be improved. it's a nice waterpark although queue management could be improved. They also need to have a better treatment for people staying at the Burj or suites in MJ. Can't chuck them all in the same queue for towels and give the bracelets in advance...

Great fun in the sun..... A very lovely experience in Dubai recently was visiting the Wild Wadi water park... the kids area was absolutely wonderful, the rides interesting and challenging as well, with all relevant signs detailing the excitement levels... facilities were clean and well maintained...food was expensive but that is sort of expected in a place like this... all in all, great fun in the sun
Soak, Scream and Surprise!. LOVE LOVEEE This place!! Great rides, fun environment and lots of every age to do. Do keep this for a summer vacation though since winter months can be a bit chilly

Wild ride - great day for all. What a fantastic park - water slides that go up a hill so no climbing stairs and no dragging the tube. Lots of friendly staff along the way and the "watch" to load up money on is a brilliant idea! We had the best time and we are aged in our late 40's and early 50's and great kids areas as well. Plenty of spots for those that just want to laze around but why would you!

Crowded and expensive - but fun. A little bit tired now and in need of a spruce up - but still fun and lots of great rides. Getting away from the place is ridiculously chaotic though. We waited over an hour in a taxi queue - and we're told this is par for the course

Once again the World's ultimate waterpark!. Great new rides and the old ones still remain outstanding. Spotlessly clean (for a waterpark) and loads of sun beds. Negatives were the long queues (the worst was an hour but 15/30 minutes was not uncommon) but it was a holiday week and we understand these are unusual.

Great Water Fun. Best water park I've ever been to. Had a great time.. Water rides are thrilling and exciting. The Jumeirah Giant Slide was really nerve wracking.. over all.. it was great fun. i just love wild wadi
Great place. For all ages......and the dancing lifeguard is amazing! Great slides, lazy river and under fives section. Def worth a visit
fantastic waterpark. fantastic day out.lots to do for families.water slides are great,great lazy river.fantastic waffles & ice cream
Family fun. Lots of exciting water activities for young and old. The beach area and children's playground is perfect for a young family
Amazing!. great rides, just a little bit pricy. Perhaps staff could do with some training on handling kids with special needs, not rude just clueless,
Great fun. Given it's always baking hot, spending a day at the Wild Wadi is a must. Great fin for adults and children with a range of rides from the tame to the terrifying,

Fun day out. Very enjoyable on a hot day in dubai! The rides are exciting and the variety is adequate. Well maintained, and enjoyable for the whole family! I was expecting bigger waves. Safety is Good with life guards and jackets all over the place! nice section for little kids to splash around in, but the water falls through buckets overhead at great force, so look out mummies!Food is ok, theres not a large variety but you get the basic pizza, burgers etcLook out for the soda top up offer!The long waiting can be tiresome as the line of people waiting to get to the rides are long! So you may not get to do the popular rides too often. For muslim sisters theres a special ladies only night!Prayer facility available.Get ready for the long flight of steps leading to the thrillilng rides:-)
Look out for discount vouchers. Various rides cater for all members of the family. White knuckle rides, relaxing lazy river. Toddler park. Plenty places to eat. Locker and towel hire.
Best waterpark in dubai. Wild wadi is definitely the best waterpark in Dubai- so much to do.Looking forward to going next year to go on the new Jumeirah sceirah!!!
Fantastic water park!. Plan for a whole day here, its even as fun for adults as for kids! Try all the rides nd go around the uphill rafts!

Best Water Park in Dubai. There are a couple of water parks in Dubai and some more not very far if you are happy to drive. But I would recommend Wild Wadi as it is more cost effective and once in the park the costs such as food, locker hire etc are alot more reasonable then some of the others.Wild Wadi is clean and well kept. The staff are very friendly and on hand to help. They have a great children's area for those little ones that aren't tall enough to use the rides. Recently new riders have been opened and they are alot of fun (or so Im told).Queues for the surf machines can be long, but they generally let you have a good turn even when you fall off after the first few seconds !!!One of the best places to get a fantastic photograph of the Burj Al Arab as well if you are interested. Walk to the back of the park which is closest the beach. There is a gift shop and food place which has decking on the roof. Best place for a piccy!!If you want to save some money you need to go to the book shop in the mall and get a family entertainer book as they have buy one get one free tickets. It might seem pricey but if you are planning to do alot in Dubai this will save you ALOT of money.

AWESOME. This water wold is by far the best I've been to. The facilities are great, the staff are friendly, the weather is always great, and options are almost endless! A few useful notes, they will check your bags for drinks or food as you go in. They want you to buy their food and drinks. The food options are basically fastfood, and a bit pricey. I wouldn't say the food is good value for money at all. Although the weather is hot and sunny most year round, during the summer it is abnormally hot, this means you'll be making sure your head isn't in the direct sun all day. Running from one activity to other as the floor can be real hot.Having said all that, it is definitely a must visit while in Dubai. The highlight is the air doughnut that you sit in and it floats you to and from lots of the activities.p.s. warning for the ladies, the vertical drop is great, but there is a reason lots of young lads are standing at the end of the water slide, biki tops amlost always come off!

Great Fun. I would suggest that you get there early if you can. It is good fun for everyone and there is plenty to do. Do not use the lockers though, you really do not need them, trust me. When you look for a seat (sunbed) go up and away from the pools. We was suprised at the amount of beds not being used and how much more peaceful it was up there.

Better for big kids. This would be ideal for those over 110 cm as they could then go on everything. The entrance is a bit spendy to go there for the waterplay only. The rides are great and there is plenty to do.If you can get hold of these little wetsuit shoes, i would advise it as in the summer months the ground can be hot despite the cooling water spray.
My kids loved it.. It took me 20 years back in age and I was a kid again. I have tried each game at least twice. Sometimes the wait is long but its worth it.

Great day at Wild Wadi!!. This was my first experience of a water park and I had a fantastic time. The time to get into the facility was a bit long- approx an hour which would be my only criticism. Luckily, the day we were there the queues for the rides were not too bad and the rides themselves are fantastic. Also lots of nice places to chill out and sunbathe if rides arent your style.
Been here now on 6 separate visits. This time it was half term. The park was very busy, with lengthy queues. My son and I love the Blaster Rides. Good choice of food. Excellent and helpful staff.

Big disappointment. We visited Wild Wadi 11 years ago and had a fab day, so when we returned to Dubai with our 8 year old in October we thought she would love it. Sadly, our day consisted of a 1.5 hour queue in the searing heat to enter the park and 3 further hours of queuing to go on three rides. When you do get to the front of the queue, the rides are excellent, but I’m not convinced the 3 rides were really worth the 220 dirham (each) entrance fee.

Amazing. I have spent lot of my weekends here and this is the place to be in any season. I never feel like coming out even if they make evacuation announcements :p . I like everything there, specially the flood river, jumeirah sceirah, lazy river and wave pool. Nice food options available. great service and friendly staff.

A nice experience with friends or family. Its one of the best destinations to go in dubai
U can spend the full day there with friends or family as well.
Many different level games , either for adults or children even more than atlantise water park in palm island.

Very Disappointing. Save your (significant amount of) money!. Wild Wadi was supposed to be one of the highlights of our short family holiday in Dubai. What a disappointment, though. We queued for 30 minutes just to get in, then very long queues for all the rides - not that there is that much choice of rides.However, in case queuing to get on the rides isn't miserable enough, the rides themselves then jam up due to the number of riders, so you end up going around the course in a series of stop-start phases, which totally ruins the flow and any excitement of the ride.In 5 hours on site we only managed to get 5 rides.The solution to this problem is so simple - just limit the number of people entering the park! Unfortunately the operators don't seem to care whether their customers actually get value for money, instead cramming the place with as many unsuspecting punters as they can.We are not a family of whingers and we certainly expect to queue at any theme park, but this was the worst example of profiteering at the cost of quality and value that we've ever experienced.Think VERY carefully before parting with your £40+ per head!

AVOID: Queues and No place to sit. This place is a total disaster. First you queue to get in, then you queue to buy a ticket, then you queue to get a towel, then you look for a sunbed and they are all taken. You would think for the price they charge you. AED 1000 for family of 4 they could invest in enough sunbeds. Anyway then you queue for every single ride.

Wild Wadi Rocks. For lovers of water, this is the place to visit for loads of water games in cool clean clear water. Spent more than 8hours at wild wadi. A little problem though with LONG queues for the really exciting and thrilling games

Great Water Park.. We had a fun day at Wild Wadi but do find it very expensive for what you are getting. Its a bit over priced i think for a water theme park but was nice to have done it. But won't be going back again.Also towards closing time as everyone is leaving is good to try and arrange a taxi in advance coz the taxi queue is a nightmare or should i say overall is hard to find a taxi.

A nice place to visit with children and teens.. Wild Wadi offers many kinds of slides and a wave-pool (be careful with kids, it's deep), You can easily spend a day there, and they had this nice system when paying the food and drinks. You got a bracelet, where you downloaded for example 20e amount, and you could pay with it, without going to the locker rooms and searching for money when wet and so on.

Nice, expensive, worst part- NO HOT WATER in men's showers. We had a good time on October 19, 2012 until the end where we did not get any hot water in the men's showers. This really spoiled the trip. Some low class people were banging on the door while we waited for a drop of hot water. The bloody manager named Rawad said that this is not possible while we experienced it and heard the cursing of some men over the un-availability of hot water.Oh we'll, I guess you can't have it all.

Great family day out. Wild Wadi was a lot of fun. The kids had a great time. We were lucky to go on a relatively quiet day, so the waiting time was minimal. I can imagine waiting times being unpleasant during weekends or holidays. Try of week days or off peak times. Definitely worth a visit with the family old and young.

Great Water Park and well planned out. Wild wadi is located close to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel and is ideal if you want to experience a Water Park with great views of the iconic Burj Al Arab. Get there early, opens at 10am, then the rides are a little quiter. Slides are great value and well mixed, queing is always an issue but the queues are well laid out and well managed so you do not seem to wait too long. If you are using vouchers you need to check they are accepting them on the day you want to go. All round a great fun day out

Be warned it gets busy. Be prepared to queue but its still great fun. Great rid and good food but very expensive. Be warned getting a cab at the end of the day is very difficult. Walk to the Jumeriah hotel to catch a taxi.

take your own towels. great water park - fantastic rides and slides.not even that bad queues, and we went on a public holidayMake sure you take your own towels - hiring theirs is extortionate.food is reasdonably priced - and they have a wristband system that you can charge with cash, to save you carrying money. they give you a refund at the end of the day of anything unspent.If making your own way there - the Mall of the Emerites is the closest Metro stop, and then its a short taxi ride away.Remember on the return that the queue for the taxi's back is long and doesn't go down particularily quickly.
Had fun with my friends.... It was so amazing...You can have fun there...The park has lots of entertainments with friendly staff...

Small and busy!. Arrived early to make the most of our day only to be met with really big queues. Having pre-purchased our tickets, we didn't expect such a lengthy wait to enter but still waited 45 minutes - in full Dubai sun - to get in. Shocked that the waiting area had no shade. Thought communication was very poor re queuing and entering. Also very surprised that there were no family change rooms, and my husband said the male change room was like a frat house - definitely not suitable for small children. We chose Wild Wadi as we thought it more suitable for small children rather than Atlantis but although the attractions were good, there weren't many, and all had big queues. In our 3.5 hour visit, we went on 5 attractions and spent the rest of the time in queues.

A good option to spend a day with kids. We went there with a friend of mine. It's a nice water park, but it's more for children. Anyway, we had a good time, and since it was a low season (early December) and a weekday, there were not many people there. Food is available, but it's fast food like pizza and burgers.Not alcohol in the park.Smoking in designated areas only.

Only the (Jumairah Scierah). Don't you ever miss the slides (Jumaira Scierah) one of the best slides I have every visited!!! It’s very scary for the first time, very fast and quick! But after the first time you will become addicted to this slide!!! I can repeat it forever!!! Wish it was longer though!But for the decoration of the park, I didn't like it, the green color is rare. Variety of restaurants is poor too.I have visited the Sunway lagoon park in Malaysia and then this park, for me I liked Sunway lagoon ways more and I think there is no comparison between the two and the credits go all to Sunway Lagoon Malaysia on all levels. But for the best waterslide, Jumaria Schiera is the best.
Great Fun. Had a great time and free entry when your a Burj Al Arab Guest. Plenty to do and see. Food was good.
GREAT. i went to more than 10 waterparks across the the world and so far this one have the most challenging slides in the world.......sleep on jumaeirah beach hotel to get free entry
Great splash and refreshing... just avoid holidays!. Want to cool off here in UAV? This is your ticket! just avoid any public holidays or you spend your time in the waitingline!

Great Fun. I love Wild Wadi. It is a great way to cool down in the middle of a Dubai summer.The lazy rivers that turn into rides is a great concept.If you are staying at either JBH or Madinat Jumeirah, the free access means that you can pop in for an hour or two and have some fun while cooling down.If you are staying outside, you really need to make a day of it as the cost will stop you having a fleeting visit.
Fun park. Fun weekend water park. I enjoyed all the rides. Changing rooms are clean...should only allow swim suit...

Best Water Park Ever. Its USP is that the rubber rings and water jets get you up to the top of the slides without having to walk. It is ery easy to spend many hours here, you don't have to be riding all day.
Food and drink was expensive for Dubai.

Fun in the Sun. The location is convenient, although I have to admit a bit awkward as I am not used to having views of a bustling street while I am waltzing around in a water park in my bikini. However, the other side of the park offers beautiful views of the Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, which make it an ideal tanning spot. Spent 7 hours with my friend and her little sister, which just flew by! Staff were friendly and generally had a good attitude. The rides were fun and exciting and it was thankfully not too crowded. Would be best to go in a big group of friends to thoroughly enjoy and as I had been there in 2011, I hope they have added more options for attractions and rides since then. Also, look out for the various offers and promos that they have on offer with regards to the entrance fees!
Full days entertainment.. Big enough to take a couple of hours to get your bearings. Hair raising big stuff and gentle meandering rides around the complex. entertaining and somthing for all ages.

Family fun, Jumeirah style. The park is a must-go and must-see destination in Dubai. It has rides for all ages, conditions, and death-wishes. It has a wave pool for the tranquility lovers, kiddy park for the little ones, and major slides for those looking for a challenge.
I LOVE IT. Wild Wadi is the best water park in Dubai and always will be, great staff, great fun and a great day out for everyone
fun day out. me and the wife went here for the day and had a great time. Load a wristband with "cash" and get a locker, then you dont have to worry about carrying cash around with you.
fun for all. This is a must see . it is a little small but has some great water activities ,with the heat in Dubai plan to make it a full day of fun in the sun and Relaxsation
Great fun for all. Great place to cool down , so much fun , it can suit all ages all rides for different ages .Havent tried the new ride !!!! was too scared ......

Amazing Experience. We went to Wild Wadi Water park this time when I was in Dubai. It was an amazing experience. It was our first time though we first face little issue finding the rides but the staff was very helpful and we enjoyed there a lot. though I would like to say that the training staff at some rides could be a little more helpful but I am assuming they might be tired from the long day. But still it was great to be there and surely will go again next time when ill be in dubai
Getting a bit old now but fun. If you dont fancy the size of Atlantis, this is good too. A little old now but is still good fun. Seating can be hard to find, but a good small wate park

Great fun for kids. Not as big as we thought, but plenty of exciting rides for the whole family. Surprised to see bikinis on many- we preferred to be a bit more conservative. Rash guards and board shorts protect skin from the bumps and corners!

Enjoyment. This water park is amazing.you'll have a great time there.it has a pool that makes waves and the DJ mixes the hit songs.there is a special space for the children and they are safe there
Flow riders are awesome and the important item: it's clean and organized

AMAZING!. Visited 3 years ago, I was pregnant, but still rode the jet power water slide, its bumpy when it went up. Amazing set up, amazing location. Quite expensive, but we got discount from "entertainer book" a book full with discount for attractions and restaurant in Dubai, u can get it in the bookstore.
enjoyed it there.

Wonderful day. WW was a wonderful experience. Kids really loved it. It was the perfect size for us (3 kids - 5, 4 and 3) in that there were enough rides so as to not get bored on 1 or 2 of them... but also it was all close enough to get to without walking ages. We went on a Monday and it was busy but the queues were by no means very long... so it was fun all the way. The views of Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Hotel add to the environment... All the lifeguards and staff around the park are extremely helpful. One tip for the photographs - make sure you ask for deals when they push you to buy - 130 AED per picture was very expensive... and you can get a USB with all your pictures for 250 AED (most of us will put them on iPads and the such like anyway).

What a rush!. Absolutely loved Wild Wadi! Organised and clean. Great tube rides, two flow riders, wave pool and of course the Jumeirah Sceirah drop is truly a rush! Restaurants all over, ice cream and the little fish that nibble your feet!

You don't have to walk up hill!. This is a well laid out and organized water park. We barely queued for anything and had a great day. It is also the only water park I've been to where you don't have to walk up hill. You can sit on your tube and be blown up the water slide by a series of water jets! They run a cashless system where you pre load a watch strap with credit so you don't need to carry cash or go back to your locker when it's time for lunch. You redeem your balance on the way out. The system works well. All in all well run and loads of fun. If you are in Jeremiah don't miss this place!

Fantastic fun. A brilliant day out for all ages and was extremely impressed with the amount of lifeguards on site.Certainly very committed to the safety of all it's visitors.Staff at wild Wadi are really pleasant and helpful.Great slides and loads of fun for every age group.
Great fun. Superb rides - even for the lazy, as water jets force you up certain sections to get to the top again. Thoroughly good day out in all respects.

Best Water Park in Dubai. Closely overlooked by the world’s most luxurious hotel in the world, The Burj Al Arab, you are guaranteed a great day of fun for all the family at the Wild Wadi Water Park in Dubai. Packed with daring and fantastic water slides, waves of fun, kid friendly slides & water play areas and a big lazy river for those who prefer relaxing, you will not be disappointed!• Entrance at Wild Wadi is AED220, I would put a minimum visit time of at least 5 hours probably go for all day really. It clearly does get busy at times because there is evidence of queuing systems for some rides and so it would presumably be best to avoid weekends (Fri and Sat) when the locals will be using it. • You get given a wristband on entry and you pay a small fee (AED20 for small) to use a locker access for which is put on the wristband (they will ask you if you want a small, medium or large locker) a small locker only really good enough for 1 person.• They have a cashless payment system - you load cash on to a wristband which you can use for food, drinks etc, which is good. It's mostly junk food, just so you know. If you don't spend credit you get it refunded in cash when you exit. • They will take away any food or drink when you go through security but will keep it in a fridge for you to collect on exit.• There is free water available inside (small drinking fountain) to the right hand side of ladies changing rooms.• The rides are brilliant something for everyone from lazing around in giant rubber rings on a lazy river to the new Sceirah ride which is a brilliant ride for the adrenalin junkies!• A tip - unless you're bagging some loungers and leaving your things there, put everything in your locker - flip flops, sunglasses, sunscreen etc, as you can't carry it with you. The walkways get very hot in the sun so you have to walk quickly, or find puddles! I imagine you would need to keep little ones' sandals on to walk as it would be too hot for them in the summertime - they do have racks by the rides where you can store your shoes. Wear lots of sunscreen and make sure you go back to your locker to put more on. Bring towels - you can hire them but you have to pay.

Ladies night!!!!!!!!!. This place was awesome, 205 dirhams which is £36.00 personally this compares to Uk theme parks. The best I can give you is ditch our man and head to wild wadi with your girlfriends on ladies night 4/5 hours of exclusive time depending on the season. I went today October 11 2012 it opened at 8pm and closed midnight. This is for the local women so they can remove their traditional clothing as men and children over 8 are not permitted, nor is photography. What this means is there are zero queues I waited for nothing and I highly recommend the tantrum alley and the jumeriah sceirah. Overall for me the experience was ace the temperature was great and everything was lit up. Great evening

Lots of fun. Quick and easy location to get to by taxi, the Wild Wadi Water Park is a fun attraction for young and old. Our overall experience was great, no crowds or queues. The "wristband credit system" is an innovative aspect, where you don't need to carry Dirham around to pay for any extras, just load up the band and you can check your credit on the many scanners around the park. The rides are fantastic and certainly had the adrenalin pumping. Change room is clean, with lockers provided as an extra fee, but well worth paying for. Shoes are a must as the concrete paving is scorching when walking around. The gift shop is in need of improvement, as in better stock. Signage is somewhat lacking as to where and how to get to some of the rides. Taxis are plentiful when your day is over.All in all, we had an awesome time.
