This park has got better and better!. Visited Wild Wadi for the second time after a 5 year break. The new rides are very exciting, especially the one that launches you up in the air in your tube. We visited at 3.30 after the main heat of the day and very much enjoyed the last hour before it shut when the park was empty so we could go round and round on the tube ride watching the sunset over Dubai. Loved it!
great fun. a bit overpriced for my liking but good fun, rides were good not too slow or boring like some waterparks, q's were long but thats normal at most waterparks.

Good waterpark. When we went unfortunately a big part of the park was closed for constructions but the atmosphere is great, try the surfing, it is fun! It is a bit crowdy over the weekends but is a fun day out!
Still one of the best water parks. Wild Wadi is still my favourite water park in Dubai, great fun - but use 2-4-1 vouchers as admission is quite steep.
Fantastic new ride. Although not a big as the one in Atlantis , it still makes you have a good time. The new rides are great and the food is good and prices are reasonable

Great place. The place is really nice to spend a day, the rides are various and thrilling, or you might just relax by the pool. The only thing? The entrance is pretty expensive for what it offers, considering that some of the services inside are again by paiment.
Kids Loved It!. My husband took our two 10 years olds here and they absolutely loved it! Comments from the husband were fun day out but fairly expensive and long queues when busy.

A decent waterpark, target for a day of pure fun!. The water park offers a variety of different rides for all different ages. Best thing to do is hit all the thrilling rides at first before it gets crowded and u start losing your energy; then go for a ride through the lazy river, grab a bite at any of their restaurants, they're all ok for a water park. Don't forget to grab a plate of their cold delicious watermelon.
fantastic. loved wild wadi fun for everyone no matter what your looking for worth the money everything is available inside food, drink etc.. great location as well we had a great time

Its ok. The rides break down and stop for up to 40 minutes whilst someone turns everything off then turns everything back on then off because it hasn't worked. The big main rides were being worked on so Im sure when they are working its not a bad place. The food is adequate and the staff vary from very friendly to "I'm getting paid and I don't care about customers". Overall its a nice trip for the family but consider going on a quiet day ie not Thursday, Friday or Saturday.
excellent place for kids.... and grown ups alike! however the long queues on the weekend just make it too long and boring to wait for a few seconds of fun! I prefer aquaventure!

Still a good day out - BUT expensive. Great day out and the new rides are really, really good. I have not been to Wild Wadi for a couple of years and one thing that did shock me was the prices - seems very expensive, dread to think of the costs to take the family!
great place to take your children..... relax while your children will go wild in the water....some of the glides will test your fear levels...

Great fun, but quite expensive and very busy!. Its a great water park, the ticket price is quite expensive for us (try to find any discount voucher if you can, maybe from your hotel, etc) and there are extra expense for locker and towel hire. We bring our own towels, but need the locker, choose the big locker, but disappointed with the small size and L-shape, not ergonomist at all! Btw, you are not allow to bring your own food into the park, but if you want to buy food in there and dont want to bring your wallet, just deposit some AED to your wristband. We all have a great fun, the staff are nice and life guards are every where, but it getting very busy after midday, so better come as early as possible so you can enjoy all your favorite attractions with out waiting to long.
Great day out for all. Great waterpark. There are three big slides which are great fun, the rest are good but a little repetitive. Good day out though.

huge fun in the water... for adults too!!. We have been to this for many years when in Dubai on holiday... it is a huge amount of fun for young and old.... lazy rivers, water blasters, wave pools... Tremendous numbver of life guards there so the kids atre always safe. For a special experience, go in the evening and shorter queues. You will definitely enjoy it if you go there.

Money Pit!!. A hugely expensive day out starting with the entry fees - which DO NOT include locker or towel hire - new visitors be warned. They've got you over a barrel there, unless someone wants to sit beside the bags all day you need to get one. Or two, or three, as they are tiny. They have the cheek to ask 35 AED ( nearly £6.00, $9.50 ) for a so called large locker which is a stupid L shaped affair ( so that they can fit in more ) and little use to anybody. I have to say that the whole place was pretty tired and tatty looking; especially the changing rooms which were dark and dingy. So dark in fact that we almost left a good pair of sunglasses behind as we couldn't see into the locker properly. At the start of the day when it was quieter, the rides were all properly managed; i.e. the next person was not allowed to go until either the green light came on, or the last person was well out of sight. As it got busier however, these rules seem to fall by the wayside as the queues mounted up. We watched a few instances on parts of the river rides where the staff were very lucky that they didn't have anything more serious than cuts and grazes to deal with. There were quite a few walking wounded being treated along the way. The big rides stuck to procedure though and they are quite spectacular and worth a visit.Food and drink stalls are everywhere; usual run of the mill fast food stuff and expensive. All in all it was quite disappointing, and I doubt very much if we will ever be back. My advice would be to save your money and go to the Atlantis waterpark instead. Far nicer!!

Great Day Out!. Good value, very clean and brilliant rides!Very well run and they think of everything including a wrist band that has 'money' on it so you dont have to carry money on you!Great for all ages! sunbeds scattered around if you get tired and want to sun bath

Fun but WOW expensive. I think we spent $300 bucks just getting into the park, not counting food. But we each got a pair of shorts from the gift shop. They have some really fun rides. I wouldnt recomend the slide that you stand in and the floor drops out from under you. Nearly gave me a heart attack and I got off before the floor came out. Chicken I know. But that was the only "scary" slide. All the others were really cool. Easy river and easy slides. A LOT of people. Overall, it was nice. I would go again only if I had friends to show. TIP: Put money on the wrist bands befror you enter the park, it's a life saver. Ask the ticket keeper about money wristbands.
Fantastic Day out!. Brilliantly organised and some amazing rides - lots of shade when queueing for rides but be prepared for some reasonable waits for the larger attractions!
Splash. Great water park do not go on a Friday or saturday as it gets very busy very clean and safe lots of life gaurds
Go early. Beat the crowds and be there at 10am when it opens. Its a great day out for the whole family as there is something there for everyone.

So much fun, just loved it!. It is a great place for both children and adults. There are so much fin things to do, and the wristband made payment so easy. We loved the cabana slide, and did it twice. The drinks are affordable, and staff are nice. A highlight and must-see in Dubai, recommend it to everyone!

Children loved it. Expensive but when in Dubai a must for children. Some of the rides seemed a bit old & the children had scrapes and scratches after going down them, didn't put them off and they want to return to go on the new glass coffin flume!

wow. This is a great water experience. You can wallow in the water or take a rapid white knuckle ride sitting in a giant rubber ring (I hurt the bottom of my spine and was v badly bruised - ouch!). You can also cruise in a gentler fashion on a ring. Lots of fun for all the family.
Worth a visit. Had a thoroughly good day , went with friends, and spent the afternoon there, entry was free as staying the hotel next door
Super scary ride. Just come back from Dubai and tried out the Jumeirah Sceirah, it was amazing!!! So scary but you want to do it again and again!

Fun for everyone!. My husband and I were in Dubai for our twentieth wedding anniversary.We had the most awesome day at Wild Wadi.This is a great place for everyone,even old folks like us.Water, water everywhere.The Master Blaster tube rides were great fun and everyone we saw was laughing or smiling.Staff everywhere were extremely friendly and helpful.It was a joy to be there.The food is suprisingly good, lots of fruits and healthy options.Put your money on a waterproof wristwatch and you don't have to worry about carrying cash.There are some lovely views of the Burj Al Arab, so it's a good place to take your photos at the end of the day.My husband loved the waved rider and the Jumeirah Sceirah.It is such an attractive and well designed place.We didn't wait too long for anything.The ground was never too hot for bare feet, thanks to sprinklers on the paths.You don't even have to walk up stairs if you don't want to as water jets will push you uphill.We also went to Aquaventure but I think Wild Wadi was my favorite.We really had the best fun day in years and can't wait to return with our kids.

Great fun. This is the 2nd time I had visited and still enjoyed it as much as the first.Look for the entertainer voucher books in places like Carrefour (A5 telephone directory style book!) which is full of 2 for 1 vouchers including several vouvhers for Wild Wadi. Although the book costs AED350 you will likely recoup this and more (PS voucher book also has vouchers for Ski Dubai and loads of other places). Entrance at Wild Wadi is AED220, I would put a minimum visit time of at least 5 hours probably go for all day really. It clearly does get busy at times becasue therie is evience of queuing systems for some rides and so it would presumably be best to avoid weekends (Fri and Sat) when the locals weill be using it. We went on a Wednesday and found it was relatively quiet with only 10 minute queues for the 2 bigger adrenalin rides.You get given a wristband on entry and you pay a small fee (AED20 for small) to use a locker access for which is put on the wristband (they will ask you if you want a small, medium or large locker) a small locker only really good enough for 1 person. You also can charge your wristband with credit to enable you to buy food and drinks without needing cash. If you don't spend it you get it refunded in cash when you exit.They will take away any food or drink when you fo through security but wil keep it in a fridge for you to collect on exit.There is free water available inside (small drinking fountain) to the right hand side of ladies changing rooms.The rides are brilliant something for everyone from lazing around in giant rubber rings on a lazy triver to the new Sceirah ride (check out YouTube before you go so you know what you are letting yourself in for) which is a brilliant ride for the adrenalin junkies!Would definitely goagaineven though it is quite expensive

Wild wadi. We got to go here for free as staying at one of the Jumeirah group hotels, was ok passed a few hours enjoyed the 2 slides burj surj etc, and floating around but after that was ready to go. Do like the fact that they give you a wristband which you can put credit on so don't have to carry money around with you!

Im Kid There. We have been to wild wadi five times now the rides are fantastic one of them your in a massive rubber ring its like been inside a washing machine, great try all the rides and i always end up staying at least 6 hrs opens 11 am try get vouchers not cheap.
a fun place. great rides and a really fun place to spend a day - whether a couple, group, family there is something there for everyone.

A little bit weird but great people watching. I just sat and watched. The kids ran around and had a great time as the heat was unbearable. The people watching was amazing; fascinating what people find acceptable swimwear. From burkas with very high heels, variety of burkinis, bikinis of all kinds, to interesting men's wear from pajama bottoms to itty bitty bottoms. Also fun was the fish-pedi - perhaps not entirely hygienic, but fun.
Great day out.. Never time to get bored at Wild Wadi, so much to do and this time the queues were not very big, all at Atlantis most likely! More fun at Wild Wadi.

A great day out!. As with all places in Dubai Wild Wadi has great customer service. The rides were brilliant and there are great views of the Burj Dubai as you slide past which is pretty cool. Food at the park is actually reasonably priced - try the foot long hot dog at Ali's BBQ. There isn't too much for smaller children other than a wave pool and one play area but the kids who were there seemed to enjoy it.The only negative is that it is a little on the expensive side for entry. We had a by one get one free voucher from The Entertainer which I would highly recommed buying if you are going. This saved us a fortune. All in all a great day out and must do on your visit to Dubai.

Great Fun. it was a lot of fun ... i totally love the cooling systems they have .. with water sprinklers almost every feet to keep the ground cool as well as yourself cool ... and u just have to try the JS .... its FUN FUN FUN ... don't forget to wear your sunblock !!!!

Great water park. We were lucky when we went here, because we were staying at the Jumeriah Beach Hotel you gained entrance to the water park an hour before it opened to the general public. We had a great time
Nice place but small. It is nice to have such entertainment in Dubai but wish it is bigger. It cant be compared with Florida's water parks but Kids enjoyed anyway!

Wild Wadi Water Park. Excellent fun. Load bracelet with 25 dirhams to use lockers if you need them. Jumeirah beach guests have free access to facilities. Bracelet gets scanned on way in, then enjoy the rides. Make sure you put plenty of sun screen on as it gets very hot!! Free towels!

Average. Maybe better for kids that dont mind standing in line to get on the water. As an older adult I preferred Atlantis for the lazy rivers that connected to all the other rivers and slides via connectors and conveyor belts.

Great fun day out!. We all had a brilliant day! Arrive early to beat the crowds. Tube rides seemed to go on forever and are great fun and thrilling!!Nothing too scary!Lovely relaxed feel to the place.

a great day out.... If you want a bit of fun this is the place to go. However catch some sun before you go and bring your flipflops! for a park like this food and drinks inside are relatively cheap (especially by Dubai standards!)....give all the rides ago, especially the crazy one where you basically stand in a capsule and the floor opens! fantastic even when you have no kids with you.
Fun, Fun, Fun. It does not matter how old you are, 5 or 50, you will enjoy the experience. Be warned it is Hot, Hot, Hot.
Really good fun. Great waterpark, you load a bracelet with money so you can just lock your things away in a locker and enjoy the day. My husband really enjoyed the fish pedicure there as well.

Fab fun. Went there with huby on our trip to dubai and we really had fun. Loads of different water activities to do. Good changing failities. Children would love it, adults as well. A must visit if you are in dubai. I think there is an entry fee but we didnt pay as we got vouchers or something from our hotel.

Fun. So many water slides !! long lines though for the bigger rides (bit annoying), but so much fun - worth a visit !Cafe wasn't great though, waited AGES for 2 drinks and a kids meal (that was so greasy) - give the food a miss
Refreshing. Really enjoyed here with family lots of staff make you feel safe even with lil children. good food aswell but the slides amazing.

With your family or friends - this place is great!. I loved water parks when I was a kid, and whilst I was looking forward to visiting Wild Wadi, I wasn't too sure if it'd have the same appeal now that I was older... How wrong I was - it was all that AND more! Visiting this place actually made me feel like a kid again - it was great! There is SO much to do - so many water slides and so many pools, it would be easy to spend a day here. As it was, we only had a few hours, but made the most out of it.There are lots of positives to Wild Wadi, but in brief: * There are lifeguards everywhere - you never need to worry. * Sun-lounges have little covers over them to help protect you from the scorching sun. * Each slide gives you a brief description, so you know if you're heading down some hard core rapids or something a little more low-key. * There are pools and slides to suit everyone, and a great area just for kids. * The staff were all really friendly and helpful.One of my friends took the 'Leap of Faith' slide and when she stepped out of the pool said that she was "shaking, laughing, crying, terrified and elated all at once" - I'd say that's a pretty good review! :)
Fun fun fun. this is a great fun filled water park for the entire family...there r so many slides and fun water activities...highly recommended especially in the summer

Good, but needs updating. Enjoyed,however long queues formed after lunch. Live DJ playing.
Liked the way that the paths were kept wet to ensure that your feet didn't burn!
Entrance to the park free, as included in hotel package, would not have visited as often if had to pay
fun fun fun. we enjoyed the first visit this year, a lot of things to do . One of the place i will visit more often this year. bye

Worth the money.. The rides are all amazing, there is also a good range of rides so even the oldies will probably find themselves enjoying the park (eg lazy river). There is also a lot of shade available. The only downside would be due to it's popularity it can be hard to find a sunbed sometimes.

a very fun family day. this adventure water park is must for anyone visiting Dubai. Me and my family enjoyed this day out very much. all the rides are fun and the atmosphere is very nice. you want to avoid spending buying swim suits from the shops there (which are quite expensive) remember to take your swim suits!the entrance fee is 220 dirhams, per person which is quite dear, but worth the fun you have remember to go early and make the most of the day pass. a memorable day out with the family, for all age groups. my daughter was 16 months old and enjoyed all her time there. the staff are very nice and helpful. some of the popular rides do take a 45 Que wait at peak holiday times so avoid those if you can.

Ruined my whole holiday. Sustained injury due to poor ride safety. Faced with rude manager, Roshika.. I felt compelled to join and to compose a review regarding my recent (within last hour) experience at Wild Wadi. The staff member at Wild Wadi was very rude and abrupt did not care about me (a "valued" customer). I wait for over two hours to speak to a manager. The Jumeirah Sceirah ride is not even a mildly thrilling ride, the danger factor makes it something to be afraid of. I was lucky to come out alive with some scratches and grazing to my back. I followed all instructions closely, but it seems that the 900 test-runs just weren't enough. On my previous visit to Wild Wadi, it had a pleasant experience. Even though the temperatures were searingly hot and there were sweltering conditions, the park did take measures to keep customers cool. This was perhaps the only positive of the day.

Fun day out. We was staying in a Jumeirah hotel so access to the water park was complimentary. The park is a decent size and there are quite a few different attractions. Wild Wadi is mainly made up of slides which push you up using jets and then you ride down all within rubber rings. There were only 2 attractions which required you to physically walk up stairs to get to the start and these were the bigger large raft rides. I would recommend visiting as part of a stay in Dubai.

Everyone can enjoy there. It is a very large and beautiful water park.the games are not too much, but most of them are interesting. the guides and maps are perfect. you can see guidance boards in the beginning of each game which determine the excitement level of that. the staff are very polite and expert. we had a great memory there.

wild wadi water park. great fun,lots of slides and tube rides, free entry if staying at jemeirah beach hotel, get there when it opens and do the rides you want first,gets quite bus lunch time onwards.

Fun Water Park. We stayed at the Jumeriah resort (DAM hotel) and took full advantage of our free access to the water park. The kids loved the kids area (with the exception of the huge bucket of water dumping on them) and the wave pool. I love the fact that the slides are all connected to the lazy river so you don't have to do much walking around.
water park. quite small but a surprising amount of rides. woudl reccomend going in winter summer is very hot in the middle of day

Fun!. If you're looking for a water fun experience, Wild Wadi has a lot of choices to choose from.
Very good for families and group of friends.

the wonderful water park. it's a nice . it's a big and butty .
if you have children under the 6 it's not good place for visits . baby must bigger than 6 to use all things in this park .

Family Fun. Great family fun for all ages will keep you entertained for a few hours. Put something on your feet as the floor is very hot walking around. During Ramadan lovely and quiet but Eid onwards just too busy for us. The water park is aimed at all age ranges

A good day out if you get there early.. We took a day out to revisit the Wild Wadi and still loved it. Earlier in the day means the queues are small for the bigger rides. Each ride splits so you can come down from top to bottom in a number of combinations. There are double "seats" so I was able to sit with my nervous daughter on all the slides. The wave machine comes on every so often in the biggest pool. There are lifeguards everywhere, and despite the searing heat and how hard they work they enter into the fun of the park; always smiling and a credit to the park. Annoyingly you have to pay for towels which we didn't expect. There are lockers (pay for) and a good selection of food onsite. Really safe and child (and adult) friendly.

wild wadi worth a visit. My family and I visited Wild Wadi water park in Dubai in August .We have experienced plenty of water parks around the World and we enjoyed this one.There were some unusual rides, which my family enjoyed. The park is not huge, but there is plenty to do. It opened at 10.00 and after the initial push and shove, it calmed down and there were lots of places to sit in the shade or sun.As you come into the park there are security people checking bags. No drinks are allowed in or food. We had brought a bottle of water with us. It was taken away and the guard gave us a card which we used at the end of the visit to reclaim the water back. It had been stored in the fridge, so it was rather nice to have a cold drink , while we waited for a taxi outside. We paid for a locker which was located in the changing rooms as you come in. There is a system whereby you and your family wear a band , looks a bit like a watch. You put money onto one band or as many as you want, depending on the ages of your family. This means you don't need money around the park. You buy food, drinks , ice-cream , they zap your wrist band and as long as you have enough funds available it pays for your refreshments. Bands can be topped up. We thought this was a good idea. The park became noticeably busier after lunch. From 10.00 to 12.00 there were very short queues, after that it took longer to access the rides. We were there during Eid which meant that it was a public holiday so lots more locals were there too. The hotel next door also has free access to the park and its own entrance , this also meant people came in later on during the day.We really enjoyed our day at Wild Wadi, it made a lovely break from the hotel pool and beach.A tip, there was a small magazine in our room at the hotel . It is produced monthly. At the back there are discount vouchers and we used them for our Wild Wadi trip.We really enjoyed our Wild Wadi visit
Awful. Went a couple of years ago, give it a big miss and go to Adventura at Atlantis. The water seems dirty, not a great variety and way to full.
Not the best !. The park in attract you only for 3 hours , not any more ! Its amazing for children and babies ! And the ticket price is very high , 220 AED

Fantastic!. Brilliant day out, loved all the rides. Tantrum Alley was great fun, the Burj Surj was fabulous (when I dared to keep me eyes open!) the highlight was the brand new ride Jumeirah Sceirah which was fantastic. The first time was great without really knowing what to expect, the second time knowing you are going to be dropped with the floor disappearing edges on the side of stupidity and a total thrill!! Spent most of the day in a rubber ring on the slides, absolutely brilliant :) The staff were all great, really helpful and friendly you could tell they wanted to ensure everyone had a great time. At first I wasn't sure if the price was worth it (before going in) it was my first visit to a water park but after staying until they virtually threw us out, I would definitely say it was worth the money!

New rides. We first went to wild and wadi 10 years ago. The new rides are good and a welcome update. The high slide was closed and not due to Reopen in its new format until the 4th September 2012. A few q's and the wave pool got fairly busy. Different rides to Atlantis and still worth a visit. Great views

Excellent. Ive visited this and the aqua venture water park and preferred the wild wadi by far.the lazy river was my favourite but hubby loved the more adventurous rides and the food was better here than aqua venture also

new scariest water slide!!. we had been recommended to visit Wild wadi and we were not left disappointed. Small tip- get there early! we arrived at about 10.30am and were able to go on each ride once without having to queue for long. After lunch time, the big water slides had between a 15 and 30 min wait. The tantrum alley was really fun, you have to have a minimum of 2 people, max of 4 to partake and it takes you really high up from side to side. Im quite a scaredy cat but i really enjoyed it. My fiancée had a fab time. The new capsule slide is TERRIFYING!!!! you get placed in an upright clear coffin type contraption with a floor, then once they have taken your picture, the floor disappears and you go shooting down almost vertical. I was too scared to go on it, but my fiancée said it was fantastic!!!! It's over in 7 seconds.The staff were all really friendly and just want to ensure you have a great time. They do take your photo a lot and give you a million wrist bands so you can view them all at the shop. We did buy a couple but only because we were able to haggle a good price for the 2. the ground can get quite hot here, so wear sandals. They do have a waterfall which comes on at intervals to flood the ground within the park, which is nice and its lovely also to just relax in the wave pool, which was quite fun. The waves aren't very big though. I can imagine that kids would love itThe views are great, you can see the Burj al Arab from the park, so our photos looked really good. Worth a visit, though costly.

We love it here. We stayed at the jumeirah beach hotel & came to wild wadi every day. We were gutted that we were going home the day the new jumeirah sceirah opened, but they kindly let jumeirah hotel guests try it out the day before. My two boys were the first 2 down on the morning of the 3rd sept. They loved itLifeguards are amazing, we actually witnessed one guard dragging a lady from the deep end of the wave pool - excellent.Fridays & saturdays are very busy with gangs of young men shouting & screaming at every ride - so choose another day if you can.The only thing that shocked me was seeing a young woman in a g string bikini I a strict Muslim country. Really think she should have been told to cover up & show a little more respect

Watersplash in the desert. A trip to Dubai is incomplete without a visit to any of the water parks such as Wilde waidi, the atlantis and aquaventures. its gives an unforgettable experience of cool mixed with hot meet cold

Fun. Visited the park 2 weeks before the new capsule rides opened. The latest rides include a family friendly tube slide and an adrenaline infused funnel ride. The later being the funnest in the park. Visit the park for the surfing, the 11 slide ride and the funnel ride. Tip: the funnel ride allows a max of 290kgs combined with max 4 people. Make sure you get as close to the max weight allowed. Adds to the speed and shoots your higher on the funnel walls. Fun!

Great For Kids. A great place for kids to have fun, our kids had a lovely time, in the kids area.Plenty of things for adults to do as well, but these can have a slight queue, so be prepared to wait.Def worth going.

Great for Kids. This water park is small but was Ok. I have been to better. The slides had a appeal but the tyre canal was a little lame. It does need to have more water being pushed through to make it more of a fun ride rather than a sit on a tyre and having push yourself around.

Not to be compared. Remember this is not to be compared with your American water parks or those in Europe. Surprising with all the money floating about in the region and the fact it is hot for nearly 365 days of the year. Decent for a day out for families, couples or lads jolly. Would go in the week and not weekends. Some decent rides for thrills and a laugh with good safety aspects an lifeguard cover. Worth a visit for the rides or just relax by a pool.
On the doorstep fun. Being in the Grounds of the JBH and getting complimentary unlimited entry by the hotel meant I could take my son in there every day for a hour or twos ultimate fun .... Love it

Still good after all these years.. LIKE: Kids (& me) thought it better than Atlantis but very busy especially the locals weekend of Friday & Saturday. We have been going for years.DISLIKE: Not the same value for money it used to be, but that is the UAE now.

Great day out (if you get there early). I visited Wild Wadi with my 7 year old daughter & a friend. One of our first rides was Burj Surj & it was absolutely amazing. The great thing about the ride is that it comfortably seats four people in a "dinghy". Master Blasters is also a "must do". It's a journey made up of 11 water slides, some taking you up-hill just like a roller coaster. The family play area is safe & great fun for kids (even big kids over 40). It's a great place to cool off, especially during the HOT month of October!The Fisho, foot pedicure, was also a fun feature. Be warned, if you're ticklish, you'll squeal!!Word of advice: get there early! The first time we visited, we got there at 2pm & couldn't get in because of the crowds. We were advised to arrive at 9:30 the following day and got in easily. It does get quite busy, so it's best to get all the rides you'll probably queue up for, out of the way as soon as possible. Other than that, it's well worth the visit.
always amazing. It's always been very nice here. They added 2 new game, which can 4 people play together. So happy to visit here all the time, surely come back again

Not as expected. Some rides are good and can give you the thrill that you expect from such a park. Could need some maintenance. A definitely negative point is that during the Eid holidays (end of Ramadan) the park is overcrowded. As hotel guests of the group, we could not use the park for 4 days. Long ques, too much noise and totally anti-relaxing environment. Avoid visiting it during these period.

great day out. Wild Wadi is a great day out to escape the constant shopping and bling of Dubai. It features an array of rides for the adventurous and not so adventurous. It is reasonably priced and clean.
Great family day out.. We visited for my son's birthday and he had a magic time. There are a variety of rides. something for everyone.

Convinient. Great water park if you are staying in the Jumeirah beach hotel or Madinat. You can gain access an hour before anyone else and this is the time to go. There are 3 fast rides and a great area for little ones. If you are not staying atone of the hotels I have mentioned I would go to Atlantis instead.

Get there early!. As guests at The Madinat, we would get to the park early between 9.30 and 9.45. We were able to check in (get wristband) but not enter the park. They usually allowed entrance at 9.50 without queuing again to check in. If we were particularly early, we would check in then go over to JBH pool for a 10 minute dip! On entry to the water park we would go straight to the Surf Rider before the queues formed. We found the park to be quite busy by 11.30 so we would do the main rides first - surf rider, tantrum alley, Burj surj. Then we would leave the park and return to the pools in the hotel. By midday, the queues were just to long for it to be an enjoyable experience. It was particularly busy as it was Eid (a holiday following Ramadan).

Clean and Cool with Great Rides. Having been to many Water Parks (inc Disney) I can honestly say this is one of the best. Yes, it's not cheap, but for the price you get access to some of the most advanced rubber-ring flumes/coasters I've ever riden, and some really scary thrill rides for older children/adults who enjoy them. There are also two artificial waves to ride, and a large (much cooler) wave pool for everyone to enjoy. The 'lazy river' type loop was very varied, with tunnels and greenery all along.The food was slightly disappointing, but we were just happy to have the option to eat as it was Ramadan and most other places didn't serve anything. It was 40oC+ on the day, but there was enough shade and cool water to keep us comfortable. It was July (low season) so not too busy, which was fantastic for us.

One of the best water Parkin UAE. Is really what a water Park should have.Nice slides, cold water in Summer and nice places to have lunch.Perfect to have a nice family day with family.Better if you get one of the discounts offered.

Get there early!. Great place to mess around on the slides but make sure you get there early as it gets very busy by 11.30am and the queues can get very long. Make sure you wear plenty of sun cream and/or and top as you WILL burn without realising!

Wouldn't bother.. I wouldnt bother going here. Atlantis is so much better. There are 4 rides and if your not staying at one of the hotels that gives you free access then its not worth it. Ques are long and floor is very very hot when your waiting if you have no shoes on!!

The best water park ever!!. The first thing you will notice is the view of the 2 most beautiful hotels,certainly in Dubai and possibly the world! The 2nd thing you will wonder is how on earth will you get up to the top of the rides- Just grab a rubber ring and enjoy the ride. More than worth the money. Approx 200AED.

Best in large groups. Went here with my husband which should have been a good enough deterrent for all the wandering eyes a woman in a swimwear can incur here. Intimidating is an understatement, meat market more like it. If you like lukewarm waters, cheap eateries where they dont care about what they put in your food(hot dogs, burgers, fries), tons of children running around crazy, men staring and whispering about you go for it! Hopefully will never have to return...there must be better water parks than this.

Avoid it during Weekends. Wild Wadi Water Park is located between two prestigious hotels, Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach Hotel, the Water Park is good and clean, with around 30 rides and attaractions.The prices are a little bit expensive for families (entrance fee does not include food or any items except rides) but it goes down before 2 hours of closing and they also host ladies nights (mostly on Thursdays).I have enjoyed Wild Wadi, but unfortunately, due to my work I only can go during the weekends and it is usually crowded at these days, people have to wait in queues in order to use each ride which makes the waiting process boring.Due to that, it is recommended to visit during working days (Sun - Thu).The park has many restaurants inside with lots of other activities and the Burj Al Arab view is really nice for photographs.For more information abhout the park, please use this link:http://www.jumeirah.com/en/Hotels-and-Resorts/Wild-Wadi/Services--Facilities/Operating-Hours--Rates/

Good But Atlantis is Better. WE loved it but you must get there early. If you are a resident in the hotel get your entry bracelet at 0900 and enter as soon as gates open. For the next hour and a half you will be able to do all the rides without a queue. But as soon as the main gates have opened for a while the queue's are bad. The rides are good but Atlantis waterpark is far better

Good but not the best. We went to the Wild Wadi Water park as we were staying in a neighbouring hotel but had already been to the Aquaventure park a couple of days before.Overall it was good but evidently not the size of Aquaventure. The only other thing that let it down was that one of the rides kept breaking down.Compared to Aquaventure there were a much higher percentage of males here too with a fair number that decided to stare at any women they saw who wasnt covered head to toe
Wildwadi good place to visit. Nice place to spend long time with family inside the waterpark Expensive pictures ( but you should get it for memory)

Totally Wild. You have to get there when it opens. We spent the morning going on all the water rides, had lunch at the park and then headed home. Long ques for the rides were forming around lunch time.

End of Ramadan disaster. Went around 10am on a Dubai public holiday; having been for the last 4 years when on holiday we expected another wonderful day.However, due to the end of Ramadan public holiday we were in for a surprise. By midday the park was too busy and overcrowded; upon asking why it was so busy we were told that they had let too many people in and were now operating a '1 in 1 out' policy.Safe to say from what is usually a very enjoyable day turned out to be an absolute disaster. Would never go during a public holiday as there seems to be a lack of control.

Fun water park. We had free access to the Wild Wadi as we were staying in the Jermirah Beach Hotel resort complex. The water park is not that big but has some fun rides, and caters well for younger children in their own play area with some good slides. The park has numerous restaurants with a good menu selection. The lazy river can be come very busy at times. Seaitng fills up very quickly so visit early or later in the day. The paths become very hot so you will need shoes to walk around. The park operates ladies only nights throughout the year so closing times vary.

Great fun!. We had entry included with our stay at Jumeriah Beach. rides were good. We probably could have done with keeping our flip flops to walk around in as we put in our non-refunable locker and found some surfaces rather hot!!

Fantastic, Fun Day out!. Wild Wadi is a great place for a day out with the kids. You can seriously spend most of the day here and forget about the world outside. The rides are great and varied, and there are plenty of spots to relax in the water without some hair raising experience. The wave pool with groovy music is a nice experience; everyone from all walks of life and different nationalities all floating around in life jackets and enjoying life!

Wadi fun. We were here during Ramadan and it was great: no queues, no crowds and maximum fun! The white water wadi is the best ride as you sit on single or double inflatable rings and are 'shot' up the ride on jets of water. Yes, you get flung about a bit but it is exhilarating and it does make you squeal! There is a long lazy river ride at the end of it to help you recover and then you go around again. I would advise wearing rash shirts if you go there in the day to help protect from the sun, alternatively go there after sunset. Thursdays appear to be women-only nights, so another bonus if you have 2 X chromosomes!
Outstanding. Go on everything and give it a try where else can you go on a water slide and go up hill other than the playground in Dubai.

Great Fun. My son and I had a fantastic day at the water park which we got free entry too as we stayed at Jumeirah Beach hotel. The only down side is finding how to get onto all the slides. We missed some
Nice Splash in the heat. It is sooo much fun , I love water and splashing water and my favorite is lazy river. It is fun I hope they keep good maintenance and keep the park up to date.

Fun Experience. Had a great time in Wild Wadi Water Park. Visited with 3 other adults, so I can guarantee that this place is not just for kids. We enjoyed a lot, especially with the daring rides. The place felt safe as there were lifeguards all over the area. I recommend staying at least 4 hours to fully enjoy the park. We went there on a Friday (during Ramadan) at around 1:30 PM. There were a lot of people, but not too crowded. Waiting time for each ride was about 5-10 minutes. I commend their retail shops, specifically the one near the entrance (forgot the name). They had a wide selection of swimsuits (though it wouldn't hurt to add more!) at reasonable prices. Staff were friendly and helpful so we didn't have a hard time picking out stuff. Restaurants were okay. Quite overpriced though. Too bad you couldn't bring food in. But, totally understandable. Just hoped we could bring in beverages, at least. (For those visiting during Ramadan, food and drinks are sold inside the park - just FYI.) Changing rooms/facilities were nice and clean. They have free plastic bags for your wet clothes. Shampoo/soap was available (and smelled good!). The lighting could use a bit of improvement though (It was a bit dark in the ladies' room). Also, the "big lockers" were not THAT big and it was hard to store some stuff because of the locker's shape (kind of L-shaped). So, better not to bring too much stuff. My other comment would be regarding their signage. Although they provide maps at the entrance, it's not like I'd bring it with me all the time. It would help if there were posts/directions to where the rides were. Or maybe they could just increase the number of signage around the park. Just a suggestion. :)But overall, we had a fun experience at the Wild Wadi Water Park and would love to visit again once the new rides open.

amazing time. really enjoyed myself here, we had a great time, we used all the faciolities for all the day and you can end up spending all day in here and getting ,lost from all the others, it was a samashint time and you need to make sure you go here next time you are in dubai
Amazing !!!!!!!!!. Not only the best place to go the most amazing water park ever i had my experiment and it was really good it was at 2008!

YAY!!!. We love this water park. We have been going regularly since they first opened! We like to go on special Saturday mornings, they sometimes open early from 8am to 10am for families only, it is a lovely time to go, before it gets too hot. The rides are great and even though the food/beverages are expensive, they are no more than other water parks, and there are plenty of choices with a lot of fresh fruit and juices too.

Not only for kids!!. We have stayed on several occasions in Dubai over the past few years and we love the place. 3 years ago we also decided to pay a visit to the Wild Wadi Water Park and what a fun day we had!! Excellent rides, rafts etc. with something for everyone to enjoy. We did not try the food so I could not comment on that, but it looked just OK...We will try it again probably next year during our next visit to Dubai!! Have fun everyone!!

Nice waterpark, Small general area.. As a waterpark is amazing. Nice rides, innovative games and a good distribution. The new joint games with boats for 4 people in a raft its by far one of the best ride I saw in a water park putting you until the edge.The bad thing, the queues are long even when its empty. The space is small in some areas and there is not a proper big area to hang around. Plus the food outlet are kind of lousy and they rip you off.

day out at wild wadi. the new ride is fantastic, can't remember what its called but you are on a large rubber ring which seats up to 4 persons. it was so powerful it knocked my hat and sunglasses off, but i got them back !

Best park. Ok, im a waterpark freak,so having test all the parks in the country, this one beats it hands down. The rides are the best, the surroundings, the great views... just love it. The only problem with this park is the food they have on sale. Every time I visit Dubai I visit this park and the food doesnt get any better They need to get fresh ingredients, fresh bread, and have international standard food.. fresh and tasty. Not dry and not tasty. Thats what lets this park down as each time I go hungry and cut my visit short. Hope they listen and next year when I visit the food will be tasty.
Perfect for the children. A must see for a Dubai family visit. A lot of rides and a lot of excitement. Always interesting to see abiyas and bikinis going together....
Slip, slide and cool off. I only spent a couple of hours there, but it was great. The slides are brilliant, the service great and friendly - thank you for a great time
Great fun. Go early and get a bed in the shade, they even spray the concrete with water! Queues can be a bit of a nightmare in the heat

Wild Wadi. It was amazing; we have been three times, every year we have been to dubai! We loved it so much its a must if you are travelling there. The taxis are cheap and everything about it is amazing. When we went it was a shame that the tall rides where in construction this year (the ones that you dont go in a doughnut on) If you dont want to do anything you can just sit in the lazy river getting blasted back up all day!

Not as good as Atlantis Water Park. Wouldn't even all us to take drinks in for our family of 5! Expensive because you have to buy all of your food and drink in the park. Would rather go to Atlantis, better value for money.

Best waterpark dubai!. O iv e been here so many times, iv e lost count. And i every time i go i get just as exited as the first time i went. its just so fantastic, and so safe!Life guards everywhere. and the slides are all well put together and full of excitement and mystery. There are so many rides, however its not that big that you get lost, thats a good thing!.. and the food is also nice, its all little snacks and a bit of unhealthy but its lovely, and simple. Wild wadi is for adults, teens and kids! love it, wish i could go there everyday.

Awesome Fun. lots of fun...lots of things to enjoy... specially enjoyed the rides...too good. wave water is awesome...huge bucket full of water falling on kids is very nice to see... experience in down ride from dark hole pipe for around 1 min is a bit scary but adventurous. Had a great fun experience in there...will definitely come again to enjoy the fun.

Best waterpark I've ever been to. Wild Wadi is the most fun you can have. The slides are like no other waterpark I've ever been to as most of them blast you upwards. My favourite one however, is Tantrum Alley. As you shoot down the slide it tips you up and you genuinely think you are about to fall onto the road. Quite a feat of engineering! I've been here about five times now and intend to go back soon. I love it!

great place to cool off. They have a great armband system that I haven't seen before. They put on what looks like a wristwatch and it has a chip in it so you can put money on it for dining while you are there. When you leave, you get back what isn't spent. Admission was included in our hotel price. I recommend watershoes if you go in summer as the pavement is SO HOT! Loved all the slides and wavepool. They even had vests for all ages so if you don't swim, it's just not a problem. Don't forget sunscreen!

Great place for fun with water. It's well laid out and beautifully done. Wave pool is really big and ideal for just idling. Our younger kid was happy to rest next to it while we went out on rides with restrictions for young children.While Master Blaster and the one where you can surf are good, the best ride undoubtedly is Jumeirah Sceirah. Though I always look forward to fastest and tallest rides and roller coasters, still it made my heart pump faster when I stood at the top this ride getting ready to lie down for sliding down. And, was amazed that my son did not think twice before going down this ride. We both enjoyed this ride most.Juha's Dhow is another one which kids will love.Overall a great place to spend a day in Dubai.

Best Waterpark in Dubai. This water park is better than Atlantis as there are more rides to go on and it seems better organised than Atlantis also it is nearly £10-15 cheaper than Atlantis. If you like waterparks or are looking for a fun day out than definately go here.

What a great great day. Going back tomorrow.. I love this place. Loads of slides. All tucked away. One slide not working yesterday. But omg tantrum alley, slide, so so good, for serious thrill seekers. Nearly killed my dad, from intensity hahaha. Brilliant.

Fabulous water fun. Kids will love it. Adults too. Well design slops and machinary to give you maximum pleasure. Staff are fun and lovely. Food is little expensive but you dont care as you have lot of fun. The high dive is scary but memorable.
Great for kids. It is great for kids. If you are staying in a nice hotel with a nice pool I would stay in the hotel.....

fun at waildwadi. went to the wild wadi for the day, we used the entertainer vouchers with no problem, which made the entrance price seem quite reasonable. the park is nicely themed with some good slides, which all require tubes, of which there was plenty for everyone. I think possibly could do with a couple of slides which don't require tubes, just to add a little more variety. overall the park was clean, well set out, with plenty of lifeguards, and we all had a good, full day out.

Great waterpark for kids.. The kids area in this park is phenomenal. They have a giant play area with many slides, a wave pool and a long lazy river. The water is heated and there is plenty of seating. The rides for adults left something to be desired, with long lines and nothing particularly extraordinary about them. If you have the time, stop by the fish spa!

Awesome family fun!. Just a fun place to spend the day with the kids! Best plan is to get there as it opens so that the queues for the rides are not too long because as the day goes on it does get very busy!

Fun park. Fun park, staff was great, I'm starting to see all of Dubai is like this. Only downfall not that many rides but the rides they had were fun. We saw it was open late for Ramadan so we got there at 5:30 pm only to find out at 8pm it was closing time because it was open late only on Fridays and Saturday's during Ramadan. Little disappointed as we spent $50 U.S. to get in. So for my family I spent $150 for 2 1/2 hours. I wish staff would have said something. I would of come the next day instead.

Best water park in the UAE. The UAE has 3 water parks, I visited all of them, but by far Wild Wadi is the best park. Its not as big as some of the others, but its the most thrilling. Avoid going in weekends or public holidays. Expect to pay about 200AED per person. If you are going as a group it pays off to buy the entertainer coupon book and use the 3 coupons in the book. You can rent a towel and swimming shorts at the park. You will not be allowed to bring in food or drinks from out side the park, but sadly the food selection at the park is not great.
Great waterpark.. Stayed at Jumeriah DAM, so we had free access, both my boys loved the park and the rides, the big ride was being rebuilt so was not open.

Feel like a kid - fun in the sun for everyone!. There are plenty of pools and rides to keep children and adults entertained. There are also many shady spots if you want to relax. There is a food court where you can find a wide variety of food. There are some gorgeous views of the beach and the Burj Al Arab.Bring your towels, sunscreen and a camera!

Great family day out. It's a bit expensive, and the food is not brilliant (would be great to add a McDonalds guys! Kids love that stuff, and your burgers are no comparison :)) - but all in all, a fun day out with the kids. Worth a visit.

Excellent experience. Excellent water park, great family day out.Plenty of rides and pools to keep kids and adults happy. No problem finding seats and shade, food excellent too. Genuinely a great value park, easily as good as Aquaventure which bills itself as Wild Wadi's big brother but is just spin.
Good water park. It is a nice park , with new additions, the entrance was free for us as we were staying in Al-Qasar Hotel where the buggy wisked us to and from Wild wadi to the hotel.
fun fun fun. its just fun , very good service , very clean , everything is new, good parking , good working hours , safe routes, all brilliant

Unique. It is a waterpark like no other! The attractions are amazing and perfectly placed near the Burj Al Arab. I visited the attraction on a number of occassions as it was included in the stay at Jumeirah. Theres something for everyone! The only let down was the queus. There was no way to avoid them. Weekends and mid day were peak points and I would recommend coming earlier as you get more out of the experience. There were many long rides and lazy rivers and safety was insured as there were life gaurds at every point and staff everywhere! A day activity and a must visit!

wondeful water park but busy. the park is very nice to visit and enjoy its activities, however it is very busy and moving around it will take time. Nevertheless the parl has enough to keep you wet all time.
one of the best water parks. lots of fun and time flies by. if you dont want to Queue up then avoid weekends. many of the rides you dont have walk up as they are water powered
Nice blast. We went there 2 times (was included in the stay at Jumeirah). Is has some very long slides were you go both up and down. Come early before the queus gets to long.
Wild Wadi Water Part. The water park was located next to our hotel and is a great facility with great rides, the park is not too big and very easy to get around in, great for every age group.

Wonderful in the hot Dubai sun. Great fun. Well recommended and wonderful in the hot Dubai sun. Lots of facilities and rides to go on and family oriented. Would recommend you leave your sun glasses in the locker as they can be easily swept away. A definite must for anyone visiting Dubai.

Fun, Fun, Fun!!!. One of my best day ever spending time with my family. safe ride, very enjoyable... Tantrum alley made me scream however feel like trying again. Its really fun! awaiting for the new rides.

Fun for the kids but less so for older guests. Wild Wadi is Aquaventure's baby cousin. If you were going to select one water park in Dubai to visit, make it Aquaventure at Atlantis The Palm, and not Wild Wadi. Although Wild Wadi boasts stunning views of the Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, unfortunately the slides lack luster. Most of the park's tube slides are upwards propulsion ones, meaning they push you up and around the back, instead of you walking up stairs and then riding a slide down on your tube. While these upward propulsion slides are great for lazy people, they just aren't as fun. The two big tube slides at the top of the tower at Wild Wadi are great and new, but they require two-four people to ride them. Families don't seem to like singles being added to their group, so make sure to bring a friend to ride with. The average age at Wild Wadi was definitely trending younger, as they really just don't have many super-exciting rides.

Great Fun. Great Water Park a full day of entertainment for all ages. It is not very cheap but it is a great experience. The only downside is the young Arab males who love to queue jump, which is very frustrating!!
Wadi nice day out. really good high slide closed but 2 new good ones and another big one coming winter 2012 look forward to going back next year

Aweful service when it comes to refunds. Only determined to make a short term gain.. After arriving to wild wadi's in a group of 7, one of our group had to leave within the first half an hour and therefore the group had to recharge back into our clothes. On the way to collecting our refund we were barraged by a manager who's sole purpose whilst speaking to us was to out debate our reasons why we deserved a refund. After 10 minutes of showing our group how smart he was, he decided we only deserved tickets for another day. Outsmarting us again he handed us tickets with expiry dates for 30th July 2012 (within next 2 days knowing they were working days)Totally unacceptable behavior and the manager drags down the good image that was wild wadis (having been a customer since at least 2001). No more.

6 great days!!. We stayed at JBH so had easy and included access to WIld Wadi. My girls aged 5 and 6 had a blast enjoying all the rides each day. LUCKILY my 5 year old was JUST tall enough at 1.1m to enjoy all the rides and slides. Family favourites were the new Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley. We arrived at opening time - 10 am each day - and that was great - we were able to enjoy everything without queues. A couple of days we came back LATER in the afternoon and evening - and found the queues were too long for both Burj Surj and Tantrum Alley....so we just did the other rides and the pools etc. Was lovely that the pools were chilled as the air temperature was HOT!!! All in all, a great visit....again!!

Enjoyable water park. There was a toss up between Wild Wadi and Atlantis water park...we are glad we chose Wild Wadi...much more centrally located, fun rides both for adult and children...especially surfing...even the layout is very nice...a bit expensive though...wud be good if you could manage some discount coupons
A must go. A must go..for kids and adults of all ages. Has the best and the most water rides in Dubai, Located on Jumeirah beach
WWW park a nice day out. It's is free entry if you are staying in the Jumeirah Madinat Hotel Group. We love it so much especially the wave pool! Everything is organized and safe for the kids.

A great day out!. One of the best things to go and do in Dubai! Make sure to pick up leaflets in hotels as they usually offer a small discount on the entry price. The "Burj Surge" I think it's called, was amazing! I'd recommend queueing for it early as it get's very busy during the day!

FULL OF MEN!! Looking at Women!!!. Not the WOW experience, i would rather go to Aquaventure AGAIN!avoid weekends if you can, make sure to leave at least an hour before the park closes otherwise you wont be able to enter the locker rooms.Also its better to park on the other side of the street, cause you will face hell leaving the parking which is small and become chaotic during departure.Price is expensive to the quality you get, since its the same price as Aquaventure id rather go there.Also you dont feel you get what you paid for
I like!!. It was a great time at xmas 2010 with my friends. We had fun and ll behaved like kids again. Great expereince. Look forward to re-visiting.

takes time to get in..but a fun day out.. You have to answer loads of questions, do you want a towel, do you want a small/large locker, do you want to prepay food..loads of stuff. Good at getting your money, nearly forgot to credit us any money on the way out. But was fun, and you become a kid again for a day. Burnt my shoulders thou. Remember suncream.
Great Day's Fun. What a great day. Just what you need in the baking heat and right next door to the Burj Al Arab Hotel. Great slides and is a must for the kids.
wow!. the most amazing place EVER!great for all the family!a bit too hot for really young kiddies but utterly amazing!just go to dubai,no long queues,amazing service and security

Worth The Cost. Costs about 200-250 AED per person but is worth it. Many rides will keep you occupied throughout the day. However, queues can get really long ang sometimes it takes 45 minutes to wait for your turn so I suggest going earlier in the day. Food is available at reasonable prices.

Incosistent Regulation. I went there on mid-week of July with my friend to spent my vacation at Wild Wadi. I wanted to join with one of the games. i had made long queue for this game by standing for 10 minutes to wait for my turn. when my turn was coming and taking the tire buoy and one of the guard told me that you are not allowed to join this game because you wore a trunk, and i told him that this is swimming short suit, and he told me that No, it's not. after long argument with the guard, and i said well it's fair enough for me, and i told him that i am gonna buy one. the supervisor guard then promised me that he would give opportunity to join the game without making long queue. before i bought the swimming short suit from their shop, i saw there are a lot of visitor did not wore swimming suit and no guard stop them to join kinds of game. It was really inconsistent regulation and it made me really upset with their regulation and procedure. There should be consistent for their procedure/regulation. finally i bought one from their shop and i went there and no guard or even the guard supervisor gave me opportunity to join the game without making long queue as he promised to me before. i was really really upset, and i should wait for ten minutes for only one game. I think the management has to train them to be hospitable and know about hospitality service and consistent. and one more thing to think: never give promise if you can't guarantee to your customer/guest, before the customer/guest get mad that you can't do it at all.

Wild and Wadi-ful. I love this place. A little smaller than the Atlantis water park but nicer in a way as easier to get round and some great rides to enjoy. Ever seen water going upwards?? No? You need to go here!

Good but….... Good clean facilities with lots of security and staff on hand to assist. Ive been to Hurrican Harbor at Magic Mountain, California which is the best and the one to beat. The only negative about Wadi is the concession food stands were slow to serve and poorly manned. Otherwise a great day out.
Brilliant day out. Absolutely love this place, been to Dubai 7 times and this place never gets old,if ya love flumes and having a laugh, this is the place!
Best Yet. Best water park every been too! Not a rip off, cashless system perfect, loads of lifeguards about. Go early to get the best of the rides before queues start building up.

Great rides, mostly fast food!. The rides were fun, the staff was professional, you can spend the whole day in there however most of the food is just burgers, fries, hamburgers... fast food in general. Try to get a deal and not pay the rack rate which is a bit high for the amount of rides they have... and way too hot in the summer april-august.

Great for a day out in Dubai!. Really enjoyed our visit to the Wild Wadi. We stayed at the Jumeriah Beach Hotel so our entry was free. The place is clean, tidy and well maintained. The rides are good fun and we didn't queue for long on any of the rides. Well worth a visit! :-)

Great fun. We prefer the park to Aqua Adventure, rides are less spread out and the two BIG rides are so cool. Tubes are nicer and firmer. Wave pool nice to relax in, not so crowded when we went but can imagine not much fun if too crowded as Wild Wadi more compact than Aqua Adventure.
nothing magical!. not my favorite i went once and will never go back !! water is really warm and the place just feels dirty... go to Aquaventure at Atlantis much better same price !!!

Three generations had a ball at this place!. My two kids aged 14 and 10, myself and my husband and even my mother who is in her 70's, had an absolute blast at this place.We spent most of the day going around and around the slides......plenty of shade and places to sit and eat. The queues are longer after lunch so get there early (10am at opening) and you'll be pretty much queue free until around 2pm. After this time we bumped around in the wave pool. Plenty of security here.Extremely friendly staff always greeted us as we came off the next slide...ready to be pushed onto the next.....such lovely people.
Wet.....nice park.. I was with my family, really really enjoyed whole together. Nice service, all the staff 10 point.

Wild Waadi Dubai. Had an excellent day there. Lots of water rides, two lazy rivers nd brillint wave pool. Not very expensive for entry fee costs £35 for a day visit which is more than enough. Food courts serve good food atbreasonable price but buying professional photos can be expensive. oveall good experience

Great family day out!. Just returned from wild wadi today excellent family day out!We have visited this water park once before and complimentary entrance with free towel hire for jumeirah guests- absolute bargain! We are staying at jumeirah zabeel saray and you need to collect you entrance tickets at the hotel prior to visiting. The tantrum alley was the best ride for us, not for the faint hearted, the inflated family rings powere you high up the walls of the slide as it plummets down hill, the lazy river is always a hit and no need to walk for miles to go on the rides, off shoots from the lazy rivers powers you uphill on rubber rings - great fun. The are ample rings both single, double and junior rings for use in lazy river, all in good condition. The wave pool and kids zone is fantastic and funnily enough lost my hubby in the kids zone for some time! Food is as you would expect fast food things like, hot dogs, chicken burgers, tika, fies plus drink for around 41 AED. But a wild wadi water bottle 30AED for small or 35AED for large including free sunglasses cord and all refills are 5AED wrth it. We added money to a wrist band on arrival whic is a great idea as you do not need to carry any money, staff just scan your wrist band and money deducted. At the end of you visit the balance is returned in cash. Might pay another visit before we return to the uk - jumeirah pulls it off again thank you!

my family enjoyed a lot. I use to travel a lot , but i never feel good in any countries except Dubai . Dubai remembering me friendly places , you never feel you are stranger , you feel that you are at home . I Love Dubai ,

Good Water Park. This is a very good water park.... excellent choice of rides here.... i've been here in summer as well as winter....people normally like going in summers but I loved it in winter....fun to go here with friends...!!
Fantastic for Families. My kids love it and i enjoy it as well. its nice to have fun with the family
Water Fun For All. Had a great time at the water park fun day out and excellent way to spend the day. It was expensive but a fun packed day.

The quality is decreasing. The management is neglecting the importance of wearing swim suit and you can see people by almost any type of suits and even underwear. it makes a dirty sceneHowever, type of games are unique in the world.

Very disappointing. I was very much looking forward to this water park but ended up being very disappointed. The smell whilst lining up for some of e rides is truly revolting. I started off by going on the big extreme thrill tube ride but waiting in line was a disaster because the ride was stopped for at least forty minutes for reasons unknown. This ads up to a long time waiting in the que when it is a Hal an hour waiting time anyway. The next ride I went on was the tube that goes all around the park. Unfortunately whilst I was standing in line this ride had maintenance problems TWICE because of what I can only assume we're too many majorly overweight people attempting to go up the first tube. Surely the life guards can realise when a person is CLEARLY not suitable for a ride. I went to the park on a Friday and despite the closing time being 6pm, the rides get shut off at five thirty. This is not good when you arrive at 3:30 and only end up being able to go on two rides. Two proper rides does not to justice to the extremely expensive fee paid to get in. The admission prices are far too high, to put it simply. Even discounted tickets towards the end are not worth it because you have no guarantee on doing even two of the rides. Because of some of the massive que's after my first two rides I decided to have a go at some of the children's slides where there were next to no lines. I was not allowed on. I am sixteen so that is understandable. However not when there is practically no line at all and two of the major rides have major lines and the rides themselves go in and out of maintenance. The best part of my time at the park was sitting down near the big pool at 6pm with the Reston my family as the lifeguards attempted to get everyone out of the pool. No one is ready to leave at that early time and it was a bit of a laugh seeing everyone joke around for about an hour refusing to get out. I can see how on maybe another day I would enjoy myself more but upon my first visit I found the experience extremely disappointing (maybe due to extremely expensive prices) and wouldn't recommend the park to anyone unless they got there as soon as the place opens.
wild wadi, dubai. My kids absolutely loved all of the rides available here! I also could not get enough of the ride which blasts you up the tunnels! It was a fantastic day out!
Good but small. Was good but not enough. The area was not big enough. Even with view of Burj Al Arab...I expected more from that.
Not as good as Aquadventure. Good water park but a little dated. Preferred the water park at Atlantis Hotel.

FUN, FUN, FUN!!. We went to Wild Wadi with our 1,5 and 7 year old children and had a brilliant day! There was plenty for each of the girls to do, compared with other theme parks that can offer very little for a 15 month old! There were plenty of life jackets everywhere that the little one could wear. You could use your own floatation devices too - not like the stupid Oasis Beach Tower where we are staying (see my other review).We rented one of the cabanas which was completely worth it as our baby had a sleep in the middle of the day in peace and shade whilst the older two continued having fun (normally we would have to leave by 2pm to take the little one home for a nap, much to the other kid's displeasure!)The service in the cabana is amazing - someone greeted us at the front gate to organise all the tickets, credit on our wristbands etc! We had someone personally usher us to our cabana and take care of our stroller as my husband purchased some shorts. Upon arrival at our cabana at a very peaceful but convenient location, we were given ice cold towels and an esky full of ice cold bottled water - heaven in 40 degree heat. We had a host take care of us all day who, bringing us food and drinks at our request. He even brought complimentary ice lollys each of the many times the girls asked. Even at the time of settling the bill, there is no waiting in queues as the host takes care of that too.There is nothing better than to lie on your own sunbed with ice cold water waiting each time you need a break from all the water fun. Then when ready for your next visit, you have fast pass entry back onto White Water Wadi which means no waiting at all.On this our 2nd visit (our 1st was 10 years ago before kids), Wild Wadi lived up to our previous fantastic fun visit. The weather, the vibe, the eager to please staff (from management, lifeguards, etc), the rides, the music were all fun, fun, fun. My only gripe was the hot walkways, but I'll remember to bring a pair of crocs or similar next time that I can wear on the rides!!I look forward to a 3rd visit someday.

Wild Wadi. Wild Wadi is nice and we really enjoyed a lot. we can easily spend an entire day here.we liked the rides specially the one from where we can get the view of Burj Al Arab.Its a must visit place in Dubai.

Good but not Really Wow. Ive been in more than one water parks.. this one was nice but not the best.. first of all, it was too expensive.. around, 50 Euro i guess,, the main slide was closed, so missed one main game, waiting time was too long for the main games, which was not that suspense.. overall, was nice, but if you have been in water park before, you can skip this one...

A little tired but fun all the same. This water park is a little tired and dated. It appears to be in need of a makover. the rides are ok but nothing special. Kids will have lots of fun, but it really isn't up to top international water park standards.There is very little shade, so wear a hat!

Amazing vistas and good fun for the family!. Wild Wadi is nice and compact for family fun compared to some other gigantic water parks. We liked the rides, especially the ones with tubes. The visit gets very expensive as outside food and drinks are not allowed but it was definitely one of the highlights of our stay in Dubai. Views of Burj Al Arab and clear skies were amazing!

Much Better!!! Get the entertainer. Our second visit here was great!!!! the new rides were wicked, there is always places to sit and chill if u need a break from the addrenaline rides they are top notch.we are going back to dubai next yearand we will definitly be going to wild wadi!!ps I advise anyone going to dubai to buy the entertainer voucher book. we saved £700 over 10 days on water parks, meals, attractions, snacks, bowling,

Lots of fun especially for the kids. Wild wadi is one of the largest water parks in the world with lots of rides. the entire family,especially the young ones, will have a blast and can easily spend an entire day of fun. they have recently added a ride to make things more intersting.It is a fun place and a must visit place

Two Words: Uphill Waterslides. I happened to be in Dubai on business, where we took time out for a day-trip to the water park. HIGHLIGHT OF THE TRIP! What ISN'T there to do here?My favorite part of the visit was to the water slides. They had multiple slides and they all took you zooming through the park, uphill and downhill, through tubes and tunnels, open air and past views of the rest of the park. It was insane!I'm a big guy, but these things shot me around like it was no big deal.Another thing I love is a good lazy river ride. I love to just kick back and relax while being pushed around with the other sheep. Forget all that - Wild Wadi has a Tsunami "Lazy River" that regularly pummels the river with a flood of fresh H2O! Your gentle teetering float gets a hefty push and you cruise the last half of the ride... and do you get off? Heck no! You stay on, because although you didn't expect it the first time, now you plan your Laziness to be int he right spots at the right times and take full advantage of the Tsunami madness!The food at the park was nothing to write home about. Literally. But after hours of lounging and rocketing through the park, eventually you need to refuel your water throttling carriage... and it does that just fine. Of course you are very close to a lot of great dining around the area, so once you leave the park, you are not far from some good eats.Is that all there is to the park? Heaven sakes no. But I spent all my time on the stuff that amused me. If you want to stand in line a bit, you can climb the tower (which I did) and send yourself jettisoning down practically from orbit and keeping cool int he water slide as you re-inter the earth's atmosphere. This tower ride (I can't remember the name of it) could be wedgie inducing if you don't cross your legs. It's a fast few seconds to the bottom, and I only rode it once, since the climb and wait took about 20 minutes. But it was still fun. Worth doing at least once.I can't recommend this park enough. The ticket price was acceptable, and you get free tickets if you stay at the neighboring hotels. FUN FUN FUN!!!

A fun and refreshing visit.. I have been to Dubai druing the winter, and the spring. This last time I was there right in the middle of summer, which is a whole different story. Temperatures were in the upper 120s, so we were trying to cool off somehow, We have been to the malls the previosu three days, so we needed to do something different. We hit Wild Wadi right in the middle of the day and it ws probably the best choice. Lines were short, water was cold, sun was nice and bright... perfect day for water slides. Even though most of the rides are guided towards kids and preteens, the two rides we were able to go on, the two big tobogans, were SO MUCH FUN!!!! line was not that bad, it is to be expected. a 15 minute wait at the most.The bracelet system is always convenient. You get an electronic bracelet with you reload with money and it works as an atm card, with everytime you want to buy something, they wave the watch on the register and it makes the charge, eliminating the need to carry a wallet or cashwhile getting wet. At the end, whatever money you don't spend, you will get it back, no fees or hidden charges. Facilities were clean, locker rooms were well kept... overall a good plaec to spend a hot and sunny morning-afternoon.

Brilliant Time. Wild wadi although the older of the water parks I think is the best. The rides are fantastic and its a great day out. Would highly recommend and definately cheaper than the alternative

Fun Waterpark. I don't like water parks but my partner really wanted to visit.It's quite small compared with ones we've visited in the US.It's worth mentioning for women-best to cover up. I felt more comfortable wearing my swimwear under shorts&t-shirt. Some good flumes, clean and fun.

Must do in Dubai. We normally stay in the Jumeirah beach or Dar al Masyaf when in Dubai as a family,this decision is heavily influenced by the fact that the kids have unlimited free access to the Wild Wadi. The 2 new rides that opened last year added to the experience and I noticed that a new signature ride was being built this year. There are a huge amount of lifeguards and the place seems very well run.
Best water park. I've been to both Atlantis and Wild Wadi,but prefer Wild Wadi. It's more compact, (not as spread out as Atlantis) And I think the tube rides are better.

OK but VERY expensive entry. The water park at the Atlantis is a lot better, more interesting rides, the main attraction at Wild Wadi was closed when we went but we still paid full entry fee £200 for 4 of us.

fun. we spent a few hours here on our stopover trip.It is around £35 each to get in but we had a lot of fun there. My daughter even managed to get me to go on all the rides something i rarely do.Worth putting credit on your wristband so that you don't have to go back to lockers for cash, simple to get a refund at end of day if you havn't spent it all.Only 2 rides had small queues the others we just walked on whenever we wanted.
