What a day!. Had the best time at Wadi Wadi. Cashless system really good. You load money at your arrival onto a bracelet and that pays for any food or drink for the day. Any remaining money is refunded at the end. Rides are really fun for all ages. Queues moved well, sometimes a little long but it doesn't matter. Photographers everywhere taking reasonably priced photos so no need to take a camera. Towels are hired there too. My daughter hurt herself a little on the flo rider and was spotted by one of the security guards who took us straight to first aide. An ice pack was quickly supplied and all was good. A real easy, fun and funny day. Do not miss.
Too many people. The line ups on the rides were excessive with up to 45 minutes to get on a ride.
Good fun. Great day out at Wild Wadi, some fun slides, lazy rive and wave pool.

A pretty fun day. We got there in the morning, just after 10.30 and it was pretty dead which was awesome for riding all the slides. No queues for just about everything. As you move more towards mid-afternoon, the crowds really start to build up, but nothing too serious.The upward slides (if you haven't been on one) are really, really cool-just about the highlight of the day. The best 'ride' per se was the Tantrum Alley-listen to their instructions at the top, you definitely want to be holding on the whole time. The wave pool, when not 90% human 10% water is actually really refreshing, they must put some cold water in there. All in all, quite a good day, and that is coming from roller-coaster fans, not sliders.

An Excellent Aqua park. the aquapark was really fun , me & my family enjoyed the water games , specialy the kids zone. and the huge pool. also you can see Burj el Arab v. closely & the beach is v. near to the park. but you cant access it unless you are a guest in Jumareh Hotel
Great day!. Wild Wadi Water Park brings out the child in everyone!
Fantastic time. We arrived at 11am and left at 6pm!! Lots of rides even if you are a wuss like me to do!! Not alot of queing, food reasonably priced.

Dated, Delapidated, Dump. Returned to Wild Wadi after not visiting for 4 years... (as have been going to Aquaventure instead)..I heard that it had be renovated and was 'new and improved'.... it is exactly the same, but with more children, more chewing gum on the floor, walls and floating around, more rust, dirt and band aids...Unless you are 5-15 years old (who seem to be thriving in the dirt and grime), you will detest this place... Kid soup.
desperately want to come again. been to any water sport but i just miss wild wadi in Dubai.... it just so nice

Wild Wadi - Dubai. Just what you need to cool down !Can't take own food or drink in but they kept it in the fridge for us until we left !Good choice of food inside park.Rides / pools were varied, making it more interesting.Never been 'up' a water slide before - hilarious !

Great fun.. People are very kind, good service all thru the park. We wanted to have a bite in one of the restaurants. The terrace we sat down was closed. 2 employees got a golf cart to bring us food and drinks we ordered from another restaurant in the park. It is very busy during the weekends, so try going on a weekday.
pure fun. wild Wadi Water Park was super secure and had super fantastice management. so many helpful and smily people work there who are ready to help you.
Amazing... Always loving it..even been there like 20 times..new 2 rides are crazy...the one where u literally feel u gonna fall over in the start..!!! not for all people...lol

get refreshed!. a good park, for everybody, not scary or risky in anyway, and topclass facilities. really relaxed atmosphere. The ladies night is absolutely the best experience.. if you are so lucky to be a lady, clearly! (cheaters discouraged!) there are discounts voucher in big hotels, so you make get in for little less. do not go on public holidays or weekend in the summer, however, or you will spend your day in a queue..splash!

Interesting as usual. Wild Wadi has always been interesting especially during the summer. What I don't like is the prices. They are so much expensive and prices are increasing for the same service. It's worth it anyway. Have fun.
fun fun fun. lots of rides very safe, and free if your staying at the jumeriah beach hotel as we were.

Family fun. The rides are excellent! If you are a water baby then you will love it. Fairly well organised, a little queue jumping when we were there, but ok I guess that happens everywhere. My husband would have liked a beer but it's Dubai, what you gonna do? Would visit again if we had nephews and nieces to stay.
crowded and expensive. A great waterpark but they seem to fill it upto the last square meter against a serious price... expect to fork out a whopping AED 1000 for a family day out.

Great day out. Fantastic waterpark and a great day out.We visited on a quiet day so no queues - not sure how much fun it would be on a busy, hot day as there aren't that many rides.One word of caution - our experience of food service was very slow with rude staff - the food was actually pretty good when it arrived though!
Great Day Out. This was a real family fun day out we had 3 generations on our vist and everyone eft happy
summer escape. one of the best places to escape from the summer heat, great rides. but they should have reduced the price some more. Still great value for money.

Has what you need..... The service, the facilities, the food, everything is just what you need....i went there with my brother and his kids, and we had a blast...its the place to go with you family, with your friends or even with your spouse...i would love to go there everytime im in dubai...

supa-enjoyment. Quite enough of rides, especially enjoyed the Trantrum which had 20 minutes of waiting queue. Went there for 7 hours. However, sad that food and drinks are not allowed to be brought into the premises. But, prices of food is bit high. Although, Vegetarian Pizza was also excellent in Leila's. Next time would bring pocktable waterproof camera to capture wonderful memories. It was one of the best days of my life.
brilliant for smaller children. many rides that children over 1m can go on plus a great water play area.
Worth it if you have kids. Very nicely done. Too hot in the summer. Spring or Fall is better time to visit

Awesome. We had private and free access to the park which we didn't make the most of . We decided to go on our last full day and had a great day. The slides were awesome and people were friendly. Would def recommend to anyone and age.
The best ever!. The best place to cool off in Dubai. Way better than Aquaventure. Cant wait to return
nice place to have fun. This is a good place to enjoy with family, but avoid sunny days....july was not good time to go there.

Kids love this place. you need to book a hotle that has a shattle bus to wild wadi as to enjoy the best of it. make sure you have non slipery shose and a sun hat and lots of sun screen as it's so hot this time of the year

Awesome day out at Wild Wadi. We had a great time at Wild Wadi. It was really hot, so bring lots of sun cream and a hat. There are life jackets proivided all around the water park. And all the different slides and lazy river are great. But the surfing ride was defo the best!

You´ll get blown up on your rope and than it goes down like hell. Good service including towels free of charge. Enough sunbets, all saved by noumerious life guards. A lot of fun on different slides and attractions like waveboarding and wavepool
great fun. yes all big kids or small ones will enjoy this place,next to jumeirah beah hotel
Not enough rides. There are 2 or 3 nice rides, the rest are more geared toward younger children. I hear good things about the Atlantis water park, I'll be going there next time.

Excellent. We loved Wild Wadi!! Great for all ages, very clean, plenty of food stations to eat and drink. Lots of sunbeds available. Paths are watered to keep them cool so your feet do not burn. New rides are fabulous but not for the faint hearted. Lots of lifeguards about.
Well worth the visit. Stayed at the Jumeriah beach hotel, well worth the visit and enjoy the water park
Great water park. But don't go during rush hour, or use the metro instead of taxis or shuttle buses.

Best Park EVER!!!!!. This has to be the best waterpark we have ever been too. Amazing location, spectacular views of the Burj Al Arab. White knuckle rides, and calm relaxing lay river... A wave pool, a kids area, all great. However the food is aweful..eat before you go!
Great value day out. well worth the money, you will be here all day plenty of things to do, wether you want to relax or have a fun packed day, kids never moaned they were bored! what more can I say.

Fab Fun. Great day out, much better than Atlantis even though Wild Wadi is much older, very relaxed, love the upward moving water slides so you don;t have to climb steps - how lazy:) Can recommend to anyone planiing a holiday to Dubai and if you don;t have time to do two waterparks this one is still the best! Atlantis is too 'plastic/Disney style'

A couple of good rides, but thats all.. The water park is a little on the small size now compared to newer parks. The lazy river is tiny. A couple of good rides, but the lines get long! Go early to get the best of it.
Great family fun. great day for all the family, had lots of fun we all loved it,, its well worth a visit.

Brilliant day out!. I came here with a small group of people and for someone who gets bored of waterparks quickly I was ammused for the entire day! Plenty to do in terms of slides and pools etc, places to eat/drink. Expensive, but so is everything in Dubai!
so fun. the wild wadi water park is so fun with some thrilling slides its great for everyone of all ages

Just ok.... Coming from the US where there are plenty of Waterparks, I was underwhelmed with the ride offerings of Wild Wadi. To me, it's an average waterpark. Don't understand why Jumeirah wouldn't pull out all the stops a-la Disney World style (Typhoon Lagoon or the Snow version one)

Fantastic. I am a big Wild Wadi fan and personally much prefer it to Atlantis Aquaventure. It isnt quite so busy, has a more varied ride selection including a couple of new rides. Neither waterpark is cheap, so make sure you buy a copy of The Entertainer Voucher book before you go. It pays for itself 10 times over and there are 3 buy one get one free admissions to Wild Wadi.

Awsome things. Its appreciate me to spend more time in trip adviser.Its gives the all the informationg about you want when you are going for a picnic place or for a journeyIts can make easy with its all product given and its brief introducts to me.

Fantastic Water Park. Wild Wadi is the place to visit for fun and excitement, We always visit Wild Wadi and when you stay with Jumeirah, you get in free, what more can you ask for the kids love it, including me I consider myself as a kid when I enter Wild Wadi, the new rides tantrum alley and Burj Surj are just superb I can't wait to get there again this year only 8 weeks and counting. Wild Wadi is a must for anyone visiting dubai

fun for the whole family!. its a must visit place in dubai especially if you are there during the summer! theres attractions for everyone.. relax in the lazy river.. swim in the man made wave pool!enjoy the never ending slides that defy gravity! for the more daring ones enjoy the one of the fastest slides or try out surfing!i will definitely go to wild wadi again!:)
Our 2 year old loved It. I have been to Wild Wadi many times before and love it especially the Flowrider, but this year our 2 year old was old enough to go on the kids slides and she really loved it.
Amazing. they day i went i was mega hot during the day and i went in the evening and it was amazing in the dark it still warm on all the slides :D definately worth the visit!!
Best water park ever. You will love it. very nice place to be whether with friends or family...
salam. the nice girlsnice location and friendly and obedient staff
A Good Day Out. Dubai's first water park is great but has been overtaken by the water park at the Atlantis

3rd Visit - great fun!. Wild Wadi is a multi-faceted water park. There is a tangle of fairly tame water shoots for kids in a separate area. There is a pool with wave machine (waves about every 20 minutes for 10 minutes or so) with pumping music (a bit like being on a dance floor in the water) and there are some huge rapid-style water slides, running into a river that flows around the park and enables you to get off at various points. There are also lots of sunbeds bordering the pool. For kids, the water shoots are expertly manned with attendants at the top and bottom of all the slides and dotted around the area. It is really so safe that you could leave them, depending on age, if you needed to for a few minutes. It can get very busy and manic, but is a fun day out, or if you are staying at Jumeirah Beach hotel, nice couple of hours every day to cool off and have a laugh. There are shops there selling everything from hats to rash vests, etc and a cafe. There are also life jackets provided for none swimmers.
expensive day out. This is a great water park and we always enjoy it, but this year we paid over £40 each to get in plus you have to pay for towels 25 dhr each.

PURE FUN!!!!!. The Wild Wadi Water Park brings out the child in you. Lovely place to be considering the Dubai heat in summer. Especially loved the Wave pool and standing under the huge bucket that tips tons of water on your head at intervals.

Fantastic Day Out!. Closely overlooked by the worlds most luxurious hotel in the world, The Burj Al Arab, you are gaurenteed a great day of fun for all the family at the Wild Wadi Water Park In Dubai!Packed with daring and fantastic water slides, waves of fun, kid friendly slides & water play areas and a big lazy river for those who prefer relaxing, you will not be dissapointed!MUST DO In Dubai!
Wet!!!!. It was ok, only one good slide and a great tyre float around the park ride, could be more creative considering its location
Good day out. Had a good time there enjoying the rides, but found Aquaventure a little better. However, it's a great place for all ages and staff are very helpful at Wild Wadi
A great time. The first water park I'd been to. A little over the top, but that's fine. Well run, good assortment.
Ok. Cheaper than Aquaventure but not as much variety. There was a DJ by the pool who played great 80's cheesy music which really made me feel in the holiday mood!
not worth the money. crowded with people, make sure you go early enough to find any pool bed free.

Discover your inner child.... I've been here many times, but not for a couple of years. We are a couple in our late twenties, and went recently - it's just as good! Really fun rides, and we went early in the day (it opens at 10am) and there was very little queuing. It's very lazy river based, so relaxing. There are also lots of sun beds but i'm not sure i would want to leave my bags out. They have a cashless payment system - you load cash on to a wristband which you can use for food, drinks etc, which is good. It's mostly junk food, just so you know. A tip - unless you're bagging some loungers and leaving your things there, put everything in your locker - flip flops, sunglasses, suncream etc, as you can't carry it with you. The walkways get very hot in the sun so you have to walk quickly, or find puddles! I imagine you would need to keep little ones' sandals on to walk as it would be too hot for them in the summertime - they do have racks by the rides where you can store your shoes. Would also recommend (for women) a sturdy swimsuit - this is not the place for a strapless bikini, as you're likely to have a wardrobe malfunction. Also recommend wearing a t-shirt over your swimsuit as the sun is very strong and you catch the sun more easily as you're in the water all day (I got worse - strap marks for the rest of my holiday!). Wear lots of suncream and make sure you go back to your locker to put more on. Bring towels - you can hire them but you have to pay. I have to say it is expensive, by the time we'd paid for entrance fees, locker fees and a few drinks we spent nearly £100. But - definitely good fun!

Great way to spend the day. There is something for all ages here. We went in June 2012 and as I write this, the Jumeriah Scarer is out of action, seems they are building a new one! It gets very busy at the weekend so avoid this if possible. There would be no problem in spending the whole day here as there is so much going on. Fast food reasonably priced as Dubai goes! They do the best Strawberry Smoothie ever.
Good for all ages. We had free entry from our hotel. Made it easy to visit several times but not have to stay all day.

Excellent Day Out. Wild Wadi is a wonderful day trip for all, whether your in a big group or just the two of you! Lots to do, very clean, lots of fun and safe for the little ones! Worth visiting at least once during your stay!
Wild Wadi. Only went here because it was free as we were staying at the Burj Al Arab, feels very closed in, much prefer Dreamland!

Burj Khalifa - 124 storeys high!. worth a visit - as good as the empire state building for me. Go for a telescope though as it offers lots of options for the view, although you only get 2.30 minutes so be warned! No queues, plenty of time to see everything you need to.
Fun day out!!. Really enjoyed Wild Wadi! Slides were excellent. We didn't stop all day! Definitely would return with the kids next time! Would definately recommend it!

Kids Would Love It!!. I happened to went in the place since I stayed next door. The concept is quite cool and suitable for children above 8 years old. Don't worry about carrying your money around since you can reload it in the wrist strap at the entrance.No worries about the ticket if you stay in the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. It is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel but you can take a buggy ride too.
Clean , great staff , great day out. This is a great day out for the family. Around 235 dirham per person, very clean, staff very friendly, and very well trained. We had a great day out here.
Great kids love it. This is a amazing place our children love it, have to drag then our each time we visit.

Costs you no more than a visit to uk theme park.. Went to wild wadi after reading various reviews. The park itself although not huge and the new ride not yet open was clean and well organised. The staff are helpful and courteous and there are lifeguards everywhere. Good fun for young and old, no more expensive than a day out to a uk theme park. Having initially dreading it after serious nagging from my 13 year old son I loved it as much as he did! Great day out.

Good for kids , not for adults tbh. Its ideal for kids as all the slides are not really that intense. There was two big slides with different intensitys and in all fairness they both Seemed the same.It will kill half a day in dubai and it is worth while going if u have kids.Dont be fooled by all the reviews...imo it has no wow factor :(
Wild wadi. Great place to go to , to cool of on a hot Dubai day. Lots of fun for all ages.

Waterslides GO UP HILL!. Fantastic water park! Most of the slides are accessed via other rollercoaster type slides, where jets of water shoot you up hills. Making your way around all of them in this method saves your feet, and is also quite relaxing as parts of it are just a gentle flow.Wallets aren't needed as you can charge up a wristband on entry that will then give you access to your locker and enable you to buy food and sourvenirs, and any money left on it when you leave is refunded in full.Great way to spend a day or even just an afternoon.

Love this place. I have been many times to the water park and I still think it is excellent value for money. There are not many rides compared to some waterparks, but it is excellent fun and in a great setting between the Burl Al Arab and the Jumeriah Beach Hotel. Staff are friendly, and they take loads of photos of you, it could cost you a fortune if you bought them all

No wow factor.. Wild Wadi a little bit disappointing after the whole wow factor of everything else about Dubai. Too many people being admitted to the park also quite a bit smaller than I expected,in my opinion it needs to double in size to inject that wow sensation.
Excellent. This is a great park - just like Atlantis - very good rides and lazy river - good for families

Took the family - they loved it !. We hadn't been to Wild Wadi for a while so decided to take our two children (2 and 3 yrs) whilst our folks were in town for a visit.We had the best day we've had in a long time. The children absolutely loved the water play area. We managed to prise them off it for long enough to have some lunch (good by-the-way) and they were back on the slides again.The rellies had a ball with the children and found a little time to take in some of the rides themselves.The staff are a credit to you Wild Wadi - friendly, chatty and helpful.There have been some new rides added since our last visit and my wife and I scared ourselves silly on them - fantastic.We'll be going back sooner next time.
Enjoyed !. There were some additional games since my past visit and it was fantastic and amazing. We really enjoyed our time there.

Awesome. This was an awesome day, the flow riders were a standout , heaps of rides for all ages, wife and I had a blast, 3-4hours and your done we did everything twice. Pay system is great, great view of the Burj al arab

dont miss it!!!!!!. you have to go to wild wadi if you visit dubai, top class great day out , you wont wan to leave, i have been several times ,love it! changing rooms safe and secure, food is good , lots to do ! this is not like a european water park , life gaurds everywhere totally safe even for people who cant swim!

Mind blowing, loved it. We went on ladies night - I was a little disappointed that such late entry (this also applies to the sundowner pass) doesn't merit more of a discount, but I would go back for the whole day. LOVE the fact you aren't climbing stairs all the while - the slides shoot you up before they shoot you down. The 'big' ride is closed and the other big two had horrible wet drippy stairs and the queue was much longer than indicated (clearly not 15 EARTH minutes from this point) - I don't understand why they weren't sending people down quicker, since it only lasted 20 seconds anyway. But I could spend all day flooming round the other shoots and lazy river. Ace :)

Brilliant. I have been to alot of water parks all over the world including Walt Disney World. Whilst it is nowhere near as big t is absolutely lovely and the rides are very different. The staff are also very friendly!

THE BEST. This waterpark is wonderful for young and old. We stayed at the Jumeirah Beach hotel and because of that the entry was free for guests. it is great- the small snack bars have good fresh food and despite the dozens and hundreds of guests the waits in the lines, even on the busiest of days is not bad.The price is very high if you are not staying at a Jumeirah Hotel, but that is OK with us, otherwise there would be even MORE crowds and lineups. A definite must when in Dubai for the whole family.
Kids fun!. My teenaged daughter and all her high school friends love it! Convienient location.

Good afternoon. It's small and a little on the expensive side but there are discounts available through most of the hotels. It can get a bit busy at the week ends.Try the Jumeira Scarer it's a slide that just drops very scarey.
Great Fun. Had a great afternoon at Wild Wadi. Admission included in hotel rate. Loved the rides where you were pushed upwards by water pressure, loads of laughs.

Fun!!!. This water park is not as huge as I imagine however it's still amazing how they built the water park in the city that surrounded by dessert. It's clean and well maintainance. My friend and have a good time there. We spent all day there and got sunburn at the end of the day.

Great Water Park, better than Atlantis!. Wild Wadi is a really great place! Visited in November 2011 when it was getting a little chilly. The rides are a lot of fun except for the Jumeirah Scairah (that ride hurts your back a lot!), but I believe they've closed that ride down now. We are residents of the UAE and we were expecting to avail the special AED150 entrance fee, however, we didn't know that the special fee is not during holidays, and the day we went it was the Islamic New Year, so we had to pay the normal ticket price which was annoying because we were 5 people, so we basically paid AED250 extra but other than that, I didn't have any problems. The rides are a lot of fun, even though most of the slides haven't changed since the last time I visited in June 2006. The two new rides that opened last year are also a lot of fun. I noticed that one of the main rides/ slide didn't have a proper entrance. When we first arrived, we were trying our best to find where the ride's entrance was on the map because its always been my favorite, but we couldn't find it. So, then we asked the people that worked there, but they didn't really help. After a little while, we realized that there was no proper entrance to that slide (which was the most fun IMO). We then saw some people walking across the river, and we decided to see where they were going, and to our luck, we finally found the entrance of the ride! The park hasn't properly given directions to the ride BUT the good about this, was that there was no line up's even on a Friday for the ride, since hardly anyone knew where it was so we went 4 or 5 times on it, without having to wait. Food has always been a little expensive at the park, like almost every amusement park, so we didn't eat there this time. Most of the staff were friendly, but some of them were a little rude, so that put me off a little. Also, our locker key had a little bit of a problem in it; We didn't load any money on it, but, when we were leaving the park, it said we had a AED100 balance, and so we were confused. When we told the staff at the exit that we didn't add AED100, he checked the computer again, and said it must have been an error; they should be grateful that we were honest, since anyone else would have just taken the money. Overall, it was a great day out and still my favourite water park in Dubai. Even better than Atlantis. Atlantis is good, but I find Wild Wadi more fun and thrilling, and the most annoying thing about Atlantis is that, you have to climb up the stairs on this pyramid shaped thing every time you want to go on a ride which gets tiring. And, also, I don't think this water park is more suited for children, cause my teenage children loved it and they love thrilling rides. However, if I had to choose my favorite water park in the UAE, I'd recommend Dreamland Aquapark in Um Al Quwain. Although its in the middle of nowhere, its the cheapest park in the UAE, and it has the most rides.

Water fun. To me nothing so spectacular that we have not experienced before. Durban and Cape Town have similar set ups of water fun at Ushaka Marine world, Gateway Theatre of Shopping and Ratanga Junction. It would be unbearable in mid summer to be here, very little shady spots.
too crowded. nice water park but it gets annoying while waiting 30 minutes for every 1 minute slide
Two Aussie girls on holiday in the Middle East. The park is 5 stars! Must try the fish spa! The only issue we had was the security trying to take photos of us in our bikinis.

very intresting!. I had lots of fun there and playing with water was so good,but i have heard that atlantis park is better than that and more expensive but I haven't gone to atlantis yet.I really suggest you to go to one of these places.
Great day out. Got free entrance as a resident, really good time there. loads to see and do.
A one in a million water experience. What an experience. Water attractions for all ages. Fun for the whole family in a safe area. Had the time of my life. Want more. Will come again I promise.
Lot of fun for all ages. Enjoyed our visit to wild wadi a lot.Great rides and very friendly staff.Waiting lines can be a little long at certain times of the day, but that didn't matter.
I could live there. I've been five times, I believe, and it's always a pleasant experience. I never feel like leaving.

Fantastic fun for everyone !. We visited as a family with kids aged 8 & 5, and having been to quite a few other water parks over the years, including Florida last summer, this was one of our favourites. There really was something for everyone, and the location is amazing. There is plenty for younger kids to do, as well as the thrill rides, and apart from our first day round the hotel pool, we spent every day there! Would highly recommend and we would go back in a heartbeat.
Good Place to Relax. Had a lot of water sports and enjoyed a lot with my friends took our mood to old school days
Enjoy great fun in an improving location. Prepare for a great friendly time in this wonder world of slides and water.

Amasing place. Terrific number of state of the art rides and attractions available. Water pressure propels swimmers sitting on rubber rings up to the top of rides, where gravity takes over for the decent. If you have the opportunity to visit Wild Wadi don't miss it. Some height restrictions apply to certain attractions. Excellent day out, and well worth the money.
As two adults - sooo much fun. We had an amazing time. There were more adults than kids and we had so much fun. We intended to go for an hour or so and spent the whole day there

Wild Wadi. Not to be missed - there were new rides since we were there 3 years ago - if you ever wonder what it must be like to be in a washing machine for 10 mins then here is your chance to find out !
great fun. the attractions are great, great day in Dubai, make sure to go there once in this vibrant city
Watery fun. Simple watery fun. Costly, but in a city of expensive activities this is one of the best.
Fun. This place is for everyone, it has many slides, different rides and good places to eat from.I advise to visit it on a weekday so that you dont have to stay in line for 45 for each ride!!

Fun!. We only spend 2 hours there, and we did manage to have a go at all of the attractions, so 215 AED seemed a bit too expensive for that; however, the fun we had definitely worth it. Just some points: remember to charge/top-up your bracelets before you go in, so you can buy things (food, drinks,..) inside, and also beware that the photos they take are quite expensive!
Amazing Rides. much fun in the heat, with all the rides and activities one can't feel bored, its good for couples as well as family and even alone.
Best of the Waterparks in Dubai. Wild Wadi is great for families and kids, but also groups of any age. A lot of variety in the rides, really good fun. Good options for food and beverage too.

Water Slides are Fun. Was not bad, a little expensive to take a family and feed them for the day. I would probably only reccommend staying half a day or less in the summer months as it is really hot and not a lot of shade. The water slides are lots of fun, however if you are not into slides there are a few other things you can do. Def go if you are into water parks, however not fantastic.
Lot's of fun for you and your family. It's a very good water park that' enough for passing funny times at half a day ( not more ).You can also enjoy the food in different parts of the park.
fun for kids and adults. I visited wild wadi last summer, it was Ramadan and they had good discount. I think it is way better than the Atlantis water park.

good place for family or couple for one day. This water park is good place to spend one day with family or your friend for water rideyou will be all day outside in the sun and water . It has places to play for all ages aslo you can eat there .it is not allow to have food with you.you will get locker to keep your staff and you can charge your ticket by any amount of money to use there balance you can collect it while you are leaving.
family time out. take your family and enjoy the water park ,, dont forget to put some lotions to be aware of the sun

Wild Wadi Water Park!. Situated right in front of the stunning Burj Al Arab, a place to go for water ride lovers. Excellent management, superb rides and adventure slides which are quite safe. Slides : excellentFood: GoodAtmosphere : AwesomeEmergency medical : SufficientValue for money : Great (AED 200 for Adult without any discount, you may opt for sunset pass which will cost you much cheaper but entitles you to enter after 1600 hours)Please note that place is full of women dressed in swimwear and bikini’s, if families or ladies are uncomfortable, Thursday is ladies day only.
FUN FUN FUN. dont miss this. I dont care what people say about the atlantis. This is the best water park out there.You can sit on a tube and enjoy the whole day!!

Nice attractions, but you can do it all in less than 2 hours. After that, you feel like it was too short, A little bit more was expected... A water park should be able to keep you entertained for an whole day!
WOOOO. Luuuurrrvee this place, spent alot of my childhood here..just gets crowded with locals sometimes, they can get a bit touchy.

Great water park. Wild Wadi is the over 10 years old but it is very well maintained. When we visited the biggest ride was closed however they have a lot of other rides to keep people busy. There are several restaurants inside as well as shaded areas for sun bathing. They have a separate area for younger kids called Sinbads something.. Currently they are running family hours from 8 am -10. am on Saturdays. They only let families with kids during this period. It is great to enjoy the rides with children before it gets really hot and crowded. I remember seeing ladies only nights advertised in the park as well.

Fantastic water park. Great facilites. Really fun place to be. You cannot bring water or food into here. Bag searched. Good changing facilities. Bring your camera. Lots to photograph. Family friendly. Lots of life guards watching over you. The pool was fun. Waves in it. Best in Dubai I think. Bring your own towel.
Fun. It was a great day out but disappointed that there weren't many rides

Spend the day.. Nice wild wadi park, you have to pay the fee for entrance, try to get discounted coupons from online. You will go wild in this wadi park. So many things to do here for everyone like kids, adults, mature etc. Highly recommended if you are in Dubai.

Wild wadi VS Aquaventure waterparks. Aquaventure And wild wadi both are really good water parks,, different experience... To me both are must try water parks,, however if I'll have to pick just 1 as a favorite hmmmm I'll pick wild wadi
Nice to play with water. went there on Saturday, lots of people as I expected. next time may need to try go there during the weekdays.

Lovely to cool off in the sun. First time at this park - typical sort of entrance fee - thankfully we had Dubai coupons to get discount - one grumble is you cannot even take in your own water or snacks. Otherwise a very clean park with wide range of rides. Not overly busy midweek but could imagine weekends seeing lengthy lines. Super view of Burj from top of family raft. For some rides you need to be really good swimmer but they cater for all safety wise. American influence very apparent with such as wavepool. Plenty of lounges for relaxation & as you would expect in Dubai no real risk of items being stolen unlike the Florida parks

Nice but small and crowded. We had a lovely running away of the summer heat,but we really expected to find a bigger place with more games and atraction,the long waiting for some games extend for more than 45 min for 30 sec slide!!
Very Nice. Really exciting experience for young and old. Take your swim things though as everything is pricey if you buy there.
Splashy Fun. unbelievable fun, the entrance fee & food is pricey, however, some great fun to be had.
Good fun. This is a really good waterpark in a good area of Dubai that's easy to get to, particularly Abu Dhabi. Good rides and some now being updated.

The best in Dubai. A great water park you must buy a locker key on entry and you must also haev a wrist band that you have to put money on,you only need one wristband for a family the locker is quite big

A fun day out. This is a super fun day out. There are rides to suit all ages. My family tend not to like the more frightening rides but there is still plenty to keep you entertained.The food is pretty awful, all fast food which is not the best quality and very expensive.The kids water area is amazing and the last visit I spent most of the time there, we had a ball!It is smaller than Atlantis water park but I actually prefer it . The sunbeams can be in short supply so grab one as soon as you can.

Wild Wadi - mad experience!. We went to see the park because we'd never previously visited a water park, our hotel was nearby and we were offered free access; the park is much as one would expect and, although rather small, supplies most of the amenities necessary for a kids day out.The park appears to be clean and safe however many of the staff are rather surly and unhelpful. The queues were comparatively short on the Saturday on which we visited.Just as one would expect there's deafening music playing all the time, extremely exited children running in all directions, junk food, lots of water and a general air of well-supervised hyper-activity. It looked to be perfect for the requirements of the younger visitors, many of whom appeared to be in a condition somewhere between hysteria and ecstasy.We rode all the major rides, could find no food to our liking and so we left to eat in our hotel. The park was OK and I'm sure that children enjoy it but it was a mere shadow of the amusement parks in the US.
fantastic time. i love the park, except for the fact there are no healthy options for eating except a juice stand.

its good - but can get way too overcrowded!. have been going to Wild Wadi for years. i really do love it but there is a real difference in experience depending on what day you go. go on a Friday or a saturday and you're asking for trouble! its simply too crowded, although with that said, if you have kids its best to go on Saturday morning which is reserved for families.
Much better than Aquaventure. got the entire Entertainer idea from the wild wadi web site, used the book extensively. great place to spend an entire day with kids.
Definately Wild. Love this place, I think it is great, I was never one for going on any rides including small ones, but for some reason I love this place and the rides are great.
Fun for about two hours. It's not huge, but there is enough to do for two or three hours. I enjoyed the network of waterslides that shoot you uphill :)
Good but pricey. Good family day out, very hot, quite pricey but do use the Entertainer for BOGOF vouchers.
Good family fun. Good all round entertainment for the family. Food not particularly good and you cannot bring in food or even water from outside. The cleanliness of the place could be improved.
tame the heat. one of my favorite places ever with loads to do in the heat of UAE. loved it

brilliant. this is a great day for the whole family it has a few slides for thrill seekers and a few for the whole family you just have such a brilliant day there and they even take photos of you under water and you can take them home. i would recommend this park to anybody i see i think you should go if you are going to Dubai

refreshing water park. whilst its a little pricey , theres no such thing as cheap in the emirates, its great fun and ther are options to suite everybody. the really scarey rides bt also theres this waterway system that you just sit in your doughnut and bob around we took doubles so we could be with the kids and the current takes you round the whole park and you can step on and off anytime you want very sedate and relaxing but at any time you can vere off and take a chute to one of the rides , immense fun. glad we went.

Can hang out the whole day on an innertube. Most of the park can be experienced while still in your inner-tube. Many slides are all interconnected, and you even use a reverse slide that pushes you uphill so you never have to climb up any steps or hills. Ahhh the relaxation!
You will never be fullfilled. Time will pass fast and you will feel that you need more time to have more fun

One of the best waterparks ever!. Loved the variety of water slides. The lazy river is cool. The whole water park is extremely safe and well monitored. There must be at least 1 lifeguard every 20 metres!

Fun, but Self Conscious!. I don't like walking around in a bathing suit anyway. Being a Western woman in a bikini walking around a water park with 70% men staring at you was a little disconcerting even with my husband with me. The water park itself is fun, lot of good rides, pretty well organized, but yeah...They do have a ladies night at the park. Recommendation- don't go on a Friday- it will be VERY busy.

A great diversion. This is a well-run, small water park. I am not sure of the cost of admissions if one is not staying in one of the Jumeirah Hotels, so I cannot determine if it represents good value or not.
Waste of Time and Money. Very small waterpark and very overpriced. Okay for children.

Fantastic Fun. Combining watersport with speed and fun.Wild Wadi is a gtreat day out and the updated rides are awesome.Had a real good time there and will certainly be going back again and again cause there is just so much to enjoy.
Lots of fun. This is a fun place to be with lots of water rides and swimming pools. The only problem here is that the price is steep, around 215 AED per adult

It is getting low!. I have visited Wild Wadi for more than 10 times and I have realized that during the last few times it is getting low standard and fun.First whenever you come to the ticket counter there is a long queue and you might take more than 10 minutes to be in.Then you will surprise by a lot of people inside to get in the rides.And between your rides if you want to go to the locker you might get cold as the AC inside is extremely cold.When I went to get a sandwich I waited for more around 20 minutes to get it however the price is little high.I think also that the water in the pool is over balance of chlorine.At the end I was not happy that they are using now towels instead of the tissues in the bathrooms which is totally cheap way to save money and also I think it is not hygienic.
Fine but nothing special. it was fine for a water park. Our family just prefers Aquaventure at Atlantis instead. Wild Wadi didn't seem as clean or as taken care of.

Wonderful time. One of most important reasons to visit beautiful Dubai.
I hear sometimes from my daughters: "Daddy, when we'll come back to Dubai, to Water Park?"
Top highest quality service.
ladies night. i really like the ladies night although didn't try it till now. when i visited during the it is nice,clean and full of thrill and adventure.

Essential part of Dubai holiday. Been here twice. Very cool place. Food is average but the park more than makes up for it. Can get frustrating competing with other tourists. But definitely worth the trip.
Best waterpark. Best waterpark in GCC - old but very good fun if you are into this sort of thing

Family fun. Very nicely planned and safely run. Especially the top rides are amazing and the comfortable runs are fun. However would recommend to go in the morning as it tends to get uncomfortably crowded in the afternoon.

Delightful treat for all. Realy Wild Wali Park,
keeps everyone busy
unlimited visit with the stay at jumeirah

nice place for fun. it's one of best water park in dubai
you can make a good they in the park with attractive tools
Stay at Jumeriah Beach and this is free. Our kids were in and out of the park all week long, easy to naviagate around fun rides but must be 110cm tall for most.
good day out but expensive again!. liked the costume restrictions here, you had to wear proper swimwear here to go into the park which I think is sensible
Great fun for the young.. My grandson loved it. There are huge waterslides which he says are "brill". Safety is paramount and there are literally scores of lifeguards watching all the time.
Waterlious. If you go here you must enjoy the family ride - both of them as the bring out the trill and its more enjoyable because its scary !!!

Wild Wadi, a wild experience. 250 dirhams is really worth for this place. Only few kilometers away from the Airport and Dubai proper.
You wont just sit on one place for you will definitely try all the attractions inside the park.

Rides and thrill. Have visited a few times, and managed to lose myself into the thrill... if you like speed and water, it is something you should try. The only negative is that being relatively small, it tends to get overcrowded, so there are long lines at the most coveted rides. While now the water is cooler, perhaps it's a good choice. Have taken a model there once to take some shots... waterfalls and all, the shots came out great. Got some good, natural looking props there. There are places for kids of all sizes, so make it an all day family event. It is not cheap, however....being in prime location next to the Burj Al Arab.

over priced, over crowded and very over rated.!!. If your lucky enough to stay at the JBH the Wild Wadi is actually part of your complex and therefore free on entry which would be nice if it was anything like a normal modern water park that weve become accustomed to but its not - its small, very basic and on a good day ridiculously over crowded. I visited the park during one of my first visits to Dubai and the cost for the 3 of us including a couple of beds was circa £100 which isn't a massive amount of money but given the return seems excessive even by Dubai standard
must do great rides for kids. had an amazing time just outside of burj al arab.. beautiful water park for kids but we enjoined it too.
Good Fun. But not as good as Aquaventure @ AtlantisDecent rides but a lot shorter and not as many as you would expect.

Good Day for the kids. Excellent water park, better than Atlantis (Aquaventure) in some respects. TIP , go quite far into the park and try for the sun beds up the steps that overlook the burj Al Arab and the beach. Great for the kids. Snack bars are OK. Rides are great, although "the big one" is in the process of being replaced. Don't put less than AED200 on your wrist band, especially if its a hot day.
Best Day out in Dubai. excellent family day out with lots of fantastic rides. Not too busy and the staff were charming and could not be more helpful. Very well organised .

First time to Wild Wadi - Awesome water park!!. I've been to probably over 50 water parks around the world and was excited to finally visit Wild Wadi. It certainly lived up to the hype and was a real blast!We splurged and rented one of the cabana's which I cannot recommend enough!!! The service is fantastic, you can leave your stuff, have wait staff bring you food, and best of all, walk right up to the start of the 'blaster' water slides (highlight signature attraction) without having to queue! It also includes towels, bottled water, and more.The park is pretty compact but packs a ton in. You can choose different paths on the blaster slides each time you ride which makes it very re-rideable. The two new slides can take up to four people at once which makes them great for going with family or friends. The kids play area was busy and could probably use a couple more slides but was easy to watch and fun to enjoy. The lazy river and wave pool were great, and the photographers around the whole park took awesome pictures.The park also has two of the 'Flowrider' surf simulator rides. These are just fantastic. Again, I've done quite a few of these around the world, but the staff working here were so helpful and taught me new tricks and techniques that I had never been told about before.We will definitely visit again next time we're in town!
Great water park. Similar to The Aqua adventure park but better rides and they also have the SINBAD GALLERY a restaurant for everybody there too.

Great Fun. I felt like a big kid again !
The Park was right next to the Jumeirah Beach hotel so very convenient. I had such a laugh on all of the rides. Great vibe.

Great water park. Our first time in Dubai. My kids age 5 and 12 both loved Wadi. In fact we went there 4 days in a row because of the complimentary free entrance from our hotel (Jumeirah Beach Hotel). It was extremely clean and safe.The staff were friendly with plenty of life-guards on duty. The weather in the evening was surprisingly a bit chilly in April. Friday was quite crowded because it being a holiday.
super. it was wonderfull aquapark that I have ever seen before
Great Fun!. Water park is worth a visit. Loved the tube rides. Entry is included if you are staying in the Mina A Salam
Still the best. Wild Wadi has competition these days but it is still the best day out in Dubai. The rides are great, fantastic staff.

WILD IS NOT HE WORD VERY WILD. have visited this park 4 times 3 times with friends once with family just seems to get better and btter every time.i would recomend the private cabannas sure thell cost you about £200 extra but well worth it you get to skip the main ride . you get your own private sunbeds and towels . also the food gets delivered to your private cabanna so no queing upall i will say to the management good luck and keep it up
Kids. Kids and Adults have a fantastic time - very clean very safe - Lifeguards are brilliant

A little dingy now. We went to Wild Wadi because we were staying at the Jumeira beach hotel and it is very convenient because you walk direct (or take the buggy) from the nice garden of the hotel to the water park. This place is now quite a few years old and it starts to show its age because the heat , sun, humidity and dust are not kind to plastic things. Our son liked it but I found that one of the attraction ("lazy" river) was too fast in some part and , while sitting on one of this ring, he banged himself quite strong. The main attraction, a big slide almost overhanging the beach road, scared me and I didn't let him do it. We didn't stay very long there and went back to the beach and swimming pools of the hotel wich are beautiful. The restaurant on the beach, "Beachcomber" is very nice, beautiful view of the beach, sea and Burj al Arab, nice bbq buffet in the evening. We wouldn't have done a special trip for Wild wadi, it was ok as an extension of Jumeira beach.

The best day of my life!. No dislikes! Just likes!My friend got injured (he was chasing me like a kid - this place makes you feel like a kid again) anyways, the first aider attended to him in 15 seconds (I timed it!) - absolutely unbelieveable, there are so many stewards, makes you feel so safe.Highly recommend it!
Amazing. This is a water park like no others. Great family fun.

one of a kind.... we went there in the weekend and during the week. if you go during the week, you an play non stop without the hussle of waiting in a lane! smart ha !!!they will check your bag to make sure that NO food or drinks are allowed from outside. food is ok but a bit pricy. sll games are close to each other, so you do not have to wear flipflops and worry about loosing them in the rides. you can get in with your kids and still have a good time. i suggest for you to come early to enjoy a whole day in it insted of regretting later for not coming earlier ;)There is photography section inside the rides if you want to have one or two memorable moments!

Great family day out. Visited here during the Easter holidays. Fantastic day had by young and old alike. Althought there aren't that many slides it perfect for the kids to run around on their own. The surf simulators were excellent fun... providing you can get the hang of it! We had a fantastic spot near the wave pool, which was nice ands quiet with an amazing view of the Burj. Food was mainly junk food but quality was fine and prices were reasonable. Overall a great day out.

Fun but packed. Wild Wadi is packed all the time but that's what you expect at a water park I suppose. I was glad it was connected to our hotel the Jumeriah beach hotel, and it was free to hotel guests. They have a couple of slides that come from a tall tower. They are really awesome. Super fast and short but I was really glad that I did it. I wish there had been no lines so I could have done it a bunch of times in a row. Probably had to wait 15 minutes for each time.
2-3 great rides. Probably slightly better than Aquaventure but again not a huge number of rides. Free for Jumeirah guests. Good way to kill a couple of hours but go at 10am before the queues start.

All day in the park. A great day. Get there early/on time and be prepared to have a great time on some fantastic water rides. The food choice is limited and mainly junk food. Find a nice spot and just get into the day. Whilst it is tempting to get near the main wave pool for a central location, there are music speakers and the music is played all day. It gets busy but was not crowded.
Day Out. Went with my Grandson excellent day out great rides and facilities
Great Day Out. Loved it ! Great water rides and lots to do for everyone.I would highly recommend for anyone who is visiting Dubai.
Good but small (visited in 2005). Good but small. Stuff is very friendly. Rushdown Ravine is breathtaking!

A fun way to spend a hot day. My kids and I enjoyed our day at Wild Wadi, but were a bit disappointed. I guess we've been spoiled by bigger and better water rides elsewhere. It is a small park compared to many in the U.S. The rides are fun, but there aren't that many of them and some are showing their age. There were very long lines the day we went, but we had no trouble getting on every ride, often multiple times. We decided to pick this park over Atlantis since we had been to the Atlantis propert in the Bahamas. We probably should have gone there anyway.

2 for 1. visit www.wildwadi.ae and you can get one free entrance:-) Don´t forget to do it in advance - they will deliver it to you by post. Wild wadi is a great place for fun under the Bjur al Arab - the most luxurious hotel in the world.

few very few water rides. Very small and very few water rides only 3 for adults including the lazy river and only one big octopus like slide for children
if compared to other water parks in Dubai that i already went to this is the worst of them and the most expensive as well
will never go back

fun. Fun for the kids. But the place is not enough to accommodate the visitors.
I hope that there will be more activity for children under the age of 10 years

spent great time. we spent great time at Wild Wadi with friends and 2 yo daughter - there was enough entertainment both for her and for adults (though one of the attraction (the highest one) was closed).
Good fun. Took my 11 year old daughter. Had a blast. Lots of different types of rides and play areas. Well maintained and kept.
Wild Wadi Water Park. really a fun place to enjoy - carry your swimming costume beforehand - inside it is very very expensive (unless you are a regular user of swim costume)
amazing day out!. loved the rides, slides and food. Tip: they don't let you take in your own food or drink. You have money belts that you can wear to buy food & drink inside.
Far too busy. Not as good as Atlantis & far too crowded at all times no sun loungers to be had.
Wild Wadi. The famous waterslide is currently replaced by a new attraction. Long lines at the interesting slides only three more intense slides for boys 11 and 14.

My son loved it... I nearly had a heart attack lol. Ok the most important thing for me was whether my son liked it as he is the ''water park king'' so if he wasnt impressed with it then i damn know it wasnt good... but he loved it. Its very rarely you will see me on the rides at a water park.. usually i leave my son to run around and entertain himself, but this time i joined in to, it was loads of fun, going from ride to ride on the rubber dingy thing. The only thing i did not like was the massive tall water slide ride they had, this thing nearly gave me a heart attack, i felt like i was going to come off of it as i was going down, and i did come off a little whilst in the middle and bang back on which was not comfortable.It is a tad to expensive also.. never have i paid around £50 sterling for 1 person entry to a water park for 1 day before.. i think if the price was made more realistic then i would visit with my son more often as he is always asking to go back there.

Good But Park Staff Could Make It Better. Wow! That was my first impression. Good, clean water park with very good rides. As the day went on my impression changed. Rules are not enforced by the workers. People smoked everywhere. Some of e workers would tell them couldn't smoke but did not enforce the rule and the smokers contnued to walk away laughing.A group of four young people, aged 16-17, cut the line on the Burj Surj ride, pushed their way to the top. Everyone was angry with them and reported them to the staff. The staff made them wait five minutes then let them go on the ride. When I asked the main worker, Hassim, why he would not kick them off the ride or out of the park and he asked, "What was my problem?" He seemed to be encouraging kids to cut the lines.Bottom line, if you can only go to one water park in Dubai - go to Atlantis. If you want to go to two water Parks in Dubai and have a good time - go to Atlantis twice.

Wet & Wild. Very well executed water park that manages to appeal to both kids and adults. The place is well organised and clean and a great day out for the family or the adult who wants some simple wet fun!

We spent a joyful day in the park. We spent a joyful day in the park..My wife & the kids loved it.. it covers all the activities you want to do in an Aqua park or you can sit lazy in the water and enjoy the view of Burj il Arab ....Tips:-- Dont go on weekend it is crowded (i went there on Sun which is not weekend in Dubai).- if you go as a family book the bigger lockers which is 35 AED (i thought that the small locker will cover my family thinks but i was worng) and cause we already opened the locker then i was forced to order a 2nd one for the rest of staff) you can re-order the bigger locker if you had ordered the smaller one but in one condition (you should not use the small one as what happend to me).- I left the kids cart with security staff (extra 35 AED) dont take much stuff there unless you need them..- you can see alot of park photographers dont hesitiate to let them take you picutres every where ..finaly you can check them out and if you didnt like it you wont purchase.. and prices where cheap comparing with other attractions...- Even if you dont know to swim - like me :) - you can find a lot of places which not much deep and still enjoy the park (life-guards and life-vest (different sizes) are every where )- Smoking is allowed in certain areas..

Great day out, we loved it, staff were superb. Excellent day out for any one that loves water parks. A little limited on the number of rides but the surfing ( two variants) makes up for this. The park is really clean and the staff a very friendly and helpful. Just been to Atlantis and Wild Wadi was a much better all round experience.

Looks nice, but nothing more!. Went there two times. The overall park design is nice and plenty of food but a bit expensive.But if you are looking for adrenalin than the park is not for you!! There are very few slides and they are boring and slow (except one). A lots of kids!! If I had to rate the fun I had in UAE's water parks I would put: Ice Land (RAK), Dream Land (UAQ), Aquaventure (Dubai) and Wild Wadi.
Great fun for visitors. Well worth a trip if you have family and friends over. The 'new' slides are worth a go as it was getting a little dated with the Aquaventure opening up.

Avoid at all cost. There are very few water rides here and whilst there I injured my foot on one of the concrete slabs surrounding the ride. When I went to seek medical attention I was offered a paracetamol and had my toes bandaged in a non-waterproof bandage, go figure!!! No apology was ever forthcoming from wild wadi themselves

Still brilliant. They now have cameramen who take your photos everywhere with your permission including underwater photos and give you a wristband which you take to the counter on the way out and you can buy your photos. Very very expensive photo packages thoughA couple of good 4 person rides now.

Not for very young kids, only wave pool water warm.. In general this park is still pretty good. Overall area is small. All power slides are interconnected with is a pro. My two year old did not play in kid's area as the water was too cold (Feb)and too many (big) kids. He only liked wave pool. Insufficient sun loungers. Food was pretty good and at a reasonable price (all relatively).
Not scary enough!!. loved the scary slides, wish the Jumeriah Sceriah was still there

My favourite water park in the world.. I just love this place. I preferred it over Atlantis because at Wild Water, water jets blow you up the rides instead of the conveyor belt. Plus the view over the Burj Al Arab is outstanding.
wow its very unique. im so glad i visit the wild wadi very nice experience amazing water events
wild wadi. too many people was there for 2 hours and only went on three rides wish i could have done more but not much variety
Great day. Second time to Wild Wadi- great fun day. Spent about 5 hours here- about the max you will need to spend to enjoy the day.

Great Fun Even For An Adult. I visited Wild Wadi Water Park for the first time in March. I was staying at The Jumeirah Emirates Tower Hotel which gives you Free entry into this water park plus Free Shuttle Service back to the Hotel.Upon arriving at the entrance i was greeted by the friendly staff. I was then directed through into the park to where i got my towel and locker for a small fee. All the staff where very helpful and very friendly.I arrived at about 10:30am which was perfect as there was not a large crowd until it picked up at about 11:15am, so i had plenty of time to get a sunbed in a nice cosy position. But don't worry, there are plenty of sunbeds to go around.Wild Wadi has plenty of things to keep you amused. The park has a great selection of Waterslides, Rapids and Wavepools. There also never much of a wait as rides are running at a fast past so you never seam to be waiting in a line.Wild Wadi also has some great views of the Burj al arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, so don't forget your camera.If your after a day in the sun with some fun. Then i would recommend coming to Wild Wadi Waterpark for the day.

Clever Theme and Cleanest Water Park. Wild Wadi is the cleanest water park I've ever been too. We went in February late in the afternoon which was a little cold for our 5 year old, next time I'd go earlier in the day even if it meant battling crowds. The staff was friendly, we felt very safe and had a ton of fun.

Great rides but quick!. The wave pool is great and is save as life jackets must be worn. The bit with all the slides is amazing and everyone enjoyed it. The lazy river was the favourite because it was very fun and went at some times got high speed and fun. It is however hard to get off the lazy river and if you have small children make sure you hold on to them as the force is very big! It is a great day out overall.
nice new rides but done in 90m minutes. i enjoyed the new rides, but the park is basically experienced in 90 minutes. by then all rides have been checked out and you can leave for the beach :-)

one of the best attraction of dubai. Wild Wadi is one of the best attraction in dubai. You can spend your whole day with your family specially with younger kids in secure & peacefull envoirnment. This is a water park specially for those who loves the water rides. Though a bit costlier, but a real worth of money.

Fun with a Bunch of Friends. Number of rides are a handfull. What you do is go around the lazy river many times just to relax and enjoy the sun and water. Went there back in 2007 and went there again in 2012. Its fun with great company. Laughing and running around. BEWARE food is expensive in there! No sneaking snacks in here! Boo!
Water fun. The waterslopes, the tobogans and the surfwave are great.
No as expected. nice place... but i have been better.. and terriable value for money.. its very expensive.
Fun day out. a good day or 1/2 day of water park fun, also the fresh fruits are a nice touch rather than junk food

Awesome water entertainment. Great day spent in the cool water, just managing to escape the glare of the hot sun overhead. Fantastic for kids and teens, especially the big 'must do' ride in the park(Jumeirah Scierah). Great memories to take away. Try to book a hotel close by, as you will certainly be tired out by the end of the day.

Ladies night at summer. Its good activity at summer to go to wild wadi and do some water sports and hangout with family and friends For me ladies night is the most convenience for me but it gets very crowded especially at the end in the changing room And the looker room is air conditioned and cool, if you where wet and went inside or wanted to take shower.
Water Park.. Great for the kids and even enjoyable as an adult, lots of stuff to do for the kids and they don't get bored, very refreshing water slides, very hot there.
Lots of Fun!. Definitely a great place to cool down in the blistering heat. The big slide is a bit scary!
Brilliant day out.. We really enjoyed our day here. The rides are a great selection from scary to sedate and the staff are friendly and reassuring. Ace fun.
Excellent Family Gateaway. Enjoyable by whole family,Excellent Family Gateaway!!Will visit again.Children loved it.

Fantastic day for all family. Cant fault Wild Wadi. Fun thrilling rides suitable for every age group. We took our 6 year old daughter for her birthday 3 years running. Very safe, very clean and there is something for every age. The jets shoot you up whilst sitting in blow up donuts. Roller coasters in water. So much fun, nobody wanted to leave. Would definitely recommend. Good value too.

Fantastic Water Park. We had a fantastic time at Wild Water Park, we went straight there immediately after checking in, not minding the jet lag and time difference, and the layover in Quatar. We have unlimited entry into the park because we stayed at Jumeirah Beach Hotel which is right next door. Tips you need to go on all the rides!!! We did and when we are tired we relax in the wave pool which was really cooling from the heat. Lovely place my son cannot wait to go back.

Excellent Water Park. Very good water park (costs approx £20 per person per day), but there is a lazy river & lots of water slides, underwater shutes etc.Avoid Thurs/Fri (Dubai weekend) as it can get overly busy with locals.

Lots of fun for everyone. The highest water slide is awesome, not for the light hearted. However highly recommended, adrenalin rush when you finally end up at the bottom.Lots for the kids too, the ques for some rides were long, however that is expected when your in a desert and have found water :)

Excellent night out with the girls!. During the summer months when it is warm all through the night, Wild Wadi keep the doors open until midnight once a week for a Ladies Night! This means it's not only for female visitors, but that all the staff working there are female too (perhaps not that important for some, but for Muslim women this might mean the difference between really being able to let their hair down or not). It's a fantastic venue for the whole family in the day, but we decided to give it a go at night and go without the kids - and we had an absolute blast! The views from round the park at night are amazing - the only downside in fact was that no cameras are allowed on Ladies Nights, so I wasn't able to get any shots of the neighbouring Burj al Arab. It does get chilly waiting in line for the rides though, despite the high evening temperatures, so don't be afraid to do this right in the middle of summer! I am definitely going back there again once summer is here again - the thrill of the rides in the dark is so much greater than during the day!! It's a real shame there are no couples nights when you could go and relive your youth with your husband/partner and leave the kids at home... but if you can get a girlfriend or two together, this is a night not to be missed!

fantastic and amazing memory for my family. I were there 4 times . every year we go to Dubai with family and as a rule we must go to wild wadi . it is a place for which my daughter come to Dubai every year. I think it would be a good idea to have more number of chairs around the swimming pools.

Paradise by the beach. took a cab here (as everyone does) here while staying with friends spent the whole day, even though it was out of season and they were maintaining the main pool still had a fantastic fun filled day the uphill water flumes were great fun. The lazy river was great.

relaxation. . .. .. relaxing and will enjoy it but it was too cold after 3pm. One of the rides was out of order, so there were more queues for the others and still had to pay the full amount to enter !

A great fun place for Family. One of the best water parks we have been to. The facility has activities for all ages of people. We had a teenager as well as daughter of 04 years, and everyone enjoyed there a lot. Only entry fee is charged and rest of the park is free. There is age restrictions for one of the kids area otherwise, its a place for everyone.We enjoyed the wave pool, lazy river and kids slides.

An evening of chaos. Thursday evenings are Ladies only. Expats wear swimsuits but expect to see fully clothed people in the water. It is packed with groups of school kids so families should keep a very close eye on young ones.
Lots of fun. Great fun day out, good for all ages, well organised and easy to get food, drinks, leave all belongings in lockers and enjoy the day.
A great experience. Liked the fact we had free access as stayed at nearby hotel. Some of the water was too cold for me but would be Fabian hotter sumermonths

Fantastic day out. This was my second visit. Plenty to do for all ages.
Tantrum Alley is my favourite water ride of all time closely followed by the Burj Surj.
Get soaked!!!. Excellent thrills and spills (literally) only disappointing thing was the main ride was closed...

Great fun. Great fun for everyone, large wave pool and lots of rides, and entrance is free if you stay in one of The Jumeirah group hotels. Plenty of quieter sun bathing areas and pools if like me you have to go with the family but don't really like waterparks. They have a wonderful fish spa only 50 drms for 20 mins, the little fish eat all the rough bits of skin from your feet, very tickley to begin with but you soon get use to it.
best during peak summers. good water rides to go in & enjoy...will be crowded in summer; but good to go anytime else...
Great Water Park. Best water park I have been to in a long time, hours of fun and time permitting we would have definitely spent another day at Wild Wadi!

Great Day Out. We had free entry to Wild Wadi as we were staying at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers which is a fantastic deal. Also loved the fact that we could walk along the beach to get entry from the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. Weather was a tad on the chilly side but at least then we didn't have to queue much. Can imagine it being quite exposed in the heat. Having grown up going to the Disney waterparks I have quite high standards so didn't know what to expect. Decor-wise it doesn't compare but I thoroughly enjoyed the rides, especially the interconnecting uphill slides that mean you don't have to carry rubber rings upstairs like with most waterparks. Tantrum Alley was terrifying though, even for someone who loves rollarcoasters so would not recommend unless you are very brave. The lazy river is pleasant and the wave pool was very good: warm water and views of the Burj Al Arab. A great way to spend a day in Dubai.

Best place in Dubai. Great for kids and great for adults to be a kid all over again. Bring it on.. My family love this place. It can get very busy so get yourself a cabana and get out of the crowds.From the private area of the cabana you can step straight into the lazy river which takes you on a great big slow rotation of the waterpark and access to all the rides.Another massive beneift of the Cabana is that you have waiters serving you and you can get cold drinks and lollys on demand (very impotrtant for the kids).The rides are awesome. 2012 is the year that my son will be tall enough to go on all the rides (they are height restricted). Have already done them all with my daughter (and on my own a few times :) so the fun never ends for me.Best place in Dubai. Great for kids and great to be a kid all over again. Bring it on.

A fun day out!. A great day out. We enjoyed all the slides, but unfortunately some of the solo slides were closed for renovation, but we still had enough to choose from. There are plenty of staff (life guards) around and they are very friendly and helpful, and it was reassuring to some of friends who are not the strongest swimmers. The queues to the slides and attractions were small so we didn't have any waiting around and we spent to last part of the day relaxing in the heated wave pool.

Good fun. We enjoyed our day here, not many rides but they are good. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Refreshments were reasonably priced. Nice to be able to relax in the lovely pool and on the free sunbeds.
Fantastic. Kids loved it, I loved it. Beautifully designed, really great slides. The one at the top that you do without the inner tube is truly scary and worth it!
Fantasticccc. Perfect place to be in during the hot afternoons in Dubai .......my kids loved it ......great rides for kids and adults too
I think the ticket price is too high. They could give more discount for kids under 10, as I paid for my 6 y.o son a full price. For 3 people it cost me 200 USD

Great fun, something for everyone.. The park was great fun & not busy when we went in Feb time. However, after being to other waterparks I was expecting it to be larger. We had done all the rides within about 2hours! Not complaining though as had a good time, & stayed from about 11-4 in the end. When you go in you pay for a locker & get a electronic wristband which you also load cash onto to spend inside. ( Good idea as means you don't have to keep going to locker) No food or drink is allowed inside, not even bottles of water. Anything you have is confiscated when you go in but stored & given back to you when you leave. I would recommend taking in an empty bottle as there are water fountains around the park if you want to fill up.  Good, clean changing & shower areas. I imagine they would get very busy on a popular day as there isn't that many.There are rides to suit everyone. Lots of comfy sunbeds. We found some overlooking the beach & Burj AlArab. All the staff are friendly, lots of life guards everywhere.I had fun but probably wouldn't go again now I've been once.
it is very nice and good place to view people. lovely and best place for people who try to find ice in dubai:) this is rite place for them
FUN FUN FUN. Outstanding - We loved this place so much - no queing like disney parks - really good and also if you are a football fan - there were a few footballers and Managers hanging around
One of the best. It's my 5th visit and as always I'm very satisfied with the experience
Coooooooooool. Just FUN!!!!!!!!! Really go! Have someone with you that doesn't get tired of running around!

new ride Burj Surj very funny. Caught a buggy from the Al Qasr pool which is a lovely way to arrive from the Madinat hotels. They check your room number on a computer, and you're in. They provide towels but not lockers free, so leave valuables back at the room. As with many water parks, it's quite hard to get your bearings, so make a base somewhere so kids can meet you back there if you get separated! In feb there were hardly any queues at all, and we got to do all the rides we wanted v quickly. We took a water bottle in our bag but that's frowned on, I think you're supposed to buy all food and drink there. They take pictures of you as you go around, and give you a wristband to check them later. Enjoy!
Fantastic place to chill!. Fantastic place to beat the heat in summer at Dubai! Great water slides and suitable for both adults and children.

Run down, not many good rides. We were really looking forward to a day of fun in the waterpark but were disappointed when we arrived to a run down park. There were a couple of good rides but nothing amazing. The highlight was definitely the surf ride!! Good for children!
Superb!. Brilliant day, and free when you stay at any Jumeriah Madinat hotel..we have been twice..and enjoyed both times.
small but fun. excellent watermark for a morning or afternoon. great rides for all the family. Immaculately clean as is all the resort at Jumeirah.

Great fun place - even for adults. My godson says this is his favorite water park ever - but alas, it is Dubai as well. I wll say, however that the rides are fun, the water even sprays up - sending you rocketing up the slides as well as great downslopes. It's really landscaped and decorated well, nice places for lunch - great lockertooms with lockers, etc. You will not be dissapointed.

Not a must go for a grown up like me. It's located at the entrance of Burj Al Arab rather than Jumeirah beach hotel, it offers free parking. The admission is AED 215 for adult, plus 25 for small locker rental, nothing comes free in Dubai. So I would recommend those with kids, should stay at jumeirah hotel, which offer direct access and free admission, apart from the room charges, the total cost would save a lot. Speaking of the waterpark itself, it's only about 3 or 4 major slides, which is quite less than I expect, a wave pool, and some kids mini slide. A big plus would be , since no food and beverage allow from outside, the food and drink inside the park charge in a reasonable level. Also the slide itself do joy and excitement indeed. Wish someday a bigger waterpark will be available, since Dubai always love to break the records of greatest size.
been there 6 times and eager to visit again !. one of a kind experience with many rides well-designed for every taste

Half a day visit. Water parks are always fun, especially in the summer. This place has many attractions. Kids will have soooo much fun. Try to avoid during the weekends and winter. If you visit Wild Wadi, make sure you visit all close by attraction: Burj Al arab for some photos, Jumirah beach hotel for lunch, and Madinat Jumirah for shopping.
Too much fun. An amazing place to have fun with the family. Avoid weekends as they are more crowded.

A place to be in during the summer months of Dubai. excellent place to pass your time during the summer months of Dubai....well managed and great fun for kids and adults both....the new rides are also good

Kids loved this place .... We had a great time here, plan your swimwear carefully! the Tantrum Alley terrified us, we weren't expecting it to be quite as white knuckle for a family of four with two young kids. Lots of giggles afterwards once we'd got over shock.
