Lots of fun!. The water park here is heaps of fun for all ages - from small children to adults, there's plenty to do for everyone. Can get quite packed during school holidays and weekends (Thu/Fri) but you can also go in the evenings, which is great for pale-skinned people like me! Also, if you take your camera to the top of the high-speed slide, you can take some great pictures of the Burj Al Arab - especially at dusk.
So much fun!. Loved the ladies nights...A great chance for the ladies to let their hair down and quite a nie experience to visit the park in the evening.

Such a fun day. Such a fun day out, rides were fun and mainly on rubber rings. Slide for all the family to enjoy. It is a little pricy and until late 2012 the biggest ride is being changed to a new one so you are one slide down. The locker hire was expensive but needed and the food was nice and not too badly priced.
Great fun. Based on the Jumeirah Beach hotel site, the water park is great fun and the staff are very friendly and helpful
Splash around at Wild Wadi!!. Great place to enjoy during the summer months in Dubai. All my friends did recommend this to us. Terrific experience.
Still good. The Jumeirah Scarer is closed and a new slide is being readied at the moment.
Great fun for children. Great to spend a day specially for kids. We used entertainer voucher, however they were not accepted for children as children are counted based on their height instead of age.
It is a great water park. I had a wonderful time there. It is not incredible big, but is a lot of fun! The water slide is an experience that cannot beforget!
Such fun. At 50 plus still love the Wild Wadi. Staff are so polite and helpful.
great for kids. well placed waterpark next to burj Al Arab. Not as big as teh AStlantis one but easy to get around . Lots of smaller slides for kids Will go back.

Never on a weekend!. We visited Wild Wadi for the first time on a saturday. The whole (not so big) area was crowded, sometimes we had to wait an hour to get on the slides.It's a nice mix for all ages but we like the "Dreamland"-Waterpark in Umm al Quain more, even if you drive about one hour from Dubai. Iceland in Ras al Khaima is also very nice, nearly no people and very funny slides!
very bad and expensiv. the park is very small , just 3 aktivities , just finshed all of it in 30 minttes. ticktes is expensiv .

Waterslides with a difference. Wild Wadi, like many things in Dubai is not the usual water park as we know it. Even though its relatively 'old' for Dubai the park is excellently designed for all ages. We were a mixed group and really had a good time. What we really liked was the long ride on donuts, which shoot up against gravity! Told you its not the usual ride with slides and all.

Wild Wadi. We left this to the last day (wish we hadn't), it was free as we were JB residents and my 7 year old son and I had a fantastic time for a few hours whilst Mum crashed around the pool. So much better than Atlantis in my opinion, less crowded, shorter queues and not so naff !!

Great day out for kids-but more food options. Great day out for kids...but the food options are not great...and you cannot take in any food or drinks yourself so can be an expensive day out. Buy the entertainer guide (blue book) for 2 for 1 vouchers

First rate entertainment and just a little fear!. A great who spend a couple of hours. A good combination of modest but thrilling rides, a lovely wave pool, surfing, and two spectacular and thrilling mega-rides. We lived it, and it's free if you are staying at the Jumeirah hotels.

Compact but great fun. This water park is surprisingly compact, but a lot is packed in in the shadow of the Burj Al Arab. A long lazy river, multiple rapids and flumes. As the main ride is being renovated the two remaining "thrill" rides were busy, but worth a 15-30 mintue wait - we splashed down with smiles on our faces every time. The flowriders are super with patient staff who took time to give instruction to beginners. I was amazed by the large number of lifeguards on duty, all of whom were smiling all day, and cleanliness of the park.The bracelet money system is great and avoids the worry of cash in the park. The changing rooms were a little busy and claustrophobic. Free parking.
Expensive but great on a hot day. If money is not an object, I'd recommend this place. There are plenty of both tourists and locals alike enjoying the facilities.
Wadi fun. This was a return visit for my daughter and grandson and they enjoyed it just as much a before. Worth a visit
Good, but not the best. A lot of fun rides and a nice wave beach, but it is too crowded and the Sceirah slide is down for construction. Aquapark is better, even though it lacks a surf wave.
Best water park I have every experienced. Didn't like the fact that the pathways burn your feet. Love the new family water rides.
Fun for all. Took the grandchildren for a days activity and we all had a great time. The biggest slide was worth a try, but will not be repeated
Kids & Adults Paradise. My daughters and I had such fun here. Felt like I was a teenager again floating around on tubes all day and laughed so much. Really was fun
Teenagers will love it!. Noisy, waterpark that older children just love! Great fast rides and surfing.

a lot of fun. The Wild Wadi Water Park was a lot of fun, and greatly located right next to our hotel! I also enjoyed that once you pay for your hotel, the price includes the Water Park tickets for you and for your family members!
interesting, exciting. We had very good time in this park. there was no delay time for each part of park. We hope we can visit here again.
great day out. Loved wild wadi , facilities were good and the rides are fun food resonably priced for a theme park
A must!. There is not much to say, there is a lot to do. Especially with young people.
For fun. If you want to have fun in the water park, it is quite good. Apart you have wonderful views of Jumeirah Beach and Burj Al Arab Hotel. It is for all ages.

very good and fun waterpark , best in Dubai for water rides. We were in january in Dubai and went to Wadi wild, it is a very fun waterparks , the rides are very exciting especially if you have teenagers( we were with tow teens and one 9 years old )I tried the fisho spa and was amazing and at good price , my daughter tried the surf experience and she loved it , you have behind you the view of Jumeriah hotel and from the top of one of the ride you can see a beautiful view of Burji al Araab , amazing , the food is good , good price , choice is good for family ,the wave swimming pool is lots of fun .the music is nice and pop music .really a very good day and we will definetely go back next time we go to Dubai.

AMAZING. Liked it so much I bought a yearly pass.
The Flowriders are just more fun than anything else
You will love it
Good place. it is a nice park. as when we went there the water was cold and the weather around 23 we did not use it at all even when it was free for us staying in al qasr .

Nice for children !!!. Children and Teenagers love water parks. They will have a great time on Dubai. Some Parents have better time enjoying their kids smiles. In Dubai you can wear a bikini of a conservative cloth whaterver you choose it is just FINE.

Fun Under the Sun. Went there with a friend to chill out and spend the day. Enjoyed almost all the rides in the park. But the most amazing one was Jumeirah Sceirah, that one was a thrill, climbing all the way up, with the suspense building as you see the warning signs and all the people stepping down scared to actually take the ride after they had went all the way up there!A great place for the family and friends to spend the day and have a good time.
not only family must see and do. we were there for our little girl but i think we loved it as much as she did it was a great fun fun fun water slides waves and lot fundo it it it

Getting old, tired, smelly and gridlocked at busy times....... Have been to Wild Wadi many times over the years, enjoying it almost every time. Last visit left me feeling that I may never return. Too, too busy. We had to queue for 45+ mins for everything. Queues can be smelly - I don't know why, and I don't want to think why - I just know to take Velcro sandals with me! It would be so easy for them to employ people to clean litter - you don't want to be swimming with tissues in the water. Same old rides, exciting if you've not done a wet theme park before. 2 new rides - great for when you are on them, but not worth waiting nearly an hour. Expensive day out and you feel hard done by when you have been on less than half of the rides. Put enough credit on the wrist watch to buy food, drinks, lollies. You can get a refund of unused credit. Take sandals - ground can get hot. UV Wet shirts worth it if you burn easily and even if you dont. Change of clothes can be left in a pay for locker. Free access if you stay in any Jumeirah hotel.
fun all day. if you are looking for fun with family for whole day then it's wild wadi!
What an experience. A must do! dont miss this. Entire day of fun sun and relaxing.

exciting for kids, for adults NOT. wild wadi water park might be an exciting and fun place to take your kids but for adults it doesn't really have that much to offer. the rides are few and not very adventurous and there's not much else to do besides that (one wave pool). no free access to the nearby beach, no smaller pools (jacuzzi-like). those 215 AED could have been spent for something more exciting (plus they make you pay for the towels and the locker).
Fantastic fun. Try to avoid the weekend (Fri-Sat) otherwise this is great fun.Excellent cashless payment system.Probably best to avoid the hottest part of the day.

I went there the first time in Dubai and I loved it.. Now I'm taking my kids there and they love it too. The only remark I regrettably have to make is that staff is not capable of handling the youth. Spoiled young Arabs misbehave, throw things on the floor and do not accept instructions of the staff.Please change this and empower your staff by removing people who spoil others day out and refuse to obey the rules.

Great fun. Excellent place for a fun filled day with family. Great rides and good facilities. You can combine this with the visit to Burj Al Arab which is next door. You require a confirmed restaurant reservation to enter this luxury hotel though. Good views from some of the rides of Burj Al Arab and the private beach adjacent to the hotel.

Small, slow and old. Quite a small waterpark, with very old, slow and boring slides, you can do most of them in 45min... I cannot understand how they can charge a similar amount of money as Aquadventure. Was lucky as we went on week day, it must be horrible a full capacity. The toilets (mens) are not that clean and the whole place looks like it needs a good scrub. Aquadventure, not only have much better and faster rides, but is really clean, big, has a beach and well tough layout. Also you can take up to 1 liter of water at aquadventure and nada at Wild Wadi.
yeah....party time. my kidz love the adventure and the cold water rides when its cooking hot in dubai....
More fun per sqm. More fun per sqm - better then Aquaventure. No need to walk or look for a tire.
A little expensive............... ....................to get in. But excellent fun for the whole day when inside! Just watch out for the flood water above your head when you leave the changing rooms!
a real adventure. so many ways to get wet and so many adrenaline rush experiences

Water Adventure with Kids. Our second time in Dubai. During our first visit, we visited the Water Park in Atlantis. This time we tried Wild Wadi. and we cant help ourselves comparing it to Atlantis...Wild Wadi looks crowded to me. Not much space, too much structures everywhere. It is small compare with Atlantis. The river ride does not look too attractive. The way they designed and with its colors makes the water looks dirty.I like though the surfing idea though we did'nt try it. We also like the wave pool though the intervals was too long.On our next trip, we prefer to visit Atlantis again
Fun & Safe. Wild Wadi is a fun place. The crowd is always good and place is very safe.Although its not as big as some other places in asia, its a lot of fun

Good Fun for Family's Day out. This a a nice and compact water Water park located in the heart of Dubai..There are about 10-12 rides , the fastest slide being the Jumeriah scaria.. There are a couple of family rides which I could enjoy with with 6 year old kid as well.The food inside the park is quite expensive though and there are very little options

Great!. Amazing and Amusing. rally a nice place to spend a day with family.I would like to go there again. My kids always remeber with pleasure the day spent at Wild WadiGood both for teens and younger childrenSafe and clean and also a place where, during Ramadan, it is possible having meals if not observing religion rules
Great. great place to go especially during the hot summer months. Mind your back when you go up the water shoots as you can end up with nasty bruising to your deriere.
water. about 3 yars back i went there with my family and we had lots of fun and we went in the water coaster

An oldie but goodie. The Wild Wadi is Dubai's oldest waterpark but was a trend setter in its day. The facilities are a little aged but are all still in perfect working order and a lot of fun. There are plenty of slides and guests do not need to leave the water often as they are simply water blasted, conveyor'ed or drifted to their next slide choice. The views of the Burj alArab in the Arabian gulf are awesome and the park is well worth a visit.
Great Water Slides. Wild Wadi was great, i found the rides are little more thrilling than aquaventure, the location was great right next to the Burj Arab.

Good, modest size. We have been to watermarks in several countries. Wild Wadi is a quality site, well maintained. It is rather small, though, so about half a day is the limit. Some of the rides are more rough than at other water parks, so small children need closer supervision. A lot of concrete, not enough shade.
great. great, touch $$$$$ but big and small kids will enjoy
Closed. Closed in january - but looks amazing. Didn't seem to be much work going on though

Great fun. Everyone loved this place! You can be a bit lazy and just lounge about or you can have a go on all the slides no matter how scary they are. The layout can be a bit confusing at first glance but it's fine once you get started! It was very safe and the lifeguards really did their job as lots of people went into deep areas despite not knowing how to swim and every 2 minutes a life gaurd was jumping in to save someone. There isn't a huge variety of slides and in a few hours you can get a little bored but if you're not one for a huge waterpark and just want a little fun then this is the place. There is also a car park etc for those taking their own cars.

Quirky fun!. Loved it. I took my 10 year old son and so did he... It's really well-organised and has loads of rides for all ages. I loved floating along in a rubber ring - my son loved the Jumeirah Sceirah - which is VERY scary! We visited in winter so it was not too hot but I bet it is a great place to cool down in the summer. We'd def go again.

Great Fun!. We had such a great time at this waterpark. While there are alot of rides for adults (about 6 I Think), the rides that were there were great fun. We used a 2 for 1 entrance voucher that we got from the entertainer book, which cut down on costs. Definitely recommend this water park
Eclipsed by Aquaventure. We went 2 years ago and were very disappointed with Wild Wadi. Quite expensive and few slides and got bored by lunchtime
awesome water park. how much ever i say its less no words to describe this simply superb nice place to hang out n have fun with family n friends overall nice experience
Great family day out. There is a lot for all ages. Our 15 year old Son had a lot to do and we were able to have a nice relaxing day.
Quite small. Compared to other water parks in Dubai, Wild Wadi is fairly small and with very few attractions I must say.

What a day. i was not a big fan of water parks.. but it is extremely nicely executed theme park.. had a wonderful day.. they rides ARE thrilling especially one of the two new slides added recently.. plus the entire feel of the place is something that stays with u till long.. and whenever the feeling starts fading.. u do want to go back there.. :)

Great Fun but sooooo hot!!!. Not a lot of shade which was a pain when you were fading in the heat. The lockers weren't operating on the day we were there which meant and extremely long wait in line to manually check your bags in to a secure room, along with some very impatient and rude people who were also waiting. Staff were good though and remained calm.
Splash out!. If you are staying at a Jumeirah property, make sure you visit the Wild Wadi at least once.Great fun, for kids and adults,

Great Park - buy the F&B card so you don't have to carry money. Wild Wadi is run very well and quite enjoyable for everyone. Plenty of space to sit and lounge while the kids run around going up and down all the slides. The great thing they do here is selling the "food and drink cards" so all you need to keep track of is the card and not worry about getting money wet. They will refund the excess too so put more on than you think you'll need. During Ramadan it was a great place to spend a day.
Fun day!. Great time and nice park. Clean and great with friends. Well worth a visit if you have seen the other sights.
Wild Wadi!!. Very nice park... Even though it is not a very big waterpark, it has many water rides that one can enjoy!

Fun day out. Now that it has two new rides, Wild Wadi can rival Aquaventure. And the view of Burj al Arab when you're going up to the taller slides is fab. It's quite compact so if you're caught for time and want to spend a half day there before heading off somewhere else it's a better choice than aquaventure.
Still the best water park in town.. Great for families and conveniently located to Medinat Jumeira.
lots of fun for the kids. the oldest but probably still the best of Dubai's water parks.

Fun and endless enjoyment. We visited Wild Wadi Water Park in 2010. However, we still remember the lovely memories of our visit. We were staying at Alqaser Hotel and entering the water park was complimentary for the hotel residence. I remember the price was a bit expensive so for a family with a young kid they will save a lot by staying in the hotel. There was a gold car that took us from the hotel to the park which was also part of the enjoyment.

Enjoy whole day. Wonderful park with almost non-stop entertainings. It is very convenient that you do not need to climb ro spend 10 minutes in queues every time you want to have a 20 seconds ride. here are are braught from one ride to another by water :) Just relax and enjoy!Surfing teaching is cool!Hint: try to come early in the morning, before most of touristic buses come - then you will enjoy more.Try fish pilling!
splendid. liked all the rides , my children were ecstatic and this was a good start of the year

Fun Day out ,especially for kids. Very nice place to enjoy a splash with your family or friends especially during the summer days. My only concern is that it tends to be a bit overcrowded on weekends and you need to wait for a while before going on each ride. Food there is a bit overpriced too. Otherwise, great experience and highly recommended.

BEST WATERPARK EVER. The best day of our holiday was here. Best location in Dubai. My 14yr. old daughter had a super awesome time. Friendly and helpful staff,security and lifeguards. Entrance fee souvenier shops and food outlets prices were very good. Will definitely visit with every trip to Dubai. Wild Wadi Waterpark ROCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Great day for the adults and kids. Fun day out for both kids and grown-up kids. Rides cater for all sorts of folks, rides for families and the jumeriah scarer for the individuals.
Water Park. Nice way to cool down, food was ok, but the rides where fun.
Fantastic. Love it every year, great family fun and our kids are 23 and 26!!

A Great Family Day out. Wild Wadi is an excellent water park for all the family. It has a number of different rides, some of which the whole family get on together. There is a small fun park for the little ones with sunbeds nearby so that you can relax whilst keeping an eye on the children. A tip would be to go as soon as it opens at 10am, as it gets very busy in the afternoons.

My Fave water park!!. We went to the Wild Wadi the first time we went to Dubai in 2008. This was before Aquaventure and Atlantis had opened. We actually preferred this water park to Aquaventure. The slides are so much fun, with shoots that send you up the slides rather than down!! Wild Wadi BASHER was possibly our favourite slide!! There is also a surf pool which has the amazing Burj Al Arab overlooking it.If you are staying at the Jumeriah beach resort then I am pretty sure that you get free entrance to this water park!!We spent the whole day hear until about 7pm at night!!! It has lots of facilities including towel and locker rental, food facilities and amazing views!!! Back in 2008 it was relevently cheap to enter the park and we found it good value, however when visiting back in Oct 2010 (i know my date of visit wont let me go back that far!) it appeared to be shut for a refurbishment!! Looks like they were building plenty of new slides!!!Definatly would recommend this to all the family as it is a great day out!!! Definatly take plenty of sun cream as it gets extremely hot when walking around!!!

best water park i've ever been to. we went in december and there wasn't a queue for any of the rides and the fact that most start at ground level and use water jets to propel you to the higher level (start) of the ride is also an excellent idea
A Must!!!. Have returned so many times that we are becoming residents of this park. Also to note, went during the month of Ramadan and they served drinks and food.
wow. beautiful view as its totally opposite the burj al arab. rides are great if you are brave enough.also the pool area is perfect for families with playareas
Excellent. Wonderful cool fun. Husband had an accident and came off his dinghy. Lifeguards very prompt and delt with him. Thankfully not a hospital trip

Excellent Place. This place was excellent....The layout and relaxed atmosphere is a credit to Dubai! Everything ran like clockwork and the kids had a fantastic day..This place is a must see when you visit Dubai.

Everyone's paradise. A water park for the young and old. A place to cool down in warmer months and have some fun. The rides are great , does get busier on the weekends, so queues are long. Lots of food and beverages to enjoy and lockers available. Yes I would go back.
Fun. Lots of fun if you are over 1.1m. My kids loved the wave pool.

The Jumeirah scarer slide scared me twice in one ride a) soooo fast b) so about to pull my pants off..... Must do if you have kids and teenagers with you. A neopren shirt might be good advise here especially for the hottest summer and coldest winter days.

AWESOME. We stayed at the Jumeirah Beach hotel and had free access to this water park. Brilliant! Perfect to cool off, some of the rides go for a long time, so you stay in the water. The master blaster was great, take us up not down! The wadi wash was interesting, a storm breaks out every hour releasing flash flooding! A well done water park with a variety of rides, not just slides! Kids will love this place and so will adults. The lazy river was great to just float in the water.
Heaps of fun!. The kids and adults enjoyed the sides. It was an enjoyable day for all. It is very similar to other water-slide parks however the atmosphere and cleanliness was a real bonus.

a fun park with wicked rides. We spent something ridiculous like 10hours here one summers day and it was just great, take on the heat and climb the many stairs to the rides at the top, there are 100%worth it, so much fun and hair raising!

Splendid park. Best water park I've been to a lot of rides like the jumeirah sceira and the wave pool. Swimming at the river was memorable but swimming trunks were very expensive. Nice views of the burj al arab. A must visit in dubai.

average overall and good rides. the overall look is a bit old but the rides are great , the water was heated so you can enjoy it even in winternice for all ages but very expensive, would prefer aquaventure if for kids
A grand day out. We all had a great day here, but I would not like it if crowded. Sunbeds are at a premium so get there early. Buy tickets in advance to avoid queues
Excellent. Been to Wild Wadi loads of times and and really enjoy it every time.

Good, not as large as expected. Park was good, impression I got from advertising was that it would be bigger but it was still big enough to entertain. Excellent for kids (but as I don't have any not so great for me). Also would advise if going in winter to only go in the middle of the day when it's warmest, lots of shade there so can get nippy
this is great day!. you and you children will enjoy very much.Staffs are realy good and kind.Loker rooms are realy clean.But food is very expensive there.You can take amaizing pictures under water.
Day of water fun. I spent a whole day at Wild Wadi. It's a lot of fun and I would recommend it to others if you feel like a day of playing around in the water which is not the beach.
best waterpark in the UAE. good rides, amazing views, fun atmosphere.. good music
Excellent water park. Really good for ALL the family even quiet small children wont feel left out of the fun
Well run and great fun. Quite expensive but well run with loads of friendly, helpful staff. Greatly enjoyed.
Kids will love it. This is by far the best attraction for kids. Its an all day thing. Avoid it if the weather is cold as you are outdoors and in water allday.

Cool down in the Arabic Heat. This was our third visit to Wild Wadi. The park is very popular among both Dubai visitors and locals, so it is not surprising that all rides have endless-looking queues. To avoid as much crowd as possible, it is best to visit on business days (beware in UAE Friday & Saturday is weekend) and of course arrive as early as possible.
Average water theme park. Its an average water theme park, although its got a really good photo shoot of the Burj Al Arab. Large area.
Great Fun. Lots of amusements for the kids, spoilt for choice on which to go to next
OK water park. The park had 3 exciting rides otherwise it was a fun day for the kids to enjoy wading in the wave pool.

Wet and Wild in Dubai. This was another water park we visited. We stayed at the Madinat and had unlimited access to the park.The propulsion system is something to experience for yourself. You only have to climb stairs for 3 rides in the entire park: The Jumeirah Sciera, Burj Surge and Tantrum Alley. You sit in inner-tube like floats, like inner-tubing downriver, but then at intervals along the course, you get blasted upriver or upwards by these water jets up chutes that lead to the different slides and rides.We actually rode this system up most of the way to The Jumeirah Scierah which is a long climb otherwise.Tantrum Alley and the Burj Surge are rides that where you ride in a dinghy with other riders. Definitely give Tantrum Alley a try.Comparing the Leap of Faith at Aquaventure Water Park and the Jumeirah Scierah at Wild Wadi, the Leap of Faith is the more spectacular ride.Worth a visit.
Fun Fun Fun. The kids loved the rides and so did we ...the rides are incredible!

A good day out. There is a good selection of rides. The main slide is over very quickly though! It actually got a bit chilly on the day. If you are staying in the Jumeriah complex its definitely worth a visit as its free.

Easy to orientate with. Got a buggy from the Madinat - no problems with entry (free) and kids were confident enough to go off on their own to give us some sun bed time! Clean and efficient - not too long for rides and happy time spent by all
Wet!. Great day but expensive and lacked more slides..Lots of beds to choose from, and different food outlets.Needs to be bigger!!
Very nice bday party when in town. Excellent, well organized, clean, excellent rides and super weather
funny. Really funny... another waterpark like anywhere else but really funny....
Full of Fun. I had one complete day full of fun. It's amazing. you have lots of choices of water games to enjoying.
so much fun!. all you need a your swimwear. Leave your phone at the hotel otherwise you had to hire a locker each time you go on the rides. Queues can be a nightmare!!!!

Amazing waterpark. So much fun!. Must visit place!
Loads of great rides and loads to see. I went in 2004. But am sure it has improved even more since then. The weather is great so you can go year round.
Take out a whole day to visit!
Great fun.
Splish splash. much improved water park, varied rides, have updated some of them with the challenge of Altantis near by. cheaper altentative to Atlantis, good for a family day out
Fantastic Waterpark!. My kids loved this waterpark. The waterslides were amazing and fantastic fun!
Best waterpark I've been to. Nice escape from the heat and a great day there. The rides are very nice though not numerous.

A fun-filled day!. This is a great water park - something for everyone! Wave riding, lazy rivers, wave pool, kids jungle gym and of course great slides! When it is hot, it is great to go late afternoon and ride the slides while watching all the lights come on around the Burj al Arab! Spectacular!
Wild Wadi. Only place the journey up was as fun as the ride down waterslides
wild wadi. the staffs were really helpful.when i had a problem there the doctos helped me in no time
Great Day Out!. A fun day out! Make sure you take lots of pennies!

KIDS LOVED IT. My kids loved the place for its magnificent rides, artificial beach and the pools.. A must for everyone including adults... Water was too cold though but what do you expect in winter eh?
overpriced junk. i didnt like anything about the food, it was awful

Still amazing. I've been to this park every time I visit Dubai. It still looks as it is brand new. Very helpful staff. It's very expensive so take all what you need with you ( towels, slippers and creams) as they are very expensive in the park. Food is not allowed and will be taken from you before you enter. It's better during the summer time although it's more crowded but when we went in December, it was bit chilli although the water was warm but we weren't comfortable...Summer is more fun.

Fab day!. Wild Wadi is the best water park we've ever been to. The slides are amazing and we loved the ingenious way of travelling to the top of them! The floor is mega hot so try to stay in the shade. Flip flops would be the best solution but the have to be removed before going on the slides/lazy river.
Great place for fun in the water. Wild Wadi Water Park is really awesome. not just for kids but parents as well. ideal to spend the entire day here
Good day out. Compact water park with 2 new rides - closing for part of January for maintenance so check website

Fun. Tickets were 200 AED per adult n 150AED per child.opens @ 10am n closes@ 5pm.really had a great time wif my hubby n kids.theres a wave pool,kiddies slides,tube rides for every1 n slides for adults n older kids.my husband enjoyed the fish spa inside.unfortunately u dont get access to jumeirah beach thru wild wadi
Good day out. Good day at the waterpark, not quite as clean as other s I have been too and a little pricey
Wild Wadi with the grandchildren. It was a great day, the rides kept us busy and the fish that eats dead skin of your legs relaxed us ready for the homeward trip

Limited... but fun. It is pretty easy to complain about how the park is too small and it is a good point. There are only a handful or rides and once you have done each one a number of times it does start to get a bit tedious.The park itself is clean, safe and the staff are friendly and helpful. There is a decent amount of food options - not particularly great or cheap but decent when compared to other amusement parks.I went during the "winter" so the park wasn't packed and maybe that is why I found the park a bit repetitive - during peak times I would imagine that the queues would be crazy.Overall this was a good experience and it would be really fun if you had kids. I wouldn't go back and do it again - once is enough but I did enjoy it.
The Best. Wild Wadi is a great park. Kids need to be over 1.1 meter to use the rides but new additions to the park have made this the best in dubai.
Great waterpark in a great location. Caters for all ages and a complete days fun for the whole family.

Wild Wadi in the winter. This is a out door water park with a few exiting rides. The best part is the minimum height is 1.1meters hence small kids can enjoy almost all the rides.The tickets are like AED 200 and things are expensive inside, as with all parks. You could bring your own towel (rental is AED25 or so).During winter season the park is not too crowded hence you can cover the park in less than half day.. The water in the wave pool is heated so its good funI think they need to introduce more rides.

Family Fun. Spent the entire day at the park with the family and had a great time. Queues were not overly long - we have stood in longer at our own water parks in Australia, and the facilities all round were good.

Expensive and shabby. Paid full price for 2 adults even though I was pregnant and not allowed on anything (I wouldn't of gone on anything anyway) but there's no discount for none riders.A few rides were also closed for refurbishment so not very much for my husband to go on so we spent most of the day swimming and sunbathing something we could of done at our hotel.Food choices not good either.Wish we had of gone to atlantis Instead

We all had a great time.. It was pretty busy when we visited.It was a bit of a challenge to navigate round the park.The locals hogged the surfing ride.At first it was good to watch them but it quickly became boring as the the queues built as they were taking an age showing off and trying to do tricks.Everyone was cheering when one of them fell.
Nice for a bit of fun. It is nice but not amazing. The fast slide is crazy fast. The ground gets very hot. Don't go in summer.

Great Fun Day Out. Had a great day out at Wild Wadi. The Master Blaster coasters are great fun and I like that you go from one to another without needing to get out of the water. All the staff that help steer you onto the slides are friendly and courteous.Tantrum Alley and the Burj Surj were also great, so much more fun when you can all go down together. I just couldn't pluck up the courage for the Jumeirah Sceirah!There are 3/4 places to eat, all serving the same style of 'fast food' - burgers, chicken nuggets, pizzas, salads and pastas etc. It's very handy to have the wrist strap loaded with money so you needn't worry about your purse.Changing rooms and lockers were adequate, nothing fancy but were being constantly mopped and cleaned whilst we were using them. On a previous visit to Dubai we went to the Atlantis waterpark and it's hard to call between them. Both are definitely worth a visit. They are a great way to spend a day.
fun fun!. you can have fun here no matter how old are you! I recommend it 100% . the staff were fun too. but the photos are very expensive and time consuming!

A Great Water Park for Fun. Go early and space you time out well. There is a lot to see and more to do! You can be bashful or simply relax. Good food and lots of Fun... but you got to let go and enjoy the place! If you dont .... call me! I will show you the fun side of Wild Wadi Water Park!!
best park in dubai. its just park eventhough great selection of food..............................................................

Great fun for the young and young at heart. Not a cheap day out but excellent facilities, great customer service and most importantly a lot of fun.Perhaps not as large or as many "rides" as anticipated and therefore as a practical tip, if you go out of high season and no large crowds as was the case with us then a half day pass may be quite sufficient to enjoy the park.
nice water park. its fun very nice but make sure u go in mid week its disaster in the weekend "sooo crowded" ull have to wait like an hour for every ride

Very busy.... We had already been to Atlantis a couple of days before, and this one just did not compare. It was so busy, queues were long and there were millions of children! Atlantis I think is better for adults. Happy we went to both water parks, worth a visit :)
exciting. A must go place. full of fun. a minimum of 2 hours is needed for it, but more is better!

Nice break for a couple of hours. We enjoyed visiting the park especially the first two days, when it was not crowded and we did the rides for the first time. After two days you have seen it all and it gets a bit repetitive but it is certainly worth a visit. Food was not very nice, with limited choice and not very much taste!

Fantastic. Aquaveture is newer and a bit more fancy, but this original waterpark is in a great location next to Jumeriah Beach Hotel and Burj Al Arab. Also probably better for smaller children and doesn't get too busy, even on National Day.

Great place for family!. Wadi (meaning water) is great for children and child-a-like. i have to admit i enjoyed trying all the slides and all their attractions..plus with a great view of the Burj Al Arab (its perfect)...we went there last March 2011 so the weather is ok. Not too hot and not too cold (if u know what i mean, since Dubai can be ery hot during may-july)... You must take a camera that is waterproof! Pictures are worth to cherish in this place :)

Brilliant location and a good fun way to spend the day. Wild Wadi is brilliantly situated between the Burj Al Arab and Jumeriah Beach hotels so there are some fantastic photo opportunities before you even get in. We decided to spend time there on our last day in Dubai after we had checked out from the hotel.You're given a wristband when you get there which gives you access to your locker but you can also load money onto it which you can then use for food and drink in the day.There were about 8 rides so not that many but they are really good fun. you sit in rubber rings for most of the rides. I really liked Tantrum Alley and the Burj Surj and probably went on them about four or five times. The view of the Burj Al Arab is fantastic at the top of those rides. The queues weren't so bad on the day we went and that was also on the weekend.I personally skipped the Jumeirah Sceirah but my boyfriend did it - it looked terrifying! it is apparently the tallest slide outside of North America. It is actually quite entertaining just watching at the bottom of the slide just to see people's reactions when they get to the bottom - can be very funny.There are plenty of sunbeds if you fancy just taking it easy. there's also a wave pool and they provide life jackets for kids.We spent about four hours at the park and that was probably enough - having said that we didn't eat. It's a great place to take kids (we didn't) or if you need to pass the time in the day after checking out and going off to your flight.

Great fun!. We had loads of fun there! The only drawback was the fact that it took ages to get to some of the slides.We only had approx 3h to spend and it was enough to try most of the interesting slides and then got back to two or three that we liked the most.There are signs and maps on every other corner so it's easy to find your way and the slides are visibly marked with the 'thrill factor', so you can try the less scary one.When you get the pass (something that looks like a watch) make sure you have money for a locker and perhaps some AED for drinks or food if you plan to stay there longer.I haven't try the other Dubai's water park so I have no comparison, but I can really recommend Wild Wadi - both for children and adults.
average, aquaventure is better. Flowrider ques are long and you dont get long on the attraction itself. Rides are not very thrilly apart from the 2 new ones and the jumeirah screirah.
Fun Day. Just a little bit too busy so had to wait alot for the rides. Not family orientated rides for the younger children
Loved It. What a fantsastic water park! Every single slide was good with queues not much of an issue. The man made beach is excellent with a wave machine. This is a must visit!

It is wild!. We believed that Aquaventure at Atlantis was the best Dubai waterpark, but it has to be said that the two new-ish rides at Wild Wadi, literally blow Aqua out of the water. No apologies for the pun.The thrills are amazing. At one point you truly believe you or your friends are going to fly out of the park and end up on Beach Road.The lazy river is cool, as is the big pool with the wave machine. When that thing gets going, you feel like you've done a workout.Much fun for all!
Fun and relaxing. Great place! We enjyoed the slides and the pools, and the closeness to Burj Al Arab is fine.

One of the best waterparks anywhere. We had two fun packed days at Wild Wadi on separate trips to Dubai and will definitely be back someday. This is the kind of park which never gets old, so much classier than the competition. The price is very reasonable and sometimes you will even find discount coupons in hotel lobbies. The whole place is clean, spacious, pleasant to look at, there are enough comfortable sun loungers for everyone, free drinking water, and the food is pretty good compared to the usual theme park fare.Staff are very friendly and helpful and seem to be having a good time which adds to the atmosphere. I especially enjoyed trying the flowrider surf ride where you get a mini surf lesson from staff every time you ride, even volunteering to try the stand up version, and entering the inflatable hoop race on the wave pool.The rides are very good and safe too. There is plenty to keep everyone amused and many of the rides are very re-rideable. The capacity of the rides, especially the masterblasters is quite high, so the queues are never too long.

sore bottom. spend the day in there, you do not pay if you are staying in the jumeriah, as we went in and out loads to do no need to worry about sunburn as there is lots of shelter, travelling up water by jets can get a sore bottom if it hits the wrong place

sore bottom. spend the day in there, you do not pay if you are staying in the jumeriah, as we went in and out loads to do no need to worry about sunburn as there is lots of shelter, travelling up water by jets can get a sore bottom if it hits the wrong place

Up hill water slides?. Our 12 year old Son loved the wild wadi, not too busy when we visited and free for guests of the Jumeira beech hotel. The up hill water slide was fantastic fun for children and adults alike.

Fun in the sun. The thing that sets Wild Wadi apart from other water parks across the globe is the view - where else can you check out the Burj Al Arab as you get shunted up the river on your tube? The two new rides are also great fun.
Great place for the kids. It's expensive, but will keep the kids amused for a few hours

Must Visit. Wild Wadi is a must visit for people visiting Dubai. One can't simply miss it. The thrill rides are amazing and the experience will literally blow your mind. Also the sights and people are amazing, though one can mostly find either westerners or the locals. Regardless it is a fun place to be and you can easily cover 3-4 hours going round. Many opportunities are there for taking photographs esp. with Burj Al Arab as a backdrop.In addition there is a fish spa, ice cream corners and other dineries.Please take note of these points to make your trip more enjoyable:1) Buy a Suntan lotion, if you purchase it from inside it is relatively more expensive.2) Do not carry any food or drink; its not allowed inside and they check in the entry gates3)Keep spare set of clothes and towels4)In the entry gate or even inside, you can convert your paperback currency into magnetic credits stored in your arm band; this can be useful as you won't have to carry around your money and risk getting it wet. Keep atleast around AED 100-150, to help you move around. Rest of your wallet or money can be kept in the lockers.5)If you are allergic to the sun, or don't like water in your eyes...make sure you are adequately covered with a swim suit and googles. Only get good quality slippery swim suit as other relatively dry fabrics can impede you during water slides and are usually not safe. In most rides you won't even be allowed in such cases.6)Goes without saying, but do not let go of children. It is still a place with lot of pools and it may not be safe although they have an impressive amount of safety protocols in place and more than enough professional life guards.7)Try to rent a large locker instead of a small one, though it will mainly depend on the amount of things you need to store.8)If you are a heart patient or prone to vertigo...please get a clearance from your doctor. Try to avoid most free fall rides9) Keep your loose things tied with your wrist (I lost a very expensive pair of polarised sunglasses while swimming). If you lose anything make sure you immediately report it to the lost and found.10) Keep 4 hours in hand, to have a total and complete fun
Fantastic. Worth every penny! Great fun and excellent slides especially the Tantrum...

Amazing day as long as it's not too busy. The rides at Wild Wadi just about beat the ones at Aquaventure (the other waterpark in Dubai at Atlantis). There are 2 new rides that are really quite amazing and innovative! There are a few negative points, like the queues on the surf rides are always at least half an hour long and the queue for the fastest ride (Jumeriah Scarer or something) can get very very long (an hour or more) later in the day. Overall though it's a great day and one of the best waterparks in the world!

Only whe for free. We were able to enter Wild Wadi for free because it's included in the Burj al Arab package. If for free: go inside, make the 3 best rides & leave to the beach. In case you've to pay approx. € 50,00 to enter... don't go. It's a bit like a bad copy of Disney water parks.

What A Ride, Great Fun. We went here whilst we were on holidays in Dubai in Feb 2010, my girls and husband loved it. There are so many water rides it's amazing gets the adrenaline going. Some rides we were not game to try but great to watch others doing them. It got quite crowded later on in the day, a little wait for some of the water rides. Food is good and area's are clean and shaded. If you walk to the top it's a great view of Burj Al Arab. It's a wonderful exhausting fun day at Wild Wadi Waterpark.

What a Water Park. I would say this is the best water park I have been to so far. I just wish I hadn't been on my own. If I wanted to address anything I would not charge for lockers as i think that is a bit cheeky.

Great fun!. I compared based on lots of internet resources and the advice of the hotel which of the 3 parks to choose (I understood besides Wild Wadi there is the Atlantic, and one more park further outside), and the decision for Wild Wadi was very good. It was my first Water Part in this size, and we were impressed. Besides nice attractions for all ages (The whole family enjoyed everything! - and there are still attractions to explore next time) and reasonable waiting times (max 15-20 minutes), the park was clean, staff was friendly, and even the (fast) food was really ok for such a park and the amount of people. Price seems to be ok for a day of fun.We'll go again next time!

Best water park in Dubai. Loved the lay out of the park - easy access to rides, toilets and the new rides are fab. This place is so much better than the hyped up Atlantis park.If you ae looking for the best water park experience in Dubai - this is the place to visit.

Arabia n water park them. visiting Dubai means visiting Arabian culture and it is great to have fun with lots of slides and water actions during the summer or most of the year ,remember to bring your sun lotion because Dubai sun is very strong in the summer

Great Park wish they would open one in Abu Dhabi!. This waterpark is well designed and built and could give Disney a run for it's money. I went on Friday and it wasn't too busy with minimal to no waits. The food for a park was well priced and was great quality.

Very helpful and polite staff. I should say that the most impressive things there were well organization and very helpful and polite staff. Whenever you need help there was somebody to help you and answer your question and the security and safety were so good. The guards were keeping watch for everything without bothering anybody. The park can be even better if they could add a couple of more rides to it but I think there is no more room available there.

Real fun for all ages !. The best water park in Dubai. It's a real fun with a number of rides/lazy river. The wave pool is a fantastic. Lots of fun for all ages . Good health and safety controls with plenty of guides and friendly staff.Not to be missed if going to Dubai. It is offered complimentary if staying at Jumeirah Beach or Mina al Sallam.

Great day in the sun. Had a really fun day. Loved the music that played throughout the entire park. Tantrum Alley and Burj Surg were the best rides. All the slides (except the really big one) use inflatable tubes to go on (provided). Expected some rides to not use tubes but that's okay. Expected a larger variety of rides. There are really only about 7 different rides just a couple of them are a long series of connecting slides. Overall had a good day. Check your hotel for a coupon as we go 30 dirhams off from our hotel.

Great day out!. Many visits over the years to Wild Wadi. Our 4 kids just love this place and there is something for kids of all ages. I would suggest looking online for discounts as it can be expensive. Food inside the park is passable but not special. Better to go in the November to March time frame as it is a bit cold for the locals! It is a big park though so even a good place to go as the weather gets warmer. Arrive early if you want a nice spot and a lounger. Don't forget your sunscreen and hats for everyone. The number of absolutely roasted tourists I have seen at this place is frightening! Kids will burn like crazy getting in and out of the water.
Wild, Wild, Wild!. What a lovely day, and what attractions too! Best in Dubai!

Pure Fun. After 5 years I did go again to Wild Wadi while visiting Dubai. This is pure fun. Unfortunately a bit packed even though it was Wednesday but prior to public holiday weekend. So even vacation and long weekend. Queuing went smoothly anyway and then you can also watch other people which can be fun too. The best is Tantum Alley...real kick and so much fun. We went a few times in row because it was so much fun. the river is nice...a bit of bruises afterwards but great. lifeguards in pools are very nice, friendly and polite. around 5pm the speed/power of the river increased, probably as kids have left. Closing is around 6pm, when the sun goes down. could be open longer as it would be fun at night too...changing rooms are way too cold, not many showers and very crowded especially when closing is near. you can charge money to your bracelet, which makes it easy to leave your valuables locked in the changing rooms. food is average fast food, but the pizza we had was actually quite nice. chairs were occupied but if you know that there are few corners which are less crowded you are fine. few on the burj al arab is cool. i would recommend it, but not for first dubai visitors. and would always prefer wild wadi to the aquaventure, as i am not sure if the aquaventure is really good for the animals and fish in the tanks.

Go early and miss the crowds. We went on the rides and left as it was becoming busy and we had no wish to queue. We also wanted to eat something better than what was on offer. We preferred the comfort of our own hotel and looked forward to lunch and comfortable sun loungers.Good for kids but not that exhilarating. We arrived early and left by lunch-time.

Great day out for all. Took the gran kids there for the day, they had a fantastic day, it's not cheap for a whole family, but look on the Internet or local information site for special offers, we got a 2 for 1 offer
Brilliantly Brilliant. You jus can't miss it.. Don't wait at the entry hesitating to pay the high price, its more than worth inside!! Must-visit!!

Perfect Recreation from the lunacy of Dubai!!!. For all prospective visitors.....don't hesitate and put this on your schedule. I could write loads about this fantastic attraction....but you really need to experience it yourself!Great idea to 'load' credits on a wristbands...saves carrying around cash.
great water escape. take a few hours to spend on this water park, it's a great adventure
Great place for KIDz!. If You want to rest from Dubai heat and You have Kids, it is Best way to spend one of sunny days riding on waves and enjoy the sun!

Wild Wadi. Well, this was part of my stay in the Burj. I had a wonderful time, but on one of the rides where you are jetted around in these rings in a water course I kept getting my buttocks grated on ridges in the course. I could not stop laughing though! Amazing bruises a few days later!!!
fun!. It was a fun day here with the family - i'd like to go back !
Water Splash!. brilliant for adults and kids. it has a massive water slide. great fun for all, even my 2 year old was provided with a life vest.

enjoy together. the climate is too hot in dubai, so water park is fun. wild wadi water temperature remains as it is convenient for public, so many ride for children and adults dont feel like getting out from here and by the time you are back you feel value for money and full of fun.

Adrenaline rush guaranteed!. Love Wild Wadi, try to head there for a half day everytime I'm in Dubai. We stayed at the Al Qasr. The first day we went it was crazy busy, the rides we wanted to go on had a very long wait so we spent most of the time in the wave pool, that was fairly full too but we still had lots of fun. As we were leaving the resort the staff at the exit gates/towel drop asked us if we were residents & seeing as we were, they suggested we arrive the next morning at 9:30 as the park is open to guests of the nearby hotels solely until it opens to the general public at 10:00.We followed their advice & had a relatively deserted water park for almost an hour, we got to do loads of rides with no queues. The staff even cared for my younger daughter while we went on a twin doughnut ride. Great fun, great staff, loads of laughs! Guaranteed!

Amazing!. Where else can you get in watersides that can take you 15mins to get to the end!!!Wild wadi is an incredible waterpark. Everything you could want... Regular watersides, inflatable watersides, lazy river, wave pool, death slides, and sun loungers, surf machines!!Really enjoyable day out and prob better than Atlantis. If you fo get straight on to the super exciting ones.Enjoy.

Great fun for Kids and Adults. Fantastic water park, not many rides, but the ones there can be repeated and are still fun each time! If you're checked into the Jumeirah Beach Hotel you get free access and you're let into the park 30 mins before the public are let in!

Great but do it early in the day. Fantastic fun. We stayed at the JUm Beach hotel so it was inclusive. That meant we went in as soon as it opens at 10am and did 6 or 7 rides in an hour an half with small queues. We did that for 4 days out of the week we were there so the . Friday and Saturday are the busienst times for obvious reasons. Afternnons means queues so you have been warned. Clean well worth a visit or 4 if you're staying in the hotels next to it. Oh and it is SO much better that Atlantis which is mainly floating around in tubes.

Wild rides. Fantastic day at the water theme park. all types of rides from the gentle to the most daring. My family had a very good time. Only sour point was one of the security guards who insisted that my shorts were not of approved material (!) and that i had to cut out the two buttons of my hip pocket. He is probably right as per some rule hidden in his rule book but i wish such rules were displayed prominently in their web page.

A little dated at parts... We went with 6 adults and 5 children between 7 and 11. The kids loved it and most adults enjoyed it. First time we went is about 11 years ago. Some parts of the park are a little dated but in general it is in good shape! They are offering the fish spa.. Very funny feeling when these fish nibble all the dry skin off your legs and feet. If u interested eat first cause for every big meal u receive a 30% discount voucher for the fishspa!! The food they could improve!! All very greasy...and unhealthy! Other than that a good place for a day out with the family!!
Fun for all. You are never too old to enjoy the rides, atmosphere and attractions at this waterpark.
Best water park.... ...and we've been to plenty. Very clean, loads of beds, space and excellent rides. Don't miss it.

A must. This is a must for all families. Can be a bit expensive so if you can take your own towels that can help. Also buy the entertainer books. These have buy one get one free vouchers in. A family of 4 can save 400AED which is ove rthe cost of teh books (320AED)
Good for all ages. Alot smaller than Atlantis but also much cheaper. The rides are quite good and on a few of them you can ride the tube with up to 5 of you which is lovely with the children.

Even though.... My friend and I had the opportunity of visiting Wild Wadi Water Park yesterday, which coincidentally was the first day of Eid. Before going I called them up to see if I could use the Entertainer. A lovely lady by the name of Margery assured me that even though it was a public holiday we could use the voucher. Since it was our first time we never knew what to expect. We arrived around 11.50am and saw people everywhere! But rather quickly a South African gentleman showed us where to queue. The queue was LONG! However it moved relatively quickly. The cashier was very kind and helpful and welcomed us to Wild Wadi with a smile. After we got inside my locker wouldn't work and again right by our side was someone to help. I got my locker sorted and almost in a flash my old locker had a sticker on it saying "out of order". Let me start with the negatives. The locker rooms are freezing! Maybe turn the AC off during the winter? The park is very confusing when you arrive, but once you get used to it you're on your way. And lastly there was a man by the name of Prashad by the exit of the Tantrum and the Burj Surge around 13.40pm who was very rude with us. Even though we had these small problems, which I am sure do not happen often our experience was amazing! A very special thank you to Esther who was at the kitchen( the one as you walk in by the souq) during lunch and helped me out with some vinegar. And to all the team working on the section of blaster rides that afternoon. YOU ARE AMAZING! And because of you we will definitely be coming back for more!! P.s We have video's of you which are coming soon! Thank you!!!!! :)

Thank you Christopher Perry, GM of wild wadi for your great care. Today, Chris went out of his way to help me and my family! After having a medical emergency on the beach outside wild wadi, Chris personally escorted my two kids and took care of them. A wild wadi touch of quality and care! Inside, all kids are family and are taken care of and secured! Th next time u go to wild wadi, just remember u r in safe hands. It is not just the fun inside, but also the security and safety. I didn't recognize Chris until after I left and don't believe I will have the chance of meeting him again, just want to drop my thank you for him and his great team.Keep up the great work!
The boys had a great time. The new rides got a big thumbs up and a very enjoyable 4 hours

great fun and escape the heat. had a great day out here. it can take a while to reach if you're hotel isn't located nearby. cost was a little high....but it is dubai after all. they are very strict about eating outside food in the park which is a little over the top. they just want you to buy their overpriced food and drink. otherwise, the rides were fine and you can quite easily spend 3-4 hours here. not quite a full day though. avoid the weekends and school holidays.
massive hydrocoster. the hydrocoster feels like everlong, the double tubes are heaps of fun,a bit overcrowed so dont go on weekends!

Great fun - even if you don't like the big, fast slides. We were told this was an older and smaller water park than Aquaventure. It seemed more cramped and a little tired in places. The food wasn't very good. However, for someone who doesn't like the fast rides this is an excellent place to spend a day. The upward slide is brilliant fun and very sociable. There are some great views from the platforms for the highest slides - a great place to take photos at the end of the day.

An Amazing Day Out. It ws fantastic to relive my childhood and hurtle up and down the amazing slides. We had the best time ever. Only downside is its very very expensive to get in, there werent enough sunbeds and we almost could not find one at all. The food was v expensive and you werent allowed to take your own food and drink in
Day at waterpark. This is a good day out and free if you stay at the Jumeriah beach hotel so quite a saving. The kids loved it

Enjoyment redefined. The half-day at Wild Wadi water park was probably the most fun thing that I could ever have thought of doing. All the rides and slides are fantastic. It was, as ever, a hot day so there was nothing better to do. I would certainly recommend this place to anybody who doesn't mind a spash! However, I don't know how Aquaventure would stack up against this one, because I didn't go there-it might have even turned out to be better, but I don't mind. I wish I could have stayed longer, and gone on the Jumeirah Sceira!

Good time with your family. A lot of activities including pool with waves. Be careful about the sun by wearing protective clothes which you can by in the shops inside the park. There are a lot of food but of a very low quality unfortunately. Sunbeds are free only in the early morning, after 11:00 it is a problem to find one. Towels are also available for 25 dirhams. Overall good experience for children, stunning views.
Very Nice. Its a great day out, for kids as well as adults. Try it !
Cool and Refreshing ! !. Wonderful, Cool and relaxing day out with lots of fun in the water !
Brilliant. the 2 new rides were a great addition since we last visited.Staff very attentive and lifeguards join in with the small children in their area.Great day out.
Fantastic Time. As a family we loved this place, plenty to do. Very easy to access, use bracelets rather than having to carry money. Would return.
Don't visit on weekends. And remember that weekends are Friday and Saturday.
average but not really worth the money. not as many water slides as i would have liked apart from that its was ok
Exciting and Fun. We took our four year old to the Water Park, he loved the different slides he could go on and the pools to visit. There was some amusing incidents watching people learn to surf!!

Good day out. Liked the water slides, not having to walk up loads of stairs as they shoot you up on a rubber tube by water jets.
Didnt like the £40 entry fee and expensive food

Wild Wadi. well worth a visit,used the Entertainer coupon to get BOGOF,can put money on wristband so don't need to worry about having cash,very long queues for a taxi when it closed so walked to Jumeirah Beach Hotel were queue was alot smaller

Worlds laziest and one of the most fun Water PARKS!!!. Dubai’s 21st century water park is AMAZING…… Get this; you don’t need to walk up the mountain carrying your rubber ring……….. NO….. Powerful jets push you and your ring up to the top of the ride! ONLY IN DUBAI!
Loads of rides for all ages..... My favourite is the wave rider where you can surf on a manmade wave!
Wild Wadi. Me? Can't stand water parks and this isn't for me BUT my 17 & 16 year old boys love this park . . . . . 'nuff said?

Awesome waterpark in sunny Dubai with view of Burg Al Arab. Great waterpark with kids saying 'awesome' all day! Scary Screirah slide worth a go but wave pool, slides ESP whilepool all not too scary, the surf simulators look great but not easy so be prepared to embarrass yourself by wiping out big time in front of the public. A must do in Dubai
Great Fun!. How to entertain a 9 year old! Am sure that our son grew gills during a recent holiday in Dubai - Wild Wadi is something that we're sure he'll remember for a long time - brilliant fun!

Great for fun!. Wasn't too busy and the queues seemed to go pretty quickly. Get there right from the beginning as then the queues are a lot smaller. Lots of fun rides and something for everyone, including a fish pool for your feet! Reasonably priced considering you can spend all day there.

Fun waterpark. This waterpark has a few good rides but is definitely a good day out. The food is reaonably priced and when we went the lines weren't too long.We did owever get lost and couldn't find a few of the rides but as it is only a small park it didn't take long to walk around. We were deciding all holiday between this one or atlantis and were quite happy with our decision

good fun. spent a day here recently and had good fun, we had loungers by the wave pool and had a great view of the burj al arab. rides were good but we thought that atlantis was better as we liked the rides there better.food was fresh and a decent price.avoid wknds as the park will be very busyif anyone is visiting Dubai they should by the Entertainer, has hundreds of 2 for 1 vouchers in it and both atlantis and wild wadi are included so you save alot, book costs about £80 i think but if you onl use it twice you will be quids in!!

Excellent water park, but very crowded. Excellent water park, but very crowded, and easily will get lost there. But we really enjoyed it.Be careful of sun burns and wear a t-shirt to cover your shoulders and use sunblocks.
Good, clean fun. Quite simply, for a couple in the midst of middle age we spent a day here and had a great time. As my wife would say, 'good, clean fun' - a must for anyone coming to Dubai.

Great experience, excellent staff, very clean but a tad pricey if you're not a thrill-seeker. We decided to visit Wild Wadi as opposed to Aquaventure at Atlantis, and I think we made the right decision.Wild Wadi is visually VERY impressive with prehistoric-style landscape and flanked by the Jumeriah Beach Hotel and The Burj. The resort is scrupulously clean and all ALL staff were friendly, attentive and professional - such a welcome change from the "grunts" that staff in many UK attractions communicate with! There were plenty of options for food with a few more healthy options as well, although a few more fresh food/fruit options would have been great. Food wasn't badly priced and the melon from Sinbad's was delicious.We went with our 3yr old and did feel that there could be a more for the very little ones (who still have to pay to get in so should be catered for). The river rides were good (as long as you avoided the waterfall) as was the wave pool but the pirate ship was deceiving. At first glance it seems very child friendly...but every few minutes an enormous deluge of water engulfs the entire structure and is really quite terrifying for a little one. It would be nice to see a small area dedicated to younger children who love the water but have not yet got the confidence to be dunked/drenched/soaked!We felt it was a bit pricey (partic when you add on the cost of hiring towels and lockers) although maybe it would be better value for adults/older children able to enjoy the more intense rides. Overall, don't be put off - it was a great experience and I'm sure we will go again when we are next in Dubai.

brilliant slides using rubber rings. wave machine to body surf on quese get big so get there early and do this first. most slides are for use with rubber rings and they mostly lead in to one so less queing. far better value than atlantis
water fun. great fun and very enjoyable for both adults and kids. the only negative is that theres no real place to keep your towels as the entrance to most rides is not the same place as the exit!
still Dubai's premier water park. The two new rides make this number one. Great to spend a day with the family and something for all ages. We never get bored of the rides. Excellent!

Fantastic experience each time!. There are two water parks in Dubai and I have been to both twice. Aquaventure at Atlantis and Wild Wadi near the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. They are both excellent and offer slightly different experiences.In my opinion Wild Wadi has a slight edge over Aquaventure as it seems easier to navigate around and the rides are fantastic. I also find Wild Wadi offers slightly more as it has a wave pool and an area for body boarding.One more thing Wild Wadi has is an area where fish nibble on your toes - a strangely lovely experience.The new rides are a great addition to an already superior water park!Well done and we will be back!

Tantrum Ali. Aside from the crowd - Tantrum Ali is a great ride! the food is also very reasonable for adults and kids. it will be great if hours are extended on certain days to accommodate tourists who are busy during the day and would like to have fun in Wild Wadi after 7 PM :) only a thought....

A lot of fun. Wild Wadi is the best out of the lot in the UAE. Staff are extremely friendly and very helpful, the location is prime, the rate is acceptable, the food/juices offered on site is of good standard. The rides are real fun.

It don't get better than this. Walking around in 36 degree heat then diving into cooling water surrounded by plenty of pleasant and professional staff on enough fun and enjoyable rides, is the best way to spend a day, and thats what I got, at Wild Wadi World. Then I got hungry and ate delicious but well priced food, until some fishies ate my legs!! What a day. If it were in Sydney, I would be there daily.

Great place for families. Must do in dubai, it does not matter if you are in your honney moon, traveling with friends ore with your family this place has activiiee for all ages and you can gave a alot of funIf I had to focus this to a certain group of people I with go with families first but you can have a great time no matter who you go with Overall a must do in dubai
Hilarious!. Haven't had so much fun for ages. This water park is not huge but the rides are fantastic. We went on Oct 12th and we did not have to queue more than 5 mins for any ride.

Water park fun in amongst amazing hotel views. Wild Wadi is a must do for 2 to 3 hours in Dubai. It is a small park compared to Atlantis but is well laid out and packs in plenty to do. I have been twice with friends over the last few weeks and the lesson learnt is go weekdays (Sun to Thurs) if you can and avoid the queues. There are two new large tire rides which are great fun and a good combination of excitement and cruising. Healthy food options exist - the watermelon a refreshing treat. Kids and big kids all loved it.

Fun for a few hours. Just got back. Went there at 10:30 on a Monday morning so there were no queues. By 1pm queues were about 15 minutes and there were holdups due the stuck people.The central setup of a bunch of slides connected by uphill water jets and rivers is good. Some jets are great - pull your feet up to the tube to spin around. Many slides were ho-hum though. At the end of the sequence, you're dumped in the lazy river and it can take 5 minutes just to get to the first opportunity to get out (even if you go all the way around the river, you have to get out to rejoin the queue anyway). The big multiperson rides are tamer than similar ones elsewhere but last longer. The big jumeirah sceirah is also tamer than big slides elsewhere. Wave pool also tame. There are a couple of free flowriders though but queues can be long.There were plenty of footpath misters and shade so I got around without thongs or a shirt no problem (note that you can wear a shirt on all but the biggest ride). Extras were expensive but I hardly got anything. Note that there are always discount around that you should look for - I got one with my ticket to the aquarium in Dubai Mall.I can compare it to others in the UAE or in America but compared to Australian waterparks, it's slightly inferior - better in some ways but seriously deficient in thrill rides - despite costing the same. Worth doing in the heat of a Dubai weekday though.

Amazing place, great fun in Dubai!. I'm not really the type of guy that goes to water parks so I have to say it was something new for me. I had great fun and experiencing the fastest slide in the world made me had an unforgettable moment.I went alone but still had great time as there is a lot to do. The view of Burj Al Arab is breathtaking from the top of the slide tower.

AL RAIS GROUP ENJOYED AT WILD WADI. This was a great get together with all my friends I have been in UAE for almost 5 years but I have visited wild wadi first time with all my colleagues. There are many rides like tantrum alley,jumeirah sceirah,master blasters,burj surj. The best ride i liked was tantrum alley and jumeriah sceirah. And the best you can also enjoyed the waves that is fantastic . I suggest to all that one should visit once to wild wadi

The constant improvement of facilities make this one of the best destinations for the family. Living in Dubai, my children constantly want to vist Wild Wadi above all the other parks, In recent visits I have noticed a vast improvement in staff attitudes and catering facilities. It makes a huge differance, and value for money I feel it is the best water park in the region. Just keep investing in friendly , knowlegeble staff and it will get better

best place to go for young children. Actually this is a very attractive place to visit and enjoy you and your children where you can find very nice water park ,swiming. Pools ,very clean water and very safe place for children to practice swimming under full and continuous. SupervisionWe will repeat this visit soon .
reaaaaaaally nice one :-). in that hot weather of Dubai, this is one of the best places to go and you will really enjoy it ;-)
Great day out to get away from heat. Excellent value day out in Dubai - 180 Dirhams for a park full of great flumes, from single rider to four person rides, there's really an option for everyone.

Large and comfortable. We visited many waterparks over World, but this one is really great! Many attractions there,good price, good and quickly food corner,shops with many things wchich you dont need but children must have now :-) Staff at fruit corner very friendly. We were at Children Castle area, near wave lagoon, our son very happy there and Lifeguard staff is really everytime ready help and VERY attention to children especially!
The Best in the Region. Big & vary. enjoyment is indeed. staff are friendly. do not miss all the rides.

loved it large :-). went to wild wadi in ramadam, was quite busy queues was about 10 - 15 minutes max! my dad went on flowrider which is a surf simulator and very fun. there is a good wave pool which is great for the family. Tantrum Alley is awesom and went on it so many times i lost count, its a great thrill ride. Burj surj is a great family ride as well its alot of fun. The water is chilled so you are not too hot through the summer months.well worth the visit will be back :-)

Ok rides but I won't be back! Read this if you are going with your wife or sister. The rides are ok but a bit over rated the main problem with wild wadi is it's demographics- 90% men at least which means as a women you are constantly stared at by the local men. We deliberAtely did not go on Friday as apparently it's even worse with the men although I find that hard to imagine after my experience today. I decided to go in the lazy river while my husband lay in the sun- big mistake! I was targeted by a group of about 8 local men on a stretch where there are no life guards who thought it appropriate to surround me and touch me I jumped off the ring and tried to get out the river but they were all groping me and laughing. I shouted at them to stop but they didn't and lucky for me an American visitor came to my rescue and safely escorted me out of the river. When I got back to my husband I burst into tears I was so upset that this had happened. I get that they may stare at you even though I still don't think that appropriate but groping you is stepping way over the line. if you are male go I am sure you will have fun but if you are a decent female- forget it. Such a shame as JBH is lovely and I have enjoyed a few dinners there but not sure I will even go back to the hotel after this. I have been to Atlantis several times and never had any problems. Overall Atlantis is better suited to a mixed crowd

Loved it!. A great water park, great rides, well organized - well suited to families with children of all ages - my 2 year old and 10 year old loved it - and the cool waters of the wave pool were perfect on a scorching hot August day.You can put money on wristbands so no need to carry cash, and suggest buying the drinks bottles for 35 dirhams, and then only 5 dhs for refills - you will drink a lot in the hot Dubai weather, and makes a nice souvenir to take away. Food is decent, suggest the BBQ kiosk, very nice - prices a little steep, but average for Dubai.Difficult to chose a favourite between this and Atlantis Aquaventure, but the tube ride up to the slides is a definite bonus for Wild Wadi, and think overall this park is better for older children and adults.

Aquaventure at Atlantis is more family friendly but an overall pleasnt experience at Wild Wadi Park. We are a family of four, including a 3 and 5 year old. We had already tried Aquaventure at Atlantis Dubai a few months back, so on our next getaway to Dubai we thought we'd try out Wild Wadi. Overall it was a fun experience and we stayed 7 hours. But compared to Aquaventure it doesnt measure up. Hands-down Aquaventure is more family-friendly for people with young children than Wild Wadi is. If you have small children that are shorter than 1.1 metres, I would highly recommend you go to Aquaventure than WW because it has more rides that are family-friendly. At Wild Wadi the only spots/rides we could use was Juha’s Dhow and Lagoon, Juha's Journey (like a lazy ride, not very exciting) and the Flood River (which was kinda boring coz it wasnt very long indeed). At Aquaventure you have a kids water play area and lagoon area like in WW, but there are numerous other floating rides you can take including some similiar to white water rafting (mild) that the children could go on. I would recommend that if you have children taller than 1.1 metres, teens etc, Wild Wadi is the place to go because compared to Aquaventure it definitely has more rides and stuff.
