But if your kids are still very little, I would recommend Aquaventure because there are more things to do for the family.On a side note - Aquaventure also has more seats and chairs available than WW. Things are also more spaced out in WW, so you gotta walk a lot. The water is 'cleaner' at Aquaventure with blue tiles throughout (including the floating rides) so it looks nicer. The tiles in the floating rides at WW were black so it makes the water looking dirty and murky.Tips: DONT go during a public holiday (like we did) coz the place is PACKED!!!! It almost ruined the experience because you have hoardes of stupid people doing stupid things, like running around the sides when your little ones are sitting their innocently splashing about. My son almost got ran into by a stupid hoon chasing his friend who didnt see my sun sitting there :(Overall a great experience but because my kids are still little, I wouldnt go again until they were much older. Aquaventure is more suited to our tastes and needs :)
All day fun for all. Regretted that we did not visit more oftenfantastic day out
I love it. nice place to have fun with your friends or your children under the hot sun in dubai :)

Not bad. Wild Wadi is located beside the Jumeriah Beach Hotel and in front of the Burj Al Arab and is very easy to get to. There are numerous rides and attractions and some were better than others. The setting of Wild Wadi is marvelous. Two things disappointed me firstly it was just to hot ,45c in the direct sun and surprisingly considering the heat the place was packed and there were just to many people there and you had to queue for almost every ride.I would go back, but in the cooler months and when it is not so busy.

Excellent fun, loads of friendly lifeguards, not cheap!. Really good fun, lots of rides that are quite varied, some very scary, some very gentle. Great lifeguards make you feel safe at all times. Constantly being cleaned so no rubbish left lying around. It is Ramadan at the moment but plenty of food and drink available and almost no queues. Everything floodlit in the evening, very nice. Only downside, very expensive even with a BOGOF voucher and the food inside is not too good, only fast-food and expensive. They search your bags as you go in to stop you taking in your own F&B.

Wonderfull new ride will kill you !!!. Wild wadi is a really good place for having a fun day in Dubai."Tantrum Alley" is really exciting ride and you should try it with 3 other person to experience the maximum speed and enjoyment.Also Jumeirah Sceirah (Water Slide) needed the maximum of your daringYou should try both of them 3~4 times ;)I tried the "Leap of Faith water slide" at Atlantis but I think Jumeirah Sceirah is a little scarier than that.The normal ticket price is 205 AED =56$ Also small locker charge is 25 AED = 6$ --> Always you can find the 30 AED Discount ticket in the lobby of any hotel in DubaiThis is good for group of friends and also families.

You must visit. One of several entertainment places in Dubai... but I do believe you should never miss itStill remember every moment we've spent there "Me, wife & little kid"It contain very nice water games really suitable for all ages and interestingIf you love adventures I think you have to try the high ski, I cannot forget these crazy seconds when I skied from almost 60 Matters with speed 70 KM/hourAlso don't miss to ride waveFor Kids it will be one of the best day you can spend with them in Dubai and almost you will suffer to convince and to go out :)Also the unique location give you great chance to take nice shots as Borj Al-Arab will be your background

Run of the mill. Visiting Wild Wadi was our way of using up the final day of our stay in Dubai. Having visited quite a few water parks in Europe and the USA, I would rate Wild Wadi as distinctly average in terms of the quality and selection of rides.We enjoyed the tyre ride that takes you on quite a long journey up, down and through the park.... the first eight or nine times, but beyond that it inevitably gets tedious and there aren't that many alternative options.Cleanliness also leaves a lot to be desired - tables were left with half eaten food for unacceptably long periods of time and the bottom of some of the pools felt gritty with sand. That's not to mention the large number of band-aid plasters I spotted floating around...Would I go again? Certainly not at full price, which is extremely excessive. Maybe if I had a voucher for BOGOF and even then only if I had nothing else to do.

Great day out!. This is a great water park with amazin views of the Burj Al Arab hotel. Ticket prices are reasonable (approx 205 dirhams per adult). There are money off coupons to be found in the malls though. Park provides a wrist band which you load with money to pay for drinks/food etc whilst in the park and saves you carrying this about. The wrist band also closes and opens your locker. A great day out and I would also say this is slightly better than the water park at the Atlantis - Palm Jumeirah.

Great water park.. Having been to Wild Wadi and Aquaventure, id rate W.W as by far the best. Rides were brilliant, food was average but a lot cheaper than Aquaventure. The electronic wrist band is a great idea. There are life guards everywhere you look which is reassuring. Locker rental is 25dhs for a small locker which is a decent size. Towel rental was 25dhs also. You could leave your belongings on the sun lounger all day and they would be perfectly safe. Overall great day out.
LOVELY WILD WADI. Hello everybody! I visited wild wadi in August! I loved the place and it was fantastic in so much hot! The big pool is like beach and you can have so much fun there!! You must go!

Good Water park. Prefer this water park to Atlantis. The rides are better and there are more shaded areas to sheter from the hot desert sun. One gets some good offers and does not always have to pay full prioce fopr enterance which uis otherwise a little steep.

A wet and wild day at wild wadi!. Our company team spent the afternoon bonding in the water. We loved the chilly wave pool especially with the 40+ degrees C we've been having. The river and rides were all loads of fun! Just do it!

Great fun. We visited here during our stay at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel as it gave you free access to the waterpark. It was my first time visiting here and I thoroughly enjoyed it. It opens at 10am and at that time it is relatively quiet and you dont have to queue for the rides but come early afternoon it starts to get busy so we tended to leave the park and go back later on, you are able to leave the park and return later which was a bonus. You are given a plastic watch to wear which you can put money onto which saves you carrying money around and this gets swiped at the eateries if you wanted drinks or a meal. I would recommend if you have a rip vest that you wear it for the jumeirah scairah as the speed you go down will protect you. The rides were thoroughly enjoyable and I would certainly recommend it to people who visit Dubai as an entertaining day out for families.

All rides open?. Hi we visited wild wadi in oct 09 and we had a good experience. however some of the rides were closed. we are returning at the end of august until sept the 7th. will all of the rides be open this time as we dont want to pay full price for half the park as we did last time?cheers

Average Water Park. Wild Wadi is 1 of 2 water parks in Dubai itself, the other is part of the Atlantis Hotel Complex. For someone who has never experianced a Florida water park I can see that it would be good fun. However if you have been to any of the parks around Orlando be prepared for a disappointment. There are a selection of "adventure slides" and a quite small area for younger chidren to play in. The food outlets are average and expensive. Wild Wadi DO NOT allow guests to take in their own food or drinks including water. It will be taken from you on entry if seen. Additional charges for lockers and towels are levied. TAKE YOUR OWN TOWELS. The wave maker is quite good though again not up to US standards. Because it is the major park in Dubai it is heavily used and long lines can develop for several of the slides. Avoid Friday & Saturday(UAE Weekend) . If you have your own car the hours drive to ICELAND in Ras Al Kahmai is worth it. Keep an eye on the on line discount coupon websites IE Cabone.ae for 50% off offers. Makes ICELAND an even better bet.

Amazing. I went there yesterday with a couple of my friends, and we had a great time, not including the long ques though, we all went and tried the new "intense ride" which everyone loved to bits except for me, i ended up with chest pain, which sadly ruined the rest of the day in wild wadi, Take the warning's on the sign board seriously, or else you'll spend the rest of the day inside the infirmary, Not for the faint of heart!

I choose you over Atlantis. Hi I am only twelve but about 1.5m would I be aloud to do al of the rides even though I'm 12 also I have choose your park over Atlantis due to bad reports about there park and due to videos online im realy looking forward to this visit but I don't wan't to go if I can't do any good rides if you could answer my question I would be very thankful And I have rated you on how u look online

still the best. Its been a few years since i last went here, and i was tied with here or Atlantis, but after much deliberation and many chats with locals who said that Atlantis was not very good, we went.It was good last time, now even better, more rides, plenty to do, just a tip avoid Thursday PM and Friday as this is the locals day off and gets very busyIf you have kids this is the place to be!!!!, and the locals were not wrong - this is better than Atlantis - unless you want to swim with Dolphins

Had a blast! Good rides and good fun!. I had one of my best times in Dubai at Wild Wadi! My mom and I visited on Thursday night which is Ladies' Night in the summer. We are avid fans of thrill seeking rides and this experience did not disappoint. The Master Blaster ring ride was a great surprise as you twist and turn and then promptly plunge into a huge pool that carries you off to the next Master Blaster adventure! Although, I was too scared to try the Jumeriah Scierah, my mom was keen - her only complaint was that it was too short of a ride ;) After catching her breath, we hit the Tantrum Alley ride...our absolute favorite ride at the park. What a blast! My mom and I haven't laughed and screamed so loudly in years...it was great night keeping cool and enjoying the beautiful park and view of Jumeriah Beach Hotel and the Burj.

Good but not much depth. It is a lovely waterpark but there are only 2 or 3 fun rides which get a bit dull after a while and all those slides/flumes get crowded around midday. The jets are easily the best ride and the only other relatively good ride is the jumeirah scarah which is terrible compared to the leap of faith at the atlantas' aquaventure but the good things are there are some stunning views of the burj al Arab hotel looking over the waterpark because it is insanely close to the waterpark and finally if you stay in the burj al Arab, jumeirah beach hotel or in the madinat jumeirah I think you get free access which is great.

Nice waterpark, avoid weekends!. Have been to Wild Wadi and made the mistake of going there on the weekend. Crowded and we had to stand in line for all the nice waterslides, which were blocked with families.Besides this fairly good park though. We had vouchers for a discount, so the price was not too bad - I wouln't pay the full rate though.Good way to spend a hot day.

Most horrific experience of my life.. I have been to wild wadi multiple times by myself and I have to say I always enjoyed it. HOWEVER this was my first time with my four year old daughter and it was one of the most nerve-wrecking, heart wrenching experiences I ever had. I took my daughter to play on the child slides which vary in height. To my surprise I was not allowed to go down with my daughter in front of me, but rather had to let her go down first and then follow her or vice versa. I asked the life guards whether the slides were suitable for her age and each time they all said yes. Against my better judgement I let her try. As we moved on to try another slide (the blue one to be exact), I let my daughter go ahead as her cousin was already at the end of the slide waiting for her. As she slid down she got stuck half the way and she stood up and started to walk in the opposite direction. The lifeguard started to whistle and ask me to tell her to sit and go in the opposite direction. I started shouting at the top of my lungs but the water was so loud that all she could hear where mumbled screams. As she continued to walk in the opposite direction my heart was skipping beats and I was screaming at the top of my lungs but to no avail. Then the thing I dreaded most happend. She burst into tears and started shouting "Im scared, I'm scared" and then she started to look over the edge. Yes! my average sized four year old was able to look over the edge of the slide. I started to feel myself going faint. Now you must think that the lifeguard was taking some kind of action. GUESS WHAT?! she didnt do a single thing. She refused to let me go down, understandably saying that the force of the water can push my daughter down. But then again, why didnt the lifeguard at the end of slide climb up? why wasn't there any emergency protocol followed? why wasn't the water stopped? You must be wondering how the dilema eventually ended. Luckly for me and my four year old who continued to walk in the opposite direction, she reached an area of the slide which was close to the ledge on the floor beneath me where some ladies who had witnessed the horror reached over and pulled her. I hate to think what wouldve happened if they didnt act fast or if, god forbid, they dropped her as they were pulling her over.Beside the complete lack of action or apparent emergency protocol, I would like to post a few questions:1. Why am I not allowed to go down the slide with my child?2. Why arent these slides covered by some kind of arched net so they can be safe and such situations can be avoided.It was only by the grace of God that this passed. However, it reflected complete and utter negligence by the lifeguard and ultimately the park and unfortunately compeltely ruined and otherwise enjoyable experience.

Had a great family time. Playing in water in scorching Dubai heat!? What more can you ask for. And there are some really good rides especially the scary Jumeirah Sceirah which me and my 9 year old son really enjoyed. And we had some great views of the Burj Al Arab, while in queue for Sceirah (so who was complaining about the queues?)Do get your towels and swimwear and your cameras too. But if you don't have one, the shop here stocks everything from swimwear, slippers to towels and other stuff.This is the place where we could really interact with the locals and I found that they are very friendly people. The staff here are mostly outsiders but helpful and nice.We came out all tanned and tired and hit the hotel bed with the satisfaction of a well spent family time.

Hope to go to wild wadi really soon - never been to Dubai!!. Hi allJust have a few questions since I figured everyones really helpful with their tips and comments having read them.My question is about cameras, ive been on youtube and come across some videos of people on the rides filming their experience, id like to take my camera on the ride also is it actually allowed? Also if i got tired of holding it would i be able to put it back in my locker? Your input would be great! Thanks in advance! :)
So Small, Boring and not a good place for adults. so crowded, we had to wait up to 45 minutes in line. For adults, it is a boring place and lack of fun. it is good for childs.

World Class Waterpark. Stayed at JBH so did not have to pay. Overall it was really good particularly liked the burj surge as it was a large ring with 4 adults. We must have weighed 400K so the ride was fantastic.I went evenings and overall it was never that busy even on sat night.its a lot of fun and with the heat nearing 50c it was a great laugh.Make sure you charge up your arm band to spend cash

Crowded and lots of holdups due to machinery breaking down. My family were here on holiday for a couple of weeks and although perhaps not a fair comparsion, as we went to Atlantis Aquaventure on a week day, the two experiences were completely different, Wild Wadi did not quite live up to its advertising as several slides were out of action for at least part of the day. The crowds were unbelieveable and to top it all my partner had his Birkenstock sandals stolen, We reported it to security and within five minutes also witnessed another two people who had also had their flipflops and or sandals taken. If it had been a genuine mistake and they had been taken in error I would have expected a pair to have been found at the end of the day but sadly this was not the case and despite phone calls to security for a couple of days they never turned up. Moral of this little tale, dont wear shoes that you cannot afford to lose so wear the cheapest possible pair. We did have a locker but needed to wear something on our feet to walk between slides as the floor gets so hot even with the little sprays here and there. I would love to know how many pairs of shoes go missing on a daily basis particularly on busy weekend days. Perhaps a bag check on the way out would be worthwhile, I knew of three pairs of missing mens sandals in five minutes, maybe somewhere there is a roaring trade in secondhand foot wear. Final disappointment we were not allowed to take in our cool box containing bottles of water and were then charged 9AED for a small bottle which we were told we could refill with very warm water from the couple of fountains near the shop. Yuk, I had just spent days telling my grandchildren they needed to drink lots of water because of the heat, so come on Wild Wadi management, allow water in, they do at Atlantis. Final whinge, I couldnt find 30 slides, had they gone missing along with the sandals!!!

Too Crowded & Long Ques. We have visited the park on 1st Friday of June 2011, bought whopping expensive tickets for 3 (US$ 56 each approximately), however infants were allowed to enter free. We had fair time but the park was too crowded probably because of weekend. There were very long ques on rides, so we just took the ride once only, though rides are great. I suggest to visit the wildwadi park during weekdays, not on weekends and holidays if you are going with your family. Also note that the food prices are high.. a chicken burger, fries & large cola will cost US$ 11. I think the best place to go is dreamland aqua park .

Still a great Park after all these years!. The water park is located next to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. Most of the rides are quite tame and enjoyable and because they are all linked together, there isn't too much walking involved. Good for all ages and the recently added "family" rides provide an extra stomach churning experience!Great fun.

Its really wadi. Visited wild wadi along with children.Good to float on water and swim.Attractions such as waves, surfing,sking,floating around canal,rain water fall,are worth spending time.Need some good moneyto spend inside for food,tatoos etc;Carry water proof camera,handy cam,swim cloths,towel. Take care to apply good anti fungel creams before dipping in to water to avoid infections.

Fun but expensive. I last visited this water park in 2007. In my visit to Dubai in 2009 we visited the waterpark in Atlantis a lot as we were based there.We returned to the Wild Wadi this year as I had heard it had a few new rides.Our hotel had discount vouchers in the lobby which knocked off about 25% from the entrance price. It is still a hefty outlay for what is no more than a half day attraction.The core ride of interconnecting slides is still the same and there seemed to have been plenty of hold ups at the time of my visit and there was a breakdown as well for a few minutes.The new replacement rides were fun but so were the previous rides. The park was busy, initially we had trouble getting a spare lounger as many people were hoarding them. As the afternoon wore on their were less queues but waiting times were not that long.The kids enjoyed it. Our youngest liked the kids section of the park. Having been to both this and the Atlantis waterpark, there is little to choose between them. Fun but expensive.

Be Sure to Check Out FISHO... And a great way to beat the Dubai Heat!. Spending the afternoon at Wild Wadi is a great way to beat the Dubai heat. The park offers multiple water rides that will meet everyone’s needs. There are rides suitable for all ages and for families and also features a large wave pool. Especially fun was “Flood River”, “Master Blaster”, and “Ring Rides” - a combination of thrilling “rides” and splashes. Jumeirah Sceirah was really exhilarating. It’s best described as a VERY long, sliding board on which you travel super-fast. (The website claims that you travel upwards of 80km per hour.) The wait was kind of long, about an hour; however it was worth it for the opportunity to slide down it once. On most rides you have the option of riding on a single tube or with a partner on a double tube. A few of the rides offer quad tubes as well.For those that are not confident swimmers, life jackets are available all over the park. Additionally, there appear to be lifeguards and attendants around every corner. The park is very well staffed.While at Wild Wadi, I also tried FISHO. The fish spa uses garra ruffa fish (aka “Doctor Fish”) to gently nibble away dead skin from your feet and lower legs. The fish were quite ticklish at the beginning and the sensation was a bit odd. It’s very odd to look down and see multiple fish feasting away at your feet. After my 30 minute session, my feet were definitely smoother. (The treatment was 50AED.)If you plan on spending the day at Wild Wadi, I would suggest that you arrive close to the opening time and choose loungers in a great location. I arrived mid-afternoon and it was difficult to find two loungers together.Lockers are available free of charge. You may also rent towels from customer service. All guests are issued a wrist band upon entrance. When you enter the park, you “load” money onto your wrist band and then you use this to pay for your incidentals throughout the day (i.e. refreshments, souvenirs, etc.) What a great way to avoid soggy money!Overall, Wild Wadi offers great fun for tourists and residents.Additional interesting information: If you stay at the local Jumeirah properties, you will have free access to Wild Wadi. Saturday mornings offer a few hours of “family only” time at the park. Thursday evenings are ladies only.

An excellent day out for the family, especially in the hot weather. We had a great day here after it was recommended by a taxi driver. My kids loved the wrist bands as it gave them independance to spend thier own/our money. I found the staff were all friendly always smiling and looked liked they enjoyed thier work. The restaurant staff especially Ally Babas were a delight and the food was excellent. The queues for the rides were not too long that you would get bored and there was enough to do all day. I especially liked relaxing in the wild river

Wild Wadi - Get Wet and Wild with the whole family!. Great place to spend the summer with the whole family. Variety of activities open for different adrenaline rush. Kids won't have a dull moment as the choices of pool and playground are next to each other.Only thing I would like to comment is that the park does not have cold deck resulting in burning of feet of most guests - including me! They might think about it in their next Capex. Lifeguards are animated and staff in public area are accommodating. Food and Beverage peeps should smile more.Great experience and cool new rides!
Excellent value for money. It was not on my to do list but we just decided to go while we were there.Great value for money,amazing place.

Good Value for Money for a family with older kids. My husband and I are in our forties and went with two teens (12 yo girl and 14 yo boy).We didn't get to the park until about 1pm due to other commitments and expected that we'd be bored within a couple of hours.Thanks to the glorious weather and the interesting set up, particularly the slides which you ride uphill, we were still there at closing time at 7pm.If there was one part that was a bit disappointing it was the food. We saw a BBQ operating when we got there at 1pm, and decided to go back and BBQ chicken kebab and burgers for lunch when hungry. Unfortunately when we were ready to eat it was nearly 3.30pm and the BBQ shop was closed and we ended up stuck with pizza and chicken nuggets instead. The food was ok, but not what we had intended to eat.We weren't allowed to bring any of our own food in, even water bottles. There were a couple of bubblers around to have a drink of water if needed.The really cool thing I liked was the wristbands used for entry. These could be loaded up with a cash value to purchase items in the park like towel and locker hire, food and drinks. This meant we didn't have to carry money around with us all day. The amount put on the wristband which was left over at the end of the day was fully refunded at the shop.All in all a fun experience with good facilities which would satisfy for at least a few hours. Probably most suitable for adults or families with older kids, although there appeared to be areas suitable for water play for younger kids too.

1st Birthday celebration.. SUPERB/TERRIFIC/A MUST FOR ALL PARENTS... My wife and I have been looking past 6 months for ideal 1st birthday celebration and service for us and our guests.. WILD WADI!!! was perfect! The service! The staff! Sales Team! From day one you are taken care of until the big DAY!! Had over 30 guests and all were taken care from start to finish. Two staff from wild wadi with us from start of day from decoring the place till all guests left and assisted us back to the cars with all gifts etc. I highly recommend anyone for birthday celebrations make sure it is WILD WADI!! IN MY BOOKS - WILD WADI IS THE NO.1 VENUE FOR BIRTHDAY PARTIES.. THANK YOU SOO MUCH FOR MAKING MY TWIN SONS 1ST BIRTHDAY AND OURS MOST MEMORABLE FOREVER!!!

Excellent day out. This was one of the top items in my to do list while in Dubai. I had been in Dubai a bit over week waiting for a clear day and finally got it.Arrived at 11:30am on a Monday. Never thought it was too busy for a theme park. I've waited longer at parks in the USA. Food seemed to be well over priced compared to what food normally costs in Dubai but when I converted to Australian dollars, it worked out quite cheap.Same deal with the photos they take of you. A tip for the company, DigiPhoto, I know you're in this to make money, it's a business, I get it but please come into the 21st century! I could not get a digital copy of my photo. The only option they offered for this was something like 22 pics and a video on DVD for 600 AED. Dreaming!More options for different sized photos as well. Tourists do not want to always cart around 8x10s with them.The rides were all great and the staff were very friendly.Some warning for the Jumeirah Sceirah: if you are a big fellow, weight or height, you will have some big momentum going on, the last dip will feel like you're airborne. If you're wearing a rashie, tuck it in to protect you're backside. Not much you can do to lose your pants up you're crack though!

Enjoyable afternoon out. I visited Wild Wadi with my wife following recommendations from friends.The main attraction is the tube ride that shoots you uphill before descending back down. Due to its multiple branches, this is marketed as being 11(?) rides which is a little misleading. But it is good fun and lasts 15 minutes or so. There is also a tall speed slide which is fast but not the best I've been on...prepare for a long queue! There is also a double slide that you go down in big 4 person dinghies...again good fun and there is an "extreme" slide that we didn't try. On top of these there is a wave pool, surfing simulators and a lazy river.Overall I would recommend it. The rides are fun and innovative and the place is pretty well run. On the negative side it is expensive (almost 100 GBP for 2 people with locker hire, towels and lunch) and there are only really 3 different rides.

Good fun when no queues. Hadn't been to a water park for 10 years and must say I expected more. Having said that the wife and I had a good laugh for 90 mins as we left the kids back in England. The new rides are fun, although I expect it would be hell queueing in summer (we were there in January when there were no queues at all!).

I was really looking forward to it..... ....but was really dissapointed at the end.The rides were too short with the exception of the tube ride one that goes all around the park! We went on that ride 3 times just to try and kill time. We got there around 10am and we had done all the rides by 11.30am!! We tried to go seconds but at that stage the crowd had built up and the queues were long. The tube rides would have been better with my partner, but they insisted everyone to go on the single tubes! What’s the point of having a 2 person tube?I swear, I was going to strangle the life guards with the whistle! They blew it for every little thing you did. If you want to relax and chill by the beach pool, you won’t get that because of the annoying whistle. Seriously, you sneeze, they blow the whistle. You splash water around, they blow the whistle! You couldn’t even laugh out loud without having the life guard blow the whistle at you!Food and drinks were over priced and don’t bother taking your own food there, you wontt be allowed. We waited behind a couple with young children and they couldn’t take food in for their 1yr old child!! Unbelievable! It’s 200dhrs to get in and by the end of the day you will be forking out another 200-300dhrs for food and photos if you want them.If I could take that day back, I would have went skiing instead of Wild Wadi.

Good, needs updating. We enjoyed our time, esp my daughter - she loved the pool! Expensive but be aware of touts outside trying to sell u tickets! It's a con and always buy from the ticket office.The carpet in the prayer room are old rustic and almost in shreds! Pls change them- it's a shame. Best of all it location, nestled between the burj and jumeriah beach!

Happy Place!. choosing between Wild Wadi and Atlantis Water park was a big problem ! every body told us that ATLANTIS was better but my friend insisted to go to wild wadi! ( for unknown reasons! ) this was our first water park experience so we had fun but according to other ppl and also the taxi driver who took us there ATLANTIS is the better one! ... it starts working on around 10 -11 m till 6 pm ... this is winter time in Dubai so i felt a little bit cold when coming out of water! I guess it would be more fun at spring or summer time ... totally it was very entertaining , the staff were friendly and polite and it was a clean place ...

Tired, old and dissapointing. maybe if you'd never been to any other water park you'd have a good time, the wave pool amused the boys (14 & 12), Food was over priced and awful.Cracked, dirty tiles, splintered seats,Not a patch on Atlantis.
Great fun for the whole family. This was my first water park experience. My kids and I really enjoyed the experience. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great way to spend a summer day.

Terrible value for money. This place pretty much has 3 rides - the speed slide, the tube ride and the flowriders. Sure, they will claim that there is more but the tube ride just has a few different options when you go through it. I think you can take all options if you get on it 3 times. We got there at 10am and had done every ride by 10:30am thanks to no queues early on. The place filled up and by 1pm, there was a 30 minute wait to get on any of the rides after this point. We pretty much just paid for an expensive sunbake for the rest of the time.We were going to go to Aquaventure the next day but people actually rate this place similarly in quality to Aquaventure so we decided to give it a miss. I would implore people who rate this park highly to visit pretty much any other water park in any other country to gain perspective.

Great for the whole family!. Loved every minute!This was my third time in Dubai and fourth time visiting the wild wadi. I went with my partner, sister, her husband and her two daughters, (8 and 12 years old)! We all went on fantastic rides! It was NOT a 'rip off' and the experience was great! Wild wadi is an excellent adventure for a person of any age!!! Amaaazzingg!!!!!

A fun day out. Went to Wild Wadi with my partner last week and enjoyed being a bit of a kid. Not been to many other water parks so difficult to compare but chose WW over the alternative at Atlantis as you can use your Entertainer vouchers here to get 2 for 1 entry. Some of the rides were closed as a new family part is being built and due to open any day now. As other reviewers have said, I would have expected a slight reduction in the entry fee as a result. We both enjoyed the roller coasters and wave pool and found that it wasn't too busy despite some parts being closed. Lunch in the park was reasonable and OK quality providing you're not expecting haut cuisine!Longest queue was for a taxi back to our hotel and stupidly the line goes straight past a big waterfall so we were getting soaked with the spray as we waited. Maybe that is ok in the height of summer when you need something to keep you cool but not in December when the temperature was only about 22 degrees!

Expensive, limited rides, but exhausting and fun. We spent Christmas Day 2010 at Wild Wadi. We arrived at opening time, which turned out to be a great idea. No waits on any rides all morning. It was a warm and breezy day, but the staff at our hotel told us it probably wouldn't be crowded because "it is too cold today." :-)There were two major slide rides closed. Yes, this information is on the website, but there was no discount on the admission price. For big kids and adults, there was one big slide, one tube ride, two stationary waves, and one floating river ride. Not a lot of variety. There was a wave pool and a small kids' play structure too. But those two big slides that were closed would have made a BIG difference in the quality of play all day.The Jumeirah Sceirah was fun, but five days later, I still have big dark bruises on my hips and shoulder blades (I rode five times). Good and fun bruises, but still, plan your visit so you're not flying out right after your Wild Wadi visit, and squirming uncomfortably in your airplane seat.The park cleverly uses a plastic wristband as its payment system. You "load" money on the wristband, then when you buy things, you just wave your wrist to pay. It's a nice psychological effect: if you had to hand over cash for your fast food lunch, you might be shocked at the price, but if you just wave your wrist, you don't even notice how much you're spending. It was a pretty expensive day overall, and we didn't even buy any of the many photos that park staff took of us.If we ever return to Dubai, I'll probably take the family again...as long as the other slides are open. So I'll give Wild Wadi a "recommend," but check the website to make sure the slides are working before you act on my recommendation!

Daylight robbery. So i visted Wilwadi after 6 months staying in Dubai. After all the excitement i was extremely un satisfied. So here are my reasons for not enjoying the park : -Comapred to water parks visited in Malaysia, South Africa this does come close to them at all. Less rides for one. Over Priced as well. Also i understood from the advertising on the webiste that 2 rides were closed. Which severly impacted point 2 even more. For adults all you now have is 1 slide, 1 tube ride and 2 board activities.But what annoyed me more is the fact that Management at the park refuse to use logic and reduce the entry fee as a result of closing down 2 rides. Visting Ferrari world today you see a company that values customer Service. One ride in the THeme Park was not working and the Entry price was reduced by 30 AED. A fair gesture by the Park Mangement. Maybe Wild Wadi Management can comment on why they insist on ripping of customers. I would like to see some sort of gesture of Good faith from Wild Wadi to compensate visitors to the park.

Very Expensive - not worthe the money. I was very very dissapointed with the place..not worth visiting, espcially if you have visited water parks in Florida, USA. It cost the same thing and all it has a tidal wave and very very few rides..its still being constructed..not worth it

Narrow-minded management. I recently called up Wild Wadi to enquire about FISHO - the treatment where you put your feet into the water and the fish nibble at them. I explained that I wanted to only go to FISHO and not on any rides with my 70 year old mother. That's ok - just pay AED 50/- admission and then the AED 50/- for the treatment I was informed. My mother had read about this and was very much looking forward to it. After a 1/2 hr taxi ride we got to the information counter and were advised that we would have to pay the AED 200/- admission fee to the part plus the AED 50/- EACH for the 20 minute treatment. I explained that this was not what I was told over the phone so the assistant checked with the manager. We were then advised that we would be escorted to the area by a member of staff and would only need to pay the AED 50/-. Happy that this was sorted we waited to be escorted through only to be told that the management of FISHO were not happy with us not paying the admission and we couldn't go through. This was so narrow minded of the management, not to mention a complete waste of my time and ruined what was a lovely day. Come on Wild Wadi/FISHO get real. More people (residents included) would love to only go to FISHO but stop being so greedy and think outside of the box!
Fantastic. Love to come back!

Great for all!. Absolutely love wild wadi!It's a great place to bring out the childish side of you! The staff are so friendly, cheery and seem to enjoy what they do! Been 6 times and would love to go again!Even better if you stay at Jumeirah Beach Hotel as it has it's own entrance and free entry!Keep up the good work

A COMPLETE RIP OFF. I went to this park last week with my husband and children by the time I paid for the locker and the towels it was 900 dirham, (about £200) when we got there the ticket counter informed us that the family rides were being refurbished and were closed as we had paid 80 dirhams in a taxi we had no choice but to go in! HALF of the rides were closed and being refubished and there was no offer of a discount or anything, it really is unfair, if you stay at the Jumeriah or the Burj as we have before the access is free but if not then I wouldnt waste my money, I talked to the ticket office on the way out after only being there for 2 hours and told them I thought it was outragous but they did not seem to care and offered no refund at all

A nice place to go. We spent a great day at Wild Wadi on our trip to Dubai. Nice, diverse attractions, and not long queue lines. We expected more rides, however. I guess, we'll have to visit again when the new family attractions are ready in 2011. I recommend the kamikadze slide, which is extremely thrilling.

Fantastic Water Park. You should not miss to pay a visit to this splendid water park in Dubai. We went there with our family and we enjoyed a very funny day with lots of different attractions. There are more private places to stay on the top of the big ride. From there you can also have great views to Burj Al Arab and make wonderful pictures. You can leave your stuff on cabinets and put your money in an virtual account for what you get a bracelet to buy food and beverages. Inside there is fast food restaurants only. Surfing in artificial waves is a great experience, don't miss it.

Wild Wadi rocks! LOVE DUBAI. I've just recently come back from Dubai and visited Wild Wadi, I had an amazing time, the staff were really friendly and the park was kept clean and to a high standard cant wait to go back again :)

It is fun. I was there alone, but still I had great time. There are cabinet where you leave your personal belongings and get a bracelet with an amount you can use for a meal or so. There were just fast food restaurants, not worth mentioning. Rides are mostly slow; they do not really increase your adrenalin. But guys that work in the pools and help lazy to move in their inflatable boats are very kind and smile all the time. If you can surf the waves, there is a pool with artificial waves and you can try. On most of the rides one has to wait in line, even half an hour what is one of the big negativities of this park.

If you think it's expensive why are you in Dubai?. Face it. Dubai isn't cheap. Why do you expect one of the best water parks in the word to be cheap? You pay for what you get. QUALITY! It's a beautiful place with great rides in a superb location with excellent, friendly service. This was a once in a lifetime trip and I loved every minute of it. Dubai rocks, Wild Wadi rocks!!!!!!!!!

Very nice attraction, but very expensive!. At first I have to say, that it was a really nice and relaxing day i spent in Wild Wadi.The park is well maintained and very clean and there was no ride for which i had to wait a long time. The rides are lots of fun also and you have a terrific view from the Jumeirah Sceirah tower.But i definitely gotta say, that the prices are too high. ok, it normal that inside such a park, meal prices are a lil higher than outside, but entry is 200 Dirham plus 25 dirham for a small locker, that's way too much! recommendable to check the homepage for promotions (40 dirhams off thru september 9th, 2010).Another positive point: All outlets where opened during daytime in ramadan.

Okay day out. Recently returned from Dubai where we spent the day at Wild Wadi. We Had a good day although we didn't think it was as good as the Atlantis Waterpark. We'd bought the Entertainer book so got in for £20 each, if we'd have paid full price we don't think it would have been worth it. One of the rides was closed when we visited so only felt like we had a small number of rides to go on. Whilst we were there though my husband did get his flip flops stolen. We left them at the beginning of the rides where everyone else leaves them and when we came back they had gone. When we mentioned this to the staff they just said that someone probably took them as the floor was hot and they'd probably turn up later?? So if the floor is hot and you have no flip flops you just take someone else's?? I appreciate that they're not responsible if items go missing but they could have been more helpful instead of saying that it happens all the time. If you visit Wild Wadi make sure you have rubbish flip flops in case they go walk about!!

Fantastic fun in the sun. Having visited many water parks around central Florida, I thuoght I'd seen it all. Taht was before I went to Wild Wadi. It wiped the floor with every water park I've been to before or since. Sick of trailing up endless stairs lugging a rubber ring? No problem here. Just sit in your ring at the bottom of the slope and be pushed UPHILL to the start of the flumes by jets of water! The flumes were great, lazy river relaxing and pool areas spotless.Another clever thing was the memory chip you can buy when you ourchase your admissio. It is built into what looks like a dodgy 1980s watch but was so clever! This little device opens and closes your locker (no more cumbersome keys!) but more importantly, you can load cash on it to save leaving money unattended in the park or having to traipse back and forward to said locker every time you want to buy a snack or drink-brilliant!! I can't wait to go back!

Great day out. This is the first time we have gone to Dubai , and have 2 children 7 and 8 yrs, my husband is a non swimmer and we all had a great time , The wave pool is ideal for all ages , there are lots of lifeguards (very well trained) throughout the park and they are very professional .There are rides for most ages , though at busy times the queues are a little long. The food is expensive for what it is and I think it would be a good idea to spray the paths with water as they get incredibly hot

Great Fun! Best water park in Dubai. Really enjoyed our day at Wild Wadi. Many reviews say it is expensive but don't forget Dubai in general can be expensive we actually found it reasonably priced. The water parks in Florida are no different and are very expensive. Rides were great, first water park we had ever been to that didn't require walking up lots of stairs to get to rides the rubber ring floats pushed you all the way to the top at top speeds! The Jumeirah Sceirah was a long wait as was probably the most popular ride. Women especially need to be aware that you can lose your costume on this ride bikini's not advised. While we were there they were doing some improvements to part of the park so not all rides were available but that didn't affect our enjoyment. Food was ok, reasonably priced and in our view a good sized portion. Fresh fruit drinks like the watermelon was delicious a must have! Great idea to have wristbands that you top up with money to pay for food and drink all day, saved us having to carry wet money around. All round great fun with wonderful views of the Gulf, the Burj al arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. Would definitely return.

The views from the hotel are great, good.... The views from the hotel are great, good opportunity for pictures with the Burj Al Arab in the background.The main swimming pool/wave machine was good.However, its too expensive for what it is. Around £40 per person was too much considering there were not enoughrides. Also the rides all end up in the same place so you have to walk around in circles a lot to get to different rides.The park its self is poorly sign posted to we had to constantly look at the main map which was hard to figure out as well. The worst thing was having to pay for lockers! Not a deposit, pay to "rent" them. This is disgusting as we had paid £40 each to get in. The lockerscost around £5 but still unacceptable. Also, the food there was extreamly expensive compared to the rest of dubai.Only go here if you don't mind not getting your moneys worth.

Great!. We were staying at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, which is really close by - just a few minutes walk from the hotel. This also meant free access to the water park, which was really great, as it's not cheap, but this meant that we were there most days during our stay. I thought that it was really well organised, and my son ( 7 years) loved the kids area with the slides, and buckets, and hosepipes etc. The lifeguards were great, and it meant that you felt really safe, and they are literally everywhere, watching, and were not afraid to blow their whistles. It did get a lot busier on Friday, and Saturday than it had been earlier in the week.

Splash fun. One word FUN......If you love water this is the place for you. We as a family enjoyed it so much that we didnt want to leave the place. There is everythitng for everyone. From children to adults. Staff is very trained. The place is very up to the mark. Please go in summer time the best water park.

A must for children in Dubai. Whether you are a permanent resident or a visitor, this is a must for children in Dubai. Our children (aged 9 and 7) love the water parks and particularly Wild Wadi as there is more for the smaller kid to do at this one (due to more rides with height restrictions at Aquaventure and the larger park size).We sit by the water wave pool (well supervised) which is central to most of the rides. We bring our own towels and little that requires a locker (we add money on admission to the wrist band). The food is the usual theme park food (nothing special) and the usual cost. We have been in Ramadan and that makes it slightly more difficult to eat and drink by the pool, but the children cope well. Yes, there are the usual Digiphoto shots but there is no great onus to buy them at the end of the day.The park is clean, well organised and well supervised. The children enjoy themselves so much that we can spend all day there, especially when the Dubai weather gets hot, hot and hotter.

Beauty with Joy and Happiness. Hats off to the creators of wild wadi and my heartiest congratulation to you !!! Its a wonderful place full with beauty and wonderful rides. Suitable for all age group of people. Being residing in dubai for the last three years i was avoiding to spend 200dhs per person , but after going there it actually worth it. Its a must visit place. So all Dubai people its my request to you to go there once. One request to you .............please kindly add some more vegetarian food in your menu.Thanks and regards

Enjoyable but pricey day out. We visited Wild Wadi in April and did enjoy it. It is rather expensive and as 2 of the family rides were not working was a dissapointment for my young son who wasnt able to access most of the rides!! The kids did enjoy it though.The park was well supervised and all staff were very helpfull and freindly. It was also very clean and the food there was surprisingly acceptable and not too expensive.One major downfall was i picked up an ear infection from the lazy river which after 2 weeks is only just clearing up!!!

Great Water Park - Not so great extra charges. Recently I spent half a day at Wild Wadi. A beautiful beautiful and fun water park. The design of the park and the views of the beach when you got high enough are breathtaking. A lot of staff were there to help out and watch over the crowd which made me feel well take care of. The only thing I didn't appreciate...was charging extra for towels and locker usage, this should be included in the admission price and a lot cheaper. Also, I heard the photos that they take of you at the park are ridiculously expensive if you want to take one home. So be sure and bring your camera, put it in your expensive locker and then before you leave take pics. Otherwise very friendly staff, very fun rides, beautiful park.

We had a good time. Just came back from a full day of fun and relaxation at the Wild Wadi. I would definitely recommend it to families with children 6 years and up. there are lifeguards everywhere, and the instructors at the surf-events are very good with the children.tip: If you are in Dubai for a longer period of time, or if you are 4 persons or more, then buy "The Entertainer". It's a coupon book and it has three coupons for Wild Wadi. Each coupon is "one free admission when buying one", So you can save 400 AED if 4 persons are entering together. The book is 295, so it's a good plan, and then you have a LOT of coupons for the rest of the time, for restaurants and more.

Overpriced and not enough value for money. Too expensive and not enough there for the money spent on getting in. I expected more slides. Between 2-3 hrs is more than enough as all the slides can be done within 2 hrs. Cheaper ticket available if you go 2 hrs before the park closes. Dissapointed with the experience.

Splashed out and had a ball!. We splurged and booked a cabana. Good call! You get a front of line pass to the best ride in the park, the kids (and me) were never off it! Four sun loungers, a private locker, a dining table for four and a beautiful shaded (bedouin tent style) cabana in a private garden area. Cabana staff take your food and drink orders and deliver them to your table, and we received complimentary mineral water, ice lollies and fresh chilled fruit, it was fantastic!The rides were brilliant, the park is spotless, the service is first class, we spent a full day there and enjoyed every minute! Worth every penny!

Wild Wadi is WAY TOO Expense!!!!. I like the waterpark and so did my guests in 9/9 but its way too expense specially when you go in a group ( its no fun going alone anyways...) I agree with many that the towels and locker plus food is a "rip off".. ...Besides that the park has a wide fun areas to enjoy!!!A. HarrisonDubai - UAE

I would not recommend it. I have been to Atlantis but not Wild Wadi, I decided to give it a go taking visiting friends. I regret it.When we arrived we were advised that sections of the park were closed. We were nonetheless charged full price. Once inside we realised the extent of the closure. THe park charges for everything - lockers - towels but nothing when they reduce what they offer.Also ruining the visit was the catering. Without a doubt, the worst coffee I have EVER had and I have had bad coffee. The 'fresh lemonade' was from a bottle.One of our guests (a lady) queued for over an hour for one of the wave rides. We watched men enjoy the ride for on average 5 minutes each. Our guest was whistled off after 47 seconds!! She felt that the men were given priority and preference in the queue and was disappointed. I had to reassure her that Dubai is not usually sexist!!I was impressed by the electronic wrist bands which meant that i did not need to carry money.I would definitely recommend Atlantis over Wild Wadi to anyone.

Good water park for half a day. Although the older of the Dubai waterparks we actually found it better than Atlantis. Staff were friendly and there is a good array of rides. The surfing rides are fun if difficult while the tube rides provide enough interest to keep kids amused for hours. The big ride is fast and scary. Once seemed enough. I would get there early as it seemed to become much busier in the afternoon, wait times rise and all the loungers are taken. Main concerns are the cost of entry (~£35/person) and price of food (£5-6 for a buger). If you can get hold of 2 for 1 vouchers (available in a booklet) the day becomes much more cost effective. You also do not have access to beach area. Overall a good waterpark.

A day of fun and more fun. 6 adults (2 could not swim) and 2 children under 3 years old, attended wild wadi on the 29th of december 2009, we arrived at 10am and joined a queue a mile long to get in, you have to pay for towels, locker and to get in, which is not cheap, but if you ask at your hotel they all have vouchers for thw water park so it makes it cheaper!!!!!!!!!!!once in we walked for a good 20 minutes trying to find 6 beds together, but once we found them we had a great day, as their was something for everyone the none swimmers went on the lazy river or sat in the main pool, or watched the pros on the surfing machine (which i went on and lasted under 2 minutes, it is hard to do but great fun).The food in the park is good but it is like all parks quick food at a price.Jason Cowell and family, Whitley Bay, England

Rude staff !!!. It's a good day out if you don't mind paying over the top price, there are only a few good rides and the queues are quite bad ! We would of enjoyed the trip much more if it wasn't for a very rude member of staff (Jane) at the entrance and exit, I was later told by a member of staff that "she is like that", she was even making rude comments when we were leaving !

looks nice, but amazingly expensive. 195 Dhs to get into the park, then 25 Dhs to hire a towel and about the same for a small locker. £1 = approx 6 DhsThe park looks nice and is well maintained. There is however, a lack of actual rides to go on. I went on 2 all day. The queues were crazy because I went during the Eid break, which I suppose is my own fault. However the park operators should consider a limit to the number of guests allowed in at any one time - the wave pool is not so much fun when there's about a square-metre each of space to "swim" in!! The queues are amazingly long and the locals will chance their luck to get in front of you - do not let them in!!!If you have time, try the water park in Ras-Al- Kaimah instead, it's much better and much cheaper. Wild Wadi rate themselves like the amazing water parks of North America and they simple are notalso, the 'restaurant' is horrendously overpriced and the food (which i had) was below-par

Good but old. Great days at wild wadi, but hot concrete with bare feet, peeling paint and rusty falling apart equipment in the kids bit made one a bit concerned for safety. Not much to occupy kids under 1.1m high.

worth it for kids or if its included within your hotel. Was fun but not really a full day out and cant be compared with wet and wild etc. As we stayed at the hotel the entrance was included within the rates but i wouldnt pay for this otherwise. 5 or 6 rides only. but dont want to sound like an old fart as i'm sure that kids would love it!!!

Nothing Special. This park is OKtheres muliple water rollercoasters (up and downhill in a ring), a decent free fall ride, wave pool and waveriders (surf/bodyboarding machine) - both the free fall rollercoaster and wave rider have long queues!!The park is much smaller than i expected and is pretty expensive for what you get. Food inside is a rip off as is having to pay for a locker :(
Less than good. I think that its not bad. The water is not clean, and their are too many single men (taxi drivers, street workers) inside the park that make the family expedition uncomfortable.

Total Rip-off. I was at Wild Wadi last weekend 21/08/09 and with the exchange rate of 5.5 Dhm to the £ the 195 Dhm entrance fee equates to £40 each - with a locker. It is not worth that sort of money. I'm a non swimmer but I couldn't stay in the hotel while my wife & son went for his 13th birthday. So a complete waste of a day for me! We were there for his 9th birthday too - and nothing has changed except the price. With the Atlantis opening a Water Park -albeit the same price entrance fee - we will not bother with Wild Wadi agin.

As a non lover of water - this was exceptionally brilliant!. We visited the hotel a while back and decided to use the Wild Wadi Park one day. I am not a lover of "getting my face in the water" - and for anyone who is like me , do not let this put you off visiting the park! We had an absolutely fantastic day at Wild Wadi and I would recommend it to anyone from small kids to OAP's. A fantabulous day out. Something for everyone and even if you just wish to relax, there are loungers next to the water. I even tried to get onto the slides - but was advised that they were for kids only! That's how much I enjoyed this day out - going from someone who would not go near fun water parks to having my partner practically pull me away from it! If in doubt - GO.

No thrills...but not bad. I was a bit weary of attending the Wild Wadi Waterpark after the reviews which seemed to give a somewhat lukearm response to the experience.They were right - Overall I would say that it is not bad for a relaxing day in water. There are far too few rides but the ones available are good fun on the first go. However given the lack of rides, you will tend to revisit the previous rides only to be met by boredom really.The communal wave pool was nice though and would be especially good for children. In all I would recommend it for a day out in water, but would not recommend it if you're looking for thrills.Point to note: You will most probably walk bare foot through the park as its too much hassle to carry flip flops around...however your feet WILL burn in Summer!! Despite their attempts to cool the floors with sprinklers, there are areas which do not have water and will make the walk to your next ride a painful experience.

Very disappointed with this.....very boring and dull. Visited this park at Easter time and I have to say it was very disappointing overall. No really decent rides and very few rides overall. I have been to water parks in Ayia Napa and Gran Canaria and both were far, far superior to this. I don't recommend it at all. Completely overprice for what you get.

WILD WADI WATER PARK, SLIDE WITH "BACK DOOR TRICK". Wild Wadi Park is indeed a nice place where to spend a couple of hours while you are in Dubai. As the rest of the whole Jumeirah group the facilites are amazing (I would have never thought I could slide up a slope while on the water...) but let me warn you aboutthe only real danger of the water park:after waiting 30 minutes I managed to reach the top of the biggest slide, the one where everyone want to go.. the tallest one you can see from the outside...I prepare myself to enjoy the slide paying attention to what the lifeguard guy is telling me .. keep your arm and legs crossed, your head down and enjoy. OK DONE I AM READY. Dear all, believe me, when they say cross your legs, keep them tight crossed otherwise you will get what I have experienced : the wild jumeirah purgation ! Litres of water will attempt to reach your inner bowel through what you can already imagine..DISGUSTING! Rember the legs.. it is worthy..

Fun Fun Fun. This waterpark is in the backdrop of the famous Burj Al Arab hotel on one side and Jumeirah hotel on the other.Its like a regular water park, but with limited rides.The good thing about it is the staff and the fact that its nearly empty during the week days, so you can walk in post lunch(the heat permitting) and walk out before the evening tea time, and cover all the rides!Entry is not as cheap, and you cannot take money inside.To pay for the food inside you should purchase food coupons at the entry itself and lock up all your belongings on the lockers provided (at a fee).They have their camera people around so you neednt carry your own cameras.It has rides that can be enjoyed individually or as a couple, or spend time relaxing at its beach area with man made waves, fun.

Cool place, good timez. I am originally from Toronto so I have been to my share of good amusement parks (Marine Land, Canadas Wonderland and Wild Water Kingdom). This park does not compare to those I mentioned but it is good in its own right. My favorite part about it is where it is located in between the 2 stunning hotels. The rides and attractions are decent. Theres always something to keep you wet. My favorite would be the lazy river and the surfing one. The value for a one time trip is not too bad, but for people who live there it can get expensive. With my entrance fee, locker and food I paid approximately $85. Outrageous in Canadian standards, but then again its Dubai, so why not?

friendly atmosphere. I went to Wild Wadi in October 2007. Actually the facility is really wonderful, well operated. The location is good. At that time I heard that the guests of Jumeirah Beach Hotel were free to use the park. I always keep this in my mind and on my next trip to Dubai, I am considering to stay in this hotel and using the facility everyday. The food is good and the prices were okay that time. Good souvenir shop, nice landscape and nice scenery of Jumeriah Beach Hotel and Burj Al Arab. However Dubai has a new aquapark within the Atlantis Hotel, I still think Wild Wadi will remain as a good place for enjoying splashes in a cheaper way with all quality!.The most I liked about Wild Wadi was, yes I admit not much variety of slides but; you do not have to climb up hundreds of steps to reach the start of the slides. It was not tiring to enjoy it. There is a continious slide which takes you all around the park with all excitement. Secondly surfing pools. Thirdly the atmosphere is really matching the concept.Please be reminded that the park becomes so crowded in the afternoon. Go early!

Great Fun with family.. Wild Wadi was WILD!! Great rides and choices. I did the highest one with my son also! Closed my eyes and let loose! The rides funnily push you upwards first in most cases. I had done ATlantis the day before which is all downhill. This was different. But a good variety none the less. They had water fountains! (unlike Atlantis) so you can refill your bottle of water rather than buying it at huge markups. Food is expensive, but we have learnt that ALL FOOD is expensive ANYWHERE in Dubai. So....A great outing for the family. Highly reccomended.

Perfect for kids and lovers of water. Wild Wadi has everything! View: The iconic Burj Al Arab and Jumeriah beach! Another architectural wonder, the Jumeirah Beach Club, is just behind it. The water park is perfect for families with kids, for controlled water fun. For parents safety is of utmost importance, and Wild Wadi looks safe enough. Experienced staff and lifeguards guide tourists every step of the way.Must try the water slides. Kids and adults alike, find the thrill of the ride irresistible. These rides are on tube rings and both up water and down water rides are thrilling. The breakers bay wave pool is also advised for those who want to take it easy, laze the day away in a lounging chair while getting a little wet.Take everything you would take to the beach. Towels, sunbloc, kiddie toys, when coming with children. Food stalls within the water park are rather limited. Eat somewhere else or don't expect a big meal available at the stalls all the time.If you want to learn surfing, Wild Wadi is also the best place to practice. The attendants at flow rider (surf wave simulator) can give you tips.

not as i expected. Didnt know what it was going to be like, there seems to be lots of rides but when you get there they all interconnect. Theres 1 with 11 or 12 rides and 1 with 6 and i think 2 big seperate rides.It was nearly 80 GBP for 2 adults, the locker was an additional 5 GBP which is understandable but when the park isnt what you expected it ends up costing you more and more when your in there. The electronic wrist band is a brilliant idea, you can choos an amount you want to put on it and use it throughout the day rather than takin money around all day or having to keep going back to the locker, whatever money is left they give back to you when you leave.Depending on what your looking for i would not recommed this attraction, the atlanits palm hotel seems better and says its the best water park there and thats costing around 114 GBP for 2 adults.

ok waterpark. it's an ok place to spend the day, there are a few rides mostly interconnected but their still fun to go on there are people who can take pictures for you if you want but they are very expensive to buy £13 for one photo!! ( we bought 3) you could stay there all day and kids will love it! you also get a great view of the burj al arab and jumeirah beach is just next to the waterpark

Fun in the Sun. Wild Wadi is an entertaining water park with lots to do and enjoyable rides for couples or for families. It is surrounded by beautiful beaches and hotels. Wild Wadi is a great place to spend the day and have a little fun! Make sure you take a tube ride around the park experiencing all the upward thrills and a trip through the black tunnel. All day prices are roughly 195AED to 165AED for children.

Great fun until 7pm, 9pm in the Summer. We went to the Wild Wadi Water Park at 4pm after a day at the Jumeriah Beach Park. It was great fun and we found that 3 hours was plenty of time to visit all of the rides. After about 5.30p.m. it started to get a lot quieter as people made their way home to get ready for the evening. This is brilliant as it means you can literally walk on the rides. My only disappointment was the number of rides there. I thought there would be more. My top tip - wear a decent bikini/ swimming costume as a few people had trouble with theirs going up and falling down due to water pressure!!!!

Water park fun. This water park is good fun for the day. We bought our tickets at the hotel to save a few dirhams. They have a cashless system at the site where you give money over at the shop when you arrive and you get a wristband. this works for lockers, food etc. On the subject of lockers, I paid for one large one (which wasn't that large) but all 3 of us couldn't use it as they are inside the changing rooms. Boys over 6 are not allowed in female changing rooms. It would be worthwhile taking a coverup top as you can forget how long you are in the sun. There are bits of shade, but not much. Toilets are very clean. I have put a photo of the kids play area on and the wave pool is a bit heated, waves come about every 15 minutes. Lifeguards very watchful. Towels cost about 15 dirhams to hire. I would recommend it, its not cheap but its really fun.

The Best WaterPark I Ever Been.... We went to the wild wadi water park, this attraction is awesome. You will have a great day and a great experience. When you planing visit a Dubai, you cant miss this attraction. Is not that expensive. Great staff, they will try to scary you in the rides, really funny and awesome. This is Unforgettable attraction.And you can see nice Jumeirah Hotel and Burj Al Arab, they are so close, i you can have a nice pictures...

The Kids enjoyed it and that's what matters!. Although there was no time to experience Aqaventure at the new Atlantis Hotel, where is it supposed to be a lot bigger and better than Wild Wadi, my kids enjoyed W/Wadi thoroughly. I didn't take part but I saw grandparents/elderly people participate in the rides and the next time I go, I will dress more appropriately as I got very wet. But with the hot weather, we spent a good four hours and the kids did not want to leave. Wild Wadi may be 'old' as compared to Aquaventure but it still produces loads of fun.
Great For The Kids. For any families in Dubai this makes a great day. Something suitable for all ages.
Wild Wadi Water Park, Dubai. The stationary wave there is great. And the Up-hill water shoot takes you half way around the park and exits into the Lazy River.

Take your credit card. It was an okay day out, but take your credit card! It cost over £100 to get in (2 adults 1 kid) plus they really load on the drinks once you are in... eg bottle water at airport is one dirham, same bottle at wild wadi is a staggering 9 dirhams. And you need plenty of them, as you are not allowed to take drink/food in with you.Grab a chair/lounger as soon as you arrive, otherwise you will find every single chair has someones towel on it, especially the ones with shade. Also if you leave around 5ish there is a huge queue for taxis and the traffic back to town is very bad and will take ages. My advice is, walk around to the Jumeirah Beach Hotel (2 mins) and join the tax queue there, much shorter.

Great time, even for 27 year old kids!. My fiance and I were quite surprised that we had such a good time at Wild Wadi, considering we are both 27 and thought water parks were more for kids. We went on a Monday afternoon and were very happily surprised that the park was not overcrowded. The lines were short, which made the day even more enjoyable. Plenty of beach chairs and even umbrellas that were free. Definately didn't appear to be old or run-down to us. We are looking forward to another day at the park soon.

getting old and pretty not wild. well with the oppening of Aquaventure in atlantis the Palm Island, wild wadi is getting really old, well the price of entry in wild wadi is still cheaper and yes you do have a variety of rides, but the whole attraction is getting old, its obvious that a major renovation is required to bring up this park back to its wildness again.

Awesome!. What a fab place to spend a few hours if you can tear yourself away from the beach and the shops!At the grand old age of 49 and having never been to a water park before I can thoroughly recommend a visit to this

High price for a shower and a litte slide. They should skip the "wild" part in the name. They do have 2-3 OK slides, but if you are looking for some thrill or action, this is not the place. Agree with above, overrated and overpriced (190 dirhams per entry). It is a small, overcrowded park, most suitable for children under 12 and maybe sedate grown-ups.

not really worth the effort. Wild Wadi is situated by the Burj Al Arab and the Jumierah Beach Hotel , access is complimetary for residents, and the views from the park of both hotels are amazing.As you know this is a water park, with around 20 rides. Children need to be at least 1.1 M to ride, an most of the rides are worth going on.here's the BUT.Its basically a swimming pool with a few slides, most hotels already have pools, if not the beautiful Arabian Gulf which is less crowded, and free. WW has sunbeds, but these are usually taken up and are crowdedWild Wadi costs AED 195 pp entrance, addtional costs are lockers AED25 , and towels AED 25, so save some money and bring your own.There are large changing rooms with showers, so feel free to come dressed and bring swimear to change into.HINTS:- do load up credit on the wristbands, it allows you to buy food without having to carry your wallet around, and is refunadble on unused credit.- search the internet or local fpress for discount vouchers, we got AED 60 off pp

not as good as its made out to be. I went on a womans only night which was horrible. The rides themselves were ok slides filled with loads of just floating in water. More thrilling rides needed.Definitely over-rated and over priced. Wouldn't go again.

Wild Wadi. Excellent day out for the whole family, even better if your kids are over 1.1 meters. Even the more thrilling rides are good for little ones 'coz they can ride with Mummy /Daddy/whoever. We spent 4 hours and couldn't get the kids to leave. Thorougly recommmended and would definately go again and again!

Do you like urin? Than go and dip into the Wild Wadi Park..... A truely disappointing day at a place which suppose to be the best thing to do in Dubai. We went for a 11am opening time just to find out that they opened at 10am - already so we lost one hour of "fun". The advertized offer of 50% discounts for Hoteliers did suddenly not apply with no reason or proove given that this had been expired. Inside we found the walk-ways to hot to walk and carrying & managing your flip-flops is not what you are imagining from a day off in a park. The rides are fun until you tired of the very very limited choices; the main launch station was not working proberly and had to be repaired several times which ended up at us looking at this time-consuming event unedr water sprinklers which smelt more like urin than clean & fresh water. Disgusting! Bottom line we lost another good 2 hours being limited to one secondary option and the little kids playground. Forget about taking showers as the water is boiling hot and the staff close by seems to have fun watching people experience this unique 'refreshment". As for the Staff in general we did find some life guards which did enjoy what theyw ere doing but the majority was obviously fed-up with their daily routine of pushing those tubes around the corners and pushing all sorts of people down the pipes. We would have expected some sort of mentioning of the down time of the main launch area but nothing - on mentioning our concerns we were ask to complete a questionaire. No interesst nor concern. The emailw e send to the Park Management remained unresponded whereby we made it clear that we were not asking for a refund etc. Something we would not consider recommending or repeating unless you like to leave a water park smelling like you been pee'ed on. Lovely!

My four year old loved the place. We went with our four year old daughter on Tuesday. She absolutely loved it even though being under 1100mm she could only go on about four of the attractions. One of these, Juha's Dhow actually has five slides, water guns and a deluge bucket. There was no queing for any of these slides. The other ride she enjoyed was the family raft ride called Summit Surge and Rushdown Ravine and we did sometimes have to queue for about ten minutes for this. The first part blasts your raft up a slide and the second part slides you back down a chute. The first part's a bit hard on the bum when you go over the water cannon and the second part is quite boring as I didn't find it extreme enough (plus the raft keeps nipping your skin as it goes up and down the sides of the chute).Most of the sunbed areas were busy and the sunbeds are really shoehorned in. We found the best spot for us was a decking area on the roof of Sinbad's Galley snack bar which wasn't packed with sunbeds and was really quiet. It has the advantage of being close to the toilets and snack bar and connects directly to the family raft ride and the Juha's Dhow attraction. It's also a good photo spot with the Burj al Arab in the background.I didn't find the cost of food to be too bad and it was of reasonable quality.I didn't like the lazy river "Juha's Journey". Instead of taking out rings that people had abandoned they were left to float around so there were log jams all over the place where you had to push them aside. There were also a few groups of twenty something local lads mucking about flipping the rings in the air and behaving like ten year olds. I had to grab one of the rings to stop it from clobbering my daughter. Not a relaxing lazy river at all then.It wouldn't be top of my list of places to go but it was my daughters favourite part of our week in Dubai.

Ok place to cool down.... Wild Wadi Water Park is an ok place to go to if you need to cool down. The entrance fee is quite high compared to what's on offer and after a couple of hours you are likely to get bored of the water slides. You have to pay for the lockers and the food is overpriced as well. It's better to go to the beach as it doesn't get that crowded or have the security guards that will confiscate any food or drinks...

Crowded and overated. I can't really understand why Wild Wadi is so popular tourist trap. Or can, 'cause it's so good advertised. But I don't think that very many people who come here first time want go back. The hole place was so crowded, we been here on thursday afternoon which is popular time, but still! We must stay in line about one hour to get any slides. Restaurants was so full of people and around the pools there wasn't enough deckchairs. Yeah, I admit that the waterpark located in spectacular place: Burj al Arab and Jumeirah beach-hotel on the background were unforgettable. The ride called Masterblaster was very nice too, but it was just like the Family ride, I couldn't notice any difference. Jumeirah Sceirah was too scary so we didn't even try it. Flowriders should have been fun - but it's not if you can't surf. Breakers bay was so crowded that we couldn't enjoy about the waves at all. Flood river was ridiculous: the "creating waves" were so slow that we almost fall asleep. And Juha's Journey: the hell of the waterpark! Every slides end up with those terrible lazy river! When you have sailed it throught once, you don't want do it again - but you should. So that's why the most of people just climbed up the walls and tried to get away from here as soon as they can. So that's the other problem besides the crowded: every slides are either too easy or too scary. That's why I won't go to the Wild Wadi if I come back to Dubai someday.

Nothing special. This water park is nothing special as the water parks you would find in US. Its like if you dont have anything better to do and want to go for abit of fun then yes you can go have a good time. For kids they would love it. Its entrance is expensive but service inside is great and staff very helpful. I have been once to experience it but would not go again.

Be warned!. Beware the gate security!
