We've visited water parks around the world and never encountered this before!The security 'guards' made absolutely no attempt to check through belongings for anything threatening as far as we could see, the only aim appeared to be to take all items of food and drink away from visitors. These were then confiscated until departure time: a whole room inc fridges were devoted to this 'contraband'!I objected to this and was told they are a profit making organisation!! As I said that my children had allergies, I was allowed to keep our sandwiches - I also hid a litre of water and as they weren't doing proper security checks, got away with it! At 36degrees, expensive to buy drinks and food on top of their hefty entrance fees.The park itself was ok but unremarkable and apart from one ride, mild, but staff inside park helpful and friendly. Desert safari definitely worth a go, though touristy as you would expect, we found Funtours way cheaper than Arabian Adventures for what appeared to be same trip and was fun for all the family.Big Bus Tour very good value and a good start to holiday.Beware of the Dubai traffic - a nighmare and don't let a Dubai taxi driver take you to other than a major hotel in Sharjah- they are prone to get lost and charge you for it!!

Excellent FAMILY Water Park. Wild Wadi Water Park is an excellent day for the entire family. However if you are an adrenalin seeker, it's probably not for you.The Park is a good size as it is not too big but has plenty to see and do with lots of variety. The queues move quickly so you are not constantly waiting and spend more time doing.We loved that there weren't many stairs. Kids on waterslides can be quite tiring after a while if you are climbing steps all day so at WIld Wadi you can have family fun but it's relaxing too. At the bottom, you get on a tube and the water and conveyer take you to the top and the water slides. Therefore it is also great for those who are not so mobile.The park is very well presented with great views of the Burj Al Arab and surrounding area from the highest point.

A great-sized waterpark. My family and I got free entrance to the Wild Wadi cause we stayed at the Burj Al-Arab (Wild Wadi is owned by the same company that owns the Burj). I like the waterpark, cause the line moved along speedily, all rides took an average of less than 5 minutes. And we went on Friday and Saturday, where it is supposedly the most crowded. There is a big complex for toddlers and kids with its own slides. There's the body boarding for more skilled attendants. My favorite ride was the individual tubing slide, where they shoot you up a few times, and once you're up there, you go tubing down the slides, with a total of 11 slides including a completely dark tunnel.It was amazing, fun for all ages, safe and clean.

wild wadi experience. Get there early!!! The prices are the same as you would pay in England - £20 pp and £3 for a locker (which is a rip off as you need a locker to keep your clothes in, so they should have been free)There are fantastic water rides to suit everyone from children to adult, from surf simulators to log rides. There is a very high slide (not for those scared of heights) but from the top you get the most fantastic view of Al burj hotel and the sea. No trip to Dubai is complete without experiencing this. As a muslim I wore tracksuit bottoms, a t-shirt and hijab, and it was fine. Munna, Newcastle

Get there early. A great park especially with the kids. Need to get there early esp in holidays - some hotels gain you access 1 hour earlier than the general public - worth thinking about when booking your hotel.

Best Part of The Holiday!!!!!. Everytime I go to Dubai (Which is six times a year from Surrey), I enjoy the water park the most. Anything rather than the Mall of The Emirates!Plus, I stay in the Mina A Salam hotel within the Madinat Jumierah complex and entry is discounted! This applies to the Burj Al Arab and the Jumierah Beach Hotel!Brilliant!
Fantastic. Have been 3 times now and have had a great time on each occasion. Its very well organised and is great fun for all ages !!

don't bother. This park was dirty and small. There wasn't one ride in this park worth seeing. If you have been to ANY florida water parks, you will hate this water park. the staff arent over pleasant either. It would probably take you ten mins to walk around the whole park. It is also, relatively expensive to get in, although food is cheap inside. The park is full of complete idiots!!!!!Don't WASTE your time!!!!!!!!!!!

fairly fun waterpark. i agree that if you have been to a large waterpark before, this will not seem as amazing to you- it is very overhyped and much smaller than you think it will be. That said, its still worth a visit- go in the evening to skip the queues and intense heat.

Very Enjoyable. I think the things that stood out for me was the fact that theres an area, within the park, higher than the rest of the park where you canlie down on sun beds and enjoy the sun and as you look to the right you have the jumeriah hotel literally in your face!Also, there is a ride whereby you have to walk up what felt like hundred of steps before getting on and sliding down the water to the bottom. Honestly people you are so high your legs shake and when you get on you go so fast you think your gonna fly away! AMAZING.Also, theres rides that are relaxing, others that go up as opposed todown! and the eating is great also.The actual attendants there are really friendly and really add to thewhole experience.This is another 'must do' as far as dubai is concerned.

Needs to shape up a bit more. I have visited the Wild Wadi each time I have been to Dubai. I went in February with my daughter. Although she is only 8 years old I had to pay adult price for her as she is deemed to be too tall. Obviously I was not to best pleased by this. I found admission to be too high for what it has to offer. I noticed a few of the visitors had discounted tickets to ghain entry.The water park is fun, but the novelty has worn off as far as I am concerned as I have been to other water parks apart from the wild wadi and these have more to offer, as well as cheaper prices.Many of the rides are inter-connecting. The wild wadi needs more water slides. I note a few new attractions for younger kids have been introduced but it is not enough.It is fun, and worth going for first timers but it needs to shape up for the repeat visitors.

Favourite place in Dubai. Wild Wadi is the only water park I've seen where the jets push you up the hills, often faster than you go down!Be sure to avoid school holidays otherwise you'll be queueing for hours, possibly only going on a handful of rides in a whole day.I highly recommend the body boarding!

Fun for all - sort of. Wild Wadi if you think about the concept of being in the desert etc than its not too bad, in actual fact i enjoy wild wadi, i have been there a few times now and each time enjoy myself, the advertising of the amoutn of rides is untrue as most people said the 13 connecting rides is just that, connecting rides so its really one big ride.however, if your in dubai with kids you shoudl visit wild wadi its a great way to kill time and enjoy the sun..go early though to avoid ques

wild wadi. wild wadi has to be without a doubt the best day at a water park i have ever experienced!!!! I spent a week in dubai and visited the park 3 times as there is so much to do and every ride leaves you wanting to go on it again and again!I would recommend it to anyone whatever your age as is caters for every need, not only was it clean, well presented but the staff were fantastic!keep up the good work to everyone that works there and i hope to be back in 2 years with my son!!!thanks for a great experience that ill never forget!

great day out. spent mother's day at the water park with my grown up family and will be a day to remember. we had a wonderful time and haven't laughed so much for ages. the life guards were excellent very patient, good fun and made my daughter into a surfer in one easy lesson!best views of the two big hotels and surrounding area too.

Don't waste your money. We (Couple late twenties) took our 10 year old child to Wild Wadi and were highly disappointed with the whole experience.The rides did not in any way live up to the hype and publicity that promotes the park. In reality there were very few rides (as someone said the interconnected rollercoaster is one big ride) and they were all of yawn inducing quality. On the day of our vist the 'Screamer' (whatever) was inexplicably closed and the 'surfing style' attractions were mobbed by local teenage boys and men which didn't make for a 'family atmosphere' and although my daughter and I would have liked to have tried these rides - we felt too uncomfortable (even with a male) to approach these crowds. Nothing overt but there was defintiely a palpable mood of 'men only need apply' surrounding these areas. Other westerners were obviously also steering clear for this reason. I was also very uncomfortable that my daughter (dressed from neck to knee mind you in a sun suit/wet suit) was actually ogled in a perverse manner by some of the local guests. The showers have no hot water which due to the extreme chill of the air conditioned change rooms is actually desirable (yes even in the dessert in peak summer times). In short, stay away from here - the park is very expensive and doesn't deliver much entertainment value. If you want water park action head instead to Australia's Gold Coast for better fun at WetnWild or Whitewater world (haven't tried the latter but intend to). A visit to wild wadi was supposed to be one of the highlights of our trip but was deemed by each of us to be an all time low. If you are looking for something to do in Dubai consider taking a dessert safari (we had a blast).On a positive note the staff at wild wadi (who seem to be recruited from every corner of the globe) were all outstandingly friendly, helpful and courteous - lovely people. A big thumbs down to those visitors we saw berating the poor staff for the lack of features at the park. As if they are responsible for delivering such a lame product.

Best in the Middle East. Woopy Doo.. If you have never been to a decent water park you will love Wild Wadi. Otherwise, you will still enjoy it, but don't expect too much.Adult rides (above 110cm) are:1. Flowriders: 2 surf machines. Take a lot of practice and not worth the effort unless the lines are short and you can keep cycling through quickly to improve technique.2. Master Blaster: tube ride that takes you around most of the park using a series of water jets to go uphill and slides to go down. This is advertised as 13 separate rides, but is best done as one ride from start to finish.3. Jumeirah Sceirah: "a speed slide that hurtles you at speeds of up to 80 kms per hour! It's the tallest and fastest free-fall speed slide outside North America". Best ride in park and queues to match.Children's (& big children) rides are:1. Family ride: group tube ride, similar to master blaster but relatively short.2. Juha's Dhow: standard water slides for children.Tips:1. Bring lunch. Food is quite expensive.2. Get there ealry (11am opening time).3. You will be given an electronic wrist band. Don't bother with credit on the wrist band (for food) unless you don't have cash handy.5. If no one can mind your gear, get a locker.6. Grab a sun lounge/s near wave pool asap (You might be the first person in the water park, but somehow most of the lounges will already have towels on them... sound familiar).7. Go straight to Jumeirah Sceirah first before the queues get too long. After that do the master blaster.Once you have done these 2 rides at least once, go on the family ride together. You can then spend the rest of the day wandering around the park at leisure and taking turns to look after the kids etc.Hot Tip: If you buy "The Entertainer" book [-] for about 100AED you can use several of the 2-4-1 vouchers, including wild wadi, inside it during your holiday.

Fantastic!. A truly fantastic water park with wicked rides, slides and a few gentler attractions for the more feint hearted! The food here is very cheap and tasty :-) Brilliant view of the Burj Al Arab hotel nearby and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. My son didn't want to leave!

the whole family loved it!!!! wicked!. we had a great day out at wild wadi!!! We got a taxi from our hotel, and we were greeted by very friendly staff.The kids couldn't get enough, (including my hubby!), I particularly liked the location of this park. The view you get of the Burj al arab and jumeirah beach were lovely!! I'll never forget it!!At the end of the day there were plenty of taxis outside waiting to take us back to our hotel!We want to go again, and are already planning our next vist!! This time staying at The Jumeirah Beach Hotel, so we have UNLIMITED access to the Park!

Excellent!. Had a great day at Wild Wadi. We took a taxi from the city which was fairly reasonable (taxis are cheap in Dubai). We were met at the entrance by some very friendly staff members who took us through to the park and explained everything we needed to know. We were there in January so the weather was just warm enough and there were no queues for the rides which we loved!. All the rides were great and the general atmosphere and layout of the park really makes you feel like you can get away from everything for the day. Definately worth a visit!

wicked time. We had a ondeful time. I felt like abig kid again. I had the intention of just going to relax on the sun chairs but my friend had other ideas!! Went on all the rides , especially on i would never forget - the slide where you climb to the top, when you get to the top you have some good views of Dubai. To go down the slide you lay down on you back, cross you arms over your chest and cross your ankles. aparently there is a similar ride in Las Vegas. I screamed my hear out and had a few words withmy friend as she was th e reaon I went on the ride. She told me that you slide downon a rubber ring like the other rides!!The best time to go is late in the afternoon, less queues!!!
Once u pop..u cant stop. Wicked!!!!!!. What a place!!!. Actually went twice in the 10 days i was there.

great rides. just come back from visiting family in dubai, while we were there we went to wild wadi and what a excellent day we had. we were met at the gate by a member of staff who helped us with buying our tickets shown how to use our locker key and where the changing rooms were. we were showm to the ride that we were looking for and all in all found the staff helpful and very friendly. the rides were great and they were all open which makes a change from other water parks that we have been to. I would like to say a big thank you for the great day that we had and when we are back in dubai we will be paying wild wadi another visit.Thanks to all your wonderful staff you should be proud of them. thanks sean and julie of the uk

its great!!. this waterpark is brill, i went with my partner and had a few photos taken by the staff there and they are a reasonable price.its great for all types of people not just little ones. when i return to dubai i will go back to wild wadi, there is a place near the enterance that sells food, looks out for a man with a hot dog hat on hes a good dancer (better than my boyfriend) make sure u visit this park!

wot more can u ask for!!!. I go to dubai 3 times a year to visit my relative, its a tradition, the day after I arrive we always got to Wild Wadi, i don't think u can ask for much more, fair enouogh its not the biggest water paark but u have everything u need all in a small area. The views from the Kamikazi are to die for over looking the burj, the staff are lovely all from different nations, the static waves are just so much fun, especially when you don't have a clue what you are doin. I don't think there's a better place in dubai (At the moment, that will change) for your first day on holiday in sunny lovely dubai.

Very outgoing and friendly Staff. Wild Wadi is wicked!! Visted Wild wadi two times in a row, if you want to have a laugh then i would recommend Wild wadi to anyone. The rides were not that many, however you could just relax and sunbath if you like.The staff were very friendly and outgoing, on our second time around we had met some off the life guards they had a day off. They accompanied us by recommend us the best rides in the Park. ( I do not recall there names, but hey if you know who I am talking about contact us regarding the group picture that we took together.Overall I would recommend Wild Wadi for the young and old, is a lovely they out, to have a laugh and relax.

Been to much better. I really liked the appearance of this water part, which is like a theme park in nature, but there wasn't much in the way of rides. They may advertise 20-something rides, but what they don't tell you is that most of them are the interconnected parts of one ride. So, there really isn't a lot of variety.Also, although I hear this is to change, if your children are under 1m10cm, they aren't allowed on many of the rides, being pretty restricted to wet slippery dips coming off a boat. Cute, but not much for over 100 dirhams.Honestly, the propaganda is good, but the park itself is pretty average. I found the staff very pleasant, though, and there is a high safety record thanks to the many life guards. And, surprisingly, the park employs international paramedics in its clinics in case of emergencies, and to look after the Wild Wadi staff. They were very nice to me when I went in to see them after my daughter twisted her ankle. An Australian paramedic was particularly nice, and had us all in stitches with her accent and humour.

Not Great I'm Araid. If you're staying in Dubai with children you'll end up at the Wild Wadi at some point. Or maybe if you're young at heart. We were staying at the Al Qasr on Jumereih beach, so it was literally next door for us. Unfortunately, I think we've been spoiled by the Disney waterparks in Florida - Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon - which the Wild Wadi doesn't match up to. Why? Well, it's quite small for a start, which means you will have to be quick to grab somewhere to sit and put your stuff (although there is an efficient locker system). Although we were in early, we had no chance of grabbing a sun lounger. Secondly, the rides. What makes the Wild Wadi unusual is that on most of the rides, you sit on your inflated doughnut and are then blasted UP hills by jetted torrents of water before coming down the slides themselves. It's quite fun, but can be sore on your backside if you're not careful. You can actually do a full circuit of the nearly all the rides in the park this way without ever (voluntarily) leaving your doughnut, but be prepared to queue for half an hour at the start to do this. Also be prepared for queue jumpers. This isn't Britain, where queuing is a religion, and here people will happily barge there way up the line to stand with someone they vaguely know - unless you stop them. The kids supervising the rides weren't willing to do it.You complete the circuit in about twenty minutes. That leaves two other good thrill rides, the family doughnut and the big tower slide. The former was fun, the latter the queue was too big for so we didn't bother. Plus I have a bad back which was straining after three circuits of being blasted around all the other slides. We had some lunch in the park - again, everywhere was mobbed - and watched the people queing for the surf rides. It looked like fun once you mastered the technique, but how long would that take? After about four hours, we returned to the Al Qasr, and had to fight with taxi drivers to take us the short hop back. It was too long to walk in the hot sun, we hadn't arranged for the shuttle bus to pick us up and we eventually had to ask a security official to demand that one of the taxis take us back. The driver was fuming about it too and it was a pretty unpleasant ride - but at least it was short! In summary, it's worth visiting the Wild Wadi, but don't expect too much from it.

Do it!! You'll love it!!. My Wife and I, both in our 30's, decided to go for a day, we had the time of our lives, it is an absolute blast from start to finish so much so that we even went a second day!!Very "disney" in the way that they constantly smile and say good afternoon etc...The best views of the Burj al Arab you will get, clime the Jumera Scarea and you will get a fab photo.Do it!! You'll love it!!
Brings out the child in you!. So worth a visit! Whether your an adult ot child - you've got to go to Wild Wadi!! Have Fun!

an exiting day out. Wild Wadi water park is a fantastic day out whether your planning for a relaxing, sunbathing water ride. Or the most fastest ride in the park! it's a fantastic experience. suitable for all ages and friendly staff, what more could you ask for?
A fun packed day. I had a great day at Wild Wadi in October. My tips - get there early to get a sun lounger and have a long day. Late in the day there were hardly any queues so we had loads of rides.

excellent and aimed at all ages. spent a day here last september, and what a great day it was, clean tidy and so many helpful staff. cold water running continuously across paths make it easy on the feet and lunch was good quality and reasonably priced, going back in july and definitely will be going back there. queues do grow a bit as the day wears on.
